HWB5lrbVOiK9wg20NgmweQ.text: This place used to have a pretty good atmosphere and fun crowd. However the last two times I've visited, my experiences were pretty bad.    A couple of months ago I had a rude bartender too busy chatting up some guys to take my drink order, it was like she intentionally refused to take her eye off her dude and acknowledge me in the hopes we would give up and go away.  When she finally asked if we needed anything she got my drink wrong.  I ordered a vodka & soda with a splash of grenadine and she gave me a vodka & 7up.  Of course it was SUCH a hassle to remake it the way I asked that I got the bitchy eye roll and sigh.  The last time I was there a few weeks ago, my friend and I were told we had to leave the couches we'd been sitting at for over 30 minutes because all the tables outside were reserved. We stayed at the bar inside for at least 30 more minutes and never saw the patio get even half full.  In addition, the flat bread we'd ordered outside got "lost" when the waitress couldn't find us so we had to order again.  We finally got our appetizer about 45 minutes after we first ordered and it came out burned.  Gee, thanks.  It's a great space, I love the decor, and I really wish I liked it as much as I used to.  But the food, the service, the crowd are all just "Meh" now; what a waste.

VVB4Npx98rd4axJ68zJLmA.text: Beautiful patio overlooking the Scottsdale Waterfront...perfect for Sunday brunch and yummy mimosas!

AuAv-sa920VARtJmHVrtnw.text: Love their food and funky outdoor patio. I crave their red sangria and I highly recommend the bacon wrapped dates. Sounds strange but everyone who I've had try them is always pleasantly surprised.

jorNhl-LB5pEOCXe92GZog.text: Hey Fox concepts: Is it your concept to be consistently Rude to customers. Wake Up.  This is strike 2 for this restaurant. I will not bring my customers again. You have to have a meeting of you hostesses wait staff and management. Last Thursday I walked in with 3 peaple. I was told 3 times that is 5:00 and no happy hr on the patio  with tables  So Ok rude hostess.... fine.  The waitress...  3 times are you dinning. Wine appetizers then we shall see.  She did not like that answer and rudely sat us.  The appetizers were very Small and just Ok.  We had 2 bottles of wine but the waitress kept  on asking about food to the point where we decided to have dinner else ware. We are locals fox not Snowbirds.  Today I walked in at 11:30 we were 4 peaple. Same attitude.   Sorry their is  an 1/12/ hr wait . We only take reservations and you do not have one. Hardly anyone was on the patio at that time......  A manager walk by and asked how we were doing . I said Not Ok . And she just ignored my comment and walked on her very busy way. My 1st time customers and friends reminded me that their is Plenty of restaurants in the are that want our bussiness. So we left....   To note ... Fox . That we told this story to a neighboring restaurant and he agreed that you guys Turn Off more people and that's great for this bussness.  If you care this was at 11:30 today.. Check the time sheets .....  I doubt if I will give you a 3 rd time because My Time is valuable also ...

JAjtA7CgWhfp579D_XD1zw.text: I love love love this place! The beautiful courtyard and fun food options, while sitting on a couch enjoying a cocktail is perfect. For 9 months a year, sitting outside next to river walk, is my peace. However, the market inside is my go to place for a delicious grab and go lunch. My girlfriends and I love to have happy hour inside too!

RNrcV_YSgiSru8qdlY3jGQ.text: I used to eat here all the time when it first opened up but got spoiled with all the great dining in my area, central Phoenix and quit making the trip to Scottsdale.  So this past Sunday we decided to journey up to Scottsdale for Sunday brunch.  I notice that the dining area has become more formal than it used to be but the atmosphere and food are still fantastic.  Their peach bellini's are yummy and all the food super delicious!

UMSHDY2ynXaDRiBLdVRxlA.text: Is my favorite patio in scottsdale!! Great ambiance. Nice servers. The Mediterranean salad is delicious!

KFvJPhC8mic2nfWL7vpluw.text: Must go!! I have been going here for years and every time it is amazing. Awesome location, in the heart of Old Town Scottsdale, Waterfront. The outdoor patio is very beautiful and comfortable and a great place to lounge for happy hour. On the weekends they have a live DJ, playing chill lounge music. Atmosphere is what makes this place stand out. The complimentary pesto and focaccia is to die for. Great wine list and drink specials. Mediterranean Mule is my favorite. Service is always spectacular.  I would highly recommend checking this place out!!!

uZNeNwGdMDK-6T-T5c3cJw.text: Great food and great service - their brunch menu is fantastic. I had the sausage breakfast sandwich with the house-made English muffin - incredible. This is already a regular brunch stop for us and will continue to be one as long as they keep making food like that.

z2HU_QeM_o09SPQTVDQSPA.text: Olive and Ivy is my go-to place when I can't decide where to eat! I have never had a bad experience here. The sweet potato canneloni with shrimp is my FAVORITE!!!! Salmon plate as well as the scallops and potatoes are to die for. Try the red and the white house made sangria, it's nice, light and refreshing. Just what you need in Arizona! Nice staff, great environment. I also reserved a table for 12 for my birthday and they were very accommodating.

AGkNPMEyNHEQa--4VoNxQw.text: Delicious red sangria, amazing food, and outstanding ambiance.

53hXSGANvq4LZiHK9TRiuA.text: I came here on a Thursday late afternoon for dinner for the first time. The atmosphere and decor was amazingly put together. The staff was great but the food was terrible. I was expecting so much more. If I'm going to pay that much for food I expect it to taste good. Unfortunately, it didn't live up to the standards of the decor and environment. I will not be coming back or recommending.

K40wACiWlPKpH5r_S2vk-g.text: I'll start by saying the restaurant is a really nice space which is why it got two stars instead of one.  After being seated we waited ten minutes before anyone even came over to get a drink order or give us water, and it was a server from another section that felt bad for us.  I'm not exaggerating when I say that literally nothing was good which is why I don't feel the need to go into more detail.  I had much higher hopes given the ratings here, and so I write this in the hopes that possibly even one person will be spared the same experience.

00lWEI-BDNIS2W3uXtI6mQ.text: We were a party of 6 celebrating my wife birthday . We have never been in this  resturant before . The resturant atmosphere  was  awesome . We got seated at the patio .The foods were exelent,good quality  ,well presented and good  portion.The reasons behind giving this restaurant a three starts are  1- the pesone who I talked to make the reservation at 9:15 didn't mentioned that the kitchen closing at 10 ,so we got rushed and we didn't have enough time to enjoy having  our salad . 2- The waitrest that she was taking care of us was not friendly and doest have any kind of customer service skills . I understand she might be tired but I don't think one smile would be hard to be expressed . 3-   After we finished the dinner,we asked her to bring a cake in order celebrate my wife birthday .She said there is 2 $ fees will be charged per person .  It kind of wired , our check is 200$ and they still asking us to pay" fees ". There no value of the 2$  in these days and if I paid it will not  affect to my budget BUT it's all about principles and customer satisfaction.

ePgEqHCIXrqjH_UZ_rLRyQ.text: The food is great. The service is great. The atmosphere is great. Oh yeah, the wine list is good too. Sit outside if it's under 100.

u92BGne_p1fl4szgmm6A9A.text: My favorite place for any meal! I always take anyone who comes in town to this place. Love breakfast, brunch, lunch AND dinner here.

DXvlhYSmcKs9JO4fIIr5gA.text: This place is good but the plates were small. The food was good but a little pricey.  But it is Scottsdale so that is to be expected.

8jwRqu_XSKKARQp5qPqxOQ.text: I've recently been here for breakfast a number of times. You can sit outside with your dog so I'm a fan! The food is good and hearty, nothing fancy. The baked goods are worth the calories. The staff is friendly. It's also right off the canal so you can ride your bike to Olive and Ivy and not worry about parking.

jsKlYDb_ojkbU8rDkZsZBg.text: Excellent.  My only complaint is that they never seem to have the bacon wrapped dates.  I have been dying to try these, and I've been through PHX 3 times this year, but have not been able to get them once.  Apparently they don't have them for lunch, and they sell out really quickly for dinner.  For the food I actually got, the bacon wrapped pork loin was heavenly.  It sits on a bed of squash that absorb the bacon/pork flavor.  I almost licked the plate.  The watermelon salad was also good.  The dressing is sweet, but has a slight kick of savory pepper.  I had it for lunch once, but I think I might order for desert next time I go.  Speaking of desert, the huckleberry cheesecake was momentous.  It's served in mini-mason jars, which some of my colleges got a kick out of.  The service has been outstanding every time I've been there.  Both waiters I've had demonstrated extensive knowledge of the wine list and menu and made great recommendations.  The scenery isn't too bad either.

dwK2KN4TnulnlLmSMPmwkQ.text: Piece of melted plastic in my Lasagna, very bummed. I would have said this is my least favorite Fox Concept restaurant.

y9feZ2nHZe7WkDR1jSa4wA.text: We came to Olive & Ivy for my friend's bachelorette party his past weekend and we were all so pleased with the ambience, food, and amazing service!  We had a group of 9 and ordered the bacon wrapped dates (with sausage filling), artichoke hearts, and the white and red sangria for the table. Upon seeing that we were there for a bachelorette, the waiter brought us a round of shots!  Some girls in our group are pescatarian and vegan, and the waiter and chefs prepared breaking/dairy on the side for our appetizers and food. I really was impressed by the accommodations they made for us. Not to mention - they brought out cake and a scoop of sorbet for the bride-to-be!!   Highly recommend this restaurant for group events or even for a romantic dinner. Next time I'm in AZ, I'll definitely revisit!

jDCmveXiASSyDzOiGLVXvg.text: Service was dismal. Our server kept smacking her lips while chewing gum; unacceptable

3uR7vqt4b-Ok7QK_FvUFeg.text: Just OK- I've been to a lot of similar places nearby, and I'd say this is pretty middle of the road. The staff isn't overly friendly, the restaurant can be way too dark at night (can't even see my own food), and parking can be tough if it's busy.

lUeFfR2VfMHgFWE3hTcr-A.text: Great ambiance both indoors and outdoors. It's the best to sit out in the patio when the weather is nice out with a glass or bottle of wine . Food is great but the alcohol here is better . Price is average for old town. Highly recommend! Cute date and brunch place!!

8VdCDKIhAsqeyBVqpE0R3w.text: We shared the Kale salad and tuna sandwich and they were both amazing!  Service was great and patio was perfect on this day!

kMtRrPvaHRR9apWym5dd1g.text: Good food and great service.  Except for the hostess.  Maybe her dog died, she was miserable.   She literally threw the menus down and trotted away without a "hello" or an "enjoy your meal"  That started us off on the wrong foot.   But our server(s) were great and we each ordered a different item and shared and everything was amazing.   Pretty expensive as the portions were not huge and we are a bunch of Italians, so we are used to making enough to feed an army.  But, hey, this is Scottsdale ...   It was VERY loud, don't go there for an intimate, quiet date. Go there if you want tasty food, brought out quickly from the kitchen.

qIjU1XP2We5tW7iPoIy7Rg.text: This totally hurts my heart to write this, but I had such an awful experience at this location.   I went the other evening, and it was honestly pretty quiet. When I walked in, the hostess was gossiping so loudly with one of the servers, and I usually wouldn't care, but they were complaining about another server (I think) and it was just so nasty and it really put a bad taste in my mouth. They ignored me until they were done with their conversation, too, so it was really awkward for me.   So after my awkward/distasteful beginning, I get seated. The server comes over and asks what we would like to drink - I order a fig and ginger mule, and my friend ordered some sangria. We also order the calamari and veggies to start. The server brought me my mule, but forgot the sangria. Fifteen minutes later, the app comes out, and it is cold. Still no sign of my friends sangria. We mention that the calamari was cold to our server, who says that just happens sometimes but that it seemed pretty warm when it was brought out. We were confused by the response, but its whatever. We order dinner - Ahi tuna for me, pesto chicken for my friend. It takes forever to come out. Still no sangria for my friend, which we pretty much just give up on at this point.   The food came and it was good, which is why this is 2 stars instead of 1. It took a very long time on a very un-busy night for our food to come out, so I'm not sure if our waiter forgot to put it in or if there was just some mishap in the kitchen.   When the bill came, the sangria (which we never received) was still on there. We told our server, who seemed irritated, and another 15 minutes went by before we got the updated bill. I totally get everyone has their off days, and I love Sam Fox concepts, but I don't think I'll be returning to this location any time soon.

qvM2FLaN1P9EPKn5orJNlA.text: This place was a surprise.  We were at the mall nearby and saw the reviews.  Will keep this review short.  Waiter wasn't that great, the person who was shadowing him was actually much better and friendlier.  He also poured our alcoholic beverages at brunch (only one per person) as a much lower level then any table around us, by about half.    Food, pretty decent.  One person ordered the Margherita pizza.  good crust, right about of tomato, the mozz did NOT taste fresh whatsoever, but the weird thing, my sister asked for some Ricotta cheese to be added, and it made the dish!  Another person ordered the egg sandwich which was just okay, when it's mostly bun/roll versus inside, it's never a good thing.  And lastly I had the grilled chicken panini.  There was not a lot of chicken on this at all, but the aioli made up for the sandwich as a whole.  Is it worth going, yeah.  The atmosphere is awesome, place is stunning, food, average.

D15x1iF8G45EkDrKcfIi-g.text: Very nice atmosphere. The artichoke appetizer was spot on delicious. The rib eye steak was cooked perfectly and the veal ravioli was a nice light meal. Oh the pesto they serve with the bread was my favorite very yummy!

zXgLQK1JxGk6FkDuA4lxbQ.text: They used to be great, in service and food, last 2 times we were there for lunch and dinner, it was bah. There are other restaurants much better near by and less expensive.

UZTMnQN7HtToIrRPyvDVZQ.text: I love Olive and Ivy. I go there for breakfast at the cafe and lunch and dinner in the restaurant. Fav dishes are the ravioli, salmon ceased and burger. Fav drink is peach Bellini. Bartenders are always cool. Servers are decent managers are on point it's a good vibe. It's a bit overpriced but it's at the mall so that's expected. Oh the patio...perfect when the weather is nice! When I don't know what I feel like I go to Olive and Ivy I can find something.

vgmi1Hf1u4ZT07G4MiFJTw.text: So so good! My husband and I shared the bacon wrapped dates and hummus. We were so impressed with the food and will definitely be going back before our vacation ends!

ii4BaXYI1oJv93HN4DB-NA.text: Came from out of town on a Thursday night around 8:30. A short 15 minute wait, felt lucky as that is out of the ordinary from my understanding. Service was excellent, and the atmosphere was amazing. Sat outside, very trendy and probably the nicest place to sit to have a conversation. Bar scene was lively. Had the scallopini, was AMAZING. Would give 5 stars, but Mushroom pasta was sent back due to lack of flavor and lack of mushrooms! Would come back here again.

508-uSaiABYWCcTkmmbNqw.text: Great place for a girlfriend's lunch.    Fresh organic food.  We ordered the soup of the day (minestrone made with red peppers), chicken pesto sandwich and beet salad with arugula and goat cheese.  All delish.  Good wine list.  Nice decor.

SCXyWg49_z48OvIDqNsezw.text: The patio is lovely! Loved the private dining area. The open table seating is fun on the patio!  We love the people watching there  too!  Sangria is tasty!

SlIH62Q1Of0bNYbIWMQEgQ.text: Wonderful first time experience at Olive and Ivy. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. All pastas are fresh and homemade. Had their wild mushroom pappardelle and it was so fresh and flavorful. Our server was so friendly and very knowledgeable about the menu which made it helpful.

reSwaqjnsCsp8UmugdwEew.text: We went to Oliver &ivy for a late Sunday brunch. The place was spacious and airy with lot of sunlight. They have beautiful patio seating as well. We ordered Bloody Mary and peach Bellini for cocktails which were top notch. They give you bread and pesto sauce to go along which I really liked. The bread literally melts in your mouth. My husband and I ordered pesto flatbread and lamb gyro. The flat bread was delicious and lamb gyro was okay, which we could have passed it on. This place was a recommendation and surely didn't disappoint

h36MCbF0e14MzxtQWeektA.text: I like the scene of the restaurant and the food was decent. The service was commendable and very friendly. The only disappointment was that for the price of the food I was just hoping for better. I would come here again but it just wouldn't be my first choice.

bOD3x7AB4Vhrz3rSJteYrw.text: This place is awesome! The food and drinks were delicious. Reservations are recommended since the place is super popular and always packed. The restaurant is centrally located in a beautiful area with lots of fun shopping.

-xcRjEVRenn_Qack6hiJzQ.text: This is our to-go-to place when visitors come to town. Always great service. Love starting with the focaccia & fresh pesto. The bruschetta appetizers are excellent. Some favorites are the flatbreads, sea scallops, sea bass, Mediterranean salad, sweet potato cannelloni and peanut butter mousse dessert!

-YzmnlsTC54fXnwF7g5thg.text: After an afternoon shopping, my gf and I make dinner reservations at Olive & Ivy. Wanting to take advantage of the beautiful day, we waited for a table on the patio.   The cobblestone, foliage and water feature made the patio that much more enjoyable as we sipped our cocktails in the sun and watched people bustling about at the courtyard across the way at a festival.  When our kale salad, bruschetta and sea scallops arrived, I couldn't decide where to start! A light citrus dressing and slices of granny smith apples gave the salad a nice tartness. Of the trio of bruschetta, my fave was the sauteed mushrooms served with melted swiss - savoury deliciousness! Accompanying the sweet scallops were seared asparagus and polenta drizzled in a balsamic reduction.  You can really notice the freshness and quality of the ingredients they use here. If you want to enjoy Olive but don't have the time to sit down, they have a marketplace inside the restaurant where you can pick up things like sandwiches and fresh pressed juices - something I'll keep in mind if I want a quick snack while shopping!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bruschetta trio
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Kale salad
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sea scallops and polenta

ChvsaZFaofK2JPw1KgMfQA.text: Great service. We went for a belated birthday and they treated us very nicely and with a lot of attention. This place is easy to find and pretty central. We got the 33oz bone in ribeye, mac and cheese, and also brussels sprouts. We ordered it medium rare and it came out pretty rare in general (which was fine with us). The ambiance is nice and since it's a large open kitchen with patio and bar space...you have a lot of options in terms of seating.

NiQDYrPBIL3Xi0maCIyH3A.text: Excellent food and service for Christmas Eve dinner... minus the refrigerator effect  Our family has a tradition of visiting a nice restaurant for Christmas Eve Dinner. From the Brown Palace in Denver to the US Grant in Sand Diego to the Phoenician in Scottsdale, it's a special occasion to celebrate with relatives.  This year, we decided to stay closer to home and agreed on Olive and Ivy for the cuisine and Yelp! ratings. It was a very good fit.   Our service person, Jessica, did a fine job-- accommodating of taste preferences spanning grandparents to children, kept the timing of courses on track, and made sure drinks were never more tan 1/3 to empty.  Bruchetta Trio was worth a try even if it was unremarkable. Hot chocolates hit the spot on a cold Scottsdale evening. Mediterranean salad, kale salad, and the plate of artichoke hearts were superb-- especially the latter.  Just as excellent, the rib-eye was supremely tasty and perfectly cooked, my wife was very happy with her salmon, and my father-in-law said the shrimp risotto was worth coming back for. The cheesecake was also good, though we were all so sated and chilly that it was a forced attempt at dessert.  Speaking of chilly: One (BIG) knock is that there is a well-used door in the back room. When wait staff traversed in and out, it sent 40-degree air our way. And when an inconsiderate family was finished eating, they held the door open for a good five minutes as everyone sauntered out. A waiter finally noticed and came to have them close the door as I got up to ask them to not freeze us any longer. The result was the same: We ended up eating most of our meal with our coats on us and our food quickly lost its heat. I'm docking one star just for that poor experience and for no one noticing or making a good effort to fix things. Could just be that it's southern Arizona and they aren't used to looking for people eating with coats on, but still...  Definitely worth the visit and I suspect the chilly letdown we had was an anomaly. The food and service staff were quite good.

q3F1VgVM8heL3tPTSKsisA.text: Very nice place to take guests, it has an ambiance that is upscale yet not pretentious. The servers are nice and the food is pretty good. Their happy hour is nice for wintertime since you have to sit outside on the patio to get it. My only complaint is how the food costs an arm and a leg and has portion sizes not even fit for a child...

pNqeQTJrZVeD9lPd-ohizQ.text: Great restaurant - atmosphere and staff service.  Really big menu, so many options.  Exceptional outdoor seating as well.

75YrMS0uAB2YWGi7PgJCFg.text: The mozzarella bruschetta and Lamb meatballs were both very tastey. The dark chocolate creme brulle was an excellent finish.  The gem of this restaurant for me was the ambience out on the outside couches. I relaxed there for over an hour people watching and enjoying the April weather in Phx.

eMoZ-1CnGZtY-QcvLUJrUg.text: Amazing place! Not only is the atmosphere and decor amazing and beautiful, but the food is to die for! I had the salmon and I am dead serious when I say it was the best salmon I've had in my life! I also had the coconut sponge cake as dessert and it was delicious!

fWlkaMh-wvx6eXu8BJ35aQ.text: Had a lovely lunch here with friends that also happen to be business associates (that's the best way to do business - makes things easier).  I have been here many times and Olive & Ivy is always a solid choice. The ambiance is stunning (and only to get better once the patio renovation is completed), the food is delicious and the service is always top notch.    I recommend the sweet potato cannelloni and the roasted beet salad very highly.  Easy to order both and share between two people - that way you can taste a little of each and still be more than satisfied.  Now onto the wine.  If you are a white wine fan, you MUST order the Chenin Blanc.  I'm not kidding.  It's fantastic and a great value.  At $7/glass, you might think it will be terrible.  Wrong!  It's the value play on the menu.  Every restaurant has one - it's up to you to find it....and here it is.  Crisp and light.  Perfect, easy and drinkable....sounds just like the date you had on match last night, eh? ;)

fpUXIcD9KYZSvmGUe4GugA.text: I can't say enough. These guys are fantastic and very consistent. It's probably my favorite spot for lunch. Yesterday, my wife and I went in and our server noticed we are having a baby very soon. Our experience was already great but I was impressed when he bought us an incredible desert just to say congratulations.

thAtxWL-N1FO770qT7n92w.text: I love eating at olive and ivy! It's great for a refreshing breakfast or date night! I always get the Mediterranean salad, but you really can't go wrong here! If you are in the area, it's a must have!

wGGpD66Gc1acfaVw7CiRRQ.text: What can I say, Great Food, Great Service, Amazing "waterfront" location.  Love it and go back often.

Ukw-oy8vczzUH5mDUyc9Hg.text: I like the patio more than inside .. The wine menu is really good .. This place is nice for breakfast and dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

eWkl3XGbcSIvyJ-_YN0uvg.text: I have many had many great dining experiences at Olive & Ivy. The lamb meatballs and sea scallops are amazing! Wait staff is friendly and attentive. This is defiantly one of my favorite places.

6JYDqhQqX0hkhPIOYTgRFg.text: Ive been for Brunch a couple of times. The food is great and the staff are always friendly and personable. The space is very large with a beautiful outdoor patio as well. Nicely done!

rZVrgYR8E5h3CKsOHIZ-Hg.text: start out with the best hummus ever. they also give you fresh bread with pesto sauce. there lasagne bolonese is great, also fantastic flatbreads, and top notch salmon. great service with annalise.

iZu_RDS8vQXOKtADVnWqtQ.text: My girlfriend and I both started of with the eighteen dollar margaritas(which are actually $11-though they would be $18 in California for how strong they were). Then we had the bruschetta sampler appetizer, which was enough to be a meal. The ambiance was far nicer than the mall setting would seem to allow. And our server, Alyssa was prompt with getting our order, bringing our food, and guiding us toward more optimal options. I wish she would wait and on us every time. All in all it was a great place to dine out in Scottsdale

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

pglqg33cH42Bg7brz-J9pQ.text: So, my daughters and I wanted to dine there Sat nite but we were unable to get a reservation. But we did get one for brunch on Sunday. We were very excited to experience the outdoor patio. Sadly, our experience was filled with lows and highs. Our waiter provided very poor service. When I asked the origin of the House sparkling wine for the mimosas he could only respond that "yeah it's good." Our food orders were completely incorrect, poached eggs looked inedible but were delivered to my one daughter. We asked for the manager. She was lovely and responsive. We were delivered a whole new cream fast. And we expressed our appreciation. But unfortunately my other daughters over easy eggs were swimming in a pool of grease. When the manager checked in with us again she comped the whole meal. The lows were that the meal was only ok and the service awful. But the highs were that the manager really cared about us and took care of us. We have high expectations for Olive and Ivy. And they need to do better for brunch.

YvRGu86cbYw3wqvah3-d5A.text: This place lures you in with its spacious bar area and the inviting patio of colorful lounge chairs and firepits overlooking the beauty of the Scottsdale Waterfront. It's a great spot to meet up for happy hour or drinks before venturing off to Old Town and start your shenanigans. For my singletons, I will say it is a great starting point for first dates as you can really hit any of the other restaurants once the meet and greet awkwardness wears off (speaking from experience as the lifeline/wingman).  Unfortunately, as with most things deceptively beautiful outside, the interior make up does not always match up. I am about consistency. And both food and service are spotty. They have been phenomenal when we hosted a large birthday dinner in the large room. The bar area is fun and you'll always be able to strike up a conversation with anyone as I love the diverse crowd that hangs out there. Patio service tends to be harder to gauge. I've had fantastic and attentive servers and some not. The sangria and flatbreads are incredible such that you don't realize you might have ordered twice or more times because you want that much more. They used to have a watermelon salad that my tongue craves but has been replaced by a beet salad which isn't a bad stand in. However, I've been here on a Friday night where a friend couldn't get a Coors Light. How do you run out of beer and that beer of all things on a weekend? I also love that you can just pop into the market and grab gelato that has an array of flavor I want to bathe in.  Usually for a FCR, I am generally impressed but Olive & Ivy has struggled to maintain the bar that Sam Fox sets at his other venues such as Culinary Dropout or Arrogrant Butcher. With that said, even low on Sam's radar is pretty high in the restaurant industry.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. I recommend the white sangria, bacon wrapped dates and the Mediterranean flatbread for your happy hour starter

o0KozWZh3e2BOFH7MJ8HBw.text: I've walked by this place countless times and finally made the time to stop in! Came for happy hour on a Friday afternoon and sat by the bar. Inside is nicely decorated, they also have outdoor seating but a storm was coming in so we didn't sit out there. On a nice day, you would get a lovely view of the canal! It's right on the waterfront. Hubby and I got some drinks and apps. The happy hour menu is decent. The apps we got were the lamb meatballs and then their bruschetta. The on meatballs was just a tiny serving and then the bruschetta was pretty good, but honestly not the best I've had. Our server was nice, but that's about it. We had to find her or just stop another server every time we needed something. It was an okay experience, but not 5 stars. I might be back for the Sangria!

-x7srVZ8xNtnjGR8NJXlAQ.text: Super trendy  Great vibe Good service Just overall awesome And great ice cream   Has a nice front patio over the creek And the staff is super awesome

vcySEzSQhtUOob3g38k34w.text: My mom and I came here for a nice little ladies night out and it was very enjoyable. We sat on the patio which was beautiful! It was hot outside, but there were misters and the trees provided great shade and added a bit of coolness. The pesto and focaccia was delicious. We tried the bruschetta trio...the goat cheese and asparagus, manchego and another one. All were good. The funghi flatbread was good, and the beet salad was great! Overall the atmosphere was very nice.

uxLSq6Qmz_Dwl3eszXn1GA.text: It's sub-freezing here in Salt Lake City today. Arctic chill, crunchy snow, frozen snot freezing. And yet just a few short days ago I had lunch on the patio of Olive & Ivy in the sunshine with a happy little breeze blowing through the place.  So perhaps I'm attaching a little more magic to the experience than is totally merited, but when we strip away the ambiance and charm of eating outside in January I'm still left with some delicious food.  I was immediately impressed with the bread and pesto. Zing! Lots of bite to it to help you remember the taste. We ordered a couple of flatbreads for the group and scarfed them down in no time. Then again, you put asparagus on just about anything and I'd eat it.  I ordered a simple turkey sandwich and was not disappointed. I'd like to try a few other menu items as well, because I'm not sure I had the best of the best, but still it hit the spot just the same and I'd eat it again.  As mentioned, our server (DeAnne?) was on top of things--totally professional, dedicated to her job, and one hundred percent darling. You heard me. I said darling.

4to3dWdW27LbO3IuiqiXyA.text: This place was amazing! Our waiter was named donavon and he was on point. I ate way to much but it was so good i couldn't help myself. Definitely coming back again!

tCgXhmQInicDrLTTC8PEwg.text: We sat in market and had instant service. You order at the bar then find a seat, or take-out.  Cinnamon roll was amazing! Omelet was very good  and perfect serving size.  Highly recommend this one.

7l11us3v78uUxVnocCDkgA.text: After my last review, the manager of Olive and Ivy contacted me and asked us to give them another try.  He apologized for the poor service. I am so glad he took an interest in our comments and asked us to return. This latest visit definitely rates 5 stars. We again sat outside on the patio that overlooks the canal. It was perfect. The service was excellent and the waiter was very attentive without hovering. The food was perfect. My husband ordered the rib-eye steak and said it was cooked to perfection and very tender. I ordered two vegetarian appetizers, hummus with vegetables and the flatbread. The margherita flatbread rates among the best I have ever eaten.  I am so glad we were asked to give this establishment a second visit. The outside atmosphere and location makes it a favorite of ours to take out of town guests.

vdWFn85mOvDsCcIrs2dsyA.text: Worst service, my food took 40 min, to get my food and the server just gave me attitude and forgot to place an order, not worth my money, and yes I'm disappointed with the service, because it's a nice place.

LHk-ekPSoxdW9e4IrtfQ-w.text: Had a wonderful dinner here with friends out on the patio by the canal. It was super relaxing. Love the christmas lights yay! I had a simple lettuce salad and fig flatbread, which were both wonderful. For desert our party ordered the pound with apricots which was very meh to say the least. Either that or pound cake just sucks. It might be the latter. It was super dry. We got a scoop of vanilla ice cream with it which we were all fighting over. Definitely would go with a simple two scoops next time and leave it at that. Oh yea, and loved the wine and drink selection and our very knowledgable waitress.

WVsBPTS6gAgK1u3d5NJw1w.text: This is a great place to come for Happy Hour!  The Manchego was a fun starter for me!  It was bread topped with fresh ingredients and a little on the sweet side.  The best thing here to me are their flat breads.  I've had the Prosciutto Crudo (potatoes), Margherita, and the Piccante (sausage and salami).  If I had to pick a favorite, I would go with the piccante as the best only since it had a lot of kick to it, and I don't want to go with the boring route.  The service is good and the view of the water is nice.  This place has a nice vibe and I would definitely go back!

vP3zddzMJc-xNvVo5Qx95w.text: Lve!!!   The patio is awesome. Occassionally the wind blows and the Waterfront doesn't produce the best of smells ... but the ambiance on the patio more than makes up for it. The wine was amazing, the mediterranean flatbread was awesome, we tried some of the bruschettas that were great. I really love the vibe inside too. We were there on a Sat night and the DJ kicked it up a notch but was not overpowering at all.   I'll def be back!

Rnq7r6XT-Y7T6rDbQiQyCA.text: this place has been on the list for years, and finally after getting our act together, we met another couple for a dinner at Olive and Ivy.  the decor, in traditional Fox style, is perfect. from the lights to the tile to the bathroom...even the servers are perfect looking. speaking of service, our waitress had this very laid back, comfortable air about her, but with confidence. she made some suggestions as we were ordering which were helpful. we had to ask a few times for water glass refills though.   the drinks were splendid. i had a rum honey martini and it went down way too easily. the sorbet in the drink was fantastic. for dinner, i had the sweet potato cannelloni. the pasta was soft, the sweet potato just a tad softer....it was seasoned perfectly and the sauce drizzled was a mix of sweet and savory. my wife had the mushroom tortelli and i tasted a bite and i love that earthy smell/taste of well done mushroom dishes.   i couldn't bare desert but they all sounded delicious. the only other dish tried was the salmon and i thought it might have come from a picture cutout is was so beautiful.   a great evening out with some great food!

tMqUJWWFG4sxp3Vbd_N68A.text: You walk in to impressive decor and a friendly hostess. Server was also friendly and helpful.   My appetizer was tasty and arrived quickly. .    The Caesar salad was too cheesy for my taste and the lasagna was more sauce than noodles.   I did like the cherry sorbet...

dPlIrC8_aoCLUsdW1fvFvw.text: Love this place. Food is always good. Service can be slow when it's busy, cause when it's busy here it's busy. Me and my friends come here a lot.

G_WguE2-WmzRbRwyC2EWTQ.text: Had breakfast here yesterday. The service was fantastic (our server's name was Landis) and the food was great will definitely return.

L0kSNQqh5BWYGrX3_OtlXA.text: What an incredible meal!! Had a reservation for 7 on a Tuesday. There was a sight delay for our reservation and they brought us water and bread with pesto to the patio. Went above and beyond for service and menu choice. Meal was absolutely delicious! Everything from the bacon wrapped dates and artichoke hearts appetizers to the salmon and steaks, PERFECT! Donovan was our server and he went out of his way to make sure we had an incredible meal. Will definitely eat here every time we're in town!

fcD4Z0-EIsIZ9GjzjNxQKQ.text: Was an impromptu dining visit and did not have a reservation but we were greeted quickly and told of our seating options without a reservation, we opted to done outside on the patio since it was a nice evening, we were given a table along the canal and it was perfect.  Our server was also fantastic!  We decided to do the AZ Restaurant Week menu as the options were just perfect for what we were looking for.  The fresh bread and pesto that were brought to the table was delicious.  The bacon wrapped dates were amazing, and not a small portion  either. I had the white bean and kale minestrone and it was also very good. For dinner we had seared scallops over a sweet corn and asparagus, and bacon wrapped pork tenderloin with fingerling potatoes and swiss chard.  The scallops were cooked great and the corn and asparagus very tasty.  The pork was cooked to perfection, moist and melted in your mouth with the smokiness of the bacon just yummy.  For dessert we chose the chocolate mousse and apple crisp.  The mousse was a perfect size and not too sweet.  The apple crisp was a bit disappointing, it was extremely soupy, which our server also recognized but said there was no manager to tell.  Over all a great evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cappuccino and Apple Crisp not so crisp
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chocolate Mousse
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Seared scallops

Lx8KUQ179SEEZdRCIBAD2A.text: Only because I have to give a rating.  Nothing bothers me more than when you bring friends in from out of town and not only do you get the worst service, but unfortunately we got no service.  Save yourself the trip and pick any place else.

_zDeB9tF5z8OYWc8bwlBxg.text: Great for meeting up with friends and family, or celebrating birthdays. I enjoyed it when I went there, but the price is high... Like appetizers are double digits price. The food quality does justify the price because the food was good. I had the ziti... I think. I was definitely stuffed when I left there.

faa6P_LhdwKnMXtwCxzTUA.text: First time i am giving a Fox Restaurant such a low rating.  Really was not at all impressed by the dishes. My food was in the luke warm family when i got it. I really don't mind luke warm food. It's nice cause i can just start eating with out worrying about scalding my face. (wish it was a little bit warmer though).   I got the veal raviolis and shrimp ontop (as recommend by the server).  Shrimp was overcooked... :\, ravioli was just okay... I wasn't really blown away by it. Veal tasted dry inside...is that possible with ravioli?   I tried the rest of my parties dishes and i wasn't blown away. Maybe my expectations have become too high of the fox restaurants.  I will chalk it up to a bad night at the restaurant. I'd give them a second try because all the other fox restaurants i have been to, i've enjoyed.   But out of this experience it was a 3.  :\

SNZ_01vTeELPg1hjLPlnlA.text: Maybe I am just an LA girl with LA expectations.  I found most of the restaurants, in Arizona, not up to my taste.   However, Olive & Ivy was  a breath of fresh air.  And I am writing mostly about the ambience.  It was refreshing to find young, trendy people in a place full of energy.  Vibrant decor that came to life as the DJ spins EDM.  The glasses of wine helped too! The food was pretty yummy. I would recommend the roasted mushroom bruschetta if you like balsamic.  The scallop entree was bit on the sweet side but the rib eye was pretty good.    Appetizer + 2 entrees + 2 drinks + tip = $130 Reasonable.  We will go again...  I can see it being a personal favorite.  A place to go with we are sure in going to be good.

M10r0UJyZqjZ7AfaS5enpQ.text: Visiting Scottsdale for the first time, who knew it's a foodie mecca!  Yay, I was thrilled!  My good friend Teri recommended this spot.  We walked in and were impressed by the gorgeous lighting and spaciious layout.  But my eyes were drawn to their ultra chic patio!  Too bad it was freezing outside, but we were seated in a nice warm spot.  They do have a great happy hour menu, I wish I had grabbed a drink at the bar first to take advantage of those prices.  I ordered the Butternut Squash and it was rich and fabulous.  Their focaccia bread as a starter was the bomb, we asked for a second serving!  I heard this was part of some Fox restarurants, so I definitely want to check out ther other restaurants.

1z--xNm62aY7pXGN0YlHaA.text: Enjoyed a Birthday treat for the Birthday Boy. Beautiful evening for a stroll and delicious gelato.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Gelato
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Birthday Boys Dessert! Beautiful evening to stop in Olive and Ivy for Gelato.

l1KqS4gzK7Z01-McoNaoUA.text: I've been a few times and every time is great!  The flat breads, bruschetta, and salads are great!   Although the best dish they have is the Chopped Chicken Salad.  The peanut butter granola just makes it!!!

G7I_HDO5CFE51l2BNQuoeg.text: I came for the ambience but walked away with so much more.. I did not make reservation for the patio seating but my guest and I still got great table near the patio inside. FYI.. They do have open community seating on the patio if you do not mind sharing your area.   We got the chef's board with wine..It was the perfect way to end long work week and catch up. The variety of different meats/cheeses with nuts were perfect! I was pleasantly surprised by the soft spread cheese drizzled with olive oil, great compliment to hard crusted bread on the board.   If your in the mood for desert they have gelato flavors that will make you want to cheat on your diet!   Lastly they turn on music after 7ish and lower the lights perfect atmosphere to relax and enjoy dinner..

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Dinner menu
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Wine menu

-q_d8Q_rf7hZikx6_Z686w.text: This is one of my favorite Scottsdale eats. I love everything about this place, especially the outdoor lounge space with the community seating and fire pits. I had a wonderful glass of wine, and we shared flatbread pizza and artichokes.  So tasty!  I thought our server was a doll and she indulged us as we argued about who had the best wine, then when she found it was my birthday she brought me a wonderful birthday surprise.  The BEST every desert, some banana custard with chocolate and mocha on top. YUMMY.  Thanks for making my date night romantic, fun and warm! Hugs to O & I.

HTV-RmkCxax2cVWS-lh7dg.text: Came to Olive & Ivy for brunch. The menu was relatively limited, but enjoyed our meal. I ordered an espresso martini and the breakfast sandwich. Both were okay, but not great. The staff was friendly and helpful! Would like to try another meal here.

WRi2lcBVxkBfgpyUkK_DFQ.text: I've been here a few times and it's always consistent. The service is attentive and knowledgeable (in fact... some of the most knowledgeable wait staff I've seen).  The drinks are consistently good and they have a good wine list. They are also fairly well equipped for large groups with private rooms and large tables in the main dining room.    The food is good, but not great.  It's never bad...  it's consistently decent, but doesn't blow me away.  I recommend the scallops, but replace the corn with salad...  the corn is a strange combination and not very tasty.  The kale salad is good, but too much kale without enough other parts of the salad mixed in.  The staff and ambiance are the winning aspects to this place.

kxXYBAWtr9ZXSqA27w8aVA.text: The Waterfront Scottsdale is such a beautiful place and exactly why I love coming to Olive and Ivy for brunch. The menu is healthy and pairs wonderfully with a classic mimosa or bellini. I love sitting on the patio or near the windows that has the feeling you're in a European cafe. I definitely recommend being or happy hour before heading to old town or shopping at Scottsdsle Fashion Square  which are all steps away.

TIB7WdN_oMLPjUZCKo9GOg.text: The night was beautiful and the waitress was sweet but the food was disappointing! My mom had the mushroom pasta and I had the lasagna bolognese ~~ both were too dry with too many pieces of pasta.  The beet salad was good and the peanut butter mousse was unremarkable.. Sad and surprising since the place was packed!!  Eating outside under the heat lamps was brilliant though! Cheers...

CYgWBcYL-JiIrMxNpLb68w.text: Me: So I love their grapefruit mojito. Srsly? Autocorrect doesn't think mojito is a word. Anyway, the drink is delicious.   Craig: I tried a sip and I totally agree. I should have had one, too. The beer was fine, but I didn't realize it was gonna be in a bottle, so I'm sad about that. A little pricy for a bottle.   Me: This was a surprisingly noisy restaurant given that it wasn't packed on a Tuesday night. But I have sat on their patio in more clement weather, and it was delightful. Reminds me of Paris. 5 stars for the patio.   Craig: It was mostly empty when we first noticed the noise level. That being said, it's nicely decorated inside. It's a cool ambiance.   Me: Agreed. And the service was very good, very professional and prompt.   Craig: Yeah, we got our food really fast. However, it was all cold.   Me: The bruschetta was clearly intentionally cold, but I think I would have preferred it hot. Mushrooms, asparagus, etc., seem like they should be served hot.   Craig: I think my surprise favorite was the seasonal chef board, which was like a build-our-own bruschetta.   Me: Yes, it was tasty, though I preferred the mushroom bruschetta.   Craig: I'm changing my answer. That was also my favorite.   Me: But I still think I prefer the pub board and bruschetta at Postino. And this place is a little pricier.   Craig: But it is Scottsdale.   Me: True. Still, a solid four stars for me.   Craig: Easy four.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Grapefruit Mojito - delishus
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Seasonal Chef&#39;s Board
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Prosciutto, mushroom, and asparagus bruschetta

Koopfnq9jSTLeJpz5HKryw.text: I was super excited to try Olive & Ivy during my first trip to Scottsdale and happy to report it did not disappoint! I had seen many photos and read way too many reviews after my fair share of yelp stalking! We were able to snag a reservation for Saturday afternoon for a group of 6. The space is large and beautiful!! The menu was simple and not to overwhelming which is a huge + in my book! We all tried something different and all of it was really great (flatbread + egg sandwich + kale salad + salmon bagel + truffle fried) ! What made our experience exceptional was the service we received! Our server was incredibly funniest, personable, attentive!!! She had us laughing each time she stopped by! I ended up spilling some ketchup on my blouse and she was me trying to clean with a napkin, she quickly went and grabbed some sparking soda water to see if that would help it, when it didnt she found a tide pen!!! TRUE STORY this lady was a gift!   All in all we had a great time during brunch! I'd def return!

CLZcQSGPqj-IkdSQ_8FRSQ.text: Best meal in a long time. Take a credit card, not cheap but way worth the money. Eat dessert. You'll thank me afterwards.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Dessert
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pork tenderloin
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Shrimp risotto

BVgjNNAPU9Yfvbau4eEJsQ.text: Two words: espresso martini. Thank me later! Everything on this menu is delicious.(Basically had their whole menu). Recently had the pasta and it was so good!

4b-DQ-bvi19CEYdadS2VSg.text: Came here for brunch with a few friends before a Spring Training game! The food is sooo good! Huge portion for a decent price - especially given the high quality of food! I definitely recommend grabbing a bite and some drinks if you're on the fence about going there! This place never disappoints. Close to the waterfront and right by the main OT Scottsdale area. Be prepared for an hour+ wait if you didn't make a reservation, otherwise try and grab a seat by the bar or at he open tables outside (the ones with the fire pits on the southwest side of the patio)!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Waterfront
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Nuyten being inquisitive about the menu
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Hot mocha

vW53tEsw_Exc7FLK87D9nQ.text: Underwhelming!  Not even 1/2 the lamb in gyro for $15!  Crazy silly to cheat on the meat.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Ayl9GwJSwz-AJeDzUjnX3w.text: The decor in this place is so beautiful. It took a couple of trips to be able to lock down a reservation, but worth it. Everything we ordered was amazing even the dessert. Our server was wonderful.  My husband and I had a 5:15 pm dinner reservation  to catch up with an old friend(too early but it was Friday night) and long after dinner was done we never rushed to leave (3 hrs we chatted away). I can't remembered what we ordered, we there a month ago. I believe we ordered t-bone steak, artichoke hearts, key lime pie cheesecake and I can't remember the 2-3 other items, but nothing was disappointing.  If you can snag a spot on their patio-do it. It seems to be the place people kick off the night, we saw a few bridal shower parties, bachelorette parties, and girls night out type of groups.  Worth dinning here at least once.  This company is also associated with North Italia, which we are huge fans of.

V7_iA2xd8bJHwVJb2MACGw.text: TL;DR - great food, beautiful interior.   On a recent trip to Arizona, Olive & Ivy was on my bucket list. (As any respectable Yelp Elite would, I did my homework.)  We had two plates of bruschetta trios, and three of the six arrived wrong; one was a completely different toast that we didn't order, the salmon Lox one had no Lox (hello...! Haha), etc. Errors aside, they were incredibly good. We agreed we could have easily just had those for our meal and been fine.   We also got two salads - Caesar and Mediterranean with chicken - and they were good.   The house bread never came, although we were told it was coming, so I can't comment on that.  Our waiter was quick and attentive, but there were plenty of mistakes in a small number of dishes.   Even still, we'd be back. We could have stayed here for hours!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bruschetta: Prosciutto, Salmon Lox, and Asparagus
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Outside (Olive &amp; Ivy on the left)
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mediterranean Salad with chicken

QBc_yb-5eFKCdFvYd-Xpjw.text: We really love Olive and Ivy and this is a really nice, upscale place to go and enjoy a nice fancy dinner with friends before heading out for fun in Old Town. We had my wife's birthday here and the staff was wonderful and we had a wonderful experience here. 5 stars and one of my top picks for Scottsdale!

o_Rn4ynj56TiYZStA5pgbQ.text: The Marketplace is open for breakfast....and it's WICKED AWESOME. Good coffee. Great pastries. Amazing breakfast burrito. The French toast is pretty yummy as well. Don't be fooled by the hours listed. It's open at 7am!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cinnamon French Toast with berry compote.

4aOvclAAHsyZ-rbFoBF4jw.text: Super! My 1st good meal in Phoenix ! Sigh ...come with family so Chinese food everyday..sucks...  Good as it said ..highly recommend...  The braised short rib pizza PB&J smoothie

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

SbXMM1Tjbcn8TeZT6zL2XA.text: The food was good, but I wish an establishment like this came with more vegan or vegetarian options outside of salads or pasta. They did have a toast combo "shared plate" that I turned into a meal. The options were 3 or 5 pieces of specialty toast, I went with 3 but wish I ordered 5 since the toast was more of a small baguette slice. The drinks were good, but expensive for Phoenix/Scottsdale. We ate at the bar so the service was good and the bartender was friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Shared plate toast - buffalo cheese, asparagus and avocado. $10 I believe.

PrD_2HAPFtTD7zqrCXcAlA.text: If you have a thing for Italian and Mediterranean then this is your place! Come hungry, this place oozes freshness in all that they offer from the Fresh Baked Focaccia with Pesto to their flatbreads and pasta options.  Ambiance: Hip trendy vibes. Service staff is extremely helpful and nice. If it's not too hot, sit outside on the patio it's a beautiful view.  Recommendations: Bruchetta (Mushroom and Roasted Garlic- Finger Licking good, I mean it!) and Prosciutto and Fig, Molte Bene! Pesto Chicken Flatbread is packed with flavor and not too heavy. Pasta: You must get the Wild Mushroom Pappardelle- It's amazing, it has truffle, herbs and Parmesan cheese (sorry folks it has no meat, but a well done dish) highly recommend it. It's pack with flavor, and if you are a truffle fan this is a must.  I can't go back soon enough! Make a trip to Camelback Rd to check this place out!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

xplYzHy-jtdvcZBo55XTEw.text: Cool place but awful service, for me at least. I was there with my wife yesterday for our anniversary. We had an awesome table on the patio but our server (John) was sooo slow and disinterested it was insane. He walked by our table 5-6 times to go over chat with his two friends at a table next to us but he kept ignoring us. It took him almost 30 minuets just to bring me a soda...honestly he was kinda creepy too.  I typically don't like writing bad reviews but man this guy has no business of being a server at all.  The restaurant is cool and the food is pretty solid too. Reasonably priced too. But crappy service will turn me to go elsewhere next time.

hLsSQ9ZOVnqs7CnInh59_w.text: One of our FAVORITE restaurants! Love the vibe, location, and the food is FANTASTIC! Try any flat bread, salad, pork, or the sweet potato cannoli with chicken, that is my favorite!

zwVw6egYiPfRrP7Cr-m2NA.text: Went here after a college graduation and ordered the lasagna. 10/10 would order again. The lasagna was bowl based and stayed hot for the duration of the meal. The strawberry shortcake was fantastic as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Sdupnld5yArKbcf3jIbC7g.text: Good food and quite possibly the best drinks in town. Bar is well stocked and bar staff make great drinks. So refreshing (excuse the pun) to get a well made drink at a restaurant.

JkUmWj8gOGQySIEMyg-S4A.text: Such a big place, with lots of things going on!  If you like open flames, you may find it fun to watch their open-air kitchen.  The service was quite good, and they have bottles of wine for almost any budget with a knowledgeable staff.   Their lamb and couscous dish was decent, though after seeing the rib-eye steak, I should have ordered that... The fish also looked quite good.   Also, get the peanut butter caramel sea salt chocolate mousse - it's good enough to eat it every day in place of a bowl of cereal, and it's just about as big! (I'd figure out how to make it at home if it didn't have so many calories...)   You could of course choose to get just the mousse and skip dinner... and I wouldn't hold it against you, though you might want to compliment it with the chocolate-chocolate-chocolate cake and an espresso when you do just so you don't pass out from the sheer weight of all the amazing calories you've eaten!   The espresso after dinner was an excellent addition to the mousse.  Stay hungry!

SUCy8hHWJrqLP0aE8YzZvQ.text: A beautiful place for brunch with friends. I would recommend sitting outdoors if it is a nice, sunny, and not too hot day. Sitting indoors is nice as well since the interior is all open to the outdoors.  Lots of food and drink options available for everyone, the server let us know that everything is made from scratch in house (impressive!) I ordered the table side mimosa with the smoked salmon & bagel and it was delicious! I had already snacked a lot at the farmer's market and had to take half to go, but no regrets would 100% get this again. Whatever my friends got too looked delicious (biscuits and gravy, egg sandwich, eggs Benedict, etc.) The Bloody Mary had a kick, perfect to wake you up in the morning.  What kind of was meh to me was the fact that we looked at the next table over & they got a full glass of mimosa while our table when first poured, only got maybe half a glass. Not a huge deal, but something that I saw while dining. Besides this little thing, service was great and we were in and out quickly.  Would recommend for anyone looking for a nice brunch in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Benedict
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Complimentary bread
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Smoked salmon

xAKCZvOm3IbDp0aaz6Fp9A.text: Great service and food for our brunch! I made reservations for brunch for my moms birthday. We arrived a little late but they were still very friendly and able to accommodate for us which we appreciated. The chopped chicken salad is amazing and perfectly portioned. My sister enjoyed her Mediterranean salad and the flatbreads are delicious. Service was very friendly, kind and fast. The patio is beautiful!!! While the weather is nice, make reservations to sit outside. Amazing! Highly recommend!!!

G6raZ-fAIRjpwAdEUMGWyw.text: I visited Olive & Ivy on a weekday evening in October. It was PACKED. The patio is mostly open seating. I had the margherita flatbread pizza and it was good. Our group also had a bottle of sangria. The patio was the perfect place to relax after a day of work. It wasn't too warm in the evening and the decor was perfect. 4 stars.

QLqIdjapoCmK7Zdk2JliVg.text: My husband took me to Olive & Ivy for my birthday last year and it was perfect! Their pesto is made in house and has the best flavor! I could go for a jar of that right now actually... My husband ordered the scallops, which I believe were a seasonal special, and they were the best scallops we've ever had. We also ordered a charcuterie style appetizer which was delicious. Wine was flowing and service was great! Can't wait to stop back here! (also - this is the cutest restaurant - definitely try to sit on the patio)

RrZRKgTyhiJhIf2s70xb9A.text: The foccasia bread is to die for.  It takes 2 days to make it, and I could eat it for 2 days.   Food is always fresh, and delicious.  Great service too.   The desserts are okay... and the gelato.  Salads are fantastic.

Q-QB6V48UlJfBDbm6B-a5Q.text: Nice vibe! Lots of cool interior design. We sat at the bar and only order cocktails and appetizers because we couldn't get a table on the patio. So a tip is to call ahead and advance to get a reservation if you likes on the patio because it's absolutely not going to happen if you are walking in on a busy night. My bad! One really interesting appetizer was the trio of bruschetta and you were able to pick which ones you wanted. They were very good and a real fun appetizer to share with my husband. I highly recommend Oil & Ivy if you really want to get a feel for modern Scottsdale culinary landscape.

Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Wonderful
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Best app

eZsTGbpEx9-O0ArTt_d0_Q.text: Marvelous, great ambiance, service and food selection. Our servers were top notch on the patio and in the restaurant. I felt the price was reasonable for a Scottsdale location.  If I were to return I'd probably just do appetizers and cocktails on the patio, it is really cool.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Barry at Olive and Ivy

tUvc56Gg3NMk02cUf-_gPQ.text: Great place to have drinks, visit, graze on appetizers or have a meal. Great meeting place centrally located.

qQyZaHaSD5Kx0CKGyW3y9A.text: I loved, loved the food here.  We went there for brunch and i had a croissant and the Braised Short Rib. Both were so ,so , so good!!  The service was great , the bread and pesto delish.   We decided to stay outside and The only thing i did not like was all the bird poop falling on our table/ on our clothes and on our plates. Those trees outside are beautiful so maybe just install something to catch all  poop drops. :D.

PWLcJWZUuDueM7oBqIZZFg.text: Very gorgeous restaurant with amazing atmosphere--it's really large and yet not too noisy when its full of people. Really nice surrounding area filled with restaurants. The cafe section of the restaurant opens earlier and yet I cannot find the exact time online.   The brunch menu was a little uninspiring and pretty limited compared to their regular menu? Pretty regular items, and from the photos on Yelp, sadly they don't match the beautiful decor either :( Despite of this, the food was fine. The potatoes that came with scrambles were the best! I also love the complimentary bread, which went really well with the pesto!  Otherwise, I would come at a non-brunch time, or just ordered from the cafe with pastries...

J-OZ8YFJIZGch_T-R9J0Bw.text: We've been coming to Olive and Ivy for several years. It's one of our favorites as far as food, however I will never sit at the bar again. As a prior reviewer stated service is awful. You can sit there with four people behind the bar and watch them visit, as they ignore you. We visited on a Sunday (03/31/19). It was so disheartening. I even told the bartender and he indicated that he was surprised and mentioned reviewing a video. I hope that management does review a video. This has happened repeatedly. Maybe you should consider some changes. And by the way, it was not a very busy time...11:30 am or so.

3Th_o2aIWNcCqcleKJsKQg.text: I'm from Dallas Texas and was visiting Arizona for a quick vacation. We heard a lot about Scottsdale and we looked up places to eat, Olive & Ivy was one of the first things to pop up on yelp. The 2 stars I'm giving are only for the aesthetic of the place. The seating area outside on the patio is very appealing. We sat outside around a fire place and the patio was decorated with lights. Now let me get to the part that really made me disappointed. The food was terrible. First off the price is not cheap, so therefore if I'm paying for something expensive I expect it to be good. I came with 3 other people and only one thing out of all our orders was alright. We ordered the rib eye steak which is what they promote highly, we asked for it medium well. The steak was $45 and it comes with one side which is 2 small pieces of finger potatoes and that's all. The steak came out bleeding and pretty much Raw. It was very rare and red. Second the chicken in the Mediterranean salad was burned and tasteless. The waitress only appeared a few times. She did not ask for us how our food was at all, even after seeing that it was barley touched.  Only recommend coming here strictly for drinks and a cute place to sit with friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

KmwKkUTIa_hWU5aLUq478w.text: This place was simply amazing! The food, drinks and service were delightful!   I had the smoked salmon bagel and it's legit one of the best I've ever had!

QGi9Zz_CAnNqbB7YKXfI0A.text: Since my last visit to Arizona I've come to accept there are some truly exceptional restaurants in this desert state. Going to one of the wealthier areas of Arizona, Olive & Ivy is located next to a river and features a luxurious interior of velvet, wood, and spirits. From the moment you walk in you feel like this is going to be a special evening.   Interior - 5 stars Olive & Ivy has this beautiful, romantic mood at night. The lights are low and the shadows seep into the wood work. Homages to the old style of tungsten light bulbs hang from above while plush curtains drape from ceiling to floor. The style is open and wide, allowing light to come shine from the outside and having both outdoor and indoor seating connect with no walls to be a border. The kitchen is large and open letting anyone see the beauty of their art and the giant bar located near the entrance wraps around to the back where the gelato and take out area exists. Walking around just a little a bit shows Olive & Ivy is much bigger than you initially expect.  Service - 3 stars The service was good. Nothing exceptional comes to mind though the staff did seem to work as a fluid team. Good wait staff who'll probably do their best to accommodate your needs but more likely you'll get normal, friendly service.  Food - 4 stars The menu here is simple, with only about 5 categories of food and 4-6 options underneath them. This includes a section for bruschetta, salads, flatbreads, meats, and entrees. The bruschetta was excellent. They use fresh ingredients and the bread is crisp and flavorful. All the ingredients come together to compose a symphony in your mouth and though some are better than others, none are sub par. I was intrigued to try their shrimp risotto. Often times I have found risotto is usually under or overcooked so I was hoping Olive & Ivy would be the outlier; I was happy to be correct. When the risotto came out it did look like it might be overcooked but it was perfect. The rice was moist, plump, and took in the deep flavors of the stock it was boiled in. The spiciness of the Spanish chorizo was full and a great accent to the creaminess of the dish. Along with a tasty kale pesto the shrimp in the dish is plump and plentiful. They don't skimp on the meat and the bowl is a wonderful, filling meal. If they could make this dish this well every time more people would order risotto happily.  Price - 4 stars The price for the items aren't cheap. Most entrees will run around the $25-$29 range while the salads and flatbreads lean themselves to the $17 range. It'll be a bit on the expensive side but I highly recommend trying the food and it'll change your mind. You'll see food this good is worth it. Bring friends and do it as a share meal and you'll see it might even be less than you expect.  Conclusion  Olive & Ivy has a gorgeous atmosphere fitting of impressing dates and creating happiness. With a lavish interior and robust food this riverfront restaurant has all the makings of a great night out. A must try if you are in the Scottsdale area.
