w1SADLwJzfAM0HFJwSNmuQ.text: awesome and delicious place! good for groups!

VdF4bryfSxkTjD1boHDXOQ.text: I was glad I found this place in the sea of crap that is Phoenix.  Great to excellent food, not atrociously priced. Great sangria. Beautiful room. Good service. Classy good looking clientele.   Terrific cafe for daytime snacks and coffee.

vxRMQAGdS8S9OaiERwz5dA.text: This place is characterized by rude service, okay food, and a generally callous attitude toward customers . Ideally, this place would suit those who are looking for an awful evening in a nice part of town!  If you are anything other than lily white, blondes preferred,   expect to wait an eternity for any service.  The waitress we were unlucky to get was indeed a RACIST.  She was downright belligerent and rude, behaving as if she was doing us a favor by even getting us food and drinks. We were a group of eight people and had a tab in the $400-500 range yet got lousy service.  The manager was not helpful either and his attitude was simply that the waitress is usually very good - this despite the fact that we complained that she was awful. I have been here twice and will NEVER GO HERE again.

Icm3bmxvOpmvGMODK9vWzg.text: This place rocks.  Great atmosphere.  Amazing food and super personable friendly staff.  Everything I've had so far has been incredible; from the humus plate to the bacon cheese burger and my favorite, the beat salad.  A must try!

1-HH6sVyI_erAY_pWqCB6A.text: lunch today with a friend have not been here for quiet some time. they changed up  the menu a bit but some of my favorites are still there and are still just a good. (dates wrapped in bacon) shared a med salad and sweet potatoe cannonolli was wonderful. we sat at the bar and peter took great care of us very pleasennt and knowledgable of the menu and made some great suggestions. fox resturant knows how to do somethings right and this place is still a hit with me...thx

5RNbGgln6QirzaU8_xjo_A.text: The service and the food was excellent! This was our second visit and there were no surprises; consistently great!

JRvIZ8v43SLojEmFj5aSsQ.text: Expensive, definitely, but I would say worth it.  The strong points in my opinion are the flatbread pizza, the booze, and the gelato.  I've been there several times and the only entree I remember was the flatbread pizza so that might be a bad thing I guess?  The store attached to the restaurant has some great stuff.  Definitely has that Scottsdale vibe going on, but I enjoyed it anyway.  They serve AWESOME french toast for breakfast.

tZQL9EiToF98L7kcN3FDqA.text: We showed up at 7:45 for an  8 :00 reservation and weren't seated until 8:45..great start guys..3 of our 4 entrees had to be sent back because they wre undercooked and/or cold...not good...the manager came out to inquire why we were disatisfied and I tolod him that his sous chef wasn't in the kitchen...he asked me what i meant and I said , :Your sous chef isn't in the kitchen, because he's the one who makes sure that every plate goes out properly." He blew me off and offered us free deserts which were  pretty pedestrian as we spent $300 for the four of us. I'd avoid this place at all costs. First time here...last time here...natch.

2da-7dFHANezz0sjKFXpcg.text: My girlfriend and I were walking around Fashion Square and we decided to have dinner at Olive and Ivy. We were told there was about a 45 minute wait so we had a seat on the patio. After at least 45 minutes of waiting (and watching several patrons put their names on the list after us and get seated well before us) I went in and asked about how much longer until we could be seated, and was told about 15 minutes. 20 minutes later we were finally seated. I mean it was busy, but not that busy so needless to say we were a little frustrated. Now, all of that being said, dinner was amazing. I had the sea bass and my girlfriend had the ahi tuna. We thought both were outstanding. The service (once we got in) was great and our food came surprisingly quickly. I highly recommend this place, but you should definitely make a reservation.

16_tthkILf8KRrPiQcrBrA.text: By far one of my favorite restaurants in the Phoenix/Scottsdale area.  Ever since I've moved here for school, I've always come here with my fiance, friends, or out of town guests.  The food never disappoints.  MUST try their tuna tartare in "taco" shells.  It is DELICIOUS OMG.  They make an awesome red sangria.  Their ahi tuna steak and sea bass are DELICIOUS!  Also, I've tried their featured specials from time to time and they are always yummy.  Overall, great restaurant.  On the weekends, they have a live DJ so it really makes it a great dining experience and they have a nice open air atmosphere with tables on the terrace facing the canal.  Service is always great here.  MUST EAT HERE!!!

CBfOsePDHeILnFuxS3fw7w.text: Terrific ambience and meal Wait staff was very attentive This was our second visit in 1 month

DHAs5rBqcZGdvgOKqzPNjQ.text: Food was amazing and it's a good thing b/c the hostesses kind of sucked.  Our 45 minute wait took almost 2 hours and the snotty high schoolers working the hostess stand almost caught a piece of my mind.  But thankfully the food and service made up for it.  I'd say go earlier or later to avoid some of the rush, especially as the bar area gets jam packed.

5_Xp-ZBug2FKN-OXW_-JbA.text: I went to Olive & Ivy for the first time for my friends bridal shower which was held in the banquet room.  We were promptly greeted and were offered mimosas or white sangria.  I had the sangria which was awesome, not too sweet.  The server was extremely attentive and very nice (I wish I knew her name).  Anyhow, the entire menu was great.  I especially enjoyed the pizza which had lox on it.  I never had lox on pizza, but it might just be my favorite thing.  You could tell the ingredients were super fresh.  I will definitely be back and only gave 4 stars because I need to try the rest of the menu.

lET7CFxeQXQXUhBQcPzASA.text: On the positive side, the food was imaginative, well executed and presented. However on the other side of the coin, the waitstaff is poorly trained and aggressive in telling you what you want, even after you order it your way. For example, my medium rare tuna arrived medium well because I wouldn't order it rare. There appeared to be little service training: when ordering wines by the glass, the waiter said that is what we call it even if it is wrong, when he missed one of the ladies in our party during the drink order, there was no apology just a flip comment from the waiter that clearly offended her. The staff clearly has the priority and walked thru parties while they were being seated rather than taking the 2 extra steps to walk around. It is a shame, since this a nice place with good food at a reasonable price and everyone in our party enjoyed their food but the waiter ruined it for some of us and there are so many good alternatives close by.

Hh8yRDgLBaN-cVFlmrBQeg.text: After hearing good things about this place, I finally made it here for lunch.  Unfortunately, it was after the menu change so I was expecting different choices.  Upon entering, the first thing I noticed was that there wasn't much space to sit.  There were maybe 5 small tables near the ordering counter and just as much at the patio.  This was a fast casual place(you order at the counter but they'll bring food out to you).  The menu was somewhat small.  You get to pick between pizza, salad, or sandwich.  I decided on a gyro and my bf got the corn pizza.  Since we wanted to sit inside, we decided to go past the ordering counter to see if there were any tables there.  I was skeptical since all I could see was the kitchen and waitstaff in that area, but it turned out there was a ton of restaurant seating that you can't see when you go in.  We weren't sure if we were suppose to sit there since it looked more formal, but we did anyway.  The food came within a reasonable amount of time and it was decent.  My gyro was generously portioned.  The pickle that came with my gyro could have been more crisp and the tzatziki sauce was pretty bland.  The corn pizza was also a generous portion and seemed quite good from the bite I got.  My main dislike of this place was the layout.  Seating shouldn't be hidden in the back.  The food is slightly pricey and none of the menu items jumped out at me.  I'd describe this place as underwhelming.  At least this place has underground parking.

oHopl0HZIoAw6j3LINzpig.text: Like Minneapolis & St. Paul. Like Cagney & Lacey. Like Nip & Tuck. Olive & Ivy is beautiful and near some water, entertaining and lesbian friendly and full of people who've had plastic surgery. Great space. Fabulous patio. I know. I know. The canal. Ugh. Love it? Hate it? Hey, it's there people. Embrace it! Like the Brady's did cousin Oliver.  And embrace the Eggs Benedict, Egg Sandwich, Focacciao bread with pesto and CENTER CUT CINNAMON ROLLS! You heard me people! Center cut. No non glazed, hardened, corner piece. Service was outstanding. I noticed the patio filled up just after we arrived. Isn't that weird? Does that ever happen to you? You arrive somewhere. Nothing. Soon the place is buzzing and so are you? Anyway. I digress. We were thirsty fashionistas recovering after a night at Scottsdale Fashion Week...i.e. we were pickled and thirsty. Ice tea and water was a flowin' the entire meal. They saw it in our blood shot eyes I'm sure. Eggs Benedict was perfection and had a delightful surprise of basil on top! Rickie LOVED his egg sandwich with avocado...looked great...though he never offered me any...Hmmm..Olive & Ivy. Like Ebony & Ivory. Living together in perfect harmony. Side by side....ok ok ok you get the picture.

jMaAO8WUeb7H5vopY1Thlw.text: Baaa.  Siiisss.  Boooo.  You played it way to safe with this one Fox.   There are no upscale Mediterranean/tapas style restaurants in Scottsdale, so I was really excited to try Olive and Ivy.  The space is beautiful.  I do not even want to fathom how much money went into this place.  The dining room is a little on the large side for my taste, but it still maintains a dark intimate ambiance despite its size.  Now onto the disappointments - the food is all quite good.  Very high quality ingredients.  But....  it still managed to bore me.  I was looking forward to strong cheeses, spice, pungent flavors, a culinary adventure, a good mystery.  No adventure here.  It was more Disneyland than Greece or Portugal or whatever they attempted to reference.  And the service was deplorable. Truly bad.  I know the restaurant is still new, but I am not willing to cut it much slack considering the prices.  Haven't they heard of training?  I won't be rushing back.  My advice to Olive & Ivy?  Have a little more confidence in the people.  Be a leader.  Push the culinary boundaries of Scottsdale's palate.  We need some vision.

D1x2ODBeLPh05fcwDfuUFw.text: We had a great dinner at this restaurant, fair prices, great flatbreads, beautiful restaurant.   Food tasted very fresh and and "waterfront" locale was refreshing after a few hot days in Phoneix. Very nice outdoor bar area as well.  Would definitely go back.

oBRFJDUMXzF5ksB3JMaKrA.text: Apologies for the delay, but I was here the Thursday before Super Bowl weekend.  I came here with a group of 10+ people and immediately gathered at the bar.  Considered a table but thought we were better off at the bar, since we weren't sure if our party would grow as the afternoon, evening and night wore on.  That was smart of us, since the group did grow substantially in number.  Drinks were pricey, but for the venue it was to be expected.  Atmosphere was fun, we did what we wanted, the hostess staff was absolutely adorable and sweet.  Around 5 they started charging cover ($25 a head!), so one of our friends (whose wife had been with us all afternoon) would have had to pay the cover to get in, but luckily I was able to (drunkenly, I might add) persuasively slur my magic to build a valid case, and my friend got in without having to pay.  We had a great time and had front row seats to the 50cent party entering the 944 village right across the way.

ap5-H16VI0U-aJvJP7FxPg.text: This restaurant was suggested to us by the gal at the Roaring Fork, as they were not open for lunch. I had the turkey sandwich, it was like having Thanksgiving between two slices of bread! It was awesome! The staff was engaging, not taking offense to our preoccupation with trying to figure out why some people got white napkins and some got black napkins. Turns out their white napkins are "linty" and they have had people complain, so they give out black napkins to anyone with dark pants on. Why anyone would complain to a restaurant  about lint on their trousers is an entirely different question. This place has great ambiance too. Check it out!

d7a0ufgIx_f-9oVRF9WTog.text: Beautiful location & great for breakfast or brunch. The bread served with freshly made pesto is a bonus, and the patio is lovely when the weather isn't too hot (not much shade). It gets busy during spring/spring training/weekends/etc. Good to make a reservation. The decor is really neat.

PX6AU7szYpaFWJr9Y84E7Q.text: beautiful outside patio on the waterfront with excellent food and service... the bacon wrapped dates, bruschetta and scallop entree were all delicious!  everyone from the host staff to wait staff to mgmt were all friendly and accomodating, will definitely return. the only (minor) issues we had were the iron patio chairs could use padding they were a bit cold and hard, and we thought it would've been easier if they had cut the bruschetta in half instead of thirds for our table of two...but other than those minor things def an A+ evening!

Y21prCW4NMzCg88HIVffGw.text: This place is great! I like the outdoor seating, which is casual and trendy. For instance, you can sit on comfy outdoor furniture that is grouped around a fire. The noise level and music are pretty loud, however, so this is not  a place for an intimate date or something.  Almost everything we have eaten here has been excellent, including flatbread, bagels with lox, gelato, and breakfast burritos. (My sister had the gyro, though, and didn't like it because the lamb had too much spice on it; the waiter happily exchanged it for something else). The coffee was pretty blase, though.

1zO4CtYT4T8KTOa3QsuEFw.text: The patio is the best! The environment is welcoming. And the service is nice. We wish the waiters/waitresses had to taste everything on the menu.

UfCDZVhSshFpDi1DdWEX0Q.text: This place was a huge disappointment. I went here because of all the stellar reviews on Yelp. Yelpers-- you steered me wrong.   I ordered the eggs Benedict. The description said it had shaved ham and basil hollandaise sauce. The waitress made a point of telling me that the "over easy" eggs would be very runny. Ok...Well I thought it was odd that they weren't poached, but went with it since I know Benedict includes a runny egg--It is part of what makes then delicious. I was also eager to try the bread since they made a point of mentioning that all their bread was baked in house. Boy, was I in for a big disappointment!  The Benedict arrived. It was two Thomas' English muffins with deli meat ham and the basil hollandaise was just sauce garnished with basil. The eggs were not runny--they were raw. I mean the egg whites were raw!  The waitress seemed startled when I sent it back, but was truly great about it. But...I think you can guess what happened next...It came back with over-cooked eggs...think hard boiled! At this point, I was starving, so I just went with it. The waitress noticed that I wasn't eating much so she didn't charge me.  So...I give them 5 stars for service, but 1 star for food.  I will say that it is a nice setting and I would go back for a drink, but not much more.  Thank you to the stellar wait staff for somewhat redeeming the experience!  That being said, I was just visiting the area so I won't likely be back.

YkCRvR0emS0eSvYEI-ABgw.text: Our waiter introduced the restaurant as a Mediterranean/Italian restaurant with a twist. As best I can tell, the "twist" was the lack of Italian dishes on the menu!  Good drinks, great food, prompt service and a nice atmosphere at Scottsdale prices - need I say more?

X9XtqB73RnO9MTWpXoGkOQ.text: It was our three year anniversary and we were  Treated with kindness and amazing customer  Service.  Olive and Ivy was top notch in all  aspects of service.  Thanks for letting me  Share.  I will be returning for some more  delicious dinning.

mY3VhNhkjg5HxNzjNk7I_w.text: Their bruschetta is to die for and I had this Italian dish that had cheese and sweet potatoe inside that I can't remember the name of but it was seriously so good!

1MDX2QLJYuYzybuywp_pxQ.text: I went here for the first time for my birthday. My gosh was I surprised. It was lovely there.   They have indoor and outdoor seating. The outdoor part has benches and lounge chairs. So it is a casual Atmosphere right along the waterfront.   Pesto and bread to start is amazing. We asked for more servings. It is addictive.   Got two big meals that we couldn't finish. But the food was excellent!!  Then some gelato for dessert. Absurdly fantastic.   I have zero complaints about this place. It is one of my favorite places in Scottsdale. I'm going to take family here soon.   Just make sure you make a reservation because it gets busy!

VhUiKjWqcyk08douMR981Q.text: The service was incredible and the food was good. While the dinner selections were under portioned and over priced everything tasted fine. I sampled the lamb meatballs, beet salad and a variety of their bruschetta. Olive and Ivy makes a delectable apple martini that was strong yet refreshing. Unfortunately I cannot recommend their cactus blossom cocktail, it was too sweet and had the flavor profile of a mikes hard lemonade.   Lastly I have to say bravo to the front of the house staff working on the night of my visit. Fox Restaurant Concepts have mastered the art of customer service and for that reason I'll be returning here.  I'll be back again soon and am looking forward to  trying their breakfast menu.

yqnJqCR8yTJfXANbEq5Yig.text: Just happened upon this place while traveling to Arizona to visit my parents.  Wow!  The ambiance is great and the food is even better.  We started with the bacon wrapped date small plate which was one of the most delicious tasting things I have "ever" eaten.  I highly highly recommend ordering this item, you won't  be disappointed.  We followed this with the kale salad and the funghi trifolati flatbread, both of which were made of very fresh ingredients, many of which were organic.  I will definitely be back here next time I'm in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. kale salad and funghi flatbread
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. kale salad
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. bacon wrapped dates

gD5ZhRC5tw0OfpIelklKgQ.text: Amazing!!! Service, atmosphere, food, all was wonderful. Probably one of the best meals I've had in the past month.

lDZeJ8KJrNMJEQkj6IaOPA.text: I really love this place. Great flatbreads, awesome happy hour. Go for brunch and get their delicious spicy bloody mary.  I've been here more than I've actually checked in via Yelp. Service has always been top notch and the food is consistently good. Did I say they have good flatbreads? They're awesome. Large portions, so don't order too much or you'll be going home with lots of leftovers.  Hummus is good, and oh I forgot to mention the baked items. Fresh breads and the cinnamon rolls are TO DIE FOR. Get there early and get them warmed up. The rolls go pretty fast so don't be surprised if they sell out.  This place is a little hard to find, but definitely worth looking for.

2EgjyFqnsWfLaqdN45PYlQ.text: Great trendy ambiance and outstanding service.  We ordered bruschetta to start off and enjoyed it.  Nothing spectacular, but yummy nevertheless.  Ordered kale salad and loved it.  Ordered sea bass and it was good as well.  DJ in the house playing variety of music to  set the mood.  Will return and try something new.

eSePozv97k1AjKCskifmUQ.text: Best meal experience in Scottsdale. The service, the flavors, the quality, the portions and the overall ambiance was outstanding. We will certainly dine at this gem if we happen to pass by Scottsdale again..

RQq3HMp-dgbbu6WYAwDm0g.text: Mason is amazing. Butternut squash items were amazing!  A must. Staff was very attentive to our larger group of ladies. Wait was a bit, but the restaurant was packed. Took a while for food to come out. But the staff kept coming by to tell us this, so no worries. We truly enjoyed all the different courses! Def going to be coming back!

VYKfWTexAZIQQIM8Ttfamg.text: Beautiful beautiful beautiful!!! Service was fantastic! We ordered shrimp risotto, sea bass w/cauliflower and the Scallops and polenta.  Yummy!!  What a fantastic dinner!!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Scallops and polenta - rich and flavorful.

Xh8QmgnWGMXPf7OAot3wcw.text: Recently had lunch with friends here and ordered a Margherita Flatbread, $12.  The flatbread is really a Pizza....I don't know why restaurants name Pizza different things, just call it what it is!  Anyway, the Pizza was very good.  It had a nice Garlicky kick to it and the Sauce was very light.....delish!  I had an Iced Tea to wash it down and it was very refreshing....I must have drank 5 or 6 glasses.  The service was great too, nice place to grab some lunch.  Return Factor - 90%

7kJDZba3nh7aHZvaazUIOw.text: I was able to snag the chef's table on a busy night and it was a wonderful experience. The chef influenced my husband to finally try hummus despite my years of trying!   They were very understanding of my dietary allergies and restrictions. They were charming and the food is absolutely amazing!   I would absolutely recommend this restaurant to any and all that want a superb dining experience.

g_ZCUrzQRlGJjSb2KDDD9g.text: We sat out on the patio celebrating with a few and it was just amazing!  The atmosphere on the lake front is beautiful on a gorg day!  We only had enough time for a champagne toast but I will definitely come back for dinner.  I love just hanging out casually in a stunning restaurant.

a9WKaNhHAhdYmZKRNJ3k8w.text: This was my first time to Olive and Ivy, I am a BIG fan of Fox Restaurants so I was excited to come here.  We went on a Friday night about 6pm and we got a table with no wait!  They brought out some AWESOME Bread with an incredible Pesto Sauce, Yummy!  I ordered the beet salad with arugula, goat cheese & pistachio.  I was NOT disappointed, highly recommend!  This was my dinner, I think I had to much popcorn at the movie before. :)  Between the salad and bread I was satisfied and not to full for desert!  We shared a desert, Apple Tart, Very Good!  My mother had the Mediterranean Salad and a Friend had the Lasagna and both said their dishes were good.  Service:  Our server was very attentive!  The only reason I did not give Olive and Ivy 5 Stars was because it was too noisy in the restaurant.  I have noticed more and more restaurants are going for the cement floors that lend to a nosier atmosphere.

FrO1gStI_RJLqVaWYeLOaw.text: We came here with some new friends today for brunch after church, I was very impressed with the quality of food, service and atmosphere. The perfect type of place to go for brunch or lunch. I had the breakfast burrito which was great and topped it off with a couple of fresh mimosas!

BNxWMQ2XDM4ul3rYHY94FA.text: I have been here many times for lunch and it's great - 'an old reliable'.  The pesto and fresh bread is delicious.. I nearly always have the Salmon for my lunch....always excellent. This place gets really busy, but it's always good.

IUAGo5lDn68pIsIw4VJ1lA.text: Our last night in Arizona was at Olive and Ivy. The server was Sarah and she was excellent. The restaurant held our reservation promptly even though things were hopping on a Friday night. Food was very good too.  Cannot go wrong IMHO.  Not gourmet food, but a fun, vibrant place with good food and (for us) a great server.

HpLubqCxeB4FfI08uPElcA.text: The food is trendy and the drinks are cold and strong! Great location, great staff. I have been there three times and have always eaten on the patio-there is usually an art show or something going on, and you can put your name in and they will text you when your table is ready. I plan to go again soon!

A14f0ccW1coLzq5Mo_hlVw.text: We had a great experience at Olive & Ivy. Our server was very attentive and friendly, and the food came out quickly and was superb. I want to try to recreate their beet salad at home, but doubt it will taste as good! I did have a small problem with my meal, but after telling the server, we got a visit from the manager (who was very nice) and he apologized and bought us two desserts. It totally made up for any problem - the desserts (lemon cake with blueberry compote and peanut butter pudding) were too good - had trouble eating just a little!

JOTxSMLYBdIYloIaj0PKIg.text: One of the best restaurants ever!  My husband and I starts with the bruschetta, which had a variety of choices.  Our favorite was the shaved brussel sprouts.  Also had the bacon wrapped dated based on previous reviews.  It was amazing!  The atmosphere was nice... We ate outside.  Our waiter, Zak was exceptional!

_36YN0hBun30olqZnRkBJw.text: Food was good. Nice atmosphere. Our server seemed to be overwhelmed with tables when I went with a friend for lunch. I would go back as the food was good. Not exceptional but good and worth going back too.

zrgIXNzbecKrgt3dPMHozg.text: I didn't try any food but I did enjoy the fire pit and the s'more latte.  Great date spot and friendly staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fire pit &amp; s&#39;more latte. Great night cap.

3gAvk0sPd5Pe8fuVPKKiKg.text: My husband and I shared bruschetta to start.  We enjoyed all three, but he particularly liked the Fresh Mozzarella (delicious fresh basil!!) and I liked the Prosciutto and Fig (rich, sweet, delicious!).  I had the Lasagna Bolognese with garlic bread.  The drizzle on top of the bread was so creamy with the perfect hint of garlic.  The lasagna itself was also very flavorful.  Fresh bread and pasta make a difference.  There was a lot of energy in restaurant with the lots of little groups of people chatting and enjoying dinner.  The service was also great.  Our server was very helpful with tips to help us make decisions on what to order.  We had a fun evening and a delicious meal.

fynscdFCalgCOEEuS4RfZA.text: Ok seriously how is it possible for one place to have top notch customer service AND amazing food!?!? I am enjoying by far the best cinnamon roll ever and dude made my mocha perfectly! Thank you Olive and Ivy you make my mornings so much better!

rCwK3qYi6QIZ5u1xaWywHA.text: What a great place, the atmosphere was wonderful and the staff was informative about the food options and substitutions available due to my good allergies. Very helpful!

-3PH8pi7hpVEokwax9q7Eg.text: Awesome food and beverage menu. Great atmosphere! As long as it isn't too hot, grabbing a seat on the patio is highly recommended!

YsXQ_vGcBHZyoi8VcLUJNg.text: Went for Sunday brunch after morning rains so the patio was closed. They should switch entrances so the restaurant comes before the market. Kinda confusing for the first time visitor.  The restaurant itself is very nicely decorated with a classy feel.  It's a varied clientele: I noticed tables that could've been from the Golden Girls to Real Housewives of Scottdale to Teen Mom, AZ.  I thought the food, while good, was not anything spectacular. Portions were pretty small for the price and there was not much by way of presentation to match the tag.  My sangria seemed a bit diluted.  Our waiter was being trained so I'll pardon his awkwardness as he tried to repeat everything he was supposed to memorize multiple times. I'd come back on a cool day to try HH out on the patio to people watch, but probably not for brunch.

U1WPWrWzldjf7uqr0h51ig.text: Shrimp risotto was really quite mediocre - grainy. Service was a little cold. The Fritto Miso was too oily..  The lamb meatballs were quite good.  The Pacific Bass was only OK - but the vegetables were great with it. The bread and pesto were the best flavors of the night.

dVncLz4dsM3FT-cdCsyVqw.text: Had dinner here this evening with some family from out of town. Stellar. Split the Fresh Mozzarella, Fig & Prosciutto and Manchego Bruschetta. All wonderful. The guys both ordered the bacon wrapped pork tenderloin, sister-in-law ordered the scallops and I ordered the spicy shrimp risotto. I had a bite of each and believe me when I say you can't go wrong with any of those entrees! Our server was friendly and made lots of recommendations and my boyfriend and sister-in-law both agreed the bartender made a mean Dirty Martini:) Overall a solid experience. Atmosphere feels upscale while still being casual, we'll definitely be back!

lxWhuQoRA23mVzn4Y_ateQ.text: Great atmosphere, kind of an upscale casual yet keeping it very sophisticated. Food was excellent, I loved their wine selection...something for everyone palette and budget. Give Happy Hour a try, we did and it was divine.

5UU9c9Xm0FAYZBbeq9fh2A.text: We got to the restaurant early but we could not be saeted for one hour . There is a beautiful lounge next to the waterfront.thecwaitress was attentive but it was cold wecrequested that the  heater get turned on but itvran out of gas. The fish we ordered was good but portion was small I had to order extra bread to get filled up. The c italian soup I ordered eas good but look warm. I akso tried their lasagna better portion but wery salty. The service was good at all times

aqwFUoE9RhijSKY2kJGiEg.text: My lovely bride and I visited on a nearly perfect day in Scottsdale (not hard to find).  We had lunch around 2:00 on a Friday and were astounded how busy the restaurant was but soon learned why that was the case.  Enjoyed an ice cold Peroni along with their bread and pesto dipping sauce.  Just ridiculously good.  I literally could have had the bread for lunch.  Light, airy, slightly salty.  Pesto was perfection.  We then shared the Mediterranean Salad and Chicken Pannini.  Salad was very, very good.  The Pannini was literally one of the best sandwiches I have wolfed down in a very long time.  Moist, simple, filling.  Unreal.   We found the service to be very solid.  Friendly, attentive but not intrusive.  There is not question that we will return.  The nice part is I already know what to order, as well.

7kmMjLJdTSPj_SS5YSJKNQ.text: Cranberry margarita is delicious. Butternut squash tortelli is fabulous! Ambiance is nice, comfortable and lively, but a touch loud. Portions are perfectly sized. Very satisfying!

PcWren-L7KwA7lTJNeEJ8w.text: Who put the pistachio's in the Beet Salad?  .... They are a genius!  We hit up Olive and Ivy for restaurant week on Saturday and we were more than pleased with entire experience.  They were pretty full so we took an early reservation for 5:45.  Starting at the bar, we enjoyed some  1/2 price drinks during Happy Hour.  The Pomegranate Martini is very tasty, and surprisingly not very sweet.   Once we got sat, everything at the table was spectacular starting with the hummus, then the sweet potato cannelloni and finishing with the coffee creme brulee.   I couldn't ask for a better meal.  The table agreed that the sweet potato was one of the best things they have ever eaten, it's a must!  I was in vegetarian heaven.   It was still a little hot to sit outside, but once fall kicks in, their patio at night is a romantic spot to grab a bite and enjoy some wine.

Vkm33pPuVMgnFkg01Udkiw.text: My husband and I ate here for the first time last night and LOVED it!  We had a reservation and were seated immediately in a really comfortable booth.  We liked the loud music, the atmosphere, and the energy of the place.  The location by the canal is so cool with the little bridge and all of the lights.  We split a butter lettuce salad (with avocado, bacon and perfectly ripe tomatoes)- it was delicious!  My husband had the scallops and I had the sweet potato cannelloni.  Both were fabulous and SO GOOD!  We had the peanut butter ice cream bar for dessert- the chocolate pretzel crust was very yummy.  Our service was absolutely perfect- Martin was very friendly, very helpful, and his visits to our table were perfectly timed.  We will definitely be back.

mIHsMMKjlN3brhEhRp2sxA.text: I never equate this as a place I think of when wanting to go out to eat.  Do not get me wrong, their menu is great BUT it is not anything like any of his other concepts ((Fox) in my opinion) since it seems a lil too simple and small....you can great an amazing meal (their scallops are awesome) here just for me it has been for the great patio, restaurant, bar ambiance for a few apps and drinks before heading out or somewhere for a quick drop in.  Great people watching and a great view of what the Waterfront architects were trying to create. Service is always just OK but this place always is busy so I guess that is to be sometimes expected.

gH2dsc1wDNIw8zWZPgeelg.text: Overall, wonderful!  Great food.  Loved the sangria.  Amazing outdoor seating by the water when the weather is nice!

SbGji4fj8AG2qRK1cWV3pw.text: We only came for breakfast because we were leaving to come back to Chicago, but I definitely want to try their dinner! After eating at Modern Steak and Sauce, we decided to come here and grab a bite. Fox group is three for three in our book! I had their egg sandwich with avocado, bacon and cheese and that was amazing! Those potatoes that it came with were so yummy too! It was deceiving, I wasn't sure if it was going to keep me full, but I was stuffed after eating it! Their muffins were yummy and my dog loved the treats I brought him home :) The outdoor patio was so beautiful and the dining room looked amazing. We will definitely try dinner when we come back to Arizona!

HrauVxN8FjpHGkb8Xx2t8w.text: This place was amazing! Got the lasagna and the lamb gyro.... very good!

YWjZMk4eITrFDoMJp17yig.text: It was a lunch on a random Wednesday, but the restaurant seemed vast and a little empty when we arrived.  We did see two of their private rooms which seemed to be a great choice for group dining.  I thought the food was average, our waiter was cute and friendly but a little slow for lunch, and the prices a little high.  I may need to revisit but there are so many places to go.  Luckily, my lunch friend makes all places fun!

Ks2HTz7kpNI_pvQfNI7TVg.text: Very good service. We had a party of 8, including an infant, and someone who is allergic to eggs and dairy - it was no problem. The food was wonderful. Modern looking inside. Had a gelato bar inside, which we didn't try because we brought cupcakes for someone's birthday. And I kept hearing how cool the women's restroom was. The one cocktail I had, ginger-something, wasn't my cup of tea, but food, etc. was great. I'd recommend to anyone, and we'll be back.

p2rJFzgU0hHV6wvA6GSx4A.text: Private room dining was nice, Mediterranean salad was great super fresh and flavorful; roast chicken in wine reduction was perfectly done, service was attentive. It was loud in the main dining room so this is probably not the spot for intimate conversations etc.

yer9pVVbsQDVR4QSxASPWQ.text: I have been to Olive & Ivy a couple times now, and the food is great.  from the ambiance of the restaurant to the smiling and helpful service, this place cant be beat if you want to try something "out of the norm" and tantalize your taste-buds.  This is a great place to have happy hour with tomato cheese flatbread or hummus, or a romantic date.

5niD1cgSRKuiWuASrV3-eQ.text: I went to Olive & Ivy last Friday night while on a girl's trip to Scottsdale and really enjoyed the restaurant. We made a reservation earlier in the day but when arriving to the restaurant realized that we wanted to set outside (the back patio is very cute and quieter). The bar scene is pretty good and I really enjoyed the red sangria. We ordered a bunch of items to share and everything was delicious. I recommend the roasted veggie crostini, the arugula salad, and the sweet corn and margarita flat breads. I'd give the restaurant 4.5 stars - the service was fast but our server sounded like he was reading off of a script in his head and didn't really understand the food or wine menus.

XbI56TGezYScc_zIySJaHQ.text: Favorite breakfast/lunch spot in Scottsdale. The food at the market shop counter is fabulous. The fruit and yogurt parfait is the best. And you can't go wrong with any of the sandwiches/salads. Make sure to end with a gelato. A must stop everytime we're in Scottsdale.

2zKodHblFM-J1AmkjEfZgA.text: Great location!  Been here for dinner twice, brunch once.  Dinner is very good.  The espresso poured over ice cream dessert is very unique, and a must try.  For brunch, the vanilla yogurt is AMAZING!  And I hate yogurt.  It is the only yogurt I will eat.  The potato flat bread is only meh.  Long wait times.  Crazy Scottsdale clubbers fill the bar area on weekend nights too; its distracting when trying to have a nice dinner.

UiJ3zGkLuI4dzrfAYnNOow.text: The location is good, and the patio can be wonderful on a winter afternoon.  The food, however, seems to be about 20% overpriced for what you receive.  It isn't bad, mind you, but it certainly isn't worth the prices they charge.  The bar area gets very, very crowded on Friday nights, which can be good or bad, depending on what you're in the mood for.  It is a nice place for drinks, and maybe appetizers.  Skip it for dinner, though, and try someplace else within walking distance in old town Scottsdale.

dOTf8DGfd07xbdhBDhtChg.text: Food was awesome, atmosphere was awesome. Went with my daughter and we loved it. Only wish there was one in Denver.

AcA_dN6hJbJeXR4OzpRJVA.text: A MUST!!  The patio seating is so comfortable and cool and shady.  What a wonderful place to relax on a Sunday afternoon .... or any afternoon!  The food was very good as well.  Try the "Prosciutto Flatbread"!  It's amazing!

aQPFdqfrvfCe5he5G-92pg.text: I was not all that impressed with dinner.  For me it's a more enjoyable spot for happy hour, drinks & a few appetizers.  The White Peach & Hibiscus margarita is absolutely delicious.  Go during happy hour, get 50% off, then you won't feel like it was such a waste/rip-off!

XfYL9hUEF6io93k6us3mOA.text: Definitely sit on the patio. Creamed cauliflower soup was excellent and the bruschetta is so good. The bread is slightly toasted but not enough to make it difficult to eat. Lasagna was excellent. We will go back again before we leave Scottsdale.

TgKisTYFFw8CGzd-GBFw8A.text: Good food, awesome design (in and outside) and cool environment. The three of us sat outside mid morning with a very welcome 65 degree breeze. Turns out I sat facing away from many a typical scottsdaleian, so wasn't too reminded of where I was and what crowd was there. All that matters anyway is the company you're with:) A little pricier than I'd like, but not nutso expensive (~$10 for coffee, egg sandwich + fruit) . Who knows if my review of this place is biased because of the great conversation that accompanied the meal I had, but either way, I left with a smile and a happy and contented tummy:)

AYHjIuv7LQ03vtxCk3ZRRA.text: I have been to Olive & Ivy many times for happy hour and dinner, but my first time for brunch.  I went with some girlfriends and it was a perfect spring-time girls get-together.  I had the Cinnamon French Toast, which was amazing and my friends had the mixed berries with yogurt, also delish!   I was surprised at the portions (large) and the price (reasonable).  Would love to go back for brunch and try something new.

brqkUb6XiEed8vxiJApzog.text: We had dinner at the Olive & Ivy restaurant in Scottsdale. The food was good but I did not appreciate be seated as close to another as we were.  We could not have a private conversation and we were close enough to share their food. Never again. Not at those prices.

5DICjmNZEbasXtHNc53IoA.text: We went to olive and ivy on a beautiful late- Sunday birthday brunch. The atmosphere was lovely, very visually satisfying, me and my girlfriends sat on the patio with the surrounding of the Scottsdale canal, flowers and plenty of shade. I requested we ask the server, Valentino (sooo handsome) to assist us with a few items to share amongst us. We ordered the chopped salad, French toast, chicken pesto flat bread, Salmon bagel and bacon x 5 plates. We also drank mimosas,that were kept full, with decent champagne and the perfect OJ ratio. The food was average in taste and approach for common dishes, I would suggest more personality to it but it was enjoyable and satisfying none the less. Priced appropriately.   Valentino, our server, was very attentive, very knowledgable and had over all provide exceptional service to "4 Hangry females from Scottsdale and a birthday girl." He kept the table nice and clean, was very informative of the menu and concept and the thoughtful service was more then appreciated. Wonderful service!!!   Over all I rate this as a deserving 4 stars, because it was exactly what I expect from the name and location of this establishment. I will recommend for a lovely brunch spot and look forward to my return.

YZRnyECDXtFoGdVzAfNosA.text: We were visiting for Spring Training and made reservations here on a recommendation of a friend. So glad we did! We sat out on the patio for dinner and although the night was not really warm, the heaters kept the temp just right. Food was reasonably priced and absolutely delicious! Lots of different choices. Our server Kevin was very capable and knew just when to check on us without hovering! We were never wanting for anything and he seemed to just show up at the right time. Can't wait to go back when we return to Scottsdale

F7nalBbLL_fI2UXERUpSxw.text: Amazing!!!! One of my favorite eateries in Scottsdale. The food and drinks are all phenomenal!

xPEiT8gq01fyoGjYio8qSg.text: Be prepared for a low key but high level feast.

-XO77BjwzNH-01-IR4_PCw.text: One of my favorites if not favorite restaurant in old town / waterfront area. Always busy so be sure to get a reservation! Some favorites include the chopped salad and the bruschetta boards. Also the complimentary bread w/ pesto is a plus! If you're going in the cooler months / spring try to sit on the patio! The little cafe at the front is great too for grab and go breakfast items like croissants and coffee.

rOyy2xQgp28h7-WYBKpPbw.text: Had a great experience and the food was good. My wife enjoyed the sangria especially the white sangria.

wasOLczzFDRKXOi1fY_tvA.text: I first came to Olive and Ivy back in 2006. I have come back consistently several times every year, and it never fails to impress. Great service, cool vibe, superb food, and a beautiful setting. Such a good place to go and one of the best restaurants in Scottsdale. Keep doing what you are doing and you will always have my custom! Thanks team.

1wsWO-KVU88GZIxIYuVzTw.text: Olive and Ivy's foods and drinks are amazing, also the restaurants atmosphere is very warm and welcoming.

Ht8duWjZ6z_uphzYoNownw.text: This was one of my favorite restaurants during my visit to Arizona. Don't skip the mouthwatering lamb meatballs and bacon wrapped dates (loved the fresh bread and sauce with the meatballs).  For entrees we shared the sea bass and sweet potato cannelloni. Both were delicious but I preferred the cannelloni-- the pasta had both wonderful flavor and texture. We were stuffed but had to try the house made gelato and the peanut butter pudding. I loved the dark chocolate gelato and the coconut- the espresso was just ok and didn't have the best texture.  The peanut butter pudding was tasty but very rich and heavy.  Be sure to make a reservation as it can get quite crowded on weekends. We came a hoping to be seated a bit early and there was no space at the bar. Servers were quick and attentive. I was impressed by how quickly food came out even though it was so busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

LEPNZ6F5K0mm6QIxlfDm0Q.text: Definitely one of my new favorite places. What a stunning restaurant. In a gorgeous location by the water. With an awesome atmosphere AND great music. This is a sophisticated, classy joint and the service did not disappoint either.  The sweet potato cannelloni is one of the best pasta dishes I've ever tasted. I cannot WAIT to go back!

7a-EC7DbGevRZrTr6c13_w.text: Atmosphere and location was great. Service and drinks were good. Food was mediocre. I had lasagna bolognese, and it was bland. I had to add a lot of salt. My husband had veal ravioli which was ok. I would give the atmosphere a 4 or 5, and food 2.5 to 3. Great people watching, and location is great.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Has a great vibe. Atmosphere, but not too loud.

qGhpzDONu8PyYgqqIJo1BQ.text: Really liked this place, spacious restaurant with an outdoor patio area. We ordered three types of bruschetta, chicken panini, Mediterranean salad, and cocktails. They bake their own bread and vegetables are super fresh, needless to say nothing went to waste that day! If we are ever in the area, we'd definitely come back. Prices are reasonable and food has good portions.

XtOMVGNAurkyrycloFDZVQ.text: Although the address is on Camelback it really is south off Marshall Way. There is a free underground garage immediately North of the restaurant. Very large restaurant with a lot of outside seating  The pesto they bring out to start was outstanding (see photo) Antipasto was very good also. A lot of prosciutto (see photo) Atlantic salmon was excellent Spicy shrimp was not too spicy.  Fox Restaurants 1. Olive and Ivy (Scottsdale) 2. True Foods 3. North Italia (Phoenix) 4. The Henry 5. Blanco Tacos (Phoenix) 6. Little Cleos 7. The Greene House (Scottsdale)

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. (Not so) spicy scallops
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Antipasto, Look at that prosciutto !
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Big eyed Tuna and couscous

YUSS2fzXHOXyOZSSMSyL7g.text: Stopped in here quickly during a business trip and it was perhaps the most decadent lunch I've had. I love the pesto appetizer and the Cobb salad  but the real winner was the caramel marmalade dessert. I had a drink that was fig with vodka (a mixed mule) and it was divine.  I now tell people this is the place to stop at if they are in Phoenix or Scottsdale

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

cY86_6HgNw6rJeYUlO5EPA.text: Amazing a must try if you are in the area, food was amazing we ordered the flatbreads withe the mushroom and one with the corn and goat cheese and the Mediterranean salad and loved it all , try this place you won't regret it one of the better flat breads we ever had and the salad was to die for. The service was friendly and great.

aVmckcm4U4uWV9EB6-M3gA.text: Everything we had here was great, from the service of the drinks to the food. Many things looked good and would love to return.

MtT_62rKw5NIgdYweo4iTA.text: Been here many times due to location and great patio.  First the good: Location, location, location. Right in the middle of Old Town Scottsdale by Fashion Square and the Canal. The restaurant looks the part, has an amazing patio covered by massive shade trees alongside the canal. There are cleverly hidden scent sprayers in the event the canal or the many birds in the neighborhood emanate a less desirable scent.   Service is fairly good. Young, good looking people are cast to fulfill the part of waiters and most play their part well. Our waitress for lunch yesterday was super, the one we had a few weeks go would have rather been elsewhere and we left early.   Now the mediocre: I would call it the food. If you have been to one Fox Restaurant Concept eatery you've been to all. In a sense it brings a certain level of comfort knowing that you'll have similar food in the different restaurants of the company; I wish however that each restaurant did a better job differentiating itself by offering more varied food choices.  And last but not least, the bad: The restaurant, and all of the company's restaurants really, are build for turning tables in their dining rooms. It is virtually impossible to have a conversation because it is so loud inside. The patio is more forgiving.   Basically, Olive and Ivy looks the part, has decent service with run of the mill food. If you want to see an be seen in this neighborhood its the place to be.

rcDXFP5HEzRNLSu1coce0Q.text: Great atmosphere. Great service. Food is delicious. Great outside patio with fire pits and couches.

H4b6P04PU-du_43XcIG-6Q.text: We stopped in for lunch and I have to say...seriously impressed!  We had to wait 15 minutes for a table but I'm glad the wait didn't deter us from eating here. We just took a short stroll along the water area and by the time we came back, our table was ready.   I LOVED the ambiance of this restaurant.  Very rustic decor, open kitchen, large dining and bar area and near the entrance; a section with bench seating with low coffee tables where patrons seemed to be enjoying cocktails and appetizers. I later discovered this was part of the bar. Very chic.  Even with high ceilings and openness of this restaurant, it was still very welcoming.  We were seated near the entrance to the outdoor patio so while we didn't sit outdoors, we felt like we were dining el fresco. This time of the year in Scottsdale is wonderful so we could not be any happier with where we were seated.   I ordered a Bloody Mary extra spicy and a margherita pizza (err flatbread) for lunch. The cocktail was made PERFECTLY and had a nice little kick to it...just how I like it.  The margherita pizza was absolutely delicious as well. The crust was thin, light and had great flavor and the toppings just made it that much more irresistible.  I didn't think I would be able to finish the entire pizza but I somehow did. I just could not stop myself, it was that tasty.  After complimenting our waitress (which I forgot her name (sorry!) on how great the service and food was, we discovered this is owned by the same company that manages True Food Kitchen, one of our favorite restaurants. We would come back here in a heartbeat....but since this is in Scottsdale and not in San Diego, it will be tough to get back here when we're craving you. So, can you please open an Olive & Ivy out here?

KmKNyV_xLnLIvNnuxOCegg.text: There's nothing better than escaping sub-zero temperatures for the toasty climes of Phoenix. I was lucky enough to do this last week (pre-Snowpacolypse), and there was no better way to enjoy the sun than sitting by the fountain on the patio at Olive and Ivy.  At first glance, I thought this spot was going to be a bit stuffy since it's located in a pseudo strip mall area. However, the second I stepped inside my opinion changed. It can only be described as lofty, with eye-catching light fixtures and decor. Although I didn't notice it until my way out, I am totally enamored with the white room just off the front door - it features a large round table for 12 (I think) with high-backed chairs, ethereal curtains and a to-die-for white glass chandelier. Very intimate and would be fun for a brunch party, methinks.  Don't pass up the bread and pesto here, my friends. It will put a smile on your face, as will the mushroom and asparagus truffle pizza. We tried several flatbreads, but that was definitely the standout. I enjoyed a few sips of the house sangria and am a fan of the sugared rim, and quite enjoyed my chicken curry salad, too. Just an observation - it seems like their salads are heavy on the dressing, so if you're picky about that, order yours on the side.   Stellar service here (our server was a life coach and I just wanted to hug her), and their bathroom is going on my Arizona top 10 list. Think oversized doors, floor to ceiling mirrors, and a trough-style sink. On second thought, can I hire their decorator to re-do my apartment??  As you can see, I'm a fan. It looks like they also have a little market area complete with a gelato counter in case you want to get your foodies to go. Thumbs up!

-uwTjdW6lN3bdhT9bgvnFw.text: Went here 2years ago in May, Great ambiance and atmosphere if you don't mind the testing of lighting and waiters stumbling around and starring at you. It was my birthday and Upon moving here a guy on my flight told me to check this place out. For a special occasion I think I would recommend to pass, For an afternoon of tv and football sounds great. This place is like an Italian Applebee's! So if you like Applebee's great, go. I obviously am not..a fan of Applebee's

NXCQ7KASxLbGlmANObIS9g.text: Stopped by here for a nice lunch and nothing tops the food, sangria and atmosphere sitting under the trees enjoying the canal. We had three different types of bruchetta a Rueben sandwich and ended with honey gelato. The food was excellent I can't begin to describe the flavor combinations on the bruchetta it was perfection. I am a sangria snob and to date this is hands down the best sangria I have ever had! the waitress was attentive without hovering over us the whole time. We will be going back but this time it will be at night. They have beautiful lighting out on the patio that is so romantic but reservations are a must at night! Enjoy!!!

GVVcR1NQ5M4vZftYdhMkXg.text: I've frequented Olive & Ivy several times and always had a great experience, until the last time on Sunday night. Don't get me wrong, that experience was great in the moment too - until I got home and began projectile vomiting from the food poisoning I got from the seared scallops. On the plus side, I lost 4 pounds, so there's that. Two stars for previous good experiences, no stars for puking for 17 hours straight.

pmes1TrwZ7hohx2x3Vp5nQ.text: I got here at least once a week for either Brunch, Lunch, or dinner. I also thoroughly enjoy the marketplace. Everything from the food to the service is impeccable and by far one of my favorite places to dine in the country. The ambiance is especially notable, with the most pleasing aesthetics and impressively trendy, modern, yet comfortably inviting atmosphere.

7m3NMEnpXWL33RKpACpe4A.text: We were in town for the weekend for the Rock-n-Roll marathon, wanted a relaxing (good energy) outdoor restaurant with amazing food, and we found exactly that, it was so amazing that we had gone back 3X, twice for dinner and once for lunch on this same trip.  My favorite meal was the kale salad with caramelized pecans, bleu cheese, chopped bacon, mixed with a zesty orange/balsamic vinaigrette dressing --I added chicken the first night and ahi tuna the second night. Its a MUST have. The cannelloni with mushrooms were tasty, a bit too heavy and creamy on the sauce and the bruschettas (on the appetizer menu) were also on the top list.  The wait staff are super friendly, I couldn't forget to mention the female manager that helped us out immensely as we were in dire need of charging our iphone, she was professional and so accommodating. Thank you so very much.   I work in the service industry and appreciate a nice meal with good service and this was by far my favorite restaurant in Scottsdale. We will definitely come back.

1g5lnZx9XTggX9IEsYa_-g.text: Great outdoor seating by fire pit.  Appetizers really good as well. Great people watching on weekends.

IUVsaxE-oDH6O6KT00K2sA.text: Olive and Ivy never disappoints.  The outdoor patio is the perfect meeting point for girlfriends or that special someone.  The Happy Hour with the bruchetta ( I recommend the one with fig) is always good and the people watching provides built in entertainment.  They are serious about their food here and I would recommend the brunch as well as dinner.  Definitely a "go to" spot.

XNs46zRLeqgDT8cdnTVtJQ.text: Average chain... really nice outdoor area - really average food.

E9jyE-rZKeVLsFyE3y7QUw.text: I discovered this place while living in Phoenix. And now it's a staple every time I'm back for a visit. In fact, it's the only place my girl's and I go for brunch when I'm back. There's not a bad word I could think to say about this place.   I love sitting out on the patio during the summer and sipping one of their Mimosas. Nothing bad about it.

tvOC_gDfCorbh1ZT1E6R8g.text: My daughter and I were staying at the Phoenician and went to Olive and Ivy by their recommendation. Good fresh food. Fun vibe and wonderful service!

r6pwC26PSil-yQXNrPqpHQ.text: The best dinner, fabulous deserts, awesome atmosphere and Daniel is soooooo adorable!  Best server I have had in my life!!!

-KlqJtCgOVgASeXmRq1RZA.text: Great happy hour today. Bruschetta , pesto flat bread and bacon wrapped dates all for $40 including 4 glasses of wine. And a good time was had by all.

g5WR44nmDMFOjbYgFysK1w.text: We had a reservation for two, they took us straight back right on time. The patio is awesome! Right on the water and lots of trees! We had the bruschetta appetizer and it was great! Great stiff drinks! Our server was great. Definitely a place worth checking out.

j3ywYFTTJcIEfyHvxZd42w.text: So delicious.  Went here for mother's day with my mom.  I ordered a pizza, absolutely delicious.  And the bread they bring out is one of the best I have ever tasted!  I seriously recommend this restaurant.

KS2tAuYFqIpNiEO6ChMwZQ.text: This rating is based on first experience on a Saturday around 8:30 pm. We did not have a reservation. There were four of us in our party. They use the OpenTable system. If you're planning on a weekend night, I suggest you use it. This was a very busy night.  We're not taking into account the 50 minute wait for a table. That was completely our bad for not making reservations (it was a last minute thing) and our desire to sit outside (even longer wait) as it was very loud and crowded (this seems to be another regular occurrence with Fox restaurants: they don't architect enough sound dampening to handle their capacity and they encourage standing room only at the bar with very loud/upbeat music (there was a DJ). I believe this is within their control, but they merely wish it this way.  Fox Restaurant concepts has a knack for creating restaurants with a 'hip' atmosphere and a certain kind of clientele in mind. This was my first time here but my fifth Fox Restaurant visit. I'm starting to notice the ingredients/entrees are 'shared' across Fox menus. This can be a good thing as mainly these items are fresh and of high quality.  We ordered 3 rounds of drinks, appetizers, entrees, and desserts. We kept a lively mood as we were good friends who hadn't seen each other in a while. Three of us had previous restaurant experience.  Sam Fox stresses "outstanding hospitality every time". There are little things good and bad not worth noting. They're just what you'd expect on a busy Friday night at a popular place. That being said it would have been 'outstanding' if that kind of thing you expect everywhere else didn't apply here.  Overall the food was very good (the sweet potato canneloni was noteworthy as well as mushroom soup du jour). However the service and pacing are what killed the experience for all of us.    When disappointment was expressed in an item he was not apologetic, in fact he was downright combative: "Oh, I know I said there would be 10 meatballs, but these were the last ones for the night. (there were six small ones). There was no offer to replace them with something else.  "It's a Sicilian tirimasu I TOLD you it would have citrus flavors (there were overriding orange flavors). Again, no offer to replace the item. Then of course the strange insistence he had on setting items directly in front of someone who was speaking, obscuring their view of others (a simple wait of 30 seconds would not have been disruptive), but the lack of urgency to clear the table end of meal when he was nowhere to be found and empty dessert plate sat until even after the bill was taken.  How can I write this in such detail? Because while we all tried to converse, catch up and ignore his faux pas it became harder and harder to do so until we burst out in nervous laughter. We ended up poking fun at his strange actions to keep things light. As I mentioned we'd all worked as servers so we just shrugged it off, gave him his 20% and chalked it up to a poor luck of the draw. We didn't complain to the manager or give him a hard time because he's just trying to make a living (and we didn't want the night to end on THAT note), we just all shook our heads and pondered if he knew why he probably wasn't do so well as a waiter.  I know Fox concepts wants a guest to have a great time, come back and recommend their places, but it also takes friendly service. Hospitality as Sam Fox defines it.  Even if there were a bunch of mistakes, friendliness, humility and a desire to please would have gone a long way with this group. He would do well to have more training, better quality control (why would an item go out less than promised/) and to retain employees of greater dedication and character.  We'll probably come back, but if we see this guy again, we'll definitely request someone else.

i1IdLHQ1evU2aisfpMSnHw.text: We came to Olive & Ivy on the last day of my boyfriend's vacation and it made for the perfect ending. I can't compliment our server, Tim, enough for his excellent customer service. We went with lamb meatballs, hummus, and the fritto mizzo (sp) appetizers and were blown away! My boyfriend owns restaurants in California and it takes excellent flavors, textures and quality of food to make him happy. He was so impressed with everything (especially their beer) and we couldn't thank Tim enough for his wonderful attitude and lovely approach. We would have stayed to thank his manager but his flight was leaving in an hour (we got way too caught up with enjoying our dinner). I'm hoping the manager will see this review and thank Tim for his selection in food, beer and being the best waiter we had this weekend!

tLoMv6DN6I7Lg9ixww3Kjw.text: good food, great ambience, reasonable prices, and great variety. minus one star because service could have been better.  for lunch, try the lamb gyro or turkey sandwich.

FDQl53zQt7ebcwOBaiuK3Q.text: My favorite restaurant in Scottsdale when looking for a fantastic outdoor dining atmosphere. It has such a beautiful patio with nice trees, comfortable seating, firepits and heaters for the chilly nights, all while overlooking the Scottsdale Waterfront. Wonderful to enjoy a glass of wine or a great meal. My favorite entree is the Tuna! Excited to go back soon!

HcnXMv1AObdtuLwjGE0uCQ.text: By far one of the best experiences and dinners I have ever had!! Thank you Josh P. For the wonderful service!!

uAC1_2vHwDKyihdP8uP_Zw.text: My girl friend and I were on a shopping to  the Square.shared the chicken salad and each had a lovely glass of rose . Excellent salad would most definitely recommend and we plan on returning . Nice ambience .

_w62Fz2KKkzJpdhxiVDegQ.text: This place is amazing! You can't go wrong with Fox restaurants. The chefs really know how to pair ingredients well and the dishes are so unique.  We went there to celebrate our anniversary and our server treated us to dessert   You just can't beat free food   Not only was the food and our server amazing but the atmosphere there is always fun and cheery! Highly recommend the scallops!

SJCMASOZecfvYz6FwTOVSA.text: Trendy upscale Scottsdale restaurant located by Scottsdale fashion square. Sultry dim candle light vibe inside with tall ceilings very open with low hanging farm like lights. They have a huge patio which is very nice this time of year. I give it three stars because it's in a super busy area, parking is hard to find, not many menu options and they're pricey at that, always busy, hard to get a seat at the bar, bartenders are slammed and aren't as attentive even though you're sitting right there. You need a reservation at this place, period. I feel the staff is a bit "stuffy" but the tziki meatballs are great! Worth checking out but I came here for my boyfriends birthday during happy hour for a quick little bite/drink but still waited a bit. I remember why I don't come here often. Again, come to say you've tried it but not worth the hype.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

KlmRG34glunmnOYmE5bncg.text: Stopped here on a weekday for lunch and was able to sit outside.  The service was terrific, the menu items were plentiful and the ambiance was really wonderful.  I ordered the braised short rib flat bread pizza which was OMG!  Although I didn't try any, I love that they offer scooped Gelato in addition to a standard dessert menu. Sadly, we were too full to enjoy either.  I'll be back for sure!

trHY-tTLlhpZ-VZg21lRuQ.text: What a great experience trying this place for the first time this past weekend!  If you've read my other reviews, you know I don't give 5 stars all that often. This place surprised me and delivered more than I expected.  Let's start with the food. My family and I decided to get a few small plates instead of ordering entrees.  We ordered the Fritto Misto, Lamb Meatballs, Seasonal Chef's Board and a half order of the Chicken Chopped Salad.  All were wonderful!  If I had to pick my favorite, I'd have to go with the salad.  One of the best salads I've ever had!  Who knew granola in a salad would work so well?  Our waiter was so personable and friendly.  I wish I could remember his name.  He gave good recommendations, checked on us frequently and was super attentive.  Great service goes a long way!  I will definitely be back soon.  Can't wait to try some more items off their menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Small Plates portion of the menu

xraN4qPAVxthPQtM_qoCCA.text: Love this restaurant food it is soo good. Great staff and amazing experience. Every time I go.

oMTMEurhiXdxjAjSeWKJWw.text: Love the Chopped Chicken Salad!  It doesn't look very big at first glance but you can crunch and munch to your heart's content. There are little surprises like peanut granola mixed in. Mmmm. A perfect pairing- the focaccia with pesto and the salad- and life and lunch are good!

KeWAAv7yjbOgSTDIJFF5mg.text: DELICIOUS!! Had the bruschetta appetizer and it was sooo good, personally would recommend the prosciutto, it is delicious in every way. Had the pesto flatbread and it was amazing!! Originally I received the wrong flatbread when our food came out and my server was so nice to hurry and get me the correct one and on top of that we received complimentary dessert. I love places that truly care about their customers and make it an enjoyable experience even if they make a mistake. I am looking forward to returning

F06ijEQtza0gJhm9LfKC4Q.text: First things first, I was skeptical to try another Fox restaurant while on my Arizona trip, especially after my awful experience at arrogant butcher. But I'm so glad that I did. I visited the restaurant during happy hour and was able to get a seat at the bar with no trouble at all. The servers are extremely friendly and the food was really good.   Their complimentary pesto and bread was so good and the pesto had so much flavor. I tried the salmon lox bruschetta which was recommended and I'm so glad I did, it was so tasty and just the perfect amount. I also tried their Margherita flatbread which was so simple yet so perfect. I'm so glad that I decided to give this restaurant a shot and if you're in the area I definitely would recommend going here. Not to mention their happy hour is legit.

lZ1jiTqTh4Lqsvc3POzTKA.text: This came highly recommended by some colleagues and boy did it live up to the hype!   To start, the restaurant itself had a great look - large, airy, modern. In regards to the food, our group had a variety of dishes and every single person felt they had the best dish! My Natural Chicken on a bed of Yukon puree with Crimini mushrooms and citrus jus was to die for. Their ability to elevate such a humble dish speaks volumes. Their drinks were also top notch, specifically the Blood Orange Paloma.   That being said, because O&I has nailed their food and drink, reservations (at least for dinner) are a must, we had to take a 5:30 rez. I'm not sure how their system works, but based on what we saw, we could have gotten something a bit later...   However, based on the food, I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Natural Chicken - 10/10 this picture doesn&#39;t do it justice, but the taste will!
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Blood Orange Paloma - 10/10 light, semi-sweet, effervescent

PvKmrCorUtAPBQyNEGtQbg.text: This is one of my go-to places in Scottsdale.  Unlike Old Town Scottsdale,  parking across the street is ample and you will not get charged for it.  This has a great patio by the river which makes it nice in the winter months.  When sitting on the patio, I would watch your drink as there tends to be leaves that fall down onto the tables.    The inside is also very nice and has nice atmosphere with high ceilings.  There are a lot of options on the menu which can range from lower cost (a simple gyro) to very high end (steak and sea bass).  Our last visit, we sat inside due to it being too hot outside, and enjoyed a nice meal.  The waiter recommended the bacon and dates which were good but not great.  The sea bass was very tasty and well worth the premium price.    The prices are a bit high but I think this place is worth it for going out every once in a while.

ELyP7tN8xqe7VLhJqzYvMw.text: Here is another five stars for Olive & Ivy! I had a delicious artichoke aragula salad accompanied with focaccia bread.  Ron and our friends equally enjoyed their lunch with a chicken breast green salad, a caesar topped with grilled salmon and a chicken salad with granola and other tasty items.

Everything was perfect! The patio is adorable & right on the water - would definitely recommend. I can't wait to go back!

RRtjkGylLztNJaftMPKjOQ.text: This is my favorite place , staff are extremely professional , friendly ,and they go out of their way to accommodate. There is variety of food for every one , breakfast , lunch and dinner you will not be disappointed with the choice you make . Location is amazing out in patio , inside or cafe area you would enjoy every sitting area , they have done a great job on planning the sitting areas . Their pastries and coffees are number one .

hGVH98WlIUFuoqK0tSGiHg.text: Excellent restaurant- had a hiccup with the ice maker but made good with bottled water.   Chicken ( Seveat ) was amazing as was the Scallops and Noodle dish ..  Our waitress Jill is two thumbs up and an asset to the business and was very attentive..  Little bit short on the bar service and short pour bartenders so next time I will stick with a glass of wine vs cocktails - disappointed water down drinks.

LzKjyL7GEJ3SvW0ZIzhfVQ.text: We stopped in here for a nice lunch after viewing the art installation along the canal.  They are a larger place catering to an affluent crowd and serve what they described as California Mediterranean cuisine.  The lunch menu featured sandwiches, flat breads, salads and bruschettas and almost every table seemed to be enjoying a glass of wine with lunch.  The dress code seemed a bit fancy and I did feel a bit under dressed in my jeans but it didn't seem to affect our service.  We opted for the chicken chopped salad and got the half size at the recommendation of our fine server, which was still plenty big for lunch.  We also shared a cup (really a small bowl) of the daily soup special, beer cheese-thin but good.  Fresh focaccia and pesto also come with your meal and, we decided to join the crowd and have some wine too.  Service was attentive with water glasses kept full and the salads arrived without delay.  This place seems well run.  Hopefully on a future visit it would be warm enough to sit outside on their large shady patio.  Recommended

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Stylish inside

0ggly26uFv61pSs1mUqGlA.text: My wife, two friends from out of town and I had a great lunch. We were seated on their patio and the weather was perfect. We all ordered salad dishes some topped with grilled salmon others with grilled chicken. The salads were fresh and tasty and the bread they served with the meals was excellent.  We received top notch wait service which was icing on the cake.

mWaOLPmlPnbh7LNO-xCCkw.text: YUM! This place not only has cute decor, but also great food and friendly, helpful service.  I sat at the bar since I came here alone while I'm visiting town for work. I had seen such great reviews which led me to come here as my first dining experience in the city.  The bartender was very friendly and attentive (I didn't catch his name but he had a man bun so shout out to him for management, he was great!). I started with the grapefruit mojito which both looked and tasted great.  Next I ordered a bruschetta trio: - Manchego quince & Spanish chorizo - Avocado, sweet corn, charred scallion & feta - Brussels sprout, whipped goat cheese, prosciutto & sherry gastrique   They were all delicious but my favorites were the Brussels and manchego ones. I also liked that they were pretty sizable but each piece was also cut into 3 smaller bites to make it a bit easier to eat (although still messy!).  I also ordered the lamb meatballs and omg - flavor heaven!! I typically never eat lamb but these had such amazing flavor and has an in-house made tzatziki sauce which was just *muah* The bartender who served me described these best as a type of deconstructed gyro - they come with grilled, slices pita slices as well. Again, sizable portion as well.  This place was great and I do not have enough good things to say - glad I stopped here on my trip!

aRDgomyU_f4onNeFF0jxpw.text: Third time here in the past 60 days.  I keep bringing friends here!  Flat breads are great and be sure to get the pesto and bread.  It is wonderful!  Nice outdoor area with plenty of umbrellas for shade.  I'll be coming again!

SbcUbaO-xz0qKAdKy1DqBQ.text: Loved the ambiance and vibe here, and our server Sarah S. Was spectacular! Sarah was professional, efficient and friendly. My sister and I both got the Lasagna and it was fantastic and just the right size portion. Thank you Sarah for making our dinner here so enjoyable!

ScglNfpWQiuUVf6DpIp-tA.text: This is one of the best dinners we've had in a long time! My fiance ordered the ribeye, and oh man, I was jealous. I can't believe it's $39 for that meal with the creamed spinach and potatoes. It is a big, high quality steak for that price. I had the veal and spinach ravioli and the handmade pasta was just delicious. I asked for extra bread to dip in the sauce and my plate was pretty much clean. We had the pistachio tart for dessert which was really unique and tasty. We sat at the bar facing the kitchen, and it was really fun watching all the delicious food come out. We'll definitely be back, loved this place!

0OBdvrlY6Bl3koFtpJyGvw.text: Very intimate setting with outstanding service. My wife had the Scallops and I had the Chicken Scallopini. Always busy and the reason will be obvious on your first visit. Must make reservations or go early. There is plenty of free parking on the street and beside the restaurant.

w_8uOS7WPt0AKlDIBsvBMQ.text: We had a really awesome time when we came in Friday night. We had a reservation but came early and they were flexible about seating us early. We ordered some drinks and an appetizer of Bacon Wrapped dates. Highly recommend the Pomegranate Daquiri and the Evangelista. We also ordered a bruschetta board with Manchego, Mishroom and Salmon Lox. The flavor combinations were unique (manchego and quince is quite tasty). We ordered the Atlantic salmon and the Sea scallops. I definitely loved the bread that came out along with the pesto. The bread was soft and chewy and the pesto had a good subtle tang. The scallops were perfectly cooked and the creamed corn and bacon combination you would think would be a heavy addition but I enjoyed every bite and was comfortably satisfied with the portion. The dessert is definitely the best with the Peanut butter mousse with chocolate crust (high recommendation). It's light and airy and the saltiness of peanut butter complemented the chocolate crust. Our waitress (Yvonne I believe was her name) was very attentive and gave great recommendations! I would highly recommend this restaurant :)

s8IUAm5DdaWKMxfq3KES8g.text: Absolutely loved this restaurant! My daughter took me there when I visited her at college. I can't wait to go back and take friends! Service was great! Food was unbelievable!

sE5wLirEpiLfTLGS-Gghiw.text: Pretty good food! I love the bread and pesto they bring to he table. Bacon wrapped dates were excellent. Bruschetta was excellent. Hummus was average and the pitas were pathetic Lemonade was very good not too sweet not too sour I had the bone in ribeye medium rare.it was very good. Uniform doneness suggests sous vide plus a quick grill. Demi glace was done well not too over powering and just a touch to not overpower the steak.Potatoes and spinach were a nice balance. Service was very good. Unobtrusive but on top of making sure drinks were refilled food plates out of the way etc Only knock is the music is waaaaaay too loud. Turn it down!

xJdm8lxpUDaBWKaq_b72mw.text: As a general rule I try to avoid Olive & Ivy on weekend nights, not that the ambiance isn't great or there is a food or service problem it's just BUSY! If you don't have reservations popping in for a cocktail during peak times in the bar can be challenging, on the one hand you get to get a good look at "The Real Housewives" of Scottsdale in their natural habitat and many variations there of.  So I went with two friends and I was so happy we got a small comfortable cocktail table next to the bar which can be like hitting the lottery on a busy night. Service is always good I feel even on a busy night my water was always replaced. Cocktails always good they can take a while but you will understand looking at the packed bar so you have to give them a break. In previous visits I usually get the Chefs seasonal board, Italian meats and fresh cheeses and roasted vegetables this visit we got the Hummus it was fine I mean Hummus is hummus. Two flat breads the braised short rib with Gorgonzola and arugula, I'm the only human I think that does not like short rib, I've had it before in other establishments but it's not my go to. My choice was the pesto chicken with pine nuts and I asked if we could leave the caramelized onions off half of it since I was in a picky mood and do not like onions, they were so nice about it and despite the busy kitchen it came out perfect. Service + food + ambiance +

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Great cocktails

d9prpeXgNE1FjL4UKJYczA.text: Love this place! We went to Olive and Ivy for our anniversary. The waiter was very nice and pleasant! Food was delicious. After finishing our meals the waiter said since it's our anniversary desert is on the house. We got strawberry shortcake and it was absolutely delicious!! Had an awesome time!
