Po_rXzskjNK9JFanaPHX_A.text: Olive & Ivy is hands down one of the best restaurant experiences I have ever had. The staff there is totally synced and on top of everything. THE FOOD... is amazing. Especially the bruschetta! The drinks are also all amazing and I enjoyed their selectively crafted menu. On top of that the decor and music and energy of the inside and outside is beautiful and perfection. This is seriously a can't-miss destination.   (Shout out to the best bartender ever Jameca)

Fj0snZu0fMOI9lg8-lIbvw.text: This was our first stop on our maiden vaca to Scottsdale! We enjoyed the outdoor patio area and seemed to get there right on time as the lunch hour on a beautiful day seemed to fill in quickly. We enjoyed mimosas, a charcuterie board, and 3 bruschettas (goat and fig, salmon lox, + 1 more). Service was great, prices fair, but can't beat the location and ambiance!

VwqtgKhfBnMFUeZLlbyPJg.text: Right on the canal in Scottsdale. In good weather be sure to sit outside. Very good food and service is great. Quite a variety of menu items to choose from.

d0uH6y7uOn9r4Vsh2ytsXQ.text: Olive and Ivy is clearly the place to be on a Saturday morning if you're a millennial looking to get your brunch on. The building is beautiful inside, offers both quick take out as well as seating if you're looking to linger. Not to be forgotten is the outdoor seating waterside that offers a view of the canal and a gentle breeze on this nice fall day.   We were on vacation, so we started with dessert - a lemon cake that was delicious. They also started us with a plate of focaccia and pesto. The pesto was fragrant and well-seasoned.   I opted for the kale salad with chicken. It was complemented by blue cheese and candied pecans. It is sure to satisfy any kale lover's  hankering.  My husband ordered the breakfast burrito which if consumed entirely will require an obligatory 30min to 1 hr prior to activity. It is filling, and has just the right amount of bacon, cheese, and potatoes. The home fries served alongside were crispy on the outside and delicious on the inside.   Service was excellent, and this place is very reasonably priced. Make sure to stop in for brunch soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Kale salad with grilled chicken
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast burrito
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lemon cake with cream cheese frosting

3nMb29AQvoadF0zO1ClY4w.text: I was in Scottsdale visiting my daughter for Christmas and met up with some friends.   The food was delicious but I think it is overpriced for the amount of food that we received.

KVqikQG3J5jQU3qmhXxdRg.text: In a town with so many great restaurants, it's hard to pick one to be your favorite. That said, Olive and Ivy would have to be at the top of my list. Since it's opening over 12 years ago, it has set the standard for providing quality food in a fun environment with friendly staff. Additionally, it attracts a crowd of beautiful souls that will make your visit memorable.  Michael Benson AgencyIQ MedHealthIQ

Z0C24wmBZhC4Oqg89DRBxg.text: Our favorite Happy Hour Restaurant. Love the patio with the Scottsdale Canal view and the fire pits. The food is excellent with delicious flatbreads and various bruschetta. Drinks are good and reasonable as well. Great place to take guest to watch the sunset.

putqQCbfLPoBNbxRBqVoUg.text: Came here for dinner while visiting Scottsdale. Staff was very friendly the atmosphere was terrific. I ordered a grapefruit mojito and when it arrived it wasn't stirred and I had nothing to stir it with, there were only 4 mint leaves that were on a toothpick as a garnish none were in the drink itself, it tasted like pure tonic water and I immediately sent it back and ordered the strawberry margarita which was amazing. Then I ordered a margarita flat bread for dinner and it looked and tasted like a frozen pizza that was just heated in the oven. This place is way way overpriced for mediocre food and the presentation was just boring. I was disappointed in how this place looks and seems so fancy but when it comes to their cocktails and food they are not creative whatsoever.

mgHbI7uHQQFscKXfYtXwhw.text: Very noisy restaurant  Food is ok nothing to write home about and expensive  Sitting outside in warmer weather is nice

BjkESKoJ36-zwBxVt2rYkg.text: Good Food, Great Location, cant go wrong here on a date. I enjoy the breakfast and coffee shop as well as the restaurant!

9wCWDa9VP-UwwptQQNcWhQ.text: Fantastic atmosphere especially on the tree lined patio. Food was superb and portions were substantial. Service was excellent.  A must return in the future.

INJXw4dAh_IVRI1Bk56pag.text: Love the peach Bellini. Food choices limited. Had flatbread that was a bit soggy in the middle. Service was good. We like this restaurant overall but can be hit and miss.

7e4iOfJMMPSq4hktKbLOzA.text: Excellent food, service and ambiance. We had dessert and a chocolate coffee martini, all were wonderful!

rNgNGxRVhgIllNLCgFBLdw.text: Great Atmosphere Lovedd the patio Good food and service the Mediterranean salad was very good  Be prepared to spend 50 plus per person for dinner

IYNfMz_czBJIAhBaanC5SA.text: Bartender who took our order didn't do anything the hour we were there. He made some new guy make all the drinks and the new guy asking waitresses what garnishes go on which drink. He should be asking the bartender. I can get a better old fashioned in a dive bar.

1hlK4HaF9hrQhsa-pwBshw.text: Awesome food! Small portions for the price, but high quality. The decor is amazing and loved being right by the canal! Great date spot.

RebSLO9QVDC0TBwjRzQ1Bw.text: Just got back from spending the weekend in Scottsdale with my girl friend. We dined at Olive and Ivy on Saturday night and just had an amazing time! It was packed and we didn't have reservation so waited at the bar and enjoyed few cocktails for 30 minutes and then our table was ready.   Located on the 'river' aka waterfront near Scottsdale Fashion SC, Olive & Ivy combines a lively, animated atmosphere and retro and trendy look with comfort of old, nostalgic Arizona dinning.   Fresh Creative food, Great Service and there are multiple Seating Areas; One can seat themselves inside the restaurant in booth, tables or at the bar or outside seating is available as well.   My dinner was fantastic...I ordered the Sea bass with caramelized cauliflower, snap peas & preserved grapefruit. DELICIOUS....My mouth is watering just thinking about it... lol   If you haven't been here, put it on your list and enjoy every bite and minute of your visit.

Ln4W5qN9mWlcyWgxJgBQlA.text: The waiter was great the service was awesome but finding fur with a bone in my salad while chewing is the most horrid experience I have ever had. The manager was very nice and gracious and apologetic about us finding this in our salad but that does not make up for the fact that I might get sick tonight and that I had a piece of who-knows-what in my mouth. I will never come to this establishment again. WORST EXPERIENCE EVER!

dv2XgEaHI_0QkYK-7qwwfQ.text: Fantastic place.  Lucked out when a table opened up as soon as we arrived (I asked about the wait time for sitting outside, it was 3 hours...).  Bread & Pesto = amazing. Bruschetta = amazing. Natural Chicken = Very good.  Bacon-wrapped pork tenderloin = amazing.  Beautiful restaurant, great location, terrific service.  You are missing out if you don't try this place.

JnhH2vi-R5jr-LrapmHFrg.text: Loved the food, location and service. At reception desk we arrived and announced we needed a table for 2 - hostess said do you have reservations (2:00 in the afternoon), we said no, she said will be about 30 minute wait for inside seating or we could sit outside we choose outside seating and it was just lovely out on the patio actually best seats from my point of view. Overall nice place, decent food and drink good vibe.

hXYlwlzcqp2CgBmU25Bz0Q.text: I saw the olives, however the ivy was nowhere to be seen, just like the real value.  To put it simply you are paying for decore and location, the quality ingredients do not match the prices.  We had a Veggie Fritatta $11 and the watermelon salad $10.  While it was nice that they were able to do split plates, the Mellon on the salad was not very sweet, the mint was tasteless and the chevre cream was not viscus enough to stick to the fruit.   The veggie fritata was decent, the mushrooms were a bit rubbery but the arugula and chevre were a nice touch, but was it worth $11, not really.   I did enjoy the focaccia bread and pesto that came with the meal, but that was  the high point.   The patio looked great, but with the heat and a broken misting system that was a no go.

HtFfOq7JRVkFcLR1mqol8w.text: The atmosphere is fantastic. The view of the river is amazing and adds to the overall dining experience. The food is good, but nothing to write home about. I ordered the breakfast sandwich which came with home fries. The breakfast sandwich was delicous. I also ordered a cheese danish which was noteworthy. I really enjoyed visiting the restaurants bathroom. The bathroom was beautifully decorated with large floor to ceiling doors and externally comfortable. The service was fantastic. I will definitely return next time I am in the area. If I could I would have given four and half stars.

bz7HwsoCDGL-6l3U15u7Jw.text: Food is amazing. I love their salads... so good. This place is awesome for brunch. Grab a seat outside and enjoy the view.

Ggup9MXdUuiSrLOG8Yyemg.text: The restaurant is really a beautiful restaurant. Beautiful views of the canal and patio lights. We were seated nexted to the window by the door and it was cold. We asked to be moved to another table and it was still cold. My husband had a sweater over a shirt and I had a thick cardigan. But we were determined to have a nice dinner. It was my birthday and our first time here. We ordered the sangria and artichoke appetizer. Which is a salad and very good. Artichoke hearts and baby field greens, light balsamic dressing. We thought it was a little strange we had to tell the waiter we were ready to order at this point. We were left a time waiting for our food.  Also the music was blaring to the point I wished I was sitting on the patio. Which had heaters at every table. I ordered half a beet salad, delicious. And the Bass with caramelized cauliflower. Also very good. My husband had lasagna and he said it was delicious. I would like to come back and eat on the beautiful patio next time. But my husband pretty much has crossed this restaurant off his list. We both agreed their food was delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. So pretty!!

B9CUYZDx0esDocpPa3lObA.text: Everytime we come here the service is great, the food is great, and we realize each time why we come here: there is nothing like it in town. If you haven't been here, you have to check it out, you will not have a better meal for this price point anywhere in town. I recommend it to everyone I know, and they all agree, this place is something special. Nice job, guys.

7X_NAvyywEDYz4Xy7l4wWw.text: I'm literally SO obsessed!!   I went there by chance on a Saturday and I had the tomato and spinach flatbread. Oh my gosh it was so good! The bread was all made fresh so the cheese just melted all over it. The staff is so sweet and friendly. The first time one of my girlfriend's and I went there we were so impressed at how sweet ( and cute ) all the waiters were... ;)  The next day we went there at 7am for breakfast and yet again the breakfast was to die for. We both had an egg and avocado kinda sandwich.  For lunch you have to try the simple green salad. I believe it was only $5 or so and it was SO BIG!   But for sure when you go you have to have to have to get the vanilla latte.. I have no idea why it is but its the best I've ever had!   Last but not least.. the atmosphere is so beautiful. The patio is amazing( fountain and trees and birds), and the inside seating is so cozy.   I feel like Im at a french cafe for breakfast but at lunch/diner I feel like I'm in Italy eating the best flatbread ever.  Must try for sure especially if you live in Scottsdale Waterfront.. just right across the street! :)

rRnIK9n5SkSyUMnsJ4GWFA.text: One of my favorite brunch places in old town Scottsdale. The mimosas are perfect -- almost all champagne with a splash of OJ (just the way I like it). They also give you complimentary focaccia & pesto -- so good! My personal favorite brunch items are the Mediterranean salad w/ chicken ; the Gyro ; and the breakfast sandwich.   Side note: I only come here for brunch because once I came for dinner & was pretty disappointed.. got the sea bass (~$25) & it was not very good. instead of a whole piece of fish it was like little spears of it with very little flavor :/ if I did come for dinner again I would probably stick with a salad or flatbread.

_Zl8OQD_KeqK-jW4XDmi7g.text: I've only been here during Happy Hour (Mon-Fri 3-6pm) , I've tried a few of the Flatbreads and both the Red and White Sangria. The White Sangria tastes like white gummy bears so I was pumped about that.  The Flatbreads are $9 (during Happy Hour) which in my opinion is a little steep considering they aren't that big or that great. Even if I were starving and desperate, I'd still be a bit disappointed.   Here's the thing, this place like most Fox Restaurants is about the decor, ambiance and providing a "cool "experience. Never have I ever been to a Fox Restaurant and tasted food that made me want to go back.   It's a "cool" place to hang out, they also have a fun patio area but, I wouldn't recommend it for its culinary wonders or value for money.

CCNiqfMRJToTEB6hqkYEXw.text: The favorite Phoenix area restaurant of my wife and mine! A scratch kitchen, you are guaranteed to have fresh ingredients and an incredible ambiance. The patio setting is beautiful. We love the bruschettas, fresh bread, and I always get the natural chicken. The service is always top-tier. And the marketplace has a great variety as well. The breakfast sandwich with avocado is so good and you can even pick that up at the airport location for literally the best airport meal you'll ever have!

9ofXkv-1VUIE_4qkRJd5Mw.text: Wow, fun place for a drink and appetizer after 3 hours of walking,shopping,etc. A lot of people in a great atmosphere. Fun "Happy Hour"place even better at night for dinner. Beautiful restaurant.

_YvupnhSjkr27rCsiWmoEA.text: My wife and I were out driving and we were HUNGRY could not decide where to eat when it dawned on me...Olive &Ivy!  Once again we were not disappointed.  The staff is always superb, love Christian (he's the best), and the food is delicious.  Can I please get the focaccia and basil pesto delivered to my house...daily?! Seriously, I love the food and the service. Keep up the great work, great hires and great food. Restaurant is always the busiest out of all the options in this area, that speaks volumes!!

eZ7mY8RNyehfuQkHUqZnWQ.text: I have been here a handful of times. It's in a convenient location where you can get soem shopping done or grab a drink in Old Town after. The restaurant has a good vibe; great modern decor. The wait staff and hosts/hostesses are incredibly attentive. Bonus: they are crazy good looking too. The last time I ate here, I was with 4 other girls. One of my friends broke her sandal and I asked the host if we could have some tape. Bonus points to him for giving us Velcro. We had an Open Table rezzie so we were seated right away in the dining room. I will have to ask to sit outside next time when it cools down...  We ordered much needed wine and cocktails and started off with the bruschetta. It was super tasty, seasoned perfectly and was great to share with the girls. The girls ordered shrimp and grits and salads and other dishes I can't remember off the top of my head but I went with the scallops. Moral of the story: great, fresh food and at a decent price. I didn't have room for dessert but we ordered gelato for the table. The waiter messed up on the number of scoops but that was the only thing that went wrong. Everyone cleaned their plates and was swooning over their meals. I think on the weekends they have a DJ right in the entrance, the music was actually pretty good but not sure if it fits with the crowd. There were very few people/tables who were our age (mid 20's) If you're in OT, check this place out.

uZEsEIoFHkG9eNmlrRw8Qg.text: I always have high expectations from the Fox Restaurants, and Olive & Ivy did not disappoint.  My mom and I went in for lunch, meeting my mother-in-law, sister-in-law, and her mother.  We came in the wrong door (the entrance for the attached marketplace) and tried to follow the signs to the hostess, but the signs ended before we found her.  An understanding server, who has probably seen this happen a lot, found us and pointed us in the right direction.  I ordered the tuna salad sandwich, and it was delicious.  Crispy warm toast, creamy tuna salad, fresh greens and a side of fries made for a lunch I wish I could replicate at home.  Our server expertly handled the special requests for our table, which pleased those who were avoiding gluten, dairy, or both.  My only complaint about the visit was that the music was a bit loud for the middle of the day.  Other patrons were raising their voices to be heard above it, creating even more noise.  It was nearly impossible to have a conversation with anyone not sitting directly next to, or across from me.  I can't help but notice restrooms in restaurants.  The ladies room here is very nice, with cute little touches that I was taking note of for my own home!  It was clean and well decorated, which is always a good sign, if you ask me.    I'd love to return for brunch or dinner and sample more of the menu.  For lunch, it definitely hit the spot.

fdfYcJdZOnrWsfhVPI-WUA.text: Their brunch is outstanding! I love the mimosas, the cinnamon toast, the croissant sandwich and want to try more! I cannot wait to go back. It is a classy establishment that has a great enviornment!

a804nBoBI6efAzJZQfJFJQ.text: Amazing! Our server was wonderful, knowledgable, and fun! The food was amazing. There were so many more items that I cannot wait to try. I had the surf and turf. The steak was cooked perfectly.

vH0hgHWNl7yWbTLOr3h_Jg.text: AMAZING!!!!!!!  I went with 4 co workers and we had such a great time.  The food was amazing and the atmosphere was really nice.  Not too casual and not too fancy.  Great spot for a date or a family.  Will definitely go again.

22ec0ztcFcVghb8zFLXtxQ.text: Absolutely original and delish. All Fox restaurants are great.

_tlOYqtuilIRugLA6loB8g.text: My co-worker took me here because we were in the neighborhood and she knew that I really like the Fox Concept restaurants.  The place exudes a fun atmosphere.  The food was fantastic as well.  I started out with the beet salad which was really good.  The dressing was tasty, they provided an good amount of beets, and I appreciated the pistacchios for the textural contrast.  The beet salad was almost as good as the one at the Arrogant Butcher.  We also partook in the lamb meatballs which were yummy as well.    For the entree, I chose the scallops at the recommendation of my server,  The scallops were of good size and seared on one side, but I would appreciated it more if they were seared on both sides, however.  The scallops were accompanied with scallops and sweet corn polenta which went well with the protein.  I ended the night with the chocolate mousse with cherries which was absolutely divine.  My server was friendly and attentive and it was a great overall experience.

c-4xqCnzfEFoMU2xFkumAA.text: Olive & Ivy has quickly become one of my favorites! The patio is gorgeous and has a beautiful garden patio feel. The servers are friendly and attentive. The food, drinks and desserts are on point. The Chopped Chicken salad is my favorite if you enjoy salad and the  Prosciutto Mascarpone Tortelli is to die. The Lemon Tres Leches Cake is perfection and the Tangerine  Cheesecake is a real treat! Make sure to try the Red Sangria, it's perfect on any day.

alXN409bKewKS1z0D56-Ww.text: My second visit to Olive & Ivy is what convinced me. Not that my first experience wasn't spectacular. It was, but I really steeped in it my fiance this weekend for brunch, and it isn't that our meals were just perfect, it's that the service was very friendly and attentive, as well.   My fiance ordered the Eggs Benedict with breakfast potatoes, and I had the Bacon Cheeseburger with a side salad. He cleaned his plate, and ate whatever he could of the half burger I couldn't finish. His only comment was that he preferred the hollandaise a different way, but that's because we make it ourselves at home.   The Bacon Cheeseburger was amazing, I order it medium. If I could have finished the entire thing I would, and the red wine vinaigrette on the side of greens is the best I've had in a while. I'd love to be able to make that one at home!  We ended the meal with the strawberry shortcake dessert that was interesting...not what either of us was expecting, then again, not sure what we were expecting. It was good. I'm sure there are better choices.   Our waiter really made sure we were comfortable, enjoying our brunch and our experience. We walked out of there smiling, stopping by the marketplace to order the large Cactus Blossom iced tea on the way out.

hB3FGQ1FojzCv5jxmcZohw.text: Me and my girlfriend went to try Olive and Ivy for our anniversary dinner. Let me warn you that both me and my girlfriend woke up with upset stomachs after dining here. We ordered three different types of bruschetta and a duck tortelli plate. I am not too sure how this restaurant has almost five stars as this restaurant served the worst tasting mediterranean food I have ever tasted before. Olive and Ivy is a sad excuse for a high end restaurant with inexperienced chefs that do not even know how to cook food the right way.  Apart from the food horrible tasting food, the restaurant staff was very nice and friendly. If you are looking for good mediterranean food, save your money and go to Pita Jungle. Try to avoid restaurants owned or managed by Fox Restaurant Concepts. This is the second restaurant that I had been to managed by Fox Restaurant Concepts leaving me unsatisfied and with an upset stomach the day after. It seems that management tries to cut costs by hiring young inexperienced chefs serving low quality food.

W-tXSwpc-48k-ENMjmvcVg.text: Made a reservation for 7:15pm. Got there at 7:20. Was super loud!!!! Was told I could be seated and then given a pager and told it would be a 5 minute wait. 30 minutes later I still wasn't seated and I gave back the pager and left. WTF?  Why make a reservation if it is meaningless??? I'm over overrated noisey overpriced Fox restaurants. Bye bye

65lXFDpuZLpzrA2zMD005w.text: No complaints about Olive & Ivy! Free underground parking. It looked like they have items to purchase for takeout in addition to the restaurant and bar. There was a bit of a wait to be seated for Sunday brunch, but they have pagers and we were able to wait at the bar. Waiting is always better when there are cocktails involved! When we were seated, we got bread made in house & served with amazing fresh pesto. You must try it. (see pic: yelp.com/biz_photos/wUKz...) White sangria was yummy, but didn't have any fresh fruit & was served in a low ball glass (see pic: yelp.com/biz_photos/wUKz...). Bellini was very good and very strong! I had a good buzz after 2 drinks. Eggs Benedict was very good with fresh shaved ham & a little fresh basil in the hollandaise. I would've liked a bit more hollandaise (see pic: yelp.com/biz_photos/wUKz...). My man's Breakfast sandwich was very good. The home fries were perfectly crispy in the outside & soft on the inside. (see pic: yelp.com/biz_photos/wUKz...) Patio seating with waterfront view is quaint and has a European feeling with the umbrellas, stone fountains & geraniums in the tree planter boxes. All in all... A wonderful brunch experience. I would DEFINITELY come back the next time I'm in Scottsdale.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. White Sangria (no fresh fruit?) &amp; a raspberry vodka with sprite
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast sandwich with egg, bacon, avocado &amp; cheese on really good bread
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Eggs Benedict = yummy, but needed a little more hollandaise

WvADOoZjRdwv74Pq0_VMSA.text: Impressed yet again by another Fox Concept Restaurant. This place is amazing! Julia, our server, was super sweet and beyond accommodating. The next time we come in we will definitely be looking forward in sitting in her section again. The food was amazing!! We got the jalapeno cilantro hummus as an appetizer (yum!) and as an entree we got the bacon wrapped pork tenderloin cooked to perfection! The dish was beautiful and they even split it for us! We also split the chicken pesto pizza. The chicken is shredded inside the pesto and even came with pine nuts! It was amazing! Before they entree they give you complimentary bread and pesto with olive oil and balsamic vinaigrette. Oh, and get the Strawberry & Thyme cocktail; you'll be hooked!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

mmDBtux28hGd231bmuxmwA.text: Olive & Ivy EQUALS utter bliss.   Highlights for Erin on Saturday evening:  1. Door immediately held open for me and a nice, warm welcome 2. Immediate seating (sans servervations) at Chef's Table - which held my attention quite nicely w/my adult onset ADD 3. Pleasant server who sincerely looked like she loved her job 4. Frequent check-ins without being a pestering fly 5. GREAT food (I had the chopped salad w/chicken) and smooth champs served in a gorgeous flute 6. Fab ppl watching 7. Packed restaurant, but acoustics worked well as I could still maintain a good volley of conversation w/my friend.

2FjSUKfemKiYAbdraScvqg.text: Awesome service and environment.  Our waiter was well informed and friendly. Had sweet potato CANNELLONI the taste was a combination of dinner and dessert. It was too much of one thing.  Maybe served as a side or for sharing would be good.  The spicy shrimp RISOTTO was good but not spicy at all. Overall good quality food and lovely ambiance. Has unique food not found at other restaurants. Would recommend to a friend

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. SPICY SHRIMP RISOTTO

IuN1WFw3xPrK37uFSxgxKQ.text: We were here with a larger party, and the server continuously tried to up-sell us on different items. It began to get a little annoying.  The food was good, but the portions were tiny. I think most people at the table (except for the person who ordered the flatbread) finished their meal and were still hungry. Luckily we ordered lots of desserts to fill our bellies!  We probably wouldn't return unless the idea was initiated by someone else.

2xlrQVTOilxs2fwIotGnuw.text: Good appetizers, drinks, and romantic ambiance!

6y0uCAOhWwcqulgJY6ru4g.text: Great patio along the canal. Cool, romantic vibe. The food is just OK, but the $5 mimosas on Saturday and Sunday make up for the ho-hum menu.

H7poQkuUmngmoTvY0VlbIQ.text: So this was my fourth time at Olive and Ivy before writing a review.     The first three times were at breakfast where we utilized the the little marketplace they have.  I really enjoyed going there, a little over priced but good food and a great atmosphere.   This last time I was at Sunday brunch with my girls and it sucked!!!  Sangria in a carafe $20!!!!  Granted the white sangria is pretty amazing. ..but geesh!  It doesn't even look pretty!  No pretty fruit floating around or anything.   What really brings my review down was the gyro.  It sucked.  Wilted lettuce, a tomato that looked like it had been sliced last week and cold fries.  I get that they were trying to time it out right after our appetizer but letting it die in the window? ... that is just bad service.  And at $12 it should have have been perfect.  Soooo...I will be trying some new places and staying away from here.

djv_EtTmLKg4jQRPHGHqkg.text: This place is wonderful for larger groups. It has a great outdoor seating area that would be better to visit not when summer's in full bloom. The food is good and it has a great happy hour that I visited with an MBA group. Its also has a great brunch.

ib9NaFCHhFS8sIVDZShO1A.text: Food, Service and Ambiance was amazing.  Cool looking spot in Scottsdale.  Ordered the bruschetta and it insanely good!  Sea bass was a little over cooked but it was still great.  I highly suggest you go here if you're in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mozzarella ,  fungi and Brussels sprouts bruschetta

kHBj8Lg8xVuA1PDWCoDrdQ.text: Bar tender really bad.  Stands in front of you and acts busy.  We ate and had a few drinks and he could not even refill the drinks.  Food is not great and with this service I'd say find someplace else. Who needs bad service at these prices!!!

Ldk8u3CfC57pZAE_2A0PfQ.text: I tried Margherita Flatbread at lunch today. The strong scent of basil was refreshing. Melted mozzarella embraced my taste buds. Server was very kind and offered timely service. Overall, wonderful experience

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Margherita Flatbread

_KySJi233hNBphgPPSGcpw.text: A really nice and welcoming restaurant. Service is met with high expectations and received. I went hear for my birthday, in which my girlfriend got them to surprise me with a birthday cake she got from a store. I had the veal and spinach ravioli, the dish has me craving for it even now.

JfddxP9XwBSGEjylNz8qXA.text: The decor is very nice.  The patio has a lot of trees which is a nice change around here.  Love the little lights all over the place.  The bread and pesto is delicious.  There is a bit of salt on the crust part of the bread so make sure you leave some fleshy bit to eat with it or it will be too salty.    For entrees we chose lasagna and pepperoni and sausage flatbread.  The lasagna is a bit too sweet for my taste and the sauce may have been too salty.  The garlic bread that comes with it was a little overladen with oil/butter.  It isn't the worst I've ever had, but nothing really to write home about.  The meat actually kind of reminded me of Chef Boyardi...  The pizza was solid.  The crust is very thin.  Nothing too special there.  Dessert was coconut cakes with blood orange gelato and the cheesecake.  The coconut cakes were 2 pieces of dense bits with a scoop of gelato in between.  It was pretty good though I wonder if vanilla ice cream would have been a better choice.  They also had a smear of something that was neither attractive nor additive in any way that I noticed.  The gelato was nice anyway with good flavor.  The cheesecake tasted not so much cakey but just like a very mild cheese.  I've never been a fan of graham cracker crustless cheesecake either.    So I imagine we'll come back here and there, but there's really nothing that will make me crave this place.  The food is solidly decent, but nothing overwhelmingly great that we've tried.  The decor is beautiful though.  Pricing is about average though some of the portions may be slightly on the small side.

ZSCGWM_Vww0m2RaAm77Vcg.text: Not much to say that hasn't already been said, so here's the short review.  The starter bread and pesto were amazing. Best pesto ever.  Appetizer was the calamari/shrimp/zucchini and it was so good. And I'm not even a super fan of calamari.   I had the lasagna and my girl had the flatbread. Both were excellent.  Our server was great, and even the water was good - which outside of AZ isn't usually a consideration, but not having it taste like dirt was nice.   Been here a few times and always have had a great experience.

S54PP7BYLGbXxUGJJHyqyA.text: Solid happy hour. Good white sangria. Grea view on the Scottsdale Waterfront. We had the bruschetta it was good but not as good as Postino. Great location above average food. Great spot to meet a friend.

cE7LxVHddx4Svs06_2kyfg.text: I haven't been here for a few years, but I have had a few great experiences at this restaurant.

4JNMa0Z7bNdEWJt4PpDRkw.text: Olive and Ivy is my favorite Fox Restaurant. I absolutely love their salmon. Although I must say, everything I've had there is delicious. Moreover, the atmosphere is great, especially the patio.

oUdm06AEwm5rCx7LLpTXIg.text: Time for an update only because I was invited to a dinner party last night at O&I that was absolutely perfect!  We sat in their beautiful private room, and it almost felt like we were at someone's house in their dining room.  Joel was our waiter and took fantastic care of our group.  As usual the food was delicious!  Last night I had the scallop entree (with bacon, salsify & yellow corn puree) and a side of spinach.  Jared had the salmon (with roasted beets, fingerling potatoes & horseradish vinaigrette).  We were pleased with both, as well as the bread and pesto, antipasti plate, and hummus starters.  I enjoyed a glass of Gewurztraminer while a variety of libations went down easy around the table as well including mojitos and beer.    After dinner, we moved the party outside and thankfully, the misters on the patio made this crazy AZ heat bearable!  The evening flew by (a reflection of the fine group of peeps I was with), and as midnight approached, I noticed the bar and most of the restaurant were empty... the DJ was packing up and our party moved on as well.  In usual Gabi manner, I headed home to get some beauty sleep.  Thanks again, O&I, for another wonderful meal!

CZm6501TegOr6WnNPbyaPg.text: Very good food, small portions for entrees. I went yesterday along with 3 friends at 7:30pm and put our name down for a table (yes there was a wait on a Tuesday, good sign huh? lol) after about 15/20 minutes we were seated and immediately asked for our drink orders (prompt!) Now I really love the service and the ambience (& my Mediterranean salad!) but this place can only receive 3 stars from me. The chef that night had a bit of a heavy hand when it came to the salt because my friend commented on how salty the bread was and then when I received my entree (veal and spinach ravioli) I was taken aback by how salty and small the portion was. Luckily we ordered lamb meatballs as a small plate and I had a half salad during the meal or else I would have left unsatisfied by the cost related to portion size. But I MUST marvel about the Mediterranean salad, it's been a while since I've had a really good fresh salad and Olive & Ivy's Mediterranean salad + shrimp did the job for me but everything else I ate (meatballs and ravioli) plus my red wine sangria were just like my review states, a 2.5/3. I won't write them off completely though, I'm going to say that was just a freak one time incident (so I can go back and get my salad!) haha

l8tIc86Afz1DmH5dhRPTGw.text: I can only speak for the morning experience as that's the only time I've been. The food is excellent and the coffee is great, much better than Starbucks. The morning staff is helpful and friendly, especially Nathan and Elle. Love coming here for breakfast. Thanks!

MTGUn2xQZty3Fy76cgrrPQ.text: it's always packed here (even tho we came during lunch on a WEEKDAY -- the heck???) so we had to sit in the community seating area outside since we weren't about to wait an hour to get seated. now, i got the veggie flatbread and it wasn't AMAZING but i still finish it all. would i order it again? no. and the white sangria was a disappointment, would not recommend anyone to order that lol.

H6tkgQZfydO9jTFB0Xk-ZQ.text: Dreading the long week and need a quick fix before the weekend hits?! Head down over to this behemoth of upscale delight that serves up a tasty Mediterranean menu that will keep your wallet and plastic cards happy . If you are savvy with the Fox Concept brand, then you know exactly what I'm talking about--another masterpiece done up by the creators of True Food Kitchen and Modern Steak. + Happy Hour + 4-6PM + Lounge, the Main Bar, Patio (w/ Mist) If you roll up with a clan of say 6-8, try to grab lounge seating which is located in the Bar area, especially in the Summer! the Main Bar is swanky and spacious. Once fall hits, the Patio might be the most ideal to enjoy some nice weather. Ohh k, Let's talk food and drinks! the real reason why we even bother, right? + Sangria: $5, white (lychee, blood orange, peach), red (blackberry, rasberry, strawberry, tempranillo) - decided this be my favorite one of the two, you can get a small sampling before you try, both are not too sweet just right, unfortunately no hard fruits in them but still satisfying + Flatbreads: $8, there's 5 to choose from, I personally enjoyed the prosciutto crudo (crispy potato, asparagus & fried egg) and piccante (italian sausage & spicy salami), love EGG on my pizzas! spread it over like jelly on a toast! + Bacon Wrapped Dates: italian sausage & piquillo pepper, you get the sweet and savory, wasn't as crispy but still pleasing I know some in the group ordered some Bruschetta but I did not get to try. So can't comment much. What could I say about service? Attentive, friendly and eye candy. Just saying, from the host to the bartenders to the servers. If you were not wow'd by the ultra posh dining and bar area, the bathroom will. Might be the most stylized toilette I've ever tainted! Let's just say the bathroom stalls have wooden doors! yelp.com/biz_photos/wUKz... With little room to complain, Olive and Ivy sounds to me like a winner, winner chicken dinner to help you get through your slacker ways week! ;-p

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Open Kitchen
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bathroom Stall

rNeQpWLEhG--BUNxac8V0g.text: I've been at this place many times and is one of my favorite spots to meet friends in Old Town; every time they had offered a good experience regardless of time, number of people or how busy they are.   Restaurant is in a prime location of Old Town, you can get there from both sides of the bridge (parking garages are close) or they have valet if you prefer that. Both the patio and the inside areas have a nice atmosphere. Good Service. Good Food

bsLXhqPAucBZgjVXL-Iveg.text: Recently had both dinner and Sunday brunch there.  The bread & pesto is soft, salty and delicious and while I had the lasagna which wasn't anything to write home about, the risotto was to.die.for  Sunday brunch we sat at the bar and were served by Nick the bartender. The bloody Mary's are made with fresh vegetable juice and lots of horseradish. Not for the faint of heart but clearly a popular beverage there.  My dining companions and I all had the gyro for lunch which was quite tasty.  Looking forward to dining there again next time I'm in town.

ONxu1jf-t_l5g89pnGi6_Q.text: Formulaic restaurant that works to move you quickly through your meal. Staff was knowledgable and had the company storyline down pat. Food was good, wine list was okay but sommelier lacked basic wine knowledge.  Appetizers were appealing. Salads had balanced flavor and showed up very quickly. Plates were removed as soon as last bite. Bread and pesto provided but only lasted on the table less than 5 minutes. We had to ask for the bread's return. Entrees tasted good too but were in the small side.  Not a bad restaurant but as I said they look to turn you in and out quickly. We were looking for something a little more relaxed.

VVHvg67F-ibm9w4wAtCuFQ.text: There's something about Olive & Ivy that makes me want to go back. Sadly, its not the food, as much as I wish it was. Yet, I go back. [Sometimes, it is for food. Those lamb meatballs are not meant for sharing. Take my advice and there will be peace at the table.]  Where else can you sip on 5$ mimosas, on a balmy Saturday afternoon, in a Mediterranean inspired well manicured backyard? The setting takes you miles away from the brown overloaded Arizona. The ambience and service more than make up for the 'just a notch above mediocre' food. I particularly like taking the unreserved lounge seating and linger around for longer than they may like!  At some places, the food just takes a backseat. Here, it's for a good reason.

tqVEX2ed_H1REHmkQ9lhgw.text: Absolutely atrocious. Empty wine glass and forgotten entree. This place is an embarrassment.  My party is done and I'm here waiting for my dinner or at least a drink maybe an apology but nothing.

8hll3iU2Hd0SydNbrHmPUg.text: Excellent service. Excellent tasty food. Outside patio atmosphere under the lights was perfect. Took Yelp reviews to heart and gave it a try. Will definitely go back. Many times.

-c4lj9RGDOWIma1gb1NiPA.text: Was here for a quick 2 hour Happy Hour thingy. The patio is great with lots of tables and a firepit in the corner. They have a special happy Hour menu, but watch out for the Brushetta part. The prices at $3 are attractive, but they are only giving you $3 worth of food, not a Happy Hour deal or anything. The pumpkin/Hazelnut cheese concoction wasn't even good, moreorless worth the $3 it cost for one slice of bread cut up into three pieces. Are you really that freakin cheap people? It was unhappy Hour in terms of food, but they had AZ craft beers for $5 at HH and although that isn't a great deal, it's the best you can find in this upscale happy hour, which should be renamed. Waitress was nice and staff was polite, but also an aging crowd was hanging out at the bar if your into grey, then head that way.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. $3 slice of bread. hh scam.

-fKjCdjSulEJuhvWvmtVJA.text: Great place to eat or go on a date for sure. tHe atmosphere is great. We ate outside near the heaters and water.

xNWkcxzvDfnPtkU36SF16w.text: Love this place, as long as you make an advanced rez. Awesome patio. Ambiance is perfect. DJ was on point   The homemade pesto was delicious and the kale salad so, so good! Will definitely dine here again in Scottsdale!

I1LR0IX_wrjE4U6Ub6KdsA.text: I love this restaurant. I have been coming here with my family for years and they always provide great service.  The only downside is that if you are going on a weekend day or a busy peak time, you MUST make a reservation or you will not get a seat. The bar and marketplace area is open seating but the patio here is the best place to sit. The Fritto Misto is the best dish ever by the way. I love the Fox Restaurant Concepts.   Thank you again!

hlacCEhN4afCAa0jRlIpBg.text: Stopped in for lunch after a referral from a local shop owner.  Couldn't be happier with the food and service. Our waiter was extremely knowledgeable, friendly and genuinely seemed to enjoy his job and the restaurant.  Very reasonably priced and the food was delicious.  We will definitely return and look forward to their dinner menu. Would recommend this restaurant to anyone in Scottsdale.

E720PQdigu4bFLvxxl4PBA.text: We gave this place 2 chances and both times were unimpressed by the food, atmosphere and the service.  Yes, the location is awesome but the food has more than disappointed both times. It's difficult to get the attention of your waitperson, like they couldn't be bothered, and the atmosphere just feels cold, very anonymous, no warmth from anyone.  Last time, the chefs needed 3 times to make the eggs even acceptable. This time, no one greeted us, bartender was uninterested; the only ones to say hello were the hostesses on the way out. So, yes, great location but as the review says...Meh. I've definitely experienced better.

Yx--pJJyQgzQ_CGzbouNgw.text: This is my go to place for dinner on Friday night. The live dj creates a fun and inviting atmosphere. You have to start with an order of the mozzarella bruschetta. Phenomenal. A few of my other favorite dishes are the Mediterranean salad and the sweet potato cannelloni. Both of these are great vegetarian options and are signatures at Olive and Ivy. Oh, and cannot forget about the Ivy and Ginger drink. Just order it- you will not regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bruschetta// Ivy and ginger

yLGN0p1syN7eAs7z6UO08w.text: I would give a 5 star because the service deserves 5 stars our server was Michael and made our experience amazing! We were there celebrating our friends birthday and he was so attentive, fun, and just enough attention but not being annoying! He had great suggestions and was very knowledgeable about the menu! The food was also great!   The reason I gave a 3 star was because I called to make A reservation for the private room and apparently you have to call a separate  number and they are only there Mon - fri 8-4 or something so if you have weekend plans don't waste your time calling because they won't even bother to call you back.  I did call Friday at like 10 am but still I can't even get a call back by four?! This is the second time I have tried to reserve this room and have not received a call. To top it off during the time of the reservation that room was empty!! This probably isn't the restaurants fault so I feel bad giving the 3 stars but I think its kinda crappy I can't  get a call back when this is their job!   I highly recommend this restaurant and Michael but if you have a private party your better off just making reservations in the dining room.

9STIQf9pCPo3tojavuqSOA.text: We've celebrated anniversaries and business deals that have closed here so obviously I like it. :) I've only gone for dinner and happy hour and the ambiance is always upscale, trendy yet refined.  You see all ages groups represented and quite a few tourist in the mix.  I've had the Veal & Spinach Ravioli, Sea Bass, Sea Scallops - all very good.  Taste and presentation is important to them so I don't think you can go wrong with anything from their menu.  Overall one of my favorite places to dine.

P-8-odNHMTzUc602bxwmAA.text: The place is very cool, a very pretty atmosphere. The menu is pretty simple which is great, I don't need complicated stuff. I had the chicken chopped salad and it was very good! Very similar yet but flavorful. The waiter was great and had a great sense of humor. The only thing that bothered me was I ordered ice tea which was amazing but he never once offered to refill mine or anyone else at the table. That's the only negative. I would go again for dinner

e0dw-U49jyr0pZcHD_fZHQ.text: Our server, Amanda, made the experience great.  She was very conscience of our needs and had a glowing personality.  The beet salad, cauliflower cheddar soup and chicken scallopini were tasty. The pasta used for the veal ravioli was too thick.

up4aeUBfXC0vfQtSW6RpWw.text: This place is awesome! I'm so excited to have found them reminds me of back home!!! everything is delish!!!!

LwVk587Nf4YDuAFjbHNpuw.text: My boyfriend and I came here for a late dinner after a long day of hiking while on vacation in the area. This restaurant was wonderful. We had really friendly and prompt service. I wish I could remember our waiter's name because he was attentive and informative without being pushy. The food was very good -- we got a flatbread to start and both had generous helpings of pasta, not to mention the delicious bread and pesto combo that came with the table. We really wanted to try some of the delicious-looking desserts, but our main dishes were too filling. What really makes this place shine, however, is the ambiance. The indoor/outdoor vibe and the trendy atmosphere was perfect for our "fancy date night". We loved the feel of the restaurant, with its fireplace tables, soaring ceilings, innovative light fixtures and a wide open concept. I just wish there was an Olive & Ivy in Chicago!

GEUhu7glDTOZHoDHAsMrlQ.text: A nice classy place in Scottsdale. Good for a romantic outing.  Service is good and the food is upscale - so is the pricing.  We had appetizers there along with drinks. Food was great but mixed drinks left a lot to be desired.  Rightfully so, they have a very limited cocktail menu. More focus on wine and other liquor - hence the upscale menu. Great location and ambiance

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ZRzTWw9SbAnIdK-rmGOrpw.text: I decided to visit Olive and Ivy this past weekend, when the weather was nice.  We decided to sit in the patio, which I do highly recommend if you want especially before it starts getting chilly.  The service was lacking.  However, the restaurant is so cute.  We decided to start off with the bruschetta - prosciutto & fig, funghi, and manchego.  My favorite was the funghi, but I love mushrooms.  If you are not a muschroom fan, then I recommend the manchego.  That was good.  There wasn't alot of bruschetta - I think it was 3 slices each. I then ordered the goat cheese tortelli.  One Word - "YUMMMMMM!" It was so good.  I love goat cheese. - the goat cheese, sauce, and duck was a great combination.  I practically ate my whole meal.  If licking your bowl wasn't inappropriate, I definitely would of done it.   We finished with gelato at the gelato bar.  Pretty good too.    .

MoHNZZapEqOr6UxTfi8OxQ.text: I don't understand all the five star reviews. We had an awful dinner. We ordered two appetizers, the hummus and 3 bruschetta (prosciutto, mushroom, and avocado.) All were lacking in flavor. The bread was sliced too thick, it was soft inside, and wasn't brushed with oil. Not True bruschetta, more like dip on top of a thick slice of French bread. The hummus was inedible. So much cumin that that is all you could taste. Totally overpowering. Were they trying to give it an Indian influence? My sister's beet salad was fine, but a salad you could find on any menu. My Caesar salad and my sister's flatbread were flavorless. The worst was the "gelato." How they call that gelato is beyond me. Nowhere close to what gelato really tastes like. It was closer to ice milk.  I am not sure why this place is so popular. Perhaps because of the social scene or the ability to sit outside. If you are interested in good food, skip it.

KGI006kNYhPTUE0Rr_omuA.text: I'd like to keep it short here goes...  Location is very nice.  Inside or out, the atmosphere is very pretty and pleasant  The food is good.  Some dishes are very good, but over all not great.  The bar is were we had the biggest disappointment.  It is a pricey bar that serves less than impressive drinks.  The Moscow mule was a sour pill and I have never had it this bad. The sangria my wife had was also disappointing.  The scotch selection is basically what you find on the super market shelf - not bad but only the average stuff.    The staff is young, nice but a bit scarce.  We can't go back but it is in a very nice place.

FKuA2SU1QZLFMhB3PMTs4w.text: We decided to visit after the crushbrew festival. The music and decor lured us in. We were quickly seated in the outside area, service was fast and friendly. We ordered the lamb meatballs and a pasta dish. The food was delicious, tasty and at a great temperature. Definitely something to try another night when we aren't tired of drinking/walking all day... Perfect for a nice date-night.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pasta dish---w/ prosciutto
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lamb Meatballs
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Decor

Y1ihWy_erGlCHBoF2Txfow.text: Olive & Ivy really impressed me. As I read the lower reviews and scan the pictures, I understand why my experience was so different.   I was here for a dinner celebration, but we didn't order any flatbreads or sandwiches. Instead, we had a wine and dine experience.   Rib eye - medium rare - perfectly cooked and seasoned with crisp oven potatoes. Big eye tuna - seared only - with leeks and roasted mushrooms. Pork tenderloin - wrapped in bacon. Free range chicken - with English peas and a citrus sauce. Beet salad Fresh mozzarella Fig and prosciutto bruschetta  Everything was decadent and delicious. Good wine selection, I had the Albarino.  Waiters were young and handsome; service was on point. Open kitchen, bodega aisle, and waterfront seating option. Prices were shockingly low for a beautiful restaurant.

iO2S8MhKVIOF0fReey0m-Q.text: Ive had like 5 birthdays here and their food is good as well as drinks. Good service and really nice atmosphere (inside outside patio) which is really romantic at night with their lights.

ZqyCIsrbn8enPvMgZigiww.text: This is a beautiful restaurant.  I've been here twice now, both times were excellent.  There's a huge bar area and also a big back patio with a misting system in the summer time.  Both times we've ordered the hummus.  It's that good.  It's got a lil kick to it, and it's served with pita bread.  It's excellent.  What else is excellent is their lasagna.  It's some of the best I've ever had!!!  It's served with two little amazing pieces of garlic bread, that's so yummy and pairs perfectly with the lasagna sauce.  If you're really hungry the portion is perfect, if not, it heats up well, so take it home and have it as a midnight shnack ;)  My friend ordered the Med salad and it looked really good and the portion is ginormous.  Overall, this place is awesome  and we will definitely visit again when we're on that side of town.

2bZyr5Cq4CS1-x6N9Uh7lA.text: I stopped here for lunch with a friend while I was visiting from Cali, and I had a wonderful experience. Service is excellent and the food was phenomenal!

rQsnvrHUaOVz-xidS0a6ww.text: Food was good. Service was decent. Only 2 stars because of the to-go container that my food was put in. That white layer in the photo? That's the paper peeling off of the to-go food container and sticking to my risotto. Fail.  Management needs to fix this.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

lWdia4njKNUE6M6jrtuITg.text: Absolutely delicious and perfect last night. Great night for the patio. Even though it was a very busy night, they took us immediately upon arriving to our table, were exceptionally attentive and fast with the service, and everything was delicious! And our server Colby was super friendly and attentive. Great night for food and ambiance!

JqRaKL8pxzBTO1xIWqe3lA.text: What a brunch hot spot.  I was with a group of 9 girls for a bachelorette and failed to make Sunday brunch reservations.  We showed up at Olive and Ivy right when they opened at 10AM and were seated immediately outside at a really nice set of comfy couches and chairs.  All of our cocktails were delicious and we loved the fresh bright pesto with warm bread.  There was a coffee shop in the restaurant for those of us who needed more coffee. This was a perfect gathering spot to play a few bridal games and talk.  The seating and ambiance of the patio were perfect and service was very attentive but not too much.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The back patio is the perfect place for a bachelorette brunch!

VSFYuXpTJXc-GXQLQwrRyg.text: I came here for restaurant week. I paid less than 50 bucks for an appetizer, main course, dessert and a glass of chardonnay. That's such a good deal.   As far as the food goes, it was very fresh. I ordered a Mediterranean salad with a serving of chicken. The chicken did not come with the restaurant week deal. However, it was just a small extra charge on my bill. It's worth it. The chicken on the salad was so tender.  For my main course I ordered the salmon. It was so tender and so juicy. I got my salmon medium. As far as dessert, I ordered their peanut butter mousse. It was like eating a peanut butter cup! Yum!   I'm addition, I ordered the beet salad. I liked the beet salad way better than their Mediterranean salad. The beet was so fresh and so juicy. The arugula was peppery and crisp. The dressing was creamy and sweet.  I recommend this restaurant! It serves great food with great service!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

9VUDVh416WF5FKwkDr-ZWg.text: Could not have asked for a better brunch experience. The pesto and bread starter is fantastic. Outdoor seating was great despite the colder weather thanks to the fire pits and heaters. The service and food are excellent. Highly recommend the Eggs Benedict and Cobb Salad. Can't wait to come back someday!

5v40U7VGe1ti2KeqHBZ_iA.text: The food was impeccable. The bruschetta was fresh and the cheese was delightful and paired well with each choice so you have the perfect balance with each bite. The lasagna bolognese was cooked perfectly to my liking. The sauce was also great and very flavorful. The atmosphere is the perfect date night and the restaurant is huge so the wait typically isn't too long. However when we arrived the hostess only had the chefs table available which was side by side and we were okay with that option. When we sat down it was about ten minutes before we were greeted by anyone and another ten minutes after, we were brought water. I'm typically very patient and it may be that they were giving time to have an intimate enjoyable time with who you are with. The service was otherwise friendly though. I would definitely go back and try some of the other option available.

SThaLF-p-YxuSIxUeU_F4A.text: Wonderful patio with a great view, misters and plentiful shade for the summer. Interesting cocktails and a nice variety of wine both by the glass or bottle.  Diverse menu with everything from lighter fare to hearty steaks and seafood.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

MoweSBjKhICX3AfYS9vYPA.text: WOW!    Yesterday was my birthday and my husband told me to pick a place to go for dinner. I wanted to go somewhere that was different, that wasn't too fancy, but was also a little more upscale.  I remembered that I was sent a coupon for a free desert at any Fox Concepts Restaurants.  I was really ping-ponging between Olive & Ivy and another restaurant in Phoenix.  I'm glad that I picked Olive & Ivy because I was so impressed and the food was AMAZING!    This place has an awesome atmosphere. They had a live DJ, their windows/doors were open. It's really a "grand" space. The menu is fairly simple, which I understand changes fairly often.  I ordered the sea scallops with polenta and my husband had a salad. I was amazed at how yummy my dish was. (I've never had polenta before so I hope it all tastes like this one!) My husbands salad looked really good too, I even had to have a few bites.  After dinner I ordered the lemon pudding cake. Oh. Em. Gee!  The cake was so light and fluffy and just amazing.    I have to checkout the other restaurant that I decided against next!!!

tPyqH643DmcZQVFenZhRaw.text: Awesome ambience and amazing food. The staff is all kind and accommodating. Will definitely go back!

cH1j7ogN5tYdyXcFMEqsag.text: This is a great spot for brunch or late night drinks, and a perfect first date atmosphere. They have a great selection of wines to choose from, horderves, and lots of yummy small plates to pick from. Check it out! Go with your girlfriends or your date and enjoy!

RNnnVFlDLX2PNutIPbiWpw.text: Went for a bachelorette party. Group of 12. As a server myself I am always apprehensive of dealing with a large group. Things can get difficult quickly. Our server Larsen didn't even blink at the needy requests. He made us feel very catered to.   As for ambiance this place was an absolute delight.  FOOD. WAS. AMAZING.  Bread and pesto dip could have been my meal.  we got bruschettas, and my entree was the scallops. SO YUM.   highly recommend all the way around.

sRM5X9XCzsHA9eePuF87_Q.text: Location, location, location! Right on the canal across the way from old town scottsdale. Love the outdoor seating for the evenings with the lighted palm trees behind. Brought my visitor here and my hubby was there before us. He got seated outside and when we checked in with the hostess, they didnt even try to find him for us.  Just said no one was there waiting for us BUT he was! The 2 ladies seemed a bit rude. Texted him and he said he had a table outside. Kevin was our server and thank goodness for him as he was great.  Friendly and not stuffy. Hubby had ordered bruschettas already and they were decent. Bacon wrapped dates were a little too sweet.  Liked my beet salad as it was refreshing.  Lamb meatballs were my favorite.  Sea bass was cooked well but kind of bland. Shrimp risotto was just average. Ambiance and service of Kevin was what made the night special. Food was just mediocre.

haSflTT_HIuTLOjFi-Lzww.text: Great spot for groups, all of my experiences included slow service so be mentally prepared.   The bread with the pesto dip is worth the calories! Great selection of wine and "good" pasta for Arizona.   Typical fox restaurant.

0V3FiMYeBREduQlzTpbfEw.text: We ordered the scallops and loved them so much we went back for a second round.  We also ordered the butchers block , one night was better than the other so I would like to see some consistency with that . We also ordered bacon wrapped dates, they were good but not amazing and we loved the lamb meatballs and  enjoyed desert, peanut butter mousse.

Uk1DBTNi2r0lv12Evhw5YQ.text: Came here for brunch today. The directions were not accurate. Has lots of free public parking nearby. They have a nice bar. The bartender was really nice. Had Gintonic. Appetizers were good. Had Lamb gyro as a meal. Overall great experience.

bVSjwQPrY0_ckFh6a--E3A.text: Very salty food. Far from any cuisine it tries to be. Poor service. Good decoration. Great view of kitchen. But very salty food.

3zX8MbFNTxwIqLyh5DsaqQ.text: This is one of my favorite places to eat in Scottsdale. From the small plates to the bruschettas and entrees, everything was delicious. The outdoor patio area has great ambience and the fire pits keep you warm and cozy on a cooler AZ night. Great atmosphere and service. I will be back.

drSFmfcHXfKwCQbg0FCv0A.text: Hands down best brunch restaurant. Chef Chris is amaze. Food is consistent and love the ambiance.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Back at my absolute fav restaurant. Food is consistent, and Chef Chris is a amaze. Always sit at Chef&#39;s Table best place to sit.

ngi4gQ5vw_hBcRdeN33H_A.text: Twice I've gone to Phoenix and on both occasions, I have gone here for special birthday dinners.  The place is in a lovely spot right in front of Scottsdale Waterfront. The place was always busy but there are plenty of cozy, romantic spots.  There is outdoor seating by the patio under the trees with stringed lights and pretty flowering plants.  It's my favorite spot.  Food was excellent.  If I may suggest the ones I've tried so far: bruschetta, Mediterranean salad, scallops, sea bass, the steak a hefty 18 oz rib eye is very well seasoned with a side sauce that perfectly matches.  Let me defer my review of their dessert to my review of the great service.  The staff were very friendly and accommodating of our requests.  On both occasions, we tried to collaborate with the staff in surprising our companion with a birthday cake.  We snuck to the bathroom and whispered to the staff that our companion was celebrating a birthday and we want a cake with a candle or whatever they have to that effect.  They acquiesced to our request and on the right cue they came out with a delicious cake with nice chocolate syrup birthday greeting on the plate...... all to our companion's pleasant surprise.  Try the delicious lemon cake with a scoop of salted caramel ice cream on the side, or the chocolate ganache with pistachio ice cream.  At the end of the night, you'd come out with a happy palate and an even happier experience.

F0_rjZEXQomGMuo6RA_rQQ.text: This place was just okay. I'm giving it three stars even though the food was disappointing for a few reasons: Busy, buzzy atmosphere in the oh-so- trendy Scottsdale waterfront area. Good service. Our waiter was on top of everything and just a good guy.   This is full of rose-swilling, avocado-toast eating, romper-clad millennials. I actually like a good rose and avocado toast, but it wasn't our scene. Lots of bachelorette parties the night we went.   This is a good place for people watching, fun to go with a group. Not great for a date, I wouldn't think. Menu is mostly unremarkable flatbread pizzas and salads.   I might go back for lunch sometime?

QhevG-WRfuQiY0m737HGEg.text: Great spot on the river.  Beautiful outdoor patio area with heaters in the winter months.  Service was excellent.  The pork loin was very good.
