Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Outdoor patio
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sea bass

__epSlNCoL0ZoorUBzd4nQ.text: Great food great service beautiful night in Scottsdale! Def will come back again! Great job

u460uHfC6K6jNVYog1-WRg.text: Olive & Ivy is one of the best eating experiences I've had in Scottsdale. Between the *healthy* food, patio, service and location, it's easy to see why this looks to be one of the most popular grub spots for locals and travelers like myself. The only downside is I don't live close enough to frequent this place.   Our group of six came with a local who knew the place well, so we immediately hit the patio for a table situated in a perfect mix of shade and sun that suited everyone's needs. As soon as I saw they had a salmon caesar salad, combining my dual cravings for fish and salad, I was sold. The salad did not disappoint, with a large piece of perfectly cooked fish, a delicious dressing and some addictive house-made croutons. Throw in the incredible hummus and pesto with fresh bread that started things off and endless refills of Arnold Palmers and you have won my heart.   A note that this is also a great little area to stroll in, especially in the evening. The patio and an adjacent bridge overlook a little canal and there are a lot of shops to peruse.

XA9H4en7IT2_MP--H1UdZg.text: It's a nice restaurant with really a good service  A bit expensive but it's worth it  I had the sweet potato cannelloni, it's the best dish they have in my opinion and it's a must to try

U2_9D-7iILHDZiDCwncTXA.text: I stopped into Olive & Ivy near the canal in Old Town Scottsdale with my parents in search of a nice patio for lunch. We had stopped in the night prior but were unable to get a table until 9 pm as we did not have a reservation. If your heart is set on eating here I would definitely recommend calling ahead!   We all enjoyed a different sandwich: I ordered the grilled chicken panini, my Mom enjoyed the tuna salad, and my Dad had the turkey grinder & a cup of Minestrone soup- all plates were licked clean! Our server was very friendly and attentive. Overall, a great experience!

TWnk9VvgFs6NxubQSG9IJA.text: Great service! We sat out on the patio and it felt great outside not to hot with the misters. Inside there is music playing and it's pretty loud. The food was really good. I had the kale salad and it was delicious. I like how you can get half sizes. I got the manchego bruschetta. It was good but not my personal favorite. I got the short rib pizza and it was so good ! My friend got the melon salad. She loved it but you should know it has a kick of spice! Then she had the margarita pizza and enjoyed it. We both had the red sangria and it was good not too sweet which is my preference. It is a fun restaurant and I would definite recommend it !

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

lrpW_3ffW2zRCfi3N_NOGg.text: Beautiful location and delicious food every time. This place is very consistent so you can count on it for a special occasion. Among my favorites are thier chef board for a starter (def to share or as a meal by itself), the bagel dish for breakfast, the coffee always, beautiful cocktails so pick based on your taste. My fave entree is the pork tenderloin....it's been on the menu for a long time and I hope it continues to be. The presentations are beautiful but not intimidating.  Def book a reservation in advance on the weekend as this place is usually packed (went last week and the wait was 3 hours maybe haha). They have service for lunch and a coffee/ lunch area as well as outside seating.

Qjzi9SgT-7M-RrtaG-4RNA.text: We originally came to grab a drink prior to dinner but came back for lunch the next day. It's situated along the waterfront so a good place to sit outside and enjoy the breeze. There's plenty of outdoor seating. Even though it's packed, service was never lacking. The grapefruit mojito was cold and refreshing. I liked how it didn't have so much mint floating in the glass to get caught in the straw.  As for lunch I had the tuna sandwich. It's pretty standard so not much to write about but I'd order it again. Take a walk around the area after you're done. There's a lot to explore.

05shpmzmDpjrcVfNozsm5A.text: It's one of my favorite places if it's for breakfast and if it's from lunch the best drinks and good the energy

NI6_rhiqngrAYhQen9_gtw.text: What a great place! We sat outside on these comfy couches and I couldn't have asked for a more relaxing, yummy dinner.   Was in Scottsdale for work and my coworkers and i decided to stop here after our meetings. I had the mushroom pasta and it. Was. Amazing. The freshest pasta!   Highly recommend.

AzVT2CsNs2EouKxyMDKcZw.text: If you want a delicious, bustling, noisy and fun restaurant, definitely go here! We were visiting Scottsdale and staying near Old Town and because I was in the Southwest,  I had this idea that I wanted a cowboy steak (silly, I know) and spent a lot of time looking for the perfect restaurant. It was also my birthday so I wouldnt have minded a splurge. But I couldn't rationalize $80 for a steak, and I wanted to try somewhere FUN. I am SO GLAD I found this restaurant! We had cocktails, a crostini appetizer, and my steak was divine. Really! I'm a fool for not taking pictures! They offered me a birthday dessert too :) Quick uber back to our hotel. Would go here again and again!

pFIi5h8nWOkNuft-3E1KaA.text: Both the food and the atmosphere were fantastic! It had an upscale ambiance with reasonable prices. The indoor booth seating was cushioned and comfortable, and I enjoyed the views of the trees lit up outside. The bread and pesto was THE BEST I've ever had. My friend and I shared the sweet potato cannelloni and the pest chicken flatbread, and it was more than enough. I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sweet Potato Cannelloni

um7RUgja3I8soSKOh72zUQ.text: You know at first walking into this place you think wow this is going to be exciting. The ambience will definitely give you that shock and awe for a normal Americano/French/Italian vibe very modern I guess. Vaulted ceiling's grand windows to the outdoor patio where you can lounge or sit and eat make sure you make reservations at a time. Their bread is made fresh right before your eyes it with an amazing a Oli dipping sauce with pesto upon request. The service was accommodating and fairly nice. We ordered a bunch of drinks which were absolutely delicious as well as expensive so come here for a good reason maybe not just to grab lunch. I ended up ordering the beat arugula salad thinking it would fill me up for a lunch service. As I do not eat bread, I only ate my beet salad which consisted of one and a half cups full of arugula put on a plate With four small chunks of beads on top of the bed of lettuce a tablespoon of goat cheese some drizzle and that's about it. I was so hungry and embarrassed like am I the only one who is starving after eating my meal LOL. The plate size to give you an idea was 3 inches by about six or 7 inches and it looks like a garnish plate of very small salad maybe like a side salad you could say. I would not suggest this meal for somebody who's actually wanting to eat and get full because it's a side salad. Got out spending $40-$50 and I probably won't be back. But It's a cute spot, the drinks are tasty and the Food is tasty!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

s9cLHHabzZJM5PAIDkA5Og.text: Yes! Lovely venue, attentive staff and great food less the margarita pizza. Please improve the quality of this appetizer. There's nothing "special" that sets your pizza aside from the rest which was a little disappointing to see from such a fine establishment.

Z9GOVf-yNyORAKOaq4SKpA.text: Three stars for service. Thereafter, the food is average at best.  We split a flatbread pizza and garden salad.  There was so much grease it puddled and we literally needed paper towels to sop it up.  Additionally, the garden salad's lettuce was very limp and unappetizing.  Most of the food was still on plates when we exited. With so many epic restaurants in town, I recommend not immediately choosing the most recognized establishments....

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Post massive degreasing with paper towels.

ophSsPB-x10IY5-oUg6MIQ.text: Great place to come have a drink or lunch/dinner!  They have a big outdoor patio along the river w/ heat lamps. Offer a happy hour menu.  Bartenders do a nice job making drinks.  Menu has lots of choices for all types of eaters.  There is a DJ in the evenings..not sure if it's all evenings but for sure Friday and Saturdays.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. G &amp; T
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Martini
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

7tQ-0vPvDSH8PQ3BszTE1w.text: One of the best patios, large and open close to the canal.   The food is good with lots of unique options.   I highly recommend if you want to dine outside and not overly pricy.    Enjoy

5oFSDdPztVdjFszo0lZnDQ.text: My husband and I celebrated our anniversary here last night and had an exceptional experience.  The location is wonderful-quiet and even though it was 105 degrees at 7:30 at night the combination of misters and waterfront location made for a very cool and enjoyable evening on the patio.  Speaking of which, the patio is ridiculously gorgeous.  Seriously, if they are trying for a European feel they nailed it.  Absolutely in love with the patio and the vibe.  The interior is gorgeous as well-just a bit on the loud side.  All depends on what mood you're in.    Our service was outstanding as well-from the time we were greeted, to the drinks at the bar and of course our table service all night was wonderful.  We felt spoiled.  And now on to the food..delicious.  The pesto and bread to start was amazing-some of the best pesto I've had (and it's one of my absolute favorite things).  We also had the fritto misto for an app which was very good.  Main dishes were the bacon wrapped pork and the sweet potato cannelloni-both full of flavor and quality.  We shared the lemon pudding cake for dessert, which was light and refreshing on a hot June night!    All in all, Olive and Ivy exceeded my expectations and we will without a doubt return.  Thank you for making our anniversary special.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bacon Wrapped Pork Tenderloin
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

fiSvYpww_Ruh8uMZZ1cAXA.text: Probably one of my favorite restaurants if not my favorite! I was first introduced to it by a friend that worked at a different restaurant owned by the same chain and have been coming here with my boyfriend ever since! The atmosphere is great, the staff is great and the food is amazing! Everything I've ordered has always been great but my favorite dish would have to be the Salmon, those beets are to die for!!

1ElxChRCbnhWjvBKKFyoRA.text: Great food!! Great atmosphere for an after-work drink with coworkers or friends!

2oDwJJC00AlDBBuXz_40lg.text: We had a pre-Thanksgiving lunch with the family. Loved the new seasonal menu. The Kale Salad was delicious with the addition of Ahi Tuna - perfectly seered! Never disappoints!

D17vdW2V6P6VRkz2fJSTjA.text: What a delightful atmosphere! Unique, flavorful food and dessert options with attentive yet not overbearing service. This was our first time dining with Olive & Ivy. We will certainly return as well as refer it to our friends.

T_-0qrbK5-Vo3wGzftqAHw.text: More corporate giant than quaint gem.  Nice patio.  Good but spendy entrees for the portion size.  Desserts are great value.  Scripted (versus engaged) service.  Visited on 3/09 based on several coworkers' recommendations.  Surprised to see it was in a giant shopping mall.  A quick Google revealed its one of a vast number of concepts in the parent company's portfolio (many of them also in the same mall.). With that as our expectation mindset, we were promptly seated on the patio at our reservation time.  House made foccacia was more like Wonder bread than real bread. Ordered entrees.  Sea bass and duck/goat cheese tortellini.  Very tasty but surprisingly expensive.  (Mall rent?). Wine list expectations were misled by the giant wall of bottles at the entrance.  Turns out most of those are empty and purely a facade.  Did order a couple glasses that were decent.  Waitor was minimally useful with his recommendations.  ("It all depends what you like.  They're all good.")  Ordered two desserts.  Brown butter cake and ice cream bar.  Both were excellent and a good value at $5 each.  Waiter was not familiar with them though and struggled to describe the ice cream bar.  Bottom line.  Fair meal.  Lived up to our "large company mall restaurant" expectations.  Excellent patio.

WIpc9bzOPG_Jw_OA5tWYwg.text: I've been here a couple of times.  The food is delicious and the ambience is great.  I highly recommend it.

KlA2mOxo0nbJUu4c1neUqQ.text: Nice place and very friendly staff. The girl taking my order was really helpful and sweet

XcjZuOefbcTSC_8sD-hLhg.text: This is a gorgeous (albeit large) restaurant with many favorites on the menu. I have dined here twice and both times the food and service were just average. Left me wanting.

wVOX90cb2EpegBNHDfDDxQ.text: The Olive and Ivy... yum!  Just before I came to eat dinner here I happen to be Yelping and Jessica F. quick tipped trying the sangria.  I was late meeting my party of 6 so as I sat down and the waiter took my order I knew I already wanted the sangria - red.  It reminded me of a Framboise I tried at Carly's Bistro, very tasty and fruity, I had two.  The decor was amazing!  The window coverings were plush and the light fixtures were industrial.  There wasn't uniformity to it but it all came together so well.    Upon recommendation from one of the attorneys I was dinning with, I ordered the braised short rib with mascarpone polenta & baby vegetables.  Before the meal arrived the server gave us steak knives but they were useless.  The meat melted like butter and tasted even better.  I had never had polenta before but when I tried it I realized it was basically grits.  I don't particularly care for the texture but I couldn't stop eating them.  And the vegetables were two baby onions and two baby celery, meh, they didn't add anything to the meal.  For dessert I tried the blueberry gelato and it was typical gelato, a great way to end a meal.  Another one of the attorneys had ordered the stuffed ricotta balls and they reminded me of the doughnut holes from Dunkin' Donuts.  All in all, it was a fabulous meal and great company makes the dining experience that much better.  As for the service, I wasn't impressed.  Our server had all of the decorum of someone who worked in fine dining but we rarely saw him.  The dinner lasted two and a half hours and that was mostly because we had to wait so long - wait for drinks, to have our order taken, to get our meal, to order coffee and then dessert, waiting for the check.  Then when we did receive our meals, three people had ordered the same meal but one ordered it with pureed potatoes instead of the polenta.  When the server didn't know which was which he asked them to take a bite and then he switched their plates!  They of course insisted their $26 meals were taken back to the kitchen and corrected.  I wanted to give four stars based on the food but the service lead me to knock off a star.

pfvZy3PVUtIFfpXCNN6Vaw.text: Sooooo good. Beautiful place with lovely outdoor seating on the canal. Close to everything. Great service. Fast service too. Food is awesome. I had a great salad. I highly recommend.

jKrGoCpFeh5G2KzRQCj9Dg.text: We made a reservation on NYE, and we're seated right on time. We are from Chicago and wasn't sure what to expect but we really enjoyed the atmosphere. There was a limited menu for NYE but that didn't matter, started with hummus and bruschetta trio.... AMAZING!!!!!!!! She had chicken scallopini so good, I found my knife and fork drifting over a few times. I ordered the sea scallops which were hands down the best scallops I have ever had and Chicago isn't short on seafood dining. We cannot wait to return to try out their full menu. To add we sat outside on the patio, and again being from Chicago and able to be dining outside on Dec 31 was amazing. Plenty of patio heaters and the patio is so beautiful at night with the water right there. Fire pits I'm sure are not active in summer months but were a very nice touch.

BxBx1qDv_Y1KYwOP1qh0QQ.text: I love love this place. Everything about it is perfect. The food, the service, and the food...again!!! The veil and spinach ravioli was excellent as is the bruschetta

3tgy8pKFG-lFtsdnFxZScA.text: I love the ambiance and atmosphere of this place! The food was excellent. The only slight downfall is the limited menu options. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone and will revisit!

8Da3ytFrgWbKP5UHxRM0Kw.text: Olive and Ivy has the best salad in the Scottsdale Fashion Square area.  The people that work in the Market Place are awesome!  Keep up the great work. :)

fxf_cLVoNUSLtI3aB35cfQ.text: Phenomenal. The food, service, and atmosphere here is amazing. I brought my Mom, Aunt, and Grandma here for lunch and they absolutely loved it. Mark Anthony helped make the experience exceptional through his incredible customer service, attentive nature, and spot on recommendations. I really can't say enough about this place or the server.

XeIGDHez2DZegT6FVYMmNw.text: Mediterranean salad? Yes, yes, yes, and yes. Add shrimp..of course. The little cafe is great and the patio is wonderful during the cooler months

XXqy7XbCyKsG18ZKAFuqPQ.text: Immediately seated. Free flow of fresh bread with an olive dipping to die for. Got the sweet potato cannelloni (as recommended by server). Didn't regret my decision. Others on my table got the lasagna and the flatbread which were both equally tasty. Great ambience too. Should definitely stop by if you're in the area. It's a mix of Mediterranean food with a Californian twist.

auFKe1KwdHXF3NldTPOFpA.text: I've been here on several occasions and I'm always impressed by how attentive the staff is. As busy as they are on the weekends, the staff always made sure that our drinks were being filled while we waited for our food. During my most recent visit, it got really windy outside (we sat out on the patio this particular night), and the staff was nice enough to move 2-3 of the space heaters near to our table so that my guests and I can be warm. In addition, the food is spectacular. Very flavorful and piping hot upon serving. I highly recommend the shrimp risotto and the sea scallops.

FJeGUqqqUdRmi1mAvl5DOw.text: Today was a swing and miss. We were told 20 minute wait for patio. After 45 minutes of waiting we complained. We were met with apathy by the slothful gang of careless hostesses. Sorry would have been a good word, but that wasn't in their vocabulary. We left. It left a very bad taste.

0G7pyqZPYwcZ_up_3roB4g.text: The atmosphere here is fabulous, but the food can be hit or miss! I had my graduation party here and the food was just ok. However, I've eaten here before and the food was very good!

cfBTqAAs4DxiXTass4jBJw.text: Amazing ambience, awesome staff, super yummy pesto, and their tortellini with bacon and braised leek is heaven! Save room for dessert and order the leche cake and the pb pudding

wsjb5MUHrrE16_amJ8YkGQ.text: I love this place. I have only eaten here once but it was very fulfilling of my expectations. The place is very classy and a little bit too fancy for the area but besides that the food was amazing. I thought it was a little weird that they were serving brunch at 2 in the afternoon on a Sunday but it definitely changed my thought on that when my food came. I got the egg sandwich and it was to die for! Perfect size and getting the side of potatoes was definitely a good choice. I definitely would love to go back and try what they have to offer on their lunch menu!

mDHwyQjXpMqt0YW0g6FJFw.text: What a lovely restaurant! Tonight was my second Olive & Ivy happy hour and it did not disappoint! I kid you not I've been dreaming about the strawberry bruschetta for a week! Everything is super fresh and quickly served, and the wait staff are lovely.  Thank you to our waitress who got my to-go order of lamb meatballs expedited since my boyfriend was home sick. He enjoyed them a lot and will be joining us next happy hour for the bruschetta and truffle fries!

3qg3SVLJabyroqY8cDjeFw.text: Olive & Ivy is a great place to unwind and get some great food options with a unique setting close to Old Town Scottsdale.  I love going to their Sunday Brunch (Cinnamon French Toast is unreal) or taking friends that are visiting from out of town!  Love their Bacon Wrapped Dates and Atlantic Salmon to name a few!

h5xaN27TvAsnn7XcgSV9VQ.text: Way overrated from a food prospective but good for MILF hunting if your into that kind of thing. If your looking for a great meal take a pass but if your into people watching this place is a 10!

VN10Sbmo0aIxs1L4zKgGeg.text: My friends and I were visiting for the first time for our annual girls trip.  The ambience and decor was beautiful.  Service was amazing.  Location was very nice.  I had the kale salad (delicious), sea scallops (cooked perfectly), and sangria (yummy).  My one friend had shrimp risotto (she said was ok) and my other friend had tortelli (she said was very good).  The dates wrapped in bacon appetizer was really tasty, but the appetizers on crostini were okay.  They serve dinner with fresh baked bread and a basil spread.  So crazy delicious!  We had chocolate cake with marshmallow topping and graham cracker crumble.  It was about a 7 out of 10 for me.  I would definitely recommend this restaurant to friends.

i8XPaKNMrJ-hBSuLK2wjiw.text: After eating the fabulous sandwich at the airport, my wife and I decided to try the sit down at the Scottsdale Waterfront. Amazing in every respect. Service by Mason was attentive, helpful but not overbearing. Bruschetta had many different flavor options (we tried them all) and the bread was the cosmos tame theme holding the flavor together - outstanding  Mediterranean salad- order it! Tossed lightly and very fresh and flavorful. Salmon was cooked to perfection with delicious roasted potatoes and my wife's veal ravioli was very rich and fresh  Sorbet for dessert was a trio of delight   All in all a vibrant place to dine and enjoy a great dining experience !

6RvBV3QHfV9ILrLr6hxOAA.text: Oh me oh my, but such a welcoming refuge from the three-digit heat of Arizona. Located at the Waterfront in Scottsdale, which is in fact a man-made canal that is surrounded by a plethora of restaurants, condos, business establishments and a huge indoor mall. Olive and Ivy serves food to order/take out at their deli section, or food to dine in their patio outside under umbrellas and h20 forced mist (misters?). Since it was 120 degrees outside, we chose to chill inside the large dining area near the windows - this way, we still got a nice view of the outdoor patio that borders the beautiful tree- covered walkway along the canal.  The restaurant is very "foo-foo" Italian dining in a casual atmosphere. I love ordering the melon salad, which is only served in summer or very hot days - lucky me. The pupu appetizer platter is enough for party of four because of the more than adequate amount of bread served with the other ingredients on the plate (prosciutto, salami, cheese, nuts, dates, etc). A favorite is the tomato/basil soup with complimentary bread and... drumroll... their homemade pesto dipping sauce. Oh drool!  The piece a la resistance was the desert.  Must must must try the oh-my-shshshut-the-door-already peanut butter mousse with smoked sea salt dentelle, topped off with a nutty, crunchy, chocolate shell. Ohhhhhh such delectable joy.  I tell you, I don't know if it was sheer relief from the heat, but boy did I ever have a most orgasmic-ly satisfying meal.  By the way, they also serve and have a good selection of wine/alcohol and beverages at the bar. Our "tame" party settled for raspberry drinks with ice water all around.  Great service; great food; great ambiance. May be a little pricey but worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Refuge from the 3-digit heat at Olive and Ivy, located at the waterfront in Scottsdale.

IHk0Ouq-CWLW3njUodwpPw.text: Great place and friendly service made for a great anniversary dinner. Zach was phenomenal and very professional and the food tasted incredible. I also enjoyed the casual atmosphere as well as how the place was lit. I'm not a fan of bright rooms. Awesome experience overall. Kudos!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Champagne
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lemon pudding cake

F5zZXF3NJwazKGQEEgfQvQ.text: Ok. Let me start by saying that the atmosphere of Olive & Ivy is gorgeous! I will take you through our meal so you know why we didn't love this...let me also disclose that my opinion made even me sad! I started off with a glass of white wine. I got the Chenin Blanc. The wine was delicious BUT it was wayyyy too warm. Having such and extensive wine collection, they should have known to serve more chilled white wine. I could have said something but I didn't, so that is my fault. Every table gets fresh bread and pesto. This was probably the highlight of the meal. It is seriously DELICIOUS! We decided to start with the bacon wrapped dates, recommended by our server. They were...ok. The dates were a bit too smokey and needed more of a salty element. Even with the chorizo and bacon, I found them to be much too sweet. They also had some greenery that was unnecessary. For my meal, I got 3 of the bruschetta. Great concept! You can choose 3 flavors for $12. Sounds amazing right!? BEWARE. The menu discloses GF and Veg. Again, this was MY FAULT but, the menu didn't list all of the ingredients and all of the bruschetta options have cheese on them. I don't eat dairy....so, I basically suffered through my entire meal. The brussels sprout option was 100% the best. The mushroom was pretty good and the prosciutto was less than impressive, unfortunately. My sister got the scallops and said they were pretty good and cooked perfectly! They come with 5 as well as some hearty butternut squash puree. There were chunks of squash that she said were a bit overwhelming and a bit rich. They were missing depth and needed a bit of acidity.   Overall, this wasn't a BAD meal but we were expecting a lot more. I would try it again but I would be much more cautious of what I was ordering and next time I will probably ask for more chilled wine.

d_IO8eutlhXiwCD6mCz_ow.text: My wife and I sat at the counter in front of the open kitchen.  What at incredible experience. The staff was simply poetry I motion. They execute so well and the food was incredible. The scallops and the sweet potato cannelloni were amazing.

lC3xkgt2QcTmTjyEsSs-MQ.text: We have been new residents of Old Town Scottsdale almost a year, and we have had several visitors since coming to this lively and lovely community. We have taken ALL of them to Olive & Ivy.   Their food is first rate, the mood can be restful and peaceful on their beautiful shaded patio overlooking the water, and it can be energizing and electric inside.   Of our several dining outings there so far, all have been highly satisfying.

d7LJ3PP7L-lHe7GBDppkcg.text: Very good food and a beautiful setting. My only complaint is the fact that they seat you as if they are doing you a favor by letting you eat there.

u3JzS64GYBQ9O6WAgAwXlA.text: Absolutely beautiful patio to enjoy and this place really has wonderful food. The service was so poor. Will have to seriously consider going back or not because of how poor the service was.

9K1hDfw0TuHijB3_DJNTPw.text: We came in on a busy Friday night and lucked out with two seats at the bar.   We ordered the white sangria and bacon wrapped dates as happy hour was about to end. The dates were SO good. White sangria was kind of odd... But not bad.  We split a Caesar salad and the bone in rib eye. They were very accommodating about splitting the food and everything was split prior to us receiving it.   The rib eye was cooked a smidge under medium but it was so good, it didn't even matter. The potatoes were very crunchy and yummy too!  Our bartender was a very friendly man as well, and he made the experience even better!  My boyfriend is not much of a foodie, but he absolutely loved this place. So that's saying a lot!

UqBYKEdHn3dnNRTS8uhSRw.text: One of the best Italian restaurants we've been to!  We didn't even bother with the apps because we were told how filling and good the pastas were. We ordered the WILD MUSHROOM PAPPARDELLE and the SWEET POTATO CANNELLONI! Both were AMAZINGGGGG! The sweet potato was our favorite which is strange because I usually find it too sweet and rather enjoy spicy pasta. But wow SO SO good!

QMUmpmINJxZDpeBDLHc6yw.text: Very gorgeous restaurant. The hummus and veggies we ordered before our meal was amazing and so was the bread and pesto provided. You can tell how fresh everything is. I ordered the chopped chicken salad and, while it was delicious, the blue cheese was completely overwhelming. There are so many delicious pieces to the salad that I was looking forward to- the peanut granola being one- and I could not taste any of them but the cheese! I will definitely try them out again though, a drink, appetizer and salad for around $30 was not bad. The coffee bar was amazing too. Got a little latte to go!

mnK_AvB-E5j-ZEvembyziA.text: Great dinner here.  Nice view of waterfront, ask for a window seat.  Did not dine on patio as wind was whipping out there but those that did said the fire pits provided adequate warmth to do so. Food was delicious, tried the bruschetta appetizer and the combination of manchego, quince and spanish chorizo was unique and tasty.  Splitting each a beet and kale salad was a great way to taste two different salads, both excellent and not to be missed. Husband had the steak, bone-in rib-eye (huge portion - enough for lunch next day!) with potatoes and spinach done perfectly.  The sea bass was beautiful presentation and very good, but small serving size.  Server was professional and knowledgeable.

hjuAhkG25MMOK-io-4YCzA.text: I had an awesome time here. This place is rocking after 8:00 p.m. The bar and restaurant was packed and the DJ kept the atmosphere upbeat and festive. The bread and pesto was amazing. I couldn't stop eating it.  I ended up having the ravioli and veal and it was delicious. When the food came my initial thought was that the serving size was a bit small however once I began eating I realized how thick and rich the ravioli was. I ended up being completely full after that entree. I also had the apricot and cheesecake for desert. It was an interesting combination that I've never had before so I wanted to try it. That was just ok in my opinion. I would've enjoyed just plain cheesecake better. All in all, I thoroughly enjoyed my visit here and will definitely return.

pPJGkklko73Pglg-ufcDKA.text: It's always busy here. Been around a while and still does a good job. Food overall is good and the atmosphere is very pleasant. I've frequented everything from the dining to the small grocery style counter and enjoyed most of it. Today was pretty busy so we managed to squeeze a spot on the couch next to the bar. Service was a bit off and negatives included: eggs Benedict was way too soggy, brought our cappuccinos with no sugar or spoon and server vanished after taking the order.  But despite these issues I have to say I would try this place again because the food was previously pretty good. I've never thought anything was excellent or very memorable here but it is convenient and the patio areas are nice.  Still recommended.

kvEZaRArjp_4IiPJsT1xQg.text: This is a great place to go for a special occasion. The food is fantastic and the service has always been amazing. If the weather permits try to get a table outside near the water because it will make the experience just that much more amazing! Make sure to come hungry and order the bruschetta. There are many different types to pick and choose from.

p8hp8dJHS8BxofxH9QpaBA.text: So disappointed, brought out of town guest here on Friday around 4:30.  Had a seat on the patio, waited for about ten minutes for someone to come over and ask if these were our dishes.  Another ten for them to be cleared and the table was never wiped down there was food and sauce and dried beverages on the table  but never cleaned, asked about the happy hour wine "it's not good but that's what you get for the price".  Sangria was terrible.  I understand it is spring break here,however it's no surprise and a restaurant of this caliber should be stepping up their game not saying the wine is bad but that's what you get.  So disappointed and embarrassed that I brought out of town guest to this establishment.

Dg_j3m9ch23MJGw3PxcH5A.text: What an awesome, awesome place.  Went here with my mom for a casual friday lunch and really enjoyed it.  The bread and pesto are amazing.  The reason I am giving 4 stars is because the menu is a little too funky for my taste- I am more a fan of the basics.  The dessert menu is also amazing, and all of the desserts are made in-house that day.  Definitely recommend for a nice lunch or dinner! And make sure to get dessert!

viOhmLhzQTRzhF3FqahWPQ.text: Great food and atmosphere.  Everything from a casual lunch to group parties are always fun at Olive & Ivy.  All around great place. The appetizers and drinks are spot on with plenty of share able dishes. We'll be back to O&I many more times.

pSG5C8-FSJUQdfsofauYwg.text: Wow! One of the best meals we've had ever in our travels! Everyone in our group of 4 LOVED their meal.  We recommend bacon wrapped dates, the Tortellini, chicken scaloppine, bacon wrapped pork tenderloin and the butternut squash cannelloni.  All amazing flavor s and perfectly prepared. Table on patio overlooking waterfront with beautiful outdoor lighting. Impeccable service --- REALLY. Thank you Sarah for making or evening so special. Nice wine list by the glass.

1XpLEbUDBnvVY5dmTGHeEg.text: The Sweet Potato Cannelloni is crazy good! Service was excellent. Their soda machine was down and the server went to their market place and got me a coca cola to make up for it. Really impressed!

6JOfb5D7SezCxP5PvuET-w.text: They have amazing bruschetta!!!! Absolutely love this place, great date night or girls night out! Highly recommend!

U232AByp7UJsfwSrJWAfUw.text: Quality, if overpriced food.  Nice decor.  Good service.

tJV99ftUTEC5p1G9v5oOZg.text: Dinner was delicious!  The appetizers, or small plates, as they are referred to on the menu, offered interesting possibilities.  I recommend the fritto misto - a combo of calamari, rock shrimp and zucchini - fantastic!  The beet salad was also quite delicious.  For my entree, I chose the lobster risotto.  It was tasty, though a tad bit salty.  Admittedly, I have some regrets about having such a rich dinner, but that was my bad, not a reflection on the restaurant lol.     I loved the decor and vibe at Olive & Ivy.  It's a trendy Scottsdale restaurant, for sure, but it didn't have that pretentious air about it.  I found the waiter very attentive and helpful with questions about the menu and area.  I guess I'm a real fan of the Fox concept restaurants.  I've enjoyed all the ones I've visited, thus far.

xLKtLC_ustOE2QGb5c0Z9g.text: Although I haven't been back to O&I, I was contacted by a fox rep and they were very courteous and made things right after my bad experience. I go to Blanco and Culinary Dropout frequently and will probably try North this time around. Thanks FOX!

oG6vBHTktxlXvm8Kz3RSFA.text: I go there for the Sangria alone! It's amazing! There food is good, but they took away my favorite flatbread! Great ambiance. Perfect place for a meet up with the girls.

jk6HffEpXrEIT6gsB4WCmw.text: Sometimes very busy, but you can get a seat at the bar instead of waiting for a table.  Their Gyros is the best in Phoenix.

L0AI64o1QgmvvNAwvN4b2A.text: This restaurant has real quality food. The food tastes great and the ambience is nice. The only thing that I wish they could change is to have their waiter come by our table less. The waitress literally came by our table asking:  "Is everything all right?" at least 8 times. Just a tad bit less would be fine.

eWPW1OKvHzuOt51CaL0dtw.text: I've been to Olive & Ivy three times and each experience has been flawless. The food is EXCELLENT, the service is good and the ambience and setting are some of the best in Scottsdale. The outdoor patio overlooking the canal is lovely even on hot summer nights and the inside dining room is classy and full of understated character.   The restaurant does fill up on weekends, so be sure to make a reservation.

AeFs8fojgpWMMea6VTKL9Q.text: Processed Cheese?!?  I went to Olive and Ivy with some friends for a birthday brunch - the waiter made it a point to say everything is made from scratch, homemade, the bakers got up at 4am to bake, etc.  Super - sounds great.  I ordered the Ivy Sausage sandwich, which is egg, sausage and cheese on a homemade english muffin.  One bite and I get that odd, familiar flavor of my childhood and realize they had put two slices of Kraft American Processed cheese slices on the sandwich.  What?? Are you telling me that Sam Fox can't have a hunk of cheddar cheese in the back for this?  It ruined an already mediocre sandwich that tasted like it came from a Jimmy Dean freezer box.  I scraped the cheese off the other half and tried to move on, but I'm still angry.  The two stars are for the good cup of cappuccino and the free dessert the waiter brought my friend, which was amazing.  Oh, and for using Open Table so we could make reservations and not have to wait.  None of my friends were terribly impressed with their meal either.

7dLwfeLbMJzlU3KrNMt0-w.text: Ate dinner here on Friday for the first time. Place was rocking with loud music and good looking people. The service I had was phenomenal..probably one of the best servers Ive ever had. I wish I knew his name but knew we wanted to take out time sharing dishes. He was on point recommending small plates and entrees. The bacon wrapped dates were delicious.

rXAm8HZHNAlbHDpKWVfgVA.text: Amazing place. Great atmosphere and service.  The bacon wrapped dates were fabulous.  Highly recommend this place!!

gWMEM2XnuTtdYrNZcANjYA.text: The food was decent, drinks were good. Minus one star for the bartender that tried to over charge us for our drinks thinking we would be too buzzed to notice. Their cafe side has good mocha's.

_z76uwbgZ29PUVyclcC6VQ.text: Great Atmosphere!! We always go sit on the patio for drinks. Very nice :) I think the food here is good, but it's overpriced, in my opinion (which of course this review is ;) ). We come here often just for the atmosphere and sangria. Pitcher of sangria is $20, which I think is a good deal here.

qrIwSs_snrU4NbtKea2lJg.text: My mother and I ate there last week, and everything was fantastic!  The homemade pasta dishes were incredible, and we also loved our bacon wrapped dates and the bread and pesto.  To top it off, our server was very friendly and made a lot of good recommendations.  Finally, the patio is nice and has a good view of the canal.  I can't wait to go back!

qib2_kIJHzRLiueplzROgQ.text: Been here twice and the food is pretty consistent. Service is a little up and down, depending on how "busy" it is ... seems to be the less busy, the less attention you get. Otherwise, the menu is varied and there is a good selection of drinks. Apps and salads are strong -- portions are a reasonable size -- and you can even get half salads. Desserts are good!

2ci2SsO4R9Exci3xaIVQNQ.text: This place gets customer service! The little details make all the difference and they notice details.  The ambiance is energetic and rejuvenating and the concept is unique.  Love their food as well!

XrOa02FJTRYqE8_kANcvcQ.text: This was my first visit to Olive & Ivy and I would definitely go back!  Great place to sit and relax in the middle of a nice day and have lunch with a friend.  My food was great, but I have to say the service was Excellent. Our server was Kim - she provided some of the best service I've had in awhile! If you go in, hope you get her!

4Fvb79YBjGESMR7MdjQClw.text: Always great service with smile, and great food.  This is much better service than Fox's "Training Restaurant" called the Henry.  Very satisfied every time we dine here.  The Hostess, and front desk area people were so nice, and with smiles, smiles, and more smiles....the way i't supposed to be at Fox concept eateries.  We were very dissatisfied with the Henry, and will probably not go there again.  Olive and Ivy is a model of great service, and food.

1VwVKC2t7egFEz8OHAUPLA.text: One of my favorite places in Scottsdale!  Amazing ambience!  Superb service!  The food was delish! Breathtaking decor with huge airwalls that are open to a beautiful patio.  The pesto with bread is ridiculous good!  They also have a cute little cafe side with smoothies and breakfast stuff!

bXa2LpUHIl1FHukDeYRhUA.text: Went here for a company holiday dinner. Between the aweful service (45 minutes for a refill) the loud, obnoxious music, the dark atmosphere and the food that sounded amazing and was absolutely revolting (I personally took about four bites of one slice of 'pizza' and could not even tolerate to eat it. This is coming from someone who could eat a slice of dominos if needed. Thats how very bad it was.) The dessert we got, I believe peanut butter gelato was horrific. This place is for wanna be hip people. Its actually kind of sad.

rQUzLmqnlC2u3wrdkzt0cg.text: I've been to nearly all the Fox Restaurants, and this one is my fav.

f9db5e-wK80TKZC3fCBBow.text: Olive and Ivy is a great restaurant with reasonable happy hour and great outdoor patio. We've been there a number of times and continue to go back. The service has always been prompt and friendly. Their pasta dishes are superior!

1J9PRg7X8xT5UeWQSj9FKA.text: We went when it first opened up a few years back, then again in November 2010.....definite change in atmosphere.  Although the food was very good, the service was mediocre at best, the server really had a "no care" attitude.  We had to ask for place settings, then our food came out before our appetizers which was very disappointing.  This could be a sign of the times and the business may be circling the drain.  Worth a try though, the food is very good.

b0GcI6hkAXSeKwNfSqigbA.text: Sam Fox hits the mark again! I had dinner with some friends and we were all impressed. Presentation was well executed and flavor was just as excellent. I had the Parmesan risotto as my entree. I liked the roasted cloves of garlic that gave bursts of flavor. The shrimp was cooked just right, not rubbery. Drinks were not watered down, and were very well priced for dining in and around Old Town and the Waterfront. The atmosphere/decor is spot on as well and the staff was very attentive. Can't wait to go back!

3jvINiV4qhM_hJOUZGdcng.text: We were seated over a half an hour after our resevation to start. The apps were great dates in bacon were amazing as was the flatbread. The entered however were not as good. My fish was so salty I felt my blood pressure spike! Even the salad that came on the side was too salty to eat. I have never spoken up about something like that before but it was do bad I had to. They seemed concerned asked if I wanted to order something else but I was done at that point. I was stunned that they didn't comp something on our bill they still charged us- not even a wine comp. I wasn't going to force the issue but won't go back.

x5mmvBCyqQItisoD2AxhQA.text: This resto has "meal of your life" potential! To start, the bread and pesto is to die for. I ordered the half caesar salad, and my loving girlfriend had the half beet salad. Both were nice presentations and incredibly tasty. For main I had the goat cheese tortelli. Will not lie, one of the best meals ever. The duck confit was cooked to perfection. Very tasty and well worth the price. GF had lasagna, and it was just as good as the tortelli. Highly recommend this place...will return!

PcUmZ_4ycc6eEuDtd69BLA.text: This restaurant was not a disappointment. We had an awesome waiter who was very attentive and the food we had was awesome! Make sure to start with the artichoke salad. Soooooo good!

GwHlkzNLjBXAoEjFnuV9dw.text: Where do I start? Our waiter's name was Timothy. Had to of been one of the best, most professional waiters I have ever seen. Great guy, very knowledgable and helps you chose, without any negative opinion. I highly recommend when you go here, you specifically ask to have this guy wait on you. Next, the atmosphere. What a great place! Very romantic. As my wife(laura) stated below, we fell back in love and just focused on ourselves and not anything else around us. Glad I made reservations, because it seemed dead when we first got there (6pm) and filled up shortly after we sat down. The wife and I both commented on how cool the bathrooms were. You don't see that every day,lol. Every time we left our table, any worker walking by, would re-fold our napkin. That was really nice, and we loved it. Onto the food. We ordered the Bruschetta Trio as the appetizer. WOW, what a great start out. Very good. We really got full off this so we ordered a salad and Chicken Scallopini. They split both for us, which was very nice of them. Salad was very fresh and good. I highly recommend the chicken meal we had. Very very good and seats well with your stomach and a glass of wine. We ordered a bottle of Ramon_B wich was $40. It was a limited bottle, but worth every penny for the meal and atmosphere. Then we ordered the peanut butter Ice-cream bar for dessert. The marshmellow did not taste good. Seemed still frozen, but was still too much and just didn't go with the whole dessert. We told Tim about it and he said he would pass it on. The best bonus of this was when we came in, we told Tim we were Yelpers and were looking up what to get. Tim remembered this, told the manager, and gave us our Dessert for FREE, without even mentioning it to us. Guys, if you want to wooo your wife, and have one of the best romantic nights, even for just visiting one night, this is the place!! Great job Tim and Olive & Ivy!!

A4LGIpqWQy9FeAVXmaWHqw.text: What a cool place. You can either sit and be served in the dining area, or order sandwiches and salads to go, or eat those outside on the front patio. Did a lunch group here for a buddy's birthday, and we enjoyed ourselves.  I ordered the mediterranean salad w/ chicken, and it was great! Delicious, very healthy (not the typical overloaded salad you buy at chain restaurants), good size, and I wasn't under the spell of a carb coma the rest of the afternoon!

hvG4C9yCrlA4ct3jtpI39A.text: I've been to Olive and Ivy a few times now and I've enjoyed the food, service and ambiance each time. I'm a big fan of the beef filet. This place has a great patio and the inside decor is modern and fun.

QIDmLplQO4BE5BMPH5fXaQ.text: The restaurant atmosphere was great, the ambiance was beautiful its right by the  canal and there is outdoor seating as well. The food was brought out to us very promptly and the presentation of the food was great, the thing that impressed me the most was that my boyfriend had ordered the sea scallops and i had ordered the awesome lasagna we had asked to "split the orders so that we could share" they beautifully arranged the two dishes on a rectangular plate and a bowl so it looked as though the two dishes were suppose to be together and they split the orders and put it on one plate, I have never seen this done before in any restaurant.The waiter was very attentive and very nice. The other item you need to ask for is the pesto and bread,that is a must, so delish! I even looked up for any other FOX restaurants that might be in California which I plan on visiting since I had such a great experience at this restaurant. the next time I come to Scottsdale I surely stop by here again!. Thanks Olive and Ivy for a memorable eating experience!

u_uSckfHggCa9L7v49nGGQ.text: Wonderful place! Great atmosphere and decor. Adorable outside seating. Fabulous private room! We went here for brunch for a bachelorette party and had amazing service. All the food was delicious and of great, fresh, quality. Highly recommended!

__SOu3jL3QjQRtLd4OPkdQ.text: This is a 3 1/2 rating really.  I have been here a number of time for drinks and dinner.  It's a fun place, busy on weekends, and good people watching.  The beet salad and filet medium were what I order this last time around.  Both tasty and above average.  The others ordered the steak and bruschetta I believe.  Everyone seemed happy with what they ordered.  Not the best meal of all time but good food, nice decor, healthy ambiance, and decent service.  The patio is nice any time of the year.  Although funny, because they consider the water behind it to be water front as though it's a river.  I don't think so.  I looks like all of the typical SRP water tributaries in the area.  It doesn't hurt certainly but water front - NOT.  Anyways, go there for a late happy hour and you won't be disappointed.

869z-HC3VxAlOX4mWk27aw.text: I would come back here. Great food, cocktail, and beer menu. A bit pricey but the food was worth it. Excellent service and ambiance.

GZNclAynNeOy0MtW1Dlxyg.text: We sat on the patio with our family.  It was a wonderful time. The patio seating is so comfortable with big plush cushions.  The sound of the fountain and the glow of the lights made it such a peaceful time (except when our 3 year old fell in the fountain). The food was great, especially the two kinds of bruschettas.  Our server was sweet and helpful.  Highly recommend.

then2JSkCXzk-nwAIntivg.text: I loved this restaurant, although it may be a chain (not sure). The food was terrific, as was the service and ambiance. We took our waiters suggestions on splitting a few salads (that we couldn't choose from) and a beef short rib flat bread. Everything was delicious. The manager was very visible and he took the time to explain their olive oil and Parmesan Reggiano  qualities. It happened to be a beautiful day and the outdoor seating was perfect. We watched a lot of dishes come out of the (open) kitchen and everything looked wonderful. I believe they really use fresh ingredients, cooked to order and beautifully presented. When visiting Scottsdale, or any of their other cities, I will absolutely return to Olive & Ivy.

GlXZEBhGXC7yw2sYhVDCnw.text: We went here for Mother's Day.  We ordered the wild mushroom, shrimp and corn soup, which was so good even my seven year old ate it.  I also had the Crab Eggs Benedict which was so-so.  The best eggs benedict are still at Crackers and Co. in Mesa.  There was no kids menu, so we just had them make fettucini with butter for the kids.  My four year old really enjoyed the focaccia with pesto.  Overall, I'd say the food was decent, but I won't be rushing back.

4zaD1ji5IWNqEGOPBqStSA.text: Can't go wrong here. Great place to eat. Vibrant Bar Scene, Fit for Foodies, Great for Outdoor Dining, Late-Night Find, Neighborhood Gem, Notable Wine List, Romantic, Special Occasion, Scenic View, Great for Lunch, Hot Spot

t4O_mwwTLckvr4Cs95h4fQ.text: I've eaten lunch at Olive & Ivy on a number of occasions, including this week.  The great service we received deserves a review.  I have always enjoyed the atmosphere at this restaurant for a business lunch - relaxed, not stuffy, not too noisy (but not too quiet), attentive staff and pretty good and affordable food.  This is why I choose it relatively frequently.  When we sat down this time our waitress had difficulty answering a question.  Immediately her colleague, who was within earshot, came over, as she was explaining that she was new on the job.  He answered the question and also assisted her throughout the meal with several other questions about what was in the food (important due to allergy issues).  As my colleague was enjoying his sandwich, he observed that there was not very much filling, although what was there tasted great.  When they came by to ask how things were, he shared that comment, to which the response was "we'd be happy to provide more if you would like" - very good response.  Later, when the bill came, we were told that our dessert was on the house for sharing our comments.  Totally unexpected.  An example of a great service attitude that more restaurants would be well to copy.

K7UFKbv8vRMGabqz2h2pUA.text: This is one of my favorite new spots in scottsdale!   First I must say, the host at the door was very pleasant and made me feel very welcome upon arrival. Olive, if you read these reviews take good care of Maddie, she's wonderful!   The service was great and the food was even better. Definitely will be a returning customer!

opKWqbMyCshIT4D6Nh7Oyg.text: I went to Olive & Ivy for the first time Wednesday 5/22 for lunch. My mother and I were out running errands and she suggested that we stop and eat at Olive & Ivy.  Since this is a Fox restaurant and the prices are toward the higher end of the spectrum, I was expecting an enjoyable experience and some great food. Unfortunately, I was hugely disappointed.  First, we were seated in the east section of the outside patio. There were probably 3-4 other tables that were occupied in that section when we arrived. We waited for approximately 10 minutes before the waiter decided to come over and ask us if we wanted something to drink. We should have realized that this was time to go, but since we were there...we decided to have some lunch. We started with Sour Cherry Palomas which were very very sour and I would suggest that they remove from the menu.   Our stellar waiter continued his amazing service by not bringing us bread until my mother asked, and he forgot to bring us water after we asked 2 times. I also had to ask twice for some sweetener. Once again, maybe we should have pulled the rip cord at this point and ditched out....whoops!  We ordered Frito misto, which was a highlight of the lunch for me. The breading was nice and the dipping sauce was tasty. Another chance for our waiter to screw up. In his 4 subsequent trips to the table, he neglected to clear away the empty appetizer plates. Our water glasses also both ran dry while we ate the appetizer and were not refilled until we explicitly asked.  I asked for a suggestion between the turkey grinder, lamb gyro and chicken panini sandwiches. Our waiter raved about the gyro, so I went with that suggestion. Once again, bad call on my part. Approximately 20 minutes later my gyro and my mother's salad arrived. I ordered a side salad with gorgonzola vinaigrette. My salad had no dressing, and when I tried to catch my waiter's attention, he did not acknowledge me. The gyro included lamb patties which I would say were probably the worst tasting meat I've ever tasted. This was not a good gyro. It tasted more like lamb meat loaf.  We waded through our entrees and finished our drinks. Our waiter never returned to ask how things tasted and he didn't seem to care when I told him my salad had no dressing. We asked for our check, and it was another 7-10 minutes before he was back.   All I can say is Olive & Ivy is a one hit wonder for me. There are lots of other restaurants in the neighborhood that have much better food and service. I'd recommend Bungalow or R&R or just about any restaurant other than Olive & Ivy.

bTRNbHlLH2M7zvpBs7u3-A.text: I am between a 3 and 4 on this place.  I love the location and sitting on the patio was beautiful.  A friend and I settled for a leisurely evening of catching up, having some appetizers and drinks.  The service was good and it was bad.  They were attentive but maybe too attentive.  It is bothersome to me when they take away a plate when there is still food on it (and don't ask) and take away your drink when it is almost still half full.  Those are just silly mistakes.  Otherwise, the hummus, bacon wrapped dates. lamb meatballs and gnoochi were all worth the calories. Dessert not so much (I think it was the ice cream bar).  I think it is definitely a great place to spend some time and hang out.

CtK8WioeWRZZBhqnOaQ56g.text: Quite possibly the best restaurant I've ever been to. Fabulous food, amazing service and great ambiance. I can't stop thinking about the hummus and bacon wrapped dates. I'm going back for sure!

0nhtYNFKcab940UhVLRwDA.text: I have dined here many times, and would highly recommend it.  The prices are great, the staff is friendly, and the food is amazing; I have never been served a meal that I didn't enjoy!  Overall great food, staff, prices, location, and atmosphere, please try it and you will be a regular like me in no time!

3Joumn6k0wXwvsLZ8jnnhg.text: Another excellent fox restaurant. I have been here twice and both meals have been great. The salads and flatbreads are delicious, fresh, and filling. There are tons of vegetarian options. The servers are friendly and knowledgeable.(Christian was AWESOME) and the patio is beautiful, not many restaurants in AZ really create a special atmosphere, so bonus points for that.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Margherita flatbread.

TGoi8uCfM-kcW5lcH0vCEg.text: We went to dinner here the other night and we were starving. We ordered our food right away and apps...the apps came out quickly but the entree took over 45 minutes to come out. The manager came out to talk with us and personally delivered the items when they were ready. She took care of our entrees which was a very nice gesture. The food was good...but my salmon was over cooked, I ordered it medium rare and it came out medium well. Overall the environment was amazing, we sat out on the patio at the couches as they were on a wait. We will be back....just maybe not when we are starved lol.

NAvkOpCefzQ11hGgwejNZA.text: Great place to go during work hours and also during the evening time. Great music and atmosphere.

cQI49XM8G9biG61FfnzhrQ.text: Came here for dinner with a group of girlfriends on a Friday a couple weekends ago.  We sat on the patio and had a sweet waitress.  The sangria was amazing, food was fantastic, and overall our experience was great!

Kv3GsqGeq8uZFb4JstTJog.text: I absolutely love this restaurant. The service is always top notch, the food is excellent and the ambiance on the outdoor patio is perfect. It's a True FOX example of excellence in dining.

OKnJTuycDtqh_gmQ7_RJcw.text: Pretty fricken good experience bud. Had a good time with my bud dirty corey. Drink sangria and stuff had some sick pesto doeeeee. Let's give the overall experience  a Howzitttt. Good but not great. Howzitttt. really had a great time but it's tough to give anything 4 stars if you know what I mean hyddddddd

b6DLkOQOvL3_xcIWk7XpCg.text: I am so sad that I have to give this restaurant a bad rating. I took my mom here to have a fabulous Mother's day dinner and to have a delightful finale to our mother-daughter trip. The food and the service were fabulous. We started with three different bruschetta (you can mix). They were all amazing. We then had the house salad which had a wonderful light dressing, all very fresh. We split the salad and the portions were still huge! For dinner I had the sweet potato cannelloni and my mom had fish (I can't remember which one and I can't view the menu).   Why the bad review you might ask? My mom woke up at 6am with HORRIFIC FOOD POISONING. I felt so awful, we even had to fly out that day. She was miserable. Some might say that food poisoning can happen even when cooking in your own home and that its not their fault but I find it inexcusable. Keeping ingredients fresh, the kitchen clean and correct cooking temps should avoid all food poisoning. We ate and shared the same dishes all day for breakfast and lunch so I know that it was from Olive and Ivy. Could have been the fish or the lettuce. We were skeptical about getting fish in Arizona in the first place but my mom decided to go for it....bad choice :(

OkQnWFvE-54n6SiIC3tzFA.text: Dined here at 3pm and it was fairly busy, but we got seated immediately. We asked if we could have the dinner menu in the happy hour area and were told that the lounge was strictly HH which was odd. So we sat at a table in the patio with dinner menus. The menu was pretty good however they are only limited to half the dinner menu at 3 which didn't make sense to give a full dinner menu , but we did with it.  We order a bruschetta with too much cheese and no spicy chorizo, the lamb meat balls which I enjoyed and the short rib flatbread which I loved! The service was ok. We ordered wines and our server spilt over an ounce on the table and cleaned off the menus but not the table which really made it uncomfortable to eat knowing I had puddles around me , also I didn't get that lost wine back. Bottom line, food is good, ambiance is great, and service was ok. Will potentially return , but definitely no rush

iDm1s-ox5476FPs57SrIjg.text: Went here for a moms night out and loved it!! We showed up early for our reservation and they got us right in. The ambiance was great and the food was amazing. The waiter was very attentive. Will definitely go back!

AYHc6dvR-ResPC1-L5hARw.text: This place was great! Some friends took us out to eat there & the food was amazing. Brandon & woman behind the bar did an amazing job & they took great care of us!

Zm0w_A12V_NpsikEJ-7j0Q.text: Awesome place even for vegetarians! I m a vegetarian who takes no egg, no meat, no fish. And this place served awesome pesto and bread :) we ordered flat bread - veg, bruschetta - veg. It was all great!! The waitress here are good too, she helped us make our choices.  Fine dine, with great ambience.  A must try place :)

G867jazj7D9lLsd4GuQgXw.text: Make a reservation!  We knew this place was good, because as we darted over to the only available lounge table, we saw Charles Barkley walk out!  I tried to be cool about it, but failed.  I also failed being cool about the complimentary fresh focaccia bread and pesto they bring out, because the waitress brought us another round.  I ordered the gnocchi with duck confit, and it was absolutely stunning.  I tried telling my husband it was terrible, but my face betrayed me...he ate half.  Which was OK, because I got to eat half of his dish, which I remember as some sort of seafood with risotto, and the best-tasting cherry tomatoes I have had, outside of my grandmother's back yard.  Then, we ordered three scoops of very good gelato from their counter (for only $5!).  Oreo cheesecake gelato?  Yes.  Excellent food, top to bottom, and not as expensive as it could be.  Please go, but again, make a reservation.

u3oxcujD9pXC6LbJonODNA.text: 12/2/10  2.5 stars.  Took my young cousin w/ me for happy hour and sat at the bar; This was her first time at O&I.  While I really like the look and the feel of the island layout of O&I's bar, I always feel like a fish out of water when I sit there.  (I've actually tried sitting there a few times when I've walked in solo, but always ended up moving to a table.  If it weren't for my cousin at my side, I probably would've moved to a table again, or, worse yet, walked out of the resto, which I've done before, too.)  Despite a few attempts at getting her to try a cocktail, she declined, and thus I proceeded to just order a glass of wine.  Why it's so hard to get a sampling of a couple of wines before settling on one to order here, I'll never know.  (Just a few nights ago, while at Beckett's Table, my server offered to have me try sips of the two wines I was having trouble choosing!)  Tsk, tsk, tsk!  We decided to try the Italian Sausage flatbread and the hummus app.  The flatbread, w/ its tasty and spicy Italian sausage chunks, consisted of a crispy crust w/ vibrant red piquillo peppers and creamy goat cheese-- I'd order this again, even though peppers and I don't exactly get along.  The hummus was equally delightful, w/ house-made pita bread and a "petite Greek salad," which actually consisted of only sliced red grape tomatoes and chopped cucumbers (a no-no for me!) and a ton of feta on top.  Why the salad was piled ON TOP of the hummus, and not on the side, I don't know.  I suppose for the price of the app, I shouldn't expect more veggies used (a bit of lettuce, perhaps?), but it would've been nice to be able to pick the cukes out.  Served as it was, on top of the hummus, which looked like it was baked for a few minutes before getting the salad treatment, spooning the cukes off would've entailed major loss of delicious baked hummus goodness.  And we wouldn't have any of that!  I really wished we could've stayed past 6p to check out the celebrity guest bartender, but we had other appointments to keep.  My cousin really enjoyed the food and the atmosphere here, and I'd have given this review another 4 stars if it weren't for the fact that our bartender gave us such an attitude when I asked to sample the two wines first before ordering.    FYI, the happy hour menu changed, drastically reduced to only maybe 8 items or less, down from practically all of the apps and half of the flatbreads and a couple of salads that the old HH menu contained.  Recalling this, plus the wine and salad/hummus incidents, I may just have to say goodbye to O&I for a long, long time...

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

zMo-M3_7Am6T5OR0HJ5tcQ.text: Went here with some out-of-town friends on Sat night.  Their pick - so glad they made this choice.    Excellent service with a top notch, well informed waiter.  Between 4 of us, we ordered a variety of items including the hummus appetizer (just spicy enough), sweet potato cannelloni, veal & spinach ravioli, some new tortellini dish and a rib eye steak dinner.  I tried bites of everything and all I can say is WOW!  It was all I could do the stop myself from jumping into the dish and rolling around in the sauce.  Very fresh and sauces were light, not the heavy pasta thing you might expect.    The only minor criticism is the house salad.  People, it's just a bowl of lettuce - NO enhancements, not even a lone crouton.  The vinaigrette dressing helped make up for the lack in the bowl but I think they really need to consider perking up the lonely lettuce.  It's kind of a loud atmosphere indoors.  We were seated in a cozy booth that faced the patio so some of the noise was blocked.  They had some kind of dj-something playing music and a few people dancing (??) behind us.  Still it was quiet enough for conversation at our booth.  The patio looked very inviting, that could be a good location for next time (yes, there will be a next time).  I highly recommend reservations here.  Fortunately we did have them and were seated right away.  Just in front of us were 4 people who were walk-ins and were apparently told it was a 3 hour wait??  Needless to say, they were walk outs after that news.    Anyway, I'm a new fan here.  Looking forward to more culinary experiences with Olive & Ivy.

rHquQcanHHCJJVj8XkPI-Q.text: Delicious fresh food. I always appreciate freshly made items that are healthy and this place has a lot. Nice patio, staff is friendly. I'm giving it 4/5 stars due to the atmosphere at night. I have been here during the day and it is pleasant. At night the place turns into what I like to call "The Scottsdale wannabe rich dude hang out," full of over plastic surgery individuals.. Not my cup of tea.

FTtrC-jXHcVGSA8uTcK6mw.text: First time visiting. They serve practically no food till 5pm which was not mentioned anywhere online or when we called. Heard good things about this place and really disappointed about the service and lack of communication. Will not return.

-LZzulfHR2890arS3lFilQ.text: Three stars for location, food and interior design, one star for each area. Where they need to get there act together is in the bar area and front patio. All your bartenders want to do is pick up the ladies. My wife and her friends from across the street will not go anymore due to this. I thought was BS but when I last stopped by I couldn't get a drink due to this mind set from the bartenders. The last area of critical improvement needed is all limo guys who hang out on your front patio down at the end, smoking and using the area like a Walmart break room. The best of all is the no dogs rule on the front patio.....really! Back of house good.....front of house needs major improvement.

bU17nCpDb_P86n9nr_NtZQ.text: Another Fox Concept success. It was pretty busy and we didn't want to die on the patio or wait 45 min so we sat in the lounge and it was perfect. Our server was Sabrina who is seriously the prettiest thing ever. We got Frito Misto app (fried calamari, shrimp and zucchini. The portion was small and we only had like three zucc. My boyfriend got the scallops which he devoured. There were five huge scallops along with corn and asparagus. I got the chicken chopped salad which was also so good. The granola is an interesting touch but was pretty tasty (was hard to imagine granola in a salad when I ordered). It was rather inexpensive ($14) and was seriously huge (so much chicken, avocado, and goat cheese) I could only eat a thirdish of it. Can't wait to come back and get it again, I know I'll be craving it!

rFLgiZOi7mPPlSlIfHRKFg.text: Ambiance was great and the food was delish!  We would go back for the bread service alone!

RckrInfKs35k8s_CshLcyg.text: I love the patio area of this restaurant and really like their Happy Hour menu.  Like many Scottsdale restaurants, I'm more of a fan of the Happy Hour food than the dinner menu which doesn't have much that appeals to me.  This place is especially nice if you have out of town guests. The location makes it very memorable.

a9jiMbjJVQhTTqrkV-LdFQ.text: One of my favorite spots in Scottsdale for dinner or just drinks. Amazing atmosphere, music, food on point and staff! Love it!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

FKjN0XWR_IOUdIoFowdXOw.text: Seriously, one of my favorite places! Good energy. Good vibe and great service. Love their menu too! Patio is amazing when weather is good!

cigFPOUGag0duLX1QpL8bg.text: After strolling along the Canal Convergence Light Exhibit, we were ready for our 8:15 dinner reservation a little early but they graciously were able to sit us at 8pm.   The bustling bar with the staggered Edison style glass lighting hanging from the chic adorned ceilings and a DJ to my right reminded me of being in Vegas. I nudged my hubby with surprise, "Wow! The music sounds just like the playlist I listen to when running!" It was pop hits remixed with house and dance music. So lively and energetic. Ladies were dressed to the nines in high heels and beautiful dresses. Couples snuggled in close at booths and at the bar. The older crowd appeared to coincidentally find themselves enjoying the inviting patio where the music was still present but not as loud.  Our table was nestled between the patio and the main room. It felt like the best of both worlds because we were so close to the patio with the open glass doors yet behind another glass wall away from the "bustling" main area.   Although my hubs did not want to go exactly with what the waiter recommended, we ordered the exact bruschettas that he talked about, because hey, apparently we all share the same taste in food!! Prosciutto and fig. Manchego and Spanish Chorizo. Butternut squash, goat cheese, and pistachio.   Bry ordered the bouillabaisse. The broth was amazing. What can I say? I managed to taste a clam with some broth but he basically devoured the rest of the seafood mix before my very eyes.  The Prosciutto and Marscapone Tortelli was what my eyes fancied since I first looked at the menu online for some reason. After tasting it, my taste buds were so happy. It could be because I'm partial prosciutto but when matched with Marscapone. That's just ridiculous. Butternut squash and pearl onions added varying textures and complemented the tortelli.   We didn't need dessert, but we ordered it. Bry enjoyed the thin mint gelato which of course was inspired by the season of Girl Scout Cookies. Awesome gelato. My sweet Apple dessert had super red apples glazed in sweet thick syrup, so evil, it was. I was a moo and slowly battled eating those apples, spongy type cake and vanilla bean gelato.   Don't worry. I was able to wash it all down with a pitcher of red sangria.   Our waiter was super attentive, friendly, and informative. The food was great. Another Sam Fox restaurant has won me over. Darn it!

CHPmojC3zBNHo3QoE6BOJg.text: Disappointed that one of our favorite spots has slipped.  Service horrible.  Stale bread, overall quality of food did not meet expectations.  Menu needs an overhaul.

GxQrzUmSbsLo2eDKaHUKRQ.text: Called today to make a reservation and was greeted in the most unfriendly and unwelcoming way that I chose to pass. Should the reservation team be as exceptional as the food, as they are the first introduction to Olive & Ivy? Maybe not. Apparently I am not the only one that has had this experience.

VVXRe09C4vY5GERK5AoYWA.text: Ravioli with spinach is delish! Caesar salad is almost as good as mine, but not really. Yum bread with pesto. Oh, did I say bread??? Sure did

rUxHC0esZSR8ui7hITrTaA.text: I love Olive and ivy marketplace. Great place to hang outside and have a coffee during the day or hang out at night and have gelato. The breakfast at the marketplace is very good. I usually build my own omelette.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

kxJWOp6WN0P2lmDhLFnYVw.text: This is my favorite place to eat in Scottsdale!! I love everything about it- the food, drinks, patio, service, and ambience. All of it is amazing!! I've only been here for brunch but I can't wait to go back for dinner! The mimosas are six dollars and are awesome pours for the price. I've had the cheddar biscuits and the breakfast burrito-I recommend both of them!!   Definitely make a reservation on open table for quick seating!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cheddar biscuits, gravy, eggs and house potatoes! So delicious!

hqltQ0PVua5ORPFDpS0unQ.text: Great atmosphere, service and food. Asparagus bruschetta and the bacon wrapped dates are delish!

0RrF1gBOfOyMk1qRC6vvSg.text: Food is always freshly prepared and tastes good. Although gyro is not the best there are other Mediterranean foods, sandwiches,salad choices,baked goods. Location is great too. The restaurant faces the canal and has a nice Waterfront patio. There are many activities, events around the canal in Scottsdale. It is worth to try this place.

oYzl_FWhNjJ2gfZquoUStw.text: Great place to check out when in downtown Scottsdale. It can get loud at peak hours - so if your down for soft conversation forget it ...go off peak hours . I've been here several times and have never been disappointed. I've ordered the bruschetta (you can't go wrong with any of them) , the hummus ( all good) and the meat and cheese board . Drinks were great with a few unique twists .   This time we had artichoke hearts( delicious ) . The dressing made the dish . We had a Margherita flatbread that was great - the ends had some crust , like a pizza . The sea bass had a cauliflower puree that was caramelized and some grapefruit that was preserved, wow !  If your a fan of mushrooms you'll love the wild mushroom pappardelle . Pasta dish - cleaned the plate .   The sangria was also great - chose the white over the red , tasted a little sweeter with the berry taste - both were very good though .   It's a no brainer - we'll go back time and time again . Any of the Fox Concepts restaurants give an all class experience.

_WSCjDaozuIqyftaSDuOzA.text: It's been two years since my last visit and now I've finally had dinner here. The outdoor seating is lovely especially on a fall night. The.mm menu remind the same but I ventured to entrees instead of my usually Mediterranean salad. I ordered the salmon with fingerling potatoes and subbed it for cauliflower. The dish was a-ok. I was really hungry so I ate it all but found the cauliflower to we on the dry side and the sauce was quite sweet. Overall a satisfactory dish. Our server was 5-stars all the way. I wish I could remember his name but he was on top it- he'd make Sam Fox proud.

CUK7HhqxRGY9tZ8aU9I3iQ.text: I'm going to update my review for Olive and Ivy up to 4 stars. I've come back here with new friends to introduce them to the deliciousness and each has absolutely loved it!  Menu items that remain my favorite for brunch include the Turkey Grinder and Chicken Panini. For dinner I really like the Fungi Trifoliati flatbread, Mediterranean Salad (with either salmon well done or chicken), Sweet Potato Cannelloni, and Natural Chicken. The flatbread and salad are available on their lunch menu as well!  As I've mentioned in my previous reviews, the pesto and bread they serve is absolutely phenomenal. The patio area is great for a group get togethers. We've been out there a few times just to enjoy cocktails and appetizers. The main dining room also provides a great ambiance for a group dinner or intimate date night. We'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Prosciutto &amp; Mascarpone Tortellini.
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mediterranean Salad with Salmon.
