lMMGHNYNhsSFlBy3RqvHpA.text: This place was great! Awesome atmosphere and great food. Service was spectacular and everyone was happy with their meal. The Mediterranean salad with shrimp was a good way to start the dinner and could be split. I had the natural chicken and it was moist and savory. The broth and mashed potatoes it was served with were to die for. We were out of town guests who considered going back a second night. Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ptarZOPGVm4laZt7v063Vg.text: Awesome atmosphere and incredible small plates! Haven't had dinner there yet but sure we will.   I'm going back just for the bread and pesto--amazing!!   Boyfriend had the chicken flatbread with pine nuts  and it was great

osTdBYrYpl1CZG5bcFNkbw.text: When for brunch... Solid food, good service, and the interior is beautiful.  There is a grab-and-go market with sandwiches and pastries.  Good wine, beer and drink menu.  You pay a little extra for being at Scottsdale Fashion Square.

FEo82_AxMaHoQV8fP5nrxg.text: Guys? Do you want to impress your date with a fancy treat? This is IT!!  Nice place, nice atmosphere, kinda of romantic I should say too because of the lights, but definitely a good options for girls nights or even family dinner. You make it your own. I really like the food, but honestly here are my favorite: ready?? The Lasagna Bolognese with a Belvedere Blue Martini. Honestly this lasagna is so tiny/small that you will eat it in one or two bites (and so overpriced) but it is DELICIOSO!!! And the martini... well, it is Belvedere... you don't need more explanations, hello?? Haha. (please do not have more than 2, especially if it is your first date). Oh yeah, back to the subject. Last time I was there, we had a large group, 45 minute wait, but it was a Saturday night in Scottsdale, so nothing out of the normal... Oh, there is a DJ on Saturday nights, it is not obnoxious, so do not get intimidated if you do not like clubs, you can still hear what people say (well not at the bar) but the rest. If the weather is nice, I highly recommend to eat in the patio, all those lights make it so peaceful and romantic ... awwee... I need a boyfriend haha. Enjoy!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Ready to enjoy our meal :) :)

gIOveAdOjUQdZRgvQeJAHQ.text: Always excellent food and atmosphere.  The steak with potatoes and creamed spinach is one of my favorites in the valley.  Sitting at the bar is a favorite of mine and my wife.  They have some great cocktails and a pretty good bourbon selection as well.   Scottsdale at its best.

yCWtqWoB5QI_cJkLZr2t4w.text: Peach Bellini nummy nummy nummy. Love the bread with pesto  and my gyros were delicious.

HQHxvt5_WPxHfiTzzatH9A.text: Seriously my favorite Fox Concept restaurant. Lets begin with there fresh bread and pesto with are to die for. The mediterrean salad is two thumbs up with extra dressing. Seriously cannot go wrong with anything on their menu.

e8UUNI40tQ-PS6iiV_TtqA.text: After the event at Mitchell Gold + Bob Williams last night, a group of us decided to grab some dinner and drinks at Olive. Miraculously, there was one table left outside on the beautiful patio. We were greeted promptly by our waiter, Joey, and our drinks were on their way. Pesto and bread was brought over which went perfectly with my Chianti. Highly, highly recommend the pappardelle. Exquisite. Joey was very attentive and good, positive energy. Water and wine glasses were never left empty. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and will return soon!

Q5QjBlKwZm5G-Tdq9ezL2Q.text: I am currently finishing up an incredible meal. Literally still in the restaurant, but I can't wait to post this. Not because of the food (though that was delish), but because of our server, Clenard.  We came in, sat for maybe ten minutes, when he came over, profusely apologized for our wait, and informed us he'd be getting us bruschetta on the house. Then, as we proceeded to order, he was incredibly attentive and helpful. My friend got around four Arnold palmers, and he kept them coming!! He was cordial, kind and incredibly professional. Then we also received dessert on the house (for a wait that, honestly, was NOT bad). Everyone was wonderful, and I'm sure clenard is a reflection of the entire staff and restaurant.   Because of this amazing server (and, not to forget, an awesome meal of the lamb meatballs and artichoke heart salad) I am set on being a regular here.  I've never leave reviews but because of the quality of service and meal, I must. Thank you!

EJQgXXLAFgkMvj4-uHNaNg.text: I can't wait to come back here. Everything I had was delicious. My favorite part might be the pesto sauce for dipping...  We had brushetta, the soup (it was something with cauliflower in it), the proscuitto flat bread, and the gnocchi. All of it was so good, I can't pick a favorite. They also have a great wine list. Our serve was fantastic, attentive, and had great suggestions for us.

hdOSgYjP0xAllBK-4bE8hQ.text: This place is fantastic! Today was my second time here. The first was a dinner meal and it was one of the best dining experiences in a long time. Today was happy hour, with drinks and appetizers and it was equally as lovely. Love it. And definitely recommend.

ijcXrIaoHv__VvdLZ_jh7Q.text: This place left quite an impression on me, I have to say.  First, the waiter (forgive me for not remembering his name) was refreshingly eloquent. He explained the menu item-by item in the the most intricate and juicy detail. Actual quotes: "I personally recommend the ice cream bar. I dream about this dessert when I sleep at night and I have to beg the chef to make it for me the next day. Creamy, indulging, satisfying" After his 5-minute spiel, our table was already sold on every item he listed. He wasn't just a waiter; he was a poet.  The appetizers were particularly good, with the bacon-wrapped dates taking the gold for the most creative and delicious plate. The pesto here is great; make sure to request some with your bread. Also consider the beet salad, which was my favorite among the greens.  I had the natural chicken as my entree and while it sounds like a very basic dish, I enjoyed every bite of it. The chicken was moist and slightly tangy while the yukon puree adorned the sides of the plate.   Finally, the ice cream bar ended the feast on a perfect note. It is served with a steak knife so you can carve out your bite from the log of rich deep chocolate+toffee ice cream  Distinguishing factor: this place takes the bacon-wrapping trend to a new level with the bacon-wrapped dates. The plate was the star of our table.

IUeaZMSOL4cb3pRuwn1vvw.text: Sit on the patio during the nice months, it's gorgeous right on the water. I had the sweet potato tortellini and it was amazing. Great atmosphere, food & service. I would recommend people try it.

RWBmODUnEobWAmWmApgDIg.text: Went here for a birthday dinner with some girlfriends. This restaurant is in a great location in old town scottsdale. Food was ok and the atmosphere was pretty good. Huge place with modern decor. Their patio area overlook the canal.

fwAEcXVtS5ZUBtHPd01ETA.text: Great ambiance and friendly server but the food was super average. Looking back we probably shouldn't have gone the tapas route as the options were quite limited, but as New Yorkers this is what you usually do at a "Mediterranean" style restaurant. We did the brushetta trio (two were great, the pear was bland) and the bread was not brushetta style at all (was thick bread rather than thin). The artichoke hearts were good but sort of more of a salad than we expected. The lamb meatballs were fine but nothing memorable. The kale salad was super boring, consisting almost entirely of kale and very little toppings. Overall, I think we would come back for a drink only and eat somewhere else.

JKsgGwDmx1COSPPzT2MXXg.text: Had a fantastic experience here a couple of weeks ago.  We sat at the bar for lunch, as the restaurant was crowded during Spring Training, and tried all of the dishes our bartender recommended.  Everything was delicious!  I will definitely be returning here again soon, probably for dinner next time.

E2U7O8Tqbv95HmZK0HRdQg.text: This was my first time eating here & the food is amazing!! But the real recognition I'd like to give is to our server, Jeremy, he went above and beyond to provide exceptional service! He was so smiley, polite and had immense knowledge of the menu and great recommendations! Will be returning soon!

eogqSbOYN7DRCD1eiZu6mw.text: This place is absolutely amazing. The atmosphere is beautiful, the service is impeccable and the food is beyond delicious. Highly recommend getting the scallops - I didn't even like scallops until I had them from here. Everything is made from scratch too. Again, absolutely amazing and was a great experience!

Z96UbupkdsoJ_nT3l_ZPkg.text: Great service! The food is consistently delicious. Let's not forget that focaccia and pesto complementary starter, it's amazing. Drinks always hit the spot. Atmosphere is great for a nice dinner or a lunch on the patio.

F7qIoHg66QnJr63VIlFfrA.text: Really glad we made a reservation here when we visited Scottsdale a few months ago.  The restaurant is really beautiful!  Great place for a nice dinner with good friends or on a date.  Would have loved to have been able to eat out on the lovely patio, but inside was just as nice.  We went on a Friday night, and there was an awesome house DJ spinning...which automatically gets you points in my book!  Wine and cocktails were good and most of the food was as well.  They have a fantastic caprese salad with avocado that I dreamed about for days, but the fish that I ordered (the special of the night) left a lot to be desired.  Overall great place.  I'd definitely go back if I was in the area again.

4qifms1FjG7A9ui_sShNJw.text: I wouldn't go out of my way to visit this place but I had a lovely evening.  My boyfriend and I came here after dinner for some cocktails and we cozied right up to a fire pit on the patio.  I really thought the patio was charming and definitely not overcrowded.  The drinks were reasonably priced for Scottsdale in my opinion.  My main dislike of this place was the music.  Olive and ivy is a classy establishment and I would have liked the music to reflect that; instead we had club songs being spun by a DJ.  Call me crazy but I think a little Frank Sinatra would have been more appropriate and fitting.  Oh well.

Ew9oR1_ehZ1-zvuw0wlBQw.text: The medi salad and pappardelle was really good.. The whiskey sour hit the spot!!! Pretty happening for a Sunday night

w986uHnJiihgdsopBc79EA.text: This was one of the places that we wanted to experience. We didn't get the full effect here, but I did drop in for a latte and the classic drip! It was a perfect cup!  Holiday Special: Get $100 gift card, with a $20 gift card included! Sweet!   Excellent customer service! A fair crowd for breakfast on the patio! Gorgeous day on Black Friday!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Classic drip meets Cafe Latte

r89arWNS08EY_1ZpiAQw5w.text: We have been to Olive & Ivy several times before now and absolutely loved our experience, especially the bread and pesto that comes free with every meal. We always ask for a second helping because it's so delicious! We loved everything from the artichoke appetizer to the strawberry tart dessert. What really made this restaurant experience stand apart was the truly exemplary service from Frank.  He was just the right amount of attentive without being in your face. Frank had a wonderful sense of humor and provided prompt service. The atmosphere was also just perfect for a date night. We actually sat on the patio, even though it was 101 out today but with the shade and the misters it was a perfect temperature. My husband and I would highly recommend Olive & Ivy in future to any couple looking for a romantic night out in Scottsdale! Next time we go, we will definitely request a seat in Frank's section!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

oVZg0q09hUGkZP3wu6JSNw.text: A home run with flavor town! We ordered a tasting menu consisting of small plates (lamb meatball, artichoke hearts), bruschetta appetizers, melon salad and bread with pesto sauce.  We ended with two desserts (lemon tart and gelato) to share between the four of us.  My daughter was not a fan of Greek food but was converted today. My college age son was giving praise at every bite.  A very nice atmosphere with a professional staff.

uXMJ1VAj5ZtgvUR7CaBU9A.text: First off this place is beautiful. Super trendy with lots of different light fixtures, beautiful big couches with retro designed fabric, different textured walls in different rooms, and one of the most gorgeous patios in all of AZ. I have been here twice. Once was many years ago for my wedding dress shopping day. I remember loving this location and they let us have our own room for no extra charge but I don't remember what we had. I just remember being super pleased after we left. I came back with my husband a few weeks ago and we had lunch. We started with the bacon wrapped figs, something I highly suggest. They are a perfect starter. Tons of flavor, savory from the sausage and bacon, then sweet with the date and peppers, and it's the perfect size. Then we had the bruschetta and the Short Rib Flatbread. I really wasnt please with the bruschetta at all. That would be my -1 star. But the Short Rib Flatbread was great. Tender Short Rib, creamy Gorgonzola cheese, smoked onions, and arugula. You can't go wrong. Can't wait to come back and try their dinner, and sit on that gorgeous patio now that it has cooled down.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. BRAISED SHORT RIB 16.5 dolce gorgonzola, smoked onion, arugula, red wine reduction
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. MUSHROOM roasted garlic, crescenza/ CHORIZO and parm/ PROSCIUTTO fig preserve, port salut.
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bacon wrapped figs

0Sfr2vtXidQM8K0fIjYvWg.text: I always enjoy Olive & Ivy,they have a great atmosphere with being consistent on their food always delicious ... I have never been dissatisfied..service is sometime lacking

j9BzL2kemkxxQoMkAxrexQ.text: Visiting Arizona. A friend took us here for dinner. Ambiance very modern romantic, nice outdoor patio. Waiter was very friendly. I ordered the fig and ginger mule and wild mushroom pappardelle with added shrimp. Both of which were delicious! 9/10. Highly recommend, and I wish they had more locations outside Arizona!!!

joAk4sWW7sJv3f-v_qpzLQ.text: This place is way toooooo overpriced for what you get.  The food is good but you are paying for the location and show.  If that's your thing then you'll be happy.

mC5oHjGB2hv_douAm4QgCQ.text: Oh boy, yum. Margherita flatbread and bruschetta trio. Delicious. Enough for my husband and I to share, reasonably priced, pleasant atmosphere. We'll be back next time we're in Scottsdale.

eHFGzOB_mHfiatlvWIO9Mg.text: I love this place as it's very beautiful on the inside and outside. There an outdoor patio that overlooks the canal. The big bar inside serves delicious happy hour bites and drinks. I love everything I order every time I go. My go to it their Mediterranean chicken salad. Definitely a must if you're in old town!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mediterranean Chicken Salad

3sSySefcLvP9MzwtEDq9rw.text: Had a lovely lunch at olive and ivy at the bar. The blood orange Paloma and it was delicious. I also had the chicken sandwich with fries with no peppers. It was not super flavorful but it was still pretty good. Overall a good experience

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

3AI6LAnbfdeKDEKZpXKO0g.text: What i fell in love with first at olive and ivy was the ambiance for sure. The patio is alongside the canal in old town and is adorned with string lights and trees that make you feel like you're somewhere romantic like Italy. The inside is dimly lit with an open kitchen and a great place for a date or drink with friends. They also have a few beautiful private rooms. The food is all good across the board- fresh and Id say the selection is between American and Italian. They are always accompanied to my allergy and have modified a few dishes for me. They make almost everything in house or know the ingredients source so they are knowledgeable about what i should and shouldn't eat. The focaccia bread, pastas, Malbec wine and red sangria are fantastic! The one thing is that I've gone quite a bit and the food just isn't amazing enough to warrant a 5. It's 'good' but not anything i crave or would gush over more or less. The portions are also a little small for the price I feel I'm never fully satisfied.

pl3jUy4NB8VC9KMI-RNGIg.text: One of My Favorites!! Olive & Ivy always offers great service, fresh ingredients and delicious ways of preparation that impress the palette!! I love the patio at night with the twinkle lights. My daughter, husband and I throughly enjoyed her last evening in town dining while enjoying the canal views! We shared nibbles and also shared desserts so we wouldn't over indulge. All our choices were fantastic and the desserts were out of this world ! Our server was attentive and made the evening enjoyable with helpful suggestions as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bruschetta was delicious
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken flatbread
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Our desert chocolate brûlée with banana

jp_e-XZudtyaxVqkrBVQBg.text: One of Scottsdale's best eatery atmospheres. Large indoor dining areas and fab bar. Best bet, if temperate, is the charming patio with lovely trees, planters, umbrellas and waterfront. Menu is frightfully good, something for everyone and moderate pricing. Professional staff , great service. Recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

aWM5BaZuN6CSkxkZC3YvGw.text: We were disappointed that we were unable to get outdoor seating but our waiter Easton made us overlook that part. We ordered drinks and bruschetta since we were walking around sampling different restaurants. Easton had personality, he was friendly and was very efficient. The bruschetta was delicious and the bread  and pesto that Easton brought out was tasty as well. Next time, I'm making reservations to sit outside.

gDUZN-0f8PzbyJSI_eEAFA.text: And another accidental find near last stop, with more food options and also has a nice coffee latte thing going on. I will return for more another day. Modern and new setting and seating arrangement.

njZJEJ3SPieScq8xX73YQw.text: Firstly, parking is a dream! The free garage is right next to the entrance of the restaurant, so it's simple and easy.  We were seated almost immediately, and greeted to warm smiles from the hostesses.   The ambience is pretty casual, but it has an upscale feel to it. The inside is a little noisy but not overly at all. I'm hoping to return so I can sit in the courtyard when it isn't so hot out! It was extremely beautiful out there.   Our server was very attentive and was always checking on us, which was impressive due to the high volume of people at  the lunch rush.   I ordered the Margarita Flatbread. It was absolutely delectable! The thinness of the bread allowed for you to eat the whole thing without feeling heavy or gross like normal pizzas do. It was extremely flavorful with each bite.  My guests ordered the Chicken Panni. They split it, and the server was kind enough to tell the kitchen to actually spilt it on two plates for them (added bonus). It was also very, very good. They had no complaints.  From the time we ordered our food, it was about 12 minutes until we got it. And about 5 minutes after ordering, we got the bread with pesto (?) dipping sauce.   We were all OBSESSED with the bread and pesto dipping sauce. I'm not even a fan of pesto, but this was perfectly crafted. Again, our server went above and beyond to tell us the ingredients to warn us Incase of allergies.   Olive and Ivy is a FANTASTIC restaurant that I will definitely be returning to. I'd recommend this to anyone in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

JRlCF4NW6CLBryR8aKdwyA.text: I'll make it plain and simple INCREDIBLE food. INCREDIBLE service, like top notch. INCREDIBLE atmosphere. Come here for lunch, come here for dinner, bring a date and you are sure to impress!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Parmesan pesto and bread to start!
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lamb Gyro and fries
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Parmesan chicken flatbred

o_0g7kg9VX6CV0UDHsnK2Q.text: Olive and Ivy was a great place to eat. Our food and drinks were just superb. The waiter was a little slow at taking our order but we were not in a hurry so it actually worked out great. But he was super happy and very nice when he did come around :) I would def. recommend this place.

K5LhH1Go_ICujXmAOp2glA.text: Great evening dinner. Enjoyed the lamb meat balls with the apple kale salad. Very delightful meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Kale apple salad. Pecan were the best part of this salad. Super yum!
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lamb meatballs with pickled onion and a side of pita bread.

RHH14NjYiGlEjdls_ufJeA.text: What a fun spot. Im digging the vibe here. A touch of lavish elegance mixed with a touch of casual warmth. A great dinner spot for a date or with friends. We started with the fig mules, yummy, love those. $11, size was OK. Bread with homemade pesto, nice touch. Our server was honest and informative. He steered me away from flatbread stating there are much more unique things to try, which he was right. I ordered the mushroom parpadelle, yum, great flavor. Garlicky and salty, in a light sauce with al dente noodles. My husband got the natural chicken and it was in such a yummy citrus juice, but still hearty with the potatoes. We finished off with the peanut butter mousse, it disappeared quickly. It was great to split between two people. Our check totaled to $64 before tip, and for a nice little casual date night that seemed on par. Definitely check out this spot!

GXj7lBjWdHCQH4plfAFNBg.text: Destination amazing. Our server Kelley made our whole dining experience extremely grand. He explained the lunch menu thoroughly. Not sure why- the food is grand but the menu is vague. The Red Sangria and Mojito are positively refreshing. Lasagna bolognese contains fresh made noodles. I watched the chef roll those delightful starchy chains right out of the machine. We are thrilled to have ended our Labor Day at this location. Without question we will be back and we will bring our friends. Nice break from the ordinary dining experience.  Atmosphere is beautiful and unique. Peanut butter mouse-fascinating-hard chocolate, light mouse and an airy powder.

4PHeaqm8sYONZWlBwMAdWQ.text: Had a great experience at this restaurant with my wife.  Our waiter recommended the shrimp scampi risotto because that is  the favorite dish of the managers and chefs.  I totally agree - it was phenomenal. My wife had the chicken scaloppini based on his recommendation and that did not disappoint either.  Highly recommend both dishes.  My wife is gluten free and they had a number of dishes to choose from.

_6zjV0j_1Niu1y3A8D-6-A.text: Food is good, service was only ok. However, the outside patio area is fantastic and worth going to just for that! Great place for cocktails with friends.

jPRpQs1EYr_6S_DItayWsw.text: Great service and even greater food! They were very accommodating in regards to splitting plates between two people and having a high knowledge of the ingredients in their plates. I would definitely recommend this place to those who have never been before.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

QZ1nvKQeucAVwfGZLghBOw.text: Visiting from Washington State.  I heard this place was good, so I took my mom to Olive and Ivy for lunch.  I ordered the turkey grinder and she ordered a salad.  The salad looked good, but I immediately distrusted the grinder they made for me.  The taste was all wrong.  It was very sour, like someone had dumped a ton of vinaigrette all over it.  The bread was way too hard, almost comically so, making it impossible for anyone to eat the damned thing without exerting a reasonable amount of effort.  After a few bites, I became astutely aware that my mouth was bleeding from the razor-like bread slicing into my gums.  I refused to eat anymore and sent my lunch back.  The manager graciously offered to pay for our lunch, due to the fact that their food had actually made me bleed.  Receiving a free lunch was nice, even though I left the establishment hungry and bleeding.  Although, I'm certain my mother enjoyed her experience, I certainly didn't.  I will not be returning to Olive and Ivy, due to the obvious lack of common sense exhibited by the people making the food, the people checking the food for abnormalities (like dangerously hard breads), and the management for their lack of oversight and ability to properly analyze their product.  Serving the right bread should be easy.  Unfortunately, Olive and Ivy made it look very difficult.  Any restaurant that fails so heavily on such mediocre and simple issues should be shunned and avoided.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. chop salad
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. infamous turkey grinder

xyu8Y2cpzo6SkdnThI95dw.text: We came to Olive & Ivy for dinner on last Saturday while we were on vacation in paradise valley. It had a good atmosphere and service was great. I ordered the Natural Chicken and my husband ordered the Ribeye and both were delicious.

s688AcQlNFLB5jyAZInlgw.text: I really liked the ambiance and the setting for dinner. I thought that food was just average. I ordered the lasagna for dinner and I thought it was a little flat....and kind of dry. I ordered the hummus dish with vegetables and that was really good! It had a little kick to it, but I liked that! The "Mediterranean" inspiration was a little hit or miss in my opinion. My friend got the bruschetta, and it was good but not the best I've ever had. There was a lot of bread!!

BBjvKZst_f6q0kqhc-Zmhg.text: This place is a must if in old town Scottsdale. The chill atmosphere on the patio if hard to beat.

0dKMTNCH53Habv51Hfx8Bw.text: Excellent food and service! Always a fun place to visit!

CgPVlK3eenb-zWuEGYPjNA.text: This place is so amazing, took my dad for Father's Day, and needless to say It was a great Father's Day

g5z1z4pAYstDbdhOI1_-pg.text: Tips:  The pesto here is to-die-for, a must try Potatoes are diced fried, sort of like "homefries"  --------------------------------------  I came here on Valentine's Day afternoon for an afternoon brunch after calling just 2 hours before to grab a table for 2.  We got the vegetable scramble and prosciutto flatbread pizza.   I would highly recommend getting the prosciutto flatbread.  The vegetable scramble was pretty standard and it is not a white scramble by default. What really stood out to me was the potatoes that the scramble came with. The potatoes are delicious and worth getting with your breakfast choice.

Rs709KirFoRSjqOzlzvYXg.text: Took the family here for dinner and it was great.   Had the bacon wrapped pork tenderloin and the early reviews were right, could cut it like butter.  Great flavor.  Also, we had the bacon wrapped dates.  Everyone in my family loved their entrees.

35YYpSoTt603UgpeHwu9-w.text: Great service, location and food! The short rib flatbread was a fan fave in our group. Highly recommend!

KVgvuh1We_SzoDYunBDmnQ.text: I've always had good luck coming here.  The food is consistently good, and our servers have always been friendly.  When the weather is nice outside, they have a wonderful patio area.  It is best to try to come before noon as they get really busy, and the service can suffer a little bit.  My favorite item is the Roasted Beet Salad which I add grilled chicken to.  The Bruschetta and Flatbreads are also tasty.  I do feel it is a little overpriced which is why I only give it 4 stars.

FZIPyFKx736jQ5Pb7nJO9w.text: We made a reservation for Olive & Ivy, since we had heard such great things. We did have to wait 20 minutes even with a reservation, which was frustrating, but it may have been that they were trying to honor our patio request. Nevertheless, it was worth the wait! The patio was a gorgeous atmosphere! The waitress was friendly and went through the favorites on the menu. We ordered wine and bruschetta to start--quite good! We thought 3 bruschetta for $11 was a fair price. They also brought bread and pesto dipping sauce.  The food was very good. The leg of lamb was excellent, as was the chicken scallopini.  It was a relaxing meal, especially sitting out on the patio with the canal in the background.  Definitely make a reservation for weekend dinners, as it is always busy.

0_ELdAonjpjT3tI_tl24gw.text: I ate at Olive and Ivy on Dec 5th about 1pm. My server was Casey. he was amazing. he was so cheerful and knowledgeable. It was only his 2nd day. I hope he is there when I go next time.

ENnemiNK3xb-tvsWRHymEQ.text: The vibe is super cool. Although trendy and somewhat posh, there's a cozy feel about the restaurant. I've enjoyed patio dining on a few occasions now and it's super cute. The patio is along the canal which gives a relaxed feel to things. Although a bit pricey, you are paying for the location and experience and I'd say it was definitely worth it.

cYx3irTiprjg5SQ2gdVq8Q.text: Loved this place!!! The ribeye steak and creamed spinach was delicious, the ambiance gorgeous and the service left nothing to be desired. 4 people and $172 dollars later so glad the driver suggested this place and next time I'm in Phoenix I'll make it a point to come back.

phjyVzZZJSrgZ89donDUJg.text: Great atmosphere and service was great. The food was just ok. We had heard good things and came up disappointed.

TpLiPnp-XHyTHu26QaSsOA.text: Best meal I had in Scottsdale. Service was good, drinks were delicious yet strong. Great experience all around.

ULdvraIvyg30r-BqE6GHWA.text: We sat at the bar on a Tuesday night.  Bartenders were simply not attentive in the least--it was not busy.  We had an open tab and wanted to drink and eat!  It was like pulling teeth to get their attention and get an order in.  Had to ask for utensils and coasters for drinks.  Just not what I expected.

HkBExxjujwJIisyBnyHu4A.text: Good foot and upscale atmosphere but service need improvement! One food runner ignored my request for more coffee and another cutoff my friend when she was headed to the restroom. Server checked on us tight after we got our food but then couldn't be seen for 20 minutes.

UqILiMhneARqvoiaLYUrQA.text: Wife and I had a Great dining experience last nite, wonderful food and excellent service.

k8t7280jtSxc1Kal-bIt9g.text: Talk about stuffy. Waiter had no personality. Food was ok. From what locals told us, it's a meat market.

pHZyvvY7jF9NMtT_ZrCjQA.text: Great pizza on the go! Selection is good and fresh and the service is speedy enough to not have much of a line. I will go out of my way to eat here again.

31YTWWnqG1NkpP1aksYHWg.text: Great spot, wonderful patio. It's a little pricey though and small portions. Definitely sit outside and the brunch is the best.

rGSBCFjuUd1gKCy9m0x-2g.text: We landed at Olive and Ivy at the suggestion of our Uber driver.  Listen to your Uber drivers, folks.  We were able to score an outdoor table with the firepit in the middle.  Great ambiance with the water behind us and the rustle of the wave sculpture (don't know what it is called, but super cool).  We started with the bacon wrapped dates and the salmon, avocado and prosciutto bruschetta, all of which were fantastic.  We all ordered mixed drinks, and we all enjoyed them.  I ordered the fig & ginger mule...then I ordered another one :).  For my entree I devoured the scallops, which melted in my mouth.  Others at the table ordered the wild mushroom pappardelle and bacon wrapped tenderloin and we were all very impressed.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

rj-eGPWbpTCvEf3ulYhYaA.text: Olive & Ivy sounds cool because in SD we have "Juniper & Ivy^ and it's a super cool spot, so we were hoping Olive & Ivy was super cool too... turned out the name wasn't lying!  We couldn't decide were to go for brunch so I yelped "bloody mary" and O&I came up so being alcoholics we needed our morning fix...well by the time we woke up and came here it was noon. We were able to make resos through opentable and got seated really quickly. Upon being seated we were greeted by our server and ordered drinks- Bloody Mary & Gin Greyhound.   Bloody Mary- good mix to it, it wasn't watery. Garnish was a bit bare, but my second one they stepped up the garnish game (olives, lemon & celery). I love BMs were  you can get a lot of garnishes. My friend hates gin, but he said that was one of the best grey hounds! You can't even taste the gin. They were pretty generous on the alcohol portion as we left with a great buzz.   Now on to the food! The house bread that came with pesto dipping sauce made it all better. I love bread with good dipping sauce. Plus one for that! I couldn't decide if I wanted breakfast or lunch as now it's noonish and it's already really hot in Scottsdale. So my friend and I decided to order lunch portions and split it. We got the prosciutto flatbread and the lamb gyro. I'm glad we got both because O&I is mediterranean and it didn't disappoint. The highlight was the prosciutto crudo flatbread with an egg on top. They also had basil and rosemary potatoes on the flatbread. It was soo good and portions were generous. We were able to take half the flatbread back and ate it a few hours later and it still tasted good!  *Side note: One of the bartenders looked like Manny Pacquiao,,,and we came on the fight weekend. We really wanted to go up to him and say "hey you're going to be late for your fight" but I'm sure he gets shit from everybody that weekend.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. In front of olive and ivy
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sausage
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lamb gyro

ZhCOfxk58-r9qC_pWqS1Sg.text: Olive and Ivy is great! We were recently in Scottsdale, AZ for my sister's bachelorette. We decided to hit up Olive & Ivy for dinner during one of the nights that we were in town. Interestingly enough, our group was one of four bachelorette parties there that night! We were originally seated at a table, but, after talking with our waiter, we were able to move our five person group to a much more roomy, comfortable booth. The restaurant has great ambience - it felt very cozy and had a fun atmosphere. We tried the following: various bruschetta, the kale salad, and a bunch of different entrees. Everything was delicious! Somehow we were able to save enough room for dessert - we all tried the gelato!

S5lI4WaU9iK73o4iQyXHog.text: Even tho this is a fairly large restaurant - I would recommend making reservations. Also, if you want to sit on the patio you need to tell them when you make your reservations. We didn't know that, but wish we had known because the patio was so charming & delightful. The inside was quite noisy, but we did enjoy watching the chefs at work in the open kitchen. But it was our server that made our whole experience at the restaurant a wonderful evening. Nikki was the kind of person that is full of personality, wit and charm - someone you would love to have sit down and join you for dinner!! Efficient, knew the menu backwards & forwards and we loved all of her suggestions. The Chefs are amazing! Watching them work in the open kitchen was both fascinating and inspiring - and the food was fabulous! Everything is made in house and was delicious. There were several different kinds of Bruschetta and we enjoyed each of the three that we ordered. The beet salad was wonderful as was the Mediterranean salad. The flavors in the sweet potato cannelloni were both unique and wonderfully seasoned & delicious. The mushroom pasta was equally as good, and my husband throughly enjoyed his natural chicken & mashed potatoes. At the suggestion of our server we ordered the lemon pudding cake for dessert ......yes.... it was wonderful. We definitely will come back on our next trip!

NRxUPzViPFryIBT7wn6yJA.text: So many great meals at Olive & Ivy, but tonight was the best!  Jacob was an amazing server, went out of his way to ensure our dual anniversary dinner was a memory we will never forget.  The food is incredible, amazing ambiance, and the service is top notch.  The mushroom pappardelle was delicious, killer salmon with beets and potatoes, fresh baked focaccia with house made pesto is a must to start with. Various bruschetta appetizers are a great start.  Desserts all made in house are amazing, had lemon cake, strawberry shortcake were insanely good.  Wine list is really strong as well and we loved the bottle of Sangiovese we had.  We will be back anytime we visit Scottsdale!  An unforgettable dining experience!

0grr_Q0mk-RNuwXOCdl5BA.text: My friends and I came in for a bachelorette party dinner. Unfortunately, our weekend had gotten off to a bad start so we had to find a last minute place for dinner. Luckily, we found Olive & Ivy. We made a reservation for 7:15 that night. We were seated immediately at a cute table by the window that overlooked the canal. First, the atmosphere here is amazing! It was cozy yet had a young and fun atmosphere.  We had one vegan and one vegan/vegetarian in our party of 4. Our waiter Easton was phenomenal. He recommended the perfect (strong, well-made) cocktails that really started off our night on the right note. As we were ordering our meals, Easton suggested adding medium-cooked salmon to one of the salads and it was a fantastic choice.   The best part of the service was that Easton noticed two in our party were ordering vegan. So without even having to ask, he brought out our appetizers with all the dairy on the side so the vegans didn't have to pick it off (we ordered the artichoke and hummus apps). It was so thoughtful! Definitely a great restaurant choice for those looking for vegan or veg options. Our party had a flatbread, 3 salads, bruschetta and the appetizers. Everything was fantastic. We were all trying each other's food at the end!   We could not have asked for better service or food and for the location, the prices were great too. The bride was thrilled with our last minute change of plans. We will for sure be back!

t3dClnP_bUpMDryYCGRW2w.text: First time at Olive and Ivy, second time in Scottsdale. I visited a year ago for a dirty ass bachelor party that did not entail beautiful brunches and extravagant dinners haha.   Great ambiance, attentive service, trendy, and a great effin food. We had the prosciutto cudo flatbread which had the obvious, Rosemary mashed- like potato, basil, and a sunny-side egg on top. We also had the lamb gyro which was really really tasty and the portions were extremely generous. We are both fatties and walked away more than satisfied. I highly recommend both dishes. As for the drinks, we had the bloody and the greyhound. Both were super good and strong. Check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lamb gyro
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. House focaccia bread and pesto

k9bprm8YLM1PVAbeYIVDnw.text: I was in Scottsdale visiting family and it was my first time eating at Olive & Ivy. We had the pleasure of having Mason as our server. As far as first time impressions go, Mason hit the mark! His attention to detail, kind and friendly manner and menu knowledge made our experience above the bar!  Our food was delicious! From appetizers to dinner we were very happy!  If you train your entire staff to follow Masons lead, you will exceed your patrons expectations 100% of the time!!

p9YBeTwrvAsmL3cPBpDC7w.text: This is my all time favorite restaurant. The staff here are amazing and all very friendly. I went here on my birthday this year and they gift you a great little cake with ice cream and a candle on the house. The atmosphere is incredible and the food is even better. Plus your within walking distance to the Scottsdale fashion square mall! If you in the area this is the best place to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Sds9XTAzn81M1YMfHzTnJw.text: It was my first time visiting Scottsdale area. I was very excited to find Olive & Ivy for Sunday Brunch. I saw excellent reviews and beautiful photos on Yelp and decided to check it out. This place is huge!!! It has multiple sections, outdoor shaded patio, full bar with TVs, event rooms, dinning area, and open kitchen. It's modernly designed and decorated. Initially I was worried about not having the reservation and might have to wait for a seat. Nope! We were able to be seated right the way. Their brunch menu is pretty simple. Few items on traditional breakfast and few items for sandwiches and flatbread. They also have a desert and coffee section so they offer full espresso bar items. I decided to go with plain orange juice for a hot day and my friend had latte. Excellent start for our brunch. They served complimentary bread, which was okay. I had their LAMB GYRO, which is a wrapped in a large pita bread with tomatoes, lettuce. It was wonderful!! It looks plain at the first sight but don't let it fool you. The flavors are excellent! The lamb gyro was well reasoned, juice, just perfect for the wrap. I had a side salad to balance the dish. It was really good. I loved the vibe of this restaurant. It's beautiful, it's casual, it's serving good food.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Eggs Benedict
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lamb Gyro

t-5Drxh-Ulpx-Wcs6XqWkw.text: One of my favorite go-to spots! It never gets old. Food recommendation: the bouillabaisse. So good!   Bottom line- the food is delicious and you honestly can't beat the fun, chic atmosphere. They have a gorgeous outdoor patio for lounging with a drink plus plenty of bar space and indoor and outdoor seating.   Highly recommend!

Th7IID60_Ee_zq1bCbxMSw.text: We visited this joint.  He ambiance was nice.  The food is good but not great. Service was excellent.  We had a burger that was charred , my wife complained even though we had eaten most of it. Next thing we know the manager is over and asking how they can fix it.  We said it was fine since we had eaten most of it. They gave us a free desert because of the charred meat patty.

pE2IBfRFo7o6uGdZtts9RQ.text: We went to this beautiful restaurant on Mother's Day to have brunch.  Not only did the manager call another restaurant to get a high chair for our 6 month old son, but also carried an umbrella to keep him out of the 88 degree sunshine.  The outdoor seating, amazing beverages and tasty menu is just the cherry on top of this classy restaurant.  Management= 5* Service = 5* Ambiance = 5* Food = 5* Experience = 5*

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mother&#39;s Day brunch on the patio.

UoXX79lJVmatKTwHfqv5oQ.text: Olive and Ivy is a solid choice in the Scottsdale area for a decent lunch and a glass of wine. I probably wouldn't wait more than 25 minutes for a table, there are other restaurants in the area I would prefer to eat at.   I had a business lunch here the other day, we split the bruschetta (the pear and avocado options were delicious). I ordered the Mediterranean salad (much larger than I was expecting but a decent salad).   We were lucky enough to have good weather and could enjoy the patio and view of the canal.

c4JZ9o0yBnDwFVmTqo4nLA.text: Really cool venue and my food is always delicious. Service can sometimes be an issue as this place is so large.

9cnAv4P6SDw7h8Q31ygf5g.text: This place should be phenomenal....The ambience is awesome and the building is beautiful but the food is so so. I ordered the sea bass and it was so dry it was like smoked fish. The one thing I really liked was the fig and prosciutto bruchetta.

msHXIb1kqjoUb1QLAxG6Sw.text: Excellent place and came highly recommended by the hotel staff. Our waitress, Micki was amazing and knew what to suggest based on our questions. The food (sea bass) and ambiance were great too.

vEm3hcNjvRk5Das1ohY_Nw.text: Food was great, service was awesome, and the atmosphere was perfect!  We were there for a bachelorette party dinner and the staff humored us and our giant inflatable friend.  Our server, Ashton, was a doll and didn't steer us wrong on drink or dinner recommendations. He also brought us a round of shots to start the party! I had wine but one of the girls had a delicious Moscow mule... For dinner I shared the kale salad with another girl and we devoured it.  Yum! I went with the English Pea Tortelli and it was very flavorful without being too heavy.  I would highly recommend this place!

XmZmpmsuSnWHwcGP3ORFlg.text: I can't rave enough about Olive & Ivy. At the recommendation from my broker, my mother and I went out to celebrate my move to Scottsdale. We walked up and were in awe of the high ceilings, the open floor plan, marketplace area, and really modern decor. We had made a reservation and headed out to the patio. The patio is sectioned off in to two sections: one as more of a lounge with big chairs and couches, while the other is more dining-appropriate. As we were seated the overhead lightbulb strands lit up along the waterfront, I was in absolute heaven. If I had been nervous about my move, this little setting put me completely at ease.       Our waiter (which I shall call the Lord of all Waiters) came to bring us water and ask if we wanted anything to drink, we had both decided on Sangria, and he encouraged us to get a pitcher--I always enjoy an enabler. While he brought back our pitcher and delicious, but not Too sweet Sangria, we ordered the Artichoke heart appetizer. He even had this split for us so we didn't have to portion the starter ourselves. The hand grated Parmesan, Artichoke hearts and arugula were outstanding. Both my mother and I had already started commenting on the greatness of the flavor combinations.        The Lord of Waiters stopped by frequently, asking about my trip, checking on our waters, refilling our Sangria as it got low, talking about Downtown Scottsdale....he really knew how to make us feel special. He then brought us house-made pesto and bread; I could've eaten the pesto as a meal in and of itself it was so fresh.         Finally, our entrees came out. My mother got the Sweet Potato Cannelloni while I opted to try the Sea Bass. As I ate my snow peas, sea bass and grapefruit combo in absolute contentment, I caught myself humming along to The Notorious B.I.G. this is when the greatest waiter of all time told us they have a DJ every night that spins great mixes (which I can attest to, I was constantly saying "I love this song!")      To top off our extravagant meal, we had a scoop of Vanilla Bean gelato to split. The Vanilla Bean was upfront, not overpowering but just right. We couldn't have asked for a more perfect meal (or waiter). I can't wait to start getting visitors so I can take them here and show this place off!

IWXWN7DtPJAFM8g8Iw4lXw.text: Back again for a girls day lunch, again it was great.  We ordered bruschetta this time and a Charcuterie plate, also the artichoke hearts and dates.  Everything was great, the three bruschettas we has were amazing! The manchego and chorizo was my fav, but they were all great.  The artichokes were so yummy, they were garlicy and I loved it.  The charcuterie were so amazing, the prosciutto was out of this world.

Eu9VSV4jYceWZp4OA5_O3A.text: My husband and I finally tried O & I a couple of months ago and we enjoyed it so much that we returned last weekend and asked for the same server, who was excellent! The patio is gorgeous. Service impeccable. Food is great too. I really love their Focaccia Bread with Pesto that comes FREE when you get your drinks. Yum. We've tried a large sampling of their flatbreads, salads and appies and all were delish. My favorite was the bacon-wrapped dates and the butternut squash soup (I think it was a special). The server recommended a dessert on our first visit, which was exquisite, but I can't remember what it was...I just know we vowed to come back soon, which is always a good feeling when you leave a restaurant.

n8EmXyhAhFjIAlfVG9nOhA.text: I came here with HIGH expectations. Just being honest! Many people have raved about this place-so I was expecting a GREAT food experience.  I waited for a friend at the bar. My Desert Blossom cocktail was pretty good. I would def order again. My friend was a tad late, so they gave away my reservation. Atleast they were nice about it, and seated us 6 minutes later. We were seated close to the open kitchen, service was good. I just didn't feel the food was so outstanding. The food arrived almost immediately, which in a way is good, but really makes me wonder if it was freshly made.  I think part of the issue is that sitting outdoors when it gets dark adds to the ambience, magical twinkling lights. I didn't feel the seating inside really had great ambience, so I might give this place another try in the fall.  Our fritto mist was OK, not great. My salad was great, but def not the best meditteranean salad i have ever had. Artichokes.. OK.....  I'll put this one on my back up list to try again.

LvnSwCMe6mtV-qIyKVFgHw.text: Sunday brunch w the fam. Egg sandwich, caramel apple pancakes, scrambled eggs w bacon, biscuits and gravy, and cinnamon roll. Oh yeah, delicious peach Bellini. Awesome pesto, devoured it. Everything was delicious. We all kept eating after we were full. Cool atmosphere.

M2N0MVd_aImz1eX9tglsPg.text: I could seriously sit all day on their patio and enjoy the surroundings. Great location on the Scottsdale waterfront. Great large outdoor seating selection for big groups as well as smaller, nook-like areas for couples.. Sat outside with husband while his sister was in town. Plenty of misters. Only got the chance to try  cocktails and appetizers here, but everything was fantastic. Food came out quick and they were busy. Can't wait to go back for brunch!

Iw2WrfXgd1xQwVPnupk60w.text: Bachelorette brunch for 7 girls = success! (even with one girl sick from the night before :P)  Great brunch menu, affordable prices, great service w/ hot waiter ;), great location in the mall & close to the W hotel where we stayed, awesome outdoor seating area w/ misters.. basically sums up this place.  Came here for brunch on a Saturday, we had reservations and were seated right away.  It's a fairly big restaurant (reminded me of cheesecake factory), good for big groups, but saw lots of couples as well.. it looks like they have some private rooms towards the back which look pretty cool.  We would've gone for the mimosas, but were hungover from the night before.  Otherwise, this place serves solid brunch food.  Really good bread, HUGE portions.  I recommend the eggs benedict.  Bride got the S'MORES CHOCOLATE LATTE - WOWSERS!  that's one huge special cup of coffee.  My only complaint is that the food came out a bit cold.  Would return!

rcCAojbG-szi2N5Of0sIvA.text: Aaron was our server for brunch and exceeded all of our expectations! He made sure everything was up to our standards and the food was great as usual. See ya guys next Sunday!

01x3qWfedIVaEALFwXBWxw.text: Applebee'sesque, below average to average with poorly trained ASU wait staff.

EewQrbS4BroYutQ5rxZYsw.text: I came here for brunch. The menu had good options, but I wish there were more. My favorite item was the cinnamon bun.

kj-Bx4K8SW4UFsmQ605dOg.text: Great food, wonderful lighting, gorgeous huge outdoor patio, fantastic brunch, and one of my favorite places to take out-of-towners. Great for groups, and a perfect "you just can't go wrong" restaurant. Literally, date, folks in town, girls brunch, afternoon happy hour with the kids, you name it, this place will do it perfectly!

bFcMZnOn2xYdv3yb3Hq1-Q.text: The food and service were wonderful.  We loved the out-door seating area.  However, we spent more money for the meal that I'd like.

8JPmcG8580JihXEK0OHMYg.text: Olive and Ivy gets four stars for decor, atmosphere, location and overall food. But for me, I wouldn't say Olive and Ivy has the best food in Scottsdale for the price. I been here three times, and tried appetizers, entrees and desserts.   Let's talk about the wine menu, it is expansive with various wines avialable by the bottle or glass. Also O & I does have a specialty drink menu. I think the chopped chicken salad is better than the Meditteranean.. The bread they give you is light and served with a thick pesto sauce, and is very delicious.   The patio is great. As we get to the close of the fall, spring and winter season, heading into summer, get out on that patio asap. It is on the Scottsdale Waterfront, and they have misters and nice patio decor. Very relaxing, "upscale" feeling place.  Also, they do have a small market, with food available to go, made-to-order and wine  available. I might check that out for lunch one day. I'm always tempted to raid the market before I go home, but I haven't yet.  One thing that jades my experience evertyime I've been to O & I is the hostesses. They usually have a weird attitude, and it seems like they are doing you a favor by seating you.  Waiters/Waitresses are always great, and I love their style!   This is a great place to take family or go on a special day.

zV8XJD9bapXuTv4R8x3_4w.text: Come here at least 2 times a week . For the most part always order my food at the marketplace and am able to sit there as well. Came in today and was told since the   Patio was too hot they have converted the tables in the marketplace. The young lady said I could sit outside or order my food Togo . Won't be back

RTiEgeiENXhLTkOUCxzHag.text: The manchego bruschetta was amazing! Would definitely go back to try more if their dishes.

xZyu994C0IvjSYjZAtncyQ.text: Looks like there are some haters out there!  This place - in no way - deserves less than three stars in any opinion. It is at least A-OK folks. You may have a bad experience individually, but the negative review I read were just a little snobby.  Beautiful place. Great focaccia and pesto... but go easy, Killer, or you will spoil dinner.  Tasty flat bread pizza... The asparagus/shroom combo was fine, but you must like a pronounced shroom flavor.  The Mediterranean salad was a nice balance of color, flavor, and texture.

4KmRaBErOF-0KYtBfAN0FA.text: Went for dinner on a Friday night with a girlfriend when we were visiting from out of town.  We had a res outside and when they went to seat us, someone had mistakenly sat at our seats so we had to stand around and wait less than 5 min.  Shared the sangria to start.  We then had small portions of both the beet and mediterranean salad.  Both were excellent.  I had the mushroom tortellini and my friend a seafood dish - scallops maybe?  The food was all amazing and Robert, our server, was a sweetheart.  We then asked where we could find some fruit to buy to eat before our hike in the morning.  They actually brought us a bag of fruit on them because we had to wait a few minutes for our table, after already getting a sincere apology. Awesome place!

cW9_Yu4kPYwxe0z8DEAIyQ.text: This place is great. The scenery is beautiful and the food is good. BUT most importantly the servers are fantastic. I've been here a few times sometimes dressed up, dressed poorly, and once had to sit in the awkward little sitting spot in the front. But the servers are consistently kind and caring. I didn't feel like dressed up, or dressed poorly, or put in that weird little spot that I was treated differently in any way. Keep it up servers and sorry for making you move around those outside heaters that one time. Arizona blood here.

A1IpprvgyQKtCgPlr9ot6w.text: I have no idea why all these people are giving Olive and Ivy 5 stars.   Olive and Ivy has 2 good things going for them: gorgeous decor and trendy atmosphere.  And a possible 3rd: good wine list.  The bad things far outweigh these.  We went with a group of 10 friends on a Tuesday night.  First of all, I was not impressed with the menu.  It was expensive and I could hardly find a few things I actually wanted to order.  I ended up ordering the fig and prosciutto flatbread because I had to leave earlier than the rest of our group.  The service was TERRIBLE.  45 minutes went by before my food arrived.  For flatbread!  I had 10 minutes to scarf it down before I had to leave.  I have no idea why the service to a group of 10 could be so terrible on a Tuesday night.  I could understand if it was busy, but it was just poor service.  Turns out the flatbread was mediocre...I didn't even take my leftovers.  Would I return?  Maybe to sit at the bar and have a glass of wine.  But definitely not for dinner.  Too many other good restaurants in Scottsdale that are worth the price.  Very disappointing for Fox Restaurants.

M2mWIlzLbeNDcJsKo7HdLQ.text: Solid cafe style option when you've dropped from all the shopping nearby.  My only complaint is that lamb gyro featured lamb sausage patties instead of the long strips you expect in a gyro.  Nice taste but I wish this had been advertised.  Breakfast potatoes were very good.  The salads are huge; like maybe a whole bag that you buy at the grocery store in a bowl.

nVOPMR0jpKNkjBOxz7pXbQ.text: Amazing place, a friend suggested and we loved it, not only was the food delicious but we were very impressed with the server, was very attentative and very helpful.  The spinach ravioli was delicious and the scallops dish was excellent.  Had the chocolate cake for dessert and unfortunately it did not match the quality of the place would not reccomend.

C_czOX79USruayhIh6xfGQ.text: I went with my family on a Friday evening. The sea bass was delicious, and our server Kara was very knowledgable and friendly.

VfytpSwrc-G2pU1YmhMjyg.text: Solid food, great service.  I had the filet and it was cooked medium rare, to perfection,  This is probably the tenth time I've been here and the food has never dissapointed.  Solid menu, good service, great beverages.  If you're looking for a night out with your significant other or just a night out with friends, whether eating or just drinking, Olive & Ivy is a place to go.

wo40nySx6z-QRxD7Vk5YTQ.text: So, I had a work lunch here earlier this week (this being a Tuesday, I guess it was yesterday!) and was a bit unimpressed.  Obviously, a great location and you can't beat a seat on the patio for happy hour, but it just wasn't great (and I'm a big Sam Fox fan!).  First, our waitress was a bit off - just off on timing, her explanations, a whole host of things, but she did do a good job keeping up with the pony keg of iced tea we all drank! The food was ehhh...decent. We started with the calamari (which I don't love so nothing held against O&I on that one... although the fried zucch's were a nice addition) and then I had the chopped chicken salad. It was good, but nothing to really get excited about and it had a strange peanut-brittle topping that seemed to be kind of out of place.   As for the rest of the guests, one sent his ravioli's back and got the same salad I had as he said the rav's were not good. The others (french dip sandwich, gnocchi and a flatbread) were all a bit underwhelmed.   I have been here many times before and have found it to be pretty inconsistent. I definitely prefer dinner to lunch , especially based on this last experience and again, it's pretty solid for happy hour especially with the awesome people watching...the weekly Cougar convention!  Ironically, I will be back tomorrow....wish me luck!

620k-BmrOnq2x5EAnp0NLA.text: Olive and Ivy is a trendy Scottsdale spot with tasty food, loud music and good service. The atmosphere is pretty cool - large bar up front, huge open patio and cool lanterns hanging over head. It's a bit deceiving if you enter through the dessert bar area because it looks like a little grocery store - it's definitely not.   The food tasted great and was presented nicely without being ridiculously pricey. I didn't have any ice cream, but it looked really tasty. The service was very good and the drinks were delish (try a raspberry mojito - mmm). We went in on a Friday night without reservations and had to wait a solid 1.5 hours - make reservations.   This is a great spot if you like to be surrounded by 30-something hipsters or older men and women trying to be hip. I liked that the tables weren't piled on top of each other, but it was still crowded. There was a pretty good vibe -- I'd definitely go back next time I'm in Scottsdale.

uPseIdXnTybLX3r2Ym-H8w.text: Ate here tonight celebrating a family members birthday. Had heard about this place from multiple friends so we decided to give it a try. When you first walk in you are impressed with the ambiance and the overall atmosphere, very cool. Love the open kitchen and waterfront patio. Our server, sorry could not remember her name, was very good, very attentive and was on top of things all night. For appetizers we ordered a plate of bruschetta and the Fritto Misto (calamari, shrimp, and zucchini). The bruschetta was very good but I am unsure as to why the Fritto Misto is even on the menu. I could literally go to any dive bar and get the same dish. Thats my bad for not knowing what Fritto Misto meant, had to look it up, but I like calamari and shrimp so I ordered it. So on to entrees, two people ordered the sea bass, one salmon, one spicy shrimp risotto and I ordered the sea scallops. Everybody loved their entrees including myself. Scallops weren't grainy at all and matched with the polenta it was a very solid dish. We all ordered desert and everybody loved their gelato and lemon cake. Overall Olive and Ivy is very good and I will be going back, just won't be ordering the dive bar appetizer.

ksFAvDRRhl6t286C68BIhg.text: Great spot, good food.  Sam Fox is some kind of genius.

HXpum9Xyhdj0I7ffuCrBrA.text: The entrance was confusing.  When you walk in its like a deli and to the back is the restaurant.  The employees look at you like you are an idiot and then finally they break down and point to the back where the restaurant is.  The hostess station had 3 or 4 people standing around and one extremely rude girl that took charge.  We asked how long the wait was it was a long time but she said you can go to the back patio and possibly get a seat.  We had never been there before so we asked is there a table available?  The rude girls response was "we dont know" since its first come we dont keep track of it for you.  you will have to see if there is one available.  We walked through and obviously there was no open table which the dumb B already knew.  Really bad vibe from this place.  Really rude staff.  Staff seems ultimately annoyed that you had the audacity to walk in and expect to eat there.  It was almost like "is this really happening right now?"   That was our first and last visit we walked out after the hostess was a big b and I was completely bummed because the restaurant is beautiful.  I have wanted to try it for a few years now but I cant put up with that kind of treatment.  The management here must be the absolute worst otherwise there wouldnt be so many hateful people working here.

r8YlNPM9s4uT5qir-3nM-g.text: Actually tried to hit this place up twice, once for drinks and then again the next day for breakfast. Drinks were a failed attempt. It gets super busy, I would suggest making reservations or getting there early. Breakfast was awesome. We had no reservations but you can actually self seat on the right hand side of the restaurant as you walk in. Awesome view of the canal. No real tables, but I was so excited to get a seat, I didn't really care. Breakfast sandwiches are great and nothing can beat a pitcher of white sangria for brunch.

7JkQ3vshWJy0ADqKhukS2Q.text: We went to Olive & Ivy for our third time a couple weeks ago with friends.  Each experience has been different, and I must say that this place needs to make up its mind.  Is it a trendy nighttime dining establishment or a casual grocery cafe?  I prefer the latter, although the restaurant seems to punish me for it.  Granted there are great menu selections and the food has been reliably good.  But the prices are high, the service mediocre, and the interior design more fitting of a Vegas night club.  I would never make this a first choice, although I also try not to complain if dragged there.

cTe-fneJEENRFXnfxA_nEA.text: I can never go wrong with a restaurant from Fox Concepts it seems! The bar area is definitely good 'people watching' and I love the modern contemporary decor. Where did they get the lighting for the bar area? The menu is healthy mediterranean and I love sitting outside on the patio. They also feature a 'take-out market-side' - I think they have some top notch croissants too!! I haven't been there for brunch yet so that's on my list and will have to return!

zA7MoSSZhF5K1VvznaJLQA.text: Excellent food and great service.  The fillet of beer, flatbreads and peanut butter dessert are all very, very good.

HeHY4oVMTCY3UMd0uYOJng.text: My first visit to Phoenix and this was the first place Danielle took me after getting off the plane!  What a great place!  Great wine room and the space was absolutely beautiful.  We took a seat at the large bar and started with a glass of tea, which was pretty good!  We ordered two flatbreads: the italian sausage and goat cheese and the mozzarella and basil.  Both came out rather quickly and both were pretty good!  Oh and one more thing. the fresh baked bread and pesto dip is worth the carbs and extra calories!  Service is very good and everyone was really friendly.  I'd definitely come here again!

XD4C4mFQ_YUFwcDHuUOwQQ.text: We love this place, and we wish there was a location in Chandler where we live.  Make sure you check Costco for Fox Concepts Restaurant gift cards before you go.  You can get $100 gift card for $80! My wife and I love the flat bread pizzas here, and their homemade gelato is outstanding! I would highly recommend this place.

1TAkDCTBhAVWlDXNGkki0A.text: Usually this place is good but today I had a bad experience. I understand it was busy for Sunday brunch and I'm very laid back and understand when it gets busy...things happen...I get it.  My girlfriend and I sat at the bar. (The bar tenders were both very friendly.) We waited 45 minutes to get our food and when it arrived the order wasn't correct.  My girlfriend ordered the vegetable scramble and it came out with a slice of unmelted provolone clumped on one side of her eggs. Apparently, they had keyed the order in incorrectly and asked us just before the food arrived about her order, so I suspect they threw the cheese on last minute to salvage the order.  The medium rare burger I ordered was well done. In hindsight, we should have said something, but we were starving by that point.

CiFhCySNFWx0NO06AbNujg.text: We had an important of town business associate to dine with. Wanting to sell him on Scottsdale and the vibe of Old Town, we chose Olive & Ivy. Not our fist visit and certainly will not be our last. Dinner was fantastic and our server even more professional. Needles to say, our meals were all delicious and we made a great impression. Four Cheers!

aerYZocg6xy8OLenPt7LaA.text: The crowd here was very mixed: I saw twenty-somethings all the way up to retired people. I think that goes to show that there is something for everyone here. If you can, try to sit outside; the view of the river is so pretty, and there are plenty of heat lamps if you're feeling cold. Shared a salad, flatbread, and a crostini which was more than enough food for two. The salad was awesome and the short rib flatbread was delicious. The ambiance outside is very serene and great for conversation.

I70HeiFVOHcb7NPRY15xYg.text: Amazing !! Everything I've eaten here is amazing . Try the risotto ! You'll thank me :) unless you're allergic to seafood .

Uyy1p_Tu13mRM4t_Foc-XA.text: Very cute restaurant in Scottsdale! My friend was visiting from LA and we decided to come here which was the perfect choice. We sat outside across the water on the cute couch/chairs.   We were there for happy hour and most things on their menu were 1/2 off. We started with three types of bruschetta: butternut squash w/goat cheese, prosciutto w/fig and mozzarella w/tomato jam. The bread was super fluffy and the  flavors were very good. I also ordered a glass of white wine which paired well  with my appetizers.   For my main dish I ordered the chicken pesto flatbread which was really good. The pesto was just right and I even had enough to take 1/2 of it to go. Overall, great restaurant and atmosphere. I will definitely be returning to try some of their dinner dishes!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. prosciutto&amp;fig, butternut squash &amp; mozzarella bruschetta!
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. pesto chicken flatbread!
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. salmon salad!

X5pAJaSycpJcYYpuDPg89w.text: i had high expectations for this restaurant as it is in scottsdale and for its prices, but when i physically ate there, my expectations were not met. the menu is very minimal. the pasta was OILY i felt like i was drinking oil. the server was odd and made me feel as though i meant nothing to them. no eye contact, looks of disgust, etc. would not go there again. also portions are SMALL , not filling

Uq7lmUvttuqmWab2kKk-Cw.text: Note to self next time: Make a reservation if you plan to go on a Friday night.  This was my first time here & I definitely underestimated how busy it might be. I took a friend out for her birthday & when I walked up to the desk to ask what the wait was she said the next available table was at 9:30! (Mind you it was 6:15) But we had the option to sit at the "chefs table" which ended up being really cool anyways.  Landiss was our server & he was great! He grabbed our stuff quickly & was really friendly. I love it when I can go to a place & the people act like they genuinely enjoy their job, & he did just that.  Food: Bread & pesto is killer. Non negotiable. For a starter I got the Artichoke Hearts which were tasty & well cooked. My entree was the Wild Mushroom pappardelle & that was really delicious. I wish there was maybe a little more cheese or sauce going on, but it was still good. I also liked that I was able to be a pain in the butt & get a couple Jameson Mules even though its not on the menu. :)  I enjoyed this place & it had a great atmosphere. Will definitely be back, but next time Ill make reservations.

yzorkfkg7uhhaczhuYR30A.text: So your first class flight lands. You go to check into your hotel. You go back out to explore the town and do a little shopping and you find yourself hungry again. What do you do? You go to Olive & Ivy of course!   Wow, the food is scrumptious and the atmosphere is so refreshing, clean and modern. As you walk into the entrance you will be cascaded with a very light mist of H2O. Oooh, dramatics honey. It's mainly because this is Arizona and the dry heat can get a bit irritating in the summer. So I think that's a nice gesture for businesses in this area. We walked up to hostess stand and let me tell you chile. All of the hostesses looked like Victoria Secret models. Wow. Just over the top beautiful, honey. Is this common at Olive & Ivy? Because if it is, please don't fire the hiring manager. Lol. Anyways, one of the Sports Illustrated lookalikes escorted us to the bar and we were greeted by one of the  bartenders that suggested I try the Mediterranean salad (a must order) with added shrimp. I also gulped down a few tasty cocktails. I can't remember the name of them :( but honestly you can't go wrong with any of the drinks you try at the bar.   My salad was fulfilling and flavorful the added shrimp big and juicy.   Breakfast is suppose to be really good here as well. I will have to try it out for myself.  This place is gold and I will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mediterranean salad with shrimp. Order this!!

0NS8PTT9kFT78UpXRviaiQ.text: My mom and I came here for first time and it was awesome! We walked in and got seated right away. Our waiter (Lonnie) came up immediately and got us some drinks. The space is good, decor is pretty & food is awesome! We got the cinnamon roll and hummus to start. The cinnamon roll tasted just as good as it smelled! It's hard to find a cinnamon roll with the perfect balance and this one definitely has it! The hummus had awesome, bold flavors. I ordered the Eggs Benedict and I have to say, it's one of the best I've ever had. My mom got the egg sandwich and that was just as good!  We'll definitely be coming back here again! One of the best experiences we've had and our waiter was amazing !

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cinnamon Roll was soft and sweet with the perfect amount of cinnamon!  Hummus with pita and for an additional $2 you can add veggies!
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Eggs Benedict was amazing !

L-F-nHsjr-guftx4LQ_8ww.text: the food is 5 stars, they have vegetarian options and their food is trendy. the service isn't great but there is a Canadian guy that works at the register and he is the nicest guy there so yeah

qLpABdO3UgnvxK6J8kc4Ww.text: This place has a great patio. I love it for Breakfast on the cafe side. The staff is great, especially Nathan. I do think they could improve the breakfast menu a little more. The food is just a little too inconsistent. Why not make the BLT part of the breakfast menu? Seems silly to only have it at lunchtime.

ZkvvRxsMvF4N8EtqssRNEg.text: This is a beautiful and energetic restaurant food was good and drinks were amazing when we finally got them, service left a lot to be desired which was disappointing

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

26pEyIrpvZ5iWiPjexByWg.text: Busy lunch time crowd, noisy. Great menu & interesting coctails. Gyro was tasty, but lacked authenticity. Chopped chicken salad was very good but not remarkable. Service was good for how busy they were. The real treat was sitting @ chef's table and watching the intricate workings of the busy kitchen. Tickets spitting out in 3 feet ribbons, dealt out like cards to the staff & then reassembled as meals.

CQN-CZH0id3sq3nm3S_cUw.text: I really love the atmosphere and cuisine here. It feels fancy, yet not too expensive, and I believe the food is really good for its value. Their complimentary bread and pesto is delicious in itself. The bacon wrapped dates are so savory and delicious for an appetizer, and pretty much everything else I've had here is delicious too. This place definitely will have me coming back frequently.

_n1szqsI3h6sLOGcJh_bHA.text: This is one of my fave places to go during the week if I'm in the area. I love the vibe, the food and the drinks. The service is always good.

gesyEWkHDa27IP8HoGh4SQ.text: BACKGROUND My girlfriend and business partner recommended we meet at Olive & Ivy for lunch and drinks for our meeting. Olive & Ivy is a little hard to find at first, as it is tucked away in the Waterfront Camelback and Scottsdale restaurants in the back and looks like a tiny cafe from the street. Once you finally find parking, (the best place is to use the parking garage across the street), find the restaurant. The entrance is pretty unassuming, but it has a super chic and very impressive layout and vibe when you walk in. There is a central bar with little couches around for a bit more causal seating, as well as a formal dining room. There is also a cute central wine cellar in the front which makes a great selection for the wine menu. The lighting is very modern and edgy. We ordered the Mediterranean salad with shrimp as our add protein and hummus appetizer plate to share. The food was terrific. I ordered the grapefruit mohito which was delicious. The only complaint was that we weren't served water after asking for it over and over before we were able to get even got one glass. I kept asking for water refills, but never got more. I did get all the refills on all of the expensive grapefruit mohitos though. There are many different menus, including: Market Menu Brunch Menu Lunch Menu Dinner Menu Dessert Menu Happy Hour Menu If you want to check out the food selection ahead of time, the best idea is to go to their website. Or, just be pleasantly surprised when you get there! Hours: Brunch: Sat/Sun 10am - 3pm Lunch: Mon - Fri 11am - 3pm Happy Hour: Mon - Fri 3pm - 6pm Dinner: Sun - Thur 5pm - 10pm Fri/Sat 5pm - 11pm Market Opens 7am Breakfast: 7am - 3pm For more information: OliveandIvyRestaurant.com I 4/5 highly recommend Olive & Ivy!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

b-giKNXcix_EKNfUwEzbnA.text: Another Happy Hour...headed to the waterfront to shop and ended up here. Right near the other Fox restaurant, Culinary Dropout, but menu totally different. Not so special specials, beer was $5. We also got hummus to share and also ordered a salad off the regular menu, which were good. I like the cleanliness and service of these restaurants. Not my fave but nothing wrong with that.

WCbpCiPJeGEntHM5z0cJ9w.text: My friends LOVE this place so I've been quite a bit.  The thing is, I can never really figure out what about it makes them keep coming back.  The food is "fine."  I've come in for breakfast and dinner.  I never had any dish that made me desire to come back without my friends suggesting it.  Usually they suggest great places, so maybe I'm missing the point, but really, I just don't crave this food.  I will say - the service is EXCELLENT.  I've never had a server I didn't like and they always try to make my experience great.  (I actually just added a star to my review because of that.)  So I guess ... try the food, and if you like it, keep comin' back, and if not, get a drink and enjoy the scenery and service.

arq7IBn8Cdqa4g4-MaQYIw.text: Fun chic atmosphere.  Great patio.  Food is consistent and good.  Pastas are wonderful.

robXwKegUAuR8imfL4t1kw.text: Ordered the lamb gyro and red sangria.  The food was fresh and the drinks did not disappoint.  I sat at the bar where you can watch the chef in action.  Love the vibe and will have to make another trip out here!

IXVP3C30GS44U-N1nLmwzQ.text: Yum! A group of us visited Olive & Ivy on a Saturday afternoon, maybe around 2:45. Despite having a large group, we were able to quickly get a table outside. The outside area has an awesome vibe, with plenty of shade, as well as misters and string lights, and good music.
