As far as food, my husband and I shared a piccante flatbread and a chopped chicken salad. Both were delicious! The salad had granola in it, which sounds weird but actually added some good texture to it, and the flatbread overall was really satisfying. The complimentary pesto and bread was super yummy too! Everyone in our party raved about the food.   My only complaint was that service was pretty slow. Drinks took a really long time and were all given to the wrong people when they did come out, and the bread didn't come out until our orders did. Thankfully, we weren't in a rush, so we were able to just chill and enjoy ourselves, but it was surprising since the restaurant didn't seem overly busy at that time.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

24jyRje-D77Db5ANLPLVCA.text: We took some out of state friends to Scottsdale on to show them around. We decided on renting bikes to get around quicker which was awesome. Of course due to all of the activity we were very parched. We ended up at Olive & Ivy. We were greeted with a smile and seated shortly thereafter. It was a busy late afternoon on a Saturday but they were able to accommodate us on the patio. We ordered drinks and a few flatbreads with a salad to share us. The drinks came out quickly and were very thirst quenching. Our friends had white wine, my husband a beer and I the Grapefruit Mojito which was outstanding. The Braised Short Rib flabread and Pesto Chicken flatbread were a hit but I really enjoyed the Chopped Chicken Salad. We had a very pleasurable experience and would highly recommend to anyone. The only crappy thing  (literally) was that my husband was between the umbrellas and there are a lot of trees/birds. Unfortunately he was bombed twice but he was a good sport and allowed us to laugh at his expense.  I was smart and sat under the umbrella. LOL We mentioned it jokingly to our waitress in passing which we honestly wasn't  expecting anything to be done about it . However the manager came out shortly thereafter and profusely apologized. We weren't complaining about the incident to receive anything in return but they took off my husbands drink as a courtesy. It is so nice to know that there are places out there that employ individuals that really care about service. I truly appreciate  the care not only our waitress  took but management to approach our table to apologize.  Great Job!  Needless to say we will enjoy the patio again but my husband and I will probably compete with sitting under the umbrella for protection.

iy4c9pHPk8ZcQBT2mc2kcw.text: Just moved next to this location and it comes highly recommended. I decided to go over with some friends and check it out. We set out on the patio area which is absolutely beautiful at night and enjoyed some glasses of wine. Location location location with great food selection. Was not overly impressed with the cafe menu so I will continue to have to find my lunch spot.

oVtIlABvcLF1L_IQf5JBPw.text: Have been to Olive & Ivy in small and large group settings for brunch, happy hour, and dinner with consistently good experiences. We had my Stepmom's surprise 60th birthday party here--the event space was easy to book--our event space was indoor/outdoor with great views of the Waterfront canal.

uTOI5lvJXhOLcg5t63R4Pw.text: We loved this place. Came in with a big group of 13 for a nice dinner.  Great food, appetizers main courses and desserts good wine list.  Love the decor and location, and the staff is hot.    Easy walk to bars from dinner.  Check it out.

D5wwjvtSBXiU5cyu3oUrSA.text: Had the pleasure of going to O&I for brunch recently with the gang... O&I has mimosa specials, but not bottomless like some of the other spots in town, and I'm guessing that's how our group of 6 didn't have to wait for a table at 11am on a Sunday.   I was in a breakfasty kind of mood and after MUCH debate, I decided upon their buttermilk pancakes which came topped with caramelized bananas and sliced almonds. The bananas and caramel were so good, I didn't even need the syrup on them... I used it on my breakfast potatoes instead!  hehe ... I ate every last morsel of my food, drank my specialty cocktail (something with gin and grapefruit juice, yum) and all for $25 including tip.  All in all, O&I is a solid joint. It's not overly crowded and is a nice spot to catch up with friends on the patio or enjoy drinks with your special someone.  Note: O&I does have a happy hour, but I have not yet taken advantage of it. I'll put that on my list!

xRHxmUV1BQjfk_ZYkdoDCg.text: Excellent service from our waiter Kalei!!  Atmosphere was good but the music was a bit too loud out in the patio for conversation.  Brussel sprout bruschetta was exceptionally delicious.  Sea Bass was a tad overcooked but the caramelized cauliflower accompaniment was tender and tasty.  The lemon flavored dessert was a little tangy and the cake just melts in your mouth.  The coconut cake served with blood orange sorbet was average, couldn't taste any orange in the sorbet.  Definitely request to sit in Kalei's section again.

yuAGZO0sxRcx6NBas3H0ow.text: Really cool vibe, solid service, and great food.  I really dig the flat bread appetizers, in particular.  Definitely recommend this place!

GF6Jf5XgkkPup8RIDj7j6Q.text: We had a group of 5 come here last weekend and had the pleasure of having Victoria helping our table out.  The food was delicious.  My girlfriend and I loved that everything was made from scratch.  She had a chicken salad, which was amazing, I opted for a breakfast sandwich, also fantastic.  Everyone from our group enjoyed the food, and enjoyed the GREAT service from our host.  If I lived in Scottsdale, I would be here a couple times a week for sure, its too good to pass up.

ZN31SmskasO7VV8K1qs9Mg.text: Beautiful ambiance. The first time I dined here, I had ordered several plates (bruschetta, flatbreads, which were all pretty good). This time we had come for a late night dinner and wanted something light. The hummus was delicious and one of the best ones I had in Arizona. The San Tan porter and Sedona hefe were refreshing. Hummus was delicious. San tan porter and Sedona hefe were refreshing. Great place for a date or  to catch up with friends while munching on good food.

KPYFcfOPNQo-OzSf-LXq2Q.text: Cool for sure, great design and staff. The dishes are great however the quality of product is meh. I like being there, i just feel ripped eating there:/

GWYbKG3Zwc6ER18HtVzvEA.text: Very nice place, Ate on outdoor patio. Shared a bottle of really good Riesling wine. All the food we had was very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Hummus app

BAyh8W3nhqiRlpbiaCoS3Q.text: Aside from the map showing a wrong location, everything about this restaurant was right. The pesto they serve with the complimentary bread was to die for. It was so good I slathered it with my flatbread order of Prosciutto Crudo. They serve brunch on weekends (both Saturday & Sunday) until 3pm which is ideal when you don't like time constraints in the weekend mornings (meaning noon or after). The $5 mimosa was in a huge wine glass instead of a slender champagne flute. Service was fast & good even when it seemed crowded.

2j01dbrWREe7_s7eh2HSdA.text: Went here on a Friday night after work with a friend. Made a reservation easily with Open Table and was seated immediately. The atmosphere was very nice. I really liked the place. The waiter we had was friendly and helped us decide what to get.   Simply put, great bruschetta and great drinks. Definitely going here again.

wnQBreL8eMjpheWV0DE77A.text: We stopped in here for brunch on Sunday and it was amazing. Everything is made from scratch and it shows. I had the breakfast sandwich (egg, bacon, cheese, avocado,  add tomato) and it was fantastic. Add the bottomless mimosas and charmingly attentive waiter and I could have sat and chatted all morning. We'll be back for certain.

1X_INvaPCrB3GWOS2Xz20A.text: Excellent food and the waitress was so nice. The place itself is fun too. I came on a Friday evening and they had a DJ. Awesome patio and just a fun evening. I will be back again. Lib this place!

XyYvjzspGHZRWRIOAuW97A.text: Was my first time there and everything was simply impeccable. Our service was amazing although she had just moved here from Dallas and the country gravy biscuit and Spicy Bloody Mary with blue cheese stuffed olives  where the perfect end  to my hectic week.

b3Nvr3VU5hOAOuiJpT-IQQ.text: We were pleasantly surprised at how good the food was here after coming for a late dinner.  We started out with the beet salad and lamb meatballs.  The beet salad was full of beets, which I find to be so rare at most restaurants.  The lamb meatballs were really juicy, but I wish they gave more tzatziki with them.  For entrees, I got the margherita flatbread and my husband got the chicken.  Both were really delicious and flavorful.  Our favorite was the foccacia and pesto that we got with our meal, and it was soooooo good!  I want that pesto recipe!  We also got a few cocktails to go with our meal, which were well-priced for the size of the glass.  Next time, we'll save room for dessert because the gelatos looked great!  Loved the ambiance and bar seating in front of the open kitchen too.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. lamb meatballs with tzatziki, foccacia with pesto

gJB_d9SWhLT3XlI0m6kCVA.text: Great ambiance, fantastic food, great drinks! Just a great place to people watch and listen to a great DJ. I went on a Saturday night with my boyfriend without a reservation and we were seated in 20 minutes. I love the decor...very polished.

pGB5p_VbBubGQxSpSUpRCg.text: Over rated, not bad by any means but definitely doesn't live up to the hype and I don't understand why its constantly busy other than location.  Mediocre food, mediocre service, great location.

iAAnR70Z9GayZZkfjTX3og.text: One of my favorite fox concepts.  Great open air restaurant and outside seating area.  The pesto with bread appetizer is really good, brunch is best here and the breakfast sandwich is off the hook.  The mushroom flat bread with truffle oil is my favorite thing at olive and ivy and service was good.

ys_GPJ7n-cAxdAS4dRkLHw.text: It took us awhile to get back but we did and brought out of town guests. On another hot day the patio was comfortable. We had an excellent waiter. It was brunch again. I enjoyed my flatbread. My wife enjoyed her burger. One guest enjoyed her eggs Benedict. Another enjoyed her kale salad. The peanut butter mouse was great and the lemon gelato was too we were told.  We should return more often.

ObXj-WbsyUJWT7HM4RTCjw.text: Have only been here twice, but if I lived in the neighborhood, would be dine here often!  Delicious, inventive food and pleasant staff.  Indoors is chic, but the patio is heaven!

7X5oOKXNI4sZtB6vij_HCg.text: I was visiting on business, and a  work colleague took me here (their favorite restaurant); it's located in an upscale outdoor retail and residence complex, Scottsdale Fashion Square, so on the plus side, they're situated in a good, vibrant location - suitable for people-watching!   It's a newer, larger-size restaurant, and kind of reminded me of something one might find here in the Bay Area - high ceilings, large open-air windows, well-dressed (yet casual) people, large bar, patio, animated conversations, etc. I liked the ambience - it wasn't too crowded, yet not deserted, either!  There was actually no wait, we were seated outdoors, and our server promptly took our drink order and also, served up some bread.  I opted for the Seared Ahi Tuna Salad - ($15) Mizuna Greens, Fresh Avocado, Mushrooms, Soy Caramel  ...extra avocado, of course!  The food was good, and my salad tasted really fresh - even the  tuna. I was not disappointed at all.   ...however, what I *was* disappointed in was the service. The food came out slowly, and after it was delivered, the server disappeared, and it was quite the effort for us to flag her down for drinks, etc. We were in a slight hurry, yet it was difficult to try to catch her for the bill.  After we finished eating, it was a good 20-minute wait before we took off. Had it not been for this point, I prob would've given this place four stars!

aKUYtIphxN5MPhvJDUw8Gw.text: I had been to Olive and Ivy before for wine and flat-breads on the patio and thought it was good, but when we finally came for dinner on April 24th, the experience was excellent. We didn't have a reservation, so we made our way to the bar for a glass of wine. The hostess texted us when our table became available, which was a large comfy booth clad in a beautifully patterned fabric. Our waiter was engaging and attentive, and the food was superb. The people watching is added bonus, there were lots of interesting sleeve tattoos on the staff, and tables of rich blonde debutantes.I noticed a couple of metrosexual guys at the bar with Restalyn injections and nose jobs (which is a pretty common sight in Scottsdale).  Anyway about the food, we started with the hummus and veggies which was obviously house made and delicious. My entree was the Pacific sea bass, which, as the waiter explained, is substituted with a cousin to sea bass that is not endangered but just as tasty. The braised cauliflower was great, and the portion was perfect. The preserved grapefruit was the perfect touch, the dish needed no augmentation. My partner had the scallops which were amazing, and our relatives had the filet and added a small side of shrimp to make it a surf and turf, they loved it. We shared a lemon tres leches cake with berries for dessert that was mouth watering. The place is always packed and it's easy to see why. Beautiful ambiance and terrific food!

je5celEL4Rnyqn-pBJdqww.text: I love this place!  You can always find something great eat.  I recently went for a friends birthday.  I would recommend their outdoor dining area.  It's a pretty decent size and you will have to wait if you don't make reservations even during the week for lunch.  We had my favorite appetizer, the bacon wrapped dates.  I love the arugula salad that comes under the dates.  They also give you bread and olive oil pesto dip.  That's a meal in itself.  We ordered the chicken chopped salad which was delicious!  We told the waiter that all four of us were going to share so he brought it out already divided in four bowls.  We also had the margarita flat bread and the sweet potato cannelloni that was to die for!  We also ordered the cheeseburger that was cut into four as well.  The server also brought out a chocolate cake with ice cream for our friends birthday.  We experienced great customer service!  We will be back soon.  Probably for happy hour since it's a good one!

gFQpOPK8WgXpuz7fb7zsfw.text: Place is very good.  Good wine list, good unique food.  Not gigantic portions, which I view as a good thing...

YaqyDfniOVbVfCCCQ8P8DQ.text: My husband and I decided to go out for a nice dinner this last Friday night and we decided on Olive & Ivy, and let me tell you this was a great decision! The food was absolutely delicious, the decor is super cute, and the service was exceptional!!! Not to mention the food was unexpectedly fast! Definitely recommend, and be returning in the future!

AQE7YvaiKpP1r9p94dm27A.text: Now I can say that I've dined here for breakfast and dinner.   We elected for grabbing breakfast in the front as the restaurant wasn't open.  You're able to sit anywhere you chose, grab a number, and they will bring your breakfast to you.  They have a small menu selection.  I went w/ the smoked salmon platter, it's a classic & you can't really go wrong.  I also had the yogurt parfait - it was really good.  All the berries in there were fresh and in season.    For dinner, I enjoyed the calamari appetizer, duck & spinach ravioli, and sangria.  The calamari was pretty oily - it would've been nice to have a piece of paper at the bottom of the serving platter.  The ravioli was good, and the bite of sea bass that I had was good too.   Surprisingly the dessert didn't catch my eye.  But the server was great.    On a last note I set up a group private dining event a couple of years ago and they absolutely enjoyed it and I want to say there's a private outdoor area as well attached to the PDR.  My group had nothing but rave reviews.    All in all it gets 5 stars for the ambiance with the seating outside by the river, and great service.

ZSAsZweDTLObDw9FRZYjuQ.text: We were so impressed by this restaurant! We were visiting from out of town and we were so pleased that we stumbled upon Olive & Ivy.The decor was beautiful and the atmosphere was great! The bread and pesto is delicious! We got the marinara bruschetta and it was to die and the steak and the scallions were delicious!  Marissa was such a sweet server and she did a fantastic job at getting us exactly what we needed! Overall, super impressed and will go again when we are back in AZ!

jYAKN5lfGAopu7ekKobxoQ.text: It is definatley time for an update!  after a few dozen ++ visits since last rvw!    Loved the cooking class last week in thier intimate executive room.  Sam Fox was available throughout the evening to give updates on FRC, to answer questions, and serve food.  Was very informative, and alot of fun.  Right now, there is a drop-dead special: 3 courses for $20 - yes, you heard me right: THREE course meal for less than the cost of an entree !!  O.M.G.  can't wait to go back - again, and again, and again.  Oh, HH is now 7 days/wk !   Whoooooooooooooo :-)

5cMeYiBPdmux5UPD09xFXQ.text: Awesome atmosphere. When I went to Olive and Ivy, we just had drinks, however from what I understand, all of the Fox restaurants have excellent food.  I really liked the outdoor seating - right next to the Canal. Nice way to spend a Friday evening having drinks on the patio. And if I remember, they had very reasonable prices. Parking is not too bad, you'll probably end up parking at the garage next to Nordstrom.

mBhYkKxztOjeTnn6Esdemw.text: I like this place a lot.  I have eaten here a handful of times and I enjoyed all of my meal thus far.    You have to go for lunch don't go to dinner because the seen is kind of the same and the lunch menus food tastes a lot better during lunch.  I have not been there in a while but when I went I got grilled lemon chicken with hummus and it was so tasty.  The market place is pretty good, I have only walked through it but saw they had some really good looking stuff to bring home or eat on the go.  Recommendation: to the people at the mall who want to have a nice lunch and enjoy a cocktail, but not for dinner.

rRpCAgyfr9nQ3M24KE_oZQ.text: Perfect spot for afternoon dining on the patio (at least in the spring time).  Nice happy hour menu.  My favorite thing is actually the croissant bought in the morning at their "market".  It is perfect - flaky inside and kind of crispy outside.  Treat yourself to one if you're here.

vChrhqM81shcIxQGevmzrA.text: Great food service and atmosphere. Reasonable pricing.  Wanted to find a nice local restaurant w atmosphere for our last night in Scottsdale. Made reservations for 6:15 on a Thursday and arrived early-- no problem. It did become more crowded quickly.we sat outside on a very pleasant large patio. Service was great. Menu was not huge but food was very good. Especially notable was the Mediterranean salad and the sweet potato cannelloni. Cannelloni was rich and unique. Though my hubby thought it was too sweet. He had mushroom flatbread he thought was awesome. Two in our party had great filling lasagna. We had gelato and brown butter almond cake for dessert. All five in our party gave this place high reviews.

zoGls-HFwokaRFcYu7mMCQ.text: I will definitely return!  -great location (across from Nordstrom at Scottsdale Fashion Square) -lovely atmosphere with great outdoor dining area  -pesto/bread dip was great -cheese platter app was delicious -scallops were perfect -good service

s-AGXDQOgHfDdN5Nc_9PDQ.text: First off, I've got to say that the location and decor of this place is awesome. Great job by whoever is responsible for that. This is a great place for a date, or for brunch with friends on the weekends. The food is excellent and the service is outstanding. I would go more often, but it is a little on the pricy side... but well worth it.

qtGK_uSoXWEWYLWNdutc2A.text: While my buddy Mike Z. was in town, we hit a few high spots...by which I could mean that we were high when we hit them...so munchies:)  But, no...my drug of choice is KetelOne or Bunnahabhain these days:)  One of the high spots was the fabulous Scottsdale Waterfront and Olive and Ivy:)  Of all the things that you can say about the Scottsdale Waterfront the most accurate is that it is, indeed, on the water:)  I grew up in the northwest and then lived in San Francisco for many years...I've dined overlooking the Mighty Columbia, the Mighty Pacific, The Mighty Willamette.  While traveling, I've managed to sup while overlooking the Mighty North Sea, the Mighty Atlantic and the Mighty Mississippi.  I'm probably not a good one to ask about the waterfront appeal of the Mighty Arizona Canal:)  Never the less, Olive and Ivy is a nice enough place:)  It's another Fox Concept (don't you just love the branding and labeling of these kinds of things:)  I suppose it would just be too darn simple to just say "Hey, look!...Sam Fox just opened a new place!:)...Yay!"...or something like that...no, it's a "concept"...and if you know me at all (and most of you don't) you know that restaurant nomenclature is nearly a complete mystery to me.  Fox Concept is no exception (oh, I get the "Olive and Ivy"...it's sort of Mediterranean, with a what...California overbite?:)...is that a concept?  I any event, The Beautiful Carin, Mike and I strolled over for cocktails and dinner, stayed for desert, sat out on the patio (which is very pleasant, BTW:)  And we enjoyed ourselves!  Well, why not...it was an enjoyable evening...pleasant atmosphere... the service was very good (I sometimes wonder if my reputation as a stupid good tipper is being spread around town...I seem to get great service even in places that don't really have a reputation for good service...I don't know...maybe it's just a coincidence:)  At any rate...the concept was hoppin'!:-)  Ton's of terrific people watching...people dining, people strolling along the Mighty Arizona Canal, people doing the hook up dance in the bar...dinner and a show...what a concept! :-)  We each had a couple of marti's (oh, the joys of being able to walk to dinner!:)  We started with a hummus something appetizer and antipasti...The Beautiful Carin and I split a perfectly serviceable Caesar salad and I had a nice risotto, while Carin ordered her standby...roasted chicken (I wish I could remember what Mikey ordered, but I was too busy with my marti's, chit chat and what not:)  After dinner, desert seemed like a reasonable idea:)  Mike and I each had a Porto, while we all shared something chocolate and another something kind of cinnamon and orange...  It was all pretty good, not the best risotto, but good...actually, not the best anything, but still good...all pretty well executed (if not truly inspired)  If Fox's Concept is separating me from my money on a fairly regular basis, then I guess it's a successful concept:)

iyxzArwWGKYzgj2QtC7o8A.text: I took my wife on a date and it was well worth everything. We had fun at the bar, the service was perfect and the food was the best. I will be going back.

ceiFg7cS4WdkhcvVbokfJg.text: Love the venue, it's beautiful!!! The crowd is always fun:)  Food???? uhhhhmmm  I rather eat somewhere else previous, then sip drinks at the bar or patio..  The food is not bad, it's just not great..

IvQeh7lp_Cd3FehUQsk5IA.text: I loved this place! Super friendly servers, great ambiance, I love the food and decor!

2wbSs_GiDa025Mi42e1RCQ.text: This was the first good restaurant my fiance and I had been to since moving to Scottsdale from Seattle. I had a great time and the service was great. We enjoyed a bottle of wine, appetizers, and I absolutely loved their Bacon Wrapped Pork Tenderloin. I highly recommend them for fine dining.

LdD8BY2-eDmdvd6aO8HcDg.text: I've been here a few times now recently and feel comfortable giving them 5 stars. Guess what - we are going to have our wedding rehearsal dinner here too!   If you are looking for a restaurant in Old Town Scottsdale with a big patio area for a large group, this is your place. We are going to be utilizing one of their dining rooms and part of their patio for our private dinner.   In regards to my previous experiences, service has always been exceptional. From the hostess, to the manager, server and events manager - everyone has been helpful and very nice.  Food: At our last visit, we decided to do a tasting of our own. Our favorite appetizer was the lamb meatballs. I enjoyed the bacon wrapped dates but my fiance and his mom thought they were just okay. The bruschetta recommendation from our server had manchego cheese and chorizo - delish! We also filled up on the complimentary foccacia bread and pesto dipping sauce so when it came to the main entree, we decided to split the bacon wrapped pork tenderloin since it was 3 medallions - perfect for the 3 of us.  Drinks: We had a variety of drinks. The one that stood out the most were our dessert cocktails - the espresso martini. It is probably the best espresso martini I have ever had! Definitely looking forward to have more of those!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bacon Wrapped Pork Tenderloin
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lamb meatballs, bacon wrapped dates and bruschetta
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

66DEwnJoJUCsi2ekCe5JDA.text: Absolutely LOVED this spot! From the moment I walked in to the moment I left, I was blown away. The aesthetic is very clean but beautiful with such an incredible patio!!! You seriously have to dine outside if the weather is warm (which is pretty much always is)! We were seated promptly outside and right next to a beautiful little fountain. The sound of the water running was so calming with the warm sun and slight breeze. It's a blissful oasis amongst busy Scottsdale traffic! Our waiter greeted us and brought delicious house made bread to start things off - it is amazing!! My friend and I ordered, both of us having severe allergies to different foods and were delighted to see the ease at which the waiter ensured that nothing we ordered would cause us any issues.   The food came and it was INCREDIBLE. I couldn't stop eating, I think we barely spoke over lunch. You can tell the freshness in each bite and the care that the kitchen puts in - not to mention that the food came out quickly! We ordered salads with protein but were very happy with how quickly it came out and how delicious they both were.   We will absolutely be back! This is a MUST if you're in Scottsdale and in need of a healthy but different lunch - the fusion menu is incredible and it will keep you coming back for more!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

-iwvdW1WwgoVDdZugU1u3w.text: Came here for a brunch to celebrate a friends birthday. First of all the wait was ridiculous, even though we had made reservations we surpassed that time by almost 35 min. The food selection for brunch was not impressive, wouldn't recommend for brunch.

wuj8v6RLSnuToeVkh96GbA.text: Fantastic spot! Great food, great service and awesome modern house/electronic music. It was our first time in Scottsdale and we were pleasantly surprised. Our server, Landiss, went out of his way to make sure we were taken care of. We got the manchego bruschetta as an appetizer , and for entrees we got the wrapped pork tenderloin and the chicken scallopini, which were delicious.  Definitely the top restaurant we went to in our vacation, and will definitely come back if we are in the area.  Also, it seems to be fun going in a big group (ie: birthdays, bachelorette, etc)

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken Scallopini

MCwu2NMtXxQWe0hogz1B2w.text: We needed a brunch spot to eat at before we headed back on the road to go home. We decided on this spot for a nice brunch. We called ahead to see if reservations were needed. They had tables open on the patio but nothing for inside for another hour and half. We decided to take the patio seating since they had misters outside.   The patio was actually quite cool, the building provided a good amount shade plus the umbrellas and misters kept things school. There was also a nice breeze that day that helped. Service was good the waitress checked up on a few times and kept our waters refilled. They also allowed us to bring in our outside drinks. We had stopped by a coffee shop before heading over. Their brunch menu consisted of lunch and breakfast items. I opted for the tuna salad sandwich, with apple, celery, baby greens on toasted wheat bread. Tuna salad was good it was not overly dressed with mayo. I chose a side of fries to go with it. We also had their lamb gyro with grilled pita. It was a little disappointing they used a lamb patty. We were expecting slices of lamb meat. The pita tasted more like a tortilla. The breakfast potatoes were good, the sausage patties were okay.   Overall the food was average nothing special. I did enjoy the patio, were surprised how cool it was for being outside. I was expecting a little since the reviews were so high but it just average.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Egg sandwich
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lamb Gyro with fries
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tuna salad sandwich

nxcdzWaJGFaBku0fHPN4vA.text: I like to try out a restaurant a couple times before posting a review and all three times I've been have been great!   Best thing about Olive and Ivy: THE PESTO CHICKEN FLATBREAD O M G!!! I'm not even a huge fan of pesto because normal it's too pesto-y but they put the perfect amount! Grilled onions and roasted tomatoes are amazing and the pine nuts are a great touch!   Love going there to just hang out at the bar for a drink and flat bread. Service is always really great. Menu is small, not overwhelming at all. Can't wait to go back to try desserts!    This place is a must-try!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pesto Chicken Flatbread - THE BEST EVER!!!!!
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Wine at the bar!

qbULwjpWGsNZN5togr4FcA.text: If you're in town for Spring Training, like we were, you definitely want to try Olive & Ivy. The restaurant is tucked away in a cute shopping strip on the river with a great outdoor patio area.  The menu has a wide variety of options and the drinks do not disappoint! The only downside was that they don't offer brunch on weekdays, which we were looking forward to. But other than that, our server was fantastic and the food was very good. And the pesto dip with bread sticks that they give each table was amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Blood Orange Paloma
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Turkey Grinder Sandwich

fUpQAI_pPizdpYeK02bCmA.text: Awkward Experience... I arrived for happy hour after exploring Fashion Square for most of the day. I liked the look of the happy hour loung  patio so I opted to sit there. New to this area and style of dining, I chose a table that had two ladies. They were about to leave and eagerly handed over their seats. I kicked back and lounged to make myself comfortable before I ordered a drink. The waitresses that weighted my section were incredible. There was a new and a senior waitress who took excellent care of me. Another man came and sat down at the table waiting for a guest. During the next hour if they engaged in conversation and I minded my business ordering a drink and happy hour appetizer-Salmon Lox Bruschetta (A+)!  I left my seat to go to the restroom and returned to find a different couple sitting where the previous two were. They also had a new server who explained her concern for seeing my purse and shopping bag still in the seat where I had only left to use the restroom. When I sat back down the new couple gave me the strangest looks and so did the server when she came over to take the couples order. I did not see my server again for about 20 minutes so I asked the new server if she would be able to take my dinner order. Although she acted like I did not exist at that table, also left me feeling that I did something wrong. I found myself wondering if I should have gotten up and found a different table or if I did something wrong in that situation, i'm still not sure of that answer. The tension was so strong after I placed my dinner order that I just asked for it to go. Eventually I saw my original server when she came over to tell me my food was being prepared to go.  I paid collected my food and my belongings and quietly left not to disturb the couple that was clearly on first date.  I still have zero idea if maybe there was a time limit on the happy hour seating or why I was being dismissed by the server and given strange looks by the new couple at the table. (?)  The food, drinks, ambiance and patio were amazing but the experience and the way I was treated by the new server made me feel awful.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Outdoor Patio
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Salmon Lox bruschetta

2Z1ukOAjjevsWMJBaaVzOA.text: a modern & spacious location on Scottsdale's Waterfront with a delicious lunch menu. we ordered and highly recommend:  3 Bruschetta: Salmon - whipped cream cheese, campari tomato, red onion Prosciutto - fig preserve, port salut Avocado - sweet corn, charred scallion, feta  Kale Salad with bacon, blue cheese, apple, candied pecan tosses in a raspberry vinaigrette   Bacon Wrapped Pork Tenderloin with fingerling potato, swiss chard, smoked onion, sherry jus  not to mention their house focaccia and pesto dip was addicting. our server was very friendly and kind enough to give us a complimentary dessert of our choice; we selected lemon sorbet - so good.  would definitely recommend and visit this spot again.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bacon wrapped pork tenderloin
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Complimentary birthday dessert!
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Kale Salad (half size)

Tzze-zOVTHJlxYqBsZKHvw.text: We were seated promptly despite the place being packed and us not having a reservation. The ambience is chic- perfect for catching up over a drink and small plates. My husband and I split a Mediterranean salad and a flatbread- both delicious and perfectly portioned. Great service ( special should out to our server Trevor!) and good food- we'll be back the next time we're in Scottsdale

ni_cawJEZuUqp9jfsiXyEA.text: Outdoor seating can be cold in the winter and make a reservation! We went on a Tuesday so I thought we wouldn't have a problem getting a table. I was wrong. 45 minutes for a table for two however they do offer the same menu at the bar and the tables surrounding the bar if you're willing to settle. Easy parking underneath with an elevator and stairs. It's a giant footprint and has beautiful views on the patio where we sat. Both heaters were empty of propane which took about 20 minutes to get remedied.   Lacking in apps though and went with 2 pieces of the bruschetta. Both were good but nothing  extraordinary.   The menu does not match the ambiance. It's a wonderful place packed with the charm of retro/industrial shiek, globe lights, thick tall curtains and high ceilings. The menu on the other hand was unimpressive regardless of the fact that everything is made fresh daily.

1323FaBwmuUNUBKjTRjq0Q.text: Fantastic foodie place! Really enjoy the atmosphere and menu here ! The service is very good and they have a great brunch!

kcoOMDLr5bW5KNS2FbYL6Q.text: Love this place!!! The food is consistently good and so is the service. Excellent atmosphere and even better drinks. Highly recommend!

X2r4GptvcJqjeu5xZYjW-w.text: I had such a good dinner here! And I loved the atmosphere! We sat outside, so we had a great view of the Christmas lights and sunset.   I had the margarita flatbread to start with, and it was delicious! It was perfect! That was the best flatbread I've had in my life. For my main entree, I got the natural chicken. While it was good, I think the crimini mushrooms overpowered the dish.   The server was ok. He repeatedly forgot to give me a straw for my soda. I assumed it was because straws were banned (like in SF), but nope. He was just not on top of it.

ITV05EZE-1xlCX_VTvgcRA.text: This restaurant is hands down the best.  Right on the canal in Scottsdale.  Patio seating is wonderful.  Brunch is great.  Peach Bellini is a must very good.  Service is excellent.   Everything is made to order.  Bagels and bread made fresh. Love to come here when in Scottsdale.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Enjoying Peach Bellini with my dear friend.  Great day.

HYc_9pS4QRsjPnNnLCrz9A.text: Where to begin. So the evening started off with a win! We got a parking spot close to the restaurant.   Sat down at the bar and had a great cocktail while waiting on our friends to arrive.  Bar staff was very attentive and friendly.   Once seated we ordered several appetizers bacon wrapped dates, lamb meat balls, calamari.   Dates were stuffed with sausage and had great flavors.  The lamb meat balls were dense but flavorful. The tzatziki sauce was excellent.  The fried calamari and shrimp was very good.   My wife ordered the shrimp scampi risotto, the risotto was cooked with a seafood stock which gave it a rich flavor.   I ordered the bone in ribeye with creamed spinach. Steak was cooked perfectly and the creamed spinach was extra cheesy which gave them a salty flavor that paired with the sweet sauce on the steak.   Overall great place and great food.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

RBzQd2-7LteCz30skl704w.text: Wow! Wow! Wow! I absolutely love Olive & Ivy and I wish I lived closer to their restaurant.   The food: phenomenal, the service: spectacular. From the wine menu, house bread, charcuterie appetizer; the veal ravioli to the desserts...I literally have zero-complaints.   Our server was not only friendly but on top of drink refills and getting our food to us at a very quick-pace considering our table of 5 came in at a busy hour on a Sunday evening.   It's obvious the amount of work and love put into the one-of-a kind meals prepared at Olive & Ivy and that the employees enjoy what they do. Not to mention the perfect ambiance. I'll be back again & again when visiting Scottsdale.

OlfU08_w2cQBgExdm47Gtg.text: Went with three friends for a girls' night.  The ambience was nice but it seemed that every table was in close proximity to a door to the back patio so it got cold with the servers coming in and out.    The food was good- not spectacular- but good.  My friends had the scallops, the lasagna, and the pappardalle.  They liked all of them but none were memorable.  I'm vegetarian and I really wanted a salad with more vegetables than what was offered.  They were very accommodating and created a veggie heavy salad for me which was great.  The complimentary bread and pesto were great and our server refilled it once for us as well.  It was my friend's birthday so they comped us a peanut butter mousse dessert and we also ordered the lemon cake.  Both were good but we probably wouldn't order either again.  Definitely a cute spot for a date night or girls' night.  It is loud and hard to hear though so be prepared to yell in conversation.

wNS7IN3Yr4e6sR6ybi1ULA.text: My family and I were visiting Arizona when this restaurant came recommended by many people we met at our hotel. The ambience and vibe was awesome. The food was good but nothing exceptional. Service was good. I would definitely visit again but would not go out of my way to come here.

zfwo5zLiC-xucrl4ek60Ag.text: Great spot to lose a few hours, nice selection of food and beverages.  The atmosphere is fun, it isn't extremely loud, you can hold a conversation, very nice spot.

gUDM0qp50ywtpnQMto-6vw.text: This has to be my favorite Fox Foods Chain of Restraunts. The atmosphere is lively. Food is consistently good and they are very accomodating for food allergies. Drinks were very good and the gelato is even better.  OLIVE & IVY has a beautiful out door cafe area whether your dressed casual or putting on the Ritz you will feel comfortable. They also have a quick grab and go Bistro area  if you are in the mood for coffee latte and pastry.You will not be disappointed!

WZRi14JRxME4vnwchpwjSg.text: We always try to find a new place to eat when we come here, especially for breakfast - most important meal!!  We walked in and this place is a place after my own heart. My partner and I shared The Classic Egg Sandwich; avocado, bacon, white American cheese, mayo, all on a toasted brioche bun, with some breakfast potatoes on the side.  So. Damn. Good.   I'm not sure I would be able to eat it all on my own, but I'd sure try!!  Next time I come I want to try the Caramelized Brussels Sprouts Flatbread (glazed sweet potato, chevre, smoked pistachios) *drool*

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. So many things I want to try... can I have one of everything?

trcHhrNndY5dcpEsC_bPkA.text: I've loved this place for years but hadn't been in a long time because of an injury. I forgot how GOOD everything is here!! First of all, the homemade bread and pesto are just amazing and so addicting. Two of us ordered the Chicken Scallopini and it was so delicious!!!! It's like a Madeira chicken but only lightly sauced and lightly breaded which is perfect, not too heavy. It's hard to find a good chicken dish that's not dry and doesn't have sketchy chicken pieces but this one was perfect!! It has two thin chicken breasts and has lots of delicious veggies in it, highly recommend. My dad got the bone in ribeye and really liked it!! Plus if you sign up for their e-club you can get $10 off of your meal of $20 or more. Great atmosphere, amazing location, great food and really awesome service from our super attentive server! (I will edit if I can find my receipt with his name on it!) Our server recommended the Chicken Scallopini and I'm SO glad he did. We actually ordered a third order of that dish to go to split the next day. And our server even sent lots of bread and pesto home with us!! Overall, awesome experience!

5Xjk5ZvBe2HFf7seCMM5sQ.text: Bomb!! Amazing food great patio, always good service.  I am local & live 2 miles away and this place is one of my FAVORITES.  It is a bit pricey but very good food.

MardM9__3Gv8qECq90fM3g.text: On a trip to celebrate a grand son's birthday, my daughter suggested this place. The server had that perfect blend of professionalism and friendliness. The food was perfectly done also. I was very pleased and would not hesitate to go there again.

ijAHy-SSLjh_KqlDXHrRLA.text: Best place to eat in Scottsdale! Strongly recommend reservations unless you'd like to wait a couple hours. Definitely worth the planned trip!

y_xK4dyrbejGWVhxu7jdkw.text: Beautiful place, great food. Aside from the fire tables on the outside almost burning my hair from her putting it on while I was looking at the rocks haha it was a great experience. Not her fault, just funny.

Pm7XoSknqaQTr_I1DoddMg.text: Very good! We were told 45 minute wait and I think we waited 15 minutes. We've been before and we will always go back! Service was so good and a so fast! The music and atmosphere was popping!

MKujHuJC8fLkU3Wt588liQ.text: Great ambiance, great food and great service, loved it and will come back soon.  Thank you for a delicious FREE desert ( double bake chocolate cake) it was perfect they way I like it ( not to sweet).  I loved the bread and the pesto spread, yum!  The veal ravioli was excellent, but a bit to salty for my taste. The beet salad was perfect, the lasagna was excellent and the red sangria was good but not great.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lasagna
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

uRq75rhRT6MVuo2hi5X5Qw.text: By far my favorite restaurant in Scottsdale! Love the outdoor patio at this place, very trendy and relaxed. The salmon is also amazing and my favorite item off the menu. Definitely worth it for the price.

XuB4LHmMDIvMz2iV_sascA.text: The food was absolutely delicious!  Had the bone in ribeye.  Only complaint was the slow service. We were there for 2 hours and it should have been 1 hour tops.

f548t1ClwXpWH2_qPv-B-A.text: Always the most amazing lunch! There kale salad and hummus and frito misto are to die for!! The atmosphere and service is always on point!

l_Y-sUqP8jBmQyleJTEQoQ.text: Always a fantastic time the service is fantastic if only the hostesses can loose the attitudes then this place would be 5 stars! Their bacon wrapped dates are my favorites we live across the street so trust me when in doubt olive and ivy it out!!

0XmtdLqtuSyz7d-CKByZKg.text: Olive and Ivy is one of our favorite places to go! Always great service and food!! If we have ever had a small issue the management staff has always been on top of it and fixes it. I highly suggest coming here. Weekend brunch is my favorite but there dinner menu is delish as well!

65ul3aGzw7Py_A0gUt5wGA.text: Omg this was so good.  I was in the area for work, and I was told to go to Old Town Scottsdale for dinner.  My colleague and I stumbled upon this place randomly and was rather impressed by the great service and food.  The bruschetta was amazing! The shrimp risotto to die for, and steak wonderful as well.  The ambiance, like a beautiful picture. The only problem we encountered that was quickly fixed was my colleague's steak was requested medium well. As he approach the center it became a bit on the rare side. But management took care of it right away and put it back on the grill, and it was cooked to perfection.  Will definitely be back the next time I find myself in Scottsdale.

g0G3ndewmZ3Fkn7_0wYg8A.text: Honestly, you can tell the level of attention that goes into every dish, which is uncommon. Have never had a bad experience at Olive and Ivy.

EstkCl5ys-4E71L-uGrZ9w.text: Olive and Ivy is a great place as a venue inside and outside. Over the years they have slowly raised their prices on food items but it is still a great place none the less. I personally think they have a better lunch menu than dinner menu but you can just decide that for yourself. The turkey grinder and chicken panini are my favorite. On weekends get a drink from their brunch menu.

k_JMb9D9Zs6yyV7DbiseLw.text: We had our anniversary dinner here and were very pleased with the service and the location. We started with an amazing flat bread pizza along with their fresh pesto and bread. I ordered the scallops which were recommended by our waiter. I'd have to say they were the most perfectly cooked scallops I've ever had. The lasagna my husband ordered was good but my scallops were better. Do your self a favor, order them! Also the burnt honey ice cream was crazy good.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

RfQlDKEY8fQASaJTG1sZ-A.text: My second or third time going to this restaurant first time was mediocre the second time was my birthday and I had an amazing time just because the staff treated me and my guest with utmost respect and we got the room in the back so we had a really good time. So this last time we were just there this past Saturday night for dinner and I can say I was server John was perfect. Because I am vegan vegetarian there was nothing on the menu that I could have eaten so he suggested a alternative dinner option and I got the Catalonia(sp). It was very very tasty and for dessert I had the sorbet. Everyone said the food was OK however the choices for dinner could have been much better. Everyone came to the consensus that the brunch menu is way better than that dinner menu. I just wish that the restaurant would be able to have better options for groups of parties I understand it's easier to have one menu or two menus but if I am going to be paying 50 or $60 I think the food choices and the servings should be just a little bit better tasting.   All in all I will be back but not for dinner most likely just back for brunch!

Lj74NV726Px5f_MXsrFC-A.text: I normally have a great things to say about restaurant...however, brunch was different today.  I was told by friends that they were dog friendly...but the waitress didn't act accordingly.  We felt uncomfortable and unwelcome.  Our food came quickly from the kitchen but without salt and pepper on the table we had to flag down the server to ask for it and by the time it arrived our food was cold.  Might not go back.  Too many other options in Old Town.

uvUDghAdeyKviH0Xnpwngw.text: What a fantastic night! we arrived way too early and were made quite comfy on the patio around a fire table.  Great conversations with others who were waiting and a fun server named Nikki.  When I told her I was the designated driver for the evening she winked at my wife and said..."Well someone has to be in charge"...and then high fived my wife and said..."and someone has to be in charge of having fun!" We were shown to our table at exactly our reservation time and were greeted by John.  He had a wonderful sense of humour as we joked about the weather and how so many people end up in Arizona.  He was attentive and made a great recommendation on a wine pairing for my wife. There was no rush and our little table by the canal was a perfect place to spend the evening. We will be back!

FcwJ4EzpQfLqChnDFnDFww.text: This is my favorite place in downtown Scottsdale. Great severs and great atmosphere. The food it's amazing.

d31mnIBuQrZ2fCuQZ7YVGw.text: I've been eating here on and off for years, and always enjoy returning to see the menu changes. The patio is my go to, every time.   I don't usually write reviews (see all of the one review I've written previously), but the service tonight justified the effort. Brandon was, without a doubt, worth the time put into this. He recommended great options, and answered all of our questions thoughtfully and thoroughly. We were incredibly indecisive on wine, and he made great suggestions - in several different price ranges. He was even quite patient waiting for us to make our final decisions in both wine and food.  Bruschetta was yummy, as always, and the scallops were tender and delicious. Finished off with the (well recommended) blood orange sorbet.   What a wonderful night, and thank you to Brandon for making it so.

QJQY5PXyNqqimsaH7IuWIA.text: My ex fiance and I, really enjoyed this place the food was amazing and we got to talk to the chef with our dinner. My Ex and I were both chefs in other kitchens so having a date night and getting to talk to the chef was nice. Atmosphere was great and we sat at the table looking into the kitchen.

GaUUlo3Taqqr6rYAOtynQQ.text: Customer service was great!!!!!  Friendly staff (wish I caught our cashiers name to mention it), the food came out really really fast, and the guy that dropped it off was really helpful and nice too.  The bread and pesto is complimentary in the restaurant and $2 to add to a deli item in the "market" half of this place...get it...it's delicious!!!!   We enjoyed our Greek gyro lamb sandwich very much, and added a $2 side salad which was simple and delicious.  We should had gotten two salads.  Highly recommended!

WRoFi4UDkGuDbI0CRuWNjA.text: Popped in for late night drinks and a bite to eat. Though it was busy the food was terrific and service was great! Nice atmosphere!

aizEbP7BYtltSL7llqFDSQ.text: This is definitely a five star review. Reservations were smooth, check in easy. We were seated promptly and when asked at the last minute to sit outside, they were very nice about it. The ambiance is a bit dark inside, and slightly noisy, but very warmly decorated with a great atmosphere to it. Outdoor seating is a must as long as it has cooled some, which it had. It was just perfect. The patio is decorated very lovely, cozy, and it's spacious, great for groups, and there are misters.  A must try are: The prosciutto and fig appetizer The sea bass entree, light and creamy  The salmon, cooked perfectly and seasoned with this delicious honey like glaze and beats, yum! I was five seconds away from ordering a second salmon entree it was just that great The desserts, amazing! A must try: The toasted coconut cakes with mint chocolate chip ice cream Their blackberry balsamic ice cream amazing! All fish made.  If you come to Scottsdale you cannot leave without stopping by for dinner. Trust me it's a winner!

fdKpju9hp-hzO79T4Voaww.text: This is a very nice place to take someone you really like on a first date. The food is healthy and they are very cautious if you have allergies. They took my nut and shellfish allergies very seriously, making sure to customize my food and prevent contamination. This is definitely more on the pricey side, but worth the quality and ambiance.

74K-lps0L6jtLWvclYxcfg.text: Love, love love! I love this patio! It sure doesn't feel like you are in Arizona... It is a breath of life from wine country. You can see the European influence, but also the laid back, sitting on a good friends vineyard patio where beyond the trees is rolling hills, orchards and elegant rural life. All this and only steps away from the lavish Scottsdale Mall! The menu is well thought out and a certain amount of effort was clearly put into the bruschetta list's 6 tempting creations: All refined and elegant in their execution and piled high with toppings. The bruschetta sell for $4-$5 each, or 3 for $11 - A hell of a deal! And be sure to try the Manchego with quince & Spanish chorizo, aaah-mazing!   The other wonderfully yummy price point find is the single scoop of in-house made sorbets and gelatos, $1.75 for a single scoop! I had the lemon butter cream and it was divine. Rich, creamy, with a lovely lemon finish.   The wine list is thorough and poignant. There are not 6 different Chardonnays and 4 Sauv blancs. But approximately 9 whites and 12 reds by the glass with only 1 selection of each type of grape: One fabulous vintage for all occasions! I really adore this concept.   The restaurant is inviting and as large as the desert that surrounds this city. My server was outstanding, you rock Lauren!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Trio of bruschetta: Mozzarella. Spinach &amp; goat. And the Manchego!

ef221hPGYqvW9c0AO0EiTA.text: I live in Scottsdale and this is easily one of my favorite restaurants! Everything is top notch; the food, cocktails, service, ambiance, etc. I have never had a less than wonderful experience here. I love coming here for brunch or dinner. Some of my favorites are the bruschetta (mozzerella is the best), the scallops, chicken scallopini, and bacon wrapped dates, and for brunch the ivy sausage sandwich and the smoked salmon.

LMgmEyxC0RkL2OJZ9MYkHQ.text: Although the  food reviews may be stellar, I could just not eat here.    I am not sure what Olive and Ivory wants to be - a restaurant  or  dance club - What I experienced was mor  like a dance club for foodies than an actual restaurant.   I could not hear a word the table server was saying about the menu, and I could not see the menu without a small torch lamp .  What I could read on the menu were not meals , but , rather , experiments in fusions of various traditional world foods.  Good if your into tapas type dining.  This place looked and felt like a snooty pick-up spot devoid of any real sustenance.

p3vDRWk5bsZA2b4muWIjFA.text: Loved this place!!! Awesome atmosphere. Had drinks and apps by the fire pits.  Got a bunch of food to share and all was so good. Waiters were awesome and the bill came out reasonably for a group of 4. I wish we had this place in Dallas.

QJHk4cusaudPKJHZs9E4iA.text: I like the fact, as opposed to Culinary Dropout, that every dude at Olive and Ivy does NOT have a beard! Good job guys Not over the top trendy And good old fashioneds too We went for happy hour and wanted to try all the specials

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bar view

2ImfjGzm4wBW7DCRA9Xi0A.text: Love, love, love this place. The Marketplace as well as the main restaurant. Had coffee every morning here while we were vacationing. Great espresso and friendly service. We especially loved their patio out back that overlooks the canal and into Old Town Scottsdale. Allie at the hostess stand is fabulous.

FeI7geHQJBKhUEqcsXosVg.text: Bruschetta (pumpkin and kale) = excellent Bruschetta (mozzarella) = excellent. Lamb gyro = so so  Misto frito = good but not great  Service = so so

RYFua0MwQJbwK1e3GmWmQQ.text: Had a family Sunday brunch there. We all ordered our food and waited patiently for our food. When our meals were delivered the waiters told my 11 year old granddaughter they were out of what she ordered, and proceeded to give us our meals while she didn't get hers. I cannot believe he didn't come to let us know before. So while we ate she sat and watched. When she then decided to order a muffin and asked what kind they had, he read off the list. She told him which one she wanted and he came back 5 minutes later telling her they were out of those too. NEVER AGAIN WILL WE GO BACK. For a server to deliver meals and then telling someone they were out of what she ordered is totally unacceptable,  but to do it to a child is worse.

UQmts0aCOGp_Qhm1FJR9Cw.text: This is a much needed update review for Olive & Ivy, the initial 3.5-star rating has been long passed to a very solid 4-star!   I can't count how many times I have been back here, for many different occasions, Olive & Ivy has always been one of the top choices for its food, ambiance, service and location. I always enjoyed the beginning course of bread and pesto dip/sauce, the latest addition of the ribeye seems to be one of our favorites by the group of friends.   Look forward to my next visit :)

IFzufXs6Dmr6_zCEQpVpbQ.text: Fancy place. Amazing food made right in front of your eyes. We had a blast and enjoyed the food.

J0i3XYqVE6NExXgBibIuog.text: Get the sweet potato cannelloni! Its delicious. If you are having brunch try the yogurt with granola and fruit.

-DPadQmo7tn_cbuwm5yWAQ.text: Olive & Ivy never fails to disappoint! I've been there for business meetings, date night and meeting up with friends, and it's always great! It's definitely one of my favorite Fox Restaurants, and the Scottsdale location is right on the Waterfront in Old Town.   If you're visiting, it's great in the summer or winter, but especially good when you can dine outside. You can also walk from Olive & Ivy to the rest of Old Town, without having to take another cab.  My recommendations include:  -bacon wrapped dates - just phenomenal here! -bruschetta - lots of options, and some claim that they're the best in town. I like the fig & prosciutto.  -scallops - creamed corn and bacon gastrique? So good! -the filet - I haven't had this yet, but my co-workers said it was the best filet that they've had in AZ. At $39, it's not cheap, but these guys know steak and were thoroughly impressed!  Visited September 2015

GRa425YRBuKpDwAMZ_J05g.text: Lunch was Amazing! Waiter Highly Recommended to try the hummus, and it literally was the best I have ever tasted!

UAucbAp5kxM-8HmRDawB_w.text: This place has a good, not overly complicated menu. I've tried the steak, salmon, chicken, and pork for dinner. All delicious, so I keep returning. The service is good and I love sitting out in the patio for dinner. One of my favorites in Scottsdale.

x6hsPfg065wuEXjKrz5m1g.text: It has been years since I set foot at Olive & Ivy mainly because I had been distracted by life's other attractions.  A friend reintroduced me to O & I this past weekend and I couldn't believe how much I had been missing out.  It's just an authentic, large but quaint space.  From inside to the outdoor patio, all you can see is happiness and tastiness.  We were a rather surprising, large group of chatty women but Mark, our patient waiter, served us graciously.  Olive & Ivy, go there for a happy time.

BIWdvTahBzwMb6pEgzgSNQ.text: Amazing food!  We had the Shrimp Rissotto... A must have!  The Mediterranean salad with Shrimp and the cheese and mushroom flat bread.  The service was top class.  I will return!

-dU_4yN6hLNMI8qYb65Trw.text: Wonderful lunch while on vacation.  The food was very fresh, the outside patio was super quaint and great view on the water. Our server Matt was exceptional.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

nmBW0hEp-JCuzpROSP7tQQ.text: Food wand ambiance was phenomenal - Amanda was a great server she was so nice and knowledgeable !

JJRFcFKHy3aQdaWm4x5FNw.text: The Fox family of restaurants hits another home run on this concept!   Great food and service as usual from this great restaurant company.   Very hip and cool setting on the Scottsdale waterfront.  Great patio!

0fMh4PpC2Oq2tXfmg08CzA.text: We came for dinner just before 6 on a Thursday. I had noticed they had happy hour until 6, but the hostess informed us this was only at the bar. We could have saved a few $$ if we had just done that, but honestly the food was so good I didn't feel bad paying more.   Bread was brought to our table and served with a pesto dipping sauce - I ate the remainder of the sauce with my hands it was so good.  We ordered the Mediterranean salad and piccante flatbread. I also ordered a red sangria - which was different from normal sangria since it had crushed berries it it - but it was one of the best sangrias I've ever had. The salad and flatbread were delicious. The salad was big and worth the price - flatbread was good but maybe a better deal on the happy hour menu since it was smaller than expected.   The food was the perfect portion so we still had room for dessert. We decided on the coconut cakes with blood orange sorbet. This is probably gross but I honestly did not want to swallow my cake - I kept it in my mouth like a fine red wine and savored every last piece.   This restaurant needs to come to Chicago - I would be all over it like white on rice.

J6GhhUfQOArDNwv0G3X6Zw.text: Great spot in Scottsdale! We couldn't get a table so we opted for seats at the bar. Entire staff was awesome and very knowledgable. We had fig and dates, flatbread and shared a salad. Great upbeat vibe! Check it out!  Would def suggest making a reservation!!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bar scene

cW0hSoSugIpIt0Q7xXWcig.text: Olive and ivy remains my favorite restaurant. Their menu changes with the season, but the ahi with snap peas and the cannelloni sweet potato pasta ..my mouth is watering as I type. Their bread and pesto is incredible. They have a few cocktails I really love, and the view is killer.

DFSPu8Tavd-uPr_mYT5DWA.text: Just moved to Scottsdale in May. My favorite type of food is breakfast. Olive and Ivy has the best French toast in town. On top of this is the great service behind the marketplace counter! The manager (with the beard) is always pleasant with his genuine appreciation for every guest. I frequent this spot and have yet to have a negative experience. Try the parfait served fresh daily with a hint cinnamon. Don't miss out.

DJl5C0sEXpshItx-HDNhPg.text: Always a great place for brunch or lunch! Food is good, the service is always on point.

YvOWzXv19e0eisnT72wEuA.text: Amazing!! That is the best word to describe this place!! Everything was perfect from walking I to the fun ambiance, to the perfect drinks and the most amazing food! Not a thing was wrong. Great service and such a knowledgeable waiter!!! Please bring this place to Houston!!!!!

QS4trlusrGKRf9CxNOzytA.text: If you ever find yourself walking into Olive and Ivy, especially if you're on a first date with a pretty young lady; by God you better hope Clenard Hardy walks into your life. Let me briefly tell you about my evening on June, 30th 2016 as its one I sincerely appreciate and won't forget! It's started with an off menu personal creation of his own, which you have to ask him about if you have the pleasure of his service. It was one heck of a recommendation that I'd gladly wheel my grandmother to the side to enjoy again. Also, I assume he has some sort of magic crystal ball in his pocket because his timing was impeccable. The entire experience was effortlessly enjoyable. Thank you Clenard for aiding me in a fantastic evening with a beautiful lady.

MkgrniNNk-rw7ec0fVXVFw.text: The food was amazing we were able to be seated outside.  The staff was friendly and the vibe was upbeat.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

sg3O9P5dAbyCZq_PyWGbeQ.text: I come here almost every day for lunch and I have been satisfied with the service and the food every time. If you are new to the restaurant, it have to try the chopped salad WITH GRILLED CHICKEN. I never thought I would say I crave a salad but this one is delicious.

cyNNF1jJxwIdPF43EhC17Q.text: This is a hipster place with great atmosphere and pretty good food. The service was good considering they were really busy, all the employees were extremely friendly. I got the fungi trifoliate flatbread with a glass of red wine and my aunt got the duck confit flatbread with the red sangria. She raves about the sangria which has a nice tartness to it. Our flatbreads would have been amazing if they hadn't been so burned. You expect flatbread to be a little black around the edges, but I'm talking completely burnt around the entire edges. Bummer. If not for that I would've given the place five stars.

HPcuQUwAtxChkLGPrxEAlQ.text: Much needed lunch date with my good friend!  Olive and Ivy is always a great idea. The food is delicious - always consistent. The patio is very comfortable and I love the lights and trees.   My go to is  the bacon cheese burger & of course the bread and pesto . Jason was our server today. You should request him, he's very easy going and pleasant. He  provided great service and everything was wonderful.   I need to come here more often!  Wish they sold the bread and pesto in the market area!

zAEzuEfCU419QdQig1bN-g.text: Definitely one of my fav place!!! What can I say - love the restaurant, love the food! The staff are pleasant & helpful. I have yet to be disappointed w/ this place!!!

w_eKaKc_nv1J6V2_RCQOaw.text: Ordered our food server got it wrong but offered us a free pastry to make up for it! Didn't matter everything was absolutely fantastic! Good Buisness!

526Ld0d8ELl0xkhSZVgxDA.text: Refused to give water to young teen & referred her to PF Changs.  Olive & Ivy handled this poorly, unprofessionally & pathetically.   PF Changs didn't even hesitate to give her the water.  That's why I ate there instead.

Z_yEg1mJBu2K0PAkxdK1Lg.text: I've been here twice now..once for my birthday years ago and once for brunch more recently. Here are my opinions:  - nice atmosphere...I especially enjoy the counter where you can order brunch items - interesting people-watching (can you say "Scottsdale"?) - decent food options, but nothing that really excites me - great service on both visits - comfortable patio with lots of lounging areas - cool location being close to Fashion Square and Old Town - nothing bad to say, but nothing outstanding either  Will I be back? Maybe, but it wouldn't be my first choice.

NHIHCK382BeJT2r29Gcxnw.text: Love love love!!! Having no expectations I fell in love immediately, loved our waiter Tommy - he should own the place, we felt at home, relaxed and ready to eat and drink - HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!

hvCMEBCJKIaIW1z3kY2Vqw.text: 5 stars for the GELATO!!!!!!!!  Market and swanky dining room.  Everything I ate was delicious and thoughtful.  My heirloom tomato salad was kind of funny, though.  There were multi colored hunks of tomato (which were superbly fresh and flavorful), chunks of avocado, big thick wedges of lettuce, and 2 bacon strips placed on top.  lol.  It was all amazingly fresh and tasty, but it was just funny.  It looked like they had forgotten to chop everything up and put it into a salad. I still loved it.  My friend's potatoe-y soup (cannot remember what it actually was) tasted flavorful and hearty.  All the bruschettas and breads with pesto were out of this world.  Great wines.  AND THEN.  $1.75 humongous cups of gelato.  With 3 flavors all tucked in there. And a shortbread cookie that made me weep tears of joy.  Seriously.  You can't even get the same amount of crappy froyo for $1.75.  Go eat the gelato.  Especially the PB&J flavor!!! AAAAHHH!!! SO TASTY!!!!

OW6WLn_qDw-48wD8Wvl5wA.text: Had brunch here today and asked for an indoor seat. We were seated very quickly at a very nice table. Ambience in this restaurant is really nice and the decor is really classy. The food was very tasty; however, I have to say the best part of the whole dining experience was our server, Josh. He was super friendly and very attentive to detail.  He gave us the best sellers and answered all the questions we had about the menu.  I will definitely come back to Olive and Ivy when back in town and I hope I am able to request Josh as our server!!! He is definitely an asset to the restaurant!

sSP9lJJnXbvAmmhVLrpOpw.text: Perfect date night restaurant! Try to get a seat on the patio it is very romantic. Our food was amazing and the waiter made us laugh and was very attentive. We had the best time here!

iUIHacnluDAHIJgZBb_hWQ.text: Before I lived in PV, I use to drive from Flagstaff (2.5 hrs away) just to come and visit this restaurant! The pesto and bread is amazing! Then, the friendliest staff, is just a pleasure to be waited from, comes to the table, full of information, to take your order. I've eaten just about everything and if not me, the people I've recommended to come, have, all saying that this place has great food for the price. I love the sweet potato cannelloni with spinach and mushrooms. It's so different but so so tasty. Also, being right next to the water, the outside patio is gorgeous and old Town Scottsdale is right behind them. I hope this helps you make up your mind for a great lunch or dinner experience!

erw33pTDJZ3JFHBeSjCM-g.text: Sometimes I really wish I could live in Scottsdale. I met up with two girlfriends there and we had a great time! This visit was a solid 3-4. We went in to take advantage of their happy hour (if you don't the prices seem wayyyy to steep for me). Anyway, if you take advantage of their happy hour you must sit either in the outside patio or the lounge. Now the outdoor patio was beautiful! Prettiest outdoor seating I have seen ever. But not when it is 104 out. (and there are no misters). Why did we sit outside do you ask? Because the bar area (which is tiny) filled up super fast (duh. its yummy!) The indoor ambiance is beautiful. (a little dark) The most awesome lights ever are in there. The service was good and the location is nice (right next to the free parking too!)  I tried the featured white wine, and whatever it was (sorry I forgot) was good! My friend tried the sangria, but I was not a fan. Weird flavor compared to most sangrias that I can't describe.   Now onto the food. People who raved about the flatbread pizzas...I have no idea what you are talking about.  I had the margharita and it was just not good. Soggy and flavorless. The hummus was very yummy. Needed more pita with it. Now onto the star of the show: the bruschetta. The vine ripe tomato is yummy. The apple caponata is just as yummier, and the prosciutto and fig was also excellent! Ohhhh so yummy! This is the place to get bruscetta and wine after a long day.

lUdm2d1TOJH4Sycg-rGuIw.text: Olive & Ivy is always packed due to their delicious food, atmosphere, and great prices. The few times that I have been there the staff has always gone out of their way to accomodate my group of friends. I highly recommend the lasagna there!

L3kt9J646g_xW_-uhiTZUA.text: We were visiting from Minnesota and found this adorable place for lunch. This restaurant is amazing  it's absolutely beautiful and I have never had better food or better service. Melinda was the sweetest server ever. She was never overbearing but was always there when we needed her. We were celebrating a bride-to-be and they gave her a complimentary desert and wrote Congratulations on the plate! I would absolutely come back if I was ever in Scottsdale again!

EHHNbsq3wHOWvkkG-ogyGg.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE!  Went here on a suggestion by a local socialite and boy were we oh so pleased! This place is soo cute at night on the inside with all the hanging lights rustic feel and the deejay, which played amazing music. We sat outside under the cute trees with strung lights. I was so in love with the look of this place. You can come with friends or on a date and it works! And service was excellent!  The food was very creative and if I was local I would be here every week to try all the food and hang out on patio with a glass of wine! Wish I had this place in Miami...it would be a success here! We had the watermelon avocado goat cheese salad, fungi flat bread, bacon wrapped dates, arugula artichoke salad, shrimp with corn risotto, and the scallops...all hands down incredible! Love the menu!   My only question is this place is in water front...where the hell is the water anyway??

50ki6ulAZYx9uCI-OpjOSw.text: The service was great and the ambiance is awesome. Would try again for that alone.  But the pesto that comes with the focaccia was salty, and the trio of bruschettas we chose (asparagus, vine ripe tomato, funghi) were all unbearably sweet. Cheese tortelli has a twinge of sugar as well. I dont understand why everything was sweet :/ I dont like my savory food to be sweet too, so I was a little disappointed.  The strawberry cheesecake gelato on the other hand, which I WANTED to be sweet, was to die for. yum.

7sqvM-EfoTNAnmm1GCziCg.text: My husband and I came here last night for the first time. We entered through the gelato side, not knowing where the dinner hostess was located. The girl working the gelato bar immediately greeted us and escorted us to the proper side. What happens next is what really irritated me. As we were walking towards the hostess stand there were two girls staring at us blankly. No "welcome!, how many?, how can we help you?"...nothing. I'm sorry but if you are in your 20s, you should know how to greet guests when they walk into a restaurant. I'd recommend some better training for the hostesses.   Other than that...our waiter was friendly and our food was great. The veal and spinach ravioli was the best I ever had.

Znfh5pXY8GgmxVWtC8JnfQ.text: Been here a few times now and while I have never been overly impressed I have always been satisfied. Came recently with my family for breakfast/brunch and got the eggs benedict (my favorite breakfast). The eggs came out perfectly cooked with just the right amount of hollandaise sauce. The flavors were good if not spectacular. I did really enjoy the potatoes as they were a bit more flavorful then normal breakfast potatoes.   I also had a bloody mary (little hair of the dog from the previous night). It was not as spicy as i liked but well flavored and had plenty of vodka to do the trick.  If you are looking for something in the area stop by and try it out. Like I said you won't be blown away but odds are you won't be let down either. Also sit on the patio if you can it's pretty nice out there.

K4OxFU9vnYXTM2Lr7yxi3A.text: Just had lunch here and it was delish, I had the salmon Caesar salad and my brother had the turkey pastrami sandwich...YUM YUM...Service was great too..Look forward to going back here when I'm in Scottsdale!

8gcDbcnYS3eH9-xzit2hvg.text: I came here last Saturday night with my family and I'm not sure what we were thinking but we didn't try to make a reservation until 2:00pm. That left us with 2 options- 5:15 and 9:15. Neither were appealing, but I really wanted to try this restaurant, so we went with the 5:15 sitting. It certainly felt strange eating that early, but I quickly got over that once I started to taste the food.  The first problem I had with this restaurant was that everything looked so good. My family and I must have spent a good 10 minutes optimizing our order. We coordinated a strategic attack on the menu making sure that we got to try at least one thing form every part of the menu.  We started with a Bruschetta and the Pesto Flatbread. The bruschetta was alright, a little small in terms of portions but our waiter did try to tell us. It was the Pesto Flatbread was what everyone at our table fought over. It was much larger than the bruschetta and had the creamiest, most delicious goat cheese on top.   We then had a mixture of salads and entrees. I wasn't feeling all that hungry (remember- it was 5:15) so I just got a simple green salad. Let me tell you for $5 that was a pretty reasonable sized salad and their simple vinaigrette was very flavorful.  My family members were all very happy with their dishes as well (sweet potato cannelloni, big eyed tuna, and the natural chicken), but the real winner of the evening was the Sangria.  We ordered a pitcher of Red Sangria (tempranillo, cassis, blackberry, raspberry, strawberry) to start with and even considered ordering more. It had a lovely sweetness to it that came from the fruits and it was very addicting. I will definitely be ordering that again.  I can definitely see myself coming here again and trying their other salads and their white sangria too.

BTtBGzngmKqeTXwTlmZeTg.text: Ryan G. is my dude. The restaurant is breathtakingly beautiful- from the hanging lights to the nice patio with music and fire pits. Thankfully Ryan is an intelligent guy and helped guide us through our meal as we were a little overwhelmed by all the choices. We ordered the Irish Blood & Honey and the Belvedere Blue to drink. Fritto Misto and bruschetta to start, followed by scallops and sea bass entrees. We were blown away by everything we ate, especially the seafood dishes. The depth of flavor was awesome. Ryan stopped to chat about our meals and told us how much he loves working in a from-scratch restaurant. We finished with the tres leches cake and left stuffed and amazed. 5 stars for decor, food, and amazing service. We are so excited to come back, and we'll request Ryan when we do.

8vGl8MyLUl_VTgbMd7sFZg.text: Good food, great atmosphere and friendly staff made this a great choice. Bruschetta was a hit as were the bacon wrapped dates. Will definitely be back next time I'm in town!

GhYXAKa4FF3y5jzoNA2GeQ.text: Came here for brunch on a Saturday afternoon.  Ordered the breakfast burrito and a side of fruit.  We sat out on the patio.  It was a beautiful day and the farmer's market was going on so there were a lot of people walking around.  The food and service at Olive & Ivy was great.
