My breakfast burrito (with egg whites) was delicious.  I also liked the potatoes that it came with and the fruit that I ordered was very fresh.  The service was on point too.  Overall a good experience and I would definitely come back.

Wu5SfNqrYiCL_Lck6WcwIA.text: This is place has an incredible patio view in downtown Scottsdale. The food was delicious and the view from the patio is awesome. It's one of the busiest places in the area, so there's something to be said about that. We saw lots of people waiting to be seated so a reservation is merited.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

KvPeRky_UMHRvwGQ9rOtOw.text: Right on the river near the fashion district in Scottsdale. The outdoor seating is pleasant but the river view is block by a wall and vegetation. Midday they give you a limited menu then tell you no meat or fish is being severed. We got an appetizer plater it was OK but a lot of bread and nothing was special. There is a lot of unique dining options in this area, I don't see any reason to return.

BaeL-VjyHT55oXPG-w0_JA.text: Very Rude!! We were visiting out of town. Traveling All day, We were very tired and probably not the best dressed. Needless to say, they treaded is so very disrespectful and so dismissive!! The blond  hostess was so Mean and Rude & lied about reservations. We came In and asked for table and she stated none available. We counted over 20 tables open. Not the way a business should be run!! Will Never be back and will tell 10 of my friends who will tell 10 of There's . So not cool, It doesn't matter how much money you have or don't. Everyone should be treated the same, but not here!! They should be ashamed!!

Iz-XugLUyr-QF02jw6iSXg.text: Visiting tourist.  The ambiance is really cute, service was a little bit slower but I think that's just common for Scottsdale. Good for large groups.   Highlight of my night was eating their house made pesto, I'm pretty sure I ate a jar's worth! LOL  Things I ate: Bread + pesto: 5 Lasagna: 3 Seabass: 4.5 Scallops: 3.5  Ambiance: 5 Service: 4 Food: 4 for Scottsdale

hcw0-PLteeGUo9kojC5Ojw.text: The service is amazing here. The staff is friendly and genuine. I often pop in to grab a pastry or croissant to go. It's easy and always fresh and delicious. It's reasonable as well...under 5 bucks and I'm satisfied.

XOE7c1xdFT5EhjdyG1K3NA.text: The best date night restaurant you can ever go to! The bread and pesto are so damn good and if you go for dinner you have to try the chicken scallopini! I love this place.

cAMef1SrBoG3JxjQnPGpkA.text: We went here for dinner on Saturday. This place gets busy so definitely use Opentable to book reservations. There was a DJ serving up jams. The ambiance was nice & the restaurant is definitely posh. We had a bottle of Prosecco which was crisp & smooth. We ordered the lasagna...AMAZING! Every bite was fresh & flavorful. The bread & pesto they offer the table is also tasty. I can't wait to try other options on my next visit to Scottsdale.

4rc-Qyiqqo6k6aENr6vb1w.text: I love this place and have been visiting then often. A delicious Italian Meal is what one can expect here and their quality has been at it's best every time.

7O7qP4xrcvH-hL4R6RtxyQ.text: Called to set up a reservation for a birthday and they can't do more than 10 people in a group on the patio. The girl I spoke to didn't try to help the situation other than telling me "No" and "It's against our policy". I even tried to get two separate tables and was still told "No". About the worst customer service from Fox restaurants that I've seen.

dKmTz9xdYWeAAlq_wOhksQ.text: I had dinner at Olive & Ivy back in April and the food and service were excellent! I loved the atmosphere of the restaurant. For appetizers we got the bruschetta-prosciutto and the mozzarella. We also got the margarita flatbread. These three appetizers were phenomenal. As for my dinner, I got the lasagna bolognese and it was very tasty!  As for the service, our waiter was very knowledgeable, professional and sociable.

M1Vixb2PMKfxtkaUBFi6MQ.text: Loved Olive & Ivy. Went here for brunch with the grandparents & kids and it was a cute setting right on the waterfront canal in Old Town Scottsdale. Food was top notch classy... also, DESSERT...my daughter had a peanut butter chocolate brownie that we passed around the table to share and it was by far the most complimented.

GIrRDlKiPwvXx4RPXAullw.text: Came here to celebrate a birthday and was very satisfied with the visit. Our waiter, Kevin, did an outstanding job and was very friendly. The food was amazing as always. We tried the peanut butter mousse dessert for the first time and it was so rich, full of texture, and delicious! I would definitely recommend it!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lamb meatballs
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bacon wrapped dates
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pesto flat bread

TIhiaqV2ZOIymWWI9y0T1g.text: After receiving a very genuine response from Olive and Ivy, I clearly feel it's necessary to update my review I wrote when I was 'hangry' (hungry and angry).   Apparently I just need to request a certain amount of focaccia, though I truly don't need more than one piece (maybe they were just trying to prevent me from binge eating? If so, you guys are very thoughtful). I do know that in the past they were much more generous with their servings, so I was kind of hoping they would assume if I'm ordering it, that I definitely would love as much as possible ;-)   I realize I sound like a lunatic ranting about this, but just think of this bread and pesto as a drug (because it's truly addictive) and I clearly need my fix...haha  Moral of the story: their bread and pesto is so good that some people will actually freak out if they aren't given more than one serving :-) (or maybe that's just me...)

X9tHeQIzjeWEiL9mZ6sh5g.text: Simple and delicious. Yes, it's a little pricey and you can taste the difference in the food. I had the prosciutto and fig bruschetta to start. The thin sliced, salty prosciutto, slightly sweet pop of dog and peppery arugula combine for extraordinary flavor. When I ordered the kale salad for an appetizer my server suggested a 1/2 size - perfect!   The Chenin Blanc is a must try. The forward flavor is a bit sweeter than I normally like but the finish is a bit spicy. Lovely!  For dinner I ordered the natural chicken. Chicken thigh is on point. Potatoes are creamy as advertised. The mushrooms give the citrus jus an umami essence. It's maybe a touch sweet. Just a touch.   Sadly, I'm going to have to pass on dessert. Next time.   I know I sound picky but the large screen with football ruins the mood every time I look over. It's the only reason I've given the place 4 stars instead of 5.

Eht6k7GERb0svS6NlKkw-g.text: I tried Olive & Ivy for the first time and it was amazing! I love the decorations and the atmosphere. The 2 hosts at the front, Whitney and Natalie, were really sweet and helpful when I mentioned I wanted a table outside. I got the market soup (cauliflower) which was delicious, and some of the bruschetta. Our server Joe was  awesome too! The atmosphere and food is great but the staff makes it even better Would highly recommend and I'll be back soon!

foXaxrFnI5I2EQO0078MJg.text: We came here for a casual Sunday brunch and really loved the ambiance of the outdoor patio area. While service was a a bit slow, the food was delicious! There is an amazing coffee and gelato bar that your can carry out but I really loved the lattes and baked goods. Plenty of vegetarian options and a great place for big groups. The complimentary bread and fresh pesto was delicious and definitely made our salads a bit yummier!

oYGL4fmAnqbmPaCYNawNOg.text: Tiffany, our server, was FANTASTIC! She was very helpful in deciding what to order. She was so cheerful and positive. Her attitude and knowledge really made our experience just that much better. I love Olive & Ivy!!

1_URppCi8ZvveNjmIkgrzA.text: This is my favorite spot! I come here almost every day for coffee! Weekend for brunch are a must.  Mediterranean salad with chicken and the lamb meat balls are SO good.

Pf_RTCfPeiuSvGCmHJtyHQ.text: Great place! Make sure to make a reservation as they fill up super fast. I really enjoy their bruschetta, you can order one or multiple of the different choices. My favorite is the avocado one. Their shrimp risotto is amazing! I've tried recreating at home and can't quite get the flavor down. The gelato is ok, I've had way better. Great service.

EmKrinf1wCOTftGO2WNIJA.text: Im only giving this restaurant a five star review because the service and atmosphere were AMAZING. The food and drinks were terrible and we didn't finish anything. They were very generous and discounted our bill without us having to ask. I wish I could remember the servers name. I would come back and order another choice and hope it improved. Beautiful restaurant. I hope the kitchen can get it together.

OpMhAPfvpXUG30PFTJ1NCw.text: Beautiful place in Scottsdale. Quite a busy place. Waiter was very nice and helpful in ordering. Had several small plates and wine. Good selection of wine.

7JMHGcbwmd9FqVx2IINRRQ.text: Every time I dine at Olive & Ivy, the service never fails to exceed expectations. Starting from the lovely ladies at the host stand to my favorite spot on the patio lounge couches.  I personally love brunch. They always offer a wide variety of delicious pastries and tasty cocktails. My server recommended the Peach Bellini, which was a wonderful addition with my chocolate croissant. Great hospitality and yummy food, definitely recommend bringing friends and family!

6Oq5WOYb9lJsG4OwpOjcTQ.text: A truly classic fox restaurant. Bacon wrapped dates stuffed with Italian sausage, utterly delicious. Roasted artichoke hearts as good as it gets.  The wild mushroom pappardelle pasta was fantastic and The sea scallops with white polenta were equally scrumptious.  Energy filled vibe, good wine list, excellent service and a really nice atmosphere. This  is a "go to" for me when I am in Scottsdale.

p-C_iZWkgYnr0uD-aLrFBg.text: Do t bother calling ahead for a reservation.  We did (my husband and I) and got a mini two seater table when there were clearly booths and other bigger tables available.  Food was good and service was good.  Nice ambience but noisy inside.

9Eq1CC2SBxJar3y39UbSwg.text: I note with interest that Olive and Ivy appears to advertise on Yelp, and also that numerous negative reviews have been buried by Yelp in the "Not Recommended" section.  Coincidence?  Who knows.  We'll see where this review ends up...  In short, this restaurant's location is terrific--in a vibrant spot on the Scottsdale waterfront, perfect for strolling and window-shopping before or after dinner.  Food is so-so.  Restaurant is very loud.  Service is horrible: we were seated at 6:30 and when I finally left at 8:45 my entree had not yet been served.  On a related note, the valet service doesn't use paper check tickets, they use an app which requires you to provide your cell phone number to them, and which appears to slow them down considerably because it's difficult for them to use.  Retrieving my car took about 15 minutes even though there was only one person ahead of me.

H6vvZY9hy76LFqWv3CQahg.text: A bunch of my friends surprised me with a birthday dinner here and I was impressed.  We got the whole back room to ourselves and this place was booming!  I started off with two Moscow Mules and they were reallllll good.  Liked that they put in a little more lime.  The dinner was great and everyone had something different.  I had the chicken scaloppini and it hit the spot.    They let us bring in our own cupcakes, ya know this dude has a sweet tooth. Really enjoyed our experience and I dunno about you, but I'm coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. After the surprise dinner.

H1Y7Ek3yc61McI8k2TGv0A.text: We had an early dinner here today. Megan was our waitress and she was amazing. I have lots of dietary restrictions, and eating out is a challenge. Megan knew what was in each of the dishes and was able to make great recommendations for me, and they subbed out a vegetable I can't eat and exchanged it for some I can eat. I got the salmon and it was the best I've ever had. The rest of my party got the hummus, lamb meatballs and pesto with bread for appetizers, and flat bread, kale salad, the Mediterranean salad with shrimp and Mediterranean salad with salmon. Everyone loved their food. I would highly recommend this restaurant, and get Megan if you can. Fabulous food and amazing service!

x0CqInAaTwtDoTSeYUHLbg.text: If you come here, Sit in the booth facing outside. And have Easton as your server. He is amazing, this place is amazing: Thank you again Easton!

d8qBq16ChCqZYe73LZyGwQ.text: Out of towners - call ahead even on weekdays! We showed up tonight (monday) and the only space for us was at the chef's table, overlooking the kitchen. That was actually very pleasant to watch the food prep, but it was surprising that all the tables were booked for the next 1.5 hours when the space is large and the patio is huge! Also, it meant having to sit on high stools with very difficult to reach hooks underneath the counter for our purses.  Decor is gorgeous - high ceilings, Edison lightbulbs hanging from the ceiling, candles, huge glass walls looking onto the patio & canal... Very romantic and chill.  Our server was very friendly and pleasant. We had asparagus bruschetta, bacon wrapped dates, the sweet potato cannelloni, and tried both sangrias. All tasty. Had toasted coconut and white chocolate raspberry gelato for dessert. Food was good quality, focaccia & pesto were great for setting the Mediterranean/California vibe.  The general manager even came to check on us and we enjoyed chatting with her. Lots of friendly people in a beautiful relaxing place with tasty food. Exactly what we were looking for (minus the high stools) on our vacation!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. High windows overlooking the patio area - pretty lights outside and in!
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Candles on the pillar at the end of the chef&#39;s table, overlooking the kitchen
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The beautiful interior

ysMa8JQc6ONYyG4LJCsk9A.text: We love this place! Each time we visit, it's one place we are sure to have a great experience at! Another one of Fox concepts restaurant! Which to me means healthy and good! I first discovered their True Foods restaurant . Service is excellent and food is fabulous! Call for reservations. You won't be sorry!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

zSyi6I4sCMI-RuY4pioPPw.text: I have visited this restaurant 4-5 times now with my family, girlfriends and other groups. Every time, we had a great time. Great atmosphere, delicious food, I have tried many items from their menu and all were delicious. See information below: Bruschetta appetizers- Asparagus, Prosciutto, Manchego- all were delicious Bacon Wrapped Dates- little too sweet for my taste, but for a person who loves sweets, this would be perfect Margherita flatbread- it was okay, nothing to brag about Wild Mushroom Pappardelle Pasta- for all mushroom lovers, it had beautiful earthy flavor, loved every bite of it, and leftovers are delicious too!! Sea Scallops*- a light dinner dish, scallops were perfectly done, not overcooked.  Chicken Scallopini- this was amazing, not too strong on the spices but chicken was nice and tender Natural Chicken- another beautiful chicken dish, perfectly done.  Flavors of all dishes are great and different. Their customer service is always amazing and they are very attentive to your needs. Their cocktails are more on the sweeter side so i preferred to stick with either beer or wine and they have great selection as well.  The atmosphere inside the restaurant can be little too loud if you are planning to talk a lot more with your girlfriend, their outdoor seating area would be a better choice and with the perfect weather and temperature, it is pretty nice.  Taking one star away, as they are little pricey with their menu but the quantity of main dishes is more on the smaller side.But that is definitely not going to stop me from going there again or recommending this wonderful restaurant to my friends and family members.

-qJNNbJBJwivoem_eg7gHQ.text: If you are looking for a hidden gastronomic gem, Olive and Ivy fits the bill. The Italian/Mediterranean/California influence shows in the decor. The booth we sat in possessed a warmth reminiscent of many upscale restaurants I have been to in Chicago.  Our server, Melinda, was one of the most attentive servers I have experienced. She even did something special for me (mint iced tea) that I will be permanently ordering each time.  The Bruschetta were all delightful with the strawberry being my fave. All flavors were light and enjoyable on the tongue.

LnrEsUVoyb5wHKZe3Ihu8g.text: UPDATE:  Management reached out to us to "correct" and "investigate" the poor service we received our first time in.  We decided to give Olive & Ivy another chance and tried out their Brunch today without telling them.  The hostess station greeted us and arranged to seat us without any delay.  Good so far.   Tony, our waiter, arrived thereafter and introduced himself asking if we had been here before, sharing the soup of the day and answering our menu questions.  Again, good so far, but it only got better.  Tony took our orders and returned with fresh bread and pesto sauce on the side.  We ordered.  My Eggs Benedict were not only superb but the Coffee Mocha was excellent!!  My wife enjoyed her eggs, bacon, and potatoes as well.  Tony continued to check on us.  Here's what I learned as I looked around.  The service and food should not only be "good", but it looked as if "excellent" was the expectation, the bar.  People were happy, the different food looked great - and the wait staff was very attentive.  We have become fans.  Thank you to Tony and the management.

iVCJMYpwCAoVl6e5D2XIBQ.text: Went here for a brunch with the family just before Christmas and we had an absolute blast.  Out server Tony made sure we were well taken care of, and the drinks were always full. Would definitely come back and ask for Tony!

Y1uYg7crIYg7TALfWoLuBw.text: Watch out what time you go. Lunch menu switches over to dinner at 3. You can't order anything off the lunch menu and half the dinner menu is still blocked off as they prep the kitchen. So expect between 3 and 4pm is relegated to salads and flatbreads, but its also happy hour. Happy hour only applies to the bar and outdoor lounge though. Overall great food, nice weather on good days, and beautiful area.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Grapefruit mojito ($10)
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. 3 various bruschetta: prosciutto, brussel sprout, and pear. The pear one (front) was delicious!
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Short Rib Flatbread. More filling than it looks! Also great complimentary flavors.

4nXFxZMe-6629fa9v2pilQ.text: Olive and ivy has always been one of my go to spots. The bread they give you with pesto and olive oil is a great way to start your meal.  If you're feeling really good,  get the bacon- wrapped dates.  I have yet to have a bad meal here whether lunch hour or dinner and they even have a nice market inside making it quick and easy to pick up something on the go.

EHk9dKuhyc1q2k5tG5RZkA.text: Went to dinner here with a group friends. We shared the Mediterranean salad and the butternut squash flatbread. It was all delicious and filling. I had the shrimp risotto for my entree and tried so hard to finish it but it was just too much food. Service was excellent.  Would definitely recommend to everyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Shrimp Risotto

SnxDGYHj8wFp_36hL7o9tA.text: I like the atmosphere and energy at Olive and Ivy. I love going there for drinks and appetizers. The one at the waterfront is beautiful and the large patio is next to the water. Service is friendly. If you have a private party you can reserve the party room (which is beautiful). The Sangria is one of my favorite drinks. Try it with a couple of appetizers!

Wucs4w_CUwGFlik43mHmig.text: Best place to be outdoors and chat with your Tribe of Women Friends and chat about what to do on girlie Vacation.  Great Breakfast and Brunch.

kDoghmtA9gQ67Sg3sgpxWQ.text: The pesto was GREAT! The rest of the food was Meh and the service was the same. My girlfriend and I went here. We are both in our 20's. They seemed to not want to help us. We asked for ketchup when our food came and they didn't bring it for 20 minutes. We were finished eating at this point.   If I ever go again, it would be for happy hour and pesto but I won't be buying more plates.

V8JBnbM9aCmmG_QNA0Wtbw.text: this is the place to go! the inside of this place, the outside, the bathrooms, just amazing. this is where you go on a first date (which was happening next to us btw), this is the place to wowster someone! my husband didn't need to wow me and I picked this place but whatever lol.   the bread served here with that pesto stuff is just omg. I'd have to say it was my favorite thing we ate on the whole trip. I literally couldn't stop eating it, or talking about it. the pizza was great, so was the fried calamari/shrimp etc that we had.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fritto mmmm
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

_wPdRoILtr_QKZEJ6gurPg.text: In love.  Olive and Ivy is a fantastic little place tucked in the waterfront at Scottsdale. They have two sides to choose from, the take out side where it's more of a bistro style, offering sandwiches and salads for a quick meal...and then the elegantly decorated dine in side that has TONS of outdoor seating. This place is gorgeous.  The bar is a great place for happy hour after work or to meet up with friends before a night out...and the restaurant itself offers AMAZING table side mimosas and brunch on the weekends. Delish. Absolutely delish.  If you haven't been here, get here quickly and enjoy every bite and minute of your visit.

9mKyOH48q61d_mUlZS4SNw.text: Great place to hang out with family and friends.  The back patio a Can be a quiet place to relax of have meetings during the week.  Keep the free pesto and bread coming.

raCK-xNq16SElNJQM2B91w.text: I often opt to meet here for business luncheons because the atmosphere is incredibly enjoyable. The food is of definite quality and, for the area, the pricing is not bad at all. They also have a stellar little take out order bar that is separated from main dining, which allows separation from hustle and bustle distraction. The only thing that gets me is if you eat here 2 or 3 times you could easily have tried everything. Some may enjoy that, but I prefer a little more variety in menu options.

kM9m_AR8WUqWcS2Vy4CmXg.text: My girlfriend and I loved this restaurant. Everything from the food, drinks, service, and decor were great. Next time we are in town we will for sure be back!

RrEaxSMjnagbbC7ZCL9pKw.text: I LOVED the service!  We had a car issue and had to push our reservations 30 minutes.  Even though they were completely booked because of Mothers Day and Prom...they were willing to work with us.  I told them we would leave when the next reservation for our table arrived.  They were awesome...attentive, quick, efficient and so professional without being pushy.  The manager even sent us over a free appetizer to help ease our earlier evening stresses I guess...how nice is that!   No only was the service amazing...but the food was EXCELLENT!!  This is when spending the money is worth it!  The white sangria was wonderful, the bacon wrapped dates were amazing and the butter salad and chicken with prosciutto were worth every bite!    Would highly recommend this particular area for out-of-town guests.  We walked over the bridge and enjoyed looking over the water and the beautiful grounds.  Very trendy area with at least a dozen restaurants/lounges/patios to hang out in.  Or, take an extended golf cart to old town Scottsdale to listen to some country music.

pNBS0-lKpCstZwXEyIi4YA.text: Superb simple sandwiches with FLAVOR. I was very impressed. The roast beef sandwich is to die for - the beef is shaved extra thin, bread is toasty. I was pleasantly surprised overall.

WThyJDIjZcIqoO4Tkx3jlg.text: The food was fantastic and came out quickly. I had the Mediterranean salad w/ grilled chicken. The drinks were delicious. Its a big open space with a huge bar and a cool vibe. Our server was friendly but we had to ask him SEVERAL times for things like ketchup, hot sauce, water, etc. because he kept forgetting to bring it over to us. Other than that we had a great time! I would definitely recommend checking this place out.

I6yi66QKkqWh5Qx6QC3cLw.text: Last minute real for 15 and they were able to accommodate us in a really nice private room. Very pretty decor and the service was on point. Food was good and very reasonable. Liked the sea bass and the flat bread. Must get the lemon tres leche cake!!

zli-LYRxsiQ3QT2VefD-Aw.text: Sure, the food at Olive & Ivy is good, but there are plently of places, even Fox RC places, that I have been to that are better.   Whenever I go to Olive & Ivy, I feel that the service is a little snooty, even from the point where you walk in the door. I always seem to be greeted by a somewhat inconsiderate hostess, and the servers to be honest really aren't that much better. You can tell that they are completely fake when they come to take your oders/bring you food, because they're scrounging for a good tip, which they expect from this restaurant's normal clientele-- the well-off businesspeople out to lunch or the Scottsdale moms that congregate to go out to brunch.   The food, like i mentioned, is decent. I almost always get their Mediterranean Salad with some grilled salmon on top. It's usually pretty decent, but definitely overpriced. You get about 1 1/2 standard measuring-cup cups of mixed greens, some cous-cous and other fillers, with about a 3-ounce portion of salmon all for around $21. And that's just for the salad, not including drinks.   Just about the only thing that keeps Olive & Ivy from getting a two-star review is their delicious pesto and bread that they serve (upon request) before you get your meal. It's honestly really delicious, light, and the pesto isn't too garlicy or salty. It is on the smaller side, so make sure you ration it properly between yourself and any of the other guests who you're dining with.   3 stars for:   Pros:  Decent food   Cons:  Bleh service Small portions Overpriced   Bottom Line: Yeah, i'll be back, as long as I'm not the one footing the bill.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Super small beet salad w/ goat cheese. In relation to fork, was about 8 bites for $11.
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mediterranean Salad with grilled salmon

gvtstBxMOCDlPXwVGyp3Dg.text: My favorite new Restaurant! My server Josh was phenomenal...best service ever great recommendations..,the food was so fresh and amazing!! Get the Chicken Chopped Salad with the Peanut Granola so so good!  I will definitely be back when I'm in town and will recommend olive and ivy to anyone who's visiting Scottsdale for the best food and awesome service from Josh!!!!   Also sit on the patio, what a beautiful atmosphere - I felt like I was in France!  I can't wait to come back to eat here again!

7HcquO0KC5V9QFjarVmwxA.text: The best patio experience is Olive & ivy.  I love there food and wine selection.

gl_mAKyQ8xcPy-Jv4Kmudg.text: Great ambiance. Food good but nothing to brag about for sure. Quality, service, decor all trendy and awesome.  They had a cool outdoor space that looked great for private events.

TNrveE7b6gKT-aGYprBq6w.text: I come here for the atmosphere and food, but the service brings me back.  One of the coolest things about this place is that you can pick an open seat in front--no waiting, sink into their soft leather chairs--and people watch.      The food is prepared with such detail and care.  I ordered a vegetable cheese soup and it was perfectly seasoned.  My salad was fresh with a tangy oil and vinegar dressing...Wow! what a taste.  My companion had the fresh salmon.  Served over a bed of lettuce, the taste and presentation was just terrific!!    The breads served here really satisfy.  And the dipping sauce has just the right amount of garlic and spice to keep you nibbling throughout the meal.    But what makes the difference at this eatery is their unmatched service.  Everyone is friendly and professional.  The wait staff are trained like no other.  Ask them what is in the pesto sauce and the rattle off about 10 different ingredients.    What pleasure early weekend breakast is at this place.  You will not be disappointed!!

T3coLjXPUJLHfB7uG6dkJQ.text: Strolling around and found this cute place. Started the afternoon with a friend and a nice glass of Chardonnay. Highly recommend the lamb meatballs and roasted Brussel sprout bruschetta. The service was friendly and fun.

3ICLZjkAKz5UjP2m9yKfoA.text: Such a fun place for a date night or out with the girlfriends! The food is good and the atmosphere is fun. I love Olive and Ivy! Trendy and a little pricy but a fun night out.

BgpRHJ4APd3bjUs6KpPAuw.text: We thought it would be nice to sit outdoors on our Anniversary.   We made a reservation in advance to sit outdoors.   We were delayed due to traffic so  I called them to let them know that we would be less than five minutes late.   They gave our table away anyway.  We ended up seated inside so we left.   We ended up on Maggiano's patio where we had an outstanding and plentiful entree and dessert.

s1HYAlq3-tnRPmPnW2x5ZA.text: The bacon wrapped dates are so yummy! The pumpkin cannelloni were delicious! Super rich and decadent -- one critique though is that there's so much filling and it's so thick that texturally, a bite was almost like the feeling when your mouth is full of peanut butter. The chicken scallopini had the most delicious sauce! My critique with that though was they take the time to get the panko crusted chicken breast so crunchy but the way it's plated on top of moist sauteed spinach and the sauce on top makes it all soggy and you loose most of the crunch. If it were played differently it could be better. Overall a great dinner experience though!

EwacaqI1jozfzhqxdBRPfQ.text: We had our work holiday party here and we can't wait to come back and enjoy it again. We were greeted with a large wine selection and some appetizers on a back patio. The appetizers were mini pizza/bruschetta - some had mushrooms and some has tomatoes with cheese. Both were delicious. Another appetizer was a date wrapped in bacon - this was super delicious and easy to eat. I ordered a pineapple mojito and at first our server was confused, saying they don't have a blender but could make us a raspberry mojito. (I've had bartenders tell me they don't have blenders when I've ordered mojitos before, so I was used to this.) Luckily, our server came back later telling me she was confused and viola a delicious pineapple mojito was placed in my hands with a large slice of pineapple on the rim. It was amazing! So good, the husband had to order one for himself. Our party moved inside to a private room where we were given tiny menus with simple selections. The husband ordered the beef entree, steak with horseradish mashed potatoes and I ordered the scallops with corn polenta. While the scallops were delicious, the steak was super tender and moist! (Better than a fillet we had the night before!) For desert, I ordered the chocolate cake with coffee crema inside and the husband ordered the cheesecake. The cheesecake came in a cute mason jar and was amazing. I really liked my chocolate cake but the cheesecake was better. For once everything the husband ordered was better than what I had ordered! It was a fantastic party and such a great venue. Can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. So good

E27YueVRYmnjXfbUcwFReA.text: For the price, portion, quality and atmosphere this is great!  I recommend the SWEET POTATO CANNELLONI (sorry i had to copy and paste lol).

S8hfPNccXk8_RceIfyDwCg.text: This is  a great spot. I was taken here on a date, we had a reservation for 2 on the patio and I was really pleased with the seating I dont usually perfer outdoor seating,  but at this restaurant id say Its one of the best seats and very gorgeous.  We were seated within just a few minutes of arriving.  The atmosphere is really warm and inviting as well as the staff I really appreciate when Im welcomed immediately by the hostesses it has a huge impact on my perception of a restaurant ( customer service is key and they have it)... The food was very good  also they have a good variety of choices we stuck to a simple  but yummy margarita pizza with fresh basil, bruchetta appetizer,  and drinks. Our waitress was attentive,  but not overly smothering which I liked especially while on a date.  I can absolutely see myself coming back here wether its on a date, with friends, or family....

i149C7sKsxxXsoL2FzwdVQ.text: Here is my 10 year olds commentary   Loved the lamb meatballs and Brussel sprout bruschetta. When I got my pasta,they tried to hard to make the pasta healthier. I love pasta but it should be authentic.

WuFC9-mmVgv-5yy2V1szoA.text: "Mediterranean cuisine with a Californian flare." Well I think this is my first Yelp review, and for good reason, too!  The girlfriend and I just dined here on Valentine's Day (coincidentally the gf's birthday) and the whole experience was top notch. It all started when I called to make a reservation weeks ago and they asked if we were celebrating anything else so I mentioned the birthday and that was that. Made reservations for the beautiful patio on VDay.  Flashforward to the 14th and the experience was wonderful. Parking underground was super convenient - elevator brings you up right next to the restaurant. We were immediately seated right next to the Waterfront with a great view and phenomenal weather.  Now the food (finally, this guy got to the food): Disclaimer, the menu was a VDAY specific menu, so don't get too excited about what you read here because it might not be the usual! Cocktails were A+. I got a blood orange paloma (delicious compliments with the tequila) and the gf got a mojito, also delicious. Cocktail menu was very diverse and had interesting flavor pairings - wish I could have drank more if I wasn't driving the birthday girl around!  FOOD! We started with the hummus with vegetables appetizer. Delicious hummus, slight kick to it made it stand out compared to other bland hummuses. The pita and vegetable selection was also very fresh. For entrees, the gf got the chicken scallopini which had well-crusted (slightly crispy, not fried) chicken on top of some sauteed greens - fantastic. I got the bacon wrapped pork tenderloin, cooked medium at the chef's recommendation. Also phenomenal but there was something special about the tangy/spicy BBQ sauce on top. Will definitely dream about this dish.  Now here's the special part, free dessert (twice baked chocolate cake, amazing) with a personal birthday message written in icing! I was so pleased they went to such care for us when they had hundreds of other couples trying to make their own VDay special.  Will definitely return.

2stvMjMXwQUrUUCKfsY5QA.text: We arrive to test drive this eatery for the 1st time only to be warned that two groups had booked the main dining area & a separate private room.  While I scouted the edges for an acceptable spot for the two of us, my wife appraised the patio. Finding the latter uncrowded and heaters available to ward of a light breeze on a cool eve, we settled in with Suzie as our attentive server...We hastened our selection to get them to the kitchen and bar before the herds arrived. Pleasantly affordable, generously proportioned and delightfully flavored. We'll return again this week to try some other offerings & bring our friends along to delight them when we return to the valley next month.  Very nice setting on the canal, convenient to parking and the Old Town core.

4wfBREqbsYdzkOnh5QLudg.text: I was so excited to eat here at Olive and Ivy on my visit to Scottsdale! The setting was lovely, but the service and judgement was nothing that I expected. Our food was DELICIOUS! Until I found a beard hair cooked INTO the dough of my pizza. Our waiter visited before and to take our order, but we did not see him after that until our bill. Water was empty, and my food had hair in it and after waiting almost ten minutes for our server to come and check on us I got up and retreived another staff member. The manager did offer us new pizza but did not seem to sincere with his apology (most likely because we are a group of young individuals). I would liked to have seen it at least taken off of our bill because we did not get to eat together. It is not about the money, but more so the lack of judgment in the experience. I am very disappointed, I've had better care at a Red Lobster. I'm very sad to say that I do not want to dine here again, nor will I recommend it to any Scottsdale friends.

vHAr0iCouOTJbxAYQYqS-Q.text: Overall great service I had 3 waiters come up to me and ask me if anyone had taken my order my food was delivered in a timely manner. I had the pasta which was pretty good it had slightly more lemon flavor that I would have liked but not too much where it was unbearable. Overall it was a good experience. Thanks Olive & Ivy

ZXpfN1oSQAaEeqh06Ys-fQ.text: Anyway, we arrived and without reservation we were seated immediately. Everything about our dining experience was excellent. Our waitress was awesome. It was my lovahs 30th bday dinner and she went above and beyond and even offered to take pics for us when she saw me struggling to do a photo shoot myself. We picked a trio of bruschetta and they were alllll delish! My honey got the sweet potato ravioli and omigod i couldn't stop opening my mouth so he would feed me another bite. I had the risotto which was good but his ravioli was just downright fantastic! We had champagne and they come in cute flutes and also a bday dessert with a candle on the house!!!   The ambiance here is great... good music and lighting. We will be back. I def def def recommend! (no stuttering prob, just expressing you should DEF try it out ) :)

dQ6mYExjAf6InFa8oMG88A.text: This space is a big, open area but not so much so that you can't hear each other, which was important to us, as we were meeting up with old friends on our recent trip to Arizona.   The waitress, in describing the menu, made our mouths water. She was excellent in her descriptions. She helped us choose a wine for the table, offering a sample of a Pinot Noir, which we didn't like so much and then steering us to a great Cabernet Sauvignon.  The bruschetta sampler appetizer was perfect for our group of 5. The range of flavors offered was nice too, since we all had different tastes.  I had an entree of scallops which was perfectly prepared, perfectly sized and accompanied by sides that paired with it nicely.  Everyone in our group was very happy with their dinner and dessert. This is definitely the type of restaurant that could be a go-to destination. The service was first class, the food was tasty, and yet the open feel to the area kept it from being stuffy.

blCu_HQLPsFncrtsOkmglg.text: Been here a few times for lunch and enjoyed the experience.  The weather had been spectacular recently, so we took advantage of their outdoor seating along the canal.  Great venue to people watch and eat some good food.  One occasion, I had the kale salad with grilled chicken, and another, their margherita flat bread.  Both were delicious and good portions.  What I enjoyed the most, however, was the bread and fresh pesto.  Seriously, that could serve as the sole reason to go back.  It's that good.  Great and friendly service.  Laid back atmosphere.  The ambient noise is at a decent level to hear the people you are with.  Perfect spot to have a good food and enjoy good company.

wNA5oQmAH6d5yg9OCEM8lg.text: This is my ideal dining experience and favorite Fox restaurant, hands down. O&I is absolutely wonderful. Even after a scorching summer day, the patio offers a gorgeous tuscan ambiance with a canopy of well groomed trees, expertly placed misters, strung Edison bulbs, and an overall understated elegance. So dreamy.  That's all you really  need to know, but I'll humor you since you're reading reviews for a reason, hm?   Bruschetta sampler: Prosciutto/fig, Manchego/chorizo, Apple/Brie All of them were delicious, though the prosciutto one was hard to eat due to the meat not having been cut...the bread was cut into thirds prior to the meat being added so we had to remove all the arugula and cut the meat, then re-build the app. That was weird. But the flavor was A+  We drank the white wine sangria, which packs a punch thanks to the brandy, and the cactus blossom cocktail. Both were great on a warm summer evening.   Seabass: though I did enjoy it, I wouldn't order it again. It was well prepared but I prefer fish without the gray meat as it tastes a little gamey...Again, just my preference. The sides it came with were small, but good. The few pieces of "caramelized" cauliflower left something to be desired as it was closer to just roasted cauli, but the candied grapefruit and snap peas were perfect with the mild white fish.   Filet Mignon: served with horseradish potatoes & red wine shallots--stole the show, without a doubt. Nothing to complain about here. My husband ordered it rare, and it came out with a lovely charred crust and warm red center. Beautiful. Plate envy for sure.  Cheesecake w/ stewed peaches: Decadent and delicious, and certainly enough for two after all the food we'd already had.   Roll me out and valet the car, dear. I am deliriously happy.   PS - the bathrooms are rad.

yEofux2j8NbVTwwxzJob6w.text: Love love love this place! We opted for the outdoor seating on the patio for lunch which was perfect. The seating is very comfortable and casual and included a fire pit. My mom and I ordered the avocado, mozzarella, and mushroom bruschettas. The mozzarella was my favorite out of the bunch. We also got the hummus appetizer which was good but kind of spicy. The braised short rib flatbread was the best part of the meal. Overall friendly service, lovely atmosphere, and great food. Definitely a must to visit in Scottsdale.

O-yUosQq3UYZGr0BzZOTRg.text: Loved this place the first 2 times I went and then the same dish wasn't as good... However, the salmon is always amazing. I love the atmosphere!!!

DnMsisM2leldlhBzIerc_w.text: We came here as part of our celebrating 40 years together. This place is really nice. The decor and lighting promises a romantic and relaxed experience. The menu pleasantly surprises with items not commonly found. We are warmly welcomed and promptly seated in a high backed booth that allows for privacy. I've given 5 stars and here is why. I got the veal and spinach ravioli. It comes and the presentation is beautiful. Then I take a bite and it is cold. First in a restaurant of this caliber cold food should never leave the kitchen. But more importantly how the restaurant handles things when mistakes are made. And this is why despite getting cold food I am still giving 5 stars. The manager immediately apologized, told me they would not reheat it, but will remake the dish for me so it would be fresh. My dish comes back piping hot, beautifully presented, and the taste was worth amazing. And then the manager told me my meal was on the house. And that is exactly how this should have been handled. No excuses, make it right. And on top of this, when I made the reservation I had indicated it was our 40th Anniversary. The brought us an on the house dessert to share that was so beautifully presented, and again the taste was amazing. We will definitely be back.

3sG7DH_RBzRd1xjiyX5oYA.text: There is absolutely nothing bad I can say about Olive & Ivy. Of course it's my first time, but the whole experience was gratifying.   We ordered the lamb meatballs which were wonderful, and the focaccia and pesto were to die for... Seriously. People, I am not exaggerating when I say the pesto is amazing. For dinner, my husband ordered the Mediterranean flat bread and I ordered the chicken scaloppini. I loved them both and would highly recommend them.   The place and the ambiance is so fabulous. It's an open kitchen which is so welcoming. The music is spot on, and the patio complements the indoor seating perfect. Overall, the Scottsdale waterfront scene is a must go to, and Olive and Ivy is the perfect place to start.

FxqwfNq6DeTZorV_1UXEfw.text: My husband and I dined outside on the patio while visiting Scottsdale. The bruschetta appetizer was amazing, as was the sweet corn flatbread pizza. We highly recommend it and would definitely come back next time we're in town.

BjZRgMEjP5yuBLWdX677Cg.text: Pretty much every time I come here it's a wonderful, relaxing, and yummy experience! Very friendly customer service and they can accommodate specifics with no hassle. Definitely recommend!

oWNQdA5IB3V-cZqrHFLYbA.text: We have been to Olive & Ivy many times. The bar is great at lunchtime and the patio is our favorite at night. The wine list is very adequate and the food selections are fresh and attractively presented. Our favorite appetizer is the hummus with veggies. Dinner selections are all good. I am partial to the chicken offerings and I can't fail to mention the bread and pesto.  Servers have always been great, very attentive and efficient.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fine wine and some great food with my best gal!

0PgDNaptfw6VVB8JYBhKng.text: First time here and cant wait to come back! My friend and I sat on the patio and enjoyed some sangria's. Loved the atmosphere and the little touches, the place is beautifully designed and very relaxing as it over looks the soleri bridge. The service was excellent and the bacon wrapped dates are a must try!

aVKqSVdlG6pEeB8Pz7fang.text: Ambience was nice, not too loud so you couldn't have a conversation, service was friendly and attentive,  and while I only had a salad, it was delicious! Will definitely go back & try more things.

WLtqR4WngkLu0mtI59mAQg.text: Pros: My favorite restaurant in AZ. I have never ordered anything that I haven't enjoyed. Nothing tops their pesto sauce. The best part is, it comes free with the bread at the beginning of the meal. Last night, I ordered the sweet potato cannelloni. It's very rich. My friend described it as, "Like eating a dessert." Since I have a sweet tooth, I loved it. My sister order the pork tenderloin. Her friend ordered the chicken scallopine. It paired perfectly with my past. My BFF ordered scallops. Cooked to perfection. Like eating light puffy clouds of air.   Cons: Price

pJ061QPo-QaWlLeLNo_q_Q.text: Disappointed! We have been coming to this restaurant for several years and came again tonight to celebrate my husband's birthday. We were saddened to find out that Olive & Ivy has cut back on everything food wise. You now have to "ask" for their bread and pesto when it was always part of their initial table presentation. The entree presentation is very plain and blah. The food portions appear to be smaller. I notified them when making the reservation that it was my husbands birthday celebration and all the past years the birthday person received a complimentary desert. Not anymore! Nothing was offered. We are so disappointed that they have become a run of the mill, cut costs, restaurant. The food and service are still good but the extras that made this restaurant stand out as a superior FOX restaurant are gone.

bFPJkHQb21m9B5Tj8I4Wqg.text: Really liked this place.  Beautiful setting.  Good food except the lamb.  Don't order that.  Wine was good service was great.  Not cheap

lpmzI72JPwJi30lIPnLfwQ.text: I haven't been here in a while and came with a friend for dinner.  We spilt the trio of bruschetta's which probably paired with a salad could be a full meal.  I also had the veal ravioli and thought once the cheese melted it was a little on the salty side.  My favorite part of the meal was the chocolate molten cake with ice cream...chocolate lover heaven.  Nice ambiance along the canal..with lots of outdoor seating.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chocolate cake

XRA5LuPLm1UTgmLTXp6_tg.text: A great atmosphere and great service. The avocado bruschetta was amazing. We wanted to love this restaurant because it had such a neat feel to it, but the food was less than stellar for us. The lamb was flavorless in spots but in other spots I was overwhelmed by spice and seasoning. It was odd and a little disappointing. Really fun place but wouldn't recommend the food necessarily.

Crx_8E96sIvKhaFDx4TP6g.text: Olive, Ivy -- you are both gorgeous and sexy - I LOVE YOU!  Perhaps it may be lust, but how will we ever know for sure unless we spend more time together?  What I mean is, much more time.  In fact, I'd like to move in.  Seriously.  What a beautifully designed place, with candles and great lighting, large windows, and an absolute deliciousness IS the essence of Olive & Ivy. Featuring a great happy hour, sangria, Mediterranean / Italian fare; it's a coffee shop, bar, restaurant, and market all-in-one. So nice and complete - a perfect offering is what I say!  Great wine selection, a fun & lively environment, and great food. Outside tables are especially lovely on a nice day or evening, but in the summer heat - no, no, NO.    Whether this is for a date, a small group, or a 'happy hour' with your co-workers...this place could be the object of your desire (as well).

v_oQxyr7ZSW0t57WEoPgMw.text: I'm so excited about this place and I couldn't even wait to write a review... I'm still eating!!    My daughter and I are waiting for the mall to open so we decided to find a breakfast spot nearby.  Came across this place and gave it a shot.  At 10:30am on a Sunday I expected a long wait but was surprised that we were seated right away in a great spot outside along the water.    Waiter was great, friendly and knowledgeable but perhaps had a bit of ADD, he kept getting distracted but it was okay because he was still great.    After listening to our waiters explanation of the menu, I opted for the breakfast sandwich with a side of hollandaise sauce and my daughter got the cheddar biscuits and gravy.    We got the complimentary bread and pesto, which was to die for!  My sandwich was amazing!  The bread was a buttery flaky goodness and everything was cooked to perfection!  The biscuits and gravy were unique and amazing too!  And to top it off, as we were finishing up our meal, our waiter brought out refills and had them in to go cups.  Awesome!  He knew we were going shopping and thought we needed some refreshments for the mall.    This is going on my list of favorites!  Beautiful atmosphere, superb food and friendly people.  What more could you ask for???

L6f4Yh7gTyRb_9D6eWceRg.text: My favorite place in Scottsdale! It's my go to date night place, girls night dinner, everything. The atmosphere is everything. You will not be disappointed; there is something for everyone.

wNfppm5nFDbKF01u-ep2pw.text: I love the ambience here maybe even a little bit more than the food what we had was pretty basic my niece had a huge salad and I ordered the hummus which was to die for, although the pita left a lot to be desired. I also ordered some bruschetta that was pretty good and a small plate combining fried shrimp and calamari. It was pretty good to all in all I didn't think there was a lot of variety for the lunch and the food although good was nothing I would rave about. What was impressive was the dessert display when you first walk in the restaurant.  I didn't have any but even now when I remember it I wish I had tried a couple!

GonElXRN8DDl-eESQhSJog.text: Another Sam Fox restaurant. Food is decent but the location is better. Cool vibe. Good for get togethers. Worth coming to if in the area.

eYHfrKP7qSl0Q9F1jIgQ-g.text: One of my top choices for late night dinners, drinks and a good time with my friends. Service was excellent, the drinks were marvellous and them bruschettas were fantastic. Jeez, their margherite pizza was lit! That cheese, fresh basil and tomatoes on flat bread was probably the best I've ever tasted. I was filled up just on appetizers. Will definitely be back soon.

53y7aSk6Rc3xyAYxMyOt8A.text: Meh. Went here for dinner on a date night. Have also been for lunch. My overall review is that it's $10 entree quality for $20. Not bad food but definitely not a good value for the price. Like other Fox concepts, the atmosphere is nice but generic, nice in a very trendy way, not classic or authentic. I really don't like to pay steak-house prices for medium food. That's this place.  That being said, I really do like their coffee bar/pastries (mmm the pastries!) and their gelato bar. Then you can sit outside and enjoy the waterfront and only pay a few dollars.

do3zqj5Q9v9dRy0H8CRZMA.text: I remember coming here with a friend a while ago for brunch. Contrary to some other comments, I'ld argue that their ambience stays True to Scottsdale's modern, upscale environment. It's still Arizona/West Coast influenced without needing cacti and adobe houses. I remember being really pleased with the food, but for some reason the bread really stood out to me. Their salad is, of course, a reliable option, but their good food attracts a lot of people and you're lucky to catch a seat without setting a reservation first. The servers are a bit too friendly, they might stay hanging around and make conversation with you if not every table is occupied. I'ld want to go back soon.

B9FHuQEgCUCOC9vZNO8Y1g.text: Came in here tonight with my girlfriend and grandma are waiter Josh was extremely friendly and courteous specially he took the time with my elderly grandma which you don't see a lot anymore he also knew the menu like the back of his hand and pointed us in the direction of some extremely delicious dishes I will definitely be coming back to this place great atmosphere great food and great and great people thanks a lot Josh

nq2zPN2YpnQSOGyESOZefw.text: We came here for my bachelorette party dinner.  We had a reservation for 6 and were seated right away.  We ordered some appetizers, like the variety of brushetta.  They were all very good.  For my meal I had a small cesar salad and a flatbread.  The flatbread was ok but the salad was very good.  We all had drinks.  The service was great and the food was awesome.  They even brought me a special dessert since it was for my bachelorette party.

sfDYAgckqXubABvQQ12Wcg.text: One of my favorite restaurants!! Their FREE (and unlimited) pesto dip and bread is amazing, as well as their appetizers and main dishes. The atmosphere is also a plus, with indoor and outdoor patio seating, both of which are cozy.   They also have an outside patio seating area which is first come first serve, however we sometimes prefer that over sitting at the tables because it is more relaxing with comfy patio furniture.  The only reason this place is getting 4 stars as opposed to 5 is because the past 3 times I have been there with girlfriends to grab some happy hour and/or dinner we have had girl waiters who were horrible (not bringing us water, having to ask multiple times for menus and bread, forgetting our food, adding things to the bill at the end which weren't ours, and then giving us attitude when we politely would tell them what we had and what the bill shows doesn't match, etc). We even had one waitress leave for the evening without closing us out, and without having anyone take over!! The busboy took care of us, and that is also to whom we left our tip with. Management needs to work on training their staff better!

Pwi55aRU7UTh6C2uoKZtzA.text: My husband and I had an early, light dinner of appetizers or what is called at O&I,  small plates. We shared the antipasto plate, lamb meatballs and bacon wrapped dates and 2 glasses of wine. Everything was tasty but nothing that wow'ed. Service was good, prompt. Would we go back probably not, too many other places in the area. Word of caution. We used a $100.00 gift card and noticed they took an automatic 20% off the card for gratuity. We would have given the server 20% but if we weren't paying attention we could have mistakenly doubled the tip.

9tgg4sfHmr2FsxQ9wjuQeA.text: This is a staple for Old Town Scottsdale and for good reason. Great place to meet up for a drink, get dinner, hang out on the patio on a nice day, hold an event in one of their cool dining rooms, or grab a little breakfast at their attached cafe. They can really do it all anytime of the day, year round, and everything is good. I can't remember ever having bad service and I wouldn't go there so often if I did. It's a staple for Scottsdale and a consistent "go to" spot for me.

kaohRpfxlr9g_NBH1xk2Mg.text: Recommendation from an acquaintance.  Made OT dinner reservations.  We walked in from the Marketplace entrance that we were confused as to where the hostess was.  It turns out it was around the bar.  Both of the hostesses were friendly and one even complimented my dress.  We were quickly seated and was greeted by our happy server.  I started the night with a red sangria.  Pretty punchy, not super fruity which I liked.  For starters, we had the Manchego Bruschetta which came with chorizo and the Mediterranean Salad.  One bruschetta is a good bite for 2 people.  The Mediterranean salad was fresh and tasty.  The dressing was a little tangy that at one point, it went down the wrong pipe and I started coughing.  For dinner, I had the English Pea Tortellini which apparently is made in-house.  The sauce was delicious with bacon and mushrooms.  MMMMmmm, I still remember the taste of it.  My husband had the Natural Chicken with potato puree.  The chicken was juicy and although it was a simple dish, it was made well.  The portions for both were just right.  Not huge, but good individual portions.    I had a paper cut and needed a band-aid so I asked the server for one.  He went to go check and never came back so I figured he forgot, but then a lady came by and offered me different types of bandaid.  Perhaps she was the GM.  I picked the one with hearts.  That was nice of them.  They did not forget.  We asked more about the restaurant and the Fox Restaurant Concepts company and our server was knowledgeable and helpful in answering questions.  The server even brought out the list of all the other restaurants that are owned by FRC.  Overall, great food, friendly staff, tasty drinks, live DJ.  Great place to go with a group.

LA-Fva2Gn-hnHjLx65hJ7w.text: I came to Olive and Ivy this past weekend hoping to enjoy AZ restaurant week, but they didn't have it for lunch time.  While my friend and I were quite disappointed, we turned the brunch into our own selection of menu items.  Her son got the Eggs Benedict with roasted potatoes that looked really yummy.  My friend and I shared the Mediterranean Salad and Flatbread pizza.  The ambiance of the restaurant felt very brunch-like and earthy type of feeling.  I felt very relaxed and my tummy felt in peace on a sunny day in Scottsdale.

lwJ5lJcMF91bLalmPFhGJg.text: I've been here for brunch, drinks, and dinner.  Brunch was very disappointing.  Dinner and drinks were just okay.  Overrated.

j2pXW_tG6-IlBtY6Rqyh9Q.text: I am an Olive and Ivy loving and visit often, but today I had the most amazing  occurrence .  Yesterday I awoke to some terrible news.  I was having a stroke and would need to go immediately to the hospital.  As the day wore on , I realized I wasn't going to make my reservation on the beautiful patio of olive and ivy.    When I got my phone today there was a message saying they could not hold  my reservation.  I felt badly  that  I had held a table at such a busy time so I called to explain and apologize.  I sure missed my sweet potato cannelloni, which is on the menu in heaven.  As I sat feeling sorry for myself and the long rehab that lays ahead, Matt, The assistant manager of o and I arrived with the cannelloni dinner.  Ii told him the stroke must have worse than I thought because now I realized I was in heaven.  Matt and the gang at Olive and Ivy made my day.  Thank you!  Penny Latko

zSQtNqe1XZ41jRjaZcJumw.text: Food was cooked to perfection and tasted amazing. The atmosphere was beautiful. The service was decent. I'd definitely eat there.

ACAl0w9slSESQ-IUHBy1_g.text: This place has it all - the menu, atmosphere and service with a smile ! A must for travelers looking for a unique and local dining experience very pleased !

GERyMl112cHAB4-YnDiAgg.text: First time trying Olive and Ivy last night for my birthday, recommendation from my sister. First of all, this restaurant is beautiful! I recommended sitting outside if it's not too cold. The ambiance is so nice!  We ordered a little bit of everything. 3 types of bruchetta, butter lettuce salad and the pesto flat bread, all to share. Everything was delicious! Fresh with good ingredients. Our server could not have been nicer. She made sure the meal was spaced out so we could have a nice relaxed evening. And the complimentary dessert at the end was extra special!   Great place. I can't wait to come back!

GyU8Y2qR9PUBN88uER6rqA.text: The ambiance is great!  They have a lovely patio with a bit of a retro feel.  Their happy hour menu is plentiful so keep the food and drinks coming!  If you like brussel sprouts, you can't go wrong with the brussel bruschetta.

Nqhrg4tmUqjG5daJdHwJyw.text: The atmosphere is so amazing.  The back patio looking over the greenbelt is so serene.  I had the salmon it was great.  Kids had the pizza as well as the yogurt parfait. Everyone was happy it is such a pleasant place.

jh7w1LvDJq7CMxbpKPNblw.text: Foods just OK. It is more of a scene. But I will say if you're a guy and want to see some beautiful well dressed ladies then check this place out. Since I'm married to my gorgeous wife i do not need to go here but for you single gents check it out.

nNFkdOM81aM2dU9AQU8wcQ.text: Bacon dates Enough said You can't go wrong with that nor the hundreds of wine they have here. Drink some wine and look at those sculptured heads on the wall, guess how much they cost

5XCkoH8gYbuXrMMI0zhOGg.text: One of my favorite Fox Restaurants and an Old Town staple for me and my friends.  They have amazing pesto and bread that is served complimentary with every meal.  The Ivy and Ginger cocktail is refreshing and not too sweet.  For breakfast, the cinnamon roll is amazing and so is the sausage sandwich.  For lunch, I reccomend the chicken pesto flatbread and, for dinner, I reccomend the Sweet Potato Cannelloni. They also have the most amazing Oreo Cheesecake Gelato.

eAX6uzVfxLgQ04PNL0OqWw.text: Looking for some good Italian and this place is a home run!  Loved the sweet potato cannelloni. Kale salad was delicious.

Bk1B6MImv8mJTNswDu6jtQ.text: Very good!  Did find a small piece of chicken and beacon in my vegan salad (cross contamination, accident).

ZSP2CjagyQxmW11E_-gO-w.text: Another great outdoors meal at Olive and Ivy. We probably overate as we split and appetizers, flatbread AND ordered entrees. Great service and nice ambiance make this a consistent choice.

9Febcn3hN3fgKZEGnAe5Eg.text: This is my wife and my favorite date night location. The filet is reasonably priced and amazingly seasoned. I always get one of the fish dishes and wow. He bruschetta is also to die for. Definitely get a reservation as this place can get quite busy but it's worth planning ahead. Yum!!

L_To2dXExyyIKJRu9vOe0Q.text: I have had several nice lunches at this restaurant but went there for dinner for the first time a couple of days ago.  The restaurant is large, and tends to be a bit noisy.  We were seated at a small table in the middle of the restaurant traffic even though the place was not busy. The noise made it hard to converse. Both the hostess and server seemed bored and indifferent.  The brushetta was very good.  The scallops were tasty, but the portion was very small for the price.  The chocolate cake was pretty bland.  Another time, I think I will just have appetizers and wine on the patio and go elsewhere for dinner.

9Ou6jsFC98toPqzvpBVSUQ.text: Came here for a business dinner and had a wonderful time! The service was perfect, very attentive but not annoying.  The bartenders we also great and the food was delicious.  The restaurant is beautifully decorated and cooler than the outside even when it is hot and the walls are open.  We will come back for personal when we are in town next time.

QY1CDpPhHP2SBwSwGByGaA.text: I must hand it to them at Olive and Ivy! First rate atmosphere and food. The pesto is the most flavorful I have ever had and that includes pesto I have eaten in Italy. Wine selection is terrific. The breakfast, lunch and dinners are wonderful. The bar feels a bit like a meat market but that is the only down side. It is beautiful, clean and worth returning to again and again.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tasty pastries.
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Charming upscale decor.
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fresh foccia.

UD0vD_MgV3ObBLfRa-b7DA.text: Wonderful restaurant. My only disappointment is that I live in Los Angeles and can't eat here more often. Had the bruschetta, turkey sandwich, and the lamb gyro. All were delicious. The staff could not have been better. One of the managers, Josh, was so on top of everything.I felt my pita wasn't grilled enough. Before I could finish my request to the waiter,Josh had picked up my plate and regrilled my pita. A diner slipped and fell and Josh was there immediately to help. We sat at common table facing the open kitchen.What a treat. Our waiter Nathan couldn't have been more attentive.Jim the food expediter was so nice and explained the dishes. Love this place!

QEoBLlovfVYZ45kxLfaxag.text: I don't know what was better, the food or the service? Great patio on the water. Delicious vodka mule. Sweet potato cannelloni with roasted almonds. Tres leches lemon meringue cake. YUM! Can't wait to go back and try other dishes....too bad I don't live in Scottsdale.  P.s. Any dish is available to go in their market section.

KkXuI21vOTGirVamMuoSCQ.text: One of the best pork dishes ever. My wife's ribeye was outstanding. All the food was top shelf. My favorite in Phoenix will go back next time I'm in town.  A little noisy but everything else was so good.

ZjGr-zt1F3LdHkb8XRTkJw.text: I wasn't that hungry when I came so I ordered there Cesar salad. I was expecting a pretty bland salad but I got the opposite. It was the best salad I have ever had! So much texture, flavors, and deliciousness in every single bite! The nuts and the oats added with the blue cheese just finished it off perfectly. The chicken served in it was also so moist.  I recommend this salad to anyone.

FoYqrA9avVwaOMGGOfZh5A.text: Marissa L was fantastic. We were celebrating our third wedding anniversary and looking forward to a wonderful dinner. We arrived at O&I after a  botched attempt at dining at another restaurant, which had changed significantly since our proposal. Marissa greeted us with genuine delight and guided us through the menu as a culinary cicerone. Our tastebuds danced with each delectable dish. Not expecting any special treatment, Marissa, having overheard our conversation, discovered that we were celebrating a special occasion and  brought us a complimentary dessert complete with "Happy third anniversary " inscribed with white chocolate on the plate. It was truly wonderful. Thanks to the great food, romantic atmosphere, and superb service, we will celebrate the rest of our anniversaries at Olive and Ivy.

ZZLUhXd8OREBGIBPmS9_og.text: This was an excellent experience.  Found this location on Yelp while looking for a nice lunch.  Easy parking, nice facility and very very nice people.  The yelp menu had the Pastrami sandwich that sounded so good but when we arrived, it was not on the menu.    I mentioned it to the very nice server and a few minutes later, she comes back over and tells me that they will make it special.  I did not ask, just went out of their way to do something nice for a customer.  The overall experience was excellent and the Pastrami was really good too.  I actually am looking forward to going back...

Io8K6H8IAGFOvTQrVSsjGg.text: Here's a tip that could improve your experience. The restaurant is very loud inside but the patio has a great ambiance. Try to eat on the canal patio!

v304sUCV7xtxBupJxs6FFw.text: Had Brunch here yesterday with my friend and it was amazing! The service was impressive! My friend ordered Diet Coke and they brought her out a bottle of Diet Coke and poured it for her at the table as they only have Diet Pepsi on tap. I thought this was above and beyond.  Our server was Easton and he was the best! He was very nice and knowledgeable about the menu. We loved his suggestions. His positive energy was contagious. Not once did I run out of water or my drink. They were on top of it. The atmosphere and decor is really pretty awesome as well. I will definitely return here and recommend it to friends.

xL0WOk3n3Il1QHJe3V01sQ.text: If you'd like to go on a date to be insulted by a group of hostesses, this is the place!  Rude, snobby and pretentious!  A friend recommended the place for a date night but these ladies were less than inviting upon entry and suggested we eat in the lounge area because we didn't have a reservation at 6 on a Thursday night.  We went to the area and there was nowhere to sit.  We had to come back in to yet another rude hostess, "you don't have a reservation or a name you left?", uh no we were here two seconds when you pointed us to the lounge to eat dinner!  I would not ever recommend this place even though the food was ok and server was better then the hostesses, the negative over made up ladies up front made it so awful!

yyBec5Fl6cdEAaFwUKRC1Q.text: Loved this place. Really good Mediterranean salad (w/ grilled chicken) and the atmosphere overall was classy and nice. Drinks were just OK; white sangria was pretty meh  Apparently they don't take big party walk-ins so make sure to book ahead if you have 8 people.

hIpKIWwgo34M7IZGgYMBFw.text: Wonderful Italian cuisine on the river in Scottsdale.  Enjoyed bruschetta sampler and bacon wrapped dates for appetizers.  Both the lasagne and the papardelle with mushrooms dishes were delicious and would be ordered again. Finished with two desserts. The lemon pudding cake was not to our liking, but the cherry pecan danish with orange marmalade and ice cream was terrific. Very good service by the waiter and food runners. Next time we visit Scottsdale will go again.

d4zF6KI6Pf29FlIjt3jXGw.text: This is a great place for breakfast/brunch.  We came here after climbing Camelback Mountain; needless to say we were very hungry.   The food didn't disappoint. We ordered off the brunch menu and shared our dishes. My wife had cinnamon french toast; since she is not a big fan of cinnamon, they were kind enough to keep the topping off. It was still a great french toast, especially with the fruit compote on top. I ordered the Homestyle Cheddar Biscuit (with scrambled eggs and sausage gravy). It was a home run - I highly recommend it.  The interior space is amazing. Also, this place is right by the Scottsdale waterfront, so it's a very nice setting. Go here!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Home-style Cheddar Biscuit (french toast in background)

Rm7WrJcLHcTIY24zlnLYuw.text: Let me start out with ambiance: The patio is gorgeous very Mediterranean garden feeling and located at the Waterfront which adds to a peaceful Meal. I gave it a 4 star as I have gluten allergy and couldn't believe that they didn't offer Gluten free bread or pasta like Postino. I ordered fritto misto which was crispy and delicious calamari mixed with zucchini. I added the very ,arugula goat cheese salad half size and was in heaven. My hubby had the lasagna bolognese which he enjoyed very much . For dessert we had chocolate ganache which was too dry for my taste not chocolaty enough  All in All great experience,prices reasonable for lunch. We will be back

a0kP-iibciKkpbm9lRYHFQ.text: I am definitely a fan of this place! The layout alone makes it worth it. They have a huge outdoor patio which is lovely most of the year. The inside is great too, they have a bar that is perfect for happy hour, and a market as well with coffee, pastries, other drinks, and various sorbets if you want something light or something to go.  Don't be afraid to dive into the bread they bring at the beginning of the meal; the pesto is fabulous! I'm a huge fan of the Mediterranean salad, which I get with salmon. I have a lot of business lunch meetings here, but day or night this is a great place to work or play!

R0jDXzUKvVH0Hb5nNuFWLg.text: My wife and I had a fantastic meal! Our waitress was awesome (Nicole D). The food was perfectly prepared and delicious. The ambiance capped the experience.  We sat outside on a chilly evening. The heaters kept us warm. Great view and beautiful furnishings!  We will definitely be back... again and again!  The Bruschetta was amazing - You will come back just for this.  The steak and bacon wrapped tenderloins were also delectable!  Did I mention that we will come again?

395osxbnn-MD2ZEYALIMHQ.text: While the food was good, it was really the service that was outstanding!!! Our server Michael deserves 5 stars. Michael was so accommodating throughout, always arriving to our table with a smile and some jokes. He really took time with us, answering questions when deciding what to order. And just overall, Michael had such a pleasant demeanor. Thank you, Michael! I ordered the Hash, I believe, which is 2 easy-over eggs atop potatoes and sauteed green peppers, topped with a gravy. Also had the delicious home-made cinnamon roll! The end.

xX-eoSJy8PvcJrchoSHT-w.text: We have been there many times but last night it was an awe full experience. We got a Bald waiter that didn't even tell us his stupid name and he didnt even serve us with water, utensils, the food was late and he forgot to bring ketchup, or any extra that we requested. He was serving his friends that were sitting beside us and they told us that they are friends with this idiot Bald waiter. After we paid, I talked to the manager who ignored us and told us to call him next time to reserve a place, as if he is going to do anything special. I told him that I called and reserve before hand and he just blindly ignored. I would not recommend anyone there.

pkjo6ViXGN9-M3q7_fzk1Q.text: Absolutely wonderful atmosphere and scrumptious food! The pesto is superb! The hummus - best I have ever had and I am a hummus lover! Mason was our waiter. A True gentleman! He made our night! Great service! We will be back!

PYM-54o07KcANBaTDYVQLQ.text: So glad I finally had the chance to try Olive & Ivy! I have had it bookmarked for forever it feels like ha. Was looking for a place to eat brunch in downtown Scottsdale that wouldn't be super crowded on a Saturday morning, and this was the perfect spot!  When we got there, the front area was like a little cafe, you could get quick food there, and they had some tasty looking pastries and gelato up front, yum! Loved the look of the place too, and how you can see them making the food and all the fresh ingredients and everything. We kinda had to look around for where the hostess was, but someone helped direct us. We were seated quickly, and everyone working there was super nice! I usually never order anything other than water, but the cinnamon roll latte totally caught my eye and I had to give it a try! Also they brought out bread and pesto for us to start and it was so so delicious. Everything tastes super fresh. My latte was a little rich so I couldn't drink too much, but I shared it with my mom and sister and all three of us were obsessing over how amazing it tasted.  The brunch menu is pretty small, but there's definitely something for everyone on there! I got the vegetable scramble. It was pretty good. Vegetables in the scramble were cut chunky which I like. The potatoes were phenomenal. My sister got the burrito and liked it. My dad got the sandwich, and my mom got the two egg plate. She asked for spinach to be added and our waiter said yes but for some reason they put it on the side! Our waiter thought that was strange and offered to have it fixed, but it wasn't an issue. Wasn't too crazy pricey either. I would love to come back to try lunch or dinner here, it was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cinnamon roll latte. Heavenly!!
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bread and pesto
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Vegetable Scramble

PqzoAZk1WPavCNuVJmQ0Nw.text: Olive and Ivy is a great concept. Fun, classy vibe with a phenomenal waterfront patio, great DJs on the weekend, and excellent food. They even have a gourmet market attached.  We sat on the patio even in summer due to their misters. You can hear the music outside as well. I imagine this place is packed in peak season!  We wanted a light dinner so enjoyed salads and a hummus platter. For dinner we shared tortelli pasta with corn and English peas. It was incredibly fresh and cooked to perfection.   Great cocktail program as well.  Would definitely return!

RXMBBmPkolqj95HXLQtIsg.text: Had a weird experience coming here for happy hour with coworkers. The manager redeemed it in the end, but it was still quite off-putting.  We had a group of about 20 people from work, who were going out as a farewell to one of our colleagues. Someone in our party had called Olive & Ivy the week before to ask if we could make a reservation since we had a large group. She was told that they don't take reservations for happy hour, but that since we'd be coming in on a Tuesday, it shouldn't be any problem to seat our whole group. Sounded great.  Our group arrived, and there was only enough "happy hour" seating available for about half of our group... despite the fact that there were many other open tables throughout the restaurant. Half of our group sat, while the other half tried to figure out what to do. Finally we asked about taking one of the other nearby tables that was empty (unfortunately not next to the rest of the group), and we were told we could sit there. The stray half of our group sat down, the server brought us water, and then left. She came back, dropped off an appetizer that our boss had bought for us, and then told us "I can't have you guys sitting here. We have to leave these tables open for dinner service. I'm gonna need to have you clear out of here by 5." (It was 4:45.) So we asked "Do you have another table we can go to? We were told we could sit here."
