She said there were no other tables we could move to, since the rest of the "happy hour" section was full. Mind you, most of the group was going to order non-happy-hour food.  The server walked away. Our half of the group (still removed from the rest of coworkers, including our departing friend who the whole outing was for) was left to figure out what to do. Honestly, we didn't really have any options... there was nowhere we were "allowed" to sit, so they were essentially just kicking us out of the restaurant even though we were ready to be paying customers. We hadn't even had the chance to order a drink. It was very awkward and rude.  As we were about to leave, a manager suddenly came over and told us he had made space for us in the happy hour section next to the rest of our group. We were immediately seated in that section, and were finally treated like normal customers. We enjoyed ourselves from that point on, but none of us could believe how poorly the situation was handled up until then.   The food and drinks were good, not great. I gave this place 3 stars instead of 2 only because the manager handled things right. It's just a shame it took so long for that to happen. This was my first time at Olive & Ivy, and I definitely wouldn't come here again by my own choice.

9MwD-izpDfCCQ83ECKZMAw.text: The location is terrific even if the parking is moderately terrible. The food is good and it has really terrific outdoor seating area.

ASmlyhtSMQ_ZvjLnMtxjRw.text: Absolutely perfect! Olive and Ivy is class all the way. From the hostess stand to walking out the door nothing but magical.The bacon wrapped dates are amazing. The mousse dessert was delicious. The restaurant and patio are beautiful! Staff is top notch. Will recommend and will be back again and again.

Rvb7wlMEZ_XnYkU9HLyp4g.text: This place is all around great! Atmosphere, food and service! I've been coming here for many years and never have been disappointed! Great for date night, girls night dinner and happy hour!

OaiudVIWwiqCRZaAtppH9w.text: We were looking for a nice place for a birthday dinner, somewhere that was new for us and had great customer feedback. So here we went! Made a reservation on OpenTable.com at the recommendation of other reviews and had no wait at all when we arrived. We opted for indoor seating, but we noticed misters on the patio a lovely view if you prefer sitting outdoors. The service was very good. Our server was knowledgeable about the menu items and prepared to offer recommendations based on pairings, popularity, and individual taste. The food was excellent. It is evident that they have put much thought into their menu. We tried 3 types of bruschetta, veal ravioli, and their chicken main course, We tried two cocktails, both excellent, and the coconut sponge dessert. The bill ran about $35 per person before gratuity, but the quality of the menu is totally worth it. No complaints. I'm sure we'll be back.

1ZHz6u_WjJWz7lHU0KrCaQ.text: Very good food! I come here a lot and really enjoy the food and service:) I get the salmon most of the time, but just got the pork with bacon and was blown away!

uIQldkFFyet5ucmRN7imFw.text: They really knock it out of the park here. Every plate is a slide into home plate. From the chicken to the vegetarian options, you can't go wrong!  The restaurant itself is gorgeous. They have dangling lights from the ceiling. A True piece of art. On weekend nights they often have a DJ and on weeknights the area around the restaurant has events going on that are nice to walk off after dinner.   If you want a cocktail, I highly recommend the red sangria. It is out of this world. The dirty martinis are also a notable choice.   The service is just as fantastic as the food.   If you're not in the mood for a sit down meal, they also have a cafe/deli area that you can pop into for a quick to-go order if need be.

gUqwfPpnebwDptBT2Z-8Fw.text: Olive for breakfast is my favorite! I much prefer it over their dinner-- which is also great. The breakfast is fast and very tasty. Who knew eggs could be so good!

OqVFphb4Q7_h1mp8bBR1iw.text: Nice atmosphere and had potential but service is marginal and hostess was no help.  I was there for a business meeting and was seated at a very dirty outdoor seating area.  They indicated they did not have a two top table available but this was on a Wednesday afternoon and did not look busy.  I would not recommend for business and expect slow and uncaring service.

qEwngULJ6x5iPi7clRG-Mg.text: I had brunch at olive and ivy last weekend and had an amazing experience. To start brunch off right I had a mimosa that was way above the average mimosa. He used fresh oj and very crisp champagne. I then got the breakfast sandwich which was fantastic and we shared the cinnamon role (Amazinggggg). The service was excellent and the atmosphere was perfect for brunch!

Uact3d_HfDHObYujPJtLdQ.text: My wife and I had one of the best meals tonight. The bruschetta was excellent, the scallops were excellent and the peanut butter desert was superb. Chris was our waiter and really knew his menu and guided us to some really great choices.  I would highly recommend this restaurant!!

C_joY7OfNBDA9N-0Pj2ggQ.text: The ambiance here can't be matched and this is one of the restaurants I go to for special occasions. There is almost no restaurant I love to sit outside under nice trees with sparkly light more. It seems pretentious from the outside but the servers are quite down to earth, attentive and the food is artesian and really everything I like in a dining experience. I love their focaccia bread with pesto dip starter (yes, it's free party peeps). The bread is soft and spongy and the pesto is delicious. I've had all sorts of things here as I've been a patron for over 10 years (now that I'm 25 lol!, I hope that admission doesn't age me). My favorite dishes: mushroom and fennel sausage white sauce flat bread, cheese and meat tray, pastas, and pretty much anything I order. The ice tea is wonderful too. We like coming here for brunch, happy hour, after shopping at fashion square, at night, for dates, pretty much anytime we are in the neighborhood. If you like this restaurant please look up FOX RESTAURANTS. Being the foodie I am, I pretty much love all of them. They have figured out the right recipe for great concept restaurants with delicious food. Yes, I am an unabashed Fox fan. Now I'll stop waxing poetic as I think my love for Olive and Ivy has been fully expressed.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Focaccia and pesto, yes please!
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The patio is wonderful!

Gl1sFxwlWTy0yQsqsrRcSQ.text: Another amazing restaurant by FOX Concepts! From the ambiance to the out door seating in Scottsdale on the stream - it was a great experience. Great service and great food. All the food was 100% on point and here is a break down of what we ordered:   Appetizers:  (1) Seasonal Chefs Board - great cheese and meat board. I have had better, but it was great. The breads on the board were AMAZING! (2) Lamb Meat Balls - These were also on point. Their pita bread is VERY delicious and the lamb meat balls with tzatziki was GREAT! (3) Hummus - this is honestly some of the BEST hummus I have ever had. It is flavorful and delicious!  Entree: Lasagna Bolognese - The portion was a great portion and so delicious also. Some of the best Lasagna I have had with pieces and bites of Broccoli, which was new for me, but the texture and taste profile added to the dish. The bread again with this was AMAZING!  Drink:  Grapefruit Mojito - I am a BIG fan of grapefruit, and if you don't like the grapefruit flavor I would not get this drink. It isn't so much a  Mojito but more of a Grapefruit cocktail!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lasagna Bolognese

QFyGdNlJCsd-6lpXya5u6w.text: I can not say enough amazing things about this place. The start was a little rough... 45 min wait and I asked the hostesses (there were 5 of them standing there doing nothing) if I could get a drink at the bar and they just said ya sure... not here, let me walk you (it's like 2 steps) and I'll help get the bartenders attention etc. nothin. We asked someone where to order a drink and they actually pointed us a place to sit and get drinks/food, it's in the bar area and no one prior had told us about it.... Awesome! No need to wait 45 mins to be seated. Stone was our server and he was awesome! Super friendly and very helpful with everything! My husband had the breakfast sandwich and I had the gyro. Both were awesome! I also recommend instead of fries the side salad is great! Everyone is here is smiling and happy to be here! Even management is helping and that's great to watch! We live in Vegas, but we will def be back here!

CIOjxYpyT1ySbdLuVhW5Bg.text: Not only is the service amazing, the food is also amazing!! Julia, our waitress was really nice and checked on how we were doing a few times. When we asked to pack our food to go, she even wrote what was in it and the date on it. The bread and the pesto sauce were amazing and really flavorful. The mushroom, mozzarella and avocado bruschetta were all delicious. The mozzarella was a bit spicy but still tasted really good. It actually made me change the way I thought of bruschetta. The sea scallops were perfectly cooked and so so yummy!! The creamed corn tasted really light and is perfect for a hot day in Arizona. The lasagna bolognese was served in a bowl and tasted great with the garlic bread.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sea scallop with creamed corn, asparagus and bacon gastrique
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. lasagna bolognese with garlic bread
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Avocado, mushroom and mozzarella bruschetta

B-Fptgo9V6o34gsNGEesfw.text: From making the reservation to our server and our wonderful food and beautiful patio. Everything was perfect will be back.

0czWApxQZJp_q3y9tZDZxA.text: Amazing food and outstanding service! Plus the gelato is sooooo yummy and refreshing!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Graham cracker gelato that comes with an actual graham cracker in it!
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Outdoor seating

eXxGX-bXqDJBXmEAOqgIKw.text: Great service, atmosphere and amazing food! Went for brunch and was not disappointed. Free bread with pesto was a plus!

AFGWJCSY-exT_7xISQijbg.text: This place is big, open and beautiful but their menu is limited so we usually just go here for drinks. However, the last few times, it was too crowded.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lamp Meatballs

Yr8kAAKVRFYkSLpgfYwjrA.text: The restaurant is absolutely gorgeous. Very nice outdoor seating. It is loud and very busy on weekend nights. I recommend making a reservation. Very nice date place  It is a little pricey. Most entrees about $20, but some around $15. Bread with pesto sauce is given to everyone. Their desserts are amazing!  Rated it down because the taste of the entree (flatbread) wasn't very good. And it is very slow service. Maybe slightly overpriced.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lemon Pudding Cake

l8Xhd2_xNEu7oh_p6ba_iw.text: Was in the Phoenix area for a convention and a local friend of mine suggested Olive & Ivy. We had a wonderful dinner sitting outside on their lovely patio. They had a spectacular wine list and unique dishes. I had scallops over creamed corn and something else .. lots of fresh herbs. It was so different so amazingly good. Service was excellent as well.

mCMlWrDeJOM-MCi7Cj0bzg.text: I always have a great meal here! My boyfriend and I love to stroll around Scottsdale and stop here for a quick bite. I typically get a mushroom pasta and bruschetta. If the main seating area is full trying sitting to the far left in the lounge. They serve the same menu but it is first come.

c3CNrrs5hbwk1sX_DZUknA.text: the best patio to sit and relax in Scottsdale. Their hummus is to die for. I love going to this place. All my friends are in love with this place. The service is amazing too.

Vz3nBYhza8RSTUAtfF7iRQ.text: If you are in this area and hungry for Seafood, go to Wildfish.  If you are hungry for anything else, come here.  My wife and I walked by here many times, but were never hungry.  We went to Scottsdale for some Cactus convention, and made it a point to stop here this time.  We ate outside on the patio, with the misters going.  I had the Natural Chicken or something like that, and it was amazing.  Chicken breast with the skin left on, over mashed potatoes.....with a mushroom sauce that is a bit misleading.  Says it is Citrus Jus, and since I am not a citrus sauce fan, told the waiter no sauce.  He suggested I get it on the side, so I did.  I tried it, and it MADE the dish.  No citrus flavor at all, very sweet like PF Chang's Mongolian sauce.  My wife got the Mushroom Pasta dish, and loved it.  Over all, one of my favorite places to go in Scottsdale.  Yelp, what is with the "gender neutral" restroom question?   Please!  Who gives a sh!t?  Restrooms have been pretty basic for centuries, look down, then use appropriate restroom!

OK3_BFttIq0yrISyW4tRSQ.text: Had dinner with friends. Service was great and the food was outstanding. Great bread and pesto to start. I had the sweet potato cannelloni which was exquisite. The waiter suggested adding a protein. I added shrimp, a great choice. The other guests had Mediterranean salad, bacon wrapped pork and chicken scalloping. Everyone raves. Can't wait to go back. Prices were very reasonable, too.

7dqq37gdsd84Oag8oPIQIA.text: Wow!  If being trendy equated to a five star MEAL experience then this place would have been off the charts!!  I agree the bread and pesto were great, as was the bacon wrapped dates but a neighboring table ordered the fish, sea bass which I normally love, and it stunk so bad it turned my stomach.  I had ordered the prawns in risotto and was hoping they wouldn't smell, but alas, they did. I couldn't eat them so I tried my honey's lasagna but it was greasy. So....not real impressed. The decor was amazing, the music was bumping but I was there to eat and it didn't happen.  Yelp...you swung and missed. Maybe next time.

RPIx4pOlgooi393biCg1yw.text: Great food. Great service. Best place to eat if you are in Scottsdale area. Food taste amazing.

KKO2iPBgMNqpNwpyMpqB3Q.text: I love their brunch and their dinner! The food is so flavorful and delicious. Most recently I had their watermelon salad, which was so refreshing for the beginning of spring in Phoenix. I love the location on the waterfront, which can be enjoyed from their large, shaded patio.

QefQDOv9J6jfmGh4n1q8Bg.text: Fantastic experience for lunch here today.  Their sandwiches and flatbreads were amazing.  To be honest though, it was the amazing customer service that was provided that made the experience 5 star worthy.  My drink was never empty, and they were extremely acomodating.  I will be going back 100 more times because of how pleased I am.

fPfGAfpR6zFZgI56WRbT1g.text: This was our first time here at Olive and Ivy. The service, food and atmosphere was amazing. The food was so good hard to put into words. Next time in town will be dropping in for more great food.

APuB-NbWdbvKSI84aldrkg.text: The food was pretty good, the location is excellent and the atmosphere is excellent.  I want more of a reason to come back. Location, atmosphere, and decent food all positive, I'm just left wanting more, I can't put my finger on it.  The weather in Scottsdale is awesome and olive and ivy is on the water front, which is actually a concrete aqueduct.

WVFHC9y3whbZfRsMWn4FhQ.text: I have been here for brunch twice, absolute best mimosas. Breakfast sandwich is awesome and the food was good. The restaurant is also big and good atmosphere. Good for large groups too and they take reservations.

c3-jCdo2dRJzZU_gFDFObA.text: Not only was the food excellent (I had the prosciutto and potato flatbread with an egg on top), but the service was amazing. The atmosphere is terrific as well. My only complaint is the coffee- I ordered an Americano, and it tasted like drip coffee. With that being said, the coffee was acceptable, and everything else made up for it. Highly recommended!

aVubF-DUNcP1LTPSpn4UWQ.text: While I was in Scottsdale I had a lunch meeting at Olive and Ivy.  The food was excellent as was the service and atmosphere.  I had the hummus appetizer and the salmon Cesar salad the first day.  It was so good that I came back a second time and had the wedge salad.    If you are in the area give this place a try.  You won't be disappointed!

qr6r2KfiWNzdf2Am_nsPZg.text: Great food and service! Beautiful place to go for dinner. Their Atlantic salmon and bacon wrapped dates were especially good!

_-DT3toFRU2tazeMKvo3ZQ.text: Atmosphere, service, wine, and food were all superb! I strongly recommend sitting out on the misty patio by the water and enjoying a glass (or more) of chardonnay with watermelon salad and fresh chicken! I'm returning for round two, today! Wonderful experience and food was cooked, prepared, and served to perfection!

myzQOrZ5AYE2kc9zzJMtHg.text: Overpriced most dishes look slopped on the plate. Typical Scottsdale.

ZveR7ZSjlzlCUy_RbNK59w.text: Be Careful !!    Went Thursday Late afternoon Nice Atmosphere Our Server was Angela My wife asked for a glass of house red  wine Angela said " We don't have house wines" She suggested the featured wine, To our surprise it was $15 for a very small glass all the wines on the menu were $7-$8 dollars  She never mentioned "the Drink special wines at $5 at glass available We got hustled We also had the Fritto Misto To call it Very Average is being generous WE wisely didn't stay for Dinner

pzU2PDulAww3zkf7WJwsSQ.text: One of my favorite patios in Old Town Scottsdale. It's inviting, comfortable and they offer great food as well.

1x_RopDTtfbfiPH1eC4jHA.text: I went here with my boyfriend on a Saturday night. Very nice vibe with a live dj. The service is phenomenal and don't have to wait for food because they have four lines in their kitchen. Must have- red sangria and their chicken scallopini. The outside patio is huge for lounging with cute patio furniture and lights. Gentlemen, take your ladies here

Bgr9X-iQmD9mt-aRYo1gLw.text: Trendy and located right on the Scottsdale "waterfront", its a typical fox-con restaurant.  Our service was great. We were seated promptly at our reservation time. Our waiter was helpful with menu recommendations and a little too attentive to our drink.  we had a starter consisting of a pile of fried food.  All of it was pretty good, but nothing special.  I had a chicken dish. If was fried but the breading was a little soggy. My lady-friends sea bass suffered the same problems as the skins were not crispy in the slightest.  Overall, this is probably more of a place to be seen than a place to actually enjoy the food.

Ge116aScwNwUEyvO86NezQ.text: Food was excellent.  I had the lamb meat balls, and some wine. Service was great as well.

rIdYoHlVdwRkHdU5JE-4uw.text: One of the best patios in Scottsdale.  Great stop on an afternoon of day drinking.   Recommend the side where you seat yourself.  One thing that gets me is that they change their menu every few hours.  It goes from brunch to some sort of mid-afternoon selection then to the whole dinner menu.  I find it annoying but the great service and relaxed vibe keeps me coming back.  Luckily I rarely order food.  When I do, the bruscetta trio is stellar.

3bNhgB_bEvYBytjKN4BnRg.text: Terrible bar service. I love this place and brought my wedding party here in 2013. Came here Mar 13 2014, sat at the bar and got served drinks right away. Then the bartenders proceeded to ignore us for nearly 15 min despite us having food menus waiting to order dinner. The bar was 60% full so it wasn't super busy. Very unfortunate, and we had to ask the hostess for a manager. Manager came by and acknowledged the poor service, paid our tab, and we left. Disappointing and we will no longer promote this place, as there are plenty of great places to eat/drink in old town.

0S1l2q_NtyfOLHZ08PGfEw.text: I am in town for work with a few coworkers. We wanted a restaurant that was more unique to Scottsdale. Olive & Ivy was wonderful. Great atmosphere without being stuffy, the waitress knew the menu and answered all of our questions, and the red sangrias were delicious. Definitely recommend.

tcmf2uPmKznMoCFEciYPFw.text: Unique and fun place to eat! You walk in to a little cafe with a refrigerated drink area across from an espresso stand which is next to a large pastry case. You walk further back to a very large and industrial mid century modern with antique accent open room where the restaurant is. The way the kitchen is set up you can sit at a bar and watch them cook or across the room you can sit around their drink bar. We sat in the main dining room and split a lamb gyro which was delicious! I know it was a fluke but I ordered the gyro and literally within two minutes it arrived at our table. The fries were also on point. The outside dining had a lovely view and the overall ambience was very enjoyable and impressive.

ss7gmNjqyTDGvJ83hTCGwQ.text: Love the atmosphere here, love the bacon wrapped dates, love sitting out on the patio!!  And the flatbreads are great too!  Definitely a cool vibe!!  Check it out for sure!

pPepvRDoiPc7QWur96A1tg.text: Great food, great service, beautiful location. Don't miss this place! The sangria is amazing.

-1WDENc-i75_cs1jUoNosg.text: Went here thanks to the gift cards I got for xmas because costco was selling Fox Restaurants gift card packages.  I have been to one other Fox restaurant, the arrogant butcher and it was yummy.  Olive and Ivy was really great, the service was awesome and I honestly believe the food was the best I have ever had.  The bacon wrapped dates were so rich with flavor it defies description.  My shrimp risotto was awesome.  The 3 types of bruschetta we had were all great.  2 other people in my party had 2 of the different pastas and they were both amazing.    The signature cocktail I had was great although $12 is steep.  I would eat here every day if I could afford it.  It came out to about $45 per person with food and drinks and it was worth it.

0M1_JtaQ8OKiT9eqqUovrw.text: I went to Scottsdale for a girls weekend and liked this place so much that I came here twice over 4 days! The outside patio is awesome and they have a great happy hour. All of the food that I tired was on point as well and everyone in our group liked their food. The first time I came here was for happy hour and we tried the bruschetta and truffle fries. All of the bruschetta's were bomb! Plus they were huge, split into 3 pieces, so it was perfs to share. To top it off they were $3 each. Steal! We each has the sangria and that was delish. I came back for Easter brunch a couple days later and we had the bread and pesto dipping sauce, wow! Everyone was talking about how good it was. I ordered the Mediterranean salad and it was soooo good! It was light, but filling. I even put a little of the pesto dipping sauce on top. My friends ordered the hummus, the Cobb salad, and the parfait. Everyone liked what they got. There literally was not a single complaint. Then to top it off we tried the cinnamon roll. This was super good. I only had a couple bites and we all passed it around. It's good if you go with a group to share with everyone. I definitely recommend this restaurant. It's right on the canal as well so it has great ambiance.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cinnamon roll
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Hummus plate
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yogurt parfait

Ajmz753QwRo4juEcqcJfOg.text: We had a group dinner here in October and had a great experience.  The restaurant is always packed and the atmosphere is always lively and beckons you to stay and enjoy the surroundings.  I started with the stuffed dates, enjoyed the scallops with asparagus and corn for my entree, and shared the vanilla tart and lemon tres leches cake with our group.  The food was great, the service was attentive and the atmosphere was welcoming.  Definitely a great place to enjoy the great patio for drinks and food.

aZAsfN0-uN8nvi-3sVunVw.text: I sat on the patio and was served by Amanda!  She was amazing!  I am gluten free and had the bacon wrapped dates!  I'll be back for them again and the beautiful patio!

XZqIBi987m9oYxzvuBjblQ.text: I've gone to Olive & Ivy a couple of times and I love everything about it. The atmosphere, the friendliness of the waiters, and the food make the entire restaurant wonderful. It's not the best food I've ever had, but it is good and everything else combined just really make me like this restaurant.   The lamb gyro is really good for lunch. It was not too heavy and the lamb flavor wasn't too overpowering. Their flatbreads are also really good, I think we got the Mediterranean one and, honestly, anything with olives automatically boosts my liking for the dish.  It's a great place to just sit and talk and have a glass of wine with your food. Whether you sit inside or outside, it's beautiful.  Also, don't miss out on the gelato! I get it every time. I am completely addicted, but I also have a huge sweet tooth. Every flavor is delicious and they are really nice even when I ask for a ton of samples because I can't make up my mind. :)

MhQgkXpPTyCB63zS3f0Afw.text: Olive and Ivy is by far my favorite restaurant. At this point I whole heartedly know that if I'm going to a restaurant owned by Fox Concepts it's going to be fantastic. I love the overall theme of Olive and Ivy. The mixture of old and new school class is really nice. Servers are always attentive and are great at time management and handling all of their tables professionally and Efficiently. I had Pita and Hummus as an appetizer and it's definitely my new fave. The prosciutto mascarpone tortellini is to die for. I sipped on White Wine Sangria while I thought was way better than some other restaurants I had drank it at recently. This is the perfect place whether you're looking for a light lunch or a classy date night on the canal. 10/10 would recommend. Will be back many, many more times!

w9GmNOxdJ-U7W8_vtdV6rQ.text: The decor of this place is great.  Very classy and well put together.  I was a little disappointed with the food.  The bruschetta was lacking in flavor.  Some of the toppings didn't taste that great together.  It wasn't bad, but I won't be back to have that again.  The veal and spinach ravioli was good.  I thought there was a sharp cheesy flavor that was almost too much.  I split that plate with my mom and thank god I did cause I could only handle eating three ravioli due to the rich flavor.  I won't be ordering that again. Overall if I were to come back, I'd order completely different menu items.  I just wasn't impressed with my choices this time :/

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Veal and Spinach Ravioli

5B8sUGHidIshahNk-YA24w.text: Went here for my birthday last night. I love the atmosphere but the food ... I'm on the fence. We started off with the fritto misto. Very soft, tender, not too breaded. I think that might be my fav so far. For entrees, we had the bouillabaisse, bone-in ribeye, and lasagna. The bouillabaisse was okay. My friends liked it. The broth lost flavor when dipped with bread. The lasagna is just lasagna and how can you go wrong? Lastly, the bone-in ribeye. Now, I'm the type of girl who an eat steak everyday, or every other day. I have eaten steak for 7 days straight. That's how much I love steak, and bone-in....yes! After having a bone-in ribeye at Steak 44 last week, I couldn't wait to eat another. By all means, I'm not comparing. But the creamed spinach was so rich that it took over the flavor and there was no steak to taste. Totally disappointing. If I were to order the steak again, I would ask to substitute the creamed spinach and not have any foods touch my steak. Also, it seemed like the chef really likes butter. I mean, probably not the healthiest dishes. I would come back but not order the same dishes. I'll keep you updated along the way....

wUBAz6s3rycEXs-78gXu5Q.text: I really, really enjoy this place. I think they have such a cool atmosphere going on and their food is just to die for.   We always make a reservation when we come and the service is always wonderful.   I usually get the Filet that comes in a horseradish sauce that is amazing! Not what you would think, and not spicy. Just flavorful and savory. My mouth waters just thinking about it!  The wine list and desert list are also great. Great place for date night or just to grab dinner with friends.   They also sell gift cards at Costco that are $100 in food for only $70! Great deals and great food. One of the best!

qPVgXJZUMvMJFbioCmp26A.text: My friends and I went here for the first time. The food is good and the our server was nice.

n1pOSbEQeJkIxsW1pDhPiA.text: I went to olive and ivy to celebrate a friend's engagement. It was a bridesmaids brunch and we had to sit outdoors because the place was so busy. Although it was hot out, Josh P made our brunch absolutely incredible. I couldn't have asked for a more attentive server. He was very in tune with what each of us wanted, and he made the bride to be feel pampered. Josh truly went above and beyond to provide excellent service. If you go to olive and ivy, ask for Josh P if you want to best service in Phoenix!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The bride to be getting the royal treatment from Josh P!

0wemAo1uxqLc5HVVm3gI6Q.text: People have been telling me about this place for a while and I should have listened earlier.   Food, service and ambience were all great. I made some substitutions to my meal and they nailed all of them.   I will be going back.

n5G4eH7dRv1FwkcbVIe0pg.text: To be honest I have zero complaints. The atmosphere was very calm, from the music to the dim lighting. Our server, Clenard was very genuine and an all around caring, helpful man. It's rare to find a place that has good atmosphere, food, and a genuine staff. I'm not the best with words, but I trust if you go you won't be displeased.

3peeJShjZmIznLgVoMBNPA.text: Great food! The ambiance in the patio is perfect. So relaxing and welcoming. Today i was joined by my better half and two daughters. We ordered the Gyro, Piccante flatbread, Burger and Chicken Panini. All very good. The Gyro is not their specialty I would pass on that. Burger was real good. Flatbread awesome... Service is really good.. Not 5 cause well abit overpriced, but its Scottsdale!!!

Ar8JBM2ARDDwmJrir8v5nA.text: Had a very pleasant lunch here. Nice patio on the canal, comfortable, good music, not loud. Great staff, attentive, but not imposing. Food very fresh and tasty. Definitely going back to this one. Thumbs up.

o4bM3BsQaloHX7XMMyjs2w.text: With 500+ Reviews, Most of all it has been said but I will offer this: Fox Concepts Restaurants consistently pulls off a memorable, pleasant experience that is tasty, full of quality and will, occasionally, have a memorable service experience.   All restaurants have their ups & downs, but Olive & Ivy is consistently good, innovative and the atmosphere is quite nice; inside or outside. Drinks are tasty, Scallopini and Cannelloni are both just Yum!  Never had a bad experience here.  Overall Rating: 4.5 Stars Service: 4.1 Stars Food: 4.6 Stars  Quality: 4.5 Stars Cleanliness: 4.2 Stars Value: 3.9 Stars

1uoaFc1kziloIyQqv3c56g.text: Excellent place to have a snack or late lunch in the afternoon while shopping over at the mall.  We had salads and appetizers which were delicious.  The servers and other staff were very attentive, almost too attentive at times the two of us felt initially like there was someone always coming up to our table asking to help us!  We had the beet salad and the mediterranean salad, as well as the lamb meatballs which were delicious and the calamari fritti.  All four were excellent choices.  It was not too busy.  Music is a little loud if you want to have private conversation, but the atmosphere is trendy but casual and inviting.

uu79zqfVjB6v2jqbuVLaOg.text: I am giving them 3 stars because we made advance reservations for a table of 12 to celebrate my best friends MBA. Upon arrival, they only had a table of 8 set-up for us. We addressed this and they said to go ahead and sit down and they would find a solution. We had to inquire several more times and we even offered a couple of solutions to push together available tables we saw.   In the end, they sat us at two separate tables because they could not accommodate a table of 12. If that is the case, they should have mentioned this very important fact when we called to make the reservation. There were available tables and space to push tables together so I still don't understand why they didn't do it.   The food was good. The service was good. But this one very important detail marred our experience because half of our friends had to sit at an entirely different table and it was very awkward.

KsL1q2CSnAnoiPt0WdALZw.text: I just had a great experience at this restaurant. From the location, server, menu and decoration, it was a perfect day anniversary night for my husband and myself Please if you go there I will recommend to order the wild Mushroom Parpadelle and the Lamb Meatballs, but I am sure anything you have it will be delicious Until the next time Olive and Ivy

7rfFCAaF2Dksp9Zlxw19ig.text: First time here. Here for lunch with family. Found on Yelp Review with attractive rating and many reviews.  Parking was fairly easy to find in a shaded parking structure. There were parking spaces available right in front of the restaurant, but we decided to park in the parking structure.   The hostess was welcoming. The restaurant presentation was a mix between industry and classic. Loved the ambiance!   We ordered Mediterranean salad with grilled chicken, Gyro sandwich, Bacon Cheeseburger, Sweet potato cannelloni, and Piccante flat bread. The server brought complimentary bread with pesto sauce which was surprisingly good! It was the BEST bread from any of the restaurants I've ever visited in my entire life!   The my unsweetened Black tropical ice tea. The tea was excellent as well as the rest of the dishes. We couldn't believe every single dish was so great!!  Our server, Mike, was top of the notch server!

KMq96EV2b23GJG728hov5w.text: Went tonight to celebrate my niece heading off to college, and my daughter's new promotion at work.  Got there early, and went to the bar for a drink. Bartenders were not very friendly, and ignored my order. Asked for a martini on the rocks with 3 olives, and got a straight up with 2 olives. (Didn't know how to make a martini)  never asked how I was doing, and if I needed anything else.  Food was delicious, and our server was very nice.  Overall had a great time, but will never sit at the bar again. Stayed with wine the rest of the night.

hWjKMNHOq0q_AmI_IqDnyg.text: Really good food healthy ,great taste and light and organic. Outside seating is best by. the canal -it is m quiet unlike indoors which is rather noisey. Service is impeccable. reservations recommended as there are often lines. Have eaten there many times and very reliable quality.

iIBitE_qiptjGm3AQRlZKQ.text: We dined there the other night and absolutely loved our experience. Their food was delicious and the service fantastic. The perfect ambiance for a relaxing and fun meal. Their menu also clearly marks which items are gluten free which was very helpful. We can't wait to return!

S8nhITHdzX_Uz1PJybbkUQ.text: So cute in here, clean, great service, open. I love being able to see the chefs do their thing in the kitchen. And MY Mediterranean salad with grilled chicken was delicious!

Q2lA4oWeXi8Xkdc-SZITvg.text: My friends and I dined here yesterday night.  Our server Amber was great and on top of things.  We started with bruschetta which was delicious.  I really liked the mozzarella one.  I had a Caesar salad which was so good, definitely in my top 3 I've ever had.  It was very flavorful.  I had the chicken scallopini for my entree.  It was very good however it came with so much spinach it would have been nice to have something else on the plate as well (mashed potatoes would have been nice).

7i7Ca32jiG9Q_h9smQhBBA.text: This was amazing. Went there last summer and never did a review. But I will be making a trip back.  Well worth the drive

4WhHaZpyRZcyx4LVZxA7vg.text: Went today for our office holiday party.   Everyone was very happy with both the service and the food. Our server Alfred was very attentive and incredibly knowledgable about the menu, both food and cocktails.   We started with the bread and pesto, which is complementary and also ordered the hummus, charcuterie plate, and bacon wrapped dates.  Hummus was flavorful with garlic and lemon and diced cucumber on top.  Dates were wonderfully sweet and soft and wrapped in thick salty bacon with a red pepper remoulade. The chef's charcuterie plate had nice thick bread, goat cheese spread, several different meats and olives.  The pesto was alright, not as much flavor as I usually expect,  but fresh and bright.  Entrees were the lasagna with bolognase, chicken panini,  sweet potato canneloni and veal and spinach raviloi.  The pasta is made in house.   I didn't try everything,  but all our party was happy.   I can say the veal and spinach raviolI was amazing!   Fresh pasta, tiny chunks of tender veal and fresh spinach in a butter sauce and pesto oil to finish.   It was amazingly rich and delicious. Dessert was lemon pudding with salted butter gelato and a spongy chocolate cake with chocolate ganache "kisses" piped on the plate and a ginger gelato.  They make 20 flavors of gelato in house.   I usually dislike gelato because it has a lower butterfat content than ice cream,  but theirs was creamy, smooth and delicious. Overall,   our experience was wonderful!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Veal and spinach ravioli.
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Ginger and Ivy cocktail with fresh bread and pesto.

Eo5X0sn7SpkurNsFDXwMJA.text: OK, OK...so I know I'm more than a little late with trying this restaurant, but in my defense I did just move back to AZ a little over a year ago ;).  I happened to be in the area picking up some shoes from Tony's Shoe Repair (which is awesome...a review for that coming soon) and was starving. I was craving something different than the usuals (Kona, Yard House and ZTejas) and I'd heard good things about this place so I decided to test it out solo.   I arrived right at the beginning of happy hour so the place wasn't too crowded yet. I was immediately impressed right when I pulled up to the place. I liked the fact that they actually had parking spots right up front instead of "complimentary" valet. It annoys me when that's all places have. First of all, I'm perfectly capable of parking my own car and walking. Second, NO valet is "complimentary". You always have to tip them or you'll look like a complete douche. I'd rather walk and burn some calories for free thanks :).   Anyway, sorry for the rant. Back to my review...  The positive vibes of this place stayed with me as I entered into the restaurant. I loved the decor and ambiance of the place. It was very open and fresh feeling. It was airy, without being to too expansive and hollow. It still had a comfort and coziness to it. It was raining that day (I know, what are the odds of that here in AZ haha) so I couldn't sit out on the patio, but from what I saw it looked like an absolutely lovely area to enjoy brunch or happy hour overlooking the water with the girls or even a great romantic date spot to watch the sun go down. The decor wasn't too rustic or too cold and modern. It was classic, cool and elegant.   I decided to just grab a seat at the bar because there were a few seats open and I was by myself anyway. It was sleek and modern and the music was at a perfect volume. It was loud enough to hear, but not so loud that you'd have to yell at the person next to you just to carry on a convo.   Since it was happy hour I decided to take advantage of the great prices and order a few apps as my meal from the happy hour menu. I skipped the cocktails this time (even though they looked delicious...especially the sangria) because I still wanted to go to the gym later that evening...and working out with a buzz just didn't seem like a very productive (or safe) idea lol.   Aside from an ice tea, I ordered the hummus plate, the prosciutto and fig bruschetta (with port salut) and also the fresh mozzarella bruschetta (with tomato jam and basil). This amount would have been a nice snack for two, and was more than plenty for me (I only finished about half the hummus).   The hummus with grilled pita bread came out first and did not disappoint! I loved how they had a good amount of chopped cucumber, onions, and little cherry tomatoes on top of the humus. It added a nice freshness and color to an otherwise monotone dish.   The bruschettas however, were by far my favorite! The tomato jam on the fresh mozzarella was amazing and added a nice twist to the traditional "mozzarella and tomato". It was so good that I seriously wish I could get a container of it to go and try it on everything from fries, to sandwiches or veggies. The prosciutto and fig one was amazeballs as well. The saltiness of the prosciutto plays off the sweetness of the fig nicely. I absolutely LOVED everything and can't wait to go back and try even more menu items. So many looked amazing. I was completely full when I left (and didn't even finish it all) all for under $15!   Overall, a great upscale place with great pricing (especially during happy hour), a great atmosphere and most importantly GREAT FOOD! The only reason why I gave it 4 instead of 5 stars is because of the service. Maybe it's because I was sitting at the bar instead of a table with an actual server, but I asked for a few recommendations and descriptions of certain things and wasn't really given anything except for "It's good...I'm not sure, whichever one you feel like." The bruschetta's were also a little slow coming out.   I still absolutely love the place and will definitely be back with friends for the food and atmosphere. ;)

zq_ypMEhKFdav3S6wh1e6Q.text: The best Brunch, Lunch & Dinner. .. With a very cool vib and Love the patio...   Fresh Healthy Food with a conscious. Made daily...  This place has a spot in my heart..... Never ever disappointed.... Always excellent !! Thank. You ...

_4T-qv6TEjwm3YEMw0DqsQ.text: LOVE this restaurant! Gorgeous ambiance and decor, great music, wonderful service, and delicious food! Just celebrated my end of post doc party there last night and had the best party of my life there thanks to the amazing staff!   We had folks with gluten, meat, and egg allergies and the staff took great care to prepare our order to specification even offering to substitute items on the menu. Especially loved the fresh mozzarella bruschetta and Mediterranean salad. Reasonable prices on these items.   They have a range of seating options including beautifully decorated outdoor patio with misters, fire pit, and plush seats for a chill atmosphere, indoor booths and tables (had a live DJ there too last night) with soft lighting indoors, and a gorgeous private room for events that (can seat up to 12) for a high class flair.   Usually the require a minimum charge to use their private room but yesterday out of kindness they offered me the room and waived this since the room was available and they didn't want it to go to waste. Made for a perfect evening with my friends and family. They turned the music down for us in the room so we could mingle and make our champagne toast and even let us bring in our own cake and provided us plates and silverware. Perfect amount of checking on us. Attentive waiter while giving us enough privacy.   Only feedback is to expand options for vegans and vegetarians at least by having more items available for entree substitutions. Other than that, perfect place for any occasion!! :-)

rZdi77kfDgOwDOZmq5issQ.text: Took my parents here for our traditional weekly dinner and it was lovely! I thought I had made reservations through the automated system but my age must be showing because they didn't have us on the list and thus no outside seating and wow, they have some lovely outside seating among these great heavily leafed trees but still, seated in less than 15 minutes.  Instead of full meals we shared a series of appetizers. I wasn't crazy ab out the Bruschetta but the lamb meatballs were good. My parents also enjoyed the hummus and I guess my overall favorite was the fresh sliced bread with the pesto sauce amazing. I did have a cocktail, the Cactus Blossom and the server did warn me it was on the sweet side but honestly, taste reminded me somewhat of cough syrup so I won't order that one again. However, you get your money's worth as I definitely felt the cocktail when it was done.  I guess I thought the food was good but what I especially liked was that the place had that operational hum of excellence which I've come to expect from the Fox Restaurants Concepts group. They know how to run eating establishments with a high end focus  and it shows. I look forward to coming back here again, though I have to try that outside seating when the weather is nice, looks wonderful. :-)

J5lV2CVhDevWs3DFjrsh-g.text: Atmosphere, food and drinks!! This place was my favorite in Scottsdale.   Definitely sit outside.   Friendly and knowledgeable wait staff.  We shared the Mediterranean salad...delicious!!   I had the mushroom pappardelle and my boyfriend had the bacon wrapped pork.   Both were excellent.  Don't forget your drinks!! We had white sangria and Mediterranean mule.  Cannot wait to visit AZ again and eat here!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mule

hTc5snVWYSRwU1PIv9Outg.text: I really enjoy this place. The food is good, reasonable priced and they have great ambiance. The servers and hostesses are super friendly and helpful. I got the lamb gryo with a side salad and it was good. i was stuffed for the day! They also are really nice to my crazy 1 and 2 year old kids. Most restaurants are not accommodating but they were and i appreciate that.

OQU_CiolE6W0QFH5t9bLtQ.text: Very Cute dining. It's perfect for a quick lunch or a dress up dinner. It would be perfect for a celebration or an intimate date. They make their foods from scratch daily and bring you bread while you wait for your meal(s). Their patio seating is really cute and very spacious as well. There is a marketplace adjacent to the restaurant where you can basically order anything off the menu at if you are in a real hurry.   Loved it! It seems that the FOX restaurant chain has yet to completely disappoint!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

mIidMqcoSGqq2QoKGp5ysA.text: Had dinner and drinks at the bar last night... the female bartender never smiled once... she looked pissed every time we asked for another drink or a water refill.  Never asked if we needed anything, how was our meal etc.  Back in 2007 - 2010... they had truly professional bartenders.  They knew your name, they'd anticipate your needs etc.  They've moved down market with the current staff... last nights bartender belongs at Zipps.

eBBK3gSLxuWsbH6nBb0jaw.text: Nice atmosphere, great food.  This is a great place for everything. Date? Yes. Family dinner? Yes. Grab a bite with friends or a good drink? Yes.  All of their food is made fresh from scratch. Small menus are always a good sign.  You want top notch service- ask for Tommy. Pure professional.

iq_l2DmNs9OVMRvPQHUPcA.text: Very nice dinner here tonight. The patio is beautiful but we did sit inside. They had a DJ ( Saturday night) and it was busy but not overwhelming. Our server, Victoria, was friendly and prompt.  The appetizer came out very quickly and we devoured the wrapped dates in minutes- so good. We ordered the lasagna which was excellent, the scallops, which were good but a little dull- not sure if they were marinated or not, and the natural chicken which had a surprising amount of flavor.  Prices are a little high for what you get, but the surroundings are gorgeous.

QldSxN8zSV1RuyDnd2xzsg.text: From the moment I walked in, I was blown away by how pretty and vibrant this restaurant was. When I found out that it was a Fox Restaurant, I fell in love even more. Our server was absolutely wonderful and patient with us. The wine selection was great and the drinks were delicious. The outside patio was romantic and beautiful. So why the 3 stars you ask?  I thought the food was nothing special. My expectations might have been higher than usual, due to my love for all of the other Fox Restaurants. The bruschetta was okay - we ordered the mozzarella, prosciutto and manchego. I feel like I've definitely had better bruschetta (Postinos).  The chef's board was nothing special either. I feel like I could have put together a better board. I didn't try the bacon wrapped dates but my friends liked it. My favorite out of everything we ordered were the lamb meatballs. It was sprinkled with a lot of feta cheese so it was absolutely delicious. For the flat bread, we did half short rib and half chicken pesto, and for pastas we ordered the wild mushroom papardelle. Again, I didn't think it was anything I would order again in the future.   The server was sweet and gave us a complimentary chocolate cake for our friend's birthday. The food was mediocre, but I would probably come back and try the other items on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Seasonal Chef&#39;s Board Bruschetta Bacon Bacon Wrapped Dates

AWXl_xCmBh3hQE4OTxwfog.text: My boyfriend and I met a friend from out of town for brunch today. I didn't really know what this place about except for the fact that it served brunch and that it was in Scottsdale. The suite number is 195 off of Marshall Way. It was a little tricky for us to find it being that it was our first time. There are off street parking and if that's not available, there's a free parking garage just kitty corner of the restaurant.   We made reservations for 3 for 11:45, the place was packed so we were glad that we made reservations.   We started off with some brunch cocktails: OLDTOWN HOUND $9 rutte gin, st. germain, arizona grapefruit BELLINI $8 peach puree, peach liqueur, smirnoff vodka, prosecco IVY & GINGER $11 smirnoff vodka, canton ginger, pineapple, sparkling wine   I had the Ivy & Ginger, you definitely taste the pineapple - nice refreshing drink. They had the Bellini and Oldtown Hound - both of them enjoyed their drinks.  I ordered the SMOKED SALMON* (toasted bagel, tomato, caper & red onion)  for $11 on an Everything Bagel. This was not the best Lox Bagel I've ever had; the salmon was a little saltier than I'd like. The nice part is this came disassembled so you could put as much creme cheese and toppings as you'd like.   My boyfriend had the EGGS BENEDICT* (shaved ham & basil hollandaise) for $13.5. This was also not best eggs benedict I've ever tasted either. The waitress gave us a heads up about the eggs coming a little translucent which was nice. I'm assuming they have had a lot of questions about it.  The * means that it contains raw foods and may cause health hazards; ie the eggs/salmon and tomato (jk about the tomato).  Our friend had the LAMB GYRO (grilled pita, tzatziki, tomato, onion & feta) $14. He said he liked it.  I almost forgot.... I had the cinnamon roll. I ordered one and it was big enough for 3 people to share. It was delicious! It had to be the best thing I tasted there!  What I loved about this place - the decor/atmosphere/drinks, cinnamon roll and customer service. What I didn't care for - the food. Maybe I didn't order the right things but I'd be hesitant to order food there again.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cinnamon Roll ---get this!!
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Eggs Benedict
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Salmon Bagel

m94JEScKYNxcrYGGZrjVqQ.text: The word "Eh" pretty much sums up how I feel about Olive and Ivy. It wasn't great, it was terrible.   I came in with some friends when it wasn't all that busy but even that was a bit of a stretch for the staff. I'm not sure if it was just the day I was but they were super understaffed. At first glance, the menu looks awesome but the execution left me wanting. It just seemed like they wanted to put as little onto plates as possible, I'm not sure if they are trying to save money or if the chef thinks it's artistic. Either way, the food is underwhelming.   The location is nice it's just a pain to get too which is pretty much how all of Scottsdale is. But I knew that going in.   Just to reiterate, eh.

oUh-xuxFlZ_395Sati_56A.text: What an awesome place to eat!!! Went on a couples date there and it had a awesome ambiance. Service was great. Will definitely be back to enjoy it some morw

3hWZWVk8o-A-Rr7Erk00jw.text: Very hip place right on the waterway on #stetsonRoad in the very cool town of #scottsdale. Large open space. Big bar. Both Indoor/outdoor areas are enticing. Good music playing. Beautiful people popping in and out.    Good sizes for salads and entrees.  We had the Cesar salad with salmon and ravioli. Both good. Split for no fee.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Ravioli -  veal and spinach. Half portion. Very good.

WsivaHZLRxG7pJ9dv69sPA.text: We had a group of three to eat here. First time at this establishment.  Food is kinda pricey, i had the natural chicken and it was delicious!!  No waiting but parking can be a challenge.

pZQesBKYbssD3j3zYKq3qw.text: Brunch menu is straightforward with a few twists. I struggled finding something that jumped off the page that I wanted to try but was happy with my order.   Their version of a Moscow Mule is excellent. Overall we have always been happy with our drinks here but I was a little disappointed in their take on an old fashion.   Atmosphere is modern but the lighting makes it cozy. The outdoor patio is near the canal, from your seat you can see the art installations over the canal or near it.   Park at the Nordstrom parking garage if you can't find street parking or don't want to valet.

mvs8hnyh84xdX38gXXTHQw.text: CHANNING is the best host/server in the cafe! She is so kind and such a sweet heart! I look forward to grabbing a bit there because of the nice staff!

3dKOrGiyzBSj6XXjT2mOMA.text: I really like the atmosphere, good service, bacon wrapped dates are still really amazing! Food quality is always fantastic, love the outdoor patio as well.

NyQchhpsRilkCnFNcW0feA.text: Amazing experience! Our server Jesse was phenomenal, super attentive and very knowledgeable. He gave great recommendations and was extremely friendly. The senior GM Dan came over and introduced himself and made sure everything was great. Food was delicious and the patio was beautiful. Will definitely be returning.

HSQNgBamNdynu2rCL_LgKQ.text: We went here just randomly looking for dinner. It was a nice place.  Food wise: we went with the Bruchetta Brussels sprouts which was ok. Then we had Flat bread chicken which was well made and I highly recommend. Kale salad was also ok. Kale can be difficult to eat but they had some ok flavor added to it.  Ambience wise: This is a total date night spot. If you're looking to impress, go here.  Service wise: They said it might take 45 mins for a table but they got us a table in short fashion. I wish the waiter was as good but he wasn't. He screwed up our order. Forgot to give us bread and we were starving. He couldn't remember to bring my fiance water also..   Ambience wise: The view is impressive in how it over looks the canal. The Live DJ makes it hip spit as well.. If you're looking to impress your date. Come here.  Overall: Id come back because of the ambience.

jb7Dh2byX2rF4DVG_lRfOQ.text: The most specialist place I love to go to  it was our first date we had the same server for two years and she left we were so sad but love it no matter what the menu changes upon season which is cool even tho I only order the same thing lol
