Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ki2OYUNShhOc8KYibqNaWA.text: Loved this place, came for brunch and sat at the bar before shopping over Christmas break! Will for sure be back

w781LH4krvelNgzUFAiCtA.text: Stopped in about 8 on a Sunday evening, still quite busy. Atmosphere is dark, intimate, yet still warm and inviting. Open floor plan with modern design. Had a bruschetta trio - possibly some of the best bruschetta I've ever had. Chicken scallopini was excellent. Tried a bit of everyone's dishes at the table. I think you'd be hard-presses to find anything on the menu that isn't good. Service was nothing remarkable, but I consider that a good thing in a restaurant like this. Keeps the focus on the group you're with. Will definitely return, again and again.

OfGGmi8uIlB5lvdkot7QVA.text: I was at Scottsdale, Arizona for a week long work conference when I stumbled upon this restaurant as one my hotel's "food recommendations" I love Mediterranean food so I decided why not! Since I was alone, I didn't wait too long to be seated and sat in front of the servers/chefs bar. I did feel a little uncomfortable because I came alone (definitely a place to go with significant others or a group of people) but gladly enjoyed the opportunity to watch the servers/chefs work. My waitress was really nice too (unfortunately forgot the name) and kept me company when she had downtime.   I ordered the shrimp scampi risotto, the Mediterranean salad, and a glass of white wine. I absolutely loved every single part of my meal. The Mediterranean salad was a great palette cleanser (huge portions) and the shrimp risotto was perfectly cooked. -1 star because it was a little too salty that I needed lemon to wash it down. I was still impressed because the risotto consistency was great and in my opinion hard to perfect. The complimentary bread was pretty tasty too!   I absolutely adored the romantic ambiance.. wish my boyfriend was able to join me :(

mFhRaibD9bm6rWZotJLSkQ.text: Decent modern American food. Try the scallops and chocolate cake. Decent atmosphere for dates and team dinners.  Would likely return and try other main courses.

vZQIM8W7kl0XxdhpNOOC7g.text: I like the outdoor seating  the weather was good and we enjoyed our lunch. We ordered margarita flatbread and grilled chicken sandwich. It was the first time for my dad to visit Scottsdale .

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

CxpHFG1Lm7ClnPbrHVHx5A.text: We stopped in for lunch. What a beautiful setting very nice with the decor. The food was amazing. We started off with the bruschetta trio. We got the mushroom, avocado and corn and the sweet potato and brussel sprouts. The were all good but the sweet potato and brussel sprouts with Fig jam was the most delicious. The combination of sweet and salty was a winner I also ordered a green salad. My husband ordered the cheese burger and it looked great too.

1FrA1XnxhwbuU2prgEvERw.text: If this review was about the ambiance, service and the margarita it would rate higher.  Al 3 were great. But I was pretty disappointed in the menu selections.  Didn't match up to what we found online which is what ultimately drew us here.  Like I said the decor and ambiance are fantastic.  Really beautiful place.  Nice outdoor area but it was all reserved when we came.  Busy place.  My margarita was very good.  I had a hard time picking from the menu because honestly nothing really appealed to me.  And the few items that did kind of get my attention were way too pricey (I was on per diem).  I didn't feel like flatbread so I ordered the chicken which had mashed potatoes and mushrooms.  Chicken was OK and was a pretty large portion.  Mashed potatoes were pureed so very creamy and delicious.  The best part of the meal.  My friend went with the Margarita pizza which she found tasty enough but really settled for because she couldn't find anything else on the menu.  I will be traveling a lot to Scottsdale for work in the near future and I may return for a drink and maybe an appetizer.  Just not wowed by the dinner selection.

i6L9DId6tJe50wViGrAa7Q.text: This place was excellent,  walk past culinary drop out and head over here. Everything was excellent. I had the chicken it was a sooo good. Great service. The corn chowder soup was excellent. You will enjoy sitting by the river walk.  Perfect evening.

Yu6nR4IA9COOrCcUujEYuw.text: Nice seating options,  I like the outdoor patio seating. The beard and pesto is super delicious.  I tried the lamb gyro and was nice and they are really generous unless you're really hungry, you might not be able to finish it all. My friend had the atlantic salmon which he liked. Service was excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Atlantic Salmon

7lC5Ww6idT7Q92s894zk1A.text: I stopped by Olive and Ivy with Gabi M and Andrea R for a quick breakfast in the marketplace side. I really enjoyed the coffee house/market vibe of this place, especially for such a casual meal. We just ordered at the counter, took our number, found a seat, and they brought our food out to us.  While Olive and Ivy serve a myriad of snacks, including some very delicious looking baked goods I went for a healthier option - the egg white omelet. It was served with tomatoes, avocados and a side of mixed fruit. On the day I was there the fruit was mostly melon in case you're wondering. Gabi and I also shared an order of wheat toast to round out our meal.  Andrea raved about the smoothies, but I had to have coffee since it's my favorite thing to drink first thing in the morning. And the coffee here was good - smooth and dark just the way I like it!

liWGCRBflvsVSOFha33TQg.text: Best mediterranean salad in all of AZ! The marketplace is my go-to for a quick salad.

8nSpZAitEk5LKxMEQFp21w.text: Awesome food. And the ambiance is great, especially the patio. Drinks are always poured with a generous hand. Everything is delicious, breakfast lunch and dinner. Dinner prices are a bit high, but completely reasonable for the area. Great for girls brunch, healthy lunch, or anniversary dinner - a can't miss!!!

8zv_jSWDAvfU7lz-0GGO2g.text: I love everything about this place! The water was very friendly, all the food was of high quality and amazing taste, and the restaurant itself is just awesome! Very trendy and chic. The interior decor is very nicely done and the outdoor terrace is absolutely gorgeous. I highly recommend any of their flatbreads, pastas, or salads. All are great. Same goes to desserts! This place is definitely worth checking out if you're in the Scottsdale area.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

v68ZsTTc_H4nEsZt3iLycQ.text: I love the atmosphere but the food is so so. Drinks are good tho! If you can get a spot on to patio it's so worth it. Bruschetta is my fav food and their pesto bread dip!

7wMooqRTHtn73_UkfTjMVw.text: Took the opportunity on this past perfect May weekend to use my Fox gift certificate and find a table outside. Bring on the O&I.   With a nod to the other yelpers, I was cautiously optimistic about the Scottsdale vibe [you know, are your boobs/car/jewelry big enough] enough to go with the Lovely. It was early and we had a reservation in which I had requested the patio. We drove up and although a bit put off by the $6 valet - um, really? used it nonetheless.   Seated right as we walked in, on the patio. Lovely night, perfect setting. Except for the choice of music - it seemed weird. I'm sorry, 'Play that Funky Music'?? With your filet and tempranillo? Not so much. Service was spot on, and actually a bit too 'on' I don't think its great to clear my plate when my dinner mate is still eating...just sayin'.   As others have noted, pesto and bread to die for. i tried the prosciutto and fig bruschetta which was yummy [not as good as Postino...] and Jeff had the margherita flatbread. Really fresh and light. He had the tenderloin, I had the tuna. Both scrumptious, lightly sauced and cooked to perfection. Dessert was a shared nutella pudding. Lovely unctuous pudding and whipped cream topped with roasted hazelnuts. Music to my tastebuds. Lovely texture and flavor. Wonderful coffee as well.   Nice wine list, very good cocktails and an atmosphere at least outdoors that was fab. Did i sound whiney? Dont mind me. Go, it'll be well worth it.

HnzgkK6PqI9Do4q6JA2dYg.text: I've eaten 33,567 meals in my life (11,189 days since I was born - 3 meals a day). The sweet potato cannelloni from this restaurant is the best dish I've ever eaten. Nothing more to say.

5JCLCSBeWAI2koiBgoRcUQ.text: Worst experience I have had. Their manager had no concept of how to work with customers. There was a misunderstanding about our reservation time and all he would say is "read the contract" . He had no authority to address the issue. We will never go to this restaurant again.

TtuZqP7mjR8FKEk_ropORw.text: When I like something I tend to order it again...and again...and again.  After a morning hike at Camelback Gabi M and I stopped by here for breakfast. I ordered their breakfast smoothie (mmm) and an egg white omelette, served with tomatoes and avocado. Oh, and a side of fruit too!  I liked it so much that when we finished our workout the next morning I asked if we could go back to Olive and Ivy. Same order this time around, but this time I added cheddar cheese to the omelette. They put a layer of cheese on top (rather than inside), which isn't how I usually like it, but this was actually really good.  I was bummed when I ran out of time on my 3rd morning in Phoenix to stop by for my usual breakfast, but I hope to be back next time.

2ej9ONqTWR1w_EvxymFWRQ.text: I went on a Friday night to grab a late night meal. The place is beautiful and the atmosphere is lounge-like. I saw a few families there and I thought that was a little weird since it was pretty late. So far...it's ok. Then we get to the bad part: our waiter. I don't remember his name nor will I put him on blast here. He was horrible! First he took forever to greet us. He was very apologetic for not being attentive. Then he takes our drink order and runs around cover his section. We get our drinks maybe 20 minutes later. He apologizes again. Then he grabs our menus and walks away. That's the thing...he was always around but was so fast we couldn't ask for anything. We tried for about 10 minutes to get anyone's attention so we could order. He come back and asked if we ordered. Really?!? You took our menus... So now we get to the insulting part. I asked him if the scallops were enough to split if we order an appetizer and salad. Simple question, right? Here's his answer: oh honey, don't you know...the better the restaurant the smaller the portion. Really?!? A simple yes or no could have been sufficient. Oh and he food....it wasn't great. It was just very ok. We ordered the bacon wrapped dates. Those were pretty good. Then we had he kale salad. It was so bitter I couldn't eat it. The scallop were good. Not bad but not excellent either. I would recommend this place for drinks and small bites in the patio area but this isn't a place I would come to for great food.

jifBsVBaxBDo4bqpO_4VmA.text: A great place to sit on the patio and enjoy the company of friends or family.  Casual and yet classy.  The food and drinks are great!

LajFmBILY7Lvi3i1atEC_g.text: I would like to go here but every time I try it is too busy.  One time they told me it was like a 6 hour wait???    It is pricey and 'totally upscale Scottsdale-ish'

D3qOUqnzCWbIAyNlyGIyXg.text: This is a trendy restaurant. Food is ok not great, especially for the prices charged. We did have a friendly server and I always appreciate that. Lunch menu is very limited compared to the dinner menu. I would only go back for dinner.

DO0XPeZDk8KrM5XR3JAM7g.text: Olive and Ivy has a beautiful location in downtown Scottsdale right on the waterfront. The salad I had there was nothing special, but it was good, and the fun atmosphere made it worth it. If you're looking for a place near old town Scottsdale that's not too busy, I would say this is a safe bet.

ejZst3aMHzbB515KWRZGCA.text: The environment is great.  I love their food.  The mushroom flatbread is delicious! White sangria is good and strong. My server was nice and kind. She checked on us every 5 minutes. My glass of water was always full. Great service, great food. Great place to go.

OtOD5u15vZnV0F4QuJL27Q.text: Was here the past week for a private event, got to say, not very many establishments have the feel Olive&Ivy has. The ambiance is PRICELESS. What a great time of year to relax on the patio with a glass of wine and a flatbread! Dined with larger groups here as well, VERY accommodating staff. Great menu, great wine.   All and all, an awesome place. Will definitely be back soon for a date night!

g0iDXZZy7gtIZf5khZr8lg.text: We came here for a late dinner. The hummus was wonderful...tasty, creamy, and full of delicious flavor. Service was wonderful as it always is in Scottsdale.  The beers on tap were also great..we had the Sedona hefe and Santan porter. A little on the pricy side but good food nonetheless

AW9HKhIkA10ANSbsHeKhtA.text: The sweet potato cannelloni was SO delicious! It might as well have been a dessert with how sweet it was! We also had three bruschetta: the strawberry and apple, prosciutto and fig, and the fresh mozzarella. They were all yummy but the fresh mozzarella was magical! The tomato jam on it was the best tomato jam I have ever had. Loved this place and I will definitely be going back! :)

xMPqEYEvXfUdTVf4v48bSg.text: Olive and Ivy is one of the best low key places in Scottsdale! I've been here probably 8-10 times and it never disappoints. To start off with, you get fluffy bread and their homemade pesto which is amazing. I could probably just eat the pesto with a spoon and call it a night! Lol the bruschetta is also phenomenal! They have a choose 3 for $11 (I think) and all the options are great. My favorite is the prosciutto and fig, sweet but salty. Least favorite is the asparagus, just not as flavorful as the rest. For the entree I usually get either the Mediterranean salad or the natural chicken. The chicken is so moist (yeah I said it!) and delicious! I've eaten here with other people who said the flatbreads, lasagna, bacon wrapped dates, and porkchop were delicious. I should also mention this sweet potato dessert I had once. I HATE sweet potatoes but our waiter got to talking about how good it was so my sister ordered it and OMG, the best dessert I've ever had. I think it was seasonal . The ambiance and decorations here are also very inviting! Last but not least, you can dress up or down and blend in. Not your typical downtown Scottsdale 6 inch heels and mini skirt place so everyone can feel welcome!   I'm salivating typing this! Just made reservations here for din tonight :)

AZIAO8hhSOv5O2oHLuwm2Q.text: TL;DR: food good, hip atmos, but happy hour criteria was confusing and not well communicated.  -------------------------------------------------------  We recently moved back to Phoenix after living in Salt Lake City for several years and we wanted to celebrate with date night at a nice restaurant. (Sidebar, not dissing SLC, but their food delicacy is fry sauce. Phoenix is definitely more thriving in the restaurant scene). Olive and Ivy did not disappoint!   Let's start with the food and dranks. Here is a rundown of what my girlfriend and I ordered.  - Dranks: Glass of happy hour chardonnay, happy hour pinot noir - Apps: Bacon wrapped dates - Entree: I ordered bruschetta (Salmon Lox, Prosciutto, Avocado), my GF ordered Piccante flatbread  The bacon wrapped dates are delicious. Wrap anything in bacon, it will probably be delicious. I enjoyed all of my bruschetta, although the Avocado was basically just avocado toast. The prosciutto with figs were a great pairing, the figs added a nice sweet taste. I probably should have seen that coming, but I think in the future I would get the Manchego or something different. Can't be reinforcing those millenial stereotypes you know. I tried some of the flatbread and it was pretty good as well.   The atmosphere was trendy and vibrant, at least in the eyes of a man who is neither of the two. O&I would be a fun place for a date or happy hour for sure.   Based on the food and the atmosphere, I would have given this review 5 stars, but I am taking off one star because the happy hour was somewhat confusing. We made a reservation for 5PM specifically to exploit the happy hour deals ($8.5 bacon wrapped dates instead of $12, $6 house wine) because we are cheap. After we were seated, we were told the happy hour deals only apply if you are sitting in the bar/lounge area which is open seating. This was noted on the menu, but we did not realize there was a separate lounge area away from the normal seating. We asked to move to the lounge area, because again, we are very cheap. The service was very accommodating, but the lounge seating was slightly more awkward to eat from, based on the size of the table and the awkward seating. It is definitely more ideal to sit in the lounge area for drinks...which I guess makes sense for the happy hour deal. I just think it would be much less confusing if happy hour applied to the whole restaurant or if they made that more clear when making reservations or getting seated.   The other confusing thing about the lounge vs. seating area is the table bread. Seating area gets free table bread but no happy hour deals, while the lounge gets happy hour deals but no free table bread. I carb-load for a living, not because I'm an athlete or anything, but I really like bread. I also like free things. So that was kind of a letdown that we were not able to get the bread because we sat in the area for the happy hour deals.   Overall, I did enjoy the meal and the night out and I would come back here again, just a little confusing with regards to the happy hour and different seating locations!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bacon wrapped dates ($8.5 during happy hour)
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bruschetta from left to right: Proscuitto, Salmon Lox, Avocado (3 for $10 during HH)

3HAxPTv1n3wN8s7Oysryow.text: We stopped here for lunch as this was a highly reviewed place per yelp. We had no issue getting seated for lunch without a reservation (around 1pm on a week day) outside as it was little chilly (mid 50's but sunny). They had the fire pits and outside heaters going which was helpful.   I had the artichoke flatbread (no goat cheese) and requested light on the truffle oil yet it was still pretty oily. Our kids split the cheese flatbread pizza (not on the menu but the waitress mentioned this as one of the items from the kids menu- which wasn't given to us and not sure of it exists in print but I asked for her recommendation as we didn't see anything on the menu kids would eat). The kids loved their pizza. My husband had the chicken pesto sandwich which was also a bit oily.   Overall, I enjoyed the food, it was fresh and tasty (could use less oil). The staff was friendly. And free soda water on tap is always a bonus!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Artichoke flat bread (bottom left), cheese flatbread top left.

zkezPVWRfOtCFXHkc-sUNw.text: I always love eating at Olive & Ivy.  Polite staff, lively atmosphere and fun music.  I like the live DJ on the weekends.  The outdoor patio seating is especially nice with shady trees and comfortable seating.  The views of the water canal and bridge and artwork are quite pleasant.  The truffle fries are truly delicious!!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Green Salad &amp; Truffle Fries

cLMXtaLb5YPUoAet3ie_Gw.text: This location is beautiful, ceilings as tall as can be, floor to ceiling windows, fantastic patio with tables and chairs also an area with outdoor couches to lounge around in (bonus fire pits to ward of the cold).  Our service was on point, recommendations were given, they were able to allow me to enjoy the pasta dish I wanted on a whim even though it was between service when they maintain a limited menu.   We went straight into main courses, I had the sweet potato cannelloni that was served with mushroom and spinach, topped with crunchy almonds.  My colleague had beet salad with salmon that she loved.   Dessert was a given, the peanut butter mousse - this made the peanut butter loving me incredibly happy.  It was light airy mousse topped with a chocolate shell that gave it texture and was topped with coffee pudding.  Amazing!!!  We also had the warm pear tart as my colleague is a pistachio addict.  This was good but paled next to the mousse.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Warm Pear &amp; Pistachio Tart
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Peanut Butter Mousse
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sweet Potato Cannelloni

CK3TKTA3WUet7vW6D6spaw.text: Rating Olive & Ivy a 4 because the patio is a 5 and the restaurant is a 3.  It has been a few months, but I went in the early spring and sat on the patio around the fire having drinks and appetizers.  The service was great and we had a really good time. I would definitely recommend the patio.  I went to the restaurant the other night and while the food tasted very average, the portions were small, the prices were high and the experience was not that special.  I  liked the appetizers on the patio a lot better.  If you are looking to go to Olive & Ivy, lots of better restaurant options but the patio location outside when the weather is good is definitely a fun evening.

M_NFzbhZSX1G9KSeOKZz3g.text: A nice place for a date night. Visited olive & ivy with my husband on a Saturday night for drinks & dinner. Tried the fig & ginger mule and the strawberry ginger margarita- both were really nice.  We tried the avocado , sweet potato and salmon bruschetta. The avocado & salmon was loved by us but we found the sweet potato bruschetta too sweet. The best part about the bruschetta was that each bruschetta was cut into 3 pieces which made it extremely convenient for us. Ordered the pesto chicken flatbread - the quantity of chicken/ toppings on the flatbread seemed too less as few slices didn't even have any chicken on it!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pesto chicken flatbread
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Avocado bruschetta

nBPofZPzXagsi2UecFAHCA.text: Lovely, lovely brunch! Can't wait to go back for dinner.  Beautiful restaurant, wonderful service and delicious food all made in house, scratch!  The pesto and bread they bring to the table is absolutely divine!  The breakfast was awesome quality of Boars Head meats, applewood smoked bacon, and perfectly cooked eggs! Just the way I ordered them!  Well done olive and Ivy!  The reviews did not disappoint, fellow Yelpers got this one right! I LOVED it!

Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

w0rUHkhPOekiThNlRel9xA.text: Returned to Olive & Ivy for another lunch with coworkers and can affirm, this place does amazing salads. This time I did the salmon caesar and it was even better than my last experience.   An awesome piece of the pink on a bed of romaine, dressed in a sauce that I think might be illegal in some states that don't allow deliciousness of extremely high levels.   Even though on this visit our food was really slow to come out, you could tell this business prides itself on service. They sent a manager over who was apologetic for delay. We didn't mind being late to our conference's next session, but it was still nice of him to come over anyways.   See you next visit, Olive & Ivy!

eN7XUTo9iq8ZkXfkTyPysA.text: Came here for dinner on a Sunday evening. When we arrived we were told there weren't any reservations available for the night but they have open seating outdoors on the couches. We opted for that and I actually enjoyed this type of dining experience. It was also the perfect temperature to sit outdoors. Our group combined ordered the charcuterie board which is a great sharing option, however I wish there were more cheese varieties. I ordered the scallops which is a very small dish so I do recommend ordering another dish to accompany. Overall the experience was pleasant the server was prompt and friendly and we all had a very good time.

RLE196iz7vx_2UTpl1iuAg.text: This is one of my favorite places in the valley by far! My friends and I usually go here a couple of times a month. Service is usually pretty fast which is nice. I would recommend making reservations though because this place is always busy. Last time I was here I got the scallop dish which was superior. It was my first time ordering it and I will for sure be ordering it again!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

caRAkwnkXnTFxwNAwaMJkw.text: We had dinner with 4 adults and 1 toddler on the patio.  Noise inside the restaurant was very loud so we ate outside.     The meat cheese nuts plate appetizer was really good.  Their complementary bread is great!   The rib eye steak wasn't the best meat. Not very tender.    I had shrimp with rice & it was too saucy, soupy.     My son liked his pork entry.   The ice creams out in the case at front look good but taste icy and my mint & chip was bland.  Servings are too small as well.   I will come back but I think I'll just have appetizers.

Hr-EzgSIDHmVIWviDDEV_Q.text: Went here with a friend because she always says how much she loves this place but I was unsure because it seemed to me like it was maybe a chain restaurant. But to be honest I was impressed I had a few drinks and a very nice salad and everything was really nice the food was fresh and good and the service was really good.  So I was kind of surprised the only thing was it took a little bit long for us to get our entrees but aside from that everything went smoothly and I will probably come back again.

_BRf46BPRMb5DFYV-XyWog.text: Another wonderful meal at this will located restaurant ordered from the counter excellent brochette love to watch the cooks active in the kitchen.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Brochette

Gdo14S6JvhMAb0uxazi13A.text: Olive & Ivy is a beautifully decorated, spacious restaurant with an amazing patio area that faces the water. We parked in the Nordstrom garage before heading across the street to the space.   The interior is very cool too and we were promptly seated for our reservation at 7pm. Waters and menus were already waiting for us as we had a group of 8. The menu consists of some lighter bites, salads, pasta and flatbreads, and a few meat and seafood entrees. The drink menu is on the back with wines, beers and cocktails listed. They had some delicious-sounding cocktails but I declined to indulge on this visit.   After putting in our drink orders, our server brought bread out for the table. It was tasty and came with a nice dipping sauce. I ordered the salmon bruschetta to try first and wow.. it was delicious. The salmon chunks were smaller and mixed in with everything else so it was easy to eat and the flavor was perfect. I wold definitely recommend if you like salmon, all of their other bruschettas sounded great as well.   For our entrees, I ordered the veal and spinach ravioli and my girlfriend ordered the margherita  flatbread. The ravioli was amazing... the flavors were so on point. It was creamy and delicious, I practically inhaled my portion. My girlfriend enjoyed the flatbread which was a decent size. Others at our table ordered various salads, flatbread and pasta and all seemed pleased with their meals too.   Service was okay, a bit slow but I give a little pass considering there were 8 of us. Could have been a bit friendlier but not the end of the world.   Overall I would definitely recommend this spot considering the food was so good. Would be a great date place or somewhere to hang out with a few friends. And sit outside, it's so nice!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Outside

hUm8u0V1OnNm44__2eu0nA.text: Great Scottsdale eatery. Lots of menu items that make it a great place for lunch, happy hour or dinner. Variety of seating options both indoor an outdoors make it fun for any sized group. Love the flatbreads! Enjoy.

qnKRVh2-rgqYEsmJ6f20kw.text: Olive & Ivy is a nice little restaurant located across the Scottsdale Fashion Square Mall. It reminds me of an upscale Cheesecake Factory. The menu can be a bit overwhelming with the amount of choices, but the atmosphere makes up for it. This is a nice spot to bring your friends during happy hour or at night. The food and drinks are good, but nothing super noteworthy to a foodie like myself. You don't need a reservation to sit at the bar, but it tends to get pretty packed so come early.

QfzjJtnCeswR4WJmi9rZvA.text: This place was so great! My boyfriend and I tried it on Friday night. I definitely suggest making reservations because they get extremely packed. Our waiter was extremely knowledgeable and answered all of our questions personably and happily. I got the chicken with mushrooms and he got the bacon wrapped pork. Both were incredible. This place is super trendy too. A great spot for a date night.

USGDwVagJUboUHgVVVZ1Xw.text: First time at Olive & Ivy, which is a popular restaurant chain. Comparing this to Olive Garden and other chains, this definitely ranks higher in quality but is equally overpriced.  My friends and I were seated immediately for a Friday lunch around 12pm, but it looked like it was getting packed pretty quickly. I ordered the chicken panini with a side of their daily soup while my friends ordered their lamb burger and Mediterranean chicken salad. Complimentary breadsticks with pesto were very yummy and piqued our appetites before the entrees came out. I liked the soup a lot, and the panini was pretty standard.   Excellent service and aesthetic interior - while waiting for our food, we were admiring the cute air light bulbs adorning the ceiling above us!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

QNb5OxL0ih8ZMDMxO1MPzw.text: Strolled in with the intention to eat dinner here  but after a few minutes in the lounge area and the poor/slow service we decided to go elsewhere. The ambiance is nice but doesn't compensate for the lack of attention from our server, the weak drinks and sloppy appetizers.  We expected more from such an attractive restaurant. A two star "we've had better" experience at Olive & Ivy.

zfRL2Q_w7KQtiYgTxWTjiw.text: Packed but still got a table and service. Friendly staff and love the layout and decors. Truffle fries, must get! Get extra aioli sauce! Lamb meatballs were delicious but I prefer the pita bread to be more fluffy. Awesome drink selection. Comfortable furniture seating. Puffy pillows, win. Waitress was attentive and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

L9ZPy5X-8ft_X0MbfTgnUA.text: Loved, loved the atmosphere. The wine list was great. The food was a good experience being that I have always been a steak and potatoes type of girl. I loved trying the new things. Place was definitely packed on Friday night. We are glad we got reservations and it was a night where my hubby and I fell back in love...would recommend this place to anyone. Just ask questions to the staff when you are unsure about the food.

Oh2eNGXqMXU5gpzKga3wGw.text: We missed the happy hour but the dinner was great!! We had bacon wrapped dates to start. It was tasty and interesting combination but too much for two people(5 bacon wrapped dates per order). I got pacific sea bass w/caramelized cauliflower, snap peas & preserved grapefruit. That was wonderful. I could lick the plate if it possible. I like the sea bass is crispy and tender. The grapefruit works so well with the plate. The sauce is also amazing. My boyfriend got spicy shrimp risotto w/white zucchini, arbol chili & lemon. There are tons of shrimp and the risotto taste wonderful as well. We had guava sorbet as dessert. For the price I think it is the cheapest sorbet I had in the restaurant. It taste good and real!! I wish I had a chance to visit Olive & Ivy again.

nVqAtOmKBwgt50K2cuZ2Pw.text: We visited Olive & Ivy while we were on vacation for a long weekend in Scottsdale, and it was hands down the best meal we had.  We were seated promptly when we arrived (we had a reservation) and our server was awesome- knowledgeable, informative and not overbearing.  The ambiance was great, sort of trendy/modern.  The space is large and the tables are spaced nicely, making it a nice date night spot.  The food was really great.  We had the hummus for an appetizer, which was amazing and had just the right amount of garlic.  For entrees I had the scallopes and he had the bacon wrapped pork tenderlion, both of which were supurb.  Dinner was a little pricey, but for the great quality of food and service I'd say that it was worth it.  If we visit Scottsdale again we will definitely return to Olive & Ivy.

udkVZLeX8kmus6zxMaluEw.text: Olive and Ivy-great location and the food is amazing. i am a vegeterian and requested something from the chef that he could make and a summer squash medley came out and it was great. Really great and friendly staff. I love the enviroment as well, dim lighting and great conversation seating.

oS_yj4x7TfggYSM1ssWGbA.text: Another Fox concept success. Tried it and really enjoyed everything about it. The service, the food, and especially the outside seating area. Just a beautiful place to go chill.

h-BDgy-kax7Jw7P51VrpCw.text: I went for the birthday party of a friend. We had a table of 10 but we got our own private room so it was very nice.   I ordered the Sangria, and that was not Sangria, i lived in spain, i know what Sangria tastes like, and that was like wine mixed with water....It was super strong as well, so at least if you didn't like it you could get drunk quickly and forget.   We ordered the Calamari for the appetizer and it was so so. It was supposed to come with Aioli sauce, once again, i've lived in spain, i know what aioli is and what its supposed to taste like. I felt like this tasted more like dill dip....   We ordered the Shrimp Risotto which I was thoroughly looking forward to, but it was bland.... It was a cream sauce without any real flavor to it. The side potato dish was better than the risotto, but it was nothing more that scalloped potatoes.   The honest truth is that the best thing i had while i was there was the bread and olive oil pesto dip. Which is ridiculous when you think how much you're paying to eat here.   Another thing i would say is that everything we ordered was recommended by the server. I'm totally not blaming him, because we wanted to order it before we even asked him, but he told us each time that it was a good selection.   Generally, I might try it again, but it wont be anytime soon and I'll be a lot more skeptical.

3kEZ0q_lCEbsredr7yQjHg.text: Came here on Friday with my Mom and two sisters after a day of shopping up Fashion Square. There was a bit of a wait (35+ minutes) which would've been okay if it wasn't 200 degrees at 8pm. In any event, once we were seating I must say everything was perfection. Everyone had some wine, our waiter/service was great, and the food was to die for. We started out with the Parmesan Truffle Fries as a starter - OMG - incredible!   I had the Free Range Chicken which was not only presented nicely but tasted even better. I wasn't a huge fan of the veggies but the mash and chicken were SO good. Everyone else had fish and since I don't eat that stuff I can't comment - but I know everyone was impressed!   We divulged and finished off the night with the Peanut Butter Torte. Again: OMG. The torte itself was amazing but the salted peanut butter gelato on the side was INCREDIBLE. Sigh. Definitely worth the wait. And if nothing else the people watching was fairly priceless...

qixEhaSmtYi_pASZGSWuuQ.text: I love the atmosphere and food!  Great service and relaxing environment to go on the weekend.  I would recommend to anyone!

ydgh9h5ZxM8MfWGv5z70Bg.text: I have been here twice now and had the same thing both times. First of all, the decor is really awesome and although it's a pretty big building, it's not crowded and they don't put in unnecessary tables. I had the buttermilk pancakes with caramelized bananas and it was amazing. Before your meal they bring out a focaccia bread with a pesto dip. The service has been very attentive both times and I would love for them to expand and open more locations.

Hopd8A2h8FkfKltmJdUpiA.text: I recently visited Olive and Ivy for business last week, and after 3 visits, I am convinced that Fox Restaurants has some of the best establishments in the valley.  Olive and Ivy is the Fox Restaurant of choice for consistently good food, great drinks, and most of all, outstanding service.  I spend a lot of time in various restaurants across the valley and am always amazed at how bad service can be at some of the more popular valley restaurants.  Not Olive and Ivy.  From the first phone call for reservations, to the greeting upon walking in the door to the smiles and warm reception you receive from every server you cross, this restaurant knows how to make you feel special.  Many of the reviews here will focus on the food and I could spend hours talking about my experiences but I will sum it up in a couple of my favorites.   I hate dates and prunes, but the bacon wrapped dates are crazy good! The shrimp and risotto main course is one of the best dishes I have tasted since arriving in Phoenix 3 years ago.  And hands down, their short rib entree is best in the valley.  The only catch is the cost.  Olive and Ivy is not cheap and definitely not for brothers looking to execute the cheap date.  With wine, apps, and main course, you will easy break the century mark, and if you are really being generous, $200 is obtainable.  But, it's worth every dollar and who knows, you may even get breakfast out of the deal!

JEIlohZiKTtBioyBbYpd6A.text: Absolutely one of the best meals we had in Scottsdale. The service was impeccable.. Our sever, Taylor, knew the menu so well and described every meal to the point we could almost taste it.We picked four different items and each one was incredible. The the deserts, mm. Thank you Taylor and manager for making our experience first rate.

_XmsYW5ZMq7iZE6W451IkQ.text: Went back with a couple of girl buddies.(yes, I gave in even when I said I wouldn't); seated on the patio, service excellent as before, food much better this time around, but stuck with lunch stuff.

vJ3SvCY66dKfukTMRS3I4A.text: Found out the DJ there on Saturdays spins trip hop! RJD2, Pretty Lights, Bonobo, Kill Paris, Layo & Bushwacka and so much more. If you don't know what I'm talking about, go check it out. You will kick yourself for not knowing about this genre of music earlier.

IKwFeTF7iYfoo4VJkDk6ug.text: Someone let Sam Fox know what exactly he has with this gem right here! Over the last couple weeks I have planned a night out for my wife and I for celebrating our 6 month wedding anniversary and our first baby boy on the way in the end of October, and I must say I am extremely satisfied with Making Olive & Ivy part of the plan! My wife and I originally walked into the Marketplace side door but a worker there was happy to lead us to the hostess stand and then we were led to our table. We were greeted by our waiter Josh P. who congratulated us on our 6 Month and our son on the way. This impressed me and took me by surprise as the waiter who I have never spoken to in my life congratulated us right off the bat. He gave us time to look over the menu but never left us stranded. He filled our drinks without a hitch, never reaching over us or interrupting our conversation. Josh then brought out this amazing bread with this sauce they didn't look good off the bat but was out of this world! My wife ordered the lasagna and I ordered these awesome little pasta raviolis' filled with cheesy/creamy awesomeness. From appetizer to entree then from entree to dessert, Josh wiped down the table and made everything fresh and clean. Also during our stay one of the managers, Kim, stopped by and somehow beat Josh to the punch with filling up our drinks. I'm not sure how others feel but for me it's awesome to see a manager work on the floor and see the managment team working alongside the waiters. I wish I had pics of all of the good because it was awesome, I will make sure to return ASAP as the food, staff and environment is great, thanks Josh for helping us celebrate on a special night out! Hope to see you guys again soon and will make sure to sit where Josh will be our waiter!!!

unNd5OVvCq-AuPlHCrb3Hg.text: Olive and Ivy has to be one of my favorite lunch spots here in the valley. The inside of restaurant itself is beautiful but I've always taken the opportunity to sit outside on their amazing patio. It really is like sitting out on your own little garden patio - minus the 50+ other people that might be out there! Whether you're seated under a shade tree or next to a bubbling fountain, it is hard to believe that you're still in the middle of the desert. Besides the patio, the food is what keeps bringing me back to the restaurant. Everything is made from scratch - and you can tell! The salads are flavorful and filling, the sandwiches are delicious, and the flatbreads are innovative and wonderful! Possibly the best parts of the meal are the pesto and bread and their white sangria. Every time I've been there I wish on a little star that the pesto and bread would continue to magically appear on the plate in front of me. I also have yet to pass up the opportunity to get some of their white sangria. The orange sugar coated rims adorn the sweet and flavorful mix of fruit and white wine (again wishing that would never end as well!). Because of the beautiful space, delicious food, and helpful staff I am happy to give Olive and Ivy 5 stars!

e7NkJ3MyXrkw26Bl6Qta-A.text: Sugar rush!  Went back for the breakfast items (pastries to be specific).  I ordered two cinnamon roll "centers."  I'm not sure why they call the rolls centers, but I do know that they are really big and really good and really gooey.  If you want your morning sugar rush, get one...or two.  I also got a raisin croissant.  It's called something fancier, but I have no idea what.  It is $3, but the thing is the size of two regular croissants.  It didn't have quite as much raisins as I would have liked, but it was flaky, buttery, and had a nice sugary glaze on top.    FRC, you all need to open a joint or two in Vegas!

Dh9vRCwjv33ye2bdlL3WgA.text: It is decorated beautifully inside and has a cool ambience. They give you an amazing pesto sauce with bread as the "free" appetizer while you check out the menu and wait for your meal. I went for brunch and ordered the egg sandwich with the egg cooked over easy as the waiter told me the egg could be cooked any way I like. I don't eat meat, so instead of the bacon I asked for more avocado (which the sandwich already comes with). When my sandwich came, the egg was not cooked over easy, it had ONE LITTLE sliver of avocado, and way too much mayonnaise. My sister couldn't decide between ordering a margherita flatbread or the Funghi Trifolati flatbread so our waiter suggested she do both. The Funghi Trifolati was the best part of the meal, and I wish we just ordered a whole one. We had the chocolate cake with the toasted marshmallow for dessert, which sounds yummy, but is actually just more of a challenge to eat the "hard-to-cut" marshmallow.

PdgTuMiMLGCBlAOmIb3Y7A.text: It's an upscale casual restaurant with nice decor- 4 star, a quick meal before or after shopping. A quick meal means only if you get good sever plus quick service.  We went to have brunch on Sunday and it was pretty packed in there. After looked at their simple brunch menu, we decided to get Grilled Hanger Steak with Scrambled Eggs, and Cinnamon French Toast with Fruit Compote & Syrup($8.50).   It wasn't too impressive, the food was just ok- 3 Star. I think you pay more for the ambiance than the dishes. The service was alright- 3 Star.  It felt like you are in the market with chit chat and bargain noise, which i thought it was kinda annoying.

we3ayaF4TGALBQJxuvTnVQ.text: The food was ok, even though it didn't come out how we requested (ordered the steak with no sauce, came smothered in it- no big deal except it's the most expensive item on the menu). The WORST was that my boyfriend ordered a couple glasses of 18yr Macallan before I ordered one. I don't know what they brought me, but it certainly wasn't the 18 year, though we still got charged ($$$) for it. We did a couple blind taste tests just to be sure... Maybe they thought I wouldn't be able to tell the difference? They should be ashamed. The food was pretty good, but really overpriced. We sat outside and the atmosphere was nice. Definitely will not be back and will never recommend this place. For the money we spent, our dinner should have been flawless.

NxPH-OeQGeLPhQmbPZ_VCQ.text: Ambience location great - then a slippery slope down hill. Service from kitchen extremely poor, 40 mins between appetizer and main! Then one meal, pork served almost defrosted raw - reheated to edible but the moment had passed. Apologies insincere. Go for atmosphere but not for service or food.

K_UydYUEby_XA9AHSLobfw.text: I'm not one to review, however I felt the need to for this place. My fiance and I came here for dinner while visiting in Scottsdale. The service was extremely slow and it took about an hour for our food to come out. And the food did not come out hot at all. Cool atmosphere. Terrible food. I would go here only for drinks only.

bWcntVVk9No4aviuKdlVEg.text: A great place to celebrate my birthday! Great food snd s fun drink menu.  If you want to be on their hugh patio be sure to make that known when you make reservations.  Inside was nice but the DJ makes sure you can't hear anything!  Very loud. Food great.  Loved the wild mushroom pappardelle and the lasagna was flavorful. Stu took good care of us.  If you're a lemon lover try the lemon pudding cake with burnt honey gelato.  It was worth the 30 min. Drive.

O4-UOPPNSBa0zO8UCvqmRg.text: I came here with a meetup group.  Most of us had never been, and our reviews were mixed.  I had the Mediterranean salad with shrimp (cold boiled shrimp which was fine with me).  Two friends had the fish of the day which they enjoyed.  Two ladies had the turkey hoagie with french fries.  One said her fries were cold.  Service was great.  I feel like it must be difficult to serve a table of ten ladies who all want separate checks.  Our waiter did so with no problem.  He was pleasant and courteous.  I would like to return and maybe sit outside and enjoy a different meal with a smaller group.

Y17qKJzGFx8EN_GoUZM6RA.text: I took a Catholic Nun for dinner and we enjoyed the company , waiter and the delicious food.

884kkPXIqX3_JQBDEn_CrQ.text: We went to Olive & Ivy for dinner on a Saturday night and we had an amazing time. The atmosphere was great. They had a DJ going which really gave it a fun vibe but the ambience was still very classy and open, and cozy. We had the sweet potato cannelloni and it was just spectacular. We are not from Arizona but are down there once or twice a year. Olive & Ivy is definitely on our list of must-go places when we go back.

mM50iRMGpBmS0YnP5_nMag.text: Good service, no wait. Food was good. Love the ambiance and the patio is inciting and cozy. Great place for a brunch and glass of wine.

rQMFRLlY7gbspER7DuHPbQ.text: Terrible experience. Would never recommend.   Background: I was here as part of a bridal party, and the problems began right away. We had enough people coming that we were not allowed to place a reservation outside. Fine. We'd just make do with open seating on the patio. There were 4 of us in our late 20s/early 30s that arrived first. I guess we made a mistake and had too many seats around our table. Rather than just politely explain it to us, our server snapped at us and kicked the chair out of her way. After we apologized, moved things, and fixed it, it took 15 minutes before she'd come back to take our drink order despite standing nearby. When we placed our order for our first round of drinks, we started by asking if we could please split our check. We were told we were only allowed to split our check for food and drinks if she took all of our credit cards, but combined with other comments she made, it was meant to ensure we'd actually pay (to be clear, we'd just asked to split our 4 orders into 2 sets of 2). By this point, more of the group was showing up, primarily some of the older relatives who proceeded to sit at a different table; we later found out that she had no problem splitting the check at this other table (perhaps trying to guarantee she gets at least one automatic gratuity?). She proceeded to completely ignore us and wouldn't bring any more water or anything except to the older members of our party. When we all ultimately ordered our food, we also ordered another round of drinks, yet somehow our drinks only came out at the same time as our food (as in, much later). My food was also a little on the cold side. To be perfectly honest, we suspected at the time that she was irritated that us younger couples were splitting meals and not each ordering one. We still had to flag down anyone that passed by just to be given water.   In the sake of fairness, here are some positives about the place. The decor, particularly outside, was gorgeous. If you told them you were splitting food, it comes out pre-split (hopefully you were planning on splitting all parts 50-50). The food itself was also pretty good (albeit with small portion sizes).  Overall, spend your money elsewhere, particularly if you look younger. If you still choose to go here, prepare to be treated poorly and ignored while paying too much for small portions.

Dpyji60WahohvdL_0w7rZA.text: Amazing food and ambiance in Downtown Scottsdale!  This restaurant is a little oasis where you can enjoy the outdoors without feeling like the heat is draining the life from you (I'm not local to this place If you can't tell).  Being from Denver where we've admittedly become spoiled with a great restaurant scene, I found this place to meet and exceed my high expectations.  The bruschetta are all amazing (def try the prosciutto) and the drinks were spot-in with generous pours and unique options.  Bacon wrapped dates are not to be missed as a starter as well.  Go ahead, sit on the patio and enjoy the umbrella of shade provided by the trees while listening to the fountains.  It's like free therapy while you eat good food!  Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

xuAd-THbfSiUUbi74qvpdQ.text: Wow really bad service.  Food was good though.  Their turkey grinder with greens is excellent. Our waiter brought our drinks (finally) when our lunch was half eaten.  Most people like to have their wine before the meal.  Really crappy service all the way around.  And it was embarrassing as I was taking someone for lunch. Booooooo!

LNFLbKUlMFoDvQbgnBJ6SQ.text: We were here for brunch.  I would recommend due to the atmosphere.  We sat outside on the patio which was quite pleasant.  Our server was absolutely amazing, top notch, didn't miss a beat.    I am giving this restaurant 4 stars mainly for the food.   The coffee is terrible, honestly not sure why restaurants of that quality would not have better coffee?  I ended up ordering a cappuccino which was very nice. The pastries were fantastic, highly recommend.  Especially cinnamon roll.   We had the breakfast burrito which was way too salty, that might sound a little picky, however, for me it was overwhelming.   The potatoes were also very salty.

Ax74U-VYkYDBeivHn6VOmg.text: My mothers birthday is on NYE so I wantged to treat her to a nice meal with nice ambience early in the evening before things got crazy. I unfortunately waited until just days prior to NYE to request a reservation and Olive & Ivy was already full so I had them put me on a wait list. Id never been to O&I but the Waterfront view is what I was looking for and the NYE Menu sounded amazing, I was elated that they called me early afternoon NYE to tell me they could make our reservation.  Our waiter Stew was polite, attentive, efficient. The complimentary pesto dipping sauce was delish and I would have been content eating just that. I ordered scallops, which were good. I havent had scallops that I liked that much in a long time. I also got a small portion steak with the scallops. My mother ordered salmon which she was enjoyed. After I told Stew it was my mothers birthday he brought her a slice of chocolate cake and candle on him which made my mother feel special.  I was very happy that we were able to get our reservation and it will be my first choice for lunch or dinner when Im in the area again

1CxqehoDlAKeaqziEgYG9A.text: Great place by the canal for a waterfront feel. I've had the salmon and the ribeye and both were incredible. As far as cocktails I didn't know what to think of a strawberry thyme martini but it was pulled off really well.  Plan to come back again. Only downside was the bruschetta was a little underwhelming but overall a pleasant experience

5ngOjrBR6Hnt_qzTOgTN-Q.text: The salad here is amazing. My friend got a flatbread and it was great. Not too many options for gluten free if you don't like salad but my salad was delicious. Really nice outdoor seating with view of the waterfront. Really nice workers. Definitely would recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

UXPFpsUNB6usC2iCO4xXQw.text: Bruschetta (salmon lox, avocado, prosciutto choices) tasted amazing - seasoned great. Also great we're the Mediterranean salad and chopped chicken salad. Larsen was our excellent server. Great view, people watching near the Soleri Bridge.

wwTtk-7tJTimPnE6bTmqLA.text: I have been coming to Olive & Ivy since it opened a few years ago on the waterfront. I love the location and i have come here consistently because I love having a latte on the patio as well as enjoying the food.  This year i have noticed that the coffee has absolutely no taste. When I question the bar staff, they tell me that it is the same and that it comes from Seattle. I consider myself a connoisseur of good coffee, having lived in Europe and South America. Something has changed and, with great reluctance, i will be looking for a new coffee place.  I hope that the manager/ owners read reviews.

f0EScwpPWBPhgPgZQpyjag.text: Wow this place is amazing!    Great food atmosphere & service.  Probably the best croissants & bakery we've ever had.  Our new favorite in Scottsdale.  Had breakfast here.  Peach Bellini was delicious.  Hummus, egg sandwich just everything was delicious

unxwZQNlJr4alkDM8J2Q-Q.text: Very delicious brunch.  Great drinks.  Super chic decor.

-SsJNrlt2F4wkSfCn82MkA.text: I absolutely love this place. The ambience inside is swanky, classy, and unique with wonderful friendly service. Our waiter was fantastic.  I was pleasantly astounded by how amazingly delicous the bruschetta was. Definitely pick 3 for $11 to try as many as possible! We got the proscuitto &fig, manchego, and butternut squash. I was in culinary heaven. I'm not even that interested in bruschetta, but these are an absolute must-get here. They were each an explosion of impressively creative flavors.  From the Small Plates menu we had the Artichoke Hearts, which was a fresh and yummy arugula salad. I was initially most excited about the Lamb meatballs- but this dish was the least tasty and we could've passed on it.   We had the Kale Salad from the Greens section which was very good as well. I liked that they allow half order of salads when you order an entree since when forced to decide between getting a salad and a hearty meal, my vegetable serving of the meal normally loses the battle.  From the Pasta section... omg the Sweet Potato Cannelloni... disclaimer: I love most things made of sweet potato, but this was truly a delicious dish with soft sweet potato center wrapped in pasta, with a creamy mushroom and spinach sauce. We couldn't finish it since we had ordered so much, and I very happily finished the rest as breakfast in bed as my first agenda of the next day.  Overall, one of the best meals I've had of late. Compliments to the chef for a creative and delicious menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. bruchetta (butternut squash, manchego, fig)

CeZT1NJbpnR5BnIyh6Ts-Q.text: Amazing food and staff. Love all of Fox restaurants food establishments and highly recommend in any state, and for any occasion.

FICbPYULnrJ_NLWNgzrC7Q.text: I had a fabulous lunch here on the patio with a girlfriend last week. The weather is FINALLY perfect and their patio is one of the best in the Valley! I could eat their complimentary pesto + bread for my meal and be totally satisfied. YUM! Their Mediterranean Salad with chicken is my FAVORITE! I also recommend the funghi, roasted brussels sprout, and butternut squash bruschetta. Everything is so fresh and delicious. I will absolutely be back soon. Even just for a drink on their gorgeous patio, it is worth the visit. This is also a great place to bring out of town guests so that they can get a good feel of the Scottsdale vibe!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yummy oatmeal with cinnamon apple compote!
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Best breakfast sandwich ever!

UeAyErP1lXexhMrIAXshAg.text: I frequent Olive & Ivy quite often -- almost once a weekend, in fact, since I love their brunch menu.  The food is definitely not the best, or the most exotic that can be available, but I find it very good nonetheless.    The normal routine I find most in tune with my taste is to walk in mid-morning and put my name in (I always end up waiting, though it's normally only 5 minutes, so its completely negligible), which gives me just enough time to grab a mimosa for my brunch mate and I.  The mimosa's are somewhat of a hit-and-miss, meaning the ratio of ingredients ranges depending on which bartender does the job.  Really though, they never are bad, and much better than countless other establishments I've patronized.  The food is very good in my opinion, and the pastry basket is a nice addition to any brunch, though it's definitely not for those on any sort of diet!  I usually order the mushroom omelet, which works great for any sort of low carb diet, and I am always happy with it.  The atmosphere is pretty good for weekend mornings, though I haven't yet tried a dinner here yet.  I've heard fairly good things from everyone I know that has gone, though.  The outdoor patio is somewhat of a rarity in the Valley of the Sun, which is a shame since the 8 or so months out of the year when the weather is enjoyable (they have portable heaters during the winter), the spacious patio is very nice.  There are expansive sofas surrounding a fountain, and arranged tables throughout the outdoor area.  The wait staff has been generally good, though sometimes they have forgotten to bring us water, which is honestly no problem.  If you remind them, they almost come running back with it.  Overall, I continue to come when I'm available, and definitely recommend it to anyone going into the area.

-wai6F14TsAsuv9yFYvC4g.text: I understand! I do! I get it that I'm a 22 year old guy that doesn't look like he could tell the difference between caviar and cold salty bean dip, but honestly when I went out for a nice sweet date night with my bangin' girlfriend, we had no idea that we were doomed to be shoved into the day care section at the haughtiest country club this side of Cafe la Ritz.   Everything felt good as our hostess walked us back through the crowded dining room. However, the fuzziness in the pit of my stomach soon morphed itself into a dull pooing sensation as we were plopped down at a table next to another set of young diners. Soda pop and water was on their table, and sexual tension (theirs) was in the air as we lifted our menus to let our eyes feast on the over priced menu.   Our service was fine, with the exception of a few awkward mishaps with our ID's, but the real issue was the food. Maybe it's just my misunderstanding of fine dining, but I thought that really good food was always served in small portions(because of the high quality ingredients, which in turn are high price ingredients) but tasted really really AWESOME. Olive and ivy only accomplished half of this with their veal and spinach ravioli. Wow, I didn't know that chef boyardee could be sold for 14 dollars. It was so bland, super under cooked and needed a serious hit of salt.   On the upside, I got a Sausage and mushroom pizza that was pretty good, but not amazing. Hand tossed...meh. Fennel Sausage...okay. This is one of the top five pizza topping combos and SHOULD be totally delicious every time. But I still think their are better places to get some killer sausage and mushroom pizza for a way better price.   On the way upside, my girlfriend got the red wine sangria and it was delicious. Smooth and sweet, but not too sweet like fruit punch or some crap. It still had the taste of wine, which rocks, but it was soooo cold and fruity and refreshing.   All in all, it was just alright. Maybe I expected too much. Maybe I thought that I could have the perfect restaurant experience. Ambiance, good food, good service. I guess that when things don't go right it gives me something to talk about, complain about, moan about. Like the right wing, or bad ranch dressing.

ECkzSsLnlW5aTRXTnyEA3Q.text: As soon as I saw this restaurant had opened in Scottsdale, I just HAD to try it!   It's really new and is located toward the back of the new Waterfront location in Old Town.  GREAT place!  I absolutely loved it.  Just from the look of it, I was anticipating that the menu would have pretty pricey items on it.  But I was pleasantly surprised to see that their Sunday brunch menu was VERY reasonable.    First off, the actual restaurant is gorgeous!  They have a really charming, adorable patio that is great for enjoying a sunny Arizona day (plenty of opportunities for that!).    Next subject...the food!  Definitely a gourmet feel with a hint of familiar additions like tator tots! ;) I noticed something on the menu called the croquet madame.  It sounded a little different, a ham and cheese grilled sandwich with a fried egg on top and some weird sauce that I could barely sound out!  Weird means that I definitely had to TRY IT! lol  It was soooooo delcious!  I savored every bite!  The different flavors errupted in my mouth! yum yum yum!   I have no doubt that their dinner menu is fantastic as well.  I will most definitely be checking it out again when I'm back in town!

h1cjZJZM6TWq-vmfK58cig.text: The food wasn't phenomenal but it was very good. The service was excellent. The decor was very cool. A good experience. Great selection of wines by the glass. Very pleasant experience.

Uo8jF1NxN0Gm8RmgJ5sEBg.text: We came here on a Friday afternoon/evening right after work for happy hour.  My wife had been given a gift card for her birthday for the Fox restaurants, so we decided to spend it here.  The happy hour is very underrated, and I'm not sure why we don't go more often.  Wines are half off, both by the glass and by the bottle.  Cocktails are a couple dollars off, and beers might be half off as well.  We've had the cocktails before, and they are solid - not my favorites, but strong, well made and tasty.  This time, we opted for a bottle of wine - not a bad deal at half off - ended up being a $15 bottle of Reisling.  My wife is still figuring out which wines she likes so she asked for advice in picking one out - the bartender made a recommendation, and then poured her a sample to try before we committed.  She liked it, so he went and got us a fresh bottle to share.    The appetizers and flat breads are also half off during happy hour.  We had the bruschetta - quite tasty, although it seemed like it was served on wheat toast, nothing overly inspired.  Had the prosciutto etc been served on a more intriguing bread...it would have been perfect.  Also, the fried calamari was tasty and light and cooked perfectly.    If they don't bring you some of their fresh made foccacia and pesto dipping oil...ask for it.  It was the absolute highlight for us.    All in all, good drinks, good food, service is great...and the happy hour prices are very reasonable.  My only tip - get there early if possible if you want elbow room.  The bar area seems to fill up pretty quickly - by the time we were leaving (6pm-ish) we had people hovering waiting for a spot at the bar.

cymLgzvT8cTWckxDXThWng.text: I had lunch here and it was fantastic. Having never been on a  weekday (since I usually go for their Sunday brunch) I was very surprised to see how large of a menu they offer. So many choices...  I went with the Ahi Tuna. It was under the salad menu, but it really wasn't a salad. Three pieces of delicious tuna were seared and then drizzled with a soy dressing. On the side was a shaved veggie salad, also good, that came with mushrooms mixed in.   Surprisingly, this was very filling. I had two cups of their Victrola coffee (a new fave) and left very, very, very happy - with the food, the service, the atmosphere... It's just great here!   Sure, I paid a little too much for lunch, if you ask me. $15 for my salad, but it was one of the most pricey items on the menu. (What can I say? I couldn't help myself). I paid about $2.50 for coffee with fresh cream. Mmmm. Love the fresh cream. Love the coffee!   Speaking of love, you can buy their pesto in their market area. It goes for $1 an oz, so be aware of that. Also in that area you can buy single beers. I'm not sure if you have to drink them there, with your food, or if you can bag it up and go. Hmm. Will have to check that out the next time I go. I did discover that the service on the market side of things is very lacking. It's a good thing they have the restaurant side. I absolutely love going here!

JYHptcOcoNgsJQK3tV_Mcg.text: 4 stars based on the sangria alone.  Order this motherfucker by the PITCHER, without apology.  If you can sit out on the patio, so much the better. if not, grab a comfortable booth near the bar.

9VSr7VESkS-f2BxVdili3Q.text: During the spring and fall in Phoenix, I'm a huge fan of Olive & Ivy. You can't beat their patio - its first come, first served on huge, comfortable furniture along with fire pits. The areas are nicely divided and its absolutely perfect for large groups. Sometimes the stench of the "waterfront" aka canal can creep up on you, but its usually fine.   What to order? I typically don't get dinner, but like to share small plates like the flatbread with my party. The sangria, margaritas and wine are all really good. Oh - and if they don't just automatially bring it over, but sure to ask for the bread and pesto. Delish!

2j-TynK3txjG3HyfWtc-bg.text: 5 stars for extremely passionate service and Chad.  We ordered takeout dinner for a family reunion of 12 on the Tuesday before Thanksgiving (we're not from the area).  We ordered a TON of dishes, mostly salads, appetizers and flatbreads for sharing.  One in our party has an allergy to garlic, so we requested that garlic dishes be flagged.     When we arrived, the kitchen was finishing up our order with  "Garlic" written on all applicable boxes.  In fact, just about every box.  Chad, who was running the kitchen, pointed this out and then suggested a risotto specialty that was garlic free.  While his staff whipped it up immediately (the restaurant was medium busy at the time), Chad went about retrieving breads and sauces to make our meal even more enjoyable, more stuff than we deserved.  He stayed with us until everything was complete and triple-checked.    The food was very good, though judging takeout -- without proper heat and presentation -- is hard.  But we will be back when we are in Scottsdale because Chad and the rest of his staff are True hosts and restauranteurs.

UTTFGW9gu-gWE0NwG08lDg.text: Friends of ours from the area took us here after a Cubs game and we had a very enjoyable experience. The ambience is very cool/trendy and the patio looked awesome. Super comfortable, with good seats/couches, heaters (which for Arizonians is a must), and acoustic musicians...I hear at night the bar can be somewhat of a pain because of overcrowdedness.  Food was solid. For app: Prosciutto with an abnormally large portion of meat. Fried Calamari which had a good reception for those who ate it and an awesome salad.  For dinner: I ordered the short rib which was fantastic...however when I first looked at it...wasn't so sure. Not a big portion upon first glance but after devouring an extremely tender piece of meat (even sharing a few bites) I felt differently. The pureed corn was a nice touch and I was extremely satisfied once finished. The dessert looked just as good and was from what the rest of the table said.  Only downside: Waitress seemed preoccupied the entire meal and not really all that friendly. No recommendations, monotone, and looking over your shoulder as she explained the specials and taking your order...maybe she wasn't a Cubs fan....who knows.

cOLKgWAujg-rxmGBo6bqNQ.text: Olive and Ivy was the suggestion of a friend. I wasn't to keen on the idea of driving up to Scottsdale in the middle of the week to eat expensive and tasteless food. Now, I come from California so my idea of a "waterfront" is very different than that of someone who lives in the desert. I'll give Scottsdale some credit though; the "waterfront" looks better when you're sitting beside it, at night, eating pesto and bread with sangria at Olive and Ivy.  We waited about 30 minutes for a table for three on a Wednesday night. We sat outside on their very nice patio right on the "waterfront". They bring you pesto and bread to start, and its so delicious and plentiful, we probably didn't need to order an appetizer. The appetizer we did get was the calamari which was delish. A friend and I split a pitcher of sangria...a little pricey but good. For my main, I ordered the mediterrean flatbread with no cheese and it was very good. The portion was huge so I took almost the entire thing home for lunch the next day. Service was good and the atmosphere is nice, especially the outside.  Overall, very good experience. A little on the pricier side (if you order drinks!) but I think its a great place to start a night out with friends.

plC0WHmFcT3qT_6UB6-cXQ.text: I had to take some clients out for dinner yesterday and asked my wife for some eatery ideas.  She suggested this place which I never heard of and I must admit I jumped to some negative conclusions.  I expected to find a pretentious, small portioned, over priced cafe next to the "Scottsdale Ditch" (sorry I meant to say Riverfront) where the seen and want to be seen hang.  When we showed up not a lot of big surprises.  There is parking for about a dozen cars on the cul du sac for all of the shops but never fear there is the trusty valet who has already coned most of them off  (is that even legal?) and will happily park your car for six bucks a throw.  Sorry, I digress.  It's just one of my pet peaves.  To be fair the restaurant decour was a pleasant surprise.  Very contemporary; open room, high ceiling with an outside patio next to the ditch... uh river.  The restaurant was about half full which was a departure from most of the others in the area which were empty.  I mean like not one party inside!  We were seated in a back room with floor to ceiling window views looking out on the patio and river.  Now you can't exactly see the river from the restaurant cause they planted bushes on the edge of the patio.  I'm paying a premium for a water front experience... where's my water?  I read about lousy service here but ours was OK.  They kind of figured we were here to spend corporate money on a big party so they were  tip motivated.  The general impression from around the table was that the food was excellent, portions were ok, prices kind of high but what do you expect in that area?  The wine list is extensive and pricey and the sommelier is well schooled in spending your money.  With my thirsty crew I was looking in the two figure column and he was making three figure suggestions.  Ouch!  Bottom line.  I would return to Olive & Ivy but maybe in the fall so I can sit on the patio and get a peek at the beautiful Scottsdale river.

HyUqP2bSMiNjAyP6_cMlyw.text: OI has the best patio in town.  I love their sweet potato ravioli.  It has a different name, but that's what I called them.  I love their GM, she has come by our table almost every time we were there.  This place is a great place to relax, and it is very well ran.

9WNrQ5R8ryRPNLYSAosAzw.text: Very cool patio, could use a smidge more mood lighting, but otherwise amazing.  Good place to gawk at the "Scenesters"....Expensive menu so stop at the ATM.....food is worth it....The Arugala salad is fab.  Parking blows- pretty much valet only.....  Kinda bumbed because I told the girl 3 different times it was my husbands birthday and it went un-noticed so not a birthday place....good for a first date....  bout it.

-6TP4Xfk49WrG4hdx5ybKA.text: NOTE: This is a review of Olive and Ivy during the day, not at night when the douche bags of Scottsdale invade!  The atmosphere is impressive--the patio is relaxing (I just have to laugh every time I think of the "waterfront" scam that Scottsdale is using to fool property owners--it is a big ditch!!)  Anyway, I love the variety of their weekend brunch, unique egg dishes, yogurt, and  cinnamon french toast.  They also have pastries, juices and even gelato!    I love taking a break from shopping for O&I brunch on the weekends, but I would be fine to never go there again after dark.  It is a classic Scottsdale experience in which the women are competing for most makeup and least clothes and the men are all wearing the same rhinestone Ed Hardy or 7 Diamonds shirt and way too much of whatever cologne is the 2008 equivalent of Drakkar Noir.  Anyway, the brunch is fantastic!

H8T5tLLNmm4Uw5_fSpGs-w.text: I hate going out for valentine's day.  the prices are jacked up, and the menus are usually uninspired using the cheapest ingredients possible.    I can't speak for their normal menu, but our valentine's dinner was amazing.  lobster bisque with corn fritters, lobster ravioli, pork 3 ways...the chocolate dessert that had a small peice of 6 different desserts...simply amazing.  the patio atmosphere is great too, the waitstaff were very friendly.

iY0VdsJIKOw0cPmAY1JiaA.text: For the record we did not eat here but I cannot wait to try it out!   As we were walking back to our car from strolling through Old Town we stopped at Olive and Ivy for a beverage and bathroom break.  I went with the tropical ice tea and it was AMAZING and unsweetened!   While poking around the market side I decided I needed to use the restroom. Okay so the next time you go, you HAVE to check them out! They are so unique! Huge doors dark woods and a really cool sink! No worries, I am not one to make a big deal about restrooms at all (unless we are talking about the freaky doors that fog up at TAO in the Venetian in Vegas) but they are just really cool and add quite a bit of character!

hePx8O8tShcGsfcaNmOm5Q.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants in Old town. I have loved everything I ordered. They also have really good cocktails. Some favorite dishes are the bolognese, the bacon wrapped dates, and the grapefruit mojito. Enjoy!

Kyh0n1wqPtSe0wrUYikfmQ.text: The place is beautiful and the small plates quite well done, but how can the offer a lasagne Bolognese that is closer to chili with a few pieces do pasta arranged in a bowl? And since when is cannelloni a rectangular ravioli? And although the waitress was attentive, our water glasses were never refilled! Too bad because we had high hopes after we read most reviews.

dj9YPTUxuLQtzlPui02wWQ.text: Have only been here once before under too stressful of circumstances to remember, this trip to Olive and Ivy was fantastic.   Usually going to lunch in Scottsdale is hit or miss with expectations, however today we had a lunch meeting scheduled for 11:30, I got a front row parking spot in front of the valet and had no problem being seated right away.  Sticking to my lunch salad trend, I ordered the Curry Salad with Chicken and couldn't have asked for a more perfect dish on such a warm day. The portions were great, the lettuce cool and crisp and even the "handmade" bread and pesto before complimented everything perfectly.   The only gripe I would have, understanding it is a Fox Restaurant, was how almost unnatural the wait staff was with how rehearsed and methodical all interactions were. Even down to the correct usage of "I am well" versus "I am good" seemed a bit out of place, but not a big deal.

No87hX9FxF22A8sYGSWktA.text: Almost walked out as hostess was without the mostest! BUT because we always (in the past) received the BEST service we decided not to leave and treat mom to a new restaurant and just wanted an enjoyable afternoon.Food was AMAZING as usual as well as our waiter Christian (Thant you for your excellent customer service).

TGPrSHcC7DGEdB331BZXWA.text: Our server was very pleasant and gave good recommendations. The flatbreads were great and sweet potato pasta was delicious.

m8RRL6llTUABVD390DHgqw.text: We went here with our daughter for a late lunch today. The truth is I can eat anywhere from trashy to classy. I tend to sit in the middle because that is where I find the best customer service and food, usually. That being said, my partner likes the upper middle fancy to fancy places. So he made reservations to go to Olive & Ivy. It is a typical Scottsdale place. Nice, clean, usually average service. I, however, LOVE Fox Restaurant Concepts and was expecting a sharp on point presentation. We arrived to average friendly hostesses, were seated and then approached by a waitress who brought water and then my ice tea. I asked for a sugar caddy for my tea. She said, "Sure" and off she went... not to return to the table. 20 mins later we were approached by a manager, Jake, who clearly saw that we had been sitting there for that amount of time. He came over and I explained the situation thus far. He had paper in hand and was ready to try and correct this experience asap! I have to say, I was in the mindset to never return! Jake worked his magic and our food came out in under 10 mins without the quality being compromised. He took over our table and was on top of refills, making sure everything was perfect and did his best to make us go from "Never Again" to "I'll give them another chance." That was his whole goal and he succeeded with flying colors! Thank you Jake for making what easily was going to be a one star come back up to a four star.
