I'll give an update review the next time I visit!

CbKtlQbHD9GvNRtdM6opHw.text: Visited from Canada a few years ago, and still haven't found a restaurant I enjoy more than here. Superb food and ambience. Will be back sometime in the future.

CceAu1zqn-iFt8Uj2W-36A.text: Customer Service is HORRIBLE!! I was meeting my husband and son at 4:00 for a late lunch, and from the time I walked in the front desk girls took their sweet time seating us. They talked about all the tables in the restaurant while I waited and waited in front of them  It was so rude and obnoxious to have customers waiting. She then told me that she can seat me, but we would have to be done in 2 hours because they have a big party coming in.  I told her we would be done, but would like to sit outside.  She told me that she can't put me outside due to the fact that it might rain at 7:00.  I told her that's 3 hours from now!!!! Then her manager Jimmy came by and by then I was upset and told them that it's rude to have the customer sitting there waiting. I asked to be seated. I told them I had been there for so long that I even knew how many seats were open.  Instead of apologizing Jimmy said, "Good for you!"   I finally sat down and my family came in.  When I told my husband what happened he immediately got up and wanted to leave.  On our way out Jimmy, the manager stopped me to "apologize" and I told him to not treat people like a jerk next time so he'll have nothing to apologize for!!   I have supported Olive and Ivy for YEARS!!!  I come here all the time and have celebrated many important events here.  There are MANY restaurant choices in PV/Scottsdale area. I wont be supporting this one any longer, and I'm happy to spread the word on how horribly I was treated.

NcrDxrDU8wwIfvusWYURig.text: I have been to this place a number of times for dinner, (2ppl-8ppl), Happy Hour, Breakfast and today, lunch.   it is always a perfectly wonderful experience. The ambiance is beautiful to start with. The hostess is always great, service great, food great, drinks great!   I love walking up to Olive and Ivy for breakfast. They make the BEST yogurt/fruit/granola bowl anywhere. The coffee is good. I have never had  bad or mediocre service there.   It's a great place for a date, business meeting, special event dinner party, girls lunch, happy hour...etc... etc..   Advice to mgmt- Keep up the good work.   P.S. While I've always had good service here; today I had a server named Tommy. A++++++ The perfect mixture of personality, service and leaving you alone while being attentive. Amazing!

gFutkCTLTXHAjjis4e08oA.text: I love Olive and Ivy. It is a tried and True staple, always the first place I bring an out of town visitor.    The ambience inside is warm and charming, open and friendly, and classy.  I loove thier lighting it is just so inviting.  Tables are spaced nicely, the bar has great seating and not too packed in that area either.  You can order a meal at the bar without feeling like you're knocking elbows with the person next to you.  The outside of Olive and Ivy is my favorite though.  The social hour seating fills up QUICK - get there early.  There are comfy big chairs and couches right outside the waterfront.  It is my favorite sitting spot in all of scottsdale to eat drink and dine.  For food -- I've come here plenty, and here's my two cents. Skip the apps, share a salad with a friend, and enjoy an entree. I keep coming back to the veal ravioli, it is just heavenly and perfect.  There is arugula on top with a light cream sauce which isn't too heavy at all. I have to force myself to explore the menu because this dish is just so good.  Last time I was here I was trying to stick to my diet, I ordered the salmon and subbed spinach instead of thier regular side.  The dish was perfect, salmon was grilled to perfection, a real fresh piece of fish. It was generous too (more generous portion than the ravioli) - and I actually ended up taking some home. My mom ordered the Cioippino, which was flavorful, a generous portion, and very good also.  I also love their scallop entree.  I don't eat a ton of red meat, but I went with a friend one time who ordered the steak and pretty much devoured it.    As for drinks -- thier sangria is amaze! Stick with the red one.  Honestly I'm writing this right now, a warm February day in Arizona, and want to leave work to sit outside and eat my lunch in pure bliss at Olive and Ivy. I have a day off later this week and will make sure I stop by.  I simply cannot get enough of this place.

Pm4AG0y2eTpJFIgaf2WY3w.text: Good food, great service.  Went for lunch   Very interesting decor.  Hip Place to be.  However it was so loud in there we found ourselves practically yelling to be heard.   Not an intimate place for conversation.

5lT-1VI4MF3GSEHEu5GQRw.text: My wife and i enjoy having a meal after taking in a movie in the Scottsdale Fashion mall.. sitting in the patio area only if the weather permits is the way to go... good place

4vYL81ju7uk0b8pm17PxjQ.text: Food taste great. Highly recommended for a date. Nice atmosphere. But try to make a reservation. I feel that tables are setup very close to each other.

9NKjH3FtvQMzYHTdLMDHPQ.text: Great food. Tuna sandwich is delicious. Food just seems to vary in portions depending on who prepares i guess. Sometimes I've had a side that came with literally 12 french fries and then sometimes they overload the container. Service is always quick and friendly!!

Bwz__6--3mpqQ3mxTMi1sw.text: Had helpful hosts even though we had no reservation on a busy Sunday brunch and got seated at a nice table by the window with my friend who was amazed by this gem and the interior design. Drinks, food, service was all 10/10

2sOxyk6iT-AwCAikQFWvqA.text: Pretentious is the one word that comes to mind while dining here.  Pros: 1. Vegetarian options 2. Delicious 3. Even though it is pretentious it is "Scottsdale Pretentious" meaning you can come in with jeans and a nice top and you'll be seated. 4. They allow substitutes and exclusions. I ordered the kale salad (yummy!) but wanted it without bacon and it was no problem. I have been to places with the whole "No. We are making it the way the chef wants" this is not one of those places.  Cons: 1. Its pretentious 2. It's a Fox Restaurant meaning it is a restaurant group. If you want a local, independent restaurant with vision of some struggling kids putting themselves through culinary school and opening up a restaurant and that the profit goes to their children softball and dance classes well this is not the place for you.

NOenI3OP9o8oS8iqT38Sqg.text: Wow...amazing breakfast, love this place. Had a sausage breakfast sandwich on a homemade English muffin, who knew? Love the decor, the open kitchen, and the staff. Very friendly place!! Great job!!!

_3caJu1Xpi3yGsCe9E6aGA.text: I have only been here for brunch on the weekend so my review is for brunch.  There is a great large area for the restaurant. It is a big open space with lots of seating. Not only that but there is also an outside space that has heaters too next to the water. The brunch is pretty good! The food has a Mediterranean and SoCal feel to it. Very tasty and not too much or too little. Not too shabby for a brunch! I'd recommend a try!

lQgwRkOBTMj4EhPyHiMpjw.text: Like other reviewers have said, I expected a more intimate setting and was surprised to see something so large and bustling. Not a bad thing, just a mismatched expectation-reality thing.  We started with some bruschettas. All good! Especially loved the mozzarella and apple caponata ones. For my main I had the big eye tuna--gorgeously done. Nice big chunks of meat that were seared nicely, on a bed of couscous and yumminess. I tried a bit of my dad's spicy pasta. SO spicy. Impressively spicy, really.   The desserts were also great, and I have a hard time picking my favorite. Perhaps the coconut cakes in that soupy coconut sauce. I didn't get to try the chocolate cake but it looked really good.  We were in the back room which offered us *some* respite from the noise of the restaurant (a great thing when they bring in an actual DJ and you're just trying to eat dinner!), but it also offered a blast of cold air each time a server went outside to help one of the diners sitting under a heatlamp. Oh well.

CLezoDEAmuE22duBE6DH3A.text: I was here last Sunday and I enjoyed it so much I decided to come back a week later. Last week our server was kind and attentive, fun and informative about the menu. Her name wast Nicki. This week not so much..... Our server is cold and distant and a little bit rude. He didn't even say hello he just stared at me until I ordered a drink. When he cleared our carafes, he just stuck his hand out so we'd hand it to him. I didnt even want to order anymore food because he was so short with his responses and his attitude made me uncomfortable. I would mention his name but he never bothered to give it to me.   Hopefully if I come back I get to sit with Nicki again, because she was absolutely wonderful.

T0CLw9j9ZTEmzbwdHpsa5Q.text: Wow amazing food and service! We didn't even have a reservation and they got us in within 10 minutes.   After sitting, we received drinks promptly and ordered. Food came super quick. We ordered the kale salad with shrimp and the salmon plate. Also ordered an appetizer of bruschetta.   We will be back. Good service. Delicious healthy food. Couldn't ask for much more!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Thank you Roberto for the suggestion on dessert!!!
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sweet potatoe
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bloody Mary&#39;s for days

6NV1o1os88NkP4FoRg2k8g.text: Wow best customer service I've ever received in Scottsdale. Now my favorite place. Thank you. Absolutely love the staff and the decor.

6vfPle6bnJyQS_3iIvnJ_g.text: Olive & Ivy (or as our server, Tommy called it, "The Ivy") never disappoints.  Can count on them to be consistent with service and quality of food.    Little did we know we'd have entertainment included in our lunch - Tommy was great and really took his time to explain his favorite items and cocktails.  His energy and happiness was contagious, and you could tell he had a passion for the food he served his guests.    The food is great as well - the Lamb Gyro, Mediterranean Salad, Chicken Panini, Bruschetta, Calamari, Caesar Salad w/Salmon...all great lunch choices.  But I have to admit...I look forward to the bread and pesto they bring to the table as much as anything.  SO good!  And if I'm not on my lunch break, a pitcher of their White Sangria pairs nicely.    5 stars to you, "Ivy", and Tommy!

Ns8M3p3it6U8hCNhiCgWGw.text: Great knowledgeable wait staff and QUICK!!! My girl fell in love with the pesto spread for the in house made focaccia and her martini! I loved my lasagna. Great warm interior too

fSJQiQ5Hfy_NQ761Lcf-JQ.text: It took forever to get a seat, even though only about 1/3rd of the tables had guests. Our server had a terrible attitude and appeared agitated that she was working. Also, the table next to us got piled up on several occasions with dirty dishes. Just disgusting, and overpriced.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The servers kept piling dirty dishes in the middle of the dining area. Disgusting.

vxlw3nYnWzYTMu7AvQVAVA.text: A nice fox restaurant in a great location. The food and service is fine, atmosphere is great. No stellar dishes but no clunkers either. Overall, it is a fun time out.

ytR0NOAt06CKuiggEDz04g.text: Olive & Ivy is quick, easy, and reliable.  We enjoy their breakfast/brunch options, bruschetta, flatbreads, and pasts the most.  The sandwiches have been less impressive--not as flavorful or as satisfying.    Take note, they typically offer fresh foccacia at the beginning of the meal, and it's easy to fill-up on it if you've already ordered bruschetta, too!  Lots of love for the butternut squash, fungi, and prosciutto and fig bruschetta.  We really like the funghi trifolato flatbread.  The sweet potato cannelloni is sweet and savory, and it's a rich dish but very good.  I've also had the bone-in ribeye, which is good and was cooked medium rare.

Srxgbj26oNO-apMTmDiQUg.text: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this place!!!  Every time I go to Scottsdale I have to go to this place, I'm obsessed. I with they had a location in San Diego where I live.  To start, the location itself is beautiful, upscale, and very cool. I enjoy people watching here too. They have a gorgeous outdoor area to eat as well. The service is always wonderful, attentive, and explain the dishes very well.   The food. They start you off with Pesto and bread. Probably the best pesto I have had in my life, including my time in Italy. I secretly go here the pesto alone. This past visit, I tried the salmon caesar salad which was delicious. The salmon was cooked medium and was very tender and light. The salad itself was quite good as well. My friend ordered the burger which looked heavenly.  Looking forward to my next visit here!!

Wz23K1-YZu4hNbsaYJZvNA.text: So this place is pretty fabulous!  I've been here on several occasions; for both lunch and dinner.  The food is remarkable and I want to decorate my home like this restaurant!  From the wall of wine bottles to the rustic atmosphere, this place has all the decor eye candy you could ask for.    Lunch time here is so nice, especially when they have the wall of windows opened towards the canal and the patio.  I ordered some bruschetta and the Margherita flatbread.  To start, we were brought some bread with house pesto.  I need to have this recipe, it was amazingly flavorful.  The service here is impeccable as well, our glasses were never emptied and there was always someone nearby that would check on us throughout.  The food I ordered was so tasty and you could tell they use fresh ingredients.  Will of course back for more!  Dinner time was to celebrate a birthday.  Our reservation was for 930pm.  Once we arrived we were promptly seated and brought out water.  Once the rest of our party arrived, we were immediately taken care of and ordered our food.  The restaurant at this point was pretty busy, but they had the windows open so the sound just flowed right out and made the already spacious space feel that much bigger.  I ordered the Potato Gnocchi Pomodoro.  Oh. my. goodness.  This was so crazy good.  I love gnocchi and could eat it all day, and this just hit the spot.  So perfectly seasoned and cooked, definitely comfort food in my book!  Everyone loved what they ordered and had no complaints.  Overall, this place is amazing and you can't go wrong going here for any occasion or time of day.  **Love it!**

UdyRc1U2wpbmjfixXAGWUA.text: Okay, so this review is long overdue!  My husband and I came here as we were spending our day in scottsdale. So we had lunch here for our anniversary in March.  Our waiter was Stephen.  He was very friendly.  We told him that we were celebrating our anniversary and he joked that we looked too young to be married. Haha. Anyway, we both ordered the same thing. I can't recall the exact name but it was a bacon cheeseburger with fries.  We also had margaritas. The waiter said the beef would be cooked meduim. I thought it'll be meduim close to well done but it was meduim rare. I never eat my burgers that way, but didn't think anything of it at the time. Fast forward three, four hours later,  it caused food poisoning.  Maybe it was my fault for eating meduim rare when I never do, but just be cautious if you are like me. The food poisoning was really bad. It caused several days of vomiting and diarrhea.  Apart from that, the waiter was super nice and got us a cake as an anniversary gift (on his tab). We were seated on the verge of outdoors and indoors, so the best of both worlds. We really had a good time so it sucked that I got sick! We will be returning,  though.  It wasn't their fault.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Anniversary cake
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lime margaritas
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bacon cheeseburger with fries

f6Pd4dvv7r8sUoH9b9Nzbg.text: Happy hour!! $3 bruschetta!! Delish~    Wasn't very busy for happy hour on Wednesday. This was my first time here. Love the decor and the bathroom is just medieval. Friendly staff and delicious food. Their bruschetta is awesome. Lots of variety to choose from.   Also got some gelato. So many yummy flavors and they didn't mind us sampling each and everyone of them. I ended up getting the white chocolate mint. OMG the mint punches you in the face, it's so good.  Would've love to come back for dinner.

0_yoyypQLafOMUXcZE3QUw.text: Extremely disappointed in my experience at Olive & Ivy. I went for a dinner with a few friends who, like me, had flew in from out of state and made reservations to dine. The service was absolutely horrifying. We were seated by a hostess who didn't do so much as to smile or make eye contact once with our group. She was cold and uninviting which was surprising considering there wasn't a crowd or any reason for her to be so distant. When we were seated, it took about ten minutes before we were given a menu. I had a Caesar salad which was unfortunately so horrible I had trouble getting beyond a few forks. The bruschetta's were okay at best.  The only appeal this restaurant provided was aesthetic. It is beautiful. If you are looking for a great dinner, drive past Olive & Ivy. However, if you're after a gorgeous dining decor, this is your place to go.

QLTlP5ttV4klR9QnLKl5BA.text: Delicious food and a wonderful patio. Many items to choose from on the menu. Great service

1oa_OU12X-3vXSBJvv2yJQ.text: This restaurant was my favorite restaurant in Scottsdale. I can't believe I never reviewed it when I lived in Arizona. Yum. I miss this place.

kgTiAbrSx_tUewLybxy_bA.text: O&I is the bees knees - face down (ass up) one of my favorite restaurants in Scottsdale/Phoenix, for sure!  My significant lover and I stumbled upon this place by accident, we were actually trying to find Culinary Dropout but my (retarded) GPS led us astray but lo and behold - Olive & Ivy stared at us...and we stared right back into its glorious face.  It's a huge restaurant and has a very upscale/classy vibe, but still maintains a romantically casual mood.  There's plenty of outdoor seating but what really takes the cake is the private dining in the back, which you typically need to reserve in advance unless you're lucky.  Service is always friendly and spot on but, of course, what really shines is the food.  Allow me to plan out your entire meal for you (you're welcome):  1. Start with the trifecta order of bruschetta and pick: prosciutto & fig, manchego, and fresh mozzarella.  You have not truly enjoyed bruschetta until you eat the aforementioned ones.  2. Prosciutto & mascarpone tortelli for sure.  3. Chicken scallopini - so tender, so juicy, so flavorful, AND it has prosciutto and mozzarella.  What more could you ask for?  4. If you're feeling baller I say it's justified to spend $38 on the Filet of beef.  You will not regret your choice...unless you accidentally forget and order the bone-in ribeye instead (I warned you).  5. I'm not big on getting dessert here since Gelato Spot is just down the street, but if you're up for it - try the peanut butter pudding.  Bonus Tip: Go to Costco (or visit the website) and pick up the Fox Restaurant Concepts gifit cards.  You can buy two $50 giftcards for only $79.99, so that's 20% savings right there.  And there you have it.  Get your gift cards from Costco, make your reservation on opentable, book the private dining area, experience heavenly flavors, and get ready to fall in love with Olive & Ivy.

uCbKZrRk3ODN7bfb5UhaQg.text: Best breakfast in Old town Scottsdale! Great price and atmosphere! Their calamari shrimp tempura at lunch was amazing. I keep going back because it's consistently delicious.

i7lFe7OcesUKA5x7wOv3ZA.text: Breakfast / Brunch here is one of the best! Lovely to sit outside and enjoy the AZ weather with tableside mimosas. The coffee is my favorite in town, love the granola in the parfait, the breakfast sandwiches and potatoes are delicious and the kids love all of the fresh baked treats. Bring the family, the dogs, great to walk around the waterfront too.   Come ready to relax or after a run/walk down the canal. Just love this place!

I0dBeKw6GhKBmyg4WYC5kg.text: Amazing ambience with a killer seat yourself patio and fireplaces (first come first serve. Make friends with someone on be couches and join their party). Great service. Ordered seasonal chef board and ate every crumb. Prosciutto, cherry compote, olives pistachios, focaccia, and a homemade rosemary butter. Worth it for a light dinner or heavy snack. Service delightful.

EZ5u1owktZD5eXPlv6N_OA.text: I've had some very good meals at Olive & Ivy. I've had two dinners and a lunch here. This is one of my girlfriend's favorite FRCs but for me it falls closer to the bottom for some reason.   It might be the menu options not being quite up my alley quite as much as some of the others but don't get me wrong it's still a great spot. The Patio is amazing, I had my favorite dinner out there.   For an appetizer we got the artichoke hearts which were well done. Our waitress made a good recommendation on wine. I had the sea scallops which were cooked perfectly.   The inside is very impressive as well. They have a market attached which has some good stuff in it. All in all a solid restaurant.

zCRL0nUo_No38_RWWg-DgQ.text: Excellent customer service this morning! The french toast is to die for! It was cooked to perfection with what tasted like REAL maple syrup! Definitely ask for the fruit topping on the side though. It's overwhelmingly sweet and would probably make the french toast a bit soggy.  We also ordered a lox bagel which was delicious! The bagel was toasted just right along with a lovely array of toppings including a whipped cream cheese, salmon, capers, and sliced tomatoes. YUM!  So I had to update this since I just opened my left overs.. I usually prefer to box things up myself at restaurants for this reason: The rest of my french toast was thrown in with the fruit sauce and is now ruined. :( The worst part is that there is no side of maple syrup! I had plenty left when they took my plate.. How am I supposed to eat this???

qqrlmIuFJ34J5DmmNhVkdw.text: This place was sooo good! Everything was raw and organically sourced. Our server was the sweetest and our seat was right by the waterfront.   Great vibes! Perfect place for brunch :)

kfuhERlRL2gzkcIzZcOVSQ.text: I love this restaurant. The food and drinks are great. The outdoor patio is a great spot to hang out with friends.

iwGjbvCkxOzpXOc3Zz7TxQ.text: Great atmosphere eating under the lighted trees beside the canal. They make delicious pesto fresh every day for their bread. Good pork tenderloin and amazing tres leeches!

m7EjzfJkQ_X0rZviyUjB-Q.text: Good food, nice atmosphere. Personally I think the champs is pricey. Other than that I have no complaints. The staff is nice, the food was good. I had 3 different bruschetta's. The avocado, the salmon and the prosciutto we also had the bacon rapped dates. Delish!!!!

p6vJIa5PsIVw9O6kC-wL1g.text: After debating on Friday evening whether we should go to one of our normal haunts for brunch or try somewhere new. After a little Yelping we decided to give Olive and Ivy a go since we were going to do some shopping at Scottsdale Fashion Square. Walking in to the restaurant the first thing I noticed was how high the ceilings were and the massive wine storage they had. We made a reservation before we took off so we were sat immediately. After we had been sat at a table, we were greeted by a very nice server named Casey, who gave us a rundown of the specials and encouraged me to order the eggs Benedict (spoiler alert: the eggs Benedict are phenomenal and the best I've had in the valley). They bring you a delicious pesto and bread dish to snack on while you wait. My fiancee ordered the Mediterranean salad and said that it was great. The eggs Benedict was excellent - the warning Casey gave me was that the eggs come out very soft, which I love, but if you don't you will want to modify your order. The potatoes are fantastic too! Our food came out very quickly and the entire experience was really great. I would highly recommend Olive and Ivy to anyone! We will definitely be back for dinner sometime!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

CZwGXRtu2r9PUNiFolYghA.text: Food is good but atmosphere needs improvement.  Why would you close a beautiful patio down because of a few drops of rain.  Really?  Isn't that what the umbrellas are for?  And you're forced to eat indoors regardless.  We chose to leave

7XYg1s_29CDG5TaTs5jJjQ.text: Absolutely enjoy Olive and Ivy!    Been here several times while in town on business. Great place to meet up for a nice bite and wine with clients or coworkers and enjoyable atmosphere all around.  The menu is Mediterranean fare wii a spattering of California....it's a short menu but something for everyone!     Thoroughly enjoyed the lamb meatballs and Mediterranean salad.

_WowlWesEY4Ohw8wTUbwGQ.text: The food is great here. The service is hit or miss unfortunately. We've had great service and awful service here. Hoping they can dial it in as the ambiance and food are great....however the brunch menu could be expanded a bit as well.

BBULe9ElqZRisRdkilwcUg.text: Hands down our favorite place in Scottsdale! We love the outside patio, but the chefs table is super fun too. Their flatbreads are fantastic, the pesto is to die for, their scallops and polenta is my all time favorite and you can't go wrong with their peanut butter mousse. Do not skip this place when you're in Scottsdale!

YxoGx0-Hp9AGs3TjqgtE2A.text: Read great reviews but my personal experience was not so great. I walked in with my husband and wasn't greeted by the two hostesses followed by being ignored at our table for almost 15 minutes. Our waiter didn't even introduce himself and wasn't friendly at all. Also, 45 people were running around "working" yet you cannot get empty plates off of your table or a water refill. The charcuterie board was so pathetic - save your money as they only put a measly piece of disgusting cheese on it, which is the size of your thumb. I cannot even believe that is offered on their menu!! The whole point of a charcuterie board IS an assortment of cheese(s). The other food we ordered was mediocre. Uncomfortable and unpleasant experience so will never return.

1qajNdUxYlH2GJZOwGHdsA.text: Olive and Ivy is my go to place for an exceptional experience. I go here for any special occasion because I'm never let down. I usually dine at night because the setting is romantic with mason lighting in the inside. Fireplaces and mason lights line the large patio overlooking the waterfront. Very versatile with a good sized bar for drinks, private events area, outdoor patio, booths, tables, couches, and a coffee/breakfast counter. The moment you walk in you're always greeted by a friendly host or hostess. The servers are uniform and dressed to fit the atmosphere. They are always very professional, knowledgeable and friendly. Ask for the house focaccia and uniquely divine pine nut pesto. My favorite way to start the meal. The wine is allowed for tasting and placed in a beautiful chilled stone. Chefs board is enough for 2-3. Thinly sliced meats and delicious fig spread. I'd prefer if there was more cheese since there was a lot of bread and other mixings. The mushroom truffle tagliatelle will forever be one of my favorite pasta dishes I've had for the fresh thin noodles and perfectly seasoned sauce. On another occasion we had the dessert and it was plated beautifully balanced with different textures and temperatures.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

VKmNia0j7wCrpMlzlz14AQ.text: If you find yourself wondering what this place reminds you of, think no more - it is a glorified Cheesecake Factory.  The ambience is Willy Wonka meets Alice in Wonderland with the super high ceilings, geometric decor and frankly, a color scheme that needs to be muted down a notch or two.    The bartenders are obviously swamped so they are sloppy with their cocktail creations, with luxardo cherries carelessly dropped into my old-fashioned drink, waiting to be diluted by the generic ice cubes that overflowed from the glass.    Frito misto and lamb meatballs sounded like heaven but when the plates arrived, the frito misto looked like sad calamari rejects from Olive Garden.  Not sure what proportion of the meatballs were actually lamb but they sure resembled the factory-made ones they sample at Costco.    Now I'm not some grumpy old fart but what's with the loud music being blasted by the DJ awkwardly positioned by the door? Such a weird vibe in a weird space- it was all so disappointing...

vf4DLYryI2EwDWoJRpJWcg.text: I am 21 with a REAL ID, I came here with my buddies to grab some drinks. The server (Zach G) refused to serve me because my (real government issued) ID "looked fake". I told him he could scan it or even bring it to his manager. He told me that he couldn't serve me because he couldn't verify it. At another table he was also serving, there were girls that I knew from school who were 18 without IDs and he seemed to have no issue serving them.

jIk4Ja9aJWEEwYV3yici_g.text: Love Olive & Ivy, came here for a work dinner and I knew I had to come back on my own (wait, I can't do anything alone, so I put together a girls night out.) Don't wanna lie to you, we came here for the Happy Hour, this girl has to save some coin, I've got kids!  Happy hour selection is small but big enough to find what you want!  This is what I've tried there for happy hour, ready?  1) Bacon wrapped dates, OMG! They were delish and HELLO, there's BACON!  2) Lamb meatballs, good grief, they were tender and so delicious, total party in my mouth. Their Tzatziki sauce was on point too!  3) Their french fries, rather, their TRUFFLE FRIES, someone hold me back!!! Totally shareable. God, they were good.   4) Hummus. Who doesn't love hummus? Served with grilled pita and some veggies, it was delightful.  O.k., o.k., I get it, I pretty much ordered everything off the happy hour menu but the prices were so darn cheap.  BEVERAGES!!!  Ladies, order their Sangria, 'nuff said.

hSmwdBgSNqgDpUQQZL04RA.text: We ordered caramelized Brussels sprouts flatbread  And Bacon wrapped dates and they both were amazing!! I had the sweet potato cannelloni and it was to die for!!! So many amazing flavors!! This restaurant is a must!!! Loved everything!!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

c2f_PR3MDyn944wDGArtDg.text: As a foodie visiting Scottsdale, Olive & Ivy came highly recommended. Based solely on service because I sadly didn't even taste the food, what a complete letdown. I know from their sister restaurant, Zinburger, that the powers at be won't be thrilled to read how we were treated by the staff.  Let's call the pretty lady at the hostess stand with intense attitude "Miss Personality." Upon arriving at 8:55 for a 9:15 reservation, we were curtly told we'll be seated closer to 9:15. Normally that's fine as that's indeed when the reservation is. However, there was not a single other patron waiting to be seated. A quick walk around the restaurant and I saw not just one, not two, but numerous - maybe six or seven available tables - with about four of them being two-seaters, which is what we were. After waiting for five minutes, we decided to go spend our money at one of the many and plenty of other restaurants in the Scottsdale area that are equally beautiful, with equally or even better food, and much better friendly and professional service. I hope Miss Personality enjoyed whatever power trip she was on, but she lost us as a prospective customer, sadly and regrettably. This isn't LA, New York or Miami - attitude is not expected nor welcome.

HcKYtJv6GfkZB7Tu_zB-1A.text: The location is first class being located on the Scottsdale Waterfront and directly south of Fashion Square Mall. I also like the fact that I can walk around the corner to see my buddy who is the GM at the #Scottsdalewaterfronttowers.   The ambiance is good and you can tell that this is a tourist hub for those catching the AZ during the discounted summer months. My meal was good and the wine we selected fit perfectly into the mix. I was only there for lunch with friends from Napa, so I need to come back with Twyla and catch this place at dinner. There is a full bar for those who wish to get their IV drip of alcohol moving into the infused direction; you know who you are...  Once your meal is completed, you can take a romantic stroll along the waterway and then venture around to the many various shops for coffee or dessert. Not that Olive and Ivy doesn't have a good one. However, I could use a good walk to burn the many calories I take in on a regular basis. There are so many things to see and do in this area. I do recommend checking it out with the whole family.   #vino2 #vino2ultimate  #vinosquared

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

F732zfN_8OIealBVKG_dWA.text: This place was amazing! The staff was supper nice and the food was delicious. Very cool atmosphere.

DAVzPU_N4EMsp1LRYKvyOw.text: Ally gave the best service! She made our experience one of a kind! I come here often and she by far is my favorite! The salmon is what's up at this place. You can put salmon on anything and you won't be disappointed! The homemade pesto is epic as well. Oh and don't forget to ask for Ally with a y.

mQtTEOhvcl4b-tfOqn13xg.text: Great place to eat. Terrific flat bread selections. Some interesting dinner choices we had were the Shrimp Scampi over Risotto and the Scallops. Chicken Scallopini was also very tasty. Average wines and an interesting beer selection but unfortunately nothing on tap. Prices were reasonable. I suggest reservations on weekends otherwise you will have to utilize their Marketplace section, not a bad choice either. Free Parking on the street or in the underground parking lot adjacent to the restaurant

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Nice area to stroll in.

B0cKmH9kMeAQUw2sipYTZA.text: I really loved the lighting, staff, crowd and overall ambience of this place. Colorful booths and their patio is awesome with couches and Edison lights. Unless you make a reservation, you most likely will have to wait though. The hostess was super sweet and our waitress was as well. Very friendly vibe here.   Items we tried and truly enjoyed were:  Classic Caesar salad (huge bowl-very filling and fresh) Beet salad (smaller portion served in a flat rectangle plate) Mozzarella bruschetta (all the brushettas were bomb) Prosciutto bruschetta  Brussels sprout bruschetta  Chicken and barely soup (could tell it was homemade) Lasagna Margarita pizza (nothing special, basic pizza) Spanish shrimp risotto (AMAZING!!! Cooked to perfection) I must add that one of the highlights is that they stuff their own blue cheese olives and make their own blue cheese as well...so the martinis are extra good ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Spanish shrimp risotto ... SO GOOD
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Prosciutto bruschetta
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mozzarella bruschetta Brussels sprout bruschetta

wpyXq9jK1IqgPCyhAkpRNw.text: Always a good time coming here, especially for brunch! The front desk host girls can be a little snobby at times, but once you sit down and meet the lovely servers, you forget all about them. Mimosas are a MUST and their crispy bacon and house potatoes are bomb diggity! If you want to make new friends, sit at the tables/couches outside, where it's first come first serve. The vibes views and people that come here are beautiful!

cSEBuTwoo9ckBq7mmoJyiA.text: 5 stars ain't enough.   This was easily one of the Top 5 meals I've had in my life (in its price range). A big thank you and hats off to our server Jeremy, who did an excellent job in providing us with superb customer service!!! He is everything a perfect server should embody :-)   Honestly, I came in with low/medium expectations because this place reminded me of a fancy version of Lemonade (a chain restaurant in California) serving Californian cuisine, which is good, but not my favorite. Jeremy assured us that their cuisine is more Mediterranean than Californian so that made me instantly happy!   On to the food-   COMPLIMENTARY BREAD W/ PESTO- AMAZING!!! The pesto sauce is the best I've ever had. It was thick and packed with flavor, loaded with pine nuts, and not overly drenched in olive oil. The bread was light and fluffy- off to a great start  CHEF'S PLATE ($18)- GET THIS. I dream about this plate. I was hesitant to order this at first seeing that it's pretty pricey for an appetizer. This could easily double as an entree, but I would still recommend getting it even if you already ordered an entree. This was one of the BEST charcuterie boards I've had. I could rave about this for the rest of my life. Plat included: * 2 kinds of bread- a buttered, light & crispy artisan bread + an extremely soft loaf of bread that melts in your mouth. 2 kinds of artisan cheese- one strong gorgonzola + brie-like soft cheese. * 2 kinds of meat- spicy salami + prosciutto * a LOT of olives, dates, pistachios, and pickled lettuce.  I loved all the contrasting textures and different tastes of this. My taste buds were doing backflips! I found myself still digging at this even after I finished stuffing myself with my meal. By far my favorite!!!   BACON-WRAPPED PORK TENDERLOINS ($24)- These pork loins were perfectly caramelized and had this EXTREME melt-in-your-mouth quality. My knife sliced through them like butter and it was the perfect amount of chewy and tasty. Came with yummy mini potatoes, collard greens, and polenta. This was such a good choice and is one of the more filling meat plates, as mentioned by Jeremy.   WILD MUSHROOM PAPPARDELLE ($16)- This pasta gave me life. They use a lot of truffle oil in this dish and it pairs really well with the mushrooms and parmesan slices. The pappardelle pasta is cooked to a perfect al dente and topped with fresh basil throughout.   I enjoyed every second of my meal and my experience with Jeremy and would 100000% come back next time I visit Scottsdale.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Truffle mushroom pasta- amazing
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chefs plate- GET THIS! 10000% recommend, easily one of the best charcuterie plates i&#39;ve ever had
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bacon wrapped pork tenderloins- WOW!!!

P9ESxcyzTU7eDybGJaJIgg.text: This was our second time visiting Olive and Ivy. After a disappointing first trip in, the manager reached out to me asking me to return. Several months later (we live in the west valley) we did just that, for lunch.   Our server Zack was friendly and efficient. The manger Nate was very kind, as he stopped to check on us a few times throughout the meal.  The food:  Bread and pesto is amazing!  Fritto Misto was perfectly fried and had sliced zucchini included, nice touch.  Sweet potato cannelloni may be my favorite pasta in the Phoenix area.  My husband had the lamb gyro and was very pleased.  We tried 3 different flavors of gelato, and all were unique and delicious.   Try Olive and Ivy. You won't be disappointed!!

ck6Xt9GJ-SaJ6PsRBo5Btg.text: Cool spot in Old Town Scottsdale for lunch, dinner and/or drinks. Very open layout so you get the best of worls with both indoor and outdoor dining. Food and service was also great. Definitely worth checking out, especially for a beer!  Follow me on Instagram @kgsfoodadventures to see food from across the country!

F2zxHYZibg-VgnWnQtQYkw.text: I honestly can't get enough of Olive & Ivy. I would rank it as one of the best places to eat in Old Town.   To start out, the pesto and bread is amazing. I could probably make an entire meal just out of this.   For the main course, I typically choose the Natural Chicken. It is cooked to perfection & the flavors are top notch.  We have had the gelato a few times for desert. It is ok, but I would probably opt to go somewhere else if I had a choice for this part of the meal.

RM19HJOXI_zai5FLuVlv1w.text: Location; is located at the Scottsdale waterfront - parking may be a hassle depending on times. I went early ish - so was not too bad.   Food; started out with Artichoke Hearts upon arrival too table was not expecting dish to look like it did - but it was delicious. The mix of everything combines into something need to go back for again.  Dinner; ordered the scallops and the scallops were cooked perfectly and the sides were fresh and delicious. Wine; Chardonnay, Columbia Valley was pretty good not super fruity or super buttery - but good.   Service; Casey was our server on this visit and he was great super friendly and helpful.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Scallops!
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Artichoke Hearts!

rV4OWQbgEpaCnDxbBx5cnw.text: Olive & Ivy came highly recommended to us when we visited Scottsdale. It did not disappoint! I'm still dreaming of the bruschetta. It was so good we didn't get a photo because we ate it that quickly. We went in with a large group and they accommodated us with ease. I highly recommend making a reservation if you are doing this. The space was perfect. Beautiful lights and a calming vibe. The outdoor patio space looked amazing but it was a bit too toasty when we were there. I would highly recommend checking this place out! Great for wine, tapas, delicious entrees and a fun girls night or date night out.

cxqDqC6ItZl1jyclLVwcjw.text: Mediterranean salads.  Feta, almonds, couscous, grape tomatoes, cucumbers w/oregano vinaigrette with romaine and spring mix blend. The salad was a refreshing quick meal. I enjoyed the small pearl couscous as it adds something new to the Greek salad I often eat. I liked the tiny dice on the cucumbers. Perfect size. The sliced almonds added a great crunch to the salad. The oregano vinaigrette was tasty. A bit under seasoned, but that was remedied with the pepper milk on the table.   There was a 30+ wait for a table, but they offer tables w/out a server with a limited menu.   $9.50 each  **As I was leaving, I asked for a cup of ice to top off my water bottle. The cashier asked if I had my cup from ice before. I gave it to her thinking we're using less plastic. Nope, she took the cup I drank out of and before I noticed, she used it to scoop out another cup of ice. Boom! Instant cross contamination in the ice bin. I didn't tell her, as I was shocked. Hoping management reads this.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Great selection of gelato!
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Who is not impressed with a prosciutto slicer?!
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Great options-salads, flatbreads, sandwiches, beverages without a server. Great if there&#39;s a wait.

hH0ia5j0_YD-oJEmKW8rvg.text: This is a great restaurant for date night, leave the kiddos at home and enjoy being an adult sans kids.  The restaurant is beautifully decorated.   Definitely ask for the bread and pesto! The pesto is amazing - so good i could drink a bowl of it and I am not a huge pesto fan.  The drinks are super yummy - I don't remember what i had but it was really good.  I had the butternut cannoli and I would definitely order this dish again!

rEpW-epOCOtgBJw3B7nF-Q.text: I finally got around to trying this place. I was up in Scottsdale and decided to stop for lunch. The ambience is really cool, but the food was very average. Disappointing to say the least. I had very high hopes, but I probably won't be back.  I guess if you are just going for drinks or to meet a potential love interest, this would be a great place. It's very trendy in a warehouse type environment.  The decor is very inviting. It looks the part, but unfortunately does not deliver on the food end. Prices are on the higher side, but not terrible and not unexpected for the Waterfront. At least if you go, wait til the weather cools off and then you can eat outside.  5/18/19  Same. Three (3) stars. Small portions, flavorless food and very very average.  Service was slow. Not sure how this place stays so busy. Had it not been for my guest who wanted to try it, I would not have come back.

Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. More seating
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Another angle of the kitchen area. The finishes are nicely done.

nWjDIFg0CQTXaKWqxDc3Ng.text: Cute place for brunch! Menu had decent number of options and all the dishes were good. They give you focaccia and pesto in the beginning which was really yummy. Staff was friendly and timely. Got the Mediterranean salad with shrimp. The shrimp were large and the dressing was good. Nice spring mix of lettuce. The chicken hash and the gyro were also good. The gyro is a large portion so def can share or take leftovers. Would come again for lunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mediterranean salad
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Braised Chicken Hash*

KfzZLV8XKVVILfLxedcSKA.text: This place is SO CUTE!   I love love love the decor. Right when you walk in, you feel like you are in an upscale restaurant. It feels classy, and the lighting is absolutely perfect.   I ordered the egg sandwich. It was really good! Usually, I do not expect much from my egg sandwiches, but this one was perfect -- not too heavy, and they did not go crazy with the cheese (I love cheese, but sometimes places tend to melt WAY too much onto your egg sandwich).  Further, the drinks were so good. We ordered an assortment, so I got to try a few. My favorite was the Bellini. It was light and refreshing, and delicious. It really was the perfect drink on a scorching hot (112 degrees HOT) day. Also, I loved that it was not heavy at all (at least it did not feel heavy), so I did not feel bloated after drinking it.

KvQ665zDlbbG_io08wAkrg.text: Okay this is complicated.  My GF and decided to give Olive and Ivy a try as we had dinner last week across the way at Tapas Papa Frita. Anyway, Saturday afternoon around 3, not much of a wait. Right at the point where still doing brunch, appetizers after 3 and full dinner menu after 5. Fine  Our server recommended a wine that was featured so I ordered a glass. When the wine finally came it was nothing like what had been described. Turns out the 'featured' wine was several days ago and has since changed but the server was unaware. Ordered a beer. Fifteen minutes later beer finally comes.   Ordered the Frito Misto as an appetizer and I ordered the bacon cheeseburger (medium) and my GF the gyro.  Finally get bread. Bread is delicious!! As is the homemade pesto. Not a big fan of pesto, but theirs is the best I've ever had. Period.   Still waiting for food. Server informs us we might get our entrees before our appetizer. What? Then someone else delivers the app. Start about halfway through app, food arrives.   Gyro and fries. Great! Burger and salad? Salad tasty, burger over cooked. Took awhile to get someone to check if our food was okay.   Refired burger. Still over cooked. Manager comes out and apologizes, says meal is on them.   Third burger. Still well done. Sincere apologies from management and our server. Also gave us $50 gift card (didn't have to) and of course no bill.   Fourth burger. Great. Look, everybody can have a bad day, it's how you respond that matters. I never expected any comps, just a properly cooked meal. And when a few unintended mistakes happened, they really did everything in their power to make it right.   We will absolutely be back, this time for dinner (amazing choices) and I have no doubt it will be s five star experience. This could have been one star but Dan and Rachelle changed that.   Update: Went back for dinner, service was excellent, food was excellent. Very glad we gave them a second chance.  The ambiance in this place is great.  And our server Miranda was totally on top of everything.

Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sea Bass with cauliflower
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Love the ambiance

kvtOdevCwy4Iwj5wN4gcww.text: An excellent meal in a great location with a fun, upscale spot.   Olive & Ivy is a very large restaurant with at least 40 tables inside plus a huge patio.  There is a counter-service area on one side where meals are purchased to go, a full bar in the center and tables surrounding.  There is counter seating overlooking the kitchen as well.   Lots of hustle and bustle because the place is so big, but surprisingly not very noisy.  It was very easy to carry on a conversation.   We were seated immediately.  Our server, Eddie did a great job.  She explained the menu with a charming and joking style, got the orders exactly right and even had the kitchen plate a shared salad separately.   Great job.  Thank you!   The meal starts with complimentary bread and pesto.  The pesto is fantastic, creamy and garlicky.  It's a shame that you feel compelled not to eat it all, since there's good food coming!   We had a bruschetta trio, and the chopped chicken salad.  There are 6 bruschetta choices on the menu, of which we chose 3.  Mozzarella, Proscioutto and Avocado - each served on thick slices of toasted, crusty bread.  Each piece is sliced in thirds.     The mozzaralla is thick chunks of rich, moist cheese atop tomato marmalade, garnished with basil.  The prosciutto is an outstanding thinly sliced dried ham served atop fig preserves and port salut cheese.  The avocado is chunky mashed avocado, sprinkled with feta and garnished with sweet corn and scallion.  It's hard to say which was the favorite, because there were all absolutely delicious.   The chopped chicken salad was chopped romaine, tossed with half dollar sized chunks of juicy, tender chicken breast and topped with blue cheese, bacon, avocado, peanuts and dressed with a fantastic buttermilk dressing.   The ratio of ingredients was perfect, so one did not overpower the rest.  The buttermilk dressing pulled it all together.  Yum!   The tab was $38 including soft drinks, very reasonable for food of this quality in a wonder atmosphere.  Recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chopped Chicken Salad
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Flatbreads

Hqt0bc3F2HPwDdVD-uuLtw.text: The food here is really good!  We came in for brunch and were not disappointed.  The pesto was flavorful and paired perfectly with the bread.  The cinnamon roll latte was really good.  I enjoyed my salad.  Looking forward to coming back soon.

mbjlM1W3XHrxvw_XEZl6Gg.text: We finally got to try Olive and Ivy and our experience was worthy of 5 stars!  On a Saturday while the Persian festival was going on at the Scottsdale Waterfront, we decided to have lunch at Olive and Ivy. We got there around 3:00pm. Our friends arrived before us and were told there was a 40 min wait. It took us a while to park, probably because of the festival but by the time we did, our friends were already seated, before the 40 min were over!   While we were looking at the menus, we were told only their limited menu was available for that day because of the festival. The limited menu was honestly not very limited! It had great flat bread options, appetizers, mains etc so we had quite a bit to choose from. I ordered the pesto chicken flat bread and my husband and friends ordered the lamb gyro. We also ordered a plate of mixed bruschettas, lamb meatballs and fried calamari zucchini.   Everything we ordered was delicious. I enjoyed my flat bread very much. It had chicken, pesto, cheese, tomato, caramelized onions and pine nuts & had a lot of flavor; it tasted great. I also tried the calamari which was good. My husband and friends tried the lamb meatballs & they said they were very good too. The bruschettas were also tasty, but they were slightly soggy when we had them. That's probably because they came out at the same time the food came out so we didn't get to enjoy them till later. We would have preferred the appetizers to be out slightly earlier than the food obviously but because we were very hungry, we were ok that everything came out at the same time.  Although they have a discount coupon for the first visit on their website, we did not use it this time. The prices overall are the average for a upper scale restaurant in Scottsdale but overall, not too expensive.   So glad we finally tried Olive & Ivy. Will definitely come back to enjoy the food, the location and the experience!
