qb6xAmsiWNFt0bn6HViuPw.text: This place has great customer service. They have delicious cactus tea and iced americanos. Their parfait are so yummy too but I do wish they made them a bit smaller. Their food was delicious. The side potatoes are very soft with enough crisp to them. Breakfast burrito was a bit too much for me, but it was still tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

H0B087BQPAyNYt63N5Y49w.text: Brunch, lunch or dinner - it doesn't matter! This place is great! Wonderful patio for when the weather is our friend and a great atmosphere inside for when it's not.

-2CHu7-3mqFJQ7V1PUCcUA.text: Lovely spot to grab a quick meal or some of their delicious coffee. Olive and Ivy is a great comfortable place to hang out as it is open for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Their pastries and gelato are also to die for.

FdcbKk69BKgrDTIFz1hl-w.text: Two stars for atmosphere only. Food is truly subpar. Lots of breaded crap. Save your money and hit up The Olive Garden.

BuDHlXArcx86knWJrT2EnQ.text: Bacon wrapped dates.  I don't think I need to say more, but I will anyway!  I had the dates and an arugula salad, both were very fresh and delicious.  The bread that's brought to the table is good too - don't skip the pesto that comes with it.  This is not your average "throw-some-olive-oil-and-cracked-pepper-together-and-call-it-a-dipping-sauce" kind of stuff.  I could almost make a meal out of the bread and pesto alone.  Our waitress was almost over the top attentive, but I'll take that over one that disappears any day.

SxaXteht9ffYsKrGHIE3Qg.text: Stopped for a glass of wine and ended up staying for a couple plus appetizers. The patio was so inviting and comfortable; service was good; food was great. Can't wait to go back!

EFOnw6lcW8W9n6cIvr-dFQ.text: Came here for brunch, we made a reservation for noon and got seated right away! Definitely make a reservation, there weren't any seats left on the patio and the inside was starting to fill up. Love the ambiance, it is so open and the patio garden look fantastic! The sangria is super refreshing and tastes amazing, I tried the red one yummy! They make all their bread in house so it's always fresh, you get a complimentary plate of bread with their signature pesto sauce and we scraped that thing dry. I love pesto though :) I ordered the mediterranean salad and added chicken ($14.50) it was very fresh and they put in just the right amount of dressing. Now for the not so good plate.... the Ivy Sausage Sandwich ($11) It looked and tasted like McDonalds sausage sandwich, super oily but what do you expect when it's sausage. I was expecting something a little more tasteful and classy for the price of the sandwich. Even the eggs looked like McD's eggs and it was under flavored, very disappointed with that dish. But overall, it was still a great experience, our server was knowledgeable and really nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bar area
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fresh bread with pesto
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Ivy sausage sandwich (brunch)

d0TfvAnGZIKL9Wxdr3m2bA.text: this place is great!  it has a marketplace, gelato stand, and a wonderfully large restaurant with an open kitchen. there were 6 of us that dined for brunch and we all ordered different entrees.  everyone loved their meals (Benedict, French toast, flatbreads, biscuits & gravy); I personally had the tuna salad sandwich with potato salad which was super delicious!   bloody mary's & service were good as well!

_N3VDIOj_7qtjldJknXymA.text: Just OK.  There are so many restaurants to choose from in South Scottsdale that you really need to stand out.  Olive & Ivy didn't do it for me.  Don't get me wrong, nothing was terrible, it was just OK.  At this price point, in this location, OK may not be good enough.

ARu6WBWcS_YWg7qNRPCCEQ.text: Business lunch early December 2016.  Very good.  Table was a little cramped for our group of 8 but we managed just fine.  Recommend.

QwbTlousn2aBH-uD_dX5BA.text: Olive and Ivy serves up refreshing salads and sandwiches, perfect for a lunchtime meal.  Portions are big, and you will leave satisfied and very full.  Service here is cheerful and attentive.  I would definitely like to go again to try their weekend brunch!

20UMqytRbBnILhwHmkx0oA.text: This is my favorite place to eat in Scottsdale whenever I go to Fashion Square. I think it is way better than eating in the food court inside the mall. It's a fun and great atmosphere to have lunch or even dinner and to go for drinks.  I really enjoy the Fox restaurants.

6eZjdGg8_LhTlBE5aGAIjg.text: If you're homesick for an Orange County country club meal, but can't quite find the time to make the drive across the desert, then perhaps Olive and Ivy is the spot for you.  The food was quite good, and the service was attentive. The tables are a bit crammed in together.  I can hardly blame them, I can see how it'd be tempting to eke 10% more tables out of the available space and sell more $14 salads.  Great interior design, good food. I'd go back.

FFv9jIMlRR8DU2VXB8H6xw.text: Excellent place for lunch/brunch.  Trendy upscale with wonderful outdoor patio by the canal in Old Town Scottsdale.  Weekend brunch menu is large with many good items to choose.  Definitely worth a repeat visit.

4ilw9Z0lta-1NlETNTtSAg.text: Great place... Very slow service!  Wouldn't recommend for dinner.  Fun for a drink and an appetizer... Management very unapologetic for the delay...

3JXrtdgEcaW_2OcBFdZleg.text: Poor rating is for phone service. I work on the waterfront and eat at olive and ivy almost every day. And I've never felt the need to complain. However it seems to take almost 10 minutes to put in a phone order anymore. I was left on hold today for 7 minutes before I hung up. I called back only to be asked to hold for another few minutes. I briefly explained I had already been left on hold and I only have so long on my lunch break to eat. I was finally given a person to take my order, and they let me know it was too late to order from the lunch menu. It wouldn't have been, had it not taken so long to get someone to take my order! They stopped serving lunch 10 minutes before I was given someone on the phone. Absolutely ridiculous.

1abzaCvJXWBPzK-WnGBQMg.text: Enjoy the energy. The cocktails are yummmmmmy.  The menu isn't inspiring per se, but some good salad options.  Nice place to people watch and driiiink

jC0TsXi4xOw3DUUuSqHkCw.text: This place is huge and on a weekend definitely requires a reservation. We were lucky enough to walk in and take a table due to cancellation.   The size does not affect the service, our server was very prompt in checking in on us throughout our time there.   I ordered the chicken Scallopini which says it comes with prosciutto but I didn't see nor taste it, I also would have liked to know it was breaded or I wouldn't have ordered it. Nonetheless the chicken was good as well as the spinach. I was also surprised to find there wasn't any grain to go with it however it was filling and good the way it came.   My sister ordered the pesto chicken flatbread, the pesto was good however It could have used more chicken. Just like in pizza there should be one of every topping in each bite.  My other sister ordered Blue Cheese salad which was large and she said quite good.   Overall it was ok, for the price the portions were not up to par. Our service was excellent and the place is cool however from 6:30-8 on a Thursday the music was super loud so it was hard to have a conversation as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken Scallopini over spinach, no grain

p9c0uxp1pim4kdAVAkAtug.text: Favorite place we went to in Scottsdale. Great food, amazing wine list, and I would suggest getting some share plates. Absolutely fell in love with the meatballs and savory pasta dish. Service was great.  Fabulous cocktails. Will come back again!!

QWMKqhuMJQKj1DUT_L08JQ.text: Someone gave us a gift card over a year ago but I had never seen a location close to home. We went for a walk along the Waterfront, when a monsoon hit. We came in from the storm in gym clothes and the staff couldn't have been kinder or more accommodating. The outside area of course was closed, but I really want to go back because it looked really comfortable. I would have given them 5 stars, but I missed the lunch menu which is only available till 3pm and seemed to be delicious food, more reasonably priced. We had the sweet potato cannelloni which was good, choice of (3) crostini which was also good, a chopped salad and lamb meatballs all good, for about $50, but they had our food out in record time. My 9-year old enjoyed it as well because the kitchen is all open and she said it reminds her of Hells Kitchen but w nice people.

qx6Wd58kv8FU_7kowqGK5g.text: Well lets see.  Come here a bunch of times, mostly decent but over priced for quality of food. Service USUALLY is good. However went there with a party of 4. Paid $100 in cash and then the rest on my card....(50/50 split between two people)  Turns out the waiter took all the cash and charged the whole bill to my card.....took a long time to dispute it with the manager who for whatever reason was very hesitant to reverse the transaction until I threatened to file a fraud report with my bank.....  I read another review of a similar situation....seems like a real problem there

l6AbVmlACRUZihvyXCAAfw.text: Hands down one of the best breakfast and brunch places in Arizona. Every time I come into town I have to go to Olive and Ivy as I used to live in old town and would go here on the regular. Now the items you have to order if you are a first timer or even a regular during brunch:  A pitcher of sangria (red is better than white but you can get them mixed). The sangria here is delicious and I have gone through pitchers of it here so be careful you will get a buzz without tasting the alcohol.  THE Breakfast Sandwich: I call it THE breakfast sandwich because it is THE BEST breakfast sandwich you can get in Arizona. It is on a crispy croissant and has avocado, mayo, bacon, and egg. I don't know how they do it but it is delicious no matter how many times I order it.  Appetizer: The trufulga flatbread. It's a flat bread with mushrooms and I believe truffles, and it is tasty, also their margarita flat bread is good too and even the sausage one is delicious.  Mediterranean Salad: This salad was also delicious, and although not as good as an original chop salad it is still delicious.  Also if you don't get bread REQUEST it before your meal arrives, their bread is fresh baked and comes with pesto and is delicious to just munch on just don't fill up. You can also ask for balsamic vinegar and oil as well but the pesto sauce is tastier to dip your bread in.  Again this is for brunch and honestly I have never had anything that was bad at this place.. EVER and I came here at least once a week for 5 years at one point.

3YLpnn0P8aO8YNLsvymkRQ.text: Great spot to escape the bustle of the mall. Really good salads and flatbreads. Sit on the patio if you can.

fBx07E-w-D8EAp3d_p7-wQ.text: Looking for a perfect spot in old town for great atmosphere, good service and a hip menu. This is it! We always try to sit on the water side patio. Just a favorite spot for any occasion. We have had company dinners, family brunch, late nite hot cocoa. Love this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pesto de AMAZING!

NmeVlWyxrY07MbS3HKHhPg.text: The food was good. The service seemed to be a bit snobby. Food came quickly. We ordered 1 salad and 1 flat bread but got 2 salads. Neither of us were starved so we felt this would be plenty. Again that was the waiters fault for not paying close enough attention to the details. There are plenty of other hip places in old town to consider

Knxhrx9Z9SjJvGAonnqNFw.text: I came here for happy hour with a friend and enjoyed it! I've heard good stuff about this place and was happy to say that I too was pleased with the food and drinks! We ordered the butternut squash bruschetta & margarita flatbread, which was good.  We sat at the bar and the bartender was attentive when we first arrived, but forgot about us as the night continued. My friend eventually got up to find our bartender, so we could order another drink. The bartenders were friendly though just slow. Overall, it's a super cute restaurant with tasty food and good drink specials for happy hour!

8e_tBfIczrQPU0cDT8tZCw.text: Great Salads and Bakery treats. Coffee is outstanding as well. Snack area items are a bit on the pricer side.

s1Oe-g7KuZwkql-ZNY3msQ.text: Love this place! It has a huge space, but making reservations is still a smart move as the tables fill up fast. I kicked it off with a white sangria and trio bruschetta which were amazing! The server was attentive, knowledgeable about the wines and menu. I had the salmon which truly was outstanding - cooked medium. What flavor! Also ordered was the chicken pesto flatbread - quite tasty and big portion. I also enjoyed a great vino as I took in the crowd. Awesome experience.

i14umigHylqBBt9u16PiyA.text: It's a great venue -- and unlike many other places in downtown Scottsdale parking isn't too bad because the free underground parking is right next door. The atmosphere is very nice and the outside dining area is very romantic.  I had the scallops which were as good as I ever had. My partner had the salmon which was good but not enough to earn a 5 star.  Service was professional.   The coffee creme brulee was somewhat ordinary. It seemed to be from one of those mass production dessert places.

Q_2YYjIQ2vbCWfIcCAcyqw.text: Still blown away every time I come here! My new favorite is the kale salad with added salmon. Seriously... Look at this picture. Have you ever seen anything more beautiful?!?

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Kale salad with salmon

6IOxjHy69gQkomjURYq3yg.text: I visited Olive and Ivy last night with a few of my friends and I have to say that the service we received from Thomas Mann was outstanding! !!  He was attentive to our table while having to serve several other tables.  The food was excellent.   The portions were just right Just as a suggestion when serving the lamb meatballs,  is it possible to have mint jelly as a compliment to this tasty dish? I will be back in the near future.  I thought the restaurant was absolutely beautiful with the lights all around.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

pmcnhZ8apC_mLQ8-rnfOTw.text: Everything is great here, the decorations, the foods, the service. Totally worth your time and money.

JsbW2hUvgY7PUZN6E_kNWA.text: we are are on an quest to rank the Top Ten Chocolate Cakes in Old Town Scottsdale. this is the third place we've tried so far and I'm guessing it will finish in 9th place.  olive and Ivy has great ambiance and vibe. the ranking is based solely on our mission for Chocolate Cake.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

YlhCJ78OVpobHA4PrfZ8UA.text: I mean, food is pretty good...pretty overpriced but going here is good for a nice brunch with friends. Definitely an aesthetic ambiance which is cool!

9aob2NDezBe9KPOpyRtRlw.text: From out of town, looked for a new place to eat with the Mrs. The food is good, not blown away, but definitely a place I'd return to. Love the staff, service, price, venue and location. Went on a Saturday morning had a mimosa with the eggs Benedict and treated ourself to a cheese Danish.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

5GTFKaZ5t-831lTm3qc7KA.text: The food at Olive and Ivy was delicious, with options for different dietary preferences/restrictions. We really enjoyed the bruschettas and the fish entrees. The lamb meatballs were great as well. The space is huge, so there is plenty of room for large groups. The only downside was that while we got appetizers fairly quickly, the kitchen took forever with the main dishes. Otherwise, the service was great and they did apologize for the delay in the kitchen.

CTHSS15JhEDM1e_U3k_VaA.text: Enjoyed our dinner. I read some reviews about this place, and with another positive encouragement from a local, we checked it out. Cool vibe both inside and out. We sat outside near one of the fire pits close to the river  The staff was fantastic and accommodating especially our server Taylor! We were there on Easter Sunday, so they had a limited menu for the late afternoon while they switched from bunch to dinner. We asked Taylor if she could ask the Chef if he could fire up a steak for us even though it was an hour before the regular dinner menu started. She asked and came through for us. The steak was a perfect medium rare. We substituted the standard veggies for mixed veggies and they are cooked perfect as well. Taylor's service along with the food made a fantastic ending to the last day of our vacation.   The wine list is a medium size, but they have a nice selection.  Thanks again to Taylor and the staff for a great meal!

IGggLe0-N2y5ok7xFQ1_aw.text: They have the best patio in AZ. Comfortable and beautiful and right on the waterfront. The drinks are fantastic!

VJmtzo38PEGR0l7UEK4_kw.text: Olive & Ivy is so gorgeous! It's huge and super crowded. We walked in to try to have brunch and were told that there would be a 45 minute wait for a table. A few bar seats opened up so we stationed ourselves there instead. The Moscow Mules were to my liking ("Mediterranean Mules") and I ordered a tasty Lamb Gyro sandwich. I definitely had food envy when his perfectly cooked salmon arrived. It was delicious.  When 3pm hit, we also ordered bacon wrapped dates from the limited dinner menu. I wish we would've had time to try Olive & Ivy for dinner. Maybe next time!

zoBUvprAmqS381R_WcjzpA.text: Wow. Never been so disrespected on the phone after THEY failed to change my reservation time. I called them yesterday to adjust my reservation from 10:00 AM to 12:15 PM then preceded to realize this morning that it was not changed after receiving an email saying they missed me at my reservation. The food may be fairly good, but if there are employees at this place who are rude to their customers (especially when they make a mistake), I wouldn't go here.

FVJnXk8-6YeUB1lCa-Ta0A.text: Really cute little brunch place! I loved the atmosphere of it!  I came here for brunch with a friend. I think I've only been here once before. I ordered the Potato Hash. This comes with over easy eggs, onions, pepper and a sausage gravy. I really liked the sausage gravy that it came with. I felt like it could've been better with some more meat in it or maybe if there was actually hash browns. Of course I had to wash it down with a Mimosa since it IS brunch AND Sunday Funday. =) Their mimosas are only $5 on Sundays and do NOT come in those skinny little champagne glasses. lol.   I'd like to try something else next time I come and probably sit on their cute little patio that they have. Also would want to try their happy hour. =)

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Potato Hash

f873z0g7NGO-RpOCRBZthQ.text: The sweet potato cannelloni is to die for. Everything about this place is so amazing. The wait is always long but for good reason. So make reservations!

aaeDNBL10t8xnZc9bZdZwQ.text: Cool vibe with excellent service. Food is fancy and the price reflects it. SamFox Restaurants are generally better than this though. Meh.

2acZLJQI53keTplSeHoCUA.text: I've been here a couple times for lunch, happy hour and dinner. I love the atmosphere here --whatever time of day you decide to stop by.   My favorite thing is their calamari, the dipping sauce that comes with it is so good! The bacon wrapped dates are good too. I order scallops for my entree, very tasty but other than that, everything else is good but nothing stands out for me.   I recommend going on restaurant week so you can try a 3 course meal for a good price!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. They start you off with bread, this is amazing! I could just eat this!
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Scallops

djbH4dIv5UlXMIKWmlicUw.text: Came here for lunch. First things first I have never had pesto this good anywhere else in my life. I don't know what it is but they did it right here.   Also tried the bruschetta trio (funghi, manchego, prosciutto and fig) all three were very good.   The fritto misto was pretty standard plain rings,imo calamari should have the tentacles but still tasted good. Very lightly fried and flavorful  Felt guilty after and got the chopped chicken salad which was very light and flavorful while also being very filling. Had a very interesting peanut granola that accompanied it.  Got to try my friend's sweet potato cannelloni that was incredible as well.   Really great interior design. Would recommend for lunch or a date.

z21Ae325RqWWlyetQUgRcQ.text: Sit on the patio. The ambiance is amazing. The food and drinks were good, but the sitting on the patio made the night. They had a live DJ who was one of the best I've heard in a while.

qQ5i7_4f740EsIXbMrfQOw.text: Mixed bag all around, but overall a fan.   Vibe - 5 stars. Really cool place, very modern with an open view into the kitchen and marketplace area. Loud music playing which is surprisingly pretty cool during dinner.  Drinks - 1 star. watered down old fashioned, damn near sent it back. Came stacked with ice and just overall disappointing. Ordered a beer and they opened the can at the table. Seemed kinda tacky.   Service - 1 star. Pretty miserable server. Asked for a recommendation and he listed 95% of the menu. Asked for more bread to have with our meal, he agreed and it never showed up. Asked for the heater to be turned on since it was a bit chilly and he proceeded to get annoyed and literally kick a chair out of frustration. Multiple tables noticed. Not a good look.  Food - 4.5 stars. Bruschetta sampler is awesome - the avocado and the mushroom are both excellent. Docking .5 star because the prosciutto was underwhelming due to one very tiny slice hidden under a bed of arugula. Veal and Spinach ravioli were awesome, incredible sauce.

mD20uDusziC2nAt1jMwahg.text: Looovvveee this place the view is amazing and the food is even better and the service! Wow! Best service out there! My sister brought me here for dinner a couple weeks ago and we loved it told our server it was our first time there & she told her manager and they gave us a free desert! We loved he environment so much that we decided to go back & we came back with our hubbys as a double date and again great time great service! Highly recommend this place!

KAxtJpwoe0d2DTyf8GxKjQ.text: The food, service and setting are perfect for a spring time lunch. We were celebrating two birthdays and our server Carlos made it even more special by bringing us two delicious desserts to share. I would highly recommend Olive & Ivy.

BKLsabDbLXIbDnbWl8R6CA.text: Olive and Ivy is a great place for a tasty meal. The staff was wonderful. Our waiter had recommended the grapefruit mojito. Most of their sangrias are puree based so don't expect any fruit pulp.  I had the homestyle cheddar biscuit off of their breakfast menu. It was very yummy. Scrambled eggs on top of a cheddar biscuit on the bottom.  The Iced Chai Tea Latte was prime. The only thing that took me by surprise was how heavy the whip cream was on the top of the latte.   Overall, two thumbs up.

TNaX6F6h0tWyXOO8IXFyew.text: I ate there 3 times in the last 10 days.  I was waited on by Megan, Nate (as opposed to Nathan), and another gentleman whose name I wish I remembered. The last place I had service that great was at Galatoires's Baton Rouge location.   I thought my first waitperson was exceptionally great, but then I had the same experience 3 times with 3 different waitstaff. Pleasant, friendly, efficient, discreet. I was beyond pleased. No annoying interruptions to ask me how my food tastes (fishing for compliments that add nothing to the dining experience) or to ask if I am done with a clearly finished plate.  The food there is great, too. I recommend the chicken pesto flatbread and the beet salad. They had a special gelato, cherry cheesecake, that I hope becomes a permanent menu item.

0W_fRFl3or2rs1BEJ5ZF8g.text: Beautiful restaurant!, unbelievably delicious bacon wrapped dates for appetizer!!!! Only problem was distracted service.... having to ask for water refills etc and it is pretty expensive, particularly for a very large restaurant that is part of a chain. We will check it out again though!

hEyPOHzm3v6IhpOpUEHq8Q.text: We sat on the patio for dinner when in town for a bachelorette party. It was a Saturday night so there was an awesome dj. It gets pretty loud inside so the patio was perfect for our group. Everyone is still talking about how awesome the food was!

gPA0ep31RRA6Dxa9sRDTeg.text: The easiest way to describe Olive and Ivy is ABSOLUTELY STUNNING.   From the moment you walk in you feel like you're in a whole new world. On my recent visit, i sat out on the patio which felt like I was having lunch and drinks somewhere far from Arizona. The entire patio was nicely decorated and laid out. It wasn't over crowded with tables or anything. The service at Olive and Ivy was beyond great. Everyone walked around with a smile on their face and always made sure everything was going well with your meal.   I highly recommend Olive and ivy for anyone who is wanting an "out of this world" experience. It truly felt as if I had just walked out of Arizona and entered a tranquil, beautiful space.   I had one of their Grapefeuit Palomas which are fantastic. Please order one when you go. You will not regret it. They have a great list of wines and cocktails to choose from as well.   I will definitely be returning again soon. This place is amazing.

ecpWp6S56bIDUL4enJB2oQ.text: I could spend all day here! Grizzly Claws are amazing! The patio is so relaxing! And their white wine sangria is delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

9ou6N6UeE3MPr1GRQTAkAw.text: We come here often, and the service and food are always amazing. We often book their private rooms for meetings, and they have always been helpful and on time with all of our requests. The food is fresh, and has many different flavors, and we find ourselves craving it often. The chopped chicken salad is a favorite! Highly Recommended!

LgiS_apP1Tr-vDGKDOJ8nA.text: Haven't had dinner at O&I in quite a while and was very pleased with the Watermelon Salad (with avocado, goat cheese, red chili gremolata) that I enjoyed. True Foods has a delish watermelon/heirloom tomato salad on their menu, so I asked my server to add heirlooms to my salad. It came out FANTASTIC! I almost licked the plate! The light vinegairette dressing complimented by the red chili gremolata was a perfect balance of sweet and spicy. Very light and refreshing starter or meal.

aNhPmRcyrXveE3xZ62zZ3w.text: Food is terrific and the outdoor patio is the best seat in the house if you can reserve it :)

99ZcgYKWGVbP27XQPaxKtQ.text: For the airport in Phoenix:  Good food. Fast and reasonably priced.   Loved the snickerdoodle cookies.

RpSA_Mc7yOaRlhn_pYolqQ.text: Stopped in as my hotel was close by while I was in town on business.  Started off with a great salad. The amount of fresh ingredients was fantastic and did not disappoint. The dressing was not over powering!  For dinner I had the sea bass off the menu. The presentation was very good but I felt like the fish lacked seasoning. It tastes very plain when eaten on its own. But when comings with the other ingredients on the plate it was better but did failed to deliver a WOW factor for a main course.  After the great salad I was expecting the main course to deliver awesomeness. I was disappointed.  Would I be back..meh! Not sure someone would have to twist my arm!

WQCH78hY-gzv_fX4XuPhZg.text: Came here at the recommendation of a friend and was very, very pleased with the entire experience. From our hilarious, accommodating waiter to the beyond-delicious food (I had an appetizer of bacon wrapped dates and the rare seared tuna) I would return here in a heart beat. They also presented me with a beautiful desert for my birthday, complete with a glowing candle and fancy "happy birthday" spelled in something edible, but without the embarrassing waiter-ensemble happy birthday serenade. Anxious to return as soon as possible!

0eR3VSRcckcB3xcoPpHllQ.text: The food looked nice on the plate but the taste wasn't anything my family can't cook in the kitchen. The ambiance of the restaurant was very impressive but there is nothing that can save a restaurant if they can't put out stellar product.

hkOPZDzpayom8cade_M78A.text: I have patronized many of the Fox restaurants and so far this one is the worst. I found the prices to be quite high, although I guess it is expected for the area. The service was very good, but the food just mediocre. I tasted the artichoke appetizer which was no more than some canned artichokes on top of arugula dressed with balsamic and oil sprinkled with parm, nothing above average. For the entree I ordered the veal and spinach ravioli. The pasta was chewy, the filling was strange, it had what I think was raisins mixed into it and strangely no spinach. The sauce was very rich yet had little flavor. All I can say was I gave the place a try, I think once is enough.

xyHcKvR9xdXK1HuA51fUsw.text: I'm jealous that we don't have Olive & Ivy in Denver....  My friend and I hadn't planned on going here last week, but after getting lost on our way somewhere else we wound up here.   It was a hopping Saturday night and everyone looked very dressed up. All ages filled the restaurant. We got lucky with 2 lounge chairs outside. There were limited seats and they are 1st come 1st serve and beware of couples making out.  We loved the Braised Short Rib flat bread with Caramelized Onions & Gorgonzola. I wish we knew how big it was going to be as we didn't need the Prosciutto di Parma Bruschetta with Crescenza Cheese, Arugula & Fig Preserves. But we love everything in front of us.  And their Red Raspberry Mojito was fabulous to look at and drink. Enjoy my pictures.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Red Raspberry Mojito
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Awesome Flatbread

ZYyoOvbolRoA-1UajzBzHQ.text: We went back to Olive and Ivy last night for the first time since our bad experience on New Years Eve. This time was much better! Our waiter was wonderful, service was great, food was delicious. We look forward to returning again!

wUeS7fBryzd9QfT8qLaDyw.text: Our waiter was great.  Wiped any crumb off the table, very polite, no complaints there.  This place is loud!  We went for anniversary celebration.  I felt like we were in a night club.  i think they are trying to be a hip place to appeal to 20's crowd.  Food was okay, very pricey and no value. We had chicken dish and lasagna dish.  The lasagna was a very small 17.00 served in a bowl .  Not impressed.  I make better lasagna.  My chicken dish was the natural chicken.  It was good but once again not impressive for 19.00 they charged for it.  Small portions with big prices.  Loud atmosphere.  I would go somewhere else.

TUVa7aH3s1V6iR_8O_W1fg.text: After spending what turned out to be the best Thanksgiving of my life with the love of my life and her truly amazing vegetarian family in Scottsdale, I looked forward to continuing the holiday into the next day at Olive & Ivy. One would think that after a Thanksgiving meal of salmon (that's the extent of the meat that was served), an assortment of vegetables, and Gouda grits, I would be dying for some meat. Not the case at all.   The mall to which this restaurant was attached was bustling with half crazed Black Friday shoppers; however, once inside we were led into a private room that must have been designed precisely for our party of ten.   I began my meal with the heirloom beet salad with pistachio and goat cheese dressing, followed by the smoked salmon flatbread. They were both out of this world. The couple of bites that I had of my lady's sea bass with wild mushroom ravioli, Brussels Sprouts and roasted squash confirmed to me that this place will not disappoint with any dish that you might order. I caution you, however, do not fill up on the delicious bread and pesto that they serve with the meal.   The wine list seemed a bit eclectic, and I would have loved to try something new, or the "kilt lifter" beer, but my goal to get the body fat below five percent limited my drink of choice to Grey Goose on the rocks. Next time maybe.   Save room for a cookie or gelato from the adjoining marketplace. This restaurant has the concept of restaurant and marketplace nailed. It was for me one of my high culinary experiences with plenty of love and friendship to go around. I know what you're thinking. How will I get to five percent BF while consuming flatbread and cookies? Well, how much willpower do you expect me to have after three vodkas?

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

3gArbQHCwQz9ZVhezeiEtQ.text: I really love this place. We had our company christmas dinner there, and numerous dinners among friends. Each time the food was good and service was prompt.

f2K_2qVimXbcF8dZrNOV7w.text: What a great surprise. The inside can accommodate a lot of people and yet its not noisy inside. The wait staff was very helpful and had good suggestions. Food was great - its hard deciding what to order.  Get there early because it really fills up as the evening goes on.  Great for dates, large parties or families

MKTZiBjssMapaZ_NmX6r4w.text: The location along the canal with the open doors and courtyard of sorts is aesthetically pleasing.  The menu is mostly tilted toward Mediterranean cuisine with some more American standbys mixed in as a back up for those less adventurous.  Overall, the quality was quite good and the service prompt and professional.  This place falls into the "after work, wine and a light bite" category.  The layout is conducive to social interaction, so bringing a group of 6-8 is definitely feasible.  I would go back.

ZAfq7DO9oo0eZVMBqKqlFg.text: Always love the food here. The server today was friendly and accommodating with our toddler. Try the salmon or sea bass. Just watch out for the construction of the courtyard. It might be noisy and no view. Manager didn't apologize and instead acted like it wasn't a big deal upon arrival. Sometimes a little empathy helps. Overall it wasn't bad since the food was amazing! Just heads up if you're planning an occasion before September.

waNpjAm9xK1amZNrOTHBmw.text: Started off with a Bloody Mary at the bar. Mix is just on the cusp of tasting like cocktail sauce. I have noticed it seems like a "trend" now. I believe the horseradish added creates that flavor. Staff is always friendly. Giving KUDOS to our server Jose. He was friendly, attentive, and personable (pass this along if a superior is reading this). Had the Chicken Panini and the brea was soft and the flavors full. By the way, they do have Iced Tea Vodka, just in case you were wondering. Great brunch, with great friends, and a great atmosphere. Thanks Olive & Ivy!

OVXOr0jE_GYmYM1YMoHhOQ.text: Really great restaurant.  Went alone and sat at the bar.  Excellent service. Engaging staff and fabulous food.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fungi bruschetta
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The best salad I think I&#39;ve ever eaten.  Great experience.

GxvVDGbSWBaC1m_P6al7Ow.text: We celebrated my cousin's bachelorette lingerie shower in the gold room last weekend and it was such a great experience! Since none of us were from the area, it was so nice to have a long, private dinner. Our server MA (Mark Anthony) was great! He was personable, fun, and really knew the menu (we kind of tested him on the menu!) The food was fresh and delicious, and the ambiance was perfect for a great girls night. The manager came in a few times to check on us and thank us, and even brought us a round of shots to get the night started. I'd recommend this place to anyone in the area or traveling to Scottsdale!

RxJLw81hMf3QPKKkYmYSkQ.text: A great meal of sea scallops and wine. The service was even better.  A table of 4 enjoyed the venue and food.    Desert was along good, mine some gelato, others trees leches...

nPwruXhGSkG4tUTfvl5GIQ.text: We went for a drink and to relax before dinner.  We were made to feel welcome and were not rushed to have another drink or order more.  We were in their outdoor lounge area, on a perfect day.  It is nice to be able to sit, talk  and not be rushed.  The sangria is light and fresh, the vibe great.  We love this place.

yo9-tqWLF9OuWZt0G6uZlA.text: Overall, this is a great date spot. My main attraction to this restaurant is the patio seating, especially this time of year.  The bruchetta is hit or miss.  I find the bread to be too crunchy sometimes where it hurts your gums to chew the bread, but the funghi has notably rich flavors. The prosciutto is average, and although the apple caponata was visually appealing, it was also average in taste.  The kale salad was refreshing and the serving size was large enough to split in two, but it could use more of the candied pecans. My favorite main dish so far is the veal and spinach ravioli.  I normally do not enjoy pasta, but the meat was flavorful and was complemented nicely with the light sauce.  The Seabass was poorly prepared.  Sea bass must be cooked properly, and this one was overcooked, giving it a dry texture throughout, but apparently that's the way the want it.  Next, they mask the flavor of the fish with a slice of bacon on top of the fish. I love bacon, but it does not belong on everything.  The sauce was also too tangy. Sea bass has a subtle natural flavor that should not be overwhelmed by a greasy chunk of pig.  Service was average for the FRC.  I'll be going back to olive and ivy for the ambiance, but I'll stick with the dishes that are easier for them to make.

T4UPO4UuBKwZnXf6VsFm4w.text: Cocktails and small plates on the patio. You must ask for Timmy. Witty, knowledgable and fun! White cranberry cosmos and ivy and ginger first round.

A3-U8UDkWRdPWuXHY-SiVw.text: Spinach ravioli was great. the portion was perfect for me but I don't eat a lot, I recommend ordering a side with it to be completely satisfied if you're super hungry, other than that the environment is very fun, alive and relaxing.

C0psKI-nOeEl-C09Oe22tg.text: I had never been to Olive and Ivy, I chose to take my mother there for Mother's Day. We usually try to avoid eating out on a holiday, but this special menu looked good on line, and we thought "what the heck".  Boy, are we glad we did!!  Service was superb! We had Mark Anthony as our waiter - yes, that is his name! In fact, he was so good that I said he must be a trainer - yes, he is!!  Food was EXCELLENT!! I'm making a reservation for Friday evening. I look forward to experiencing it non-holiday!  The only issue was the table situation. They sat us at a table for two that - no kidding, was in the middle of the walk way! We moved it a bit over and it made it a little better.  One of the hostesses came over and asked if we wouldn't mind moving over so they could fit a 4-top next to us - yes, we would mind moving over - we just moved from there because we were in the middle of the walk area - what did they do? They moved the 4-top around us to where they wanted us to move to and what do you suppose happened?  The table of 3 (very gracious ladies because they didn't say anything) were forced to sit in the middle of the walkway and were literally in the way of the waiters and busboys trying to get around them!! One woman was scrunched over by me to try to get out of the way! They are better people than I for not saying something!  Mr. Fox runs his restaurants like a well oiled machine, it would surprise me if he knew they were trying to fit in tables where they don't belong - especially since it truly hinders the guest experience! I'm not dinging them a star though, I chalk it up to a holiday.  Everyone knows not to eat out on a holiday!!  When we go this Friday and those tables are no where to be found, that will confirm my hunch!  I hope Mark Anthony is working on Friday night!!

BEWowEo-2jsvHVoBdoUAGg.text: Best Mediterranean salad w chicken on the planet. I moved to San Francisco and have yet to find a salad I am as passionate about as this one. Also they used to have this flatbread w corn and goat cheese that was to die for. Their bread and pesto is also dank. 5 stahssss!

Feq1a9z1vKeI7TVZ81V9CA.text: Rahim is wonderful. So good at helping us rookies at selecting perfect dishes. Wow. Amazing place food and service.

PYKQNxU_rZHgvm_5zRGjbA.text: By far one of my favourite restaurants in Scottsdale. I come every time I'm in the area for a meal. On a warm evening, it's lovely to sit outside in the garden along the canal. A great place for groups or a romantic meal. I've always enjoyed great service and food at Olive and Ivy. My personal faves are their pesto sauce and truffle fries.

OTSYXldxAFjsW8twghEx3w.text: Excellent Service!  This is one of my go to places to meet friends for happy hour.  I have to say they did not disappoint when I took my cousin for her birthday.  The bartender was great.  She made sure we knew there was less than 30 left for happy hour, then again 5 mins prior, she made sure we had our drinks and food order by 6pm.  Great Atmosphere and great service.  We really appreciate the extra attention.

81TOWuwetjCNZSbyGT-0lg.text: Love the decor of this place.  Shabby chic with classy old fashion twist.  I order 3 bruchetta to try : apple caponata, prosciutto and fig and fresh mozorella. Amazing!! Small but perfect appetizer size. For my main entree I tried the prosciutto and mascarpone tortelli. Delicious,  flavorful, and the perfect amount. I paired this dish with pinot grigio. Top it off I had share the brioche pecan and chocolate cake dessert. Too die for.I would definitely ckme back and take my friends.

vbZWYxq1XSa385e1DS6u4w.text: The place has a great patio which although most seats were open and we came on time for our noon reservation they claimed we had to have requested it. We had an important meeting and they still stuck us next to the kitchen! They did nothing to appease us. The food is OK. For the area there are way better places. I would never recommend due to horrible hosting and management.

NeZoP9DfbpY_6pVFAM3DZg.text: Best patio in Scottsdale hands down. Always exceptional service and food. Had the breakfast burrito during lunch and I loved it. Ryan my server was very pleasant and accommodating.

XVeUcanFvHCHzzmBmXuudg.text: Love the atmosphere! The food is yummy too. Not the five star dining experience but fun!

1_Qx72Mg7CIh2q96cKiHkQ.text: I really really really enjoy all of the 90. Every time I go to Phoenix I stop by this restaurant and have their amazing bruschetta, Seabass, or steak dinners. The last time we went our waitress was very accommodating and allowed us to split multiple plates. My friend and I enjoyed our surf and turf meal and also enjoyed the bruschetta.  The atmosphere and the Decour were very appealing to me and my coworkers. We are going to continue to come back to this restaurant.

iL4cuyRDnHVChRnzQY0YLQ.text: I have lived in the valley for nine years and this spot is still one of my go-tos... With a date, with girlfriends, with out of town friends or family. The menu is great for ordering lots of dishes and sharing and you can't beat their happy hours.  The patio is fantastic .... Just be sure to make reservations during spring training season!

zwyPpEAQHUb9ttbuM1_pMw.text: This restaurant was surprisingly really good. I've found that a lot of the restaurants in Scottsdale are either pretty or have high quality food, but Olive and Ivy offer both. I recommend coming here for a birthday or special event. (They also offer vegetarian options!)

mWHSuPzUpSf_RWJjBEchsw.text: Nick is an awesome bartender! He's so much fun and knows what I want before I know what I want! I highly recommend the Mediterranean Salad ( Nicks suggestion!) I got it with salmon! I will definitely be one of his regulars! Also, the pesto is phenomenal!

qZiotJg9BVyTFTuLZ8bnCQ.text: Absolutely love this joint!  Great food, great service and a unique and fun atmosphere!

d4BynkTVjo8eFj65d5uTSg.text: My boyfriend and I came here last night with some friends that were in town from Minnesota and once again this place didn't let me down!   My favorite part of Olive & Ivy has got to be the stunning patio! Seriously, don't even bother sitting inside. The patio is worth it even in the middle of the AZ summer heat, thats how pretty it is. I always get the Margarita Flat Bread and it is to die for. My boyfriend gets the Veil and Spinach Ravioli and loves it every time as well (I can't vouch for this one though, seeing as Veil is not my thing).  I have only ever had one issue with any food I have tasted here and that was my starter from last night. I chose to start with a cup of their soup of the day - Broccoli Cheddar. I don't know about you, but when I envision Broccoli Cheddar Soup, I envision orange, cheesy soup with a ton of chunks of Broccoli. The consistency of this soup could be compared to water, no chunks of broccoli and was green! I have never seen green broccoli cheddar soup. Honestly think they just pureed broccoli together, added water and a little bit of cheese and called it a day. I would definitely pass on this next time it is available.   Other than that, our guests loved the suggestion and we loved it to. Will be back time and time again!

P2Hy_0bEHzN8kTmfOg431g.text: I just love this place. The vibe and food here is always just the right mix of excellence, deliciousness, and coolness.  If vibes can be bottled, capture the vibe here to enhance your own personality, home, or business.  Will sure to turn it into a winner!

UBL2MGvc4Ong3-LhJG8Fww.text: Headed to this place for drinks and appies.  The restaurant is hip, spacious and trendy.  This is a great spot for tourists.  The staff were all friendly and apparently all the food is made in-house.   We ordered the calamari and I felt the portion was small and the dish quite salty.

Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Calamari

0Go5pOmsfYEEr5OU_H6HZg.text: Every time I come here the service is terrible on the patio.  For years and years and years always same terrible patio service and rude.

O61mZWrdGN_MaCU73FEK2g.text: Came for brunch and I LOVED it....  Super cool and nice place.  The service was absolutely freaking top notch.  Food was very good.    IVY SAUSAGE SANDWICH:  scrambled eggs, american cheese & housemade english muffin - Delicious  The breakfast potatoes were great.  CHOCOLATE CROISSANT:  Melted me... So flaky and great

Shiqn0SWM_37dAIUzH7Nzw.text: The food is good, service is so-so, its loud. Its in a great location.

ZUTzDMKMexxmb266L_A-Eg.text: Yum yum yum! I love coming here before shopping at fashion square. I always get the kale salad, it is basically the best salad ever. The bread and pesto is so good I could honestly just go for a glass of wine and bread and be happy. The sea bass though, how did you guys come up with it?!? Sooooo amazing! Mine was cooked perfectly, and the sauce was so good I almost licked the plate (okay, I did lick the plate) when it's nice outside I like to sit outside, any other time, the bar is the place to be.

kkXoU0swQKODMrNP-h6xSw.text: We started with yummy bruschetta. We were happy with the entrees we ordered. Nice portion size. Service was a little slow that's why I gave 4 stars instead of 5.

cNgaYwco_WKyK0b_mdlBQg.text: My husband and I have only dined here once. The restaurant is beautiful and the staff was superb. We had one of the yummiest deserts I've ever tasted. I would certainly recommend this place to our friends and family.

8bqCPSak7KWiEcYhAVEyPA.text: One of the pricier Fox restaurants but it definitely has some of my favorite food. The bruschetta is beyond delicious and all of the main courses I have ever had are amazing as well. Friendly service and really great looking place. It can be a bit of a wait so make your reservation well in advance.

GYrhCHcyjoR6sd_tlIXUVw.text: The food and service are always amazing. The Sunday champagne brunch is great. The morning coffee/breakfast bar is quick and delicious.

qFuJ-8D0g4o2YugoMbxHqQ.text: This was a cool, bustling little spot for an afternoon lunch. Food was good, not over-the-top amazing. Sat at the bar with a colleague and we enjoyed our time. I would suggest not putting the receipt in front of the guests at the same time as they receive their food. It gives the customer a sense of rushing and that they cannot order another drink or dessert.

f7z-ABsO3JfxvHiY5dwRKQ.text: It is always good here. A wonderful spot on the canal in Scottsdale.

QPZh1oYJXq6rE-O1vzIwrw.text: Great food we loved the lamb meatballs such a nice Mediterranean item as an app! The filet mignon steak had a great flavor nice and juicy! Sea bass was great too we just didn't like the Mash as it was a bit salty. Service wasn't bad. Our server was nice but not friendly just very direct not sure if that works for working in a restaurant but we enjoyed the food and ambiance

7dQnjcQHShIGlcuZIvFtGQ.text: Salmon was okay but nothing special. It came with a few beets and potatoes. Bar service was a little slow.

6WvAu8_dIlBUb4i42nzmmg.text: Great fox concept in old town. The only o&i and is still a great spot to come for lunch dinner drinks. Plus they have a good happy hour m-f 3 to 6. Great patio on the waterfront.

QloiiQ-9-JAY3GqFQN7QNg.text: We have not been to this restaurant in several years,  i have never been disappointed in A Fox Restaurants before,, to start with when we arrive the Rap music was so loud, you could not hear anything, they assured us it would be better on Patio. it was better but still to loud.  Our Service, Kevin was a good as it gets,  Food ok, but not as great as I had remember, being Restaurant week we tried the Fix menu, soup great,  main course, ok, had a side  pasta dish with the chicken, was under cooked, Dessert fair, Wine excellent.. If you are over 50 please call and make sure they don't have a DJ playing Rap, unless you like it.

HJBjP8saP49N2e90ZBPWig.text: I always have a good time here with good service! Seating outside is fabulous by the fire but unless you have a big party then you may be sitting with people you don't know! Since its open seating. Great food presentation and I enjoy the interior decor. This is one of my favorite places in Scottsdale to eat because of the vibe! Will keep coming back!! Trendy and fun.

23DxjHnNmG8CPS18aatxbg.text: Alissa our server was beyond INCREDIBLE. We had a reservation for a group of 6 of us who were in town for a bachelorette dinner party. She was thorough, courteous, prompt, sweet, and provided such an special "experience" for all of us that we won't forget. We had a couple bottles of wine, and her bottle service was perfect. The bruschetta was to die for. She even delivered some shots for our table in honor of the bachelorette! She also delivered a second surprise... a dessert platter! We didn't have to ask for her to do anything "special" for our bachelorette... she automatically did it! That has never happened to me before at a restaurant.   She happily provided us some recommendations of places we should go to continue our evening, and I really can't say enough good things about her, the restaurant, and the service/experience that we were provided.  Thanks ALISSA!

LxA-Y-Wmj6MM9zPELdm3cw.text: Went here last night for a family dinner and the food was great, we ordered the bacon wrapped dates, hummus with veggies , mozzarella bruschetta (which we were expecting more than a few slices but only came with 2 slices) , pesto chicken flatbread and wild mushroom papperdelle! All of these items where amazing highly recommend the bacon wrapped dates! As far as cocktails you have to try the pomegranate daiquiri or fig & ginger mule! The location is right next to the mall and near the waterfront and we sat in the patio that overlooked the water! Love this place I'll definitely be back for happy hour :)

dpGJXOu89UmOFWqFXEmpzg.text: Perfect every time! The lunch is the best! Pesto and focaccia is always a delicious treat before the panini I order and the burger my sister always gets. Never a disappointment. Drinks: blood orange paloma- refreshing! And the ivy and ginger- mouthwatering, ask for a little extra pineapple juice on the side!   Love it!!

e4GWBZ55sM2g0tm6PriCDg.text: Loved this place!!!    My husband and I were in the area attending my family reunion, and this restaurant was recommended by a staff member at the Hyatt Place.   It was a short walk from our hotel.  We went around 1 pm for lunch on a Monday. There was no wait at all for inside seating and 1/2 hour for outdoor seating (we were in a rush so we sat inside).  It was a nice atmosphere both indoor and outdoor, and their bathrooms were also very clean and cool looking.  Our waiter was friendly and gave us good recommendations.  We started with the bread with pesto. This was the best pesto I've ever tasted.  I think maybe it had more cheese than most I've tried.    I ordered the butternut squash and spinach cannollini (sp).  It was absolutely delicious! I LOVED the different flavors I tasted with each bite, a sweet and salty taste - almond slivers, spinach, mushrooms, squash, butter sauce, etc.   My husband is a basic kind of guy when it comes to food, so he ordered the burger on toasted wheat bread (he does not like ciabatta and all of the other fluffy 'foo foo' type of bread).  He said the burger tasted fresh and it had arugula on it, not your standard burger.  The fries were also good.  My husband had a peach bellini which was delicious, and I had a red sangria which was also great.  When we were done, I decided to walk through the area with the gelato.  I ended up with 1 scoop of Oreo cookie and cheesecake gelato and another of blueberry cheesecake gelato.  Both were creamy and delicious.  This was our last dining experience before leaving AZ.  We had a great time in AZ and this was the icing on the cake.  I am SOOO glad we decided to come here!

c9p5Ai7pfOfhP6QZISfxNg.text: Deeeeeeelicious food. Atmosphere is on point. I just love olive and ivy. I love the patio view it's beautiful especially when the sunsets. The food is delicious, the staff is great. I have no complaints, and antyone who does can't appreciate the awesomeness of this place. It is a very busy place so patience is a virtue, but again, I've never had a bad experience.

_C6q730m-dqL-dDiTVEk_A.text: My sister and I are GF vegan and vegetarian respectively. The menu had a pretty broad selection of foods that catered to both of our dietary restrictions and was AH-mazing. We sat on the patio - which was beautiful - had excellent service and a very delightful evening. Highly recommend to anyone checking out Scottsdale waterfront for the first time or looking to try a new restaurant  We had the charred artichoke hearts w goat cheese and the asparagus bruschetta for an appetizer. She had the beet salad and I had the sweet potato cannelloni for dinner and we shared the PB mousse for dessert. Literally nothing we ate was even the least bit dissatisfying. In fact it was beyond delicious. Every last bite.

g3o_WsvVcj5MVQoqAFXc4w.text: Nice please! Inside was pretty up scale. The lunch prices were not bad at all. Went for lunch and had the bacon burger which was yummy! Excellent excellent service! It was busy but they had enough staff and no waiting for a table. Served bread and olive oil which also was amazing. I tried the berry gelato, pretty good. Highly recommend this place for lunch. Will have to go back and try dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Blue Ivy Restaurant  - gelato
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Blue Ivy Restaurant

S_U_k1P1a-ZFV-cpnTA6ig.text: I went here for the first time to have dinner with my girl friends and I have to say it is  such an amazing experience. The place was lovely decorated on the inside and a nice patio area . Lights are dimly lit that set a warm romantic feel. Matt was our waiter, he was so welcoming and so attentive. Was very helpful when asked for opinion on what we should order since it was our first time there. Their flatbread was so delicious and couldn't have had enough of it. All the entrees tasted delightful, even the desserts were awesome . They even had a ice cream bar with many different and cool flavors! Prices was reasonable I totally recommend this place and would for sure be coming back for more date nights with my girls!!!:)

ZbxkGSztrxOrj2p-u0jH4g.text: This location is soooo hard to find. My stupid google map took me somewhere else. I called the restaurant and the host was very thorough and stayed on the phone with me and directed me til I see the restaurant. The ambience is really nice. Food was good. Service is great.

6pb_WKWpbEUYGbi-MMiTSg.text: Need reservations for dinner inside....but if you walk in there's a common fire pit area to chill in ...you just shove in and enjoy...great menu...sweet server Miranda...nice ambiance...relaxed by the firepit...nice salad, pizza n sangria. Enjoy...good music...we'd come back...thx

xRtrc8W2weRW0NsLOzXFcA.text: Great service, amazing food, especially the manchego bruschetta! Would definitely recommend- sit outside if you can!

q4hxzrEsdYprtP3OcQcM5A.text: Wonderful food and great service. Managers even deliver dishes to tables when busy and also take the time to check with diners for their  satisfaction.  My favorite is the sweet potato cannoloni. Also exceptional is the Ruben sandwich (amazing considering it's an Italian restaurant).  Try it.. you'll like it!

ZbjTuDNOkHKx4S8Op_viHw.text: Let me start off by saying the ambience is A+. The service was below average, with the server only appearing once in a blue moon. Thumbs down. I'm honestly shocked the food got such great reviews. It's overpriced for subpar food. I asked for my steak to be cooked medium well (although I prefer my meat more on the medium rare side but I was splitting with my sister) and when it arrived, I could clearly see the bright red meat clearly in the dark, looking inedible. I went with friends and we only deemed one dish acceptable. Do not be fooled by these reviews. Only recommend coming with friends if you want drinks and a cute place for pictures. Disappointing.

GOM2PT1PCQbsNKallo71vw.text: We came here on Valentine's Day weekend. I love how open this restaurant is! Their patio is adorable and it has nice views of the canal at the waterfront.  The bruschetta and our entrees were delicious. We got 3 different kinds of bruschetta as an appetizer, I got the scallops as my meal and my boyfriend got a chicken dish. I wasn't crazy about the smores dessert though.  I think this is a great place for people watching if you sit on the patio. Great place for people visiting from out of town too!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Smores dessert was alright...I&#39;d recommend trying something else
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Scallop dinner was really good!
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. My fav bruschetta was the middle one, butternut squash/pistachio/goat cheese

y55GOV0TX87etsRlBQ8HLQ.text: Awesome brunch spot!!! We loved the table-side mimosas and the flatbreads! They took a bit long making our lattes but other than that it was a great experience.

3lnyYGGLIaHtx19C55ovPQ.text: The Olive & Ivy is a really cool and lively place set at the Scottsdale Waterfront.  There is a huge shopping center with trendy shops and restaurants all around.  My party of nine started with a round of drinks out in the Patio area which is beautiful with comfortable big chairs. The place was packed Thursday night and happy hour in full force. After a round of drinks our large party made it to the table and onto the food, we sample different apps like the fritto misto and bruschettas which were pretty good. I had the Piccante flatbread which was delicious and filling. Everyone else also seemed to enjoy their food as well.  For dessert, it was the raspberry sorbet which was good.   The service was great, our server handled the large party very well. Loved the atmosphere and vibe here, I would return.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Piccante flatbread

nsItEzOzgHl79tvDu7ubjw.text: My daughter and I had an amazing meal here. The waitress, Nicole was awesome. I had the Pappardelle with mushrooms. So good. Salads were great. Appetizers were great. Ambience was trendy. I've already recommended it to several people.

TQJj912P7F8UhXfjPqWEcA.text: We took some guests with us to have dinner on January 8 The service was excellent,ambiance very good and most importantly our food was very good The bone in ribeye was served on a bed of cream spinach,,,,excellent!!!! Will go back again

ErHmfeo-yZO-Lx3hh9n0FA.text: Love this place for lunch, they do a great job convenient, and the people are great. If you're in the area give this place to try

ZEz41UVNXcT4R7nU0fi3GA.text: Poor service =no service tonight. Waited over 15 minutes, waiters, busboys, people with pitchers of water walked past us several times and not one person spoke to us.  Told manager and he offered us a free meal and coupons to other restaurants. We declined. He continued to follow us out side.  Had to tell him several times NO.    Guess they did not like that we were dressed for bike riding, even the hostess turned her nose up at us  Hey management- bike riders are local!   Can you afford such bad word of mouth from us?

8QqlOxza1JPBku1j0cHSdQ.text: Sunday brunch at Olive & Ivy started with a request for a window seat. As inviting as the patio looked, we were seduced by the comforts of indoor air conditioning. So modern are the cluster of amber lights suspended above the bar & attractive upholstered booths.   Our server was super enthusiastic about describing top sellers on the menu. I found his energy addictive (it helped me wake up!), but my friend found his over-exaggerated approach to be tiresome (like, can I just have my eggs with some peace & quiet, man!)   We ordered:  -- freshly-squeezed OJ: delicious, refreshing, sweet, lots of pulp  -- egg sandwich on a brioche bun for him  -- cheddar biscuit w/ scrambled eggs & sausage gravy for me: underseasoned on all fronts; gravy could've used a bit of pepper, eggs needed to be salted, biscuit was neither buttery nor flakey (more like mushy & starchy.) Side of potatoes were also blah.   Olive & Ivy's menu reads like a brunch lover's dream (& the Mediterranean twist doesn't hurt), but their potential has yet to be unlocked. Where are the exciting flavors to match your impressive decor & animated staff?

iV-dO3pQwrs_QH49dvaBRw.text: Love the ambiance here! The drinks (both alcoholic and coffee) are delicious. Loved the Moscow mule I had there. I've gotten the sweet potato cannelloni twice and loved it both times, highly recommend. The beet salad was light and refreshing. Everything is made in house, so their bread is incredible. This is a fun place to take friends for lunch if you can't decide where to go!

SpdFFsezT1TM-ALdSX0hww.text: Excellent happy hour! We sat at the bar and enjoyed sangria along with a very satisfying assortment of bruschettas and an order of bacon-wrapped dates.   Only downside was that happy hour is not available in all parts of the restaurant.

xKQ7_UcuyYrHNXjSY73CAQ.text: Their flatbreads are guaranteed fresh because although it took a while to make, once they come to the table, you could tell they were made from fresh ingredients. Their sorbet dessert is great. Would strongly recommend.

JBjfZHhpyH-CgtaM9Kyo3Q.text: Good spot.  Food is good, service is good, and vibe is good.  Love the patio here.  Another great Sam Fox restaurant.  Food: 3 Service: 4 Ambiance: 4.5

aEnRdheCIeGxMWg9Q4v4QA.text: Olive & Ivy is a great Sunday brunch spot with good service and decent menu options.  The prices are better if you leave the kids at home and the morning cocktail options are a little on the pricey side.  If you're looking for delicious cups of goodness the cinnamon roll latte is to-die-for and fantastic followed by their killer french toast!  Health nuts won't be disappointed with egg white and veggetarian options, so have no fear!  All around great brunch spot, just slightly slow on service, and a tad bit pricey.

6QCeVt6yDg_F5YvsnTgk_w.text: only been a couple times, but had Gluten Free options, had healthy options and they were good.  Lastly, they had an organic wine on the menu which was also good.  Love the outside.  Pretty place in general.  Now, the one at the airport... lets just say they need a little work.

HzC_c-usPzx3clmSnVGJwg.text: Smoke and mirrors...atmosphere vs substance....  I am NOT a fan. This is your typical Scottsdale spot that puts their efforts into the decor (which is REALLY nice) and not into their boring menu.  Skip it.

xhVmPhOHyyPA7Fp8ITV6cw.text: Malibu Rum Barbie has to alternate this place with the Sangria Slut. Somehow, she found out the White Sangria comes in a Tang-rimmed glass and that floozy loves to lick anything.   But again, I digress people. I have frequented O&I nearly three dozen times in the past couple years. Always enjoy myself as I usually go with a group of friends ready to drink.   Appetizers are delish. Hummus. Yummus. Flatbreads are tasty and you can still get the Pesto off menu. Just ask. They'll do it. Brunch is Fab!!! Unfortunately, my wallet takes a hit here. Their prices are a bit high but I'm sure it's the Waterfront rents that make them do it.

ncQgsxqrrEbGOFFYHPMx5Q.text: One of my favorites. The food is always great, service can be hit or miss but typically a really nice experience. Their bread and pesto dipping is fantastic. Sometimes you have to ask for it but it's worth it!

w-K_YrHlhSqmA7aPwuSPag.text: Olive and Ivy is a restaurant in downtown Scottsdale that features great food, a very extensive wine list, and an all around cool atmosphere.  Olive and Ivy has a better than average happy hour with good food and drink specials. I love the bruschetta, love the Fritto Misto (calamari, rock shrimp, zucchini), love the lamb meatballs, love the prosciutto, love the watermelon salad (not what you'd expect), love the sweet potato cannelloni, love the Maine Lobster Risotto, and love the bacon wrapped pork tenderloin.  Olive and Ivy has an indoor bar/lounge area and an awesome outside patio. Not only do they have a great wine selection, they also have a good selection of beers from Arizona, Europe, along with other domestic options.   You can also grab a coffee, salad, or sandwich to go, from their marketplace.  Great food along with a great atmosphere gives Olive & Ivy five stars.

LL3EvVnNSkUeKezMJrkfFw.text: This place is terrific! We had this restaurant recommended to us by friends and we were excited to try it. We had such a great dining experience tonight on our last night here in Scottsdale! We had an 8:30 reservation and arrived to have the table ready for us. They read our reservation request to be outside and they were able to seat us on the patio! The bartenders up front were so nice and they made us great cocktails while we checked in for our table. Our server Melissa is AMAZING! As soon as we sat down and were greeted by her, we knew it was going to be a great experience based on her energy. Melissa knew the menu so well and really set us up for some good decisions. We will definitely recommend this place to others! The music and vibe in the restaurant is fun and on point. The food and the drinks were excellent!

p1VJiLtvkxqbQ2GKmG7OSg.text: My wife and I went there last weekend for our anniversary. We had reservations for a table on the patio at 7:45. We got there at 7:50ish and were promptly seated. It was a very busy Friday night. It was one of those very cold AZ nights, so we requested our server if we could have one of those patio heaters by our table and he was back in 5 minutes with one. I would strongly recommend a table on the patio for a nice, quiet, romantic dinner. It tends to get very loud inside on the weekends and it might be good to hang out inside with friends and drink but for a nice dinner the patio ambiance is really amazing.   Now for the food and drinks - My wife got the ivy and ginger cocktail and I got the red sangria. Before the drinks came out, our server got us warm bread with pesto sauce and it was really good. Drinks came out fairly quick and I must say I loved the vodka ginger cocktail drink!! It was HUGE and had a nice kick to it.   For the food - we are vegetarians so that really cut down our options to few. Our server Ryan G. was awesome and I would recommend to ask for a table in his area. We ordered the sweet corn, red peppers and goat cheese flat bread and Ryan recommended the sweet potato cannelloni. He said the portion was big enough to share and he can even split it and get it in two separate plates for us to share. The food was out in about 10-15 minutes and Ryan was correct...the portions for the cannelloni were perfect to share and we both absolutely loved the cannelloni and the flat-bread. The cannelloni had a nice sweet/salty taste and the spinach/almonds on the top tasted amazing.   Ryan had also asked us initially if were celebrating anything and we had told him it's our anniversary. After we were done eating, he got us a delicious looking strawberry short cake (on the house), with fresh strawberries on a white plate that had a handwritten note with chocolate icing saying "Happy Anniversary" . We did not expect this at all and it was really a very nice surprise! The cake was absolutely delicious and it was the perfect way to end the meal.   We will definitely go back!

zD8XOZ69VbVOZUqfK9yaMw.text: Lunch business meeting.  A bit loud for this type of event.  Superb service .  Interesting dinning room.  Limited menu but very nice portions.  Cup of delicious soup and 1/2 Mediterranean salad with shrimp was plenty.

kAWlApkqofyVQXRByzeaeA.text: Very cool place! Dinner was excellent and the service was awesome! We sat on the patio which is by far the way to go at this restaurant. I would highly recommend this place to anyone!

tX6BhzoVevhSs-KlDhq0vA.text: Sunday brunch was great It was a perfect day to enjoy the good food, a sangria and good companionship in the lovely outdoor setting.  There bread and pesto sauce served prior to the meal is to die for,  Over time I have had many of their menu items, all of them pleasing to me.  this visit I had oatmeal, one companion had a very delicious salad. (I tried it) The meal and the surroundings make this Sunday  a special day.  I must mention that there was a slight snag with our reservation but the manager Genevieve Wallick quickly resolved the problem.  The high quality of the management in this restaurant Is defiantly a plus and adds to the overall experience.

z9ZC7nGgl11kvwB8cATiKA.text: Is it a get your drink on and flirt your a$$ off, because you look damn good tonight or is it a fine dining establishment...?  Well, it is definitely the former but fine dining, mmmm, not so much.   On the bar, seen and be seen crowd, it is awesome. Dress to the nines because it feels like Vegas ladies. People look fabulous and you can people watch all night and not be bored. The drinks are stiff, damn expensive and well worth it.   The food...Denny's sous chef was cooking the night I was eating and was doing a less than slamfastic job. We had the calamari and it was deep fried and resembled calamari in shape only. I had the bacon wrapped pork and was extremely unimpressed. The bacon was thin and slim. The sauce was dark, syrupy and had no particular taste. The ceasar salad was pure Denny's. Cut pieces of iceberg lettuce with a mayo dressing and big croutons.  Strangly, marscapone cheese was  a common ingredient in many dishes, the sauces and the soup. Given marscapone's bland taste, I didn't find adding it to entrees that innovative or interesting. So, get dressed up, get your drink on, but given the location, the Scottsdale restaurant scene is your oyster, so dine elsewhere.

nX_-g5CEQ3EASQVWZeMWAw.text: Dined at Olive and Ivy last Friday night (very romantical date I might add). Our reservation was at 8:30pm, we arrived about 30 minutes early and they were able to seat us right away. It was cougar central in there so I held my date close because he's a few years my junior.... they were eying us like prize winning hogs, or a coupon for 1/2 price Restylane injections. It was insane. I mean people were noticeably discussing our arrival. These women were not even trying to hide the shit talking. So, mad props "geriatric mafia" at the bar. Don't hate!  The wine alone is what warrants 3 stars. Two words: Arizona Stronghold. High five for the local support.  As far as dinner goes, we ordered the Seared Scallops and Bacon Wrapped Pork Tenderloin with side orders of Mascarpone Polenta and Roasted Mushrooms. My date and I happen to enjoy small plate dining and the server was nice enough to split everything up for us so we didn't have to feed each other. The food was...... get ready for it......... okay. Yes, just okay. The quality of the ingredients were phenomenal but flavor wise it just didn't deliver. Don't get me wrong, I don't have anything horrible to say but sorry, not having something bad to say just isn't good enough for a $170.00 dining experience.   I will probably go back and give it another shot at some point. I'm really glad I went with my gut instinct and didn't order the Filet because I am a total fucking steak snob. I have a feeling this review would have read something completely different and dropped in rating. Maybe brunch?  P.S. The chocolate martini was sex in a glass....... like actual sex..... in a glass.  You figure it out.  :)

ArwDY3LTnchGYfofh65s6g.text: It was nice but not a great experience.  The music was very loud.    The waitress was very helpful and knew the menu and the wines and made some good recommendations (love the Newton Chard).  We split a salad and a pizza.  The watermelon salad was an incredible medley of complex flavors - the red chili giving the watermelon, avocado and goat cheese some kick to offset the sweetness.  Very interesting.  We got the funghi trifolati pizza and it was just ok.  After the first wonderful taste of mushrooms, it was all very bland with nothing to make it stand out.  I think next time I would try sitting on the patio as that looked very inviting and relaxing.

rITbxSETgWCaQbW5Dlvqog.text: Great server bad food. Steak cooked correctly but served with a lot of salty sauce. Side of creamed spinach inedible, more garlic than anything. Kicker is I was offered 50% off my meal. Unrealistic solution, actually insulting.  Either comp it or just apologize don' offer a weird discount.

kyZajKrYxxh_QFwpi_dTig.text: Walked into this place on a Saturday night (i am from out of town) with my 4 girl friends...this place is HUGE!   Very packed and loud but in a fun way.  Love the decor and ambiance. Huge bar in the middle with a nice wine list and a variety of drink options. The wait was a little annoying, as we had reservations and still had to wait about 40 minutes. The menu had some vegetarian options, not a whole lot, but what i ate was really good.  The vegetable Crostini appetizer was amazing and the Hummus was not that bad either. I had the margarita pizza which was good, my friends had a pasta with chicken and they loved it as well. The sangria we had was ok, I've had better in Chicago.  The crowd was upbeat and lively, seemed to have quite a few out of towners as well, and the age ranged anywhere from college to seniors...price wise it wasn't the cheapest place but it won't rip a hole in your pocket either.

PzV-FNkzvbiVGy8JsiMfJA.text: The most amazing experience. Beautiful and unique decor and phenomenal staff. The food is unique and has amazing flavor! Also, very fun drinks and a million places to sit :)

S6PoPNvJ-W3iCH1O9ZoenQ.text: I had great expectations for brunch.   I ordered the eggs Benedict with hash potatoes.  For $13 I thought it would be great.   It was served to me ice cold, eggs were raw on top and hard boiled inside.  I had to wait & wait for waiter to return since the food runner drop off the food.  The waiter did not seem to know how to fix the problem.  He asked "Did you want another one?"  I replied "It would be nice to have it warm and  cooked properly."  In the meantime my friends continued to eat their Bruch without me.  Finally I got my dish, low and behold the potatoes were almost gone on the plate and again my egg was raw on top and slightly, and I mean slightly warm.   I do not recommend having Bruch at this establishment.

m_xHQBWvgj_x11afubFVZQ.text: Came in for Sunday brunch w/4 other friends. This was our first of the Fox Restaurant Concepts and they made quite an impression on us! No one ordered any of the breakfast items--instead we had salads, gyros, and lots of drinks. I'll take that pesto dip & bread over chips & salsa any day! Lamb gyro was legit & VERY filling. The tableside mimosas were delicious especially for $5 a pop. The other cocktails were about $8 a pop and equally good. Altogether we spent about $150 for 5--a little pricier than expected but had a great time and left full!

Sz_JGm-p8TlimtQO-C5HPQ.text: Sat at the bar.  Food was fine. Service was lame and nonattentive.  The outdoor patio are is nice overlookimg the river and crowded.

5X_Li3YmnQGRp_JekyLDWw.text: A very cool and neat atmosphere. They have outdoor and indoor seating. I had a salad and it was huge and filled me up! The staff is wonderful as well

vazk7aF_0FHn83t3ce10vQ.text: I liked the ambiance. It's a big venue with nice outside setting. The food was good. I wasn't a fan of what I ordered ( sweet potato cannelloni) too sweet and too oily. But the scallops and sea bass were delicious. A good overall experience.

ejLzwmbjS5AbomlhMCfG_A.text: Great ambiance and well designed space. Loved the food: roasted artichoke hearts app, Brussels sprouts bruschetta and short rib flat bread. I have a feeling anything they do out of this kitchen is awesome! I realized this is a very subjective opinion but coming from LA this place exceeded my expectations and that goes for the service as well.

tz6p3b5aVA_ZsHfU-sdLPg.text: Had brunch on the patio, it was a sunday so it WAS very busy but worth the wait. Kind of annoying that I ordered a mimosa first thing after being greeted and didn't get it until after I got my meal. It was all tasty none the less. I've been there several times since and everything that I've tried on the menu has been great. Love the atmosphere, if it is nice out sit outside!

35kGuES6WwXE151OkS1QIw.text: Came here for a bachelorette party. Such wonderful service! They greeted us with shots, weren't too on top of us, gave us more shots. When the check came, they gave us our food individually and the carafes  of sangria/dessert on a separate tab. So awesome for a group!
