3-9oZsdW4z7rl-4Fte5JYA.text: My wife and I have been a couple dozen times. Must be good, right? So we stopped in for a bite, and a pre-shopping cocktail today. There wasn't much of a crowd, and based on our experience, it is totally understandable. The food tasted just as good, leaving the service as the game changer.  I like to sit at the bar for my meals out, and I've been known to tip a shot of tequila from time to time. I'd even go so far as to say that there are no shortage of bartenders throughout the valley who know me well enough to serve me a chilled shot. No salt, no lime. EVER. Haven't had to use training wheels since the early 2000's.    I ordered a shot of Patron Silver, chilled, and before I knew it, the bartender was turning away, but I still said, no salt, no lime. He didn't acknowledge that he heard, so when my shot was served with salt around the entire rim, i assumed he had indeed not heard me. Not that big a deal, so I brushed the salt off the rim. My wife, who knows me better than anyone, said, wait! Before I knew it she had the bartender's attention, and asked for a saltless shot for me.  Here starts the slippery slope. Rather than believing the customer, our barkeep looked at me and told my wife that I had asked for salt. I'm sorry, what? I said, no, I asked for no salt no lime, to which he replied something other than okay. Basically calling me a liar.He rudely continued to argue the point  Excuse me, who the f*** are you to tell me what I said. Anyway, we were there, we were hungry, so on to faux pas number two.  We ordered a turkey hoagie to split. Having had it before, I knew it was enough for our desire to have a fairly lite lunch. I can name 50 restaurants that will bring the meal to you split in two on separate plates. Not at O&I today. We asked the guy who brought the food for an additional plate, and after he went to get one, the gem of a bartender asked, oh do you need an extra plate.  This may sound nit picky, and maybe it is. But we live in the Biltmore corridor, and there are just too many viable options for every occasion to have to put oneself through that kind of experience. Wake up O&I. You have what it takes, just show your customers a little common courtesy and respect.

VXh1AYU5y3zILEKua7PqmA.text: I don't really know how to start with my review of Olive & Ivy, this place is special to me because it's been where I have celebrated my friends engagement, where I rang in 2014, where I went with friends for lunch and for an outdoor brunch or two during the beautiful Arizona days. The atmosphere is spot on, the patio is fabulous and all in all they have the perfect set up here, oh and the food and drink is AWESOME!

WNoKspPJgOLEzzerYKbN4g.text: After a lukewarm visit a bit ago, this visit was much better.  This eatery fills up fast so there are a few options for those on the go.  Sit at the bar or order from the take out.  The watermelon salad should not be missed.  Sandwiches have unique and delicious assembled layers and sauces.  Many salads are a tasteful choice for the Paleo diet--add salmon on the side.

dZdyuF5kXckatbaXQeSvOw.text: Fox Restaurant Concepts did it again.   This place rocks! Fantastic offerings of wine, atmosphere & flavor.

sQrYAbFstqqykjPcsHFDDw.text: Simple review. Good food. Great atmosphere and service. I will be coming back.

Lu0wTivEdosYPTGp3AWuzQ.text: I came here for brunch for the first time a few weeks ago and loved it. The ambience is just so cute and classy, it made me glad I dressed up a bit that day. The wait wasn't too bad, but I was sad that the outdoor seating was closed due to rain that day. The sun did come out while we were eating though, and it is simply gorgeous out in their garden! I ordered the breakfast sandwich with egg, bacon, avocado and cheese and it was oh so yummy. The server was attentive and friendly. Hoping to come back soon for more!

RKl0uXLNPshL5U2xDtxXlw.text: Like it they have good coffee and I'm pretty sure their food is good. Nice restaurant and nice staff. The remodeling looks great. I recommend it to anyone more than likely you'll like it for whatever occasion. Very busy.

1f_rTNvxKOrKf8ScL4ijpQ.text: Came to Olive & Ivy on a Wednesday night and sat at the bar.  Ordered a glass of Pinot Grigio, a green salad, and the sea scallops.  The green salad was basic, but good with the perfect amount of dressing.  However, it took forever for me to get and wasn't able to get half way through it when the entree came out.  The sea scallop entree was not great, as the featured scallops were small and over-cooked.  They were served on a sweet corn polenta that was actually very good.  This was my one and only time here, but I expected much much better.

tHMFkuPyOEtim3dzp9pV4g.text: Went here for dinner last night and enjoyed my experience.  I thought it was pretty busy for a Thursday night, but the service was excellent and my waiter took the time to explain the menu in detail to me.  Good selection of menu options and I ended-up ordering the Chicken Scallopini, which was excellent.  It was cooked perfectly and was served with mushrooms and over a bed of spinach with a Madeira sauce.  Didn't have any room for dessert, but will have to go back when I'm in Scottsdale.

nJFB89WKfy2QVVvY8DuWAw.text: I'm a big happy hour fan and the only time I have  to make it in that window is during vacation. From 4-6pm, Olive and Ivy has $5 wine/drink specials and a small plates menu. If you happen to be there, please try the Asparagus and Wild Mushroom flatbread with truffle oil and the Italian Sausage Polenta.  To this day, I am still  dreaming about it.  As it is in the waterfront area of Scottsdale, the restaurant decor is absolutely beautiful. No matter where you sit inside a hundred hanging lamps looking at bottles of wine or the bright green outdoor space with a fountain, sipping a glass of Cab in your hands, you will feel like a million bucks! I gave it 5 stars for their bang for the buck happy hour, $25 between 2 people is a winner to me. Perfect place to end my January vacation, especially knowing I have to return to the frozen tundra or as most folks know it to be as Chicago.

sIB6mWi21QRqi2VL-RJujQ.text: I have eaten here many times with my wife.  It is one of our staple restaurants in Scottsdale.  Great ambiance, the service is good and the food is always delicious.  The outside area is really nice.  When the weather permits, I like sitting near the edge of the outside area because it is close to the canal.  My favorite thing on the menu is the Natural Chicken.  Probably my favorite chicken dish I have ever had.  We have been here several times for brunch, which is also really good.  A great restaurant in Scottsdale!

1XqdeE0xaabpnDljoFwebw.text: This was my second time dining there and my third time there altogether (the other visit, I had cocktails.)  I have to say, when I went 4 years ago, I was very unimpressed with the eatery. I felt like it was overpriced for the small portions served and way too dark. You might think that's romantic, but judging by how loud it gets, it was a weird dynamic for me.  This dining experience was far better (despite our server taking more than 10 minutes to greet us.) He made up for it by suggesting items on the menu and being diligent the rest of the night, and the atmosphere was a little more relaxed than I remember. What stands out most to me about the decor is the sprawling wine bottle display that goes up to the ceiling. I also like the pretty hanging lights and big bar that greets you as soon as you walk in.  For my first course of my meal, I had the hummus and pita bread. I wasn't a huge fan of the pickled onion on top of the hummus, but the hummus itself was good. The pita bread was a little dry, but it was nice to have a healthy option for a starter, and overall, I enjoyed it.  For my second course, I had handmade pasta, and instead of the veal ragu, I got a butter parmesan sauce to make it vegetarian. The sauce was so, so good, and you should request it, too.  For dessert, I had a coffee creme brulee with hazlenut biscotti. I really liked the taste of it, and it was so creamy, but I found it sort of odd that our table sampled many desserts, and they all came out in perfect circle shapes. It made me think they were all pre-made, and that was a turn-off.  Overall, though, I was very satisfied with the meal, though Olive & Ivy can get pretty pricey for average-quality food.

c3rDhsbiOSkOviecB41Hsg.text: We went with a rather large group around 5pm on a Wednesday night. It wasn't too busy at the bar so we were all able to gather around one side of the bar pretty comfortably. The bartenders are pretty inattentive to ordering a drink/food at the bar was difficult. They barely looked up to make eye contact with anyone! We tried their red sangria and funghi flatbread pizza which were both really yummy.

9kWYY8IEtvxDI3-KH5Ba8Q.text: Visited here two times during our two day stay in the area!  The atmosphere is amazing.  I don't think there could be a better place to hang out.  The restaurant is beautiful, inside and out.  The staff was very professional.  The first time, I had a gyro.  I can't tell you that it was the best that I've ever had because I'm not sure why there was humus on it, but it was good.  The pesto is amazing that they give you for the wonderful bread.  The lamb meatballs are worth going back for too!.  They were awesome.  My husband had a pasta dish that he loved.  I need to come back and try the gelato!

xo_TyQbdm-Y3uuDQNnwWZg.text: I'm adding one more update to my review. As I've mentioned before, the Mediterranean Chicken Salad is my favorite salad on the menu but while dining with my Mom I learned a helpful tip that makes the salad even better. Yes it is possible to make it better! Instead of having the salad with the cold chicken, ask them to substitute it with the hot grilled chicken sliced on top. It changes the salad completely and makes it an even better meal!

2GBakPFFei2WjJQ_Jhe5Mg.text: Went for lunch. Great menu, salads were delicious. As we were leaving in the market area the manager was there and we were chatting telling him it was our first time at the restaurant and he gave us 2 desserts on the house! So nice and unnecessary!

fBriWZZVq3dkNr-ak-MMKw.text: The bread, the ambiance and the bruschetta alone are worth visiting this quaint restaurant located on the waterfront.  Such a relaxing last lunch before heading home to Chicago.

oyNhftmPV5SX0hUpnWeRCA.text: Ate in the restaurant part. Had reservations.  Service was excellent. Server made many great recommendations  I particularly enjoyed the white peach and hibiscus margarita! YUM  I had the fish special, my man had the braised short ribs.   We also shared the antipasto appetizer platter, and really enjoyed it.  So yeah We really enjoyed this place.   I'm not a HUGE fan of their menu selections (they don't have any entree salads... the salads are all in the appetizer section of the menu and there are only two to choose from)  All in all, I like.

PSjPvdhMhI0ChEFKrXFWVg.text: I've been here a few times and always enjoy myself.  Being from Seattle...I love the opportunity to eat outside.  The outdoor seating is really nice and staff is friendly.  Come here for drinks, dinner or the gelato!

hDQSGhbxu99GT_jqHsGFaQ.text: I came here with a work group after Cowboy Ciao lost our reservation and were pretty well taken care of on short notice. Check the website, the atmosphere is pretty swank. Huge space with a lot of thought put into it...neat-o. The service was absolutely excellent, and we never had to ask/wait for anything.   Now the food... not too bad, but not amazing. We had a global group of visitors (Sydney, NYC, London, Chicago, Dublin) and everyone was happy with the choices, and what they ordered. Decent value for the money, but not overly memorable. On the plus side, the wine list was extensive and fairly diverse, so we were quite happy with that. The cocktails were creative, but all the ones I tried slanted a bit to the sweet side on balance (not a bad idea for mass appeal).  P.S. Cowboy Ciao was pretty accommodating. Their manager got on the phone and arranged for a group of 10 to walk in to Olive & Ivy with no notice, so I appreciated the effort.

PkmF1wtqnwm2lx1e08Ipuw.text: My mom and I tried this place out before hitting the mall during her most recent visit to town. Our first impression was the space and decor. It's very large and open, contemporary and easy to people watch... one of our favorite sports. We came after lunch and just before dinner on a Sunday. There was a significant crowd giving the time of day and day of the week. They were only serving flatbread and dinner salads at the time and we settled on sharing two flatbreads. I ordered the Pesto and she the Fig & Prosciutto along with a  pitcher of the white sangria.   We sat in the bar area in some leather couches and sofas that line the bar. Very comfortable but we could have done with a larger table being that there were only two of us and we had a hard time managing in a space that was meant for 4.  The Pesto flatbread was my favorite of the two. Roasted garlic cloves, lots of cheese, fresh tomato... what more could one want? The pesto was very good and gave the perfect amount of flavor. It was my ideal flatbread. The fig & prosciutto was good as well. It was a very unexpected pairing with fig, prosciutto, goat cheese and spinach. Being that goat cheese is one of my favorites, I felt like it was lacking. I probably wouldn't order this again but it wasn't tragic either by any means, just not exactly my taste. The white sangria was great. Very refreshing and an interesting combination of juices and flavors. I just wish that the pitcher wasn't more ice than sangria.   Our service wasn't fantastic nor was it awful as others have described.   Although I didn't order off of it the wine list was very extensive but it was also on the pricey side.

oTJ4tqNfFYVNgwTvmDXUdQ.text: I love this place, it evolves in simple elegant ways.  It's been a little more than a year since I've last been there.  I booked the reservation on line and was able to get a reservation 45 minutes earlier than quoted by phone.  On-line is where its at.  New addition since I've been there a cosmo dj spinning some old school tunes.  Love it, love it.  Took the parents, they are a little afraid of change but they give this a passing grade the last time we were here.  The sangria is very tasty and got two pitchers.  Order the lamb meatballs; pass on them, they need more flavor.  The stuffed dates are a sure hit though.  Entrees were pork tenderloin and chicken.  These were all perfect and flavorful.   Wait staff is perfect.  I finished off with the Hazelnut pudding.  The pudding was great, the pastry that was on the side, had mystery flavors that I would pass on.  I wish there was a location arond the Biltmore area.  Fox restaurants this place is a hit!

VBGWxc3DEufDfIPhEPJTSg.text: I see you brought back the mushroom and asparagus flatbread without the asparagus. The service of the staff raised you up, but dude, get rid of the ridiculously tight outfits. The "fungi" named flatbread was great though. Bring back the salmon flatbread , get rid of the howdy doody outfits, and I'll give you another star.

U4AZxqM0ognJs80bldwfYw.text: Good quality, fresh food. Great ambiance. Seating inside and out. Great vegetarian options.

kKtqaZm1kkNBj2Ev9twWiw.text: Great atmosphere, and creative menu! 3.5/5  I went there about a year ago for S's birthday. A big group of us were seated at the patio outside. The atmosphere was great. I like the menu a lot. I remember the food was good but not very spectacular (when considered the price tag...). I only have it a low 4 because of its service. We had poor service that day! I hope the situation has improved since then. I will check back and report out again!

dOrHd2vM7qInhQS1yVi7qw.text: We stop in here a lot after our Saturday runs for breakfast.  The location near the canal is nice.  They have some delicious pastries and berry yogurt.  Also have been here for dinner.  We've found it is a nice place to take guest as it has a huge patio with lights stung across.

fV75v68vwD6pEby02n_GAg.text: I have been meaning to write this review for over two months....amazing food as always and the best server I have had in a long time - Tommy! Normally we go for dinner (sweet potato cannelloni is my fave) but stopped in for lunch this time. Tommy was attentive, made excellent suggestions (pastrami Reuben) and built up an excellent rapport immediately with us. He maintained this great attitude and  service throughout the entire meal! Normally we leave raving about the food, this time we left commenting on the amazing service!

NPVYeuEzKYEYX44H9TWhWw.text: We ended up at Olive & Ivy as a 2nd - or 3rd choice due to our lateness in making a reservation for a party of 8 during the month of March.  We made the reservation about 9 days in advance.  We ended up with a primo indoor table on a Saturday night (a full house).  We were extremely pleased with the location, ambiance, service, wine list, and the food.  The dishes were spectacular.  I had the best sea scallops (with sweet polenta) that I have ever eaten.

mRnKuyyHeHhI0i6tOGZFBQ.text: Well??? Let's see???? Where to start??? Had a reservation for 3, myself, my girl, and my mom (she was celebrating her birthday), So, Sat, 6:15 reservation, we show up prompt at 6:14. They seat us right away, and I'm excited, as is Kiri my girlfriend as we have already read the menu. The place is way tricked out cool, in decor!!! but strike #1 very high celling's, making for an extremely loud dinning experience. However the booths are nice, the lightings very cool, but oh yeah strike #2, my eyes are pretty good as far as sight & I'm somber, but even w/readers & my led smart phone flashlight, it's still very hard to read the menu??? Now you must understand that I have an onion allergy and if you do??? listen UP!: Starting with the apps, everyone of them contains onions of some sort & can not... I repeat CAN NOT BE PREPARED WITH OUT? WTF??? On do second course salads: every dressing is made with onions and your ONLY options is oil & vinegar??? Oh yeah!!! YIPPIE!!! I'm having a blast! strike ###3, but it got better, now I digress, Assuming now that our sever knows the allergy exist, we attempt to move on to main course: first up chicken scaloppini I order, Kiri orders scallops, and my mom, like me, chicken scaloppini, 10 mins pass, server comes back, and states that my dish has onions in the sauce, I say ok....what can we do??? she shrugs... IDK???? I ask her to please go back and ask the Chef what they can do??? 5min later, she comes back and says: "the chef say's all the sauces, puree's/grays have onion", but still no word on what we can do??? I ask again, she say's IDK??? I'm like WTF??? please get me a menu so I can try and make another selection??? DuH! Now the table has been held up at least 30 mins??? Finally, she tells me I can have the bacon wrapped pork tenderloin on a bed of spaghetti squash!!!! YUM!!!! I ORDER! YES!!! 10mins later the manager walks up and says "hi I guess there was a problem??? I say, no we got it worked out. I'm allergic to onions, but the server got me on track with the pork tenderloin!!! He said "NO" It has onions in the squash???? WTF!!!! many mins go by, he gets it straight w/a potato puree instead, which I was told had onions, GEEZZZZ anyone still keeping up? Because only now does everything go down hill. Plates all come, my tenderloin that I ordered mid well (that slightly pink about 160deg internal temp inside, is all pink and bloody juice on plate....NO! Kiri's scallops are4 tiny scallops the size of a .50cent piece three seared only on one side and one not seared on either side and chilly cold in the middle???? WTF!!! we have to send our two plates back for do over.... "RE-FIRE" meanwhile, they leave my moms on the table for 15min and she waits for our food to return, only to have her's go cold....WTF! YOU THINK A PLACE LIKE THAT WOULD HAVE PULLED ALL THREE PLATES AND RETURNED THEM ALL HOT TOGETHER? I'm in the business and just call them as I see them???? SAVE YOUR MONEY!

UoFGFMM1CY8uwoK_EaalQg.text: We went to Olive and Ivy just for dessert after having dinner at another restaurant with another couple.  It was a beautiful night so we had to take advantage of one of the nicest patios in Scottsdale.  We ordered the warm apple pie with a scoop of Nutella gelato.  I won't be ordering the warm apple pie again.  First of all they shouldn't call it warm, it was room temperature on the outside and cold on the inside.  It looked like a cross between a hot pocket and a apple pie you would get from McDonald's.  The Nutella gelato was amazing.  I will for sure be getting that next time I go back.  The other couple we were with had the ice cream bar and a scoop of cookies and cream gelato.  I didn't try it but they said they enjoyed it.  The hostess was great.  The service from our server was nothing special. He gave us our check after we got our dessert and never came back after that.  No "can I get you anything?" and no refill of our empty water glasses.  I've been to Olive and Ivy many times and I will go back.

NP4xsttutwowYxi-UEHT7A.text: Went for a B-Day dinner.... Good times, great food.  Even had a Moscow Mule (not even on the menu) at the bar.  Good times, but with all great times comes the part with the bill.  A bit pricey, but it was my B-Day and I had alligator arms.  Will be coming back, especially to have a loaf of bread with pesto.....

92tSfl2tZPN22xqwEKrpXQ.text: I have only been here for drinks so I cannot review the food at this time.   The design of this restaurant is great.  I love the wine room with wine stack floor to ceiling.    We ended up ordering drinks at the bar then wandering outside to sit by a fire  outside. I had a very nice view of the river and it is a very nice area of Scottsdale. It was a fun place to dress up and go out. I will have to come back and try the food.

4aiGcFM0pFToW81Ib8Ed6Q.text: This is a fabulous restaurant.  We were 10 minutes late for our reservation, but the staff was really friendly and accommodating and made us feel comfortable.  Our waiter was engaging and fun.  The entire kitchen is open to the inside seating area, which was awesome to watch.  We sat outside on the patio which I highly recommend; it's right on the canal and it was fun to watch the giant "waterbugs" on the river change colors throughout the evening.  If you're going to order cocktails, I suggest the Daiquiri No. 4.  The waiter suggested a locally brewed beer for my husband and we both thought it was one of the best beers we'd ever tasted.  Now for the food:  I ordered the sea scallops, which were possibly the best I'd ever had.  My husband had the chicken entree, which was good, not great.  For dessert we shared the peanut butter pudding, which was to die for, and the Napoleon ice cream sandwich, which was just fine.  The only reason I'm not giving this a five-star review is because this restaurant is LOUD.  It's surprisingly big and it was completely packed when we were there, which was a Monday night, so I definitely wouldn't go there on a weekend!  It's definitely not the place for a chill, family meal.  But for a nicer, trendier date night, it's an awesome choice.  If I'm ever back in the Scottsdale area, I will definitely try to get in here again!

tDzC7iQi0nE7vVvo7IVmsQ.text: This was my third visit to O&I, and the first time experiencing the "brunch menu." Plenty of lunchable dishes, tho, so while my 3 yr old devoured the perfect thick pancakes with custard and blueberry compote, my wife and I enjoyed two tasty flatbreads - mine with prosciutto (bellissima!) and hers with short rib (get 'r dun!).  The serving size was generous, she barely finished hers and she hadn't eaten yet that day (we arrived around 2 pm), and I got to bring home 3 pieces for a nice snack later. (which she scammed from me!! lucky I love her....)  Everything was cooked perfectly, and delicious. The decor of the place is top-notch, making me feel like I just had my living room decorated by Vern Yip from Trading Places. (always love his designs) Lots of hanging candles, rustic furniture, and an open air feel with a large outdoor patio.  The bakery has a nice assortment  of freshly baked goodies (my son loved the gingerbread man cookies - and I must say, they were still warm and soft - best I ever had) and even gave me a free homemade biscuit for my "best friend" at home.   And the prices, though a tad bit steep, are very reasonable for the food quality. Lunch for 3 of us, including a glass of wine and a quenching rasberry mojito was about $60.  The service was just okay, not too attentive, and the waiter, tho friendly, committed one of my most hated pet peeves. As I've said in a review for Ernie's, you are NOT impressing me 1 bit by memorizing my order. Do they not give waiters/waitresses pens and paper anymore??? You could have saved yourself a few percentage points in the tip, if you you didn't have to come back to me 10 minutes later and ask me AGAIN what I ordered. Or say "You ordered the..........(long pause waiting for me to fill in the blank)...." Nope! (buzzer) The Jones Family gets a chance to steal!!!  To all servers. Please. I'm begging you. Write down my order. In crayon if you want. Tattoo it on your forearm. Whatever it takes. Just please don't come back to me asking what I ordered. 5 minutes after my meal, I won't remember you, and I won't run home to nominate you for a mensa membership. I just want what I ordered.  (stepping off my soapbox now)

zSHXufQvAnn2fY05zYhgVQ.text: Love this place. They have an awesome martini with St. Germain and Gin - love it! I also love the flatbread pizza and the wine list. The bar is large and friendly and you can always feel the warm breeze from the door - I love places that leave the doors open!  I loved this place years ago when I used to vacation here, now I live here and can go whenever I want! YAY!

oEulY8sZ1Tw82QWJIdmfUA.text: The food was simply delicious! We started with the homemade hummus. This was no ordinary hummus. It was filled with yummy veggies and goat cheese. We were then given the focaccia with a pesto spread. Very tasty, but the best was for last. The sweet potato cannelloni was one of the best dishes I have ever had. We also had the goat cheese and duck tortellini. This was very good as well. Great combination of flavors. The atmosphere was fun with open air seating.

pqCct-qwq5XdGpBrcXxbLw.text: Food is ok . It has nice patio and decor, friendly stuff. I do not understand  why it's so busy all the time......

x2HFbIaoFB_F_l4olPLY2g.text: I wish there was a half star, because truly I would give it 3.5. The food is good. The ambiance is good, but the service...meh.  The reason I go...The beet salad. THE BEST in the Valley I have tasted. The pistachios and arugula with goat cheese? Diiiiiiivine. But, truth be told, if they took it off the menu, I would never come back. Still. xoxo

2EnQZXK0ZRS7WOd0sgfg9A.text: We really liked this place.  I had the shrimp risotto and the rest of my party ordered the margherita flat bread, lasagna and the bacon wrapped pork.  Everyone must've liked their dishes because we all finished our food; except for my husband who loaded up on the yummy bread and pesto dipping sauce beforehand.   My dish was perfectly cooked and the portion sizes are just right.  All around good food with great ambiance.  It's also a fun place to people watch!

FY0qEv8VNd0ZjChwfu8TOQ.text: Two words.... HAPPY HOUR!!!!!   My girls and I went to happy hour last Friday, Olive & Ivy was the first stop, cuz everyone knows HH isn't just one hour. :-)   We had never tried their HH before and wanted to see what it was all about. It's flipping amazing is what it is. Half off almost everything.... bottles of wine, flat bread pizza, salads, sangria, appetizers, beer, cocktails.... The three of us split a couple craft's of red sangria (one caraf = $10 one caraf = two glasses per person) Needless to say we were very much pleased with our HH choice this day.   We also got the margarita flat bread and the pick three cheese plate. So good! If you are looking for a fab HH in Old Town this is the place to be for sure!

n78B_nPjuEeF6AS8-XRsCg.text: I took a client there hoping for a great meal and to conduct some business.  The hostess wanted to seat us next to a table that was about 8" away.....I had to request a different table.   I don't want to hear their business nor do I want them to hear mine.   The next table offered sufficient privacy.    It took about 5 minutes before we were greated by a wait staff or even offered any water.  The music was that repetitive club type of annoying beat and rather loud, again, hard to conduct business, or really any conversation. The food was great....but I probably won't return with a client in the future.   It's about the whole experience.

EzqD6Or4TpLx-KSIY61k_A.text: We really wanted to check this place out.  Went around 6pm on a Monday and were seated quickly.  Our server, Rachel, was phenomenal.  She was well-versed in the menu and knew a lot about the other Fox concept locations.  We had the lamb meatballs, lasagna and chicken scallopini.  My only gripe is that there was probably too much breading on the chicken, but overall it was very good.  Especially the sauce on the chicken.  It seemed to be a little busy with several 6-top tables all around.  Prices were reasonable and I was definitely full.  I'd come back to this place and try other menu items.  Pros=service, food quality, ambiance, proximity to other restaurants Cons=hard to find on my TomTom and iPhone maps apps.  Plus, I think I went in the wrong door (the marketplace) and some randoms asked if they could help me.  Not sure if they worked there or not.

jSLoJKOGTFWlPkSMS8AJkA.text: Awesome place. Great service, superb food, and fun drinks. What more could you ask for?

VXJ5AHjjTSv6quj-Mg2SSQ.text: If you like the stuck up Scottsdale vibe this is a good place for you. The food isn't impressive. Nice outdoor seating.

PjLlWZE-TAWazCBRLx26gg.text: Always great food, small portions and pricey. I try not to babble on and such, but yelp does not like short reviews.

fKE2bxMWWhEOBnAOZLA6sg.text: The food and service were great! The ambiance on the back patio was beautiful. Would definitely recommend.

lQGxawctK_bND2Onf7_XQw.text: Really cool atmosphere. The small plates are delicious and they have a great selection of wine. Perfect for a date night.

y5iTLEGlFJqsqmSr0BZ0PA.text: My husband and I went here for our 10th anniversary. Every single thing we ordered was amazingly delicious! The server was so nice, and made it a special evening for us. They even gave us free dessert to celebrate our special night, with 'Happy 10th anniversary" written in white chocolate on the plate. We loved sitting out on their beautiful patio, but the inside is just as beautiful too. If we are in the area again, we will definitely be back!

XNP-5sGv6GQSl9Hy-jH6sA.text: High prices, salad is bitter. Service is just okay. Changing my star from 2 to 1. The waitress places the silverware directly on the table.  Very unsanitary!

M-JrYAFdNR9cCzv6PVeA0Q.text: So the first time I visited Olive and Ivy was a few years back (probably a month after it first opened) I was not a fan at all. However, recently I had heard a few of my friends talking about how good this place was, so I figured it was probably just getting established when I visited before.   Last Saturday I decided to give it another go. And I am so glad I did! I am a fan of all fox restaurants - but this one might take the cake! The atmosphere and decor was perfect for a Saturday afternoon. They had the restaurant opened to the patio and the weather was absolutely gorgeous! Also they had a small band playing music, which was great!  The waitress was a little uneducated about the food and forgot to put in our order for flatbread, but she was nice - so I'll only take off one star. And the food - oh. my. god. The grilled chicken salad was the best I've had so far and the pasta was delicious!  I plan on returning soon. I think this might be a new favorite brunch/lunch spot.

u1vLbV1Yho4ofo8DKao0PA.text: Super cute and modern ambiance, reasonably priced beautiful delicious food, and helpful friendly staff.  I've been here for dinner and brunch it has impressed me both times.  It seems like they accommodate for large groups as well.  I would definitely continue to go here.

FNlJ-L9zH8D6zG3b5S9BIg.text: Managers are HORRIBLE! Tried to book a party and was treated very badly. They would rather leave their GOLD ROOM empty then to let customers utilize it. My suggestion for big parties is to either go to HEB BOX or KELLYS. Much nicer- friendlier and not as snotty!

5x0sOjakj13Nms4uvEdHEw.text: Awesome restaurant to go too. Love everything about it. Can't say anything negative about this place!!  Totally go if your in Scottsdale Arizona!!

PlJtPF-qjr7_7xluouT_4w.text: Been here many times, and also just had our work holiday party here. Classy establishment, excellent food, and nice wines. I love the patio, it's nice and doesn't even seem like you are in AZ anymore. Only knock on this place is that the waiter thought he had free reign during our holiday party and kept refilling our wine like he was replenishing water. Endless wine with no idea how many you have had? You can derive your own results for how that nigh ended up for a few people.

aNhB58uM0chYrCx4zZAILQ.text: This is a great spot to go for an afternoon drink after walking around downtown Scottsdale.   Great place to see the beautiful people of Scottsdale, if you enjoy people watching!  I loved sitting outside enjoying the wonderful weather. We had hummus and pita, which sounds boring, but it was so incredible!!   The complimentary freshly made bread with pesto was also amazing.   Their signature mule drink was light and refreshing.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

VmzCsY-r6jfXoQQjtKDsFA.text: Always my favorite staple restaurant - the food, the drink menu, the atmosphere, the music. I always bring visiting friends and family to Olive & Ivy, does not disappoint. We even had our engagement party here in 2017. The staff are lovely, and we always enjoy the exemplary service. The food is from a scratch kitchen (open, very clean kitchen you can see) and modifiable for any dietary needs. The marketplace is nice to stop in for a cappuccino or gelato while out around old town.  My favorite is the kale salad, add shrimp, sub blue cheese for goat cheese, extra dressing on the side with a glass of Sangiovese or Prosecco.

ktZENx64cJLhuZ5eFtlrZQ.text: This is one of my favorite spots in all of Scottsdale! A beautiful place with consistently delicious food! Great variety on the menu and lovely service

SgZG40E64te5xs_kjdrpJw.text: Went for breakfast and got an excellent breakfast burrito. Easily one of the best I've had. It was definitely dense and a lot of food but worth it. If you want to be full for hours after a meal I would recommend this for sure!

XHY_6Got3_dd4-zSjrR7ZA.text: The pasta with the mushrooms in it is so good it makes me want to cry. Eat it. But before you go to eat it, make sure you make a reservation like a week in advance because this place is so busy (for good reason).

Ztkcv6nqH6d0uek6_4CoNg.text: Came here for Happy Hour on a Wednesday and grabbed a seat in the lounge. This place has a really nice ambience with great lighting and friendly staff. Had the Mediterranean salad with shrimp (not on happy hour) and shared 3 of the bruschettas- avocado, salmon, and prosciutto (3 for $10 on HH). Also had a glass of Pinot Noir ($5 on HH). Everything was really delicious and not too heavy- will definitely be back to try some of their other menu options. The mall also offers plenty of free and easy parking.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

HUANrUxqvQN0H0U6rNVlSw.text: We had an amazing dining experience this evening at Olive and Ivy in Scottsdale. Our seating on the patio was a lovely setting and the misting kept us cool. Our server, Casey was very attentive without being intrusive and had wonderful dining suggestions with wine pairings. His suggestion to try the gelato after dinner was spot on!  We will definitely return for another great experience.

EmLMKl_GoKqGN3iJ8PgAsA.text: Incredible pizza ! Nice thin crust pizza that is worth the wait. Also the garlic knot is next level, has an entire roasted thing of garlic baked into the knot, pretty bomb. Wait staff can be hit or miss but worth it. For the money it's not worth delivery, takes an hour and not as good as in the restaurant.

q8wlaQGTZ0I4NSLhV9T9zA.text: Food  and service perfect Very professional staff food was really exceptional Ordered some bruschetta. They were the best

6HgU_Fb4ReaXyGIiN62GSQ.text: Outstanding! Food was excellent! We had flatbread which was really good. Atmosphere was really nice. If making a reservation and you want to sit outside, make sure you specify that. Otherwise, there are outdoor happy hour tables that are first come first serve. We were lucky and we dove for one when it opened :)

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Flatbread
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Flatbread!

inFAKe3QWENqJO1bwwOZCw.text: The food was delicious for our first time but would I go again ? No. only because as my mother and I  waited to get open bar seats for about 20-25 mins I was asked to move so that a party of 3 could join at the open bar which I found very rude. I wasn't even sitting in the middle I was at the corner and still was asked to move ( which mind you that's part of an open bar seating first come first serve ) , the bartender ignored a guy who was trying to pay his bill , mid way they had completely forgot about my burger as others got their food first than we did. Very disappointed in their service. I also work in the customer service and I get we all have bad days but still wasn't impressed with the service at all.

eiRls0kIPmpww5rh6t5p_Q.text: Food and wine were amazing!  My fiance and I were on a Saturday night .. it was really full so it took a long time to get our order

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

O2IX4QCvZq7ggu0mBzNnEA.text: We went to Arizona to attend a Cubs spring training game. Went here to do brunch at 11am. So...there are 2 sides to this place(I didn't realize until we were leaving). There's a marketplace and the fancy sit down one. My hubby was in the mood for breakfast, and Yelp suggested this place. We were seated right away, and the server took our drink order pretty quick too. We looked at the 2 sided menu, and guess what. No breakfast, only lunch items. Whatever. I informed our waitress that my hubby and I were sharing their lamb gyro entree(with potato salad), and my son had their burger(with fries). We also ordered their soup of the day. (It was kale, potato and burger soup) It was really nice of them to actually split the gyro entree into 2 plates for my hubby and I. The soup, the lamb gyro and potato salad all tasted good. My son loved his burger. The only thing is I wished I knew about the marketplace part of the restaurant. I'd probably would've gone there instead. (Prices were a bit cheaper in the marketplace) On the plus side, our waitress was very nice and attentive to us. Overall, it was a pleasant visit. I'd probably be back if ever in the area again.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lamb gyro and potato salad

m3S2Ff9EhaS3I68AD5aVgg.text: Let me start out by providing the following information: I am a big fan of the Fox restaurants in Phoenix and Scottsdale. I frequent them often.  I have dined and lunched at Olive and Ivy dozens of times and most of the times happily.  Today was a disaster.  I hosted an out of town friend who had specifically asked me to eat at Olive and Ivy. A friend of his had made this recommendation.  When we arrived we were PROMPTLY seated outdoors as requested.  It was at least 10 minutes before our server, Richard, showed up at our table.  Full of energy he proceeded to get going.  The water was out shortly.  And then Richard disappeared.  Then when he reappeared my dining companion ordered an Old Fashioned. He tells me that this must be the worst old fashioned ever.  Next was the Manhattan. Same story.  So, are you guys just inventing new versions or just have lost the recipes.  Anyway, I was embarrassed and not sure I will bring my guests here anymore.  The food was okay. But not excellent enough for my friend to erase the memory of the awful cocktails he had been subjected to. FRC is a great company. But as they grow they must be mindful of quality assurance in menu and service.  UPDATE! Just about 20 minutes after I posted this review I received a call from Jimmy at Olive and Ivy who is responsible for addressing customer feedback.  This level of responsiveness is something I have never experienced before. Jimmy, you rock! I feel important, I feel you care about how I feel.  Sam's got a good team.  Thank you.  After my next visit I will update my review to let everybody know what the status is.  Cheers!

QqgLFwPgvJn12xIL5zwpXw.text: One of my new favorite restaurants! The ambiance, food, cocktails, and service were tremendous. The Evangelista was one of the best cocktails i've ever had. Our table started with 3 bruschetta's, the house made bread and dipping sauce, the Atlantic Salmon, Shrimo Risotto, and Sea Scallops. All were the perfect portion sizes and tasted so fresh and delicious. Next time we want to sit outside on the patio which have great lounge couches with fire pits.

kYLIRX7t58XUF7KMBIpvhw.text: Olive & Ivy is still a fun place to go for HH on a Friday night.  We came last evening with some old friends and had fun time catching up. The menu has recently been updated, but all the deliciousness found on the old one is still here. Remember to make reservations if you can -- the wait list was over an hour.   We started off with light cocktails of white wine. Their spirits list is pretty impressive at Olive & Ivy, so are the mixologists behind the bar. You won't go home thirsty.   We ordered a bunch of things to nosh on.  Their flat bread pizza is still outstanding and the Scallops are delicious.  We also saved room for the Gelato machine behind the bar -- a must on your way out.  Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Scallops with corn.
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken flat bread pizza

Edjbo9RSTtHaHCsVNroA1g.text: This is by far my favorite place to come eat brunch and sit on a patio. I've been here 4 times and this place has not let me down once with food or service. Today we ordered the Mediterranean salad and bruschetta. The bruschetta choice we picked were the Brussels sprouts, avocado, and tomato/basil. The Brussels sprouts was my favorite but they are all very good. We ate our meal with a Fig Mule to sip on. That was also tasteful and not to sweet. Can't wait to come back again, don't know why I always wait to long to.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

m_OuTestpZ1H0D2cQsK1kw.text: My favorite place in old town to brunch. Best sangria in the game hands down. Love the outdoor patio. And don't forget the bread and olive tapenade dip.

Z6wXVivj_5nZFFwHgD-SUw.text: We took a large group for a bachelorette party. I cannot say enough good things. They were accommodating and absolutely perfect. Our server, Casey was fantastic. And the food...wow. I personally had the scallops, and it was truly the best meal I've ever had. Highly recommended!!

vCv1qg4eWyPx3HZJ5LsIqQ.text: The mushroom pasta dish is outstanding. Just wish the serving was a little bigger. Greek salad was good but didn't love the dressing. Gelato was fun to try.

LjHDFp5koS3aLEoreHDytA.text: Came all the way from south Phoenix to eat here for my birthday and there was a sign out front that the whole place was closed for a private event. Not on their website. Uncool

VyihgultzAks3Iq1aZaiYA.text: I hosted a large work event on the patio with heavy appetizers and drinks for about 40 people. Our main server, Daniel, as an absolute ROCK STAR - he took care of our whole group swiftly with a smile. Daniel has the ability to take drink and food orders for about 20 people at a time, all in his head, without missing a thing. I cannot say enough good about Daniel - ask for him, he will take care of you.  Otherwise, the food was really good - bacon wrapped dates, flatbreads, ravioli served family style, beet salad and hummus. They also have interesting cocktails, sangria and a great wine/beer selection.   We will be back for future events - thank you!

L9s1FyEyc0mTwz6iMQhXaA.text: AWESOME atmosphere and great food, but a bit of advice to the wait staff and bar staff...Enjoy your job or find another... TWO glasses of ice tea sent to me with lipstick on the glass...EWE.... I am in the industry for too many years myself and know that this is an on going pain in the but issue, but it is not going away anytime soon so JUST CHECK THE GLASSES ESPECIALLY AFTER THE FIRST ONE WAS SENT BACK!    DISGUSTING and So disappointing the way the help did not seem to care!  C'MON!  Take pride in your role!!!

iH-W8VBxBWOizHnzMp5kbQ.text: Great food, great atmosphere. My favorite spot in Phoenix so far!   P.S.   Their focaccia bread and pesto sauce is to DIE for. You can also buy this at the bakery to bring home. Too bad they do not sell their other baked breads...

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Love thi
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

weMvsIVohvLkXyhEZHCSgA.text: So I received emails from Olive and Ivy asking when we were there,etc., I provided the information and sent them a picture of the lame sandwich and now nobody gets back to me!  Why bother asking questions if they don't get back to you!  Will NEVER go back to this place.

9dQFhHR7g_BGQb3098Rlzw.text: I love the vibe of this place! I would love to just come here and hang out outside. They have these patio seatings with patio furniture where you'll still get waited on and it's just such a perfect seating arrangement! Along with all the seatings inside. The feel for this place is closer to mature like 20-30s. I really really love the set up and would definitely try to make this place a regular spot to hit on a random night. I went on a Sunday and it was still decently busy. I do rate this place four stars though because I had ordered a margarita pizza which I thought was not good at all. I actually didn't finish it. But I did order the melon salad which was three different melons along with goat cheese which I switched it for feta cheese and avocado. I did think the presentation of the food looked very nice and our waiters were rly kind. My boyfriend and I will definitely be back here often!

p0dhbGJtgBkSsfhDdzN1RQ.text: Such a great place! Love the location near the mall and the ambiance is great. The service was fantastic, with our drinks always full. Food and menu are terrific. Highly recommend!

jevP2Hk0d3WeZLJdz_0-Fg.text: This place is great if you can handle waits. First on a waterfront in AZ. Ok it's only a canal but gives you atmosphere. Second you eat with your eyes first so peruse the deli while you wait. Third decor was very eclectic. A lot  of ideas for the home.  Let's get to the good stuff. Menu drinks did not impress. If you have a fav I'd order it. Next the bacon wrapped dates were yummy! Salads we delivered quickly. Our meals comprised of the spicy shrimp risotto and big eye tuna was excellent. The dessert menu was simply, but I'd head back to the deli for a pastry and to people watch.

1ypR294DuVP_g87KeGH9qg.text: Can you say celebrity hot-spot? This is Scottsdale not LA so our "celebrity's are mostly ball players.    When I was young and single (boo hoo) I remember seeing Charles Barkley, Mark West, Kevin Johnson "KJ" and other Phoenix Suns basketball players out and about-everywhere, waaay before Olive and Ivy.   However, looks like ballplayers have found a new place. Last time I was here I saw Dan Majerle-and I heard a European soccer team was here...single ladies?!    The restaurant is dimly lit and modern but elegant and romantic.  Since this is Scottsdale, you could wear jeans and some high heels or shorts and sandals. I've seen men in here with Hawaiian shirts or golf shirts and shorts. Later in the evening I've seen the high heels and tight mini skirts and men with some dinner jackets so it depends on the time of day.  I've been here a few times and if you come for an early dinner you'll see family's.  In the evening, the bar has some standing room around it and on the weekends it can be standing room only.  I've been here a few times and it's hit or miss depending on what's going on in town (convention, golf tournament, etc.)  Dinner is on mark, since my review is a bit overdue, I can't elaborate but I remember thinking it was fabulous! It is a "Italian" restaurant but not the typical menu-more Mediterranean.  A huge outdoor patio is wonderful too.  I saw a few smokers out there so during dinner you could walk out for a smokey.    Drinks were a hit too, I had champagne-so you could plan for a Kir Royal and nice appetizer at the bar or stay for dinner.  A live DJ playing some great tunes has been here on the weekends when I was here.   Located next to Scottsdale Fashion Square across from Nordstroms. Don't miss it!

3bmN-ksVKSu4GiUapW3_bQ.text: Great service! We had a professional server, Clenard, who told us he's been in the business 15 years. It really showed and made our dinner a delight. (He should think of being a consultant to other restaurants which have great food but mediocre service.)  We started with the bruschetta, a trio of mushroom, fig, and mozzarella. Each was a happy mouth experience.   The chicken chopped salad was big and rich, plenty for both of us. It was topped with "peanut granola" for that salty sweet crunchy somethin-somethin. Yum!  The outdoor seating was a beautiful alternative to the blaring music inside the restaurant.   We will go again and recommend you do so as well.

I0RV3q_aoZYFsbIMeCZrtw.text: Nice open restaurant with large patio - not exactly as billed (more like Southern France than southern Scottsdale) but still not too bad.  Casual crowd, good sized bar and area, inside/outside dining, noise level was average.  Staff was attentive to our needs, so much so that the manager checked in to see all was well - NO ISSUES on service.  Wine list is not bad, has room for some expansion.  My margarita was good my colleagues enjoyed the sangria.  Food, again good.  Not top notch but no issue.  To me Olive & Ivy is a nice everyday restaurant.  I would go back in a heart beat.

fp69NcUJj_Org5bhYekFJw.text: I enjoyed myself when I dined at Olive and Ivy for the first time this past weekend.  The food was good as well as the service. They have many wines to choose from if that is your thing. My only compliant is that I was told on the phone that reservations were not needed so when I arrived there was only seating in the marketplace area of the restaurant.  I believe this took away from my entire experience.  Next time, I will be sure to make a reservation in order to secure better seating.

Gkrm3xt3RebHThNIzi4QqQ.text: Gorgeous patio area.  We've been here once before and sat inside just for drinks.  But outside is where it's at!!  We started off we the lamb meatballs.  With the bread and pesto that was already part of the night, it was a great way to start.  We split the lasagna.  Both portions were reasonably sized and tasted great!  We tried the chocolate cake and lemon tres leches cakes.  The chocolate seemed a bit dry, and the lemon was very dominant in flavor.  I'd like to see more cocktails added to the drink menus.

WXLugbnUqAPFUii_WsGD7w.text: Got home after a fun dinner to celebrate my friend's birthday and the super nice boy who filled up our drinks was very friendly!!  He made her birthday all that much better and I'd like to thank all the staff but especially Mason for being more on top of it than our waitress!  Keep up the good work  All around good experience we were all pleased with the food and service.

H7TNhcZQ2gfPxQ9dSepxVw.text: Wine Enthusiasts Beware! A party of 6 (2 winery owners, 1 collector,  and 4 wine industry professionals STRUGGLED to find a white wine by the glass that wasn't over-oaked or sweet.    Our server was patient and accommodating but we have to question the wine buyers palate.   If you are listening.. PLEASE offer a better variety of white wine BTG selections. Not everyone enjoys oaky buttery high alcohol wines with RS.

ZI4pF1msiKCp6QFU0YPCXA.text: My aunt and I came back! Thanks for the dress code you address to the woman I stating about. We took my great aunt out for lunch and it was a very lovely ladies lunch out. Food was delicious as always and our waiter was the same as the last time and again he was outstanding. Thanks

-XOFwVEVHMbG9Dpb66esvw.text: what's the point of this place? Besides the little hipster drink shop, the food i dont think is very impressive, what's the appeal? the location? I don;t get it, maybe im missing something but i remember never wanting to go sit down there again, i just swing in for a kombucha if my chakras are balanced.

7UuFBF1QZ-32S7VZv0ITZw.text: I love this place! Great atmosphere, service, and really good food! If you are a business traveler and are looking to meet others,have a drink and good food this is your place. Never disappointed by the experience

X2-uWEe8FhUe8WhR-nGaDQ.text: So... I fully intended to take photos of my food here, but I blame hunger, sun, great conversation, and delicious food for preventing me from following through! The patio is so amazing - right next to the canal, and covered in greenery, cute tables and chairs, and good shade coverage for that spicy Arizona sun! Our server was super sweet, friendly, and had some great humour - respecting the fact that we were deep in conversation, but still getting our order in reasonable time, and connecting with us on a human level too. The restaurant was quite busy, but I felt that he was still very attentive, and did a great job.  We ordered bread and pesto, and the hummus plate with veggies to start. Holy moly, guys. Holy. Moly. I got really into making pesto this summer, with bunches of fresh Italian basil being so cheap, and this was just as good, if not better than homemade (always a huge compliment!!) I also love making my own hummus and this was at least 5 times better than mine! We got a huge heap of hummus with yummy, warm pita, a great variety of veggies - cucumber, celery, snap peas etc. - all covered with semi-pickled cucumber, red onion, and feta. YUM!! You guys... go get some, stat!   For my main I got the Mediterranean Chicken Salad (as did EVERYONE else at the table, which says a lot!) and it was really good. If you pushed me I'd have had two more plates of hummus rather than the salad, but I would almost sell my first born for more of that hummus... almost. The salad was fresh, and I liked the mix of ingredients - they felt well balanced, and well dressed, but the chicken was a bit dry.   I had a great time at Olive & Ivy - it's a great place for a relatively healthy working lunch, and I'm sure I'll be back.

ubHoMc1rg6GyoNFdvokuDw.text: What a great restaurant.  I had the chicken panini and my friend had a salad.  Wonderful.  We had the Coconut cake for dessert.  YUMMOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO Great service.

AhE6G80GCKcnFBmBCoSmgQ.text: Olive & Ivy offers a creative and exciting menu.  I have tried many of the items and have been pleased with all of them.  The food is fresh, the staff is very friendly and knowledgeable and the prices off a good value.  The location I decent as long as it is not during the holiday season (too much shopping traffic!).    The only thing that would make this a better rating from my perspective is the acoustics.  It can be very noisy and difficult to hear the people you are dining with.  Other than that, love this restaurant!

YBXGgk5p1xCfeBPxJKDGuA.text: Although our waitress was super nice, over all disappointing. We had a birthday celebration and had a few extra add ons including a few significant others in which we called well over 8 hours in advanced and apparently they could not even accolade one extra chair which was crap. Through out our meal there was multiple tables and extra chairs all around our party. Also I had a decent pizza and ate a slice packed up the rest to go and left it on the table- no one even had the curtesy to ring us or even let us know when we walked out and left an entire pizza on the table. Customer service below average with sub par food. Wouldn't recommend.

SZH2Etpq1McPP791tyHBMg.text: Olive and ivy is a cute and fancy place to go eat! If you don't have a reservation, beware because you might have to sit outside or wait a bit. We sat outside on the patio area (had misters and umbrellas) that was great. I had the two eggs any style, which was good. Also, $5 mimosas on Saturday!!

iVGcuknS8vJTgnTMJ7xEpw.text: Great atmosphere, good food, great service.  Portion sizes were good and the apps delivered as expected.  great happy hour spot...

4eD6Tse93Ve1P8j9vccD4Q.text: Probably one of the nicest patios (esp since smell gone) but food only ok, overpriced & arrogant staff/mgmt.

w2oWPjcsL06ZOl8RSmLJ1g.text: Sweet Potato Cannelloni...literally the best item on the menu. Second is the Mediterranean salad. Order both. This place is amazing. The atmosphere and service are always great! Ask for Josh P when you go, he's native to MI and has always taken care of us. I'm serious about the sweet potato cannelloni. It's heavenly.

ACS93zcOgHzCappgydDX2g.text: Came in for lunch recently and had a great experience. We sat at the bar and were taken care of by the bartender, which unfortunately I cannot remember his name. He made great conversation and treated us very well. We started with the Mediterranean Salad which was outstanding. I recommend this highly. We then had the Roasted Mushroom Flatbread. This was delicious. The roasted mushrooms, with Taleggio Cheese and a drizzle of truffle oil was so good that we cannot wait to come back for just that.   If you're in the area do not miss this place.

BMdiRbOTBVG-XLVHxiUn5Q.text: I came here during my stay in Scottsdale for work on a Sunday night. It happened to coincide with Spring Training so I was told that all the restaurants were much busier than usual. This is probably the reason that despite the many empty tables both inside and outside (they were all filled by the time I left), I was told there was only availability for one at the bar or area in front of the kitchen. I opted for the kitchen area and got to watch the cooks at work during my dinner.   The atmosphere is very chic, but the patrons were a eclectic mix of retirees, families and young partiers. The concept is Mediterranean, although I didn't see any traditionally Mediterranean dishes on the menu. The menu is pretty sizable with a variety of pasta, fish, and meats to select from, with vegetarian and gluten-free options marked.    FOOD: PROSCIUTTO CRUDO FLATBREAD (topped with rosemary potato and soft egg) - When I ordered this, I didn't realize the portion was supposed to be shared so it ended up being way too much for me. If I had just one slice, it would've been great, but it got tiring after my third slice.  BIG EYE TUNA (with charred scallions, snap peas, couscous & miso caramel) - I'm a sucker for couscous! I always order it when I see it on the menu so this selection was a no-brainer. The couscous and the snap peas did not disappoint. The Ahi Tuna was sesame seed crusted and was fine, but not mind-blowing. I wish it were marinated more to give it extra flavor.   The reason I rated this as 3 stars is simply because while the food was good, nothing was that impressive, especially for the price. Maybe if I came back and tried a few more items and drinks I would change my mind, but for now, this is just an OK restaurant.  I would still recommend this restaurants for groups because I think their outside patio area is lovely. The menu is also diverse and safe enough that everyone should be able to find something they enjoy. However, definitely make a reservation, otherwise you'll be stuck at the bar like me!

bi-9a-BdZpcrFEb-gzs9iQ.text: Had a great lunch here. Love the look and feel for this place. They have a nice patio, so its open. The food is mouth watering. I would recommend this place.

8VeVjsgpLjrQTf7eMOXKKg.text: Having been back a second time, I can't say i understand why this is so highly rated. While I get that the ambiance is cool, the food was relatively mediocre and greasy. Also, it took over 30 minutes for us to get any dishes. Definitely not acceptance during a weekday lunch. Crossing this one off my list to revisit.

mLc8ZWAeaUfUALSbrS2iGg.text: Excellent food...very fresh!   I had the Kale Salad, just 1/2 though as it was HUGE, and it was so delicious. I fear I might have licked the bowl had no one been looking! I also ordered the gnocchi, which was really good, not amazing, but still very fresh. I think I might have been too full to truly enjoy it. The wine selection is not as expansive as I would expect based on the decor, but it was sufficient.   One note...for some reason I thought this place was going to be a bit smaller and quiet...not sure what gave me that impression other than the name, but it was large (i.e. the marketplace) and pretty loud and happening. Had a good vibe!

E4LPhOoBayn_TShykWT0zg.text: This place is nice and upscale. If you go at night though, the music is really loud. If you're ok with that, the food is very good. Last time I went they had a smores dessert with homemade toasted marshmallow on top. Delicous.

rrskX3lVIl6kiwIXVaDh5Q.text: Great place to eat. Very pleasant environment with great service. Been there many times and never a bad experience.  Perfect for both lunch and dinner. Sometimes both!

0GElaUriLqZgT3fHCQiLfQ.text: I was looking through Yelp and read the reviews and thought why not try something different. A couple days ago a friend and I decided to try it out for brunch and it was a beautiful place to just sit and have a conversation with great food. Our server ( I wish I remembered his name ) brought us a pesto and bread for an appetizer it was amazing but be careful you can easily get full from the bread. I order the sweet potato cannelloni - OH MY LANTA! It was so good! I love sweet potato AND I have a big sweet tooth so this was right up my alley. It had 5-6 sweet potato stuffed pasta with spinach, mushroom and toasted almonds to top off. I Highly recommend this if you like sweet food! And also my friend got the kale salad which consist of bacon, blue cheese, apples and candied pecans - I had a chance to try it and that was definitely delicious as well! Overall do yourself a favor and try it out! You won't be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pesto with bread to dip!
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sweet Potato Cannelloni and Kale Salad

WxL6QI4TjQTibCW-49J7dw.text: This place was meh. The place has way too much staff on the floor, makes it feel very busy and opposite of intimate. The menu during the weekend is limited to the brunch menu, which is disappointing, both with options and taste. Don't believe I'll be coming here again.

Fuld7dcBRVlJlytKona-rg.text: This review is solely for their marketplace in the entrance:  I have frequented the marketplace during lunch many, many times when my work bring me to Scottsdale. You can't go wrong with their pastries (chocolate croissant, cupcakes, cake) and their salads are to die for. Every single salad is delicious, even the simple green salad which I like to order with tuna salad on top. And the additional grilled chicken breast you can get as well is fantastic!

GDkzNI7GAiuRWY7hOU2JoA.text: This place kinda surprised me.  Took my daughter last night Sunday for her 25thbday dinner. party of 15. The waiter was not on the ball at all   first off he dropped a beer on my back/chair and purse. We had to ask twice to start w bread and pesto. We had to refill our own water glasses. And to top all off charged me for her bday cookie & ice-cream. (not slice of cake)  I was expecting some compensation or free dessert or even a gesture from the manager.  Not so much.

jGWa---gcJTbhJZGzRy5FQ.text: I was honestly blown away with the many flavors I experienced  here. First there was the freshly baked bread and pesto dipping sauce. By far the most flavorful pesto dipping sauce I've ever tasted. The bread melts in your mouth and the garlic pesto pairing is to die for. Then there was the spicy shrimp risotto and bone in ribeye that my wife and I shared. I'll start with the risotto. Flavor A+ however the consistency of the risotto was B-. It was a tad bit runny, but I still would highly recommend it as it was still a stellar dish. The ribeye, on the other hand, A++. I ordered it medium and it was cooked to perfection. Honestly I would recommend having the risotto as a side option. Lastly, the service was great and the drinks were great. Over all experience excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bone in Ribeye was amazing!!

Xo809i3m9apqwbZs7eQGbw.text: We love the location of this place and their food. The patio is great and there's lots of open space. On weekends there are sometimes open air markets along the canal. We are thinking about coming here after our wedding rehearsal.

DLGsESplJ0CFzs8-X_Md2w.text: Somewhere between a 3.5-4   We tried to find Aye Caramba with another GPS fail and in frustration I just drove to the Fiesta Bowl Museum so at least my plus one could get to see his football stuff..... fail (again) turned into a positive. We went in for breakfast and was pleasantly surprised.   My egg sandwich was yummy. They said Kaiser roll but what I got was something soft and delicious (similar to Matt's Big Breakfast's Five Spot). Eggs were well done, avocado was fresh, cheese was yummy and the highlight was the potatoes. The potatoes were crispy outside soft inside and decently seasoned. It was a lot of food for 7.50. Boyfriend got the 2 eggs and he was happy. While we were waiting for our food we caught sight of the french toast.. it smelled like cinnamon and sugar and they were three large thick slices along side some berry compote....next time.. next time...   Liked the decor (we sat near the wine cellar wall) and our food came within 10 minutes.    In looking at the reviews maybe breffix (breakfast) is a better option than lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. only part of their wine wall
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. glass o goodies

pXCeaQEQXShuunCG2VrFdQ.text: Spent our first night in Scottsdale enjoying a great meal at Olive and Ivy.  Our waiter ranked up there with some of the best we've ever had.   He was extremely friendly and attentive.  The wine selection was top notch and we actually found some of our favorite Italian wines.   A few of us had the Bouillabaisse which was amazing and I highly recommend.   The place was very busy on a very nice AZ night but we were well taken care of.

dPu63bGDH0sccxxjd7gwaA.text: We usually end up here for breakfast, and they have always done a good job.  It's a small menu, but there is something for everyone.  If you want a Bloody Mary or mimosa, they can help you out.  If you're in recovery mode, the cafe has some Gatorade and other options.  The patio is beautiful, and I highly recommend getting a table there unless it's too hot outside.

Y60xSEINJbnEMaYH41vceg.text: Went to Olive & Ivy on a Saturday night.  Had a reservation and wanted to push it back by 90 minutes to enjoy a long walk on a beautiful evening, and they were very accommodating.  The place is very spacious, both the indoor and outdoor patio, so don't think it would ever be a long wait for a table.  Ambience outside is great.  Close to the "water" in Scottsdale, and in the spring it wasn't too hot to sit outside.  Service was very good and the menu is outstanding.  Kind of a tapas place with many entrees as well.  We had the bacon wrapped dates, lamb meatballs and kale salad with bacon.  All very good.  Want to go back to try the Spicy Shrimp Risotto.  Very good drink menu as well.  I had the Whiskey Sour Smash which was very good (though on the strong side, so if you order it, make sure you like the taste of whiskey).  Will be going back to try other dishes, menu was very appealing.

h-tqrJLUohoXUJyBpTPsEA.text: We had a reservation inside on. Friday evening. I had a half Caesar salad and lasagna bologna see. My husband had chicken piccata. Both were good, but the lasagna was the better of the two. Our server (who was great!) recommended a lemon blueberry cake for dessert. It was light a delicious! As we left, we made a reservation for the following weekend on the patio. The vibe out there looks great!

9S8g8o0nBaSgtbll_VBOPg.text: What a great experience! Celebrating graduation and a birthday. The food was absolutely amazing. Hummus, bread with pesto, sea bass, lasagne bolognese, chicken salad, soup...everything was top notch. Celebratory desserts were also delicious and appreciated. Mary the server was so accommodating and attentive. This is a MUST restaurant to eat at while in Scottsdale!

5sL1OauFQjRUC-9rrUfJiw.text: Bachelorette party and stopped in for drinks.  Slow service the entire time.  Came recommended and never will return

sGguPE4-tb12waq0yXae8g.text: Unfortunately they have recently discontinued a number of their brunch specialties.  In fact, brunch is now at the 'chef's discretion' - whenever that may occur.  Very disappointing as I loved their cheddar biscuit and gravy.  They have lost a repeat and loyal customer.

-wm-SjWHKYzfWYOxdoIJIQ.text: Had a fantastic experience dining at Olive & Ivy! Believe it or not, we even thoroughly enjoyed dining outside in the August Scottsdale swelter- their misting system works amazingly well.  Went with my daughter and two of her friends- and I totally loved this place! I liked the high ceilings, the cozy decor, the lighting, and the marketplace feel of the interior... Because of numerous raves on yelp, we ordered the bacon wrapped dates for an appetizer. It's True, they are totally fabulous- not to be missed!   I had chicken scaloppini, which was delicious- perfectly prepared, and served with just the right amount of sauce and Mediterranean olives. The girls all ordered pasta dishes- raved about, and then subsequently demolished them. There wasn't one crumb of food left on anyone's plate!   The focaccia bread with pesto is wonderful, and they have a great wine list here. I had a glass of Syrah from Washington state, which was thankfully served at the right temperature and was very nicely balanced. We were celebrating one of my daughter's friend's birthdays, so our delightful waiter brought us a complimentary dessert- an "ice cream bar," which had ice cream, marshmallow, and lots of rich, luscious chocolate. It was totally delicious, and reminded us of a s'more.  Olive & Ivy is a nice place to people watch- the patio fronts the waterfront, and reminded me of a sidewalk cafe in Europe. I will definitely be back- only wish we had an Olive & Ivy in Tucson!

09jCSWXv4gzn_B9lGJr8xQ.text: It's just hard to give them anything less.  They have the best patio in Scottsdale.  They are always open.  I can usually get a table without a reservation or too long of a wait, or we figure out a spot in the non reserved patio area (which is where i want to be anyway). The food is always consistent. And these guys care...service is always awesome. There must be a no-attitude policy with their servers bc they are always pleasant.  I'm a fan of the med-salad and i add salmon and often will split if i'm there with a girlfriend.  it's the perfect meal and a bottle of cab.  The wines are priced very reasonably.  It's a great neighborhood spot.  PS: Their bloody mary's are really good too.

4n69l8w_Vxb_QdfAiOm49Q.text: At Olive & Ivy, the quality of the food and atmosphere is not a question. The question is, "Why isn't there more of this on my plate?"  We had a group of 7 of us at a long table and our service was relatively swift. The place was relatively quiet, granted it was the middle of the week.   My qualms about portion size are with the flat breads and the veal ravioli dish. My brother in-law and I both finished the ravioli saying, "OK, I wish there was more of this, I'm still starving".  The server said that the portions were *big* and I felt that it was misleading. I should note that this entire family isn't full of extreme appetites either. The portions were just weren't entree sized in my opinion.  Would I come back here?  For appetizers and drinks, sure. But if I'm in the mood for dinner, I would order something else or go elsewhere to fill up.

TZ9tq25qF4MsF6SrTgoN9g.text: Great patio, cool decor but for a Fox concept I was disappointed in the service.  I have been to almost all the other concepts Fox owns and brag to my Chicago friends how great they are but we didn't make it past drinks and went for dinner at another place.  The service was just bad. It was not just our server (so it wasn't like 1 person was having a bad day) we had 3 people that were boarding rude to us in a half an hour on a Monday at 5:30p when they were not busy. I'd go back for the $5 wine at happy hour but not waisting my money on dinner.

7A1YDJ8nuPMpOYebtTf56Q.text: Been wanting to try Olive and Ivy for years but never made it there - finally the opportunity to meet a girlfriend for lunch today arose and it was finally time!  We shared the bruschetta to start, a trio that you choose from a list. We chose the sauteed mushrooms, butternut squash with brussel sprouts and the third was a fresh mozzarella with tomato jam. All three were great and soooo flavorful. I LOVE Postinos but this was a nice change and new flavors.  For my meal I had the Mediterranean salad and added grilled shrimp. Again a delicious choice that I was happy with.   I'd definitely recommend Olive and Ivy to anyone :)

U_tHiazVYNWGibsxiobPMw.text: Went there on a Saturday night.  Wasn't expecting loud DJ music.  Food was well prepared.  Service was friendly, informative, and timely.

Z1F4URvJ2FhCMBN2dWK9DA.text: Excellent! Loved the decor. Sat on the patio by the waterfront. It was packed on a Saturday but service was still really good. Had the sea bass and it was delicious. One of my favorite places in the area.

WUWZ9_PVsxzqIRKaKWWiDQ.text: This place has a fun and welcoming atmosphere. The food is good too. I had a fish dish that was fresh and tasty.  I've been here a few times, so it must be pretty good. I love the outside seating as well as the bar area. There is always activity around.

SkGpPGAQBm7dNBWeNS8ziQ.text: My wife and I came to Scottsdale for April vacation/our "babymoon" and were given Olive and Ivy as a recommendation. It was all we wanted...Great food, great drinks and great staff. We came for lunch one afternoon and my wife decided it had to be our final dinner also. It was even better the second time around, made all the better by our server Jeremy. He was very attentive, gave great suggestions and was overall so pleasant we would come back here and ask to sit in his section. Definitely a must on a visit to Scottsdale.

S9RcvNAI04TchMlZMb7h2A.text: The food here is great, amazing breakfast. Only thing wrong is picking up an order. When you call in and place an order for pick up, and they tell you 15 mins Over the phone. I am realistic, normally expect 15-30 when slightly busy, and I am a very patient person but when it takes almost and hour for 3 breakfast items, it becomes and issue. This is unsat, I would expect better service than what happened today.

EZWUWV1_Nl12AP03VDxcHA.text: A stylish and delicious option for lunch! We were lucky enough to be able to take advantage of their patio, complete with a little fountain, on a beautiful sunny day, and the yummy food and lovely service added up to a great experience. At first glance this place strikes me as a bit corporate, but at the end of it I felt that they really provided a unique experience.   Two highlights of the meal: the delicious pesto that comes out with their free foccacia bread, which must have a wheel of parmesan in each bowl, because it's so rich and wonderful. I also adored the asparagus, mushroom and white truffle oil flatbread, which I shared with the table and immediately wished I had gotten just for myself.   I also had the chopped chicken salad, which I found to be disappointing. First of all, there was WAY too much dressing on it, so everything felt drenched and a little wilted. Also, I was initially really curious about the granola that comes in it but I actually didn't feel that it added very much to the flavor and found myself picking around it.   I'd definitely suggest this place to anyone who wants some pretty classic salads, sandwiches and flatbreads with a little fancied-up twist!

sklagiCh9R_PIF4ijJfZnQ.text: If my mouth could marry a meal, it would wed the meal I recently had at Olive and Ivy.  It was love at first bite.  The fireworks in my mouth were poppin like my lip gloss.  But seriously.  My friend and I were torn between two meals - the scallops and the shrimp risotto.  So we did what any logical foodie would do and split the meals!  I almost cried when I tasted the scallops.  The combination of creamed corn, perfectly prepared scallops, and asparagus was a harmonious combination of deliciousness.  The shrimp risotto was just ok compared to the scallops.  I am sure that if I didn't get the scallops to compare against, I would have loved the risotto.    The drinks here are outstanding as well.  Normally when people refer to themselves or their significant other as a "mixologist" I chuckle because come on..he is a bartender, just say it.  HOWEVER, the people mixing up these cocktails get my approval to continue calling themselves "mixologists".  I had the daiquiri and my friend had some sour cherry thing.  The cherry comes from Italy and is the only real maraschino cherry out there.  None of that bleached, died, and injected with sugar kind of cherry.   The meal was a bit expensive, but you will not regret it!  I would recommend sitting outside along the canal - yes the smell of fish is overpowering (especially in the summer heat)...but nothing can beat the meal you are about to experience.

5GjyDS549Ytc8C1z_X7gXg.text: A huge fan of this place.  The patio is by far the most beautiful here.  Actual grass, beautiful fountains, fire pits for chilly nights, and overlooks the waterfront.  Very pretty. But even better is their Happy Hour.  Great drink specials and the bruschetta is cheap for HH as well. While not as fantastic as Postino's bruschetta, it is still delicious.
