I've also eaten here for dinner and it's outstanding.  The seafood risotto is unbelievably rich and filling and I wanted to lick my bowl clean.  The little cafe also serves delicious gelato and my favorite thus far is the graham cracker gelato. Wow.  Get there early for HH because the patio fills up FAST.

sSEtBroVT418KWQtp6lV8w.text: Fun and lively atmosphere!  Excellent bruschetta options!  Delicious!  We went for my birthday and I was too full for dessert so they gave me a birthday shot instead!  We can't wait to go back!  Our waitress was so good!  Loved her!

1v7sQDGTLDSFome19Sr-IA.text: Food was good, service was bad. The waiter(name was Joe) that we got was awkward and slow. My friend said that he reminded her of the sloth from Zootopia. He also interrupted our conversation at least 4 times. He took his time setting up the utensils and clean off the plates and it was very awkward. The icing on the cake was when he gave me my credit card and called me "Siri". At the end of the night he looked at our receipts (again slowly to check the tip amount) and when I got to mine he paused and said "Really?" and walked off. Yes, really I'm not giving you 20% for bad service.

71Yj66NfBMCe-vYFEyjJPQ.text: I went to Olive and Ivy on Sunday October 22, 2017 to celebrate my birthday with my boyfriend. We had made a reservation for 5:15 for outside on the patio. When we arrived, we were told they couldn't sit us outside because they were fully booked by people who booked earlier than we did. Only a couple of the 25 or more tables were taken. The hostess said it "is the calm before the storm" and they didn't want to rush us. They seated us inside with an open door to the patio, quite a ways from the water.  We stayed for an hour and a half, in clear view of the many empty tables on the patio; when we left there must've still been 7 open tables outside. They apologized, but it was a disappointment as we'd come down from Prescott for a play followed by a romantic dinner by the water.  I've been to Olive and Ivy several times before and always before found the staff great, the food scrumptious, and the setting romantic on the patio. Not only did we not get to enjoy a beautiful fall night beside the water, but my kale salad had little else but kale in it (very sparse toppings--nowhere near what it was like when I'd had the same salad at lunch before) and my boyfriend's beet salad was really small--like a dinner salad, not an entree.  It'll be a while before I go there again. It seems as if their quality has dropped.

gkpPF-KR-GrO1FMvD8_1sg.text: Really delicious dinner spot.  Trendy, so wear your outfit to be seen in Only one complaint, it was very loud!   RESERVATIONS: They do take them on Open Table. It's gets busy so make a reservation. We didn't have a reservation however they do have some lounge seating so we were able to sit there with full menu   OUTDOOR SEATING AND BAR: They have a nice large patio with misters There are some stools around around the bar. I couldn't tell if people were just drinking there or also eating   SERVICE:  Excellent service, food was timed perfectly and they even split the dishes on separate plates (a friend and I shared a salad and entree) without us having to ask   FOOD:  The portions were quite large, even the small plates section.  The trio of bruschetta is a great way to start the meal. The Mozzarella was a favorite of the group  The BEST part of the meal was the Sweet Potato Cannelloni. Very flavorful and well seasoned.   PARKING: There are spaces in the area and a parking garage

syc3srdoWn_4pMMKMIXnnQ.text: I tried to take my secretary here for lunch Friday. They were busy, and I had no reservation. Totally understandable, we'll go somewhere else. However, they said we could sit at the bar which was wide open. Silly me; I didn't think they meant it literally! We did sit there, totally ignored for 10 minutes. No water, no "we'll be right with you." We were simply invisible. The worst part? There were 4-5 employees standing around doing nothing. We gave up and left. Bye, Felicia!

PlBTw-F8hpntYVqsvqVpUA.text: Stopped into Olive and Ivy for the first time yesterday and one of the first things I said to my boyfriend was "why haven't we been here before?"  Since we were there early, we decided to sit in the bar section of the patio and order off the happy hour menu. The food menu consists of a few different bruschettas, flatbreads and a couple other small bites.   We chose two bruschettas, bacon wrapped dates and a flatbread pizza with sausage. Everything was really tasty.  The pizza was the perfect size for two people to share. And the dates, stuffed with sausage, were fantastic! I highly recommend those! All in all it made for a great light(ish) dinner.  Everything from the atmosphere to the food to the service was great. The only weird thing was that they have an air freshener on the tree we were sitting under that squirts out air freshener at times. My boyfriend got sprayed quite heavily at one point - yuck! But regardless, we will be back!

s_j4IsRR7q-4OpsJiWivOA.text: If I could I would give 0 stars. I took my girlfriend for our 6 month anniversary dinner thinking it would be a nice dinner. When we arrived the entire restaurant was under construction , the floor was covered in cardboard and looked awful. The appetizers were over priced and tasted bland, the main dish took over an hour and was small and had a disgusting bitter taste to it which made my girlfriend terribly sick. The waiters were awful ignoring guests for over twenty minutes at a time and never refilled the drinks. Overall the worst experience I've had at a restaurant, I would not recommend this place to anyone.

2-_HknodbMirhRhVz9CGkw.text: I have been here many many times and every time the food has consistently been great, however, the staff is off and on. The last few times we have gone, our servers has been extremely uppity. Last time, our server rudely corrected my pronunciation of a word while interrupting my order, this time, our server kept giving me the stink eye each time he passed us. I even witnessed him give the lady at the next table over a mean face as she walked away after he saw what she tipped him. Then, a bird pooped on our table (we were on the patio) and when I mentioned it to him he didn't even come back with a cloth to wipe it off. We lost our appetite and left.  I'd honestly rather eat at a place where I feel welcomed.

fL4ldn-GjrFseOvAWA0CpQ.text: Great place and awesome food! This is in a great location, with good customer service and has outdoor seating for relaxing conversation and food!

IB4ERFT71yKyQPir4m6SiQ.text: A+ for ambience and atmosphere. The outside area at night is BEYOND romantic and gorgeous.. And the inside is just as cool.  I had the salmon Caesar salad which was pretty yummy and oddly filling? Haha Or perhaps I was already full from the absolutely amazing basil/pesto/olive oil spread that was served with our bread. Regardless, it was a good-sized salad.  My fiance had the spinach and veal ravioli which was downright melt-in-your-mouth amazing. While it could've probably been enough for me, he arrived starving so he was still somewhat hungry after finishing his meal in a whopping 5 minutes.  Luckily we had the bread and he had some of my salad but I do have to admit it couldn't have more than maybe 8 ravioli pieces? And for the price, that definitely wasn't enough.. Hence the 4 star rating vs 5 star.  We'll still be back.. I love their patio area and wine selection, maybe this time we'll get an app for my fiance!

6fd3d4tKW4sB5gmPz1c2BA.text: A great night out and a surprise for quality and flavours as we took a recommendation from a server at another restaurant.  Good wine list, well priced - Panther Creek Pinot noir was a hit with the table.  Margarita special hit the spot when we arrived.  Roasted chicken tender and juicy with flavorful sauce, filet mignon was cooked perfectly.   Service prompt, friendly.

K5cOo8xub_ydJJAq1XSprA.text: This place is ok. The portions are a little small and the cocktails are not as great as they sound. A good place to pop in for a quick drink if you're out and about, but I don't think I'd have a full dinner here.

_WucOsP--rTGMRaQnqhAZw.text: Wow from the moment I walked in the door until I left, I was impressed with their customer service and the food. The bartenders really know their cocktails, I would try the margaritas, they are great!!

6_O44_Z48GOj0BNtj6SuLA.text: Management staff is great, Jimmy Rowe is our absolute favorite!!! He is always so helpful and welcoming and makes our experience so incredible! -Ems & Libs & Ali!

JKYZzvRUuXezPReuMZeyxQ.text: What a fantastic place for a girl's night out! The food is delicious and the atmosphere is both lively and private. On weekends they have a DJ.  Their appetizer and small plates selections make for a perfect tapas experience. As far as entrees, the scallops with polenta are amazing. Check out the hummus and bacon wrap dates for appetizers. Looking forward to another fun night at Olive and Ivy!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. My favorite entree!
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Qm3XrLOmmdBll7HYa3aLZw.text: Love the patio! You feel like you are in the middle of a patio in the Mediteranean! Started with happy hour bruchetta's. We got three different ones and they were only $3 each on happy hour. My favorite was the funghi but the fig and procutto and the corizo was really good as well. I got a flat bread that was again mushroom and cheese and arugala. It was good, but a little burnt. And not just "crispy." Actual black burnt edges which the server should have probably noticed and not brought out. I left all the crust but the rest was very flavorful. The server was very nice, didn't rush us and we sat in between appetizers and meals for a little while.   You should call ahead for a table in the evening, we had very limited choices since we didn't but it was nice and relaxing on the patio but not as comforable for a meal, better for drinks and apps. Great location, good food, and good service but it is the atmosphere that I really loved about this place!

UfJY_-gDcE-HY3fb2dBPOg.text: Atmosphere... Environment...ambiance!! It's beautiful!!! Such a chic but comforting place to dine. The menu changes and updates but I had the goat cheese pumpkin ravioli ... Very delicious. Great choice of wines. When I'm in Scottsdale I will def enjoy this restaurant .

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

QhbDsP6QAqd7nRZLaYqh9w.text: Treated  Mom to an early Mother's day celebration at Olive & Ivy. We enjoyed the ambience and decor of the restaurant. Everything is well spread out, so you don't feel isolated, or crammed in at your table. The food was good, and tasted fresh. Our server was efficient, and attentive to us through the whole meal. Over all a GREAT experience.

npkVJ4nl_0KBiiIXCWFDqQ.text: Super service by Josh and delicious food! The outdoor patio space is huge and comfortable; feels like home but without having the clean up after party. Spot on for champagne and light bites.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Oh my GAWD, Josh is the best person in the entire city! No joke!!! He can open champagne like a champion!

99kcrp85Xr_5KOynzkVmnw.text: Formerly, one of my favorite restaurants in Arizona.  In my last visit, I ordered my favorite pasta dish, and was offered a "protein" addition.  I chose scallops-when the waiter asked how many, I said 5, assuming it would be a flat rate.  Boy, was I wrong.  I was charged PER SCALLOP, adding an additional $20 to my entree.  Really???  How do you charge for additional chicken?  And, they were just ok.  If I go back, I will not be suckered into that again.  BUYER BEWARE

5CgnDBqrDJZqRa39WsmxTA.text: One of my favorite restaurants in Old Town! The staff here are absolutely amazing, and I have never had a bad experience! Always friendly, kind, and willing to go above and beyond expectations to provide excellent service! Brandon, Calay, Nick, Amber, Zak, John, Meca, Jake, Stefan, Dan, Zane, Easton, Jeff - YOU GUYS ARE INCREDIBLE! Every time I walk in the door, you guys are like family! (Sorry to anyone I missed!) Been coming here for years and of course the food is always ABOVE & BEYOND just like the service!   All of my friends and family that I bring in always feel so welcomed and rave about the incredible service. Thank you all so much! Olive will always be a top pick for me and anyone visiting from out of town!  Food favs: lamb meatballs, veal & spinach ravioli, chicken pesto flatbread, & mediterranean salad with salmon!

80GdwsaJFcSQcc4dZMgEFg.text: Breakfast review here,  the egg sandwich and the croissants are the best I have ever had!  The peach Bellini is a must have as well. Great patio with misters and right on the canal.

HTMJCfvPa7Rh6KeHOZvfnA.text: The hostess are not efficient with their jobs. Even when you have a reservation they don't respect it. Everything else is great.

85IR4Y87kM-o0eFfbLH6xQ.text: I am amazed how many good restaurants in Tempe/Scottsdale area. Tuesday night and a 35 minute wait, says a lot. Took the chefs table, did not feel sorry. We ordered the #19 and a Moscow mule. I didn,t care for my gin & tonic, but my wife loved the Moscow mule, especially the ginger beer. The Chefs seasonal board was excellent, with the blue cheese and bread as stand outs. After the Chef, board we decided to have  something light. I had a caesar salad with anchovies and my wife a kale salad with grilled chicken. I can tell you there was no doggy bag after dinner. The anchovies were so fresh and salty, i felt i was in Greece. The parmesan  was shaved perfectly and the romaine was very fresh. The service was excellent, even with the place being packed on a Tuesday night. Will visit again

ZE2ndTY-2Pc-nPudVOYXeQ.text: We really enjoyed sharing an appetizer, salad and a flatbread for dinner. Nice wine list. The atmosphere was alive but not noisy. Would definitely recommend

5EFeGGbnVcAz2naqlY5O7A.text: I'm not sure what all the fuss is about.  5 stars?  Maybe out of 10...  Brunch was below average, offering a handful of mediocre breakfast-y things.  There was no yummy French toast, pancakes or even an omelette!  I ordered the eggs benny which was served dry boasting a teaspoon of hollandaise and was extremely underwhelming.    For lack of choice, my mom ordered a tuna salad sandwich for $14.  Really?  What respectable chef even puts a tuna sandwich on a brunch menu! ?  It was my birthday this information was in the reservation comments AND I INFORMED THE HOSTESS.  Not only did my server not acknowledge the day with a complimentary ANYTHING I wasn't even told "Happy Birthday"...  While I'm new to AZ, I know in my foodie heart that there's got to be a better place to dine as this couldn't possibly be "as good as it gets".

HIaWf74qtekB8H6NM1ux9Q.text: My favorite restaurant in the valley!  Always great food, great service, and great location!  Can't beat the atmosphere.  I've only been here for dinner but it's been amazing every time and the wait staff/chefs are willing and ready to do anything we ask with the food.  Best tasting salmon and beet dinner ever!  Update: They somehow got better!  The wait staff went above and beyond for my group this past time and were some of the most accommodating I've ever had.  Love this place!

oXfamXlXm8WVSVGJzsHbzg.text: Butchers Board, Steak Flatbread, and the Bacon Wrapped Pork Tenderloin were incredible. Atmosphere was nice even in the afternoon outside with the misters on and shaded trees next to the water. Worth it.

qYcpIajV9qXhZeH6Fsvmcg.text: While in Phoenix during thanksgiving, my friends and I decided to try this place for lunch. This places is in a cute neighborhood in Scottsdale just overlooking the water. Also, there's a lot of free parking in the garage next to it.  As we were on vacation, I decided to go with a pretty strong drink (whiskey sour smash) during lunch. My friend got the red wine sangria but sadly it did not taste fresh and she switched it with the strawberry and thyme cocktail and that was pretty good. We got the hummus to share and it was very tasty and I got the sweet potato cannelloni for my mains. The pasta was very thin and cooked perfectly and the sweet potato stuffing complimented the buttery sauce extremely well.  I think this place is definitely worth checking out if you like an extensive menu which is diverse and a great place that overlooks the water!!

_h4Q4JZhhRUSSKd4JkZHMQ.text: Olive and Ivy has one of the best patios in Scottsdale! Their servers are always attentive and helpful with wine recommendations. Happy hour deals are well worth it and delicious.

ROlyQtJBosT4vuzArBKVqg.text: Super fun scene! Very extensive menu. Everything we ordered was terrific & the service was on point. Looking forward to trying other offerings on the menu.

OgKKUg3UfyPLP7CyWMrpxg.text: Nice ambiance! Great place for breakfast, lunch and dinner. A great variety of wine and food even though it is pricey

S_0VPvqkyagF0AdSzEk0Yg.text: Ok, the atmosphere here is great, noise is medium, but over all solid ... i has the salmon - cooked perfectly medium - great presentation- friendly authentic staff...  I'm a tough critic too... the calamari veggie app was $13.50 and small, only complaint. Besides that there is something for everyone ...

FfOdmEm0GTCHCf0K50Z6-w.text: Such an amazing cuisine and atmosphere!   Loved the design and vibe there have going. The food is amazing! Definitely recommend a reservation.   Our server was Dan and boy was he awesome. We went with my parents and we was really sweet with my father "jokes" haha.   You have to try the Chiefs Sample Board, it's so yummy and so different combos of flavor. I had the Natural Chicken for dinner as it's Gluten Free. (That's another bonus, there is Vegetarian & Gluten Free options available)   My dad called ahead and order a Gluten Free Dessert and it was fantastic. I definitely recommend this place and I can't wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Gluten Free Birthday Dessert with a Casa Azul Tequila Shot ordered by my father.
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Natural Chicken (Gluten Free)
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Eighteen Dollar Margarita.

tSw_01wGWjrJk7-wbACrpQ.text: Review is for breakfast. I can not believe how cheap it is in the land of the 20 dollar breakfast joints these days. I was also surprised how good the food is. I am not much of a Breakfast gal but the toast and sausage and potatoes are really delish! The breakfast special is only 6 bucks. Can't beat that deal. The patio is animal friendly. The only negative was that it took a very long time to get our food.

sNgHEcp8AHUewmUs9WUgtg.text: Excellent place for a business dinner. Good food, varied selections. Professional service. I had the bone in rib eye and it was awesome. Too big to finish. The appetizers were also very good. Not too heavy.

OSxIgH4qR4UiXid61vvJOA.text: Our valentines date started wonderfully. Mike was our server and went over every question we had in incredible detail. Super impressed with the environment the quality of the food and the overall hospitality aspect. This is a store which keeps aspiring to top the best from the service to the cuisine techniques they employ. Great date, we will be back here soon for another wonderful evening to make more memories.

BCts_mxnvfbYjgJC6cIPQg.text: Mediterranean salad, sweet potato canoli and chocolate cake. Everything was good. The canoli was different but I tend to like savory. It felt like a desert. I tried the salmon and it was good as well. Salad was lightly dressed and it was good.

nkbEG7yiJxOpUE5L9-EtjA.text: My favorite restaurant in town. I like the appetizers a lot, salmon is very good. I like chocolate bar as dessert. Inside and outside is very clean and great atmosphere

yBKV4Z19UEPexJa8gBAWBg.text: I had this restaurant bookmarked and finally got to try it. It did not disappoint. Our server was friendly and did not rush us. The restaurant has a great selection of wines and gives generous pours. My husband and I tried the bacon wrapped dates and the funghi and prosciutto/fig bruschettas. Both appetizers were really tasty and fresh but I loved the bacon wrapped dates the most. The complimentary focaccia with pesto sauce was also great! The pesto was especially good.   My husband had the chopped chicken salad and loved it. It was very hearty. I was debating between two of the flatbreads to try, and our server offered to do half and half for me. I tried the prosciutto crudo and the funghi trifolati and it was hard to pick a favorite. Both were very flavorful and perfect. My husband also really liked the Bloody Mary mix, which they make in house.  Everything about our experience was great and the prices were so reasonable for all the food we ordered! I will be sure to come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Half prosciutto crudo and half funghi trifolati flatbread

or7NE6Ih3H-uFs4bn8SPsw.text: we happened upon Olive & Ivy while touring scottsdale yesterday, and needed a lunch spot quick (we love to eat, and when we get together, its basically an eating festival).  we took a look at the menu and decided to go for the cheaper option of the counter service were i got a $7 salad of mixed greens, two cherry tomatoes and an ice cream scoop of tuna.  it was okay. it did the trick.  my friend ate a curry chicken pita which looked excellent and which she enjoyed.    our server/cashier girl was very nice and suggested a drink that my friend tried and liked. and she was quick with the service, so all in all, a good experience. i wouldn't particularly call this place mediterranean, but it's definitely targeting rich people who care about having 8 different brands of bottled water to choose from.

-qARVFDCAIpQ3GnzVKqlEA.text: I hate to leave a bad review because I really like the decor and feel of this place. I have been here three times in the past year and I am just not crazy about the new menu. My husband had the lasagna last night and could not eat it. It looked like it had been reheated for three days in a row. He is actually sick with some kind of stomach virus today and I am thinking about calling the restaurant. I had the flatbread and it was not near as good as my last visit here 3 months ago. I probably won't return. For the price there are much better restaurants in the area.

kl1jPMOV0zPeGY3yCD69Qw.text: Nice place with a great patio area. I really liked the creativeness of the menu and the overall styling of the bistro.  The combination of the classic and contemporary is very evident at Olive and Ivy.  I would recommended this to anyone looking for an upscale setting but still wanting to be relaxed.  I like to enjoy a nice mojito out on the waterfront. Very nice in the hot Arizona heat. AHHHHH

USEWyaZlIjKcv-ndiV3o8g.text: Solid lunch spot, a little on the pricey side but classy enough to be ok.

Vogq5SzE3EHz8jjpOhugsg.text: Amazing Interior and food- CANNOT SAY THAT about SERVICE! HORRIBLE SERVICE almost every time we have gone there- We had to flag people every time to get food, drinks- anything- ONE waitress quit and went home and NO one took over her section- (US)- But food is good- and inside gets better service than the outside-   If you want Amazing ALL- Go to Sanctuary resort- Elements restaurant-  Been to many times- A++++ every time!   4th time there- STILL HORRIBLE......sheesh ...service, service, service!!!! Food is fine- interior great- PLEASE UP-TUNE THE SERVICE!!!!!!!!not enough wait staff and very snooty hostesses... baby...I am wearing good, hot swag...dont look me up and down just cause you got walmart clothes on... :)

cPBNZ5VgHxBAA14ba1rFjQ.text: The food is amazing, why can't they fix the service?  ...and yet, I keep returning to torture my guests and me.  One would think that at 3:00 in the afternoon, there would be no issues.  We had a business meeting and decided to sit on the patio which was, despite being a perfect day in the valley, empty.  Once seated, it took 25 minutes for 3 ice teas, another 30 minutes for the prosciutto and chevre flat bread (which, oops, had no chevre), and another 30 minutes for the bill.  Our business meeting was only an hour in an attempt to avoid rush hour traffic home...we failed miserably at the task.  Anyway, Olive and Ivy still receives 4 stars from me because of their food and ambiance.  Just be prepared to wait and be served something you didn't order.  Sam Fox, fix this place before you open another.

v0MiNyBjHVywRybB-nEKSQ.text: A friend and I decided to go to Olive and Ivy's happy hour on Friday. It was a warm day but we still sat on the patio and it was perfect with the misters and shaded trees. They offer great HH prices half off sangria pitchers, apps, flat breads and signature cocktails. We ordered the red sangria and it was delicious. We liked how it wasn't jammed full with chunks of fruit we felt we got more for our money. We ordered the antipasti plate that we were pleased with as well as the artichoke hearts. This was served with a salad that I thought was a nice touch. The service was friendly and attentive.

KzHetdR5TVd2PvQ4ggCyLg.text: It's typical nouveau-riche Scottsdale scene. Yes it's lovely and big, and yes that's how they do it there...I have to agree with sarah k...push the culinary and cocktail envelope, I know they have the talent... do something with it....the servers are all very young and beautiful, maybe they just need to learn more about customer service. Mine was very attentive, no complaints on that. All in all it's a "nice" place, nothin special.

l-44B6jUt5OXQvcze0u7kw.text: My husband took me here for my 30th birthday! YAH! I was not disappointed! I thought the decor here was out of this world and it takes so much talent to design like this....As some of you are food snobs I am a food and ambiance snob. We had the pita chips and hummus to start which was so good. A great feature added to the hummus was cucumbers which added a nice crunch. I also enjoyed tomato bisque soup which was out of this world. I think the waiter we had was nice but did not seem to have much of a personality which I do look for in my dining experience. I would go back here but not too soon as I have a whole list of places I would like to try now that I just moved here!

aCmSZlM80LFqUbSUJdov-Q.text: I typically go to Olive and Ivy often. I even had my bridal shower at the restaurant in October. My friend wanted to eat here on her birthday which was on Valentine's Day. She had made a reservation for 5 people. Our server Bart was very nice, however, Heather, one of the managers, was EXTREMELY rude. She came over and she said that she had a reservation that had been waiting for 30 minutes for our table on the patio. This happened less than five minutes after our gelato and drinks had hit the table. I still had a full glass and half of the dessert left (that took over 15 minutes after ordering to be brought to the table). All 5 of us are in the industry, so we are all pretty understanding and we know how stressful it can be, but we would never speak to anyone how Heather spoke to us. She then went on to blame the late joiners, which was my husband and I. She was inconsiderate, loud and disrespectful. I told her we will leave as soon as we are finished with our drinks and desserts. At this point, we still haven't even received our split checks! She stood against the wall and stared at us for about five minutes and came over again with a male manager and said "Like I said before, I need your table." (WHILE I HAD MY MOUTH COMPLETELY FULL OF FOOD.) We were all shocked in disbelief and completely embarrassed while other people at surrounding tables stared at the ordeal taking place. We asked to speak to the general manager and Heather would not budge until I had to demand to speak to the general manager. When the general manager Kim came over, we expressed our concerns about Heather's attitude. Kim went on to tell us that this reservation had been waiting over an hour for the table (when five minutes before that Heather said 30) and that they were busy, which is a good problem to have. One of our friends mentioned to Kim that we wouldn't have minded if we were completely finished or if they offered to move us to another table inside. We told the manager this and SHE STILL DIDN'T OFFER TO! We had planned to stay and drink more but we decided to spend our money elsewhere. The server even came by and felt the need to apologize for both of the managers poor reaction to the situation. As we got up and walked through the inside of the restaurant there were over 6 tables open. Needless to say, We will not be going back to this restaurant anytime soon. The staff has always been so friendly but there is extremely poor management. I left Olive and Ivy feeling embarrassed and disrespected, not how you want to feel after celebrating a friends birthday.

UWu8Jas4ivezUIkrcTmz7w.text: Great atmosphere, even better food. The fig and apple bruschetta were both fantastic, and the filet of beef was cooked to perfection. The wife didn't really like her gnocchi, but this is my review, not her's, so 5 stars it is.

zMybJWFtbBrOZ3pC-CsrAA.text: Just had an amazing meal here. I had the salmon and my husband  had the sweet potato ravioli which was to die for. The service was great  and the outdoor seating added to the experience. Our waitress, Alexandria was a doll.  I would definitely go back.

uxRNbXyw2vp7KkDT2NyF7A.text: I was immediately impressed with how stylish Olive and Ivy was, and then shortly thereafter completely let down by the food.   I was in a large group that had convened for lunch there, and the consensus was a resounding "Bleh." I ordered some raviolis that weren't bad to the taste, but three or four average sized raviolis aren't gonna do much for a brother who wants to leave somewhere not hungry anymore.   As soon as we left I was already looking for a second lunch spot. I have a big appetite, in fairness, but if you're paying eight or nine or ten bucks for a plate, it shouldn't feel like "pre-eating."

DMwrHcdTYO_ymRP7y02Mqg.text: Whenever I have a friend in from out of town I take them here. Visually the restaurant is really attractive and feels comfortable. The people watching is fun and it's near fantastic shopping. Anything I've ever ordered here has been really great.  The 'cafe' in the front is good too, if you're in a hurry...even for breakfast.

f-YoWU-tOBXf2yJIqLtB8w.text: Seriously love this restaurant.  The bread they bring you with the basil pesto is amazing!  I could make a meal of that alone!  Great cocktails that offer combinations of liquors you wouldn't expect but they taste delicious. Their small plates are so uniquely done and meld such awesome flavors with the freshest ingredients.  The salads are some of the best I've experienced and the flatbreads are delicious as well.  The huge outdoor patio is so tastefully done - you feel like you are at your own comfortable outdoor abode.  I have to give a shout out to Tommy, our waiter on 10/28/14 who was the BEST!  He said he was going to "take care of us and feed us" and with his suggestions and help with choosing our small plates - he hit a home run!  His sensational personality and wit were all it took to send our memorable evening over the top.  Been patronizing this place ever since I first learned of it several years ago and hope to be for a long time to come.

lm95M8TNZOoxf8obxzUaBQ.text: We came here in February, so the outdoor patio was lovely. The service was decent but a little slow. The appetizers were good - we especially enjoyed the brushetta selection and the bacon-wrapped dates. The lamb meatballs were pretty bland and tasteless though. We were with a large group so there were a variety of things ordered. However, I ordered the tuna and it was too salty. I didn't enjoy the flavor at all. My husband ordered the gnocchi, and while it was pretty tasty (although a little too rich for me) - it was a TINY portion and he ended up finishing up the bread to have a whole meal. For the price, the general consensus was that most meals were too small. Someone else had the chicken though, and that was good. The desserts were good overall, but again not great. Most of us had a scoop of sorbet, and for the price ($1.75) that seemed a good deal and just enough to finish the meal. The table also ordered the ice cream bar and while it was tasty it was also rock-hard and difficult to cut even with the steak knife they provided. Overall this place is decent but I would imagine that Scottsdale has better options.

b7ibXJ8W9BYb-x1xqsgH9A.text: I liked this place... it is owned by the same person that owns sauce, bloom and the green house...   I love the dining room... they have nice loungy couches that make it a private dinner... i can not complain about my meal (or the meals of my dinner mates)... none of us knew what to get so we asked the server what her favorites were... we ended up getting 3 of the 5... we had the scallops, ravioli and some sort of meat... all of them i would get again... check it out... it has not been opened long

10mhgRWmfaul4I7OTmEcCw.text: This was my 3rd time here, so I knew what to expect.  there were 3 of us women & we went for lunch on a Wed.  We were seated immediately & given menus & water.  But no drink order was taken.  When our waiter arrived - same thing - he brought bread & pesto - after being asked.  But didn't ask for a drink order.  Brought out the bread - still no order.  Came back out & took our food order, but...you get the idea.  We shared the 3-bruchetta combo which was fresh & tasty.  I had the chopped chicken salad which was just OK.  Too much dressing on it which overpowered the tender chicken & the yummy, crunchy peanut granola on top.  The table was cleared & cleaned but we were never offered dessert or cookies, pastries, gelato, etc.  Our waiter kindly split our tab 3 ways...which would have been much bigger...had he ever offered us drinks or dessert.  Decent food but if I want average, offhand serivce, I can stay in Chandler & go to Chili's and spent a lot less $$$.

qBvjwABaA3gYYh5tEmIgnw.text: Came here for restaurant week a couple weeks ago. I usually enjoy Fox restaurants, but for some reason had never come here before. For a starter I had the mini tuna tacos, which I thought were great. The taco shell was really crunchy which went very well with the texture of the tuna.  My entree was the bacon wrapped pork tenderloin. The bacon had a lot of taste, but wasn't overpowering and went well with the pork. It had a bbq sauce that had the right amount of sweet to it. What really made the entree excellent was the side dish. It was sweet corn with roasted peppers and tomatoes. It was great! Best part of the meal by far, and that shouldn't take away from anything else, it was just that good.  One reason I love restaurant week is that I get a dessert with my meal, which I usually don't ever order. I ordered peanut butter chocolate torte...so good. It came with a small scoop of peanut butter ice cream. A perfect way to end a good meal.

7HuEIrvwftUmStpBChx22w.text: I love this place. Atmosphere and their ridiculously pricey drinks. food is great and it is a fun place to come with friends and grab drinks and be social.

KQWcT4QqRVwddzw9XpD1sw.text: Really good breakfast, super good. I get the standard bacon, eggs and potatoes. They sub the toast for berries, and boy are they delicious. Super crispy and fresh. Eggs are to order ( over easy for me) bacon is generous and potatoes just right, not overdone. All for 8 bucks. Top spot in my book!

vJokomdnfSaVpItwP16Lgg.text: Great patio. Food was very good. Had the beet salad and the fungi flatbread

gh9rzhtbaBUWBT6rvjRhNA.text: I've been here a couple times and it's always on point. The wife had the pork tenderloin, I had the tuna. Both were fantastic.

pw-r_e8t_Y4s14QzWm8BLA.text: Stopped in after shopping for a drink and snack.  What a great place good food and wine. Our server Marissa made the visit great!!!

lhzUNFmRFQsYH3WrgUlWgA.text: After discussing for a while different cuisines  and restaurants in Phoenix area, our niece's friend suggested olive&ivy for dinner. we made the reservation and found the restaurant after circling the shopping center couple of times (restaurant not visible from the street) we parked in the public parking and walked in the restaurant. As soon as we walked in we were awed, beautiful, spacey modern decor. we dined in the patio and it is beautiful there right by the canal, all the strings of lights felt like Christmas time. Ot was absolutely a delightful ambience.  Now unfortunately I have to comment about the food which needs much to be desired.  The appetizer, bruschetta, were ok, salad was pretty good but the main dishes were  disappointing.My spicy shrimp risotto was unflavorful, the risotto was like a paste and the shrimps had no taste. My niece ordered scallops and they had no taste either. same thing with the chicken dish my brother-in-law ordered and the sea bass my daughter had. We ordered lemon tres leches cake for dessert and unfortunately the have no idea what tres leches cake should taste like. it was too lemony and dry (it should be really moist with 3 kinds of milk). over all 5 stars for the decor and ambience, 2 star for the food, and 4 star for the waitress who was very knowledgeable and attentive and  patient. So it was mixed feeling but the sad thing is this restaurant has the potential to get 5 stars if they only improve their food quality. Oh, I forgot, my brother-in-law loved his entree (scotch with soda), no complaints from him.

FRmjKApK77aix_4IbjrAAA.text: Later. Wow. If the mood is right, or maybe even if it is not, this place is right.  Sweet potato cannelloni with roasted mushrooms and toasted almonds.  Like having a healthy dessert for lunch.  Wow.  Got one to go for later on at home.  It was that tasty.  Also artichoke appetizer, bruschetta, all very strong.  4 to 4 and 1/2 stars.  Open-air decor, eat inside or out next to "waterfront canal" (CAP water that people used to water-ski on decades ago, towed by a pick-up truck).  Not to detract from the review, but this is "desert-rat style waterfront" all dressed up in Scottsdale fashion - but that is the city's doing, not Fox's or Olive & Ivy's.  The restaurant decor and atmosphere are great.  Highly recommended.

iYL2PfOyvpUwLg7P5SegyQ.text: Really nice place and good food. Happy hour is really good just a little weird the patio division for happy hour and non happy hour. And yes regular section had a more better service as far as attention. I enjoy my self just wish services was a little more attentive I got the wrong bill for my table and then my to go meal was giving to another table. but over all is a nice spot.

NjjOgiMDqWkrg7yKt63fOQ.text: This place is super cool and hip. I love the patio and the food and service was good.

Td7JcQmugt4730FiB1LOEQ.text: Hands down one of my favorite places in scottsdale! from the atmosphere, to the service to the food. never have any complaints .. well accept their menu varies depending on the time of day... but besides that, I'm there twice a week!

6FchmPB9o6wmsmU65pPa9Q.text: I was disappointed in Olive and Ivy. I ordered the chicken salad and about halfway through I noticed that there was not any chicken in it. I was eating at the bar and mentioned it to the bar tender and she just seemed to shrug it off. She did not offer to bring me a new one or at least some chicken.

deZ9UNebVl1DGumEgtbwuQ.text: We were lucky to secure a reservation for a private room to celebrate our daughter's graduation (ASU!) at this fabulous restaurant!  The banquet coordinator was excellent and worked closely with us throughout the planning process. Her suggestions were spot on and resulted in some of the highlights of the evening.  Even after the party got underway we were able to make some significant changes and the coordinator and staff were gracious and accommodating.  Our service that evening was beyond our expectations and the food was truly divine.  I can't say enough good things about our experience.  Just wish I kept a list of all the names of the terrific folks that helped make our party a complete success!  Don't hesitate to book a special event or dinner at Olive & Ivy. Be sure to order any of their flatbreads, their amazing scallops, and/or their tender steaks.  And don't miss their antipasti...the best presentation and so delicious!

TyXOUy-iU-19RoAA9pxphA.text: Love this restaurant. The food is always amazing and nothing disappoints. I will drive out of my way to get the mediteranian salad with cold chicken and the bread/pesto app.

I5iysh-Ha1J9PkK-cJViLA.text: First of all I must say the Ambiance is amazing the place has a great vibe and the crowd is great. Although it might feel as if your wallet will be empty as u walk in I must say that the food is very well priced. The staff is very helpful and sweet and the food is delicious. This probably my new favorite place to dine

krUrI7r8cJsNIVzDQLVDnQ.text: I enjoyed my Saturday evening at Olive & Ivy's outdoor patio.  Food, wine, location are ok to me.  I will definitely go back to this place and will enjoy wine and great food at outside patio.

OBPCDQ59OvRAANQS7dsR0w.text: This place is wonderful. Great service. Very nice staff. Food was great. Highly recommend the filet and also the lamb meatballs as well.  Only thing is considering this place has a whole room just for wine the fact that they don't carry a single moscato was disappointing.

wDeCb6-ua8W3jXQlXfOl0Q.text: I was in Phoenix for a business trip recently and enjoyed a dinner here on Saturday, 5/20/17; in short, it was fabulous!  There were three of us, and we were seated in a half round booth with a view of the terrace/patio.  It's clean, modern and the service was fantastic; our server was knowledgeable and his smile was genuine, and since this was our first time there we all had questions which he answered cheerfully.  We started with the Humus plate, and the Humas is made from scratch (as is their bread and pasta) and it was the best I've ever had.  Never had scratch made pita before this, and what a difference!  One gal had the Mushroom Ravioli which she was thrilled with, my other companion had the Sea Bass which she adored.  I had the Shrimp Scampi Risotto; the shrimp was tender and perfectly cooked, and Risotto was creamy, delicious and melted in my mouth!!  Even their Iced Tea was wonderful!!!  The only negative is that it's a bit loud and hard to hear each other which made us all raise our voices.  If you're anywhere near Scottsdale, you have to go to Olive & Ivy!!!

tLCQemJjGH4F1AhIsLeV7A.text: Not a fan.  The food was good, but it only had 9 bites total in my bowl.  I ate 4 rations of bread to fill up and used the sauce from my pasta.  Scottsdale prices, McDonald's dollar menu portions. Walk across the street and go to The Herb Box.

NtusVPC0wLEsg2A2XzcVnA.text: Very cool place! Our party of 4 sat outside. What a terrific outdoor space they have there. The inside was just as lovely. Really cool decor with incredible lighting. The service was impeccable too. All the food was delicious, although the portions were a bit small for the price. Two of us had seafood, and the other two had pasta. We had enjoyed some wine and cheese before coming here so we didn't order any appetizers. We saw someone else with the bruschetta trio and it looked really good. We definitely plan to return on our next visit to Scottsdale!

osctqYZS0dUL6Mpb97BDTQ.text: This was the pertect end to a great night.  The atmosphere is lively and the appetizers were great.  The service was excellent and I loved everything from the small beet salad to the variety of bruschetta.    I will definitely return on a future visit to Scottsdale.

SxtrlPiPeg9wYI5FfaYeFg.text: This is a very nice looking restaurant...but it is in Scottsdale so I expect nothing less in term of appearance and decor.  My friends and I dine outside on a nice day in May so we could still tolerate the weather despite flies hovering over our table because we had the smoked salmon and halibut.    I heard about Olive & Ivy so so I was expecting superb dishes but it could be what we ordered because it certainly did not meet my expectations.    Smoked Salmon flatbread- I highly reccommend the flatbreads because it is delicious!  You know what else is delicious? Their homemade bread with pesto dip!!!!   I can eat this ALL DAY!   Marinated Hanger Certified Angus Beef Steak- it was ok, nothing really special about this dish.  Alaskan Halibut - this dish did not stand out at all. Cavatelli Pasta- this was a disappointment, I ask the waiter for suggestion and this was what he suggested.  Maybe i'm not a Cavatelli fan, but it was like eating dough with minimal spiced ground pork.   Go ahead and try- see if you agree with me?   So go for the atmosphere, drinks, and bread! :)  I highly reccommend that!    If you dine outside- you can see a little canal running through- so it is river side like dining.  Boojie ;)

SdHwRaMEnvvjbE1232n7CQ.text: Wonderful place for lunch/brunch. They were very accommodating with my active 2-year-old and got his food out within 10 minutes. The food was all excellent and the service was perfect. We will definitely be back soon!

xjZzPClmFnLRVEk1XgxHSQ.text: Came here for a desert date and to get a couple drinks, we got the sorbet (they make it fresh daily so ask what flavors they have, this time they had lemon and strawberry) YUM it was amazing, it was very refreshing and light ans not to overpowering. I had one of their sangrias and boy was it sure powerful, kinda on the pricy side but that's okay it was expected. The customer service wasn't great the hostess was pretty rude and had an attitude when asking us where we wanted to sit and our waiter was pretty foul too...look I know we aren't eating a full meal but a lot of people WONT jip you on a tip if you are helpful be a dbag  get a dbag tip..coming from someone who knows how the tip system works I won't be the one to dock you money for us nit ordering a full meal..get over it.   So do I recommend here:YES (didn't try regular food but desert won me over that I will go try it again.)  I hope that maybe they both were just having a bad day otherwise I hope you don't get the service we did.

9iaYVEwOXy9XtvRhpYdecw.text: Excellent!  First, we were seated on the patio in 107 degree temps. Misters and shade made it completely pleasant!  Then...,Bruschetta, Greek salad, shrimp risotto, sea bass ... and this ridiculous lemon cake - everything was delicious!  Highly recommend.

MeJcSMvAerku-HD-eXiClg.text: Went by this place after having dinner at a nearby restaurant and doing a short strolls. Very busy but the patio caught my eye. Told my husband "let's come here for breakfast tomorrow." Always want to try as many restaurants when visiting a new place as possible.   Good choice. Sat on the awesome patio, quiet yet nice ambience. Our waiter was funny, timely and polite. My French toast was to die for.  Regular French toast then sprinkled with sugar and cinnamon served with berry compote. Didn't even use the maple syrup.  Loved it.

sobcsf1mp2O3xQwPZiW-XQ.text: My fiance and I had a romantic evening here for Valentine's weekend and I loved every moment of our experience. The mood, the customer service, the cocktails and the food! Nicole D. was our sever and she recommended sooo many delicious things! We had the sweet potato cannelloni- so phenominal and unique, and the chicken scallopini (again- amaze!!!) Such a lovely night and we can't wait to come back!!!!

hNriZRT8jlHeB7m3edgxQQ.text: The atmosphere is awesome - beautiful! Food is very good but not great. Service can be a tad slow since there's a lot of real estate to cover - it's a very large restaurant. Parking can be challenging so allow time during peak hours.

wzCNilOefCMp9WHk_yFzeQ.text: Olive and Ivy has become our favorite weekend dinner spot! The people and food are both amazing! We love the happy smiles and great service that we get every time.  I advise calling in a week ahead (or more) of when you are planning on coming because they fill up fast. If you aren't able to get a table we always love to sit at the bar or on the smalls bar couches around it. I strongly suggest ordering the bruschetta and the lamb meatballs! For dessert my favorite is their cheesecake. There is a new flavor everytime. But honestly everything I've had there has been amazing and Olive and Ivy is definitely one of my favorite restaurants!

TDFzTQW7mmTvcD7oH2nv9Q.text: I absolutely love this restaurant- it's one of my favs! The kid serving icecream in the grocery area is a total jerk though. Had I not been to olive & ivy before, and enjoyed my experience every single time previously, he would have truly put a damper on my experience. I let him know how rude he was & he suddenly told me that English was hard for him, since he was from Switzerland- when he had been speaking crystal clear (and perfectly rude) English up until then. Regardless, management should be aware of his Unprofessionalism and attitude.

RCTI3ER13tyjNOAa5XuLRg.text: Sat at the bar for happy hour- the bartender was super attentive. Sangria was delicious and food was great!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Flatbread/bruschetta/hummus/sangria

jzc4yuDsrgLVEg_w3dTx-Q.text: Eggs Benedict:  meh - kinda dry biscuit, potatoes were tasteless and strangely uniformely sized cubes Latte:  good  Nice space and service was good.  Maybe come back, maybe not.

zcoXhX9E6pxW-kX5vLh2tw.text: Service was spot on with Christopher. Big eye tuna was seared perfectly, and tasted fresh and delicious. It was served on a bed of slightly crunchy (undercooked?) couscous, however.   Hummus had a nice kick to it and enjoyed the warm artichoke hearts on arugula.   The patio is delightful except for one weird element: bathroom air fresheners nailed to tree trunks made the patio smell vaguely like a public bathroom. That made one conscious of the slight fishy smell from the canal and, maybe a little trash smell wafted through?  Not overwhelming but certainly mildly off-putting.

dS_lnEJRX70r_2VzuIVF5g.text: I absolutely love the patio at Olive and Ivy.  It's the perfect spot on the canal for a glass of wine and bruschetta. The ambience here is great, the staff is friendly, and their homemade bread and pesto dip is soooo addicting.  One of our favorite Scottsdale spots!

Vvi90M-6_ioCor5GmRX6UA.text: Olive & ivy it's one of my favorite breakfast restaurant and dinner. I went there once for lunch and I didn't really like the lunch menu.  I'm in love with their ribeye stake and sweet potato cannoli  Good service nice decoration even their silverware are commutable Highly recommend

vv0gnKjXHTrHQpPz7Abuuw.text: Love this place, one of my favorites but I have noticed it isn't always consistent with the excellent taste.  over all the atmosphere is top notch!! sit on the patio if you can! great service always! recommend making reservations :)

GQfZcgcASWG6IzJLz4kn8Q.text: A definite favourite. Incredible food (in particular the sweet potato cannelloni), perfect atmosphere, wonderful service, and probably my favourite outdoor patio to date. It's great for all occasions whether it's date night or dinner with the girls. Highly recommend this place - I rarely give 5 stars. I've been here multiple times and have never had a bad experience.

gANYeXxg4xg9Ef8ZCdievQ.text: Very Hipster with prices to match.Tried scallops for the first time- they were okay.  Tried 4 of the appetizers, bacon wrapped dates were decent, felt they could have been warmer.  There were a caucophany of flavors that were trying just a little too hard.  I did try the chicken scallopini, which is probably what I would order if i came back.

O040gzhd7lpn-nkK9eqE3g.text: Drinks were so good!! Sat outside on the patio. Open seating on the patio outside and it was really pleasant. We loved the whiskey sour mash, Bloody Mary, and Bellini. Service was great also, Jael was really attentive!! Awesome Sunday drink spot!!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Whiskey sour mash
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bloody Mary
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Brunch menu

1o887XHLr1oCoNq4vtmI_g.text: This place is still going strong after all these years.  The decor is beautiful and the bar area is a fun place to hang out.  This last visit I just had a cup of coffee and an  OK butter or olive oil cake for dessert.

hGMULnjsu775R3tujkOnTA.text: Walking into Olive & Ivy, I knew I was going to love it. The ambiance is trendy with high ceilings, unique fixturing, and a large patio.   The menu is gluten free friendly, with notations on the primary menu. To start we got the hummus with veggies. The hummus was not too creamy and not too oily. It came with cucumbers, tomatoes, and onions on top. We really enjoyed it.   For my dinner, I got the sea scallops with sweet polenta and Brussel sprouts. The scallops were perfectly cooked and the polenta was a sweet and flavorful addition. It was a pretty light and flavorful dish.   I would definitely come back if I'm in the area. The menu has many healthy options to try!

BLkfKMv5Z5BAMBv7uf2HBw.text: Had a great business lunch there and would absolutely recommend Olive & Ivy!!  Loved the atmosphere, decor, food and most of all the service.  Our server Mark was attentive, without being obnoxious.  They serve bread with their own Pesto sauce as their version of bread/butter, it was delicious.  I had their Gyro Sandwich with a light salad and it was flavorful.  Wish I would have sat in the patio area, but was concerned that it was still too cool.  Went out afterwards to check it out, and would highly recommend it.  The interior decor is definitely inviting as well, but with the great Phoenix Spring weather the patio should be great option.  Enjoy everyone!!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Love the atmosphere!
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Gorgeous patio!

QvnH_NCmZWBnAYCthMtKzQ.text: We took my parents here for dinner on the water.  The table we had was right next to the water and the temperature was perfect outside.  The waiter was knowledgeable and very attentive.  The Strawberry Thyme drink was good but very earthy.  The Mediterranean Salad was amazing for dinner.  For dessert I recommend the Peanut Butter Mousse, Delicious!  Very pleased and will definitely be going back again!

KC2J2GbN-vvi4fYZdHXLDw.text: I recently visited Olive and Ivy and had a lot to say about our experience! Check it out in my recent blog post: thebloghasspoken.com/201....

cIsQNr0V1VP6XmSet7UchQ.text: Everyone knows Olive & Ivy has the best patio in the area! Even in the summer heat I like to sit out for the views and the people watching is excellent! I love their brunch menu for the eggs Benedict (I'm obsessed) and I've always heard that the smoked salmon bagel is great as well. Drinks are always good- I prefer their whiskey sour smash personally. They also have a decent wine list including some of my favorite budget Napa wines (Tangley Oaks Merlot for one example). The atmosphere is always trendy without being pretentious and it's a great date spot!

GzFeijXx_G8-Z1HIB8L1zg.text: Love this place!!  Amazing food, design and atmosphere.  Had a perfect birthday dinner tonight for the GF.  Bread with pesto to start, bacon wrapped dates, Sangaria to drink and Lasagna/Pasta entries... All perfect!  Thank you guys!!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Thank you guys!!

pT1t8vfteQEOj-EA0aL-yw.text: Beautiful decor and ambiance. The bruschettas were a pleasant surprise. Waiter was friendly, knowledgeable and quick.

Hs_1oCbbI_I0Gx6Bl_ii7Q.text: Great-tasting restaurant- if not one of the best at which I've ever dined. My group of ~15 was able to sit in the private dining room with the beautiful round table- perfect little room with warm, romantic lighting. Our server greeted us enthusiastically as we entered, and never wavered in service the entire meal.  We were fortunate to be eating during Restaurant Week- most of us chose that menu since the rest of the menu was a bit pricy. Because I'd done my research beforehand, I had a decent idea of what I wanted to order. I'd never even had a date before but selected the wrapped dates! Absolutely delicious. My second course was the scallops, and I wish I could've finished it, but I had to save space for dessert. The apple spiced desert was one of the best variations of apple pie I'd ever eaten, all in a cute little serving jar. If I had to give Olive & Ivy room for improvement, it would be the drink specials. Not sure if the few I had were worth the $10-15 price tag/per.

kPg1DLgSL_Yr1MnX2dwR6w.text: This was our first time visiting Arizona. We ate at Olive and Ivy twice while we were here. The food is excellent and the service was top notch!   Our waiter and manager, Marc Anthony was the best! He rolled out the red carpet for us and gave us recommendations for the rest of the week.   We will be back! I highly recommend this place! A+

9iNNa7orzpfj8-AyP8gaZg.text: Parents cane in from cali to visit and them here.   All of ours first time coming to olive and ivy and we were left speechless. This place is perfect from the second you walk in.  The decor, the ambience and the location alone make it a place to go to. The staff was helpful and the food came out quick. The food was phenomenal the bruchetta to the pasta to the seafood, all a must have.

wu6OwC5_PlDlB1FKiH3FvQ.text: Lovely upscale niche to lounge outside while enjoying a cocktail, desert and conversation. If you came solo, the community spaces are wonderful for meeting new people!

QV2Gb-bmWnvwBOHTf_VZTw.text: Great location along the river, food was very good and portions were good.  All food was specially prepared while you waited.  The bar area was right beside the dining tables.  The people there were a little loud causing us to speak louder while eating in the dining area . It was a little distracting, but not bad. Still very nice place,  and I highly recommend it. Our server was Angelo. He made us feel welcome and paid attention to us while we were there. The Marriott Courtyard Concierge recommended it as a nice place for a sit down dinner.

gTdTkCMXmfZb6k3qMlelaw.text: Super cool ambience! Noise level pretty high so not great for a quiet, romantic dinner. Food was good as well as the service. Kitchen made a mistake on one of the entrees and immediately credited our bill. Would definitely go back!

yNn-wXCge83xB2ieVSKoHw.text: This place is my fav. Brunch or dinner...great food. My favorite is the spicy shrimp risotto! They provide the best bread with amazing pesto dip. The patio is right along the water, yet the ambiance in the dining room is delightful. Staff is always friendly- I've never had bad service and I go often.  Must check it out!!

pN9CqOiabSZ5_HCqHa7EcA.text: Amazing! This place easily became my favorite restaurant. Very enjoyable whether I'm there to get gelato after shopping, on a date night, or sitting on the patio for lunch. The food and the staff are amazing. I've brought about 4 people to this place, each of them loved it as well.  My last visit was the best. I was surprised to see they have a Dj on Friday nights. It was a nice touch to the atmosphere. My waitress was very knowledgeable and even split our entrees without us even asking for it. We ordered the scallops and lasagna! Both choices I recommend.   Very clean Great service Entertaining atmosphere AMAZING appetizers and entrees

5LP5Ka5n88KdhrA_S9QJNg.text: This place has amazing decor which creates the perfect ambiance. Very hipster but classy at the same time. The place is big enough for large parties.  I really like the bruschetta on their menu. It's $11 for3 bruschetta and you can choose from the 6/7 they have on the menu. Try the FRESH MOZZARELLA , ROASTED BRUSSELS SPROUT, or the  PROSCIUTTO & FIG. In addition, I got the MUSHROOM PAPPARDELLE which wasn't too bad.   Wish I came here for brunch because I hear great things about it. I definitely would recommend this place!

CIlthYgCWfsmnSKiJD5sxw.text: The location and vibe in this place are great. The patron is lovely along the canal. Go for drinks and really enjoy yourselves. But I have been consistently disappointed by the food. Oily pasta dishes, lackluster flavors. Sorry that I cannot recommend this place for food. I do check it out every once in a while, but my last time was a few years ago. So, take this review with a grain of salt, but don't blame me if the food isn't up to your standards.

aXlQ_GLsK-bvvJ9DAVwd1A.text: Loved it! Brandon was wonderful on bar. Creative,  friendly,  patient.  Server was fantastic,  very knowledgeable,  able to make suggestions. Seabass salmon and ahi were amazing.... as was the gelato. We had a great time, party of 5.

Fd9iOp09UV9uDk0d7xd3Nw.text: The food, service, and ambiance was great.  Came here on a recommendation from a sales guy at Neimans, and it did not disappoint.  Will definitely come back the next time im in Scottsdale.

x6vvnrtR1mQtQ-xKHm7wMw.text: O&I at the Waterfront is a very nice restaurant. Their patio has recently even refurbished and is a great place to hang when the weather is nice. The place is very near Scottsdale Fashion Square so the atmosphere is a bit more upscale, but still approachable- I've been here in jeans & a t shirt many times! It's one of my top 5 fav places for weekend brunch - they have $5 mimosas!! And I like that you get to pick your ratios of champagne to OJ as they do them table-side! The restaurant is very large and get a bit noisy at peak times but is a cool vibe! Also good for large crowds and groups dining!

ldMSJ8sTFfdfLgSPdL83ag.text: Decent food and good service for the happy hour on the patio. Lamb meatballs were the best

DmIAvcen54M71MEBwIpuAA.text: I have a soft spot for Olive and Ivy just because I have had a fantastic time here, every time I have come. With my fiance, girl friends, and solo when I'm taking myself out to a fancy date :P. The ambiance is everything- I really like the music, the lighting, the decor. They have a nice bar with two TVs,and across from it,little community tables which are all open seating. The restaurant is quite large and there's plenty of seating inside and outside as well. The view whilst sitting outside is really pretty- they often have lights, you can see the bridge and canal, etc. The crowd is all ages- I love that everyone dresses up and makes an effort- whether it's families with toddlers, first dates or a group of friends. On weekends I think they have a DJ. I typically always get the all natural chicken and lamb meatballs- they're delicious. I've tried the flatbreads, and other chicken (can't remember the name) those were all good too. Their deserts change but all have been really delicious. The wine selection is ok, beer not so much, but the cocktails are pretty tasty. They also have a bakery/market at the other end with gelato. The bathrooms are always clean and the service is good. My only complaint is that they've started being a little stingy on their portions- dining in and take away. The wine pour is also small! But overall, still my top few places in Scottsdale.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. hmm well the all natural chicken was &#34;all gone&#34; but that&#39;s because it was that tasty :P
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The bar
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lamb meatballs

kzsdAqIdcMJNNNJFK9bkow.text: We came here for Christmas Eve and it was delicious! I am Gluten Free and their pork was delicious. My husband had the ravioli and his only complaint was that the serving size wasn't quite large enough and he ended up eating some of my meal as well. Everything seemed really fresh and the drinks were also great! We sat outside (at 8 PM on a December evening) and the heaters and fires were plenty to keep us warm! Our dessert was also SO good. Overall, a great experience and we will be back for more. Our server was great as well!

lZS-lEkuqgpMs4R2GdoHSg.text: Great spot with amazing food. Tried 3 different types of bruschetta and all were delicious. Outdoor seating is super nice with fountains. Excellent staff.

nI2nI9AuCDSclUS9S3y40w.text: I came to Olive & Ivy on Memorial Day and it was a wonderful experience! I was really feeling wine, so I started with a glass of the resiling. Don't get me wrong it was really good, but after trying my friend's sangria I could't help but wish I had gotten it! Safe to say, I will be getting it the next time I come in.... So yummy.   Please note: if you've never been to Olive & Ivy, the one thing you HAVE to ask for is the bread and their fresh made pesto. It will change your life - I swear! It pairs so wonderfully with all the other entrees and a glass of wine! For my entree, I ordered the veal ravioli. I will say... For the price, I was a little disappointed in the portion size. But it was so tasty it didn't matter much to me! It's smothered in this buttery sauce with parmesan. INSANELY good, people! Our server was also great in every way! Come to Olive & Ivy for any occasion!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Veal ravioli

D0MHBU0-oOwEv7OrSDr2sg.text: Great service, great food. 10/10 fully recommend. She's espensif but she is worth it.

lGUn2XFfiPX6y7ahR9yg-Q.text: This place is perfect for brunch and dinner but if you're looking for a nice brunch spot with great prices and not insane wait times, go here. It doesn't open until 10 on the weekend so there is usually a short wait because every other Scottsdale native is waiting 40 minutes for breakfast club or some long line down the street. I highly recommend their mimosas ($6) they're huge and they actually fill your glass with good champagne, not just orange juice. The Mediterranean salad is my favorite dish and their hummus is my favorite starter. If you're looking for a quick breakfast, check out their market next door! Dinner is a bit more expensive and I don't recommend the paella only Because the rice was undercooked last time that I was there. Park at Nordstrom's lot across the street.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mediterranean salad with chicken

pYV2yYESamy7l1984AhJBQ.text: I have been here 5 times and I have never been disappointed. The bread and pesto is to die for. I had the chicken salad this time.  Very nice and a large portion. My favorite is the bruschetta, sadly it wasn't on the weekend brunch/lunch menu so I will have to return on a weekday. The ambiance and location is very nice. Service is always great.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken Salad

kZh8A32NT4C41WLoNnf58A.text: Bartenders only help women with fake tits, and if you have your wallet on the bar. I'm very well off and was disregarded because I didn't fit the bill.

3kolemNeyE6W2xgncq6Ivw.text: This may be one of my favorite late breakfast spots for a Saturday morning. The outdoor patio makes me feel like I'm on vacation. The pesto and bread at the beginning is a great way to start. I also love the mimosas, breakfast sandwich with potatoes on the side and a cinnamon roll to split. If it's too hot to sit outdoors, I love sitting up at the bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast sandwich split with mom and a mimosa. Delish!

Td3Ob2RlryrrhWbw1C8B2w.text: Does Sam Fox make a bad restaurant? This is my favorite place for dinner/drink in Scottsdale. Dinner is to die for, happy hour specials are awesome, staff is attentive and knowledgeable, the atmosphere is incredible. What more can you ask for? The place sets a precedent other restaurants should strive to follow.

Zc0vTBRyIdb7sVdyQRJXdA.text: This is one of our favorite restaurant in Scottsdale. Everytime we went here, we had a awesome time. Their food is one of the top class. I only had one bad service when our server disappeared for a while. Considering we visit here more than 20times, it is just small mistake. It is well over-priced but the quality is excellent. The indoor and outdoor seats r also very great. They even have small room that accomodate 20 plus people. If u want to try many things out, come after 5pm so that u can enjoy many delicious main dishes. Personally, i love their steak. Will be back soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ox2kAyFruCvfDPNFtBxTCw.text: Nine of us gals ate here on Saturday night this past MDW and.... WE.ABSOLUTELY.LOVED.IT!!  Our server (ugh!! I can't believe I forgot his name) was AMAZING! He took such great care of us, never once let a water glass go empty, made sure our cocktails kept coming, and paid close attention to our few friends with food allergies. We all enjoyed the appetizers, our mains, and dessert. I can't remember what everyone else ordered... but I do recall ordering the artichoke hearts, lamb meatballs, and bacon wrapped dates to start with.  Did we enjoy them?   Uh - yah... I would say so as there wasn't a crumb left on the plates, haha. For my main, I ordered the shrimp scampi risotto.  Those who know me well, know that I love risotto so ordering this dish was no surprise.  Plus, I needed to eat something hearty that would soak up the alcohol once we entered Scottsdale's "entertainment district", lol! Anyway... I really enjoyed my dish and have no complaints.  I would definitely return to Olive & Ivy the next time I'm in Scottsdale.  We all had a wonderfully delicious time here!

uAFcgcGnV-Ck5R08pDpdcA.text: No joke, I was floored by the food here!!! I had a sweet potato / butternut squash pasta of some sort and it was phenomenal! Not to mention THE BRUSCHETTA!!! WOW!!! That IS THE BEST IVE EVER HAD!!!! 10/10!!!

7_QgSHG542_vORTMSoJaJA.text: Food was very good and server always on top of things. When we are in town we will be back for sure and sit on patio next time. This is a very busy place so make reservations.

uYVve6b6BPWLiA09siDBXg.text: This is definitely one of my favorite restaurants to have lunch with friends. The food and the service is outstanding!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Atlantic Salmon - crispy, a little sweet, and perfect for a birthday lunch

6aaOqfHVq9Ja0xfD91H7Bw.text: Went with my friend on a Sunday night. It was really easy to make a reservation on their website through Open Table the night before, but we didn't even need one. The place is huge, and we were seated right away.  The service was beyond 5 stars. The server was very nice and attentive. Food came out very timely and they kept filling our water even though we stayed there for a while to chat. They never complained or seemed like they were pushing us out. On top of all that, the waiter brought us 2 separate checks without us even asking!  I got the scallops and I was obsessed with every part of the dish. Some of the best food I've had in a while.  Would highly, highly recommend!

jqabGOo3xUiTbAD2LRGJ7g.text: This place is super fun - great vibe, high ceilings, grand bar, a HUGE open patio over looking the river. We had a private event with about 30 people, and they seated us in a private room in the back. At the end of the night, we moved to the patio where there were several fire pits and a gelato bar in the back. I mean, what else could you ask for..??!

S1ISOT8APLBW8FYBgyJlIQ.text: I don't live in this area, but my brother and his girlfriend do. My parents had visited and they all came here for dinner. Ever since they raved highly of this place and made it a must try when we came to visit.  We called the day before to reserve a table. When we arrived we were immediately sat at our all ready table. Our server was nice throughout the dinner. We started with a mozzarella appetizer and the bacon wrapped dates. Both were so satisfying. We loved the bacon wrapped dates so much we ordered a second plate of them. We ordered a bottle of the Riesling Champagne which was very smooth. Easy to sip and offered so many taste elements.   I ordered the chicken scallopini. It was lightly breaded and cooked perfectly. The chicken laid on top of a bed of flavored spinach which complimented the chicken nicely. My girls both got the mac n cheese which was very cheesy and perfect for both my girls. My hubby ordered the sea scallops which is definitely out of his normal ordering. My dad raved about it so he got it and said it was the best scallops he has ever had. They were really good! They knew how to perfectly season and cook them.  Their complimentary bread was a hit as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sea scallops

eWaO3xYvIxxn0M5JUQ71zA.text: If you're in Scottsdale with a big group you should book a table at Olive & Ivy. We were in town for a bachelorette weekend and came for dinner on Saturday night. It was my favorite part of the weekend! The atmosphere is fun and upbeat and the restaurant itself is beautiful! We had a reservation and were seated in a corner of the patio immediately on arrival.  The servers were attentive but not overbearing. They gave us free lemon drop shots for the group at the end of our meal in honor of the bachelorette!  The food and drinks were good - we tried every bruschetta for the table! My favorites were the prosciutto, manchego, and avocado! I got the shrimp risotto for my meal and it was delicious but a little heavy. My strawberry and thyme cocktail was very refreshing without being too sweet.  I would definitely recommend this restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Strawberry &amp; thyme cocktail
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Shrimp risotto!

pZXmR1ro5axQgzh3hIMR1Q.text: The food was soooooo good!!!! I had a margarita flatbread! Delicious!!!! The servers were also really nice and the place had a really good mood

LNEEgIx-wRZSpKhXuX2LXw.text: [RESERVATION] I had been meaning to go here for a while. However, when I came with my parents for dinner, the hostess told us the restaurant would have an opening two hours later. When I came here with friends, some time later, they told us the same thing. Long story short, you should make a reservation. I was able to get a table for a Sunday night when I called two days before having dinner with my family.  I don't think the Olive and Ivy sign does the restaurant justice, because it makes it seem like the usual casual, chain restaurant. However, the inside is great (just a tad too dimly lit). There are jars with lights in them hanging down from the ceiling and a view of the river(?)/creek next to the restaurant. It is kind of loud as well.  [APPETIZERS] We were served complimentary homemade focaccia bread and pesto sauce. For appetizers, we ordered "Choose 3 for $11" bruschetta and Kale Salad [$11]. The butternut squash was my favorite. The prosciutto and fig was also very good. The amount that they give you for the salad is pretty filling. I think this is good to share because I feel like I would become bored with it if I just ordered that for myself.  [ENTREES] The Prosciutto and Marscarpone Tortelli [$16] doesn't look well put together. I was actually disappointed by the presentation when it first came out because it doesn't look like it will taste good. However, it tastes amazing. The sauce used in this dish is great to dip bread in.  My brother ordered the Bacon Wrapped Pork Tenderloin [$24], which was amazing. I don't usually order pork because I fear it will be tough and not flavorful, but the bacon definitely was a great addition. I don't know what they did to the brussels sprouts but whatever bad taste they left in your mouth the last time you decided to give them a chance will go away once you try these.   Shrimp Risotto [$25] was good - my dad really liked it. I'm just not much of a risotto person - I think that's what I'm starting to realize about myself. But if risotto is what you like, then you won't be dissatisfied.   My mom ordered the Pacific Sea Bass (I think). I thought the presentation for this was well done.  [DESSERTS] Desserts I would suggest that you get elsewhere. I mean, they were okay, but nothing amazing. We ordered the bread pudding(?) that comes with a scoop of ice cream and lemon blueberry cake.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bacon Wrapped Pork Tenderloin [$24]
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lemon blueberry cake

GeWPJg8CmP2WJj94SQeEFQ.text: Stopped in for some champagne after shopping. The ambiance was on point, the bar was well stocked and huge. Bartenders were nice and knowledgeable. On the pricey side..so prepare yourself. 2ppl, 2 appetizers and 2 rounds of drinks..almost $100

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Strawberry ginger margarita..Super tasty

xwAHoj3beGfphCVoRSc5HA.text: Olive & Ivy has certainly become my favorite brunch place over the last few months since I discovered it.   Brunch is a super great price, you will not break the bank eating brunch here. They don't have any drink specials for brunch, but it doesn't matter, because you should be drinking one of their fantastic lattes anyways!!! I highly recommend the cinnamon roll late!   The food is amazing! Everything is from scratch! I love the focaccia & pesto they bring out before the meal.   The service is great, non-intrusive & attentive at the same time.   Admittedly I haven't been here for lunch or dinner...yet, but I will look forward to the experience.

ntAsiNLcfajBPodkQy2CMA.text: You definitely need a reservation to get a table at this restaurant anytime after 6 o'clock on the weekends... In fact, even the weekdays -that's only because this place is so fabulous and so delicious! My favorite dish here is the butternut Squash ravioli or they have some of the best salads I've ever tried! Being a college student, this is definitely a meal I have to prepare for in terms of pricing. It's a nice dinner meal and it is worth every penny - but I'm not eating it every week, that's for sure!! A perfect place for a birthday dinner or date night. I will be eating here again!!

DRqMa1JSmEBKI8m0C04lFA.text: Cool Atmosphere, Good Service, OK Flavors, High Price For Serving Sizes..   So we decided to. check this place out last minute for a little treat thinking it was the same as IVY down in Chandler. We got there to realize this is a different place.  atmosphere is cool, and the location is nice. Overall vibe is good.   We ordered One of the flatbreads and it was good, but kind of high priced for the almost nothing that was on it...   We ordered next the 3 piece bruschetta and were surprised at how small the serving size was. The salmon lox was more of a patte/paste rather than tasty salmon on top. It was not bad, but its only a couple tiny bites and it is gone. We order this type of food often and there is usually a bit more for serving size.   The complimentary bread and pesto is the best part as it is actually DELICIOUS!
