But nobody every brought us refills for it so most of the tasty goodness was lost to the garbage due to no more bread....   All in all there is nothing exceptional about our experience here other than the atmosphere. Meager portions of the bruschetta are pretty unappealing and the flatbread just didn't have much going on...

BjqtRx3qwJ9Ph0g523SMrw.text: Olive & Ivy is everything a brunch spot should be.   Elegant, relaxed, refined, and outdoorsy. Brunch in the outdoors is just a necessity!  The BF and I got a late start on our Saturday. We became Scottsdale wanderers and became lost in the shiny retail-roads of old town.   Eventually we found our way to the canal, only made obvious by my recent Yelp excursion to a nearby eatery.   We took in the noon-time sights: art, people, etc. I perused Yelp for a decent late lunch and O&I was top of the list. With the gorgeous canal views I can see how it would be!  We ventured near and requested an outdoor table. Unfortunately our table was Also a favorite hangout for a local bird (apparently a protected bird). My BF and the bird became instAnt mates - much to his dismay. A few encounters later we were ushered to another table. FYI we named the bird Pippy (aka Poopy).   The views and weather were fantastic. Roughly 75* and breezy we could not have asked for better weather. The art installation at the canal made for an even better view.   Our cocktails were fantastic. A Fig mule for me and a apple/jalapeno margarita for him. With just the right blend of flavors and alcohol we were pleased. Plus the price was right (or maybe that's our SoCalroots showing).   I had the salad - which after reading a local CM's review I wish I would have ordered the warm chicken. The BF has the Tuna sandwich, which was a tad lackluster.   My salad had hefty amounts of bleu cheese which is always appreciated, but I do wish the choice of warm chicken versus cold was made more apparent.   We also ordered desert - lemon pudding cake. I found myself enjoying it, however not loving it. I did, however enjoy my fresh espresso - even thought it was received after we had finished dessert. Graciously, the server removed the espresso from the bill. Thank you for that!  I would not hesitate to visit O&I again as the atmosphere and service are five stars in itself.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lemon pudding cake
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Apple jalapeño margarita

rJ0H3JmemFc96mL6yokWPw.text: Came here on a first date and it couldn't have been more perfect. Great great food and beautiful ambience. The service was exceptional as well!

-sS6z1TY-NPTyH-ubw9nJg.text: Well... I've been sitting at the bar for about 10 minutes with no service, and no greeting for the hosts stand, the servers, or a bartender. I've been here before and received great service, and I've been here with worse service. The food is delicious if you don't mind it being served warm (not hot), but I have to give a five star to their drink menu. The fig mule is to die for and the strawberry ginger margarita is one of my favorites ever!  The hostesses are rude and very inexperienced as far as I can tell -- it'd be nice to get a smile and a "hello" at a restaurant of this quality!

OC2osdhzQwd23wVcIRrPWA.text: I love this place! I typically walk the canal with my pup and stop in for a cold brew and the two egg breakfast. The patio is gorgeous and overlooks the canal in Old Town Scottsdale. The service is always great and very attentive. Awesome spot for mimosas and brunch with some friends on the weekend!

sdGPcryg0L2q43JVlA2ZMQ.text: I've been coming to Olive and Ivy for many years and it's never disappointing. The food is so delicious and the staff is always professional and hospitable. Our waitress Brittany, was very accommodating to everything I asked for! Thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Menu

Ni-4ycQwK_MPN_-q_cOcFQ.text: Ahh Olive & Ivy how I love thee!  This has become a regular spot for my best friend and I. The decor is on point and the food is delicious! It's in a prime location and they also have event spaces great for small parties. We even considered having our small wedding party reception dinner here but the the parentals wanted something bigger ;)   Great service and good food. I would definitely recommend!

QssmxtV0mxc2m6omi__k8A.text: Great location on the river.  Food was excellent, had the salmon and their peanut butter mousse for desert.  Service was excellent.

1syJEXvYJ6N0oALn_6BAFw.text: I came here for lunch with my mother and we had the most amazing experience! We sat on the patio which was such a pleasant environment. The serve was great and the food outstanding. Their complimentary bread and pesto dip is so delicious to start with. We also got flatbread and the Melo salad - both fresh and (believe it or not) refreshing!  A little pricey so I can't come too often, but will be back for special occasions!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

x9hUHwt-xvIx8J6PyDlV8g.text: The best filet I've ever had! Great atmosphere in a really nice location! Staff is very good and present well.

FvHSj2wEEIodzCX0NxBGQg.text: Love olive and ivy!! Highly recommended! Great menu and drink menu. Beautiful atmosphere and very professional and helpful staff. Always have a wonderful time when we dine here. The food is super tasty. I recommend the arugula and beet salad, and the mushroom pasta. Everything is very fresh

JCNYI2UU4Rrsu5QYztG4wA.text: Even though I've been here a couple times, this time was definitely my favorite. The ambiance is the perfect setting for a fun catch up dinner or a romantic night out. You can never go wrong with the bruschetta. I'm a sucker for salmon lux so that is certainly my favorite, but I was pleasantly surprised by the asparagus! It was the perfect amount of crunch. I went for a light meal with the beet salad, but I also tried the sea bass which was simple incredibly. Cooked to perfection, it melted in my mouth! Ended the night with strawberry shortcake, my favorite on the menu. Solid food and setting.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

qjopJXyJ6MUrCIIQXcCdmA.text: So I just got back to LA from Scottsdale, was there for a friends bachelor party. And me being me, IM HUNGRY. So I checked this place out from the yelp reviews and moved our squad there. And, MY GAWD IT WAS AMAZING.   This place was so freaking good we came for both brunch and dinner. The bomb!!!  Ok dinner I ordered the scallops and bruschetta. Excellent. Brunch I split with others and got the breakfast burrito, cinnamon roll latte and cinnamon roll french toast, shortrib flatbread. My lorddddd  Best way I can relate this to people is if you've ever had republique in LA, this is scottsdales republique. Which basically is an amazing compliment. A MUST GO. TOP 20 restaurant of my life

VLGil8TsSgNBjxB4Cs5gAA.text: Super long wait for our party of 6. We took a seat near the bar area and had drinks and appetizers until a table opened up. Overall the appetizers were great, but our dinner entrees were too salty for half of our group. Our servers were pretty great though and treated the birthday girl in our group to a dessert of her choice at the end of the night.

-xEbcpB9qjc5-Q9Jik6pBQ.text: Beautifully decorated with a awesome vibe in the atmosphere. Bathrooms are even amazing! Tons of different seating available in a few different sections. Great food and drink selection. You can see the cooks in one of the sections make your food. It really adds to the experience. Great restaurant, fairly priced, amazing atmosphere, highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

s6cofK0Vs_fdFce7DSF3Qg.text: Ended up here on a Saturday night after we had no reservations for dinner. Lucky to find 2 spots at the bar, people are nice enough to move over one. Another shared friend dinner. Let's just say this was a lot of food, brought home leftovers.  Bruschetta trio - prosciutto, sweet potato and Manchego. My favorite was the sweet potato, loved it with the crispy brussel sprouts. Next up a split kale salad, which was huge split!  This salad alone is a meal for sure. And then had the sea bass. Delish!  Very flavorful. Took home some olive oil cake. Topped it all off with a bottle of Rose. Great ambience here, very energetic.

i4RH1ZppVhj-y1StSZBKlw.text: Typical Italian eatery.  Nothing to brag about.  Happy hour bites are average and drinks are standard.  I wouldn't really say it's the best place to go but for food but the atmosphere is great.  Any seat you take is fun and inviting.  Open seating outside by the water is relaxing and so is the seating inside the giant space that they have.  The service can be a bit slow when it gets busy.  Overall might be a spot to stop after shopping or a glass of wine between walking around the area.

uc-bkvW0geH42cql3C9FZA.text: I love this place!! it's good for groups or for intimate dates as well. I particularly loveeeeee the patio!! it's right on the waterfront with all the lights and fountains so this is one of my to-go places for romantic dates. their food's very good too and wine list isn't bad either. I haven't had anything there that i was disappointed at. Definitely will be keep going back!

dbVPy2QVJvAIt8gmyZymsg.text: Nice restaurant on the canal, but very busy. My wife's salad was excellent. The brunch menu was limited so I had a burger and fries. Only three stars cause I expected better.

7QvYLqoHHOEvCGhz4MnadQ.text: Love this place. Flatbread pizzas are excellent as was the Mediteranian salad. Pesto flatbread was my fav of the 3 we tried.  We had the ice cream bar but will have the gelato next time.

xGRKXRsUA49fxCNsEgj6lw.text: Beautiful ambiance, wonderful service, decent wine list, and flavorful dishes.  The salmon and mashed potatoes are to die for!  There sangria is also very good... this is one of the few places I have found that doesn't over-sugar or water down the drink. Solid choice for a romantic date or to catch up with friends.   Our favorite waiter remembers to bring out separate dishes for the pesto dip (delish!).  It really is the little things that make a place stand out!  Only downside is the drink orders can take +10 minutes.  If you are in a hurry don't eat here.  Live a little, relax, and enjoy the meal.  It is worth the wait!

CyVVM6RduqHBdFliaIqx-g.text: 3rd time here in as many years. This has become a regular stop during our Spring Training visits. Love the location. We have sat outside which I prefer but this visit we were inside in a booth however the entire from of the dining area opens to the outside. Service was excellent and attentive. We ended up with 4 different dishes between my girlfriend and I. We started with bacon wrapped dates, good! Then the beet salad which had a wonderful variety of flavors. We shared a piccante flatbread which was great. Finally we had the mushroom Tortelli just because we had already ordered it. Despite being full from the previous items it was still fantastic. We shared a fairly cheap bottle of wine though they have a fairly large list to choose from. Thoroughly enjoyed the meal and the venue. Easy reservations and had great service.

7Y9GvtOZ1oAUzpGInfgzPA.text: Bruschetta and drinks are good. Food is definitely mediocre. I would only go here for happy hour. Not worth full price. Service ok.

VX4IGQuUGB4CC9io1mbKFA.text: Maybe I'm a little partial because I helped open the coffee/gelato area way back when but after a few years hiatus, I'm glad to say Olive & Ivy is still spot on, if not, better.   My family & I came here for my birthday dinner & the hostesses were friendly and had no problem seating my mother & I even though the rest of the party wasn't with us (I know that some places are really finicky about that so it was nice to just be seated with no hassle).   Our waitress was great from the get go. Her name was Andrea I believe? She was very friendly without being too over the top & paid attention to details even going so far as to offer to have my niece & nephew's spoon & fork that they have with them whenever they go out rinsed off in the back (I know of places far less nice than Olive & Ivy who wouldn't even do that so it was major points).  We started off with the hummus with veggies that had a kick to it...pretty damn good. The bread with pesto is ah-mazing!! I probably (definitely) should have refrained from having as much as I did as I was stuffed by the time my meal arrived. After the hummus, I had the half portion of the beet salad with goat cheese and pistachios...pretty solid trio of ingredients on top of the arugula and it was yummy!  Following that, I ordered the flatbread; half Margherita half prosciutto/egg/potato and while I wasn't sure how that latter half would taste, it was good. I'm a sucker for prosciutto and theirs is no joke! I couldn't finish it (surprise surprise) but I still ordered desert...it's my birthday, what better day to treat yourself?! The ice cream bar that's been previously mentioned is SO good...coffee ice cream with marshmellow and a chocolate coating with some peanut butter thrown in for good measure.   I have to say, as well, that the cappuccino was amazing   Well done, O & I. I will definitely return sooner for happy hour!

izvSVtaDEOstAaAUM0PC2Q.text: Great food, excellent service, reasonable prices, convenient parking. Don't forget a scoop of gelato for dessert.

rwTdXTHBLCMuG2-sveHZPw.text: Went here for the first time with my boyfriend for our anniversary. The inside is really beautiful and the outdoor patio is incredible. I will definitely be back when the weather cools down to enjoy some food out there. There had a dj that Saturday evening which I really liked, he kept the vibe inside the restaurant light and fun. The food was delicious and they gave us a complimentary dessert for a special occasion. They even let us pick from the dessert menu ourselves instead of giving us a chocolate something like most restaurants do. You don't have to spend a lot of money here but also you can very easily spend a lot of money here. I would definitely come back on a regular evening, not just a special occasion.

yj57jZRTLPdJrxM5ieQ8RA.text: 3.5 stars - overall pleased, would adopt as a happy hr. standby, rated downward b/c food was decent, not raveworthy. Quite pleasantly surprised to discover this airy, spacious resto-lounge in Scottsdale Fashion Sq. Stopped in during happy hr. on a Thursday, decent mix of patrons. Overall space is versatile and occasion-friendly, great alfresco feel as giant oak doors were opened to the outdoor patio. Lounge is perfect for small parties with low couches and leather sofa chair seating. Great happy hr. specials (M-F 4-6pm) $5 small plates, well drinks, house wine, sangria. Prosciutto bruschetta w/crescenza cheese, arugula & fig preserves was perfectly balanced. Italian sausage flatbread w/pequillo peppers & goat cheese - the peppers and goat cheese made this flatbread, the sausage was overly crumbled and didn't add much flavor. The cheese plate was fine - a mild blue and a mild Spanish cheese, plated with thinly sliced apples, marinated in a fruit jam. Apparently, they're serving a $20 3-course prix-fixe w/several interesting options through 10/31. Menu here: foxrc.com/downloads/menu... Cons: White (pink) sangria was prettily presented sugar-rimmed, but served sans fruit (odd). Have had much better sangria. Service was spotty but potentially b/c bartender was doubling as our server, other servers ended up busing our table and were helpful. Look forward to checking out other Fox concepts True Food Kitchen and Zinburger.

RXB2TUY0G6Z0PBbe94Lm-A.text: My girlfriend suggested that we come here for brunch and I'm glad we did. The whole layout of the restaurant is nice and they did a great job with the decor.  It was a bit odd starting with bread and pesto and then eating breakfast but that's what you get when you sit down and the pesto was just so good! As for my meal, I had the french toast which came with delicious compote and warm syrup. This was probably the best french toast I've ever had that wasn't home made. Add a side of crispy applewood smoked bacon and I was in heaven. If I only come back to Olive & Ivy for brunch I'll be happy but I hope to make it back for lunch or dinner sometime as well.

eTzC2aOMzbFEotU3LdcXgg.text: Yummy food! Beautiful atmosphere. Don't miss the pesto and bread and my two favorites which are big enough to split the Mediterranean salad with chicken and the sweet potato cannelloni! Literally olive and ivy is the best. Oh and while the weather is beautiful sit on the patio

rcMVEXzVcgxpI_SSED9_JQ.text: Have been to Olive and Ivy in Scottsdale twice now; both times when visiting my daughter who lives here.  It is in a great location, near the Fashion  Square mall and old-town Scottsdale, and right on the river, where you can sit outside.  Incredibly comfortable seating outside, and it is pretty well shaded, so you are out of the Arizona sun mostly.   This time was for lunch, and the three of us enjoyed a chopped salad, a mediterranean salad, and a chicken grinder.  There were no complaints. The service was fast, friendly and professional.  It is a good be if you are in that neighborhood!

wFhU7VyR6QtC9Vf2CQss9g.text: Food was so good and so was the service.  We came here for lunch today and sat on the patio.  It was relaxing and fun. I had the lamb gyro and my husband had the pesto flatbread.  Both were tasty!

80w0HhfoJED159W-6XBgVw.text: Had a great lunch with some friends and the food was wonderful! Our waiter was Mark Anthony, made our experience that more enjoyable. Martins were nice... They need to step it up in this area. They could learn a few more twist on different ways to serve up a really great Martini by Venturing out side the box... Food was wonderful. Everything was cooked from scratch... From the flat breads, to the Turkey grinder. My Mediterranean salad was ok, not the best and could have used more ingredients (dated, currents, chicken, curry, other spices to take it to the next level). The restaurant sits on the river so the ambiance was nice...  They still need some work in the creativity department. They own many other restaurants through out AZ and rest of the  Country. Maybe they should think about hiring me as a consultant to kick it up to the next level.... If there was my creativity then just the standard mix of food, I would have given it more stars. $5 dollars for s tiny piece of bruschetta with, cheese prosciutto and they forgot the fig jam was a bit much. Messed up the drink order... But the experience was pleasurable. The waiter did his best, but they others fell short... The mixologist behind the bar could use some more experience and should learn to kick it up a notch... Chef as well. May be too many balls in the air that they are trying to juggle!

hROgsdyHKMq2fr47t_Etpg.text: I love this place! They have a gluten free menu which is great for those allergic, super convenient. I eat here all the time!

x2RkMxVuPhPI3eRAot8cKg.text: This place had amazingly good food and service! We went there Saturday night and had an amazing experience from the start to the end. We made reservations a week in advance and highly recommend doing it otherwise you most likely will have to wait.

C0W5gpzl7sh4diJFWu51XA.text: Loved the large industrial feel, open kitchen, seated in a nice tall-backed booth onlooking the kitchen and bar. (Patio closed due to rain) Tried 6 different food items from apps to entrees and everything was really good. Favorites being prosciutto/fig bruschetta and the veal tortelli. The peach whisky drink was delicious too. Really can't wait to try the rest of the menu... Busy for a Tuesday night so you know they're doing something right.

MJEdbh9aHcm-XZYbRaK6Fg.text: I hadn't been here in ages - delicious food, great atmosphere and excellent service from Zach F..  He had great recommendations and was very attentive to my table's needs without being annoying.  I will definitely be back soon!!

N1jmvuo_Zn94LAVEhpDbHA.text: Good food, good happy hour.  Kinda of a trendy see and be scene Scottsdale place.  I do enjoy their patio on the canal.

T9V4uoiLWez2FFkQqazUNg.text: The good the bad and the ugly.... good: the wine-nice selection and the manager  was very knowledgeable, though the waitress knew nothing about wine, the tuna was cooked perfectly, and the pesto was amazing. the DJ is a nice addition and the outside seating is great. bad: the waitress was not very good, she seemed a bit lost and uninterested. the meals are very small. ugly:  the cous cous was not cooked all the way-it was crunchy and I couldn't eat it, the chicken was burnt, they offered us dessert to make up for it, but I just wanted a good meal-again, the waitress didn't know what to do or didn't care. Overpriced and very LOUD.  They have a little side deli/market where we go for delicious gelato and will continue to go but we will not go to the restaraunt again.

s5Ww766NI_XTMAVrWSwKPw.text: I hate it that I love it....Fox Restaurants are taking over, but this place is great. The bread and pesto are amazing. I have never ordered something that I didnt like. The prices more than fair for the quality of service and deliciousness of the food.

wvrykt4iQjp7rb_CcJGo2g.text: Loved this place! It was our anniversary and they did not disappoint. The calamari/shrimp appetizer was the best I've had. I had the goat cheese tortelli pasta and my boyfriend had the steak and they were both delicious. The steak was a little on the expensive side but worth it. Patio is a nice atmosphere and the cocktails are unique and delicious. Overall we were both impressed, and my boyfriend is very picky! And the bread and pesto is great too.

u3qgkDGdK5jaYx-HKSEJuA.text: This place does everything right. We had to wait for a table, no problem! The large outdoor patio has waitresses. You can  come for the drinks but you will stay for the food. Both meals I have had here rank among the greatest I have eaten anywhere. My wife, who has different taste than I, agrees. The dessert we ordered was amazing as well.   It is fancy here and you are treated like it. Excellent place.

eaDLozhSwVD-ThSelB52fw.text: Had a Sunday dinner here and I love Olive & Ivy every single time i go.  Our waitress, Tess, was very nice and attentive. I love the Hummus!!!! Its a little on the spicy side and oh so delicious. Th patio is perfection, so check this place out. The ambiance is amazing and perfect for a date too. Happy Dinning

BPBKRUM_QYG4fhc7qRnp-w.text: I have only ever eaten the breakfast (egg and avocado sandwich) and pastries (cupcakes and bear claws) here, and both are very good!! The staff is very friendly and efficient.

0WBHODvCMuVcK2h7ITZVCA.text: I went here tonight for my boyfriend's birthday (11/11/11). First let me say the five star rating was for our waitress Andrea. She was amazing. The atmosphere was great...a little loud but died down after 11pm.  Andrea was very prompt, polite, and quick to make recommendations (which were all great). I asked if they could make a chicken alfredo dinner because I didn't see it on the menu and they were more than happy to accommodate, making the alfredo fresh! At the end of dinner I asked Andrea if she could do something for my boyfriend's birthday and without question she quickly brought a strawberry shortcake to the table. Tasted amazing and she even comped the price of dessert. If it weren't for Andrea I'd have given a 4 star review only because it was slightly pricey.  Overall food and  atmosphere were great, but the service was exceptional! Thanks Andrea for making our night special!

L90bTCYZ9lJe-HEr73TsZA.text: Arrived on a Sunday around 1PM about a month ago and was promptly seated in the dining area.  If you prefer, you can also visit their connected take out area.  Service excellent, although on a Sunday there were several screaming children and very loud large groups, but that's expected when you eat out so can't complain too much.  If you are a fan of pesto, you will be pleasantly surprised to taste the complimentary pesto w/warm, fresh bread.  I could have just ate that all afternoon! Delicious!  I ordered tomato bisque which was the absolute best tomato bisque ever!  If I were in the area I might try this place again, although there are so many other nice restaurants in the area I've yet to try that I'd probably opt for one of those.

SlLPpM6r0Lq_wES8p_eSYg.text: Hands down the BEST place to be in Scottsdale morning, noon and night!   Flat bread pizza is to die for, the Mediterranean salad is delicious and the wine takes the cake!  I love Olive & Ivy!

rBGDo5jh4VKME7x5pJXE5g.text: This was one of my best dining experiences in Scottsdale .It is in a great location  directly across the street from Fashion Square and on the Scottsdale Canal  which is a wonderful place to walk after dinner .The service was very good , we were seated almost immediately as we had a reservation . The server explained that everything is made in house .I was with my wife and 27 yr. old son .My wife had salmon cooked exactly how she wanted it , both my son and I had a pasta dish and a appy . The deserts were all $5 and I had Neapolitan ice cream cake which was one of my favourite desert I have ever had . . All in all an eatery you should definitely pencil in on your next trip to the Valley of the sun

2P5kX4dUMitP-fK5N8S2Fw.text: I think I got unlucky.  The atmosphere is great, and the menu sounds amazing from all the reviews.  I went on a Saturday night and got a great booth.  The bread was delicious, as all the reviews state.  I ordered the bacon wrapped dates and the veal ravioli.  The bacon wrapped dates didn't really have much flavor to it.  The texture was great - crispy bacon around a soft, chewy date...but there needs to be some sort of sauce with this to bring out the flavors of the dates.  The veal ravioli was a fail - twice.  The first time they brought it out, the center of the ravioli was cold!  The sauce was warm and quite delicious.  I sent it back, (service was extremely polite), and when it came back, the food was hot, but the pasta shell of the ravioli was undercooked and hard.  I didn't want to send it back a 2nd time, so I just ate it.  The drinks were good - I had a pitcher of white sangria, and some wine.

6sLgYJ-ttLtn7PFi872dIA.text: Over priced for small servings of food.  But the food is delicious, the patio is great in the evenings or the winter, and the ambiance overall is nice.

z-poyORjy_XJXm2DBVprnA.text: One of my favorite restaurants!! The pesto is amazing! Cool cocktails and entrees.  Sweet potato canneloni is super yummy!! Love the ambiance of this place.  Have always had great service here too.

CLr1AwFU9n6GVU__O6GiBQ.text: A very nice looking place, Food it was good, the service felt under the expectations I had over this place, so trendy, and pricey.... I will like to go back during the winter time here in Phoenix, so I can enjoy better the patio seat around the chiminea.

JNolzwvk65kEqkP_sbwf0g.text: Whenever I have the opportunity to go "out" with my husband, we go here.  Its worth the drive from Gilbert and the food is amazing.  The portions are just the right size and are delicious.  There is also some great people watching!  Its also a great place to bring out of town guests.

T5JumK0VHfO8mHh__epy-w.text: I'm kind of obligated to love this place, because my wife and I had our first date here AND I proposed to her here (she said yes, too).  Obviously, the restaurant holds lots of sentimental value to us, and I love that.  I also love the food and wine menu.  We've tried many of the entrees, including the Braised Short Ribs and Rack of Lamb, all of which were outstanding.  We've also ordered many of the red wines, and always enjoyed our selections.  Nearly everything on the dinner and wine list is pricey, but it's also worth it, so go there when you can enjoy it.  The big BUT I have to include here is that we've had both exceptional service and terrible service.  On at least three or four occasions, our service was fast and friendly, just what you want.  The last time we visited Olive & Ivy was for our one-year wedding anniversary.  I called ahead, made reservations, and told the hostess over the phone what we were celebrating and the fact that I had proposed to my wife there as well.  Once there, no one ever wished us a happy anniversary, and we were sat in, possibly, the worst location in the restaurant, adjacent to a door (in January) that was constantly being opened and closed.  It actually looked like the table was placed there at the last minute, because no one would ever want to sit that close to a cold drafty door in January.  Not only that, but our server was unfamiliar with the wine list and couldn't give us any recommendations on appetizers (she said everything was good).  Hopefully, that one bad server is no longer there, and everything is back to the way it was.  If so, I'd recommend Olive & Ivy to anyone!

s616Pd34pWBU6T7-BmdMmA.text: Yeah - I'd bring friends from out of town to check it out.  It's a fun lively spot for happy hour and post sun down week-ends.   The food is good but not consistant. Tapas are your best bet; entrees / specials just don't fulfill the expectation or promise.  It's good the first couple of times then becomes an after thought. The little market is cool and nice for a quick snack or take-out for a park picnic or your hotel room. Good drinks but tell them to half the ice.

8eGDQL26i-s1l_9nb1zcZg.text: The short rib sandwich was uber delicious, as was the bread, salmon flatbread, and the coffee! We all know how much I love coffee, and I loved it, including the glass.  I also love how they flavor their water every day in a different way.  Another thumbs up for Fox Restaurant Concepts!

NmU-mvi1IfYQj1gsr8k6jQ.text: LOVE their home made gelato! Great scallop & fish dishes. Good home made pesto, though bread served with it could be better (maybe a more rustic, crusty, flavorful bread). Fantastic location by the water.

zzyBvWzviGE_R0uSlBBfvw.text: Tried this with friend on a Thursday night - made a reservation and got a lovely table that was inside/outside.  The outside tables look a little difficult to eat at, so we were glad we were  "on the edge" !  The bread and pesto is DELICIOUS - perhaps a bad discovery as I could come back to this place just for that !  The red sangria is also fabulous.  We split a salad and a flatbread and a cheese plate - all were awesome - we wanted to try everything. Then 2 folks had scallops and for the non-seafood folks they had the veal ravioli - all were excellent - what we loved was they they split the plates already between us so there was no reaching over or fighting over the last piece  We will be back !

3Bp52JrzjUM6Qllv-C-e6A.text: Review for BRUNCH only:   I thought this place was a great brunch spot.  Dined here with 11 other girls and we all enjoyed it.  Great ambiance, relaxing, inviting, and open.  Service was wonderful too.  The homemade foccaccia with pesto was scrumptious!  I think a lot of us filled up on that before our entrees were served.  Some of the dishes ordered: cinnamon french toast (yummyy!!); flatbreads (tasty); frittata (not too heavy, eggs cooked right); egg sandwich (pretty good); steak and eggs (wonderful!).  A few people also ordered drinks and I didn't hear any complaints.  In the front of the restaurant you can also order pastries and they have gelato too.  We were too stuffed to try any but everything looked good.

e27jH_OQL4-j7ohh0hcRcQ.text: Great friendly service.  Breakfast sandwich is the greatest! Really!!  They do need a soda fountain, but that's ok.

0Yxps2ZVKiBQ7A2aZbPyQA.text: We kind of liked this place, but probably won't be back unless we're shopping nearby. Unlike some other posters, we received excellent and attentive service -- walked in with no reservation just before 5 pm on Saturday and while we couldn't get patio seating, we got a nice table right away. The food was a bit inconsistent, though. The bruschetta was cold -- flavor was good, but would have tasted better hot. Hubby and I split the scallop entree and the ravioli entree -- again, the service was terrific, in that they split them both for us without us having to ask. And, the flavor, seasoning and texture of both were excellent...but the food didn't arrive hot. Desert of coconut cake was forgettable.

-Idqat5yH71ZH1qQoskqUQ.text: Amazing sangria and food!! Perfect spot for lunch/dinner! Especially with groups! They are very accommodating and fun! Great vibe great good great location perfect patio in the heart of old town! On the water front how could you ask for anything better from sea on to season the entire restaurant gets better and better!!!

bkTP7Q3R2dNigEU2It_Eqw.text: I have a couple of issues with this place, so I will start with the food first. Myself and my wife met a couple friends here for brunch last weekend. I made the mistake of ordering the "Potato Hash", which turned out to be one of the worst things I've ever eaten period. It's a simple breakfast of eggs over easy, sausage gravy and hash brown potato's. My plate came out with two eggs that had been cooked so long that they were both hard and dry. There wasn't a lick of moisture left in them. The server noticed that the eggs were ruined, and promptly had more made for me. The sausage gravy was terrible. It was some weird super oily concoction that neither resembled gravy nor sausage, which made my burnt potato's even worse. Do yourself a favor and stay away from this dish. My second issue was my reservation. I made a reservation three days in advance for 11:30am on the patio through "OpenTable". The day before my reservation the restaurant called to confirm everything for the next day. When we arrived, the hostess quickly seated us inside. I explained that my reservation was for the patio. She told us to wait and she would go find out. Several minutes later she came back and informed me that since I made my reservation through "OpenTable", that my request couldn't be honored. WTH? I was told that if you want to sit on the patio, you need to call the restaurant direct, even though on OpenTable there is a box for, wait for it, special requests! Fortunately since I have no desire to return to this typical chain restaurant, I wont need to call the restaurant direct. P.S. I only gave it two stars because of the speed at which the server saw the two hockey pucks on my plate and corrected it.

yhkjgCBZRExrmMmFMXLxrQ.text: You'll Be Disappointed  Very attractive restaurant belies terrible service and worse food preparation and presentation.  My advice -- stay away, there are lots better places in Scottsdale and environs.  Waiter started out by lauding the size of various salads, entrees, etc.  Touted as very splitable. We split the prawn risotto. A dollop of risotto, covered by 2 prawns each.  That 4th prawn was an extra charge.  Friends split the lasagne.  We all know what a slice of lasagne should look like.  The split portions were served in a cup the size of a small custard cup.  But each had a slice of bread attached to this sumptuous presentation!  The restaurant should have been embarrassed to have brought such a joke to the table.    A third friend sent her seared tuna entree back twice.  It was served ice cold each time. They gave up and just took it off the bill.  The days of free dessert to atone for bad food and service are long gone.  This place is a culinary joke.  Don't waster your time and money.  You'll be disappointed.

gbaJVHGxN_9LDuv4rssEYA.text: We came and ate in the cafe. The gentleman behind the counter was extremely friendly and helpful. The food was delicious. I had the turkey grinder with a fresh lemonade. My friends got the tuna and grilled cheese. The restaurant is supposed to be very good as well, but is more for someone who wants to sit down and have a nice meal. For a quick and yummy lunch, the cafe is perfect.

MHwOfewapQwWlRxQdfbQmQ.text: Next to the river. Inside and outside dining. Trees outside. Very interesting decor. Friendly staff. Noisy. Interesting selection of starters. Dessert menu pretty ordinary. 25 bucks for 4 scallops on a small puddle of polenta is not a price performer. Was told later it is a famous "pick up spot". Could be. Seemed pretty popular. Would go again for a glass of wine and perhaps bruschetta selection. Not for a meal. Have been to better places for food including one at the Sky Harbor airport. Have a favorite in Tempe which I will not mention. Don't want to have to wait in line.

rj6xZgGuRwmcoSG2pFgV1Q.text: Holy smokes is that free focaccia bread delicious. Great food, great location, great space. What's not to love?

VNEjQ3ogzY6qvm6e2y308w.text: We've been here several times. The happy hour is great, $5 sangria, $3 bruchettas and $8 flat bread. And they're all pretty tasty.

688SNDaOPuvKhQ045x6qEA.text: I arrived in a party of three on a Tuesday night, and the place was surprisingly busy. I soon discovered why, and the place definitely deserves its' reputation and loyal clientele.  We were seated outside and enjoyed the ambiance and service immediately.   The bread and pesto were phenomenal, as were the Red Sangria, Truffle and Parmesan fries, and Risotto.   I sampled my boyfriend's Ono dish as well and that was delicious, although the general consensus was that it was great although the rub was a bit salty.  A restaurant of this caliber in Los Angeles would have been much more expensive than it ended up being.  The service was attentive without being intrusive, the food was delicious, and the location next to the canal was wonderful.  I will definitely be making another stop here on my next trip out.

MyaBKs0Ko8WooqG09e9jbQ.text: Great place, classy, the outdoor is amazing when the weather is nice and not too hot. The atmosphere is great and the food is good too. I think the food portion size is very small though for the money they charge and i wish they had more variety

w-ENv1WANiWPL0WtLD_BGA.text: Perfect atmosphere! There's nothing better than eating outside on a lovely evening on a beautiful patio with lights. Great food and good service. I wish I lived here year round so I could go back often, but alas, was only visiting.

yD4iFjfyfRSv88MIoD2koQ.text: I am giving Olive & Ivy only 1 star because the employees have no idea how to run a restaurant or deal with customers.  We went there to celebrate a Birthday which did not go too well.  First when we made the reservation we were told to come in before 3pm on a Sunday so we could order from 3 menus well when we arrived, we were told a different story about the menus and told something else by another person and the story kept changing depending on who you spoke with.  Well this restaurant should be closed between 3-5pm on weekends as the only items are flatbreads, a select few salads and apps but no one tells you this when you call.  So we had planned to order dinner but were told we could not something to do with the kitchen, but we were also told we could not order from the brunch or lunch menu either so we were stuck as to what to order, well it was terrible - the flat breads were terrible, dry and way to salty. The bacon burger was not worth $12.00 and it was just a real bad time and the manager would not comp anything for all the bad information and did not seem to care we could not find anything good to eat on the menu.  We had told the waitress we could not handle anything spicy as to let us know if we ordered something which was spicy well do not order the hummus, we were not told it had jalapenos in it even though we asked, they did not take it off the bill even though 5 of the 6 people at the table did not eat it.  We will not visit again, very bad experience, bad manager, bad customer service.  not a good fox restaurant, plus the uniforms looked like construction workers.  The food, was well not worth the money and have had much better elsewhere.

-ZrKRLwSUVdypwA4Jf-XFg.text: great place...fun atmosphere...great food...but pricey.... great date night restaurant anytime...If you wanna save money dont order alcoholic drinks nor desert... if you are craving desert, just go to their gelato store in house and have a scoop...its cheap, tasty and still keeps you in the restaurant.

siJT76BKPGBrvGLfhZix9g.text: Very, very nice!    Went for New Year's Day lunch and the place was packed so service was a bit strained but understandably.   Wish there would have been tables available on the patio as it's gorgeous out there.  Nevertheless the interior is also very attractive.  The warm foccacia bread with pesto was awesome and complimentary.   We had an amazing butternut squash and shrimp soup to take the chill out on a cold afternoon.   My husband had the goat cheese and duck confit tortellini (fresh), I had the lasagna bolognese and my son had the salmon.  All were perfectly cooked.   For dessert we shared the cheesecake.  The only thing we found odd was that the lasagna was served in a bowl and the cheesecake in a mason type jar.  Nevertheless the flavors were there!  We will be back to check out the dinner menu for sure.

WOMVmcF4kVe14IYjLeb-Mg.text: Great place. The food was fresh and delicious. Not the biggest selection ever, but I can see their "quality not quantity" motto. The brushetta is amazing and I love the fresh focaccia ad pesto they bring to the table. Great service and their sangria ROCKS!!!

gnTnW2T6iFGHmiKyz5-gUg.text: Had dinner there the other day. Again - I love the design and atmosphere. Service was good but the food... not worth the $$$ they are asking for. Starting with the kids option - I ordered the pasta with marinara sauce which the server told me will have short noodles for easy pick up by a small toddler, it was made of long wide noddle, even after cutting it was not fit for a child. I ordered the grilled cheese which was okay, really not tasty as it should be.  My friend and I shared the rock shrimp which was awful, tasteless and the shrimp was not cleaned through so we had some crunchy sand like experience. Then we shared the corn flat bread which looked and tasted like airport food.  We decided to leave and got our check - for what we got paying that much was a big disappointment. They didn't even take the kid pasta dish off... $5 people... really?  I will not go back unless it is for drinks only. The two stars rating is for design, location and an okay service. Food deserve ONE.

iZhTqhVAJnlXFn-uBvaG9A.text: I would like to start out by saying that I haven't eaten a full meal here...Only a croissant and iced latte.  The croissant was good!  The latte on the other hand was by far, the best I've ever had.  If you want a change from Starbucks, definitely check them out!

Ugz_i9msFV7QxHIR6vpoBw.text: The atmosphere here is very nice, and the waiters & waitresses and super friendly and attentive. Great food. The focaccia bread they give you when you're seated is outstanding. I thought the food was quite good, although the portions were a bit small (even though I did not order for the small plates menu). I ordered the grilled scallops with asparagus. When it came, I was a bit shocked to see 3 scallops and the equivalent of one asparagus sliced into 6 long strips on the plate. Not what I was expecting, but still quite good. I didn't need all the food anyway, because I stuffed myself on the focaccia bread earlier.

0iXnDjCb5snCJOBLTPba0Q.text: Josh and Conrad were awesome at Olive and Ivy tonight! It was our first time at this restaurant and it was awesome in every way! Thanks for the great first of many visits!!

_c8lvK0aWyop4xJ9PXnkEA.text: Another FOX restaurant just like True Food Kitchen.  We tried this out for both a brunch and a dinner.  Both did not disappoint...  Everything was fresh and clean tasting, and the services was very good for breakfast.  The service for dinner was much slower and not as responsive, but we can chalk that up to a busy night, and maybe their expectation that people will just be setting around socializing.  Be sure to order coffee.  It has to be some of the best coffee I have had...

qcI974nboHuJtiwLJL8kxA.text: Service was good, food was average and location was great. Felt a little rushed as they were trying to turn tables. Pesto flatbed had great flavor but but my chicken dish fell flat.

dG4hUUD5HNmmfntE6wbWUQ.text: Love the atmosphere! Very chill spot. Great food. Service was so nice and efficient.

rWFm-P6njN5RUIMaGtW6PQ.text: This place always delivers.  Solid food, solid service, great atmosphere.

UwoQRsb5H4pPmHBaBPrRgw.text: Great place to go on a Friday night! Make a reservation though this place gets busy. Loved everything we ate. Great fungi bruschetta, margarita flatbread, and natural chicken with mushrooms and potatoes gnocchi. Yum! Great Chardonnay too

y4GOnxHQ02Z8Qi_rNkH5dg.text: Sunday brunch was amazing. The service was fast and kind. The food was fresh and hot. The outdoor patio was super relaxing.

01a3ZZjnFLyxasBoh_r4GA.text: Excellent food!  And great service.  Ask for Rebecca next time you are in.  We even got to go cups for our drinks.

TnlZNXWhMRogR613NNmgEA.text: This is my favorite restaurant in all of Scottsdale. The sweet potato cannelloni is perfect. The food is very flavorful yet you do not walk out feeling overly full. It's a combo of great Italian and California cuisine. The staff is great and the patio is right off of the canal offering a great atmosphere.

vI7rhFCR981h4UnY3kJWJQ.text: I like Olive & Ivy's food, but I love their Mojitos. I could completely forgo the food and solely sip on that delicious drink. However, my gripe is that I don't really think it's worth $10. That is a little steep for that particular drink in my opinion, as they don't make it too strong and it's not muddled to perfection a la Trader Vic's style.  Their food is good to really good, and I do think that most of the menu is over priced. That's probably because you are paying for the "concept" not the food. As per usual, Olive & Ivy attracts a fake crowd - just like most of the Sam Fox spots. On the other side though, this restaurant does provide me with some excellent people watching and that's always fun every once in a while.   Some other good aspects of Olive & Ivy are the: outdoor patio (great place to sip my Mojito and people watch), sea bass or seared ahi tuna dishes (I'll usual order one or the other) and the service (their wait staff is on top of their tables).  Olive & Ivy doesn't get me too excited so it's a solid 3 stars... because if someone asked me to suggest a restaurant in the Waterfront area, it probably wouldn't be my first recommendation.

1xTuqq1CymJU8Mp2jr0LEg.text: Ive been here a few times in the past for some family events, but would have never chosen it for my own outing.  I went tonight with a couple girl friends and really enjoyed the new menu.  I had the corn pasta dish which was AMAZING! The portion was just right, not too much, not too little.  The other girls had the flat bread and a chicken salad, and said both dishes were really yummy.  The decor is nice and the service was good. I will definitely be returning.

BEZzrN1zFdHrVOETcqnwrw.text: Came here on a perfect Arizona winter night.  The lights on the patio make you feel like you are a million miles from ordinary.  The bread and pesto was amazing.  We love this place.

SakuU27k4SdRITQI9Whb1w.text: I took my son here for his birthday.  It was just mom and son time.  The place was okay.  Nothing to write home about about.  When I made the reservation, they could have said they do not serve a full menu till 5:00. We were only aloud to order off the appetizer and pasta menu.  I will give this place another sometime but not anytime soon.

XIrlxdjU-r2zrOVvCBt3ag.text: Nice atmosphere. Sit on the patio on a nice day.  Good service.  The ahi tuna tacos sounded great, but were so so.  The tomato and mozerella salad was good and so was the arugula with apples salad.  The free Pesto bread was great.  The sangria was not very good. All in all a nice place, but there is so much choice in that area that I would go elsewhere next time.

oMJL07EWFtZhyorzc4zDxA.text: Great place. Good food and fast service, even on a busy day like Sunday for brunch.

ISjsT_3azJvyUZETfDDYKA.text: I always leave here happy and full! The cocktails are very tasty and at a good price point. If you come at lunch the crowd is usually business men but nighttime is a different story. There are always trendy good looking people to look at while enjoying some appetizer pita and hummus and a delicious pasta dish. If you are still hungry try one of their 16 different gelato flavors.

eci7evyp70Sn47PACkU3BA.text: Sometimes I think people are too hard on Olive & Ivy, the beauty of this place is how simple your meal can be (if that makes any sense)!   Although there are some $$$ items, there's also some fantastic reasonable dishes. Here's my idea of a wonderful Olive & Ivy dinner- a drink on the patio along the canal, then sit at a booth inside and enjoy truffle fries with the aioli dip PLUS the house focaccia bread with pesto to start. wow. Then I eat the chopped Mediterranean chicken salad to make myself feel better. The salad is AMAZING. Beautiful place, very romantic. It's probably my fav Fox restaurant. Other items on the menu are great too like the fish and risotto.   I think the service is great, although you can tell the server is bummed I'm not ordering more expensive stuff, but who cares!!?! Still a great experience.

Ny87sSs10LezF6dQhTXAYQ.text: Gorgeous outdoor patio. Tasty sangria. Server indicated all food made fresh on the daily (including pasta, flat bread crusts, pesto, etc) .... Heavenly :)

KkePW7kIsGIguVxiUdKcUw.text: I talk to a lot of people who really love Olive and Ivy.  It has a lot going for it that works really well:  I love the ambience.  The booths are super comfy and I like that, depending on where you're sitting, you can see the chefs cooking up something awesome with flames licking the air like you're in the most awesome depths of hell (not as punishment, more like a 1980's heavy metal fantasy).  While there are items on the menu that are pretty goddamned expensive, there's always something there that's within your price range.    I like how on the other side of the restaurant you can just order something to go deli-style and grab a bottled beverage and run in and out really quick if you've got a tight time-restraint on your lunch break.  However, considering how highly the restaurant obviously thinks of itself (it really does), the food isn't that good.  Now, don't get me wrong, it's not disgusting by any means and it's certainly not even bad.  It's good.  It is definitely good, but... I mean with the lush interiors and all the fake Scottsdale noses you see around, I'd think their food would be... better?  I'm trying not to sound like a picky little bitch, but man, when you get the fries with the burger, the fries just aren't very good, man.  The burger is kind of a standard, kind of hard to fuck up, but, y'know, it could be better.  I had their short rib sandwich and just wasn't into it.  The pasta I got another time was good, I liked it, but it seemed to me like something I would probably make myself super bored staying at home.  It's altogether an alright place.  Their drinks are usually pretty good and the service is awesome.  Three stars.

ubM3NUKmJ6SPUcng16CcOg.text: YUM! I always love coming here.  Breakfast is fantastic (HIGHLY recommend their Yogurt and Granola Bowl), Lunch is wonderful (Try the sea bass w ravioli) and Dinner is great as well (sangria anyone?).  This restaurant makes you feel like your not even in AZ with it's gorgeous patio on the canal and plush sofas.  This is by far one of my favorite places to come with my girlfriends or alone and enjoy the atmosphere.  The service is always top notch and knowledgeable.  I highly recommend this place for drinks, dinner, chatting, munching, wine, breakfast, deserts, people watching, lunch and atmosphere; amongst other things...Enjoy yourself whatever you choose to do. Cheers!

kVD5eeHQD_peEfoIjhfRrw.text: Once again a win, came here with some friends and sat on the patio. Needless to say, I will most definitely be returning. The food is made to order, fresh, and plated delicately to soak into your hungry tastebuds. The pitcher of Pear Sangria was a must have for summer on the patio. We began with a couple different choices of bruschetta which was a perfect light bite! The Mozzarella bruschetta was my favorite of the 3 we chose, followed by the mushroom one. The sweet potato cannelloni is amazing! If you like sweet creamy bites, leafy sauteed spinach and a nice delicate crunch due to the almond crisps this dish is for you! The lamb meatballs were also a fan at our table if you're looking for a heartier dish. Lastly the salmon and fingerling potatoes were light and refreshingly delicious! The service here is always amazing and the ambiance is what the place is known for! Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Salmon and fingerling potatoes
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lamb meatballs
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bruschetta

KHgWxjMnFDci_J81FPMVhg.text: Had an exceptional experience this evening. We were taken care of by Nicole who is a True gem and star of a server. She does not miss a beat and is on top of all the tiny details that take a dining experience to the next level. My fiance and I were able to enjoy a very romantic dinner on the beautiful patio because we were so well taken care of. Loved the kale salad and the natural chicken- which is one of the best chicken dishes at any restaurant. Will be asking for Nicole from on- thanks for a great night!

7QMfqfUkzpvC6y1eL4kwzQ.text: Went for a special celebration for dinner   Loved the patio atmosphere and had for dinner the Pacific sea bass. I highly recommend it

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pacific Sea Bass

NYvkttcjS3TnGOTdysNCWQ.text: We came to Olive & Ivy while in town checking out Old Town Scottsdale. A great spot along the water with an adorable outside patio!  We didn't get a patio seat but the doors open all the way up so even sitting inside, so even sitting inside feels like outdoor seating. There are fireplaces outside, and groups sit together around the fireplaces.   Ambience of restaurant was cozy with great warm lighting and a high-end atmosphere.   Red sangria was delicious!  Scallops on creamy polenta was delicious. Perfectly cooked. Sea bass was also delicious, but I felt that the plate was a little too light on other things. Two pieces of cauliflower and a quarter of a grapefruit left me hungry.  We got the peanut butter mousse for dessert, and that was the highlight for us! Tasted like a peanut butter cup--yum!  Prices are certainly not cheap, so I'd recommend coming to happy hour here, unless you're looking to blow some cash. Overall, great eats in Scottsdale.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Inside seating
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Peanut Butter Mousse
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pacific Sea Bass

kh0r9zeR_VuhkemLhiGEAQ.text: We had so much fun I forgot to take pictures! Sorry, but I'll give you a blow by blow :) This is such a pretty place to go eat and hang out! Parking is the usual situation in this area, garages and street parking if you can get it. We were seated quickly and chose to sit outside as it was gorgeous. There is a view of the Scottsdale waterfront. We had breakfast and both enjoyed our meals. The peach cocktails we had were great and helped make our Sunday funday on point. My sister and I will definitely be back. We have done dinner here in the past as well and enjoyed that too. The service is great here and we always enjoy our time here. Just now getting around to reviewing them. This is a good one though, put it on your list as a must go!

OY44sgiXEC6AiXvBxXLAiw.text: Took our daughter here for her birthday dinner. A Thursday night, so somewhat busy. The food was good, Sweet Potato Cannalloni, Salmon and Mushroom Pappardelle. Reasonably priced, well made and very tasty. The best part was our waiter, Easton. Very polite, took the time to answer questions about how the food was prepared and engaged my wife in a conversation about pasta vs wontons for the sweet potatoes.  Some of the best service we've ever experienced.

g6vL0N8AWcP1CLqn_1L_bQ.text: I feel so sad to be giving this review. Olive and Ivy has always had a special place in my heart but tonight's experience was terrible. We probably come once/twice a year and we came for my birthday. When my husband made the reservation he specified it was my birthday. We got no recognition from our waiter. We ordered our drinks and my step sons soda came out with like no carbonation, the focaccia bread that I usually love was SO salty, it was almost inedible. The pesto was good however. My 2 younger children were with us so he did make sure their cheese pizza (which was delicious) arrived earlier so they could start eating but he didn't hear my stepson say no onions on his flatbread so he ended up picking them out and the waiter offered no empathy. My shrimp risotto that I had planned to share with my toddler was super spicy so I couldn't share it. Also, he gave some lame excuse but our food took forever! We have young kids so you know the importance of getting our food quick, our kids were done with their pizza by the time our food came so they were getting antsy. And then when it came time for my birthday dessert, he didn't remember it was my birthday and just asked if I wanted dessert versus what can i get you for your birthday dessert.   It was just little things tonight and when we don't come often, it's not easy to overlook. I am not sure we will be coming back. There are too many other places to try in the valley.

kId3_mBb8E2-tNwmya1nfA.text: Went for lunch on the outside patio.  Was crowded and children yelling. Ate some small plates hurriedly and left. Not a place for leisurely quiet lunch.

pMKeoTziOnkKbxh6NKNKFA.text: Great atmosphere and wonderful staff! Was here for a bachelorette party and it was lovely. Amazing food! Would definitely return back again.

a7CW7czuxLolATf4usVRSA.text: Love Olive & Ivy! The menu is seasonal so definitely call ahead if you're craving something specific. If the weather is nice sit on the GORGEOUS patio, you will not be sorry. Customer service is superior at Olive & Ivy and I always enjoy my time visiting. The prices are very good for the quality. Highly recommend.

eOAbLg6LO1nrfcAUmB3jqg.text: Darren the Manager was exceptional with our party of 10! After my own misunderstanding and the reservation time, he went quickly to work and helped save the meal for us! Food was amazing as it always is here and the staff quick and professional.   The back patio is so great this time of year with the misters on and peaceful!   The cooked oats and apples are heavenly, and yogurt with granola and berries are to die for! Huge portions!!

fqowU5GeObCDfE9mgsl1eA.text: I was flabbergasted at how big this place was when I walked in. It arrived Saturday about 4:30, to discover that the full dinner menu wasn't available until 5. Bummer. But the appetizers & flatbreads WERE -- and they were more than plentiful & damn tasty. Our waitress (Nikki) was very attentive, funny, and free w/ suggestions when asked her opinion about what to order. The outside seating area was well laid out & aside from the man & women who really needed to GET A ROOM! (and oh, pay a babysitter, instead of ignoring their kids), it was a wonderful experience. There's a parking garage just across the street so there's no reason you shouldn't check this place out. Three people: three different drinks, appetizers, desserts. Everything was stupendous. Definitely a place to visit again and again and again.

Wlf92FzJKySUJAZsmbFqZA.text: Delicious food, great location, decent service. This is one of the better Fox restaurants. Located on the Scottsdale Waterfront by the Fashion Square, right on the canal. Great patio for a nice day.

LgZ9vqRc2kXd0vWXdy64KQ.text: Having visited Olive & Ivy on several occasions, it is a very solid establishment with wonderful food and an outstanding patio. A few of my go to dishes have been lamb meatballs, wild mushroom pappardelle and sea bass.   Perhaps the preparations here are somewhat on the classic side, many dishes are simpler in nature and something I can see myself recreating at home. Not a ton of creativity, but proven recipes, which is by no means a bad thing. Wines are priced very fairly here, I usually go for a bottle of Vueve Cliquot.  The vibe is phenomenal. It is fun, not overly loud and the patio photos speak for themselves. It is without doubt one of the best patios in the area. I've returned to the establishment for many reasons and will continue to do so on many occasions to come. Romantic, fun, vibrant and delicious.

9KVQQP9Yn-J5WMkd_GTngw.text: Absolutely delicious. I always order the veal raviolis OMG TO DIE For. And the bread is so dam good. All the drinks are yummy yummy. I also had their brunch and it's good too. Especially the breakfast burrito.   I love the patio area and how it over looks the canal. Such a beautiful restaurant. It's a total Date night place. Customer service is awesome. Always.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mama &amp; step dad on her birthday!
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. My beautiful nana

9TH78lTDe--EVhNT4Y8DUg.text: I went to Olive and Ivy 3 times while in Scottsdale over the past summer. It has an amazing atmosphere, cool vibes and great food! The drinks were always good, and the recommendations from the wait staff never disappointed.  They were also super helpful with my dairy restriction.  We were able to order the delicious bruschetta sampler and they made sure to keep all of the cheeses on the side for me.  I enjoyed every meal and will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

dNmPlPNBribOYl-kP86mug.text: Recommended by a work colleague we decided to check out Olive and Ivy for lunch. The menu is trimmed down compared to the dinner menu but they still have some great offerings. Starting out with a white cranberry cosmo as my friend compared to me Samantha from Sex and the city. The drink was really well made and I ended up having 2 more which is something Samantha would have been proud of. The hummus plate w fresh veggies hit the spot while we waited for our lunch order. I had the bacon cheeseburger w avocado and a side of fresh. Well cooked burger and helped the start off the day of drinking on the right note. The only down side here was the service was a bit slow and we lost our server a few times. They were pretty busy so I'm sure it was just a one off situation. But we will definitely be and next time I'll bring the whole Gang from Sex n the City. Cheers!

jSqmyJfo-zS7vOBCPELFEQ.text: Love going there with my girls! The space is amazing and the staff is great. The food is good but like I tell everyone, I don't care how great the food is, if you lack customer service skills you won't last long.  Thankfully they have it and they've mastered it! Hope to be back soon enough.

WptC9Q_LtIFfdPuaq4PbiQ.text: I came in for their Sunday brunch with my cousin. They have a really nice, classy atmosphere and it's a spacious restaurant! Parking was a breeze. There are plenty of free street spaces, as well as a free parking garage nearby.   The hostess seated us immediately. They have a nice brunch menu with fun options! I ordered a Veggie Scramble and my cousin ordered an Eggs Benedict. Our food came out very quickly. It was delicious! The potatoes were perfect. My eggs were saltier than I was expecting, but I would order it again nonetheless!   I'd give this restaurant a solid 4 stars. My only complaint was that our waitress was somewhat standoffish. I didn't feel that we were receiving the best service from her. She made minimal eye contact and was rather abrupt. It almost felt like she was giving us an attitude. But, the rest of the waitstaff were great, and were so kind in their service!  Overall, a pleasant experience! I think they have a great setup, and the food is fantastic. By Scottsdale's standards, it's affordable and worth it!

0yDJF0-n_hhmi-Juj5fS1A.text: Poor management - phony Receptionist no help Manager no help - never came to help Has happened before / smokers bothering us Smokers on patio at chairs and tables Asked for help to correct the situation  No help Breaks the law Should be 20 feet from the door Ruins our evening on a lovely night We stopped by after the movies Wanted gelato and coffee outside Thanks for poor service

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

aM9y4QTCb92PTSNySCLJ8g.text: Excellent food and service every time I go! I recommend Olive and Ivy! The patio is fun, as well!

lLjjYp_61T_UpCSmbmhrJw.text: One of the prettier restaurants in Scottsdale! This place is located right on Scottsdale's waterfront. It offers outdoor seating under developed green trees or indoor with floor to ceiling glass, and a beautifully lit ambiance. The service is phenomenal, and you can tell the staff works as a team. You never feel like you aren't being attended to. The food is fantastic and creative. I haven't found a menu item I dislike yet, and I have eaten most of the menu. The chefs counter is also a really cool experience if you can snag a seat. The drinks are inventive and delicious. Dan and Jimmy are great managers, and have always made our table and guests feel especially welcome. One of my favorite servers is Angelo, he is always very attentive. Thanks for the awesome experiences!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

by3phuAZyBPrazkkr6UnyQ.text: This was probably my favorite spot of all the places I visited on my Scottsdale vacation. Everything from ambiance, to service, wine and food was superb. We liked it so much we came twice. The first night was a Friday night. The restaurant had so much life, attracting visitors and locals looking for a nice place to socials, dine and drink good wine. I loved the outdoor lounge area overlooking the water. Situated in the heart of old town, with the happening older nightlife.   Our intention was to just grab an appetizer and wine and head to another location for dinner but we loved the vibe so much we stayed. They had a dj inside that played a great mix of music, to keep the place lively and fun. The second night was a Monday, Halloween evening. Much more mellow, still just as enjoyable. This time around we got a bottle of red for $30 that was delicious and got a nice little buzz!  Food?! Everything looks good. Whether you're going for wine and shareables, cheese platter, main dish or dessert. We loved the mozzarella bruschetta, mushroom pasta dish and two scoops of gelato for dinner. Chop salad is also good, but had what seemed like granola on top... kinda weird! Will definitely be back on my next visit to Scottsdale.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Love the outdoor lounge/seating. Such a great atmosphere.
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yummmmmm dessert!!!
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. We split pasta and chicken dish. Pasta was excellent. Chicken was decent.

pbeYFVyJykBQkIylyo8pDQ.text: Big fan of this spot!! I've been here twice now and I'm really impressed with the food, service, ambience and the location is just perfect. Great place to bring people visiting from out of town so you can walk around old town before or after your meal. The bridge is a great place to take pics. The restaurant patio is super cute, overlooks the little river and reminds me a little of Europe.   Food is fresh and service is great. They provide you with complimentary bread and fresh pesto. I had to refrain myself from licking the plate! I split a burger and kale salad with a friend and they actually split it for us which was super thoughtful of them. Burger was fantastic. Kale salad was huge, even when it was split. I've been for both brunch and dinner now and both menus are great. Sometimes they have a live dj in the evening which creates a fun ambiance.   Love that they've managed to create a classy place without it feeling too upscale or stuffy. Prices are affordable too. Can't wait to return and try their desserts!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Split burger and kale salad from the brunch menu. So nice of them to do it without us asking!
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Complimentary bread and home made pesto!

SekqjAdBSQYRHiHWeGREfg.text: Wonderful restaurant!   Dined here last fall for my boyfriend's birthday. The restaurant is beautiful and has a very romantic vibe. There's patio seating outdoors, near the water.  As for food, we received complimentary bread and pesto. We ordered the fritto appetizer (deep fried calamari, zucchini, and shrimp), ahi tuna, and the mushroom truffle pappardelle). The tuna was seared and had a nice miso/teriyaki flavor. I think the pasta dish could have used a bit more cheesy flavor. For dessert we received a birthday dessert on the house-- strawberry shortcake with sorbet.  Our waiter was very attentive and hospitable.   I would definitely dine here again!

OtpnN1L3t0iezqSS6DiItQ.text: Love the patio on a nice day. Super chill. Good people watching. The food is pretty good though not super creative. Drinks and wine list are good. Vibe is fun and people are pretty.

DHqWs19iBmMHL5zyLaEt9Q.text: We came here on a Saturday night and we were a little late for our reservation because of traffic. Walking in the place is dark, modern, and really loud. We got seated outside on the patio right next to the Riverwalk. Only problem is you can't see the Riverwalk because of the bushes.   The patio has lots of trees for shade covering and water misters. It was a pretty hot night and the misters help cool it down some.   Our server greeted us fairly quickly. Got our drink orders and water cups pretty quickly especially since it was pretty warm outside.   We started out with the Bruschetta comb. We had the Strawberry & Apple, Prosciutto & Fig, and Manchego.  They give you one of each but cut it up into three pieces so everyone can enjoy a variety. They were all good but probably my favorite was the strawberry & apple. They were all very fresh and tasty.   I had the Bouillabaisse. Huge bowl of basically seafood soup. Not a lot of soup but just overflowing with seafood. Muscles, clams, scallops, shrimp, and fish. Everything was cooked perfectly. Excellent dish. Really enjoyed it.   My wife had the chicken Scallopini. Very tender chicken with spinach. I had a bite and and it was delicious. Very good and my wife really enjoyed it. My daughter had the pacific sea bass and her words were that is was cooked perfectly. Very tender and really good. She loved it. Son got the bone-in ribeye and they put some cream sauce on it and he thought it was one of the best ribeye he's had. That's saying a lot there.   We ended our meal with lemon pudding cake and the strawberry Mille-Feuille. They were both really good. Lemon cake was so good. Not dry at all. Very moist with a scoop of ice cream. Really really good. The strawberry Mille-Feuille had three wafer waffles with a scoop of ice cream on top. It was good but the lemon pudding cake was the best in my opinion.   So overall we had a really good meal. Very good service. Really good food. It was pretty loud outside but really warm. It reminded me outside of a garden with lots of tree. Too bad there was no view of the Riverwalk. The outside wasn't as loud and inside. It seemed like people were trying to talk over everyone else so really loud inside. I think I would prefer to come during the cooler time of the year but everything else was really good. Enjoy

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. House Special - Filet &amp; Scallops
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chopped Chicken Salad
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bruschetta - Strawberry &amp; Apple, Prosciutto &amp; Fig, Manchego

yZaixtxN10vQ4v1U8Poz8w.text: Came to Scottsdale for Memorial Day weekend with two friends and got recommended Olive & Ivy by a local friend. We had Frank as a server and he was the BEST waiter I have ever had. Personable, gave us insight about the area, and had a great time with him. He even gave us complimentary shots after our dinner. We love you Frank! Food, wine, atmosphere, and overall experience was great! Highly recommend!

K1SsGOOc2zL7DLxy1GnsGw.text: Very nice lunch spot. I go here quite often. Whether its with my friends, or family, this place has always been extremely consistent and I know exactly what I am going to get. Great food, great service. As with most of the Fox Concepts, they don't disappoint. The Sea bass is amazing! We have had many dishes here including the pastrami sandwich, various pastas, and raviolis. All of which are great. The setting is very well constructed, and allows for a nice ambiance. This place caters to a wide variety of people, which allows for a setting of all occasions.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lunch menu
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Ruben pastrami sandwich
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Veal raviolis

wuLPZdtx3Az_Ey4SeW9QRQ.text: Conflicted about how to write this review, since I actually ended up getting sick after my meal, and so did two of my friends the week prior. BUT still three stars because it's actually awesome. If we didn't get sick, easily a 4 or 5. Could have just been a weird coincidence!   First of all the place is ADORABLE. The inside is great, but the outside patio is amazingly beautiful. It's right on the water and there are cute string lights and fountains. It looks like a European garden. There are misters so don't worry about being too hot during the summer.   You HAVE to try the bruschetta board. It's fantastic. The bread is so fresh and the toppings were perfect. For my meal I ordered the chicken and mashed potatoes. It was flavored really well... the only thing I wish was that the skin was crispy. And for my favorite part: dessert. We had the strawberry shortcake. Amazing.   SO if you have a strong stomach, try it. If you don't, try it and bring Tums just in case. It's worth it.

j-2fJtheK3xNU381ZpYW1g.text: Awesome environment to eat in , the food was delicious and the service was spot on. Id definitely recommend this place to anyone who enjoys trendy locations with delicious food!

MeyPVzwK-RXvRPnJ0DCrYg.text: We were a large party and they accommodated is all. The service and food were really great. It was a very pleasurable and hope to eat there again before going back home.

KHtsx1jYZt2lqltJ89RDYA.text: I haven't tried many of the food options, but the flat breads I've ordered have been tasty. I mainly come here for appetizers and drinks. My favorite thing about Olive & Ivy is the patio. It sits right on the waterfront and is very spacious. There isn't anything better than having a few drinks (on a day that isn't 110 degrees) on their patio. If you are all about atmosphere, this is the place for you.

oPc_1OetxR_lco2eiQAV2A.text: Went for happy hour for the first time and were told that we could sit anywhere outside. Ended up on the "wrong" side. Took forever to get menus and when we finally were able to order we were told that half of the menu was not available at that time. Service was not friendly until the end. Food was amazing, which is the only reason this is getting a higher rating.

kvAmt0Gzl7YD5hM1Endudw.text: Great ambiance! We sat at the bar, ordered a couple drinks and appetizers  The bartender was prompt and friendly.. we had an enjoyable time

baMzNqL51E6BBHaTCVWtSQ.text: Great service and food. Enjoyed Green salad with olive addition and pasific Sea Bass.  Most likely be back in Olive and Ivy.

0PCeHwTkYdvjC2aTzVXC2Q.text: What a wonderful place to eat!! I had company on town and we took them to olive and ivy for brunch. I had the garden flat bread and it was amazing!! My husband had the best tuna salad sandwich we have ever had!!  My guests had a Mediterranean salad which I did sneak a taste of and loved.  Our server Courtney was wonderful! I will Absoutly be back!!  Yummy!!!

A0p4fe-syyWMDVrJrTKz6w.text: I was searching for a place to have some birthday drinks before going out into old town. My friend wanted some wine, and we compromised on sangria. I have been wanting to try out this place based on the menu alone, but I was pleasantly surprised when I stepped in. There's a market side and then a restaurant side. The restaurant size itself is large and there's a great big patio too! The ambiance, although a little on the dimmer side, remained cute and cozy.   Our waitress was super nice and attentive. She offered some great suggestions. We ended up getting the cilantro jalapeno hummus to start (comes with cucumbers, celery, AND carrot sticks) to snack on while we drank our white sangria that we ordered by the pitcher. We ended it with a lemon pudding cake (complimentary). It's good if you like lemon! The top was fluffy and the bottom was a little soggier...but not in a bad way? Soggy is the wrong word probably but I can't think of another way to describe it!! Haha. It comes with a burnt honey ice cream and blackberries. Yum! :)  It was a great spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lemon pudding cake
Photo of Olive & Ivy - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cute decor!

JtEHcO-hti2KIa0YsPZ8OQ.text: Long-time friends invited us to dinner this past Saturday to Olive & Ivy. We've enjoyed meals there before and looked forward to dinner.  Service was certainly prompt and friendly... We ordered the Chef's Plate, Bacon-wrapped Dates, and one other appetizer to share. Tasted great, but the dishes came without serving forks or spoons. Fresh pesto and bread were excellent.  Bone-in Ribeye cooked medium was very good. Scallops...meh Sea Bass - very thin and dry due to being overlooked  Mediterranean Salad was ok...shrimp were way overcooked and rubbery  Nice atmosphere, not too crowded. Food was only 'ok'

Zqx8TpybBYRgjhHwjbzcXw.text: Unfortunately I loved this place, but they seem to have changed their menu without notification online.  I took my wife there for her bday on a Saturday at 2:30.  We both looked at the menu online and decided they had what we wanted.  When we for there, we were given a totally different menu which had nothing that we had picked.  I'm guessing it was their new lunch menu.  It didn't even include their bruschetta which we love getting every time we go.  We were told we could sit at the bar for over a half an hour for their limited dinner menu to kick in, but that is unacceptable.  We ended up leaving and will probably never return since they did seem to care why we decided to leave.  A company without concern for their patrons is a company that won't get our money.
